name: ‡∏à‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ü‡∏≠‡∏á
review_1_text: They sell traditional Thai desserts. The price is at the higher side according to the locals but their traditional desserts defo got me addicted. I wish I could try a few more. Gonna come back again despite the not so good service
review_2_text: If you're looking for an authentic and charming caf√© experience in the Pa Daet area, Jan Fong (‡∏à‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ü‡∏≠‡∏á) is an absolute must-visit! This lovely spot specializes in traditional Thai desserts, and every bite is a testament to their dedication to authentic flavors and beautiful presentation
review_3_text: Service is horrible. I arrived at a time when 2-3 staffs were busy at the back of the counter packing, but even if busy you should acknowledge and let the customer know to wait. Only when I tried to ask where to order, did they tell me to wait with an annoyed look. Very bad hospitality all around, no smiles or thank yous at any point.
review_4_text: The atmosphere is great with the nice traditional sweet.
review_5_text: Anyone who doesn't like Thai desserts should try this shop and they'll change their mind. They're incredibly delicious, with a wonderful aroma of coconut milk and palm sugar. All the ingredients are perfectly balanced. The salted rice cakes, sugarcane syrup cakes, steamed rice cakes, and dog's tongue cakes ‚Äì everything we ordered was delicious. It was a truly amazing experience. The shop is cute, comfortable, and has parking in front. I highly recommend trying it.

name: Farm Story House
review_1_text:
This small restaurant is serious about its coffee - I'm not a coffee drinker so can't comment on the quality of their coffee. The food menu is limited to a handful of well prepared meals - I had chicken with chilli and Thai basil - delicious.
The iced chocolate is delicious, and tastes of real chocolate. Located in a townhouse complex it's a hidden gem and worth the effort to find.
review_2_text:
The bigger original chain at Old City is closed (those that u saw in the pics). We dined at the smaller but charming outlet. Spend a total of 500THB and was given a complimentary tasting of the freshly hand poured single origin coffee beans from Nan. Lovely service staff. Bright & cheerful!

Try the ice cream with mung bean topping.
review_3_text: Delicious, cozy, friendly. A wonderful place to grab breakfast, lunch, or dinner. They have a really nice menu and I highly recommend getting the Thai classics, spice is Thai level. The coffee here is phenomenal and well made, with an option for your preferred roast level. The staff is super nice helpful, one of them has great English. Highly recommend this place, prices are OK. Hours SSMTTF 08:30-21:00.
review_4_text: Lovely place for breakfast and coffee. We went there just by chance and it turned out to be one of the best breakfast we had in Thai. Very reasonable prices and friendly staff. Their coffee is very good actually. Many cute local crafts and herbs related products. We really enjoyed our time here. A great start for our day in Chiangmai.
review_5_text: I loved the seating arrangement that were offered. I felt like I was really experiencing the Thai lifestyle. The food on offer was excellent and my wife and I really enjoyed trying new things out that we would rarely try.

name: Caffa Coffeemaker
review_1_text:
Haven''t visited the store but buy their beans from a local barista.

Back in March-April 2025, we were very impressed with the flavor of their chocolate-infused bean. It was great!

Now, however, something has gone wrong with roasting process. The chocolate flavor is gone even though it's still marketed as such.

Without this additive flavor, their beans are average at best.
review_2_text:
this clean, lrage-feeling shop primarily sells coffee machines  (and some coffees) , including high-end ones, some look quite commercial; if you need the best you should look here;
they provide coffee on-site but that is more a favor in order to sell their on-site raw coffees; it is not meant to be a coffee shop or cafe, no food, friendly staff; iffy parking, is located in K-Park, turn left at KFC Mahidol
review_3_text: Not meant to be a coffee shop but they have dam good coffee!  Excellent atmosphere and staff! If you are nearby stop and enjoy. Very high end/quality machines for sale as well ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_4_text:
They sell great coffee and tea supplies, staff is always friendly and they provide samples.

It is always a bliss to stop by and buy some coffee here.
review_5_text: They sell the best coffee in Chiang Mai, it's not a coffee shop, they sell coffee and coffee machines and accessories.

name: Roastniyom Coffee - ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏õ‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡∏Ñ
review_1_text:
this is a franchise in a chain of the same name; smallish place, spotless, amazingly very little road-noise even tho they are right on the roadside; good croissants, decent coffee;
i found the staff a bit brusque; we went twice , consecutive days only because we had to wait for a clinic in that k-park area to open and there is very little quality coffee competition in that walking-distance area; KFC is jsut a few meters away; so-so parking; some outside seating but i cant imagine why given the huge road noise outside there
review_2_text: Roastinyom is a brand I can trust.  The coffee is always tasty.  There are 2 baristas working at this location providing good fast service.  There are enough chairs and seats for more than 40 people here.   The upstairs is a quiet area that can accommodate about 20 people.
review_3_text: Good Taste.
review_4_text: üò¥üò¥üò¥üò¥
review_5_text: This branch of Rosniyom features a spacious, airy, minimalist design with outdoor seating. The second floor houses a meeting room. The drinks maintain the signature Rosniyom standard. There's parking for three cars in front of the shop, but additional parking is available within the complex.

name: Cup of the day
review_1_text: ordered through grab, the mint cold brew is so delicious!! and i ordered deep roast for the coffee, extremely nutty flavour and i love it so much. will definitely try to visit in person
review_2_text: Really nice coffee and has oat milk, I had an iced cappuccino and asked for it not too sweet and it was just right, would highly recommend.
review_3_text:
They make my favorite coffee and Thai milk tea every morning.
It‚Äôs very nice and kindly serves me
review_4_text: Comfort coffee for me, recommend

name: Latteman coffee 3
review_1_text: The taste is very good. The owner is very friendly and lovely. I am very impressed.
review_2_text: It was delicious! I really liked it.
review_3_text: I really liked the taste.
review_4_text: The taste is very good.

name: CEZA COFFEE
review_1_text: Good coffee, fragrant, creamy, very rich, delicious. I recommend this shop.
review_2_text: Delicious coffee, lightly roasted beans, lovely owner, the owner takes care of the place himself.
review_3_text: The owner is friendly, the coffee is delicious, and the price is good üëçüèªüëçüèª
review_4_text: Good coffee, good tea, good cocoa ‚òï

name: Vincenzo Coffee (Esseppo ‡∏õ‡πà‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏î‡∏î )
review_1_text: Cheap and delicious coffee. I recommend dark roast with coconut.
review_2_text: Great iced Mocca.
review_3_text: Great value coffee, crazy barista

name: GonGlonCoffee
review_1_text: Relax after visited the ruins at this area. The coffee was great.
review_2_text: This coffee was really good! We liked it a lot. Very nice service
review_3_text: We had very good black Americano coffees at this van outside Wat Chedi Liem. Good value at 40 Baht each. Shaded seating area.
review_4_text: Delicious and inexpensive coffee
review_5_text: Good coffee, come try it.

name: Raise‚Äã Cafe
review_1_text: We stopped here for coffee and smoothies. A great hidden gem here in Chiang Mai. Excellent coffee and delicious smoothies. I highly recommend if you are in the area and looking for a place that is clean, safe, and delicious. We will be going back for sure.
review_2_text: We focus on the quality of every ingredient, while the prices at the shop are affordable enough to survive.
review_3_text: Amazing coffee at a nice local place. Nice atmosphere and a very friendly owner. Delicious coffee!!

name: One Chan cafe
review_1_text: Small but lovely and cozy cafe. The owners are lovely! Uncle and aunties! The drinks and desserts are fine + cutie mascot üíñ
review_2_text: Small cafe set in the garden of someone's house, complete with their super cute dog who will come up to you to say hello. Coffee is good, so was the atmosphere.
review_3_text: Good coffee, cute shop, and there's also an underground camping shop.
review_4_text: The cookies were delicious and the light came out of my mouth because the butter was good and not expensive. The cola was delicious and fresh. The coconut pudding was also delicious. The reception staff was very cute.
review_5_text: It was great! The atmosphere was very friendly.

name: Coffee & Me
review_1_text:
i looked for coffee at this place as i was going to a clinic nearby; 3 days in a row; no sign of life, no table outside, no real sign;
looks closed permanently to me
review_2_text: A small shop on Mahidol Road, located within the K-Park Business Center. Coffee is their main menu item and tastes good ‚òïÔ∏è. They also have a decent selection of √† la carte dishes. I already mentioned to the owner that the vegetables weren't cooked thoroughly, and I hope this helps them improve the taste even more üßÜ. It would add another great place for us to chill üßú‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. Parking isn't too difficult üöñ.

name: Cat's Alley Cafe ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡πÅ‡∏°‡∏ß‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
THE BEST CAT CAFE EVER. im not gate keeping this place anymore. please come visit this cafe more! the cats are cute, good prices ( no entrance fees just buy a drink, mine was only 75 baht ü´∂üèº ), also the decoration was so cozy.

the cafe was lil bit far away from the city but trust me it was worth it. they have parking too. also, to worth your trip, there's a second hand thrift shop around there (like 2-3 places with like 10-20 baht per pieces) if you interested too!
review_2_text:
Such a lovely and heartwarming cat caf√©! üêæ The place has adopted 14  cats, all super friendly and playful.

There‚Äôs no entrance fee ‚Äì just order at least one drink per person, and you get to enjoy your time with the cats. Drinks are nice, the staff is kind, and the cats bring so much joy. Highly recommended for cat lovers or anyone who wants a peaceful, happy place to relax.
review_3_text: Again we found Cat Alley on Google reviews. The food was lovely and reasonably priced my husband thought the braised chicken was the best meal that he had, had throughout his whole time in Vietnam. The people spoke good English and we return ed 2 nights in a row. If your visiting Hoi Chi Minh I suggest visiting Cat Alley.
review_4_text: Cute place! The cats are super friendly and very playful. There are a lot of them, do check out the top floor as well!
review_5_text:
The place is nice, but very bad attitude towards customers. Drink was good, but when you come with 4-5 kids, it‚Äôs overpriced.
In one hour we were asked to leave the place even we paid over 900 bats including drinks and food.
If to consider that generally we don‚Äôt have a crowd as our big family, we paid a good money for this unpleasant experience. unfortunately this bad treatment for your money is not delighted experience. Never come back and don‚Äôt recommend to anyone

name: Wooden Ville Kids Caf√©
review_1_text:
This is probably one of the top indoor playgrounds we have been to in Thailand - even more so than some of the top tier in Bangkok (because of spaciousness, variety and cleanliness).

It‚Äôs a Melissa and Doug catalogue. I loved the different areas - quiet section for books, puzzle areas, role-play, and then the climbing, swings and ball pit. The staff were really engaged for tidying up and safety‚Äî very sweet to my daughter.

Finally, the washroom area with the little potty‚Äôs was so clean. We enjoyed going even on a Saturday. The 10-12 slot is the best, most families didn‚Äôt come until 11 so for awhile it was like we had it all to ourselves. It‚Äôs worth the price for two hours.
review_2_text: We love this place! Every time we‚Äôre in town we visit. Perfect for our 5 and 2 year old boys. The staff does an excellent and thorough job keeping the toys organized and the spaces clean. They‚Äôre kind and welcoming to the kids and offer plenty of options to keep your little ones entertained for 2-4 hours.
review_3_text: very nice and well equipped new children's space. children enter the hall on schedule, the time of using the room is no more than two hours. friendly staff. were with a girl of three years, we really liked it.
review_4_text: The kids would love it, it is the parents who have to manage because 1), I paid 2 tickets for two grandparents to go in with the toddler, but somewhere in the middle, one grandparent got tired but the staff didn‚Äôt allow switching; so we ended up paying for 3 adults; 2), each 2 hours session is 300THB, and the whole day play is 500THB, no switch allowed. Considering the nature of kids, I find both rules unreasonable. 3) Matcha latte gives me headache, that‚Äôs rare for a person who drinks a lot of matcha latte. All in all, a good place for kids but not a no-brainer for parents.
review_5_text: Very clean and thoughtful play cafe. Bonus points for children-size toilets, nurseling room, and change tables! Food was tasty - probably the best I‚Äôve had at a children‚Äôs cafe. Lots of variety of play activities for the kids. Not the cheapest option but you get what you pay for. We will come back!

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏ó‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà Vanessa Donut Chiang mai
review_1_text:
I ordered donuts in advance for my daughter's birthday at school.
I saw an advertisement on Facebook and it was so pretty and luxurious that I thought it would go well with the birthday party.
If I buy 6, I got a 10% discount promotion, so I got a discount.
I was surprised that the donuts were not only pretty, but also they were so delicious. Both the children and adults enjoyed it satisfactorily.
The interior of the shop was spacious and neat, and the staff was kind.
review_2_text: I went to have the special in the menu board out front,but they were sold out of it. So I ordered the chicken burger and fries. The chicken burger was really tasty. As well as the lemonade. Unfortunately the fries looked nice but when they arrived they were cold. Other than that it was a good lunch. The doughnuts looked really great and I will be back to try them for sure. The atmosphere is nice they have a small water feature out back that is really cute. The place looked fairly clean and the staff was very helpful. The price was just about right for the food I received. The coffee drinks looked really good with a wide variety Give it a shot. I'll certainly be back to give it another go.
review_3_text:
I bought 2 Doughnuts, taste quite too sweet for me. However, i like Van Houton though.

For service, quite ok. Staff was polite.

Atmosphere l: nice and leisure. However, car park didnt have much.

Pricing: medium
review_4_text: I was excited for the Ceasar salad as it looked in the photo on the menu. Instead it was limp, soggy, way overdressed, and full of onion and tomato (so, not a Ceasar salad). The chicken had chunks of fat and bone and gristle. I could not eat the salad, and I also waited a long time for it. At least the atmosphere is very nice both inside and outside.
review_5_text: I was delighted to find this place. It's clean and bright with natural light. The donuts are delicious, and the coffee is good. It wasn't crowded with people and the staff were very friendly.

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏õ‡∏ï‡∏ó.‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏´‡∏≠‡∏¢
review_1_text: Staffs are very polite and kind. Great service mind .
review_2_text:
typical amazon, same products; opens at 6;
in the back of the ptt gas station complex, good parking
review_3_text: Coffee is bitter, staff leaves LINEMAN incoming order alarm go on for way too long. Not peaceful. Not enjoyable. Starbucks is much better.
review_4_text:
Nice cafe
Good coffee
Laptop friendly
review_5_text: COFFEE and tea . taste as before

name: Hom Cafe
review_1_text: A calm, inviting space that is so chilled.  Soft jazz music, cool breeze and great service. It's very affordable and the coffee is brilliant.
review_2_text:
Great food and drinks, very lovely staff! I can‚Äôt eat spicy food, so they cook for me just something not on the menu which is not spicy. I really appreciate such care.
Tasty cocoa with mint, I got addicted to itüòÉ
Prices are very attractive as well, thank you üôèüèº
review_3_text: Very friendly ownerüçÄBeautiful garden, smoke area avaliable.
review_4_text: Tasty drinks and food. Comfortable and clean. Sweet service.  Very reasonable prices. I'm usually suspicious of 5 star reviews, but this review was unsolicited (I'm not the owner's cousin) and is well-deserved. Nuttin' fancy, just homey and nice!
review_5_text: Although it is a little small shop, it is very beautiful and clean.  The taste of the cafe is very good.  The price is not too high!  The clerk's friendship is good!  I want to go again.  There is a parking lot.

name: Alchemist drip coffee
review_1_text:
This drip coffee spot  in the Nong Hoi neighborhood of Chiang Mai is like hanging out at a friend's house‚Äîif your friend was super passionate about coffee!

The owner, Mac, is all about drip coffee, using a great selection of Thai beans to craft each cup. The shop‚Äôs spacious yard, full of plants and greenery, gives it a super chill vibe, perfect for relaxing and enjoying a slow brew.

If you‚Äôre into coffee, it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit!

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: New menu item: Creamy Latte. The cream isn't fluffy, it's liquid, no different from milk foam. They made it too quickly. This menu item should be canceled. Don't try to make it. If the standards don't match the concept of every branch like this, you shouldn't expect too much because it won't end well. When you enter the shop, the atmosphere is stuffy. The seating arrangement isn't very good. The door is broken, making it difficult to open and exit. The staff doesn't look welcoming and their tone of voice isn't good. That's enough. Just this once.
review_2_text: Extremely slow. No matter how many sets of staff are changed, it's always just as slow.
review_3_text: Ordered on grab fast service and it was very good I recommend!
review_5_text: Located inside a shopping facility, it is easy to access

name: HOP CAFE
review_1_text: Bad customer service
review_2_text: A hidden gem on the road from Chiang Mai to Pai! This small caf√© nestled in the jungle enchants with incredibly good coffee and a breathtaking view. But it's not just the coffee that's a highlight ‚Äì the food is equally delicious. Fresh, local ingredients make every dish a treat. Perfect for a relaxing break in idyllic surroundings!
review_3_text: The staff member is unsatisfactory. She was constantly in a bad mood, provided poor customer service, and didn't check the order beforehand.
review_4_text: The service staff was very bad. Their manners were inappropriate.

name: ? COFFEE
review_1_text:
Nice little Caf√©
Good coffee and other drinks
Friendly owner

Seats and tables available
review_2_text: Very good. The shop is cute. The seller is cute. The taste of the drink is good and easy to drink. Overall, very good.

name: Blackbox Coffee
review_1_text: Excellent choice for coffee, mocha, latte, Thai tea (on the menu as Chai Nom Yen), green tea, and iced tea. Air conditioning seating inside and free Wi-Fi. The owner's name is Aum, pronounced 'oom'.

name: Sang San coffee
review_1_text: Very nice cup of coffee today.  You have 2 roasts to choose from.  Dark and medium. All equipment is professional and the service is pretty good.  There is enough seating comfortably for about 12 people here.    This place is ok
review_2_text: Nice place. Good Coffee üòã
review_3_text:
There was a bit of a mess on Google Maps, so when I sent him the photo, he went to another location, Sang San Coffee, in San Kamphaeng District, Chiang Mai.
I often come to Chiang Mai 89 Plaza on Wednesdays when the night market is on, and I always stop in for an iced latte before heading out to the market.
review_4_text: Cut the queue for other customers
review_5_text: I often drink light roast lattes.

name: Waffleday „ÉØ„ÉÉ„Éï„É´„Éá (‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô238/3)
review_1_text: good
review_2_text: It's delicious.

name: Minna matcha
review_1_text: Cute and homey cafe with a great variety of matcha. The staff is super friendly and helpful. A hidden gem for anyone who wants to avoid crowded cafes.
review_2_text: Small little cafe remind me of Japan‚Ä¶ Love the coconut Matcha üçµ
review_3_text:
If you're a matcha lover, this place is a must-visit! The matcha menu is absolutely amazing ‚Äî you can really tell the owner is deeply knowledgeable and incredibly passionate about every detail. They give thoughtful recommendations and are super friendly and welcoming.

I also highly recommend trying the Strawberry Lychee Soda ‚Äî it's delicious, perfectly sweet, and super refreshing!

Their coffee menu is fantastic as well. The owner‚Äôs attention to detail really shines through in every cup. I can't recommend this place enough!
review_4_text: This was my favorite stop in Chiang Mai! The lady was very knowledgeable about matcha and helped me decide which one to try and bring home. There was a wide variety of matcha and all were quality. Being able to watch the process in front of you makes it so intimate and fun! Would definitely go again!
review_5_text:
Lovely matcha place ever!!
Also nice instruction by owner

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏•‡πà‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏¢ Salah Khalai Coffee
review_1_text: Best place for good coffee in the Nong Hoi area. Salah Khalai has a cosy atmosphere and the owners are very welcoming. They are passionate about their coffee and matcha, letting you discover new things. Visiting this place is an experience every time. 100% recommended.
review_2_text: Great coffee and matcha, although I prefer coffee. Flat whites and dirties are great, good coffee beans, fantastic processing, and even proper oat milk. Overall, 10/10 coffee experience, with excellent service and cozy atmosphere.
review_3_text: Absolutely recommend this coffee shop, the owners really pay attention on details of my cup & cozy place ‚ï∞(*¬¥Ô∏∂`*)‚ïØ
review_4_text: Hidden in a small yet cozy wood house, this place serves one of the best coffee in Chiang Mai in my opinion. Such a gem that highlights my trip.
review_5_text: Must visit coffee shop.  American Honey Lemon is not to be missed.  Great coffee shop.  Also, the coffee recommended by the boss is very delicious, with a light floral fragrance.  So delicious, beautiful price.

name: Minimal coffee - ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤Wasabi Park
review_1_text: This coffee shop in Chiang Mai is my favorite. The coffee is consistently delicious, and there is ample parking. The barista is exceptionally friendly, remembers customer orders, and maintains composure and efficiency even during peak hours. I highly recommend this establishment and would gladly hire the barista if possible. Keep up the excellent work!
review_2_text:
During my holiday visit to Chiang Mai, I stumbled upon Minimal coffee at Wasabi park while searching for a nearby coffee shop. This place became my go-to spot for a cup of coffee at a pocket-friendly price while being productive. Latte and milk tea were both nice. I loved having the option to choose the roast-level coffee. The ambiance of the shop completes with air conditioning, Wi-Fi, and power sockets.

Moreover, the staff members were accommodating. They assisted me in connecting to the Wi-Fi and explained how their loyalty point system works. Their friendly service added to the overall positive experience.
review_4_text: Good coffee for a decent price. The staff are friendly and helpful ‚ò∫Ô∏è pleasant to sit there, and there's a good atmosphere
review_5_text: Service and quality is hit and miss at Minimal but this location is one of the better ones. Nice skilled baristas here. Recommended.

name: bf.59 | Coffee & More
review_1_text: Great environment and tasty coffee and tea. The cafe owner is really friendly and kind. Highly recommend, here is a real gem.
review_2_text:
Very lovely cafe ‚ô°
Good mood ‚ô°
COFFEE is dark and very hot (love it !!!)
You should come here ‚ô°
review_3_text: So delicious milk tea
review_4_text: This is a quiet and relaxing coffee shop. The coffee is of high quality for the price.
review_5_text:
Korean:
A relaxed atmosphere with a kind host.
I enjoyed the latte, coconut Americano, and butterfly pea drink.

English:
A relaxed atmosphere with a kind host.

name: Amway Cafe
review_1_text: Place to sit and wait while shopping at Amway shop. Place is clean and cozy environment. Variey of drink menu including promoted health Amway drink to select from. Price is for Amway member, having your number available for cashier. Only low side is in the afternoon the sun go through big glass wall, it quite hot inside.
review_2_text: delicious

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡πÑ‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏Å by ‡∏®‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏û‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏¢ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: Good service, delicious bubble tea, recommended.
review_2_text: Cocoa Caramel is very delicious.
review_3_text: The atmosphere is good and the coffee is very delicious.
review_4_text: It's really delicious.

name: Cafe Payakam
review_1_text: Lovely place, coffee
review_2_text: A cute, cozy family-run coffee shop with a large garden behind it for strolling and relaxation. Usually open only to their Airbnb guests but open to the public on weekends. A good place to unwind before picking up kids from school.
review_3_text: The cafe is very peaceful, shady and inviting. I will go back to sit and relax again. It is very peaceful. The coffee is delicious, like eating at a fancy restaurant.
review_4_text: The shop is clean and comfortable. The coffee tastes very good. The shop is shady and peaceful. There is a lot of nature to see, chickens, birds, trees. It is very enjoyable.
review_5_text: It's a nice, relaxing place to sit, surrounded by nature, and you can even watch a mother hen raising her chicks.

name: ‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥‡πÄ‡∏á‡∏µ‡πâ‡∏¢‡∏ß‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà by ‡πÅ‡∏°‡πà‡∏ô‡∏∏‡πâ‡∏¢
review_1_text: Great food and very kind staff!
review_2_text:
The Chiang Rai Nam Ngiao noodles are incredibly rich and flavorful. I love the Ngiao flowers, so I ordered some for home delivery this time. The restaurant also offers a wide selection of soups, including fish curry and green chicken curry. They also have chicken khao soi and non-spicy options for kids.

They have fresh coffee and a delicious Americano, which I like because it's not too strong or bitter. The milk is not too sweet and has a well-balanced flavor. They also offer quality sodas.
review_3_text: The Nam Ngiao soup is very rich and delicious. Every time I come here, I have to eat it. The shop also has many other food and drink menus.
review_4_text: I ordered through Line Man and had it delivered to my home. The Nam Ngiao soup was delicious and flavorful. The packaging was good and ready to eat. I think the portion size was generous for the price. The green tea was also nice and not too sweet, and the price reflected the quality.
review_5_text:
Every khanom jeen soup is delicious. I love it so much. It's so delicious.
They also have a wide selection of coffee beans. Every one is delicious.

name: Dunbar' s coffee
review_1_text: Best barista in CM transferred shop from Chiang Mai Land to this new location. The coffee is delicious as always.
review_2_text: Good coffee and good service mind
review_3_text: The drinks are really good! Coffee lovers shouldn't miss it! üòòü´∂üèªüòòü´∂üèª

name: ‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏¢‡πá‡∏ô

review_1_text: A small caf√© nestled in the shade of two beautiful trees. The owner is friendly, and the latte and iced lemon tea were delicious! There are small tables where you can sit and camp üòâ We'll be back!

name: SOLACE
review_1_text:
Coffee shop below co-working & meeting spaces.

Well made coffee and fresh ham & cheese bagel.

Attractive spirit house in the center of the parking lot.
review_2_text:
While traveling through East Asia, we kept running into the same problem. The coffee just wasn‚Äôt doing it for us. We love coffee, and after tasting it all over the world, our expectations are high. Then, in Northern Thailand, everything changed.

We were driving through Chiang Mai with no real plan when we noticed a small sign that simply said ‚ÄúSolace.‚Äù Something about it caught our eye, so we pulled in without thinking too much about it. That turned out to be one of the best stops of our trip.

The second we walked into Solace Caf√©, we felt it. Not just the smell of fresh coffee, but a calm that made you slow down without trying. The space was bright and open, with sunlight coming in and soft music playing. It felt peaceful, welcoming, and honestly like exactly where we needed to be at that moment.

My girlfriend and I have always bonded over coffee. Over the years, we‚Äôve made it a thing to search for great coffee wherever we travel. It started with Ethiopian Yirgacheffe, and after that first cup, we were hooked. Since then, every place we visit, we‚Äôre chasing that same feeling.

We‚Äôve walked through coffee farms in Colombia, tasting beans roasted right there on the spot. Brazil surprised us with rich, chocolatey flavors that instantly made sense once you tasted them. Costa Rica gave us clean, bright cups grown high in the mountains. Italy taught us to appreciate a simple espresso done right. Turkey and Vietnam showed us completely different ways coffee can be enjoyed, and we loved that too.

Coffee, for us, isn‚Äôt just about caffeine. It‚Äôs tied to memories, places, and moments we‚Äôll always remember.

Back at Solace, we took our time looking through the display. Freshly baked cakes, snacks, desserts, and fresh squeezed juices all looked incredible. You could tell nothing was rushed and everything was made with care.

I went with the blueberry cheesecake, and it was unreal. Smooth, creamy, not too heavy, with a buttery crust and just enough blueberry to balance it out. I paired it with a cappuccino, warm, rich, and comforting in the best way.

They also offer three coffee roasts, light, medium, and dark, so you can really choose what fits your mood.

We shared a Thai Harvest Energy Bar made with dried longan, toasted coconut, nuts, seeds, and a touch of honey. We also grabbed fresh squeezed juices and a ginger lemon shot, which was the perfect pick me up before heading back out into the city.

Some of the best travel moments happen when you don‚Äôt plan them. You just follow your instincts and see where you end up. Solace was one of those places for us, and it‚Äôs a stop we won‚Äôt forget.
review_3_text:
The coffee is very delicious with excellent quality. It‚Äôs aromatic and has a well-balanced flavor.

The shop pays great attention to details, from the packaging to the ice.

Even though I ordered delivery, the quality was just as good as if I had eaten at the shop.

I recommend going to the shop because the atmosphere is great, and the service is excellent.

name: Yokkrok Cafe
review_1_text: Our new neighborhood go-to. We just moved down the street from this place, and I dropped in on my way home. The staff was very friendly and the hostess spoke excellent English. She helped guide me through the menu and I brought home a delicious meal. She also mentioned that they would be happy to deliver to our house, so I took her up on it tonight. I had a wonderful Pad See Ew moo, broad noodles with vegetables and pork in a delicious sauce. My wife had the stirfry pork with garlic, and a side of white rice, and we split an order of kale with pork also served with white rice. She says the pork was very good and very garlicky, and she knows her pork. The kale was also very tasty, although we had hoped for morning glory, but they ran out. We definitely recommend this place, and plan on making it our regular neighborhood eatery.
review_2_text: Food was good but the service was dysfunctional. A very long wait for the food we ordered, even though they were not particularly busy. We had to remind them a number of times about outstanding food orders - no feedback provided, left totally in the dark as to what was going on! For example, the rice was delivered after all the other dishes had been served, and eaten! This is such a shame as this is clearly an exciting new venue in the area. My feeling is the establishment lacks any clear leadership. If they fix this, they will be destined for success, I'm sure. One positive, the musician/singer was excellent.
review_3_text: Love this place. We came on Friday night. Arrived at about 6:30 pm so there was still one parking space left for us. Parking space is limited but the food and atmosphere is not. Great food, entertainment, and view.
review_4_text:

May be I ask a lot of things because I am first time to come. The tea set is bounced to scone. If you want to try the cream cake, you have to buy separate.
Actually I don‚Äôt like the tea which she recommended. But the place is relaxing. My sister doesn‚Äôt like the chair as well.

review_2_text: Fragrant tea, great coffee, and air conditioning make this spot a gem. The atmosphere is sophisticated, with traditional Chinese-style tables and chairs adding a classic touch. There‚Äôs parking available too. If you‚Äôre visiting Wat Phra That Doi Kham, make sure to stop by‚Äîit‚Äôs incredibly affordable!

review_5_text: Visited the place last year. However, the standard of the cake and scone has dropped. The cake is as not firm as it was last year - acceptable level. The scone is very flaky - not recommend to try. Place suitable for tea and coffee.

review_2_text: I found this nice little coffee shop while riding my motorcycle. The coffee was really good and tasted great. She is very friendly, and the place felt cozy. It's a great spot to take a break and enjoy some coffee. I recommend it to anyone passing by!

Please stop in to support this cute Coffee shop.

review_1_text: What a lovely atmosphere here, the cafe is surrounded with a warm garden. Coffee is delicious. I definitely will comeback.

review_3_text: The food was delicious, every dish was great, and the staff provided excellent service.
review_4_text: I visited the shop and the staff were very attentive and friendly. The food was delicious and the coffee was strong. I was in a hurry to go pay respects at Wat Phra That Doi Kham but accidentally left my bag at the shop. I called to inquire, and the staff quickly contacted me back and kept my bag for me. I was extremely impressed. I will definitely come back and support them again if I have the chance.
review_5_text: The cake was delicious, the food was delicious, and the service was excellent.

name: Chamcha @ Doi Kham
review_1_text: Have visited here several times and all has been always good enough. This time breakfast set was already cold when I got it, but I can still give 5 stars for the place over all. Will return.
review_2_text: This place is super to take your young children. The play area kept our 3 year old entertained for a couple of hours, while the big leaved trees provided plenty of shade for our baby. The Koi Carp were equally entertaining for everyone. We went Monday early afternoon and it was very quite. We just had a couple of delicious smoothies.
review_3_text: Great place overall ‚Äì very family-friendly and comfortable even with small kids. Food prices are reasonable, not too cheap or too expensive. The view is lovely and the atmosphere is perfect for a relaxing weekend. Convenient location, not too far from the city.
review_4_text:
The fried rice in pineapple and fried rice with pork was very good, not too oily and the salt content was perfect (very little). The size of the dish was on the small size considering the cost.
We also ordered khao soi with chicken. The soup, wet noodles, dry noodles were very good and plenty of flavour and hot spice üòã. The chicken that came with it was not as good, cooked correctly but then left to dry in a fridge, then reheated and put in, because the inside was dry and very difficult to break the meat away. I ended up taking it out and used my finger to hold it while taking a bite and then some soup.
The Mocha cold was very good, good mix of coffee and chocolate.
review_5_text:
Amazing, big and quiet place in a nice, cool valley. We had lunch at the enclosed a/c room on the 2nd floor with great views.
All the dishes were tasty except the mash potatoes which came with the chicken steak. The mash had no taste and looked like muesli.

name: I Have Cacao Trees Coffee & Crafts Cocoa.
review_1_text:
This place is a MUST for people who love a good quality coffee and delightful experience. Bee, the barista, is the most friendly and joyful barista ever. Coco the dog is a very friendly and cute pet of his. It is totally worthy the visit, even if you have to travel 30 minutes off your way to go there. There is a beautiful white temple only 5 minutes from there as well.

You can tell how much love and effort Bee puts in every single cup of coffee he makes!
The experience of trying the cocoa fruit with coffee for the first time is a something I strong recommend to everyone!
I do not regret going there every single day I spent in Chiang Mai!!
review_2_text: We went to this shop a few times while staying nearby. B is an absolutely lovely man and a knowledgeable barista! We wanted to try the cacao pulp coffee but he didn't have any on hand, so he brought us to the trees in the back to find a fresh pod. Such a fun experience, and really good coffee!! Highly recommend the cacao shell coffee latte. The atmosphere was also great, such fun decor, and a super sweet pup named Coco. I'd for sure be a regular here if I lived in Chiang Mai. Thank you, B ü©∑
review_3_text: This cozy cafe serves cocoa made from scratch using cocoa beans. The owner is very friendly, and he explained a lot of things. We ordered an ice cocoa, and it was incredible! It was my first time seeing a cocoa pod, which was also very exciting! Thank you very much for the wonderful experience!
review_4_text: Makes good quality coffee. Also tasted the fresh cocoa drink, it was so flavorful. The owner has his own plantation where he harvests the cocoa and fermented them himself. Bought dark chocolate from him which is 100% cocoa without any sugar or other additives. This also tastes quite good.
review_5_text:
recently discovered this charming little caf√© on a quiet street, and it‚Äôs a true hidden gem! The owner cultivates his own cocoa and roasts it himself, resulting in an exceptional hot chocolate. The same dedication goes into their coffee, which is of the highest quality. It‚Äôs a place that feels like a well-kept secret, and I highly recommend visiting.

The owner is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, providing lots of information. He can even speak English, which is great for international visitors. If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about cocoa, he even has fruits available for tasting.

As a chocolatier from Switzerland, I can confidently say that the hot cocoa here is outstanding. I would go back in a heartbeat and recommend it to everyone. Whether you prefer hot or iced chocolate, or top-notch coffee, this place has it all. Plus, there‚Äôs plenty of parking. It‚Äôs truly a wonderful spot that shouldn‚Äôt be missed!‚Äù

name: YEAR Coffee
review_1_text:
A fun little coffee place where the owner prepares Thai meals. We had Thai Tea, cold noodle salad and rice with spicy chicken and basil. The lady cooks and prepares all by herself so don‚Äôt be in a rush. We spent around 20-30 min there.
The food was delicious, the tea cool & refeshing.
You can park your car at the temple nearby and take a 5 min stroll to get there.
We highly recommend going there!
review_2_text: After our morning hike to Wat Aranyawas, we stopped here for a cup of coffee around 10 am. There were many of us (10-12) altogether, and we took tables and chairs indoors. Our orders came as first-come, first-serve bases, and I was quite pleased about the latter art, ‚Äúseahorse‚Äù that was so cute!  At our table, there was a horse, leaves and bunny aside from mine. The coffee tasted strong yet gentle, there was no bitter taste. I would definitely go back to try other items and look forward to interesting latte arts. There were motorbike parking inside the property, and there is additional parking lot for cars across the street.
review_3_text: Fantastic find along the way to the White Pagoda / Wat Ban Pong! Cosy place serving the best coffee of the trip. Taiwan milk tea was delicious as well!
review_4_text: What a fantastic little coffee shop! Both coffee and meals were absolutely delicious. The place has very cozy and calm atmosphere. After only one visit I'm 100% it won't be my last.
review_5_text: After temple walking, we stopped by to get drinks. Bf got a mango smoothie. I wanted something lighter than smoothie. I also did not want coffee drinks so I asked if she can sell coconut water only , not coconut smoothie. She asked sugar option, and I chose no sugar. No sugar coconut water was good and hydrating. Natural faint sweetness was everything I was looking for as I do not like sugary drinks.

name: TENG COFFEE
review_1_text:
We stopped by this small local caf√© on our way to the football grounds and had a lovely experience. The cappuccino and cacao were delightful, and the chicken sandwich with avocado salad was tasty and fresh under reasonable price expectations.

The caf√© has limited seating, so big groups may find it a bit cramped, and sitting outdoors without ventilation can get warm. The menu isn‚Äôt extensive, but everything is made to order, not premade, so there‚Äôs a short wait ‚Äî definitely worth it for the quality.

The caf√© is run by a sweet lady, Teng, who adds a personal touch to the experience with her genuine smile.

Verdict: Great for a cozy stop for coffee and light meals; fresh, well-prepared food and a welcoming vibe.
review_2_text: One of the best sandwich and salad I've ever had. The portion was huge and is not expensive.
review_3_text: We stay 1 minute from this nice cozy coffee shop. The coffees are very well made and yummy. Be sure to stop by if you're around or on the way to the mountains!
review_4_text: Such a nice owner. Haven't tasted his coffee but he gifted me a poncho after i got caught by the rain and stranded in front of his closed coffee shop. I'll come back for sure, thank you so much!
review_5_text: We were walking past and decided to stop for a drink, what a pleasant surprise! Great service and coffee

name: Praw & Plean Green House Cafe
review_1_text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting this charming caf√© and garden house, and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough! The moment you step through the beautifully crafted gate, you‚Äôre welcomed into a serene oasis of nature and hospitality. The lush greenery and rustic decor create an atmosphere that is both tranquil and inviting, perfect for unwinding and enjoying a leisurely afternoon.

The attention to detail is evident, from the quaint sign that beckons you in to the thoughtful landscaping that surrounds the property. The garden itself is a feast for the senses, with vibrant blooms and carefully tended paths that make it a joy to explore.

As for the caf√©, the offerings were exceptional. Each drink and dish was clearly prepared with care and showcased fresh, local ingredients. The service was warm, friendly, and attentive, adding to the overall experience. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a quiet place to reflect, a spot to meet friends, or simply want to soak in nature‚Äôs beauty, this hidden gem is the perfect escape. Don‚Äôt miss out on this enchanting spot!
review_2_text: Our new favorite restaurant, along with Ozark next door. When you arrive you get menus from both places and can mix & match western and Thai to your heart‚Äôs content. Delicious food, beautiful setting, great service.
review_3_text:
Great environment.  Good view. Good fresh coffee. Food also serves  here. Beautiful garden too.
One can get here by bicycle, motorbike, car.
To get here is not difficult. Use Google map and navigate.
Good to lunch here. Wheel chair is accessable.
One fine place to relax.
review_4_text: Google reviews on point amazing food and coffee. Many choices. Khao soi with chicken 10/10 with spice on side, superb quality. Banana flambe dessert also 10/10, excellent.
review_5_text: Have visited many times before Covid. Delighted to visit again in February 2023. Improved menu but unspoilt garden and relaxed atmosphere. We'll worth visiting.

name: KOBION CAFE
review_1_text:
I have been to Kobion caf√© couple of times for a cup of coffee but this time I tried their food as well.

This place is a calm oasis tucked away from the bustling main street making it the perfect spot to work or read. Its modern, tastefully decorated space creates an instantly peaceful and welcoming atmosphere. The coffee is expertly crafted and delicious, the concise food menu offers fresh, Thai food, and the genuinely friendly service completes the experience. It‚Äôs the ideal spot for a serene escape with a perfect cup in hand.

The staff is friendly and  attentive without being intrusive, allowing the calm atmosphere to remain undisturbed.
review_2_text: The environment at Kobion is super calm and cozy, the interior is super aesthetic as well. I ordered a mango smoothie and it‚Äôs got to be one of the best mango smoothie‚Äôs I‚Äôve had so far. The service here is also amazing as the staff are kind, patient, and polite. Would highly recommend.
review_3_text: How amazing is this?!! 45 THB for a delicious Dark Roast Espresso that is full bodied, velvety and full of passion as it caresses Your tongue, like something from a dream ‚ù§Ô∏è Thank You Kobion Cafe' üôè‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: Ambience is good: coffee is just soso. But not expensive. Chill cool n good place to work if u wants
review_5_text: Comfortable seating.  Coffee is good.  French fries were very tasty.  Easy parking.

name: Underbridge coffee
review_1_text: I went to this coffee shop recently for afternoon coffee. It is a nice place to have a coffee and relax but the unfriendly staff (a lady) with very poor customer service make you feel like you are getting a coffee for free. The price of cappuccino was above average price in Chiang Mai city. I was happy to leave the place as soon as possible.
review_2_text: Came for an early morning coffee, price of a latte is 70 baht (large size latte BTW) ambience is nice but staff not friendly.
review_3_text: Freshly ground coffee, and delicious pastries heated at the moment. Americano coffee with a bit of milk is so tasty. Overall, cozy little coffee shop.
review_4_text: Cozy vibes, food, coffee and services are perfect. One of the best in Chiangmai
review_5_text: Very distinctive and cozy space. Coffee and snacks are very good. Recommended!!!

name: BEHIGH CAFE
review_1_text: The coffee is strong and delicious, not inferior to any other brand.

name: paopao cafe‚Äô
review_1_text: Friendly coffee shop located inside the parking garage and just near the main entrance.   This is appears an independent coffee shop.  2 baristas providing good fast service.  The barista asked me good questions for accuracy.  Coffee was good.  Cold ac inside
review_2_text: A surprising coffee shop! Kind of hidden in a small plaza, this little gem produces some really great coffee! Excellent cappuccinos with very friendly service. The bonus is you can go shopping right after! Definitely a repeated customer.
review_3_text: It's quiet and a convenient place to take a break after shopping in the warehouse owned by the same owner.
review_4_text: Hidden gem. Crazy strong wifi, 50bahts iced cappuccino, AC, quiet and awesome sitting. Amazing place!
review_5_text: Good inexpensive coffee lighting fast wifi. Clean and quiet

review_1_text: Taiwanese bubble milk tea is very fragrant and delicious. It is worth the price, only 19 baht. Add pearls for another 5 baht. There are many other beverage menus to choose from.
review_2_text: The Mala sauce with the cat carrying a chili pepper logo is really delicious! It can be used in a variety of dishes, especially grilled food ‚Äì it's fantastic!
review_3_text: Delicious and inexpensive, this is the place to go.
review_4_text: Very delicious, can be used in many dishes. Buying it to keep at home is very worthwhile.
review_5_text: Can make many different menus, delicious taste, can also be made into a side job.

name: Mike‚Äômilk & coffee
review_1_text: I got an iced Americano to go for 40 baht. The coffee was tasty and strong, just as I like it. Top-notch service as well, I recommend!
review_2_text:
This is a coffee shop with quality that exceeds its price. You could say that the quality exceeds its price, comparable to famous brand shops. The coffee beans, the coffee maker, and the coffee maker are all complete. The quality is over 4 stars in all three aspects.

This is a coffee shop with quality that exceeds its price. You could say that the quality exceeds its price, comparable to famous brand shops. The coffee beans, the coffee maker, and the coffee maker are all complete. The quality exceeds 4 stars in all three aspects.

review_3_text: The coffee tastes good and the staff are polite.

name: ‡∏Æ‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏Ç‡∏±‡∏ß ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà
review_1_text:
I drove past it by chance. It's a riverside coffee shop with a great atmosphere. üòäüòä
They have a wide variety of drinks and plenty of spots to relax and chill.
Everything was delicious.
review_2_text: The coffee is delicious, with a wonderful aroma of roasted coffee beans.
review_3_text: Delicious and rich. I've tried many dishes already. üëçüëç

name: The Coffee Leaf
review_1_text: The Coffee Leaf is a caf√© that feels like a ‚Äúreset space‚Äù for working professionals and those seeking a slower pace of life. The interior is airy, spacious, and well-organized, making every corner functional without feeling cramped. The coffee is distinguished by its aroma and smoothness, with a clean, easy-to-drink taste that clearly retains the unique characteristics of the beans. The baristas are dedicated and attentive to detail, reflecting the caf√©'s high standards. This isn't just a coffee shop; it's a space where thoughts can naturally become clearer.

name: Starbucks Chiang Mai International Airport
review_1_text: The staff were so friendly and went out of their way to get me a seat . the woman serving me my coffee was so friendly and made such polite conversation with me  but didn't catch her name . my matcha and Americano were lovely and my banana cake was really nice . I have never met such friendly Starbucks workers there normally so grumpy
review_2_text:
On ground floor.
Food & service is okay.
review_3_text: Fast service and with available tables and chairs
review_4_text: Standard coffee shop good services and alot of drinks
review_5_text: Staff very rude!!!  Not even waste ur time in this coffee place special the evening staff.  1 little girl very rude.  Never again will go and pls pep don't try go there or buy something good staff looks like don't want to work or be there or even help clients.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Inside the compound of PTT gas  station . Provide electricity outlet. Spacious and quiet. They play music.
review_2_text: Right next to KFC in PTT gas station.
review_3_text: Can always rely on good taste
review_4_text: Good services, friendly staff, good coffee
review_5_text: Small Amazon cafe at the gas station

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ã‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏±‡∏•‡πÅ‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡∏û‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡∏ï ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Stupidest coffee experience I have had in Thailand in my 2 years here. I ordered a large hot cappuccino which took forever to make. When I finally get my order, I get a large cup which is only half full of cappuccino coffee. Then when I ask them to fill the cup, they add in some ice. Like really? Then when I tell them that's not what I wanted they act rude and unhelpful. I ask to replace the drink with a black coffee, which they begrudginly agree to do. Then again I get a large cup half full of black coffee. Why even serve in large cups if you can't fill them with coffee? I mean I understand about kreng jai but I'm not Thai so what the... I finally gave up arguing and just drank what they gave me. Maybe there was some issue with my limited Thai language skills, but there's too many other good coffee options in Thailand to deal with this nonsense chain ever again.
review_2_text: Customer service was unsatisfactory üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°we ordered 2 coffees and paid with Citi bank credit card, which we should have 10% off from purchase.  There were 3 staff for us, none of them aware or care about the promotion, and didn‚Äôt even bother to find out what we were asking for!!!  We had same purchase in other CAFE AMAZON, there‚Äôs only one staff for us and other 3 groups of customers, and she managed our drinks and payment correctly according to promotions of Caf√© Amazon.  As we asked them why we couldn‚Äôt get 10% off, three staff went off to their mobile instead of taking care of our queries ü§Ø I‚Äôm upset not only for 15 baht discount, but their attitude and ignorance!  Minus Star for rating!
review_3_text: The quality is not the same like in the other beaches...
review_4_text: All good!
review_5_text: Medium-sized shop with about 10 seats. The shop is beautiful. The staff are friendly and take orders quickly. The system is very good. The service is fast. The shop is clean and tidy. At this time, the glasses are cute with festive designs. There are many snacks to choose from.

name: Roastniyom Coffee
review_1_text: We stopped here for some iced latte in the hot afternoon and the coffee was extremely refreshing. It is located inside a gas station along with other fast food joints. The interiors were neat and clean. The staff was humble and this cafe is in close proximity of the Chiang Mai airport.
review_2_text: They don't care about homeless people me and my wife have been homeless for 2 months and they wanted use to move somewhere else and they wanted to say that I kidnapped my wife when they are trying to lie just to get me arrested just because of my skin color they are even trying to fire a employee just because they felt bad for my wife and i
review_3_text: A peaceful afternoon. I am waiting for people here , a cup of coffee isn‚Äôt bad
review_4_text: Was staying overnight nearby and found this delicious coffee shop!!  Yummy latte a little bit off main road behind Burger King
review_5_text: Very good coffee !!! Nice people working there... The beauty girl also friendly !

name: ‡∏¢‡∏≠‡∏î‡∏ä‡∏≤‚Äã ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‚Äã ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÇ‡∏è‡πÇ‡∏Æ‡∏•‡πÄ‡∏ã‡∏•‡∏•‡πå‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
Hey guys, so I just had the best experience at this caf√©! The staff here are super friendly and welcoming. When I came in, there was this guy and a lady working, and honestly, they were both so nice
anything I asked for, they were happy to help.

I actually first came here right after I landed in Chiang Mai
it‚Äôs called Yodcha , and it‚Äôs inside a mall just by Chiang Mai Airport. A couple of days ago, I tried one of the best teas I‚Äôve ever had in Chiang Mai. It was this lemon tea, super refreshing. My friend got a hot latte and an iced latte, and both were amazing.

They also have this local specialty called ‚ÄòChiang Mai Bread‚Äô it‚Äôs basically toast, but it‚Äôs so good. And the ice cream? Sweet, creamy, and honestly, I think it might have coconut milk in it‚Ä¶ not sure, but it was incredible.

So yeah, if I ever come back to Chiang Mai, I‚Äôm 100% coming back here. And I‚Äôm totally telling all my friends about this place!
review_2_text:
Some of the best iced tea I've ever had anywhere.

The Chiang Mai white flower iced tea even without any sugar has such an amazing natural sweetness.

My wife's pure matcha was also excellent.

We also got two very nice cups that we can use at the house.

Great quiet place to hang out if you are waiting for people at Central Plaza or the Airport.
review_3_text: No cash accepted. That‚Äôs so disappointing. What‚Äôs wrong with paying cash even though I told them no need to change. Amazon next door always welcome all kinds of customers with option to pay .
review_4_text:
Sunday, 3 PM

I usually order online. The tea is delicious. I recommend it to everyone I meet. When I arrived, I was very disappointed. Not with the tea, but with the staff.

- The customer stood at the counter and didn't pay attention. When I called to order tea, they looked upset and didn't say anything. Another person came to take my place. They were busy, standing in the wrong spot, or something. Could they just say, "Wait a minute," or something?

- When I ordered, they were silent. They didn't accept cash, and they abruptly said, "No cash accepted." They looked at me like someone using cash had a problem, even though it was government-issued.

- When they called for tea, they didn't call my name. They just said green tea. Who knows whose cup it was? They put it all down at the same time. Then the staff complained, "I want to get off work at 4:00, I want to go live my life."

- I wonder if the shop is forcing the staff to work overtime. Why are the staff complaining and not being attentive?

- The atmosphere is bad. The shop is hot. They're not as friendly as the staff.

I won't recommend this place to anyone again. It's a shame the tea is so good and fragrant.
review_5_text:
The atmosphere is great, the shop is nice and comfortable.
It's located inside the Go Wholesale mall.
There's hardly any crowding.

They have a wide variety of teas to choose from.
And there are promotions where you can buy a drink together or bring your own cup for a 5 baht discount, but these promotions can't be combined.

The tea taste is average.
The orange tea was a bit too sour (maybe because I ordered it less sweet).
The matcha latte was okay.
But I really liked the atmosphere and the cup design that doesn't require a straw.

name: Black Canyon ‡∏ó‡πà‡∏≤‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏®‡∏¢‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà (Domestic Outside)
review_1_text: I initially ordered a vegetarian fried rice, however what was served contained chicken. I informed the waiter that we do not eat chicken and requested a vegetarian replacement. Unfortunately, instead of preparing a fresh dish, the same plate appeared to be returned with the chicken removed. Small pieces of chicken were still present in the meal. This raised concerns about food handling standards and attention to dietary requirements. While mistakes can happen, the response to the issue was disappointing. Other than that, the atmosphere was nice and less busy than downstairs. Food selection was good too and the staff members were friendly enough.
review_2_text: Located just at the entry to the checkpoint for international flights, nice place to sit around till the crowd clears and then clear the customs and security for your flight. Coffee and tea here are decent but nothing special. Decent place to get a drink to kill some time but that‚Äôs about it.
review_3_text:
Black Canyon at Chiang Mai Airport (Domestic Outside) is a convenient and comfortable spot to grab a bite before your flight. Located near Gate 3, it‚Äôs perfect for a quick stop to enjoy a meal. The menu offers a great variety of food, and everything I tried was delicious. The dishes are flavorful, satisfying, and definitely worth the price ‚Äì a great value for airport dining.

I felt really happy with my visit here. The food quality is excellent, and the service was friendly and efficient. It‚Äôs an ideal place to relax and refuel before your journey, whether you're traveling for business or leisure. If you're at Chiang Mai Airport and looking for a tasty, affordable meal, I highly recommend Black Canyon. It will definitely make your wait more enjoyable and your day more flavorful
review_4_text: Airport coffee.  Blackcanyon coffee means a good consistently tasty cup of coffee.  Service is professional. Typically, quick and easy.  Comfortable seating inside the airport with free WiFi.  There is only 1 dark roast offered.  There is ample supply of snacks and yummy sweet treats. Price is fair
review_5_text: I had a very unpleasant experience buying coffee at the airport. The Thai staff was impatient during ordering and spoke negatively about customers right in front of us. This was very unprofessional and made me feel uncomfortable. I would not recommend buying coffee here.

name: Wake Up
review_1_text:
Best spot at Chiangmai International Airport! Open 24hrs, offering good coffee and many other beverages, various Snow (bingsu) options, light snacks, accompanied by a Subway counter, a delicious pizza place, AND a Thai cuisine counter.

Spacious, so much variety to suit different preferences, and wifi is available for customers too!

Departure, arrival, or just waiting to pick someone up at odd hours is so much better now.

Where else could we have had pizza, subway, and bingsu all at once at 23.00?
review_2_text: Terrible cafe', DON'T waste your money here
review_3_text: Moved to second floor in domestic building.
review_4_text: The reason I gave it a full score is because the price of the food has not been increased. The price is the same as other branches, but this branch has the same price. The taste is the same as other branches. There is no reduction in quantity or quality. Overall, the shop is quite spacious, there are few people, and there is Wi-Fi and plugs to use like other branches. The weather is a bit hot. I'm not sure why they don't turn on the air conditioning, but it's not a problem. You can sit comfortably. There are other shops together, but the smell isn't strong, so there's no problem. Overall, I like it because it's cheap. 555 //RYO
review_5_text:
The staff should be replaced. The one who was in charge on July 10, 2018, at 6:00 PM was chatting loudly and even screaming in the lobby. I don't know if the branch owner knows this or not. The male staff member didn't seem welcoming and didn't smile at all. He just wanted to sell, collect money, play games, and play on his phone. #Looks like he's not mature enough to work in service.
#ImprovementsNeededUrgent

name: The Baristro at Central Chiangmai Airport
review_1_text:
Newly Opened & Worth a Visit!
The Baristro at Robinson Chiang Mai just opened and it‚Äôs already one of my favorite spots. The interior is modern and cozy, perfect for relaxing or working.

I had their signature iced coffee topped with whipped cream and espresso, beautifully layered and delicious. The menu also features great pastries and drinks.

If you‚Äôre nearby, definitely check it out. Stylish space, great coffee, and a chill vibe!
review_2_text:
One think what i dont understand, why i can't add cheese creme.

And why isn't the cheese cream available for separate purchase? That's the only reason I come here. Now I have to buy two drinks and add the cream to my cappuccino myself. Please consider this. Offering the cream separately would make things much easier.
review_3_text: I enjoyed their hot chocolate with latte art and their tiramisu was really good too. They‚Äôll give you extra cane syrup if the hot chocolate isn‚Äôt sweet enough for you. Just an FYI, I went in a couple of times and the tiramisu was sold out, but they would usually have more after 12pm.
review_4_text: At coffee shop that resembles high quality in the states. Love the presentation, latte art and taste is great! Aesthetic as well!
review_5_text: Nice big coffee shop. Good for meeting a friend, coworking space. Good coffee and still spacious. Even when its full its not over crowded. One downside. The AC is often too cool and to much airflow.

name: Yes Coffee
review_1_text: Even in such a busy environment, they still maintained great quality and attentive service. I really appreciated the care and effort they put into what they do. It made the experience much better than expected.
review_2_text: Stopped here before boarding the flight. The food tasted decent but slightly over priced. I got the break eggs with bacon and a toast and Americano
review_3_text:
This new coffee shop in the Chiang Mai airport is really great.
They have all of the usual coffee drinks (hot and cold), matcha drinks, etc.
They have baked goods, sandwiches, and even full hot breakfast made to order.
We like that they have almond and soy milk as an option, too.
It‚Äôs a great addition to the International terminal.
review_4_text:
This cafe in Chiang Mai International Airport after security  is okay.

They have places to charge your phone. The seats are comfortable.
The prices are way higher üëÄ
You are in a Airport so what can you do.
Anyway they have pastries and sandwiches and snacks.

Pro Tip: Also the chair in front of the store. Has plugs to plug in our phones.
review_5_text:
The small outlet in the domestic departure hall is conveniently located opposite one of the security screening points. I ordered their scrambled eggs with bacon and for my wife the chicken sausage with fried eggs. Both menus came with coffe and the taste was very good, real eggs and tasty bacon and sausages. The coffe here is excellent as always, and the service is very good by the attentive staff. I will definitely visit this shop whenever I fly domestic as it is a positive experience in the overcrowded airport.
Happy to have need your guest today. üòä üëè ü§ó üòª

name: PHUKHAO Cafe & Bar
review_1_text: This is a nice little cafe within the domestic waiting area at Chiang Mai airport.  The food is slightly expensive but not outrageous considering ‚Äòairport prices‚Äô, and it is surprising tasty.  I had the Krapow Gai and was satisfied.   The drink selection is good.  They have beer and wine in addition to the obvious coffee and tea options.  They have a small sitting area and it you eat there they serve the food on proper plates with proper silverware, not plastic as some other places offer.
review_2_text:
Very good coffee!
They have oat milk
review_3_text: The coffee itself is very good, which is kinda rare in Thai airports, they have oat milk
review_4_text: Good quality coffee. They sell several quality true roasts as well.
review_5_text: Very good coffee

name: On Ground
review_1_text: Sweet potato bubble tea had no flavour apart from milk, just a strong purple colour, and the pearls were hard and chewy, not good at all.  Not sure how they got this so wrong.
review_2_text: They have a restaurant on the ground floor, so if you are close to gate 3, you have to take stairs down. They serve a surprisingly good Khao Soi with chicken. Probably the best thing you can get at this airport, if you are taking a domestic flight.
review_3_text: It's like they think you will not be back but as someone who flies monthly from CNX it is disappointing all the coffee is ordinary.
review_4_text: I ordered 1 mocha and 1 hot chocolate. Worst chocolate I have had in my life.  Can‚Äôt be that difficult to make it well.. I had to throw it on the bin straight away. The coffee was cold and tasted so so. Save your money.
review_5_text: I ordered a smoothie and got a slushy

review_1_text: Delicious drinks, a wide variety of menu items, friendly prices. Closed on Sundays üòÅüòÅ

review_1_text: Cool. They have great matcha!

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏õ‡∏ï‡∏ó.‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏´‡∏¥‡∏î‡∏•‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á
review_1_text: Outstanding coffee shop with some of the most comfortable seating and tables I have found at a coffee shop. Coffee at Amazon is always tasty and good service. Fast service !
review_2_text: Outstanding coffee shop with some of the most comfortable seating and tables I have found at a coffee shop. Coffee at Amazon is always tasty and good service. Fast service !

name: Tao Bin at Ducky Wash
review_1_text:
While doing my wash & dry at Ducky I watched the men service the Tao Bin dispenser machine.

They cleaned the outer top, back front and sides.

Inside was just as thorough with the cleaning, servicing & refilling. After it was as clean as a hospital operating room.

If this is how the machines are maintained I would not think twice about using these drink dispensers.

review_1_text: Environment is really chill and cute dogs are here to warmly welcome you at the entrance. Super cozy, well decorated and chill coffee shop, hide it in a nice neighborhood.

review_3_text: We had the Turkish eggs which were done very well and one of the owners shared later that they make their own Greek yoghurt so that explains the quality taste! Banana cake was very good too. Coffees were also commendable with the Americano and Piccolo we ordered. Ambience was very relaxing and chilled with friendly staff and service
review_4_text:
This is one of the best caf√©s/restaurant I have visited for a long time that offers a harmonious blend of nature and comfort, featuring delicious food and coffee in a welcoming environment.  It is a place with a cozy and relaxing ambiance created by elements like good lighting, relaxing music, and thoughtful decor. This environment is complemented by excellent service from friendly, knowledgeable staff, and high-quality food and drinks, creating a memorable and enjoyable experience for guests. The atmosphere is still and serene, offering a quiet break from the outside world.

There is sufficient outdoor seating as well as indoor seating.
review_5_text: The food is absolutely amazing here! The staff is also very welcoming to anyone from any nation as well. Would highly recommend coming here if given the time.

This small shop located near 7-11. Few parking spots alongside the road.

name: Forever Young Cafe
review_1_text: Its a little hidden but its worth it to find. The decor is simple and stunning. The music is perfect volume and it amplifies the cafe. The cappuccino was lovely, croissant was okay. Light and flacky. They don't have wifi, which stinks cause i came to do work but not a deal breaker. Im not sure if they are new or the mall area is also new but keep them busy and come have some coffee and tea
review_2_text:
Forever young caf√© serves the best Ceylon tea in town, along with a wide variety of coffee and healthy drinks.
The warm and kind service makes every visit enjoyable, and the beautiful view of the Ping River makes it even more special.
Truly worth a visit‚Äîit always brightens my day.ü•∞
review_3_text:
Nice riverside atmosphere, though it can get noisy with groups, so it‚Äôs not the best spot for focused work or meetings.

The menu is limited, especially given the wellness location‚ÄîI expected more healthy options, but most dishes are microwaved, which doesn‚Äôt feel very fresh.

Prices are on the high side for the quality. The croffle was the biggest letdown; it wasn‚Äôt proofed properly, and the dough was undercooked, which left me feeling bloated.

Overall, unless you have a specific reason to visit, there are better options nearby with better food and value for the price.
review_4_text: Seems to open on Sundays. The coffee shop is on the 2nd floor, above the parking area. The staff are polite, the price is reasonable with good quality drinks. Free WiFi from mobile network providers is available. Free drinking water is also available. The atmosphere is peaceful, not over crowded. It is a perfect spot for killing time at senior wellness centre. Hopefully they will use reusable cups for dine-in in the future.
review_5_text: This is a really nice coffee shop at the recently opened Senior Wellness Center. The coffee is excellent, served by friendly staff in a relaxing atmosphere with views of the Ping River. They also have a selection of ice cream and bakery desserts.

review_2_text: I recently visited this local in Chiang Mai and was blown away by the quality of the food and drinks. The coffee was hands down the best I've had in the city, and the toast with egg and cheese was simply divine. I visited this spot for breakfast several times during my stay and was consistently impressed. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious and satisfying breakfast in Chiang Mai. 100% recommended!

Brekkie Rolls is a lovely little spot.
Both savory and sweet dishes are freshly made, well balanced, and easy to enjoy.
Cozy, relaxed atmosphere ‚Äî a nice place to sit and chill. Definitely recommended ü§ç
review_2_text:
If you‚Äôre looking for homemade food, delicious pastries, and good coffee, I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place! There are fans provided, and it‚Äôs not too hot since the tables are surrounded by trees. The owners are incredibly friendly, helpful, and polite ‚Äî and most importantly, they speak English üëç.

Don‚Äôt forget to bring cash or be ready to pay via QR code. I really enjoyed the cozy, homey vibe of this caf√©, and I‚Äôll definitely visit Brekkie Rolls again when I come back to Chiang Mai in the future. ‚ú®üíõ

review_1_text:
A real French pastry by a real French p√¢tissier.
I ordered 2 espresso, chouquettes, and financiers. I enjoyed this place.

Everything was delicious! I will come back for sure üòã‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: A pleasant surprise. A coffee bakery in a village. Quiet perfect for work. Good coffee . Does sandwiches n bakery too.

review_4_text: Ho...ly...cow! This is likely the best pastry shop in the entire city. The chef here is a trained pastry chef and it shows. Our genuine French friend said this is top tier stuff worthy of a real Parisian‚Äôs praise and he wasn‚Äôt lying. Chef‚Äôs kiss after each bite. The owner is sweet too: we ordered two croissants and they could only give one (these delicious morsels were nearly sold out) so she gave us her best selling sweet for the price of a croissant! This level of decadence isn‚Äôt cheap (70-150 Baht or so) but it is 100% worth it.
review_5_text: Delish Bakery. Lemon Meringue is the best I have had in Chiang Mai. The other deserts are good too.  Coffee was good but a bit strong for my taste; even in a latte.  Outside patio sitting had ash trays so smoking must be allowed outside :-(.

name: Sahai Cafe
review_1_text: nice place ; good staff; outside seating a bit noisy from the road; good coffee
review_2_text:
This is the same cafe 3 minutes from where I live. I did a grab pick up and hit the wrong one.

20 minutes later, with all the traffic for school, I made it.

I ordered two ice lattes. They bagged the latte and the ice in the cup separately.  My first experience and it was a pleasant experience.
Once I got home and put it together, the cup was full. I was definitely impressed.

Parking is limited on this busy street for cars. Scooters rule!!
review_3_text:
There are much better coffee shops around. Skip this one. This shop charges 15 bath extra per coffee for actually putting the coffee in a cup üòÇ and they use misleading photos in their Grab app.

This shop, 2 low quality cappuccinos delivered; 191 bath.

Other shops, 2 good quality cappuccinos delivered; 120 bath.

Will not order again. This shop needs to upgrade their packaging and service. Anybody proclaiming anything else seemingly has low standards for their coffee and service.
review_4_text: Nice coffee and friendly service. We were impressed with the coffee as we are from Sydney, love our cofee and this is the best cafe so far.
review_5_text: Very nice coffee shop, reasonable price and taste great.

name: House of Tea Ëå∂
review_1_text: This caf√© is so lovely! The decor is beautiful, and the drinks taste amazing. I‚Äôve been here twice already but just got the chance to leave a review. The matcha is absolutely incredible ‚Äî highly recommend everyone to try it üçµü§éü§é
review_2_text:
A lovely little sanctuary for tea lovers.
Such a cozy and calming space. The tea selection is impressive, and everything‚Äîfrom the aroma to the presentation‚Äîfeels intentional. Perfect for quiet afternoons.
review_3_text:
A hidden gem for authentic Chinese tea lovers!
This newly opened tea shop offers a truly authentic experience. The staff are incredibly attentive and friendly, and every pot of tea is thoughtfully prepared right in front of you, adding to the charm.

For just THB 120, you get a full pot of premium tea that can be refilled up to five times ‚Äî perfect for a relaxing break or a quiet conversation. Whether you‚Äôre thirsty or simply want to unwind with traditional Chinese tea, this is a must-visit spot.
review_4_text: The coconut matcha is a must-try‚Äîrich matcha with a gentle coconut note that‚Äôs so soothing. Cozy space, calming energy, and lovely service

name: The Arc Cafe and Surf Skate
review_1_text: A little disappointed they only serve you in plastic cups. Felt like the service was a bit out of sync with the venue. A good place to chill out for a day to work - two indoor spaces and one outdoor patio is available. Personally did not feel like the coffee felt a bit too flat for a latte, so I would probably opt for a non-coffee drink or espresso next time.
review_2_text:
The Arc Cafe in Chiang Mai is a spacious and visually appealing destination that caters to both food lovers and those seeking a beautiful backdrop for photos.

Ambience and Setting

Spaciousness the cafe is known for its ample space, but they have few comfortable seats few aren't if there are more than 10 couples you have to sit outside in the hot temperature

photogenic Corners: It boasts many corners designed for taking beautiful photos, including a swing seat. The overall design seems to lean towards a tropical style.

Atmosphere  a relaxed vibe
Food and Drink:
The cafe offers a variety of food options.

Pasta Carbonara The Pasta Carbonara is highlighted for its very creamy sauce.

Iced Latte The Iced Latte is praised for its strong coffee flavor and aroma.

Menu Variety Besides the mentioned items, the cafe also serves other beverages, baked goods, and potentially other dishes.

Additional Points from Online Sources:

Location: The cafe is located on the road along the railway, near Montfort College Secondary School.

Opening Hours: The cafe is open daily from morning until evening.

Features  both indoor and outdoor seating areas.

Surf Skate:  The Arc Cafe has a surf skate area.

Parking: Convenient parking is available.
review_3_text: Wonderful and very cute place. Now before Xmas the decoration looks lovely. Great place for work too.
review_4_text: As a inline freestyle slider in Chiang Mai, I recommend this place. It‚Äôs big enough and the area is smooth. They also can do vegetarian egg fried rice without onion and garlic
review_5_text: Not too far from the railway station. Lots of parking space. Good place to get some coffee and some cake early afternoon.
