review_3_text: A nice, relaxing cafe. The owner is fun to talk to. The coffee is delicious. The service is excellent. There are many menus. I like it very much.
review_4_text: The staff provides good service, the parking lot is spacious and convenient, the coffee tastes good, and there's also a small meeting room available.
review_5_text: The owner provides excellent service and the cake is delicious.

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡∏Å‡∏µ‡πâ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà DOG CAFE Chiangmai
review_1_text: There are many cute dogs of various breeds waiting to welcome you. Snacks and drinks are available. You can buy treats to feed your dogs.
review_2_text:
The dogs are so cute! The owner is polite and provides excellent service.
I highly recommend this shop.
review_3_text: The dogs are all very cute. The owners are kind and have a great personality. The price is not expensive for both the entrance fee and the food. However, there is a slight problem with cleanliness, especially the smell of the dogs' urine and the cleaning of their urine. If this can be fixed, it would be great.
review_4_text: The dogs are so cute and friendly. They welcome you warmly, haha. They jump on you like they've known you for a long time. It's so much fun to sit and play with them.
review_5_text: The dog is cute. The owner is very friendly.

name: Irish Coffee And Gallery
review_1_text: My favorite place for L√†tte and atmosphere.
review_2_text: The avocado smoothie is amazing! üëçüëç
review_3_text: There are coffees to choose from, including medium-dark and dark roasts. The coffee is delicious and reasonably priced, suitable for everyday drinking. There are smoothies (made from real fruit) starting at 25-35 baht. I had a mango yogurt smoothie, which was also delicious.
review_4_text: It's delicious, you should try it.

name: Over 8 caf√© x ‡∏ï‡∏∂‡∏Å‡∏™‡πâ‡∏°
review_1_text: I eat kra pao with beef, the food is tasty and the staffs are friendly‚ù§Ô∏è will visit next time again
review_2_text:
Orange Building's Krapao Platter. I usually order from Grab, but today I came down to the front of the shop to check it out.

The atmosphere is great, air-conditioned, and the shop is very cute, almost like a cafe. There are about five tables, each table can seat 4-5 people. Inside, it seems like a co-working space.

The shop has rice, tea, fresh coffee, and a wide selection of drinks.

The Krapao Platter is delicious. I've tried many dishes and they're all great. The portions are huge.

But today, I tried the Krapao Kai Omelet. It's a dish with Krapao and omelet inside. The omelet is fluffy and crispy, and delicious. I highly recommend it.
(You can choose the level of spiciness.)

The owner is very friendly and kind. The service is excellent. Please come and support us.
The shop is near Montfort School. You might have to make a U-turn to get here. If you don't want to make multiple U-turns, I recommend parking at Montfort and walking to get it. But there's parking in front of the shop.

Google reviews also say they have free fried chicken with jaew sauce. It's amazing!
It's so delicious and they give you a lot! üíï
They also have a promotion where you check in on Facebook and get 1 fried egg or 2 sausages. So many great promotions!
Highly recommended! ü§çü´∂üèª
review_3_text: The shop is clean, the stir-fry is delicious, and there's air conditioning to keep you cool. The menu focuses on stir-fried basil, but there are also stir-fried dishes. The service is very friendly.
review_4_text: The food is delicious and the portions are generous. The owners are lovely.
review_5_text: A variety of menus, cool atmosphere, very good service.

name: Poly‚Äôs coffee house
review_1_text: Very good. The atmosphere, delicious coffee, the owner is kind, always has promotions, very delicious. Recommended menu: Orange Americano, very delicious. You have to come and try it at least once. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: The water is very delicious. The atmosphere in the shop is quiet. The waitress is very helpful.
review_3_text: The water tastes sweet and refreshing. The vendor is lovely and provides good service.
review_4_text: Well-rounded coffee, rich smoothie‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è

review_1_text:
Delicious, eat often, never get bored
The owner is cute, kind and friendly.
review_2_text: The fried dough sticks are delicious, the tofu soup is very delicious, and the custard is sweet and fragrant.

review_1_text: This Thai tea is extremely strong.
review_2_text: Delicious shabu, rich southern tea, lots of Mama noodles to choose from!
review_3_text: Southern tea is very delicious.
review_4_text: Everything is delicious üòã

name: Livin Cafe
review_1_text:
Food, service, and atmosphere all left a very good impression on me.
The dishes are nicely presented and full of flavor, and you can really taste the freshness of the ingredients and the care put into both the mains and the drinks.
The staff are friendly and polite; ordering and serving are efficient, and they are proactive in helping with any questions, which makes the whole experience very relaxing.
The interior is simple and bright with comfortable seating and great natural light, plus the greenery outside the windows makes it a nice place to chat with friends, work on a laptop, or just enjoy a quiet coffee alone.
Overall, this is a cafe I would love to visit again and one I‚Äôm very happy to recommend to my friends.
review_2_text:
Livin Cafe is a great spot if you're looking for a quiet place to study or work. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing, and it‚Äôs tucked away just enough to avoid car noise and crowds.

They also have a nice alfresco area that‚Äôs perfect for catching up with friends or holding a casual work meeting. Overall, it‚Äôs a comfortable, peaceful cafe, ideal for getting things done or enjoying a laid-back conversation.
review_3_text: Great place for a coffee and a meal. A wide choice of excellent dishes and drinks at very good prices. Definitely will come again!
review_4_text: Food was fantastic and the Khao soi bowls were huge I ate so fast I forgot to take a picture with food in it. Wonderful!
review_5_text:
Coffee restaurant üç¥
Small freshness with some retro elements
Add meals and baked snacks
The menu is quite rich
Drinking coffee here is a way of life

name: ‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏©‡∏±‡∏ó ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏°‡∏¥‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡πå ‡∏à‡∏≥‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏î
review_1_text:
Dear Mr. Miss.:
Nice greeting to you! I‚Äôm Elisa from Tecpacking Group (TIANJIN) CO.,LTD, China.

The pyramid tea bag packing machine is ultrasonic cutting and sealing, evidently and pretty angle. The capacity is 3000-3600bags/hour, high quality, high speed. Also we offer outer envelope machine, 90*90 or 95*95mm.
All spare parts are from Japan and Germany, so our machine can be used longer time.

As we are the professional supplier for packing machine, we could do the special design to meet to the different demands. And also, could supply the good and free after service and technical support for customers.

We have a special promise, it is warranty time two years, also we will do the service for all machine's life, and do the reply for any question from customers in 24 hours.

If there is any question or would like to know us more, please feel free to contact with me at anytime.

K&R
Elisa

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Almost 7 am but the cafe is really dark , no light in the cafe except at the counter . Asking the barista what is inside the Amazon gift, she said no idea ‚Ä¶. Black coffee taste like burnt coffee
review_2_text: I ordered a strong coffee and hot water? The hot water was in a glass, scalding hot and undrinkable. As someone who really likes Amazon, this was extremely disappointing. The service here was the worst I've ever experienced.
review_3_text: It's located right by the road, a small branch. On days when I work early, I'll come to buy coffee here first. But in the early morning, one employee can still handle the few customers. During midday when there are many people, I don't know if the service will be sufficient or not.
review_4_text: Taking very long and getting a wrong order.
review_5_text: Lower standard of services. Order two coffee, one 50% sweet, and the other normal sweet. No stickers put on.

name: Ramino Coffee Club, ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏¥‡πÇ‡∏ô‡πà‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏±‡∏ö
review_1_text: Nice coffee shop today. 2 baristas working today. This shop has good AC.  The chair are very comfortable. The upstairs private and quiet area is good for meetings. Lemon honey tea was excellent.   The cakes and sweet food do not look so good.
review_2_text: Today I stopped in to sample some coffee and breakfast. I was thrilled by both quantity and quality of everything I received.
review_3_text:
Good coffee also free tea as well üòä
Nice service.
review_4_text: Nice place, worth coming
review_5_text: We loved the coffee and the pastries! Really worth your time to visit this great little coffee shop.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Nice coffee and Amazon is much cheaper than Starbucks. Good place to have a cup of coffee while the other half is doing the grocery shopping. On the upstairs, there is an interesting Amulet Centre with reputable dealers.
review_2_text: Always good to come here.  Good cappuccino, book and people watching.  Thanks for the good service and atmosphereüôè
review_3_text: nice coffee
review_4_text: Recharged again. I understand that Chiang Mai is a cold city, but it's very hot. I feel refreshed and bright immediately. I'm a fan. I had two glasses and I'm full.
review_5_text: The staff who took orders had a sour face, used words that seemed unwilling to serve customers, and used a contemptuous tone. When I told them I could use points to redeem, they acted even more contemptuously. Overall, it was terrible.

name: Minimal coffee Big C ‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏à‡∏±‡πà‡∏ô
review_1_text: üòãüòãüòãüòã
review_2_text: Today's Americano was very bland. The taste was worse than usual. The staff didn't seem to be attentive to the preparation and service.

name: Molen Cabin
review_1_text:
Molen Cafe, but it's a board game cafe. They sell drinks, the air conditioning is nice and cool, and you can park right in front of the shop. It's a black and white building on the main road, convenient for a quick stop.

- Delicious Molen (traditional Thai noodle soup)
- Lots of games
- Great place to hang out and have fun with friends.

name: Hand Coffee
review_1_text: Staffs are very friendly and dentist takes descent time to take care of your teeth. It's not painful that's the most important part... Highly recommended ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: Currently my son during a dental brarce treatment.So far, the service is excellent, understand English and see very good progress.I'll update later.
review_3_text: Very clean clinic and facility, friend environment and staff and the dentists are all professionals and well-trained.
review_4_text: Excellent orthodontic treatment.  Good attitude of the doctor and the clinic staff.
review_5_text: This was my wife's and my first time getting our teeth cleaned at this dental clinic. The clinic was very clean, and the doctor and nurses treated us very well. They provided professional service, and we will definitely visit again. They even gave us whitening skincare products as a gift at the end! üíØüíØüíØ

name: Story 221 cup cafe'
review_1_text:
Personally, I think the drinks taste great and the rice dishes are delicious.
However, the spicy salad could be a bit too salty and lacking in flavor. I hope they keep adjusting that. But I really liked the basil stir-fry, although the portion was a bit small. Overall, it's okay. üëçüèª Keep up the good work!

name: SmoothieLife
review_1_text: The fresh fruit smoothie shop is located on the second floor of Big C Don Chan, next to the escalator on the Thai Panich Bank side. The prices are affordable and the taste is delicious.
review_2_text: Delicious! The toppings are fresh and plentiful. It's great value for money. This is one of my regular shops when I go to Big C.

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡πÄ‡∏¢‡πá‡∏ô‡πÉ‡∏à ‡∏ö‡∏¥‡πä‡∏Å‡∏ã‡∏µ ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏à‡∏±‡πà‡∏ô
review_1_text: The service of the coffee vendors at this branch is extremely bad. The person making the coffee got upset out of nowhere. When I ordered more coffee, he got upset and acted very rudely. I request permission to not use this branch again.
review_2_text: Everything is constantly being improved and improved. Thank you for your continued support.
review_3_text: The hot latte is great, the iced espresso is strong and rich, the Thai tea and bubble tea are my favorites. The plum lemonade soda is delicious, and the cheese toast is also tasty. The prices are friendly. These are the places I frequent. There aren't many seats, but it's okay. Be warned, the air conditioning is very cold!
review_4_text: The coffee tasted great, the price was affordable, and the seller was lovely, smiling, and provided excellent service.
review_5_text:
Coffee taste: 3/5
Service: 1/5

name: Lankinsen
review_1_text: Man, I was so bummed about the food. Everything on the menu looked amazing. I got the papaya salad, and honestly, it was really good. The papaya was super finely chopped and had a real kick. BUT! I also had the pad thai with udon, thinking it would be like normal pad thai, but it was just swimming in this sweet sauce. It was actually pretty awful and the sauce just messed everything up. Then I ordered the panang curry , and the serving was tiny... I probably won't be heading back there... pretty average, really. Kimchi was fine.
review_2_text: This was the first restaurant we ate at after landing in Thailand and oh man, it set the bar high!! Everything that was ordered at our table was delicious (we all tried each others and would agree). The setting itself is so amazing as well! We sat outside and were surrounded by so many plants, and could hear the light pattern of rain, and it was serene. I‚Äôd absolutely recommend!
review_3_text: Truly excellent food and delightful service! Found this place because our Airbnb was right next door, ordered two soups and the pork gyoza for takeaway which was ready super fast‚Ä¶ my husband and I couldn‚Äôt stop raving about the food while eating it, especially for under 100 THB a person. They also have ample off the street parking for both cars and scooters. What more could you want? üëç
review_4_text: I left my brown goodr sunglasses there today, they have a wire attached. I can't find contact info for the restaurant, can you please respond with contact info so I can reach out? I can't go back to the restaurant soon but I'll explain. Anyway, today my family and I ate here. Lovely atmosphere, great service and food, affordable prices. Would definitely come back!
review_5_text: I really enjoyed food in this restaurant which was more tasty than I expected, also nicely served and some small aperitifs were included in menu. I ordered grilled salmon menu and the fish was grilled accurately that it was tasty, but not dry. I will definitely come again to this restaurant.

name: Kalnas
review_1_text: Beautiful space with indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor area is especially nice and has swings and a hammock! I had the coffee with salted cream cheese foam (can't remember the name), and it was AMAZING. One of my favourite coffees ever. My wife had the peanut butter vanilla coffee, also very nice. Both were cold drinks but were served in glass, fantastic.
review_2_text: I went for a medium roast latte just after they opened in the morning. Really nice cafe in a quiet spot and the latte taste was good.
review_3_text: My number #1 coffee shop in CNX. Amazing drinks, best pasta in the city (even though it's not an Italian restaurant) and the atmosphere (!!!). Words cannot describe it. Don't miss it. You can thank me later üòé
review_4_text: Hidden away and quiet . Took me awhile to find. Nice experience and the place is very orange . Drinks and food is amazing .
review_5_text: Very nice place with beautiful garden and chill atmosphere. Cafe is just ordinary tasty, the price not expensive much.

name: kaffekeen
review_1_text: Very delicious and value-for-money food in a cosy and clean environment. Service is also excellent. Our regular hang out for meals. Highly recommended.
review_2_text: A hidden gem! The cappuccino and coffee here are top-notch‚Äîsmooth, rich, and full of flavor. The chocolate cake was delicious too, just the right amount of sweetness. They offer a nice variety of Thai and Western food, so there‚Äôs something for everyone. What really stands out is the ambience‚Äîlush nature all around, peaceful, and beautifully relaxing. The staff are warm, attentive, and genuinely kind. A perfect spot to unwind, have a meal, or just enjoy a great cup of coffee
review_3_text:
A Must-Try Thai Fusion Experience at Keenkafe!

If you're looking for authentic Thai flavors with a modern twist, Keenkafe is the place to be! Their dishes are bold, flavorful, and perfectly suited to Thai palates, while the presentation adds a stylish and contemporary touch. The price range is reasonable, from 100‡∏ø to 400‡∏ø per dish, making it great value for the quality and experience.

The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and welcoming, making it an ideal spot for a family lunch or dinner. Whether you're dining with parents or bringing your kids along, the cozy setting ensures a delightful experience.

Keep in mind that the restaurant closes at 8:00 PM, so be sure to plan your visit accordingly. Highly recommended for anyone craving delicious Thai cuisine in a refined yet approachable setting!

This review sounds natural, inviting, and informative. Let me know if you‚Äôd like any tweaks!
review_4_text:
We tried Kaffekeen after searching Google for food around our homestay. We had a couple favorites but wanted to expand our variety.
This was a good choice. We ate primarily Thai food, but they have plenty of other choices. But I personally didn't come to Thailand for western style food.
We ordered 3 dishes, which were
1) Grilled pork with chilli sauce üëç
2) Grilled pork curry üëç
3) shrimp curry with vegetables üëç

My favorite was #3 but it was close. The tastes had great flavor and richness without being overpowering. The sauce on the grilled pork was "to die for" yummy.

It's a newer place with a great ambience. Relaxing and quiet.

So "Yes" I will return for maybe a breakfast or lunch.

GIVE IT A TRY... you won't be disappointed.
review_5_text:
During my stay in Chiang Mai, I generally came here for lunch and dinner, and also worked here throughout the day. The prices are quite affordable, and the cafe‚Äôs ambiance is wonderful. The only downside is the limited number of power outlets. By the way, I would recommend the ‚ÄòSpaghetti Carbonara‚Äô for a meal.

Thanks ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: All about Coffee
review_1_text:
Calm and quiet wooden sitting area hidden under a tree canopy inside. Lovely couple with a sweet welcoming energy.

Lovely quality food, I had the eggs and they were so creamy.

We shared carrot cake and scones and wow!
review_2_text: A small cafe is situated in a pretty quiet area of Chiang Mai. The atmosphere is very nice and reminds me of a traditional Thai Lanna style house . So many options for coffee I end up trying a Vietnamese coffee and it was very tasty. The owners are also super friendly and I like the fact that they have a lot of local souvenirs .
review_3_text: All about Coffee is one of my favorite places in Chiang Mai. Exquisite food, excellent coffee & tea, friendly and attentive service, and a salubrious environment. It is the perfect place to hang out while reading or working online or with friends or for a quiet assignation. And it has the nicest restroom in Thailand other than a five-star hotel.
review_4_text:
What a cute coffee shop! It‚Äôs designed to feel like a home, creating such a shady and pleasant ambiance.

The outdoor section has a beautiful large tree and ample seating. Their recommended breakfast items sound tempting, and the coffee beans are clearly high quality.

The owner is incredibly nice and approachable, which really makes you feel like you're just dropping by a friend's place for a casual coffee. It's truly a comfortable spot.
review_5_text: One of the best Chiang Mai morning coffee and breakfast cafe.  Eggs and bread cooked to perfection.  Variety of coffee to choose from. Quiet and chill atmosphere.  Highly recommendüëçüëçüëç

name: Ram Poeng Cafe
review_1_text: This place is a hidden gem in an otherwise touristy spot due to the art village round the corner! If you want a chilled out vibe with great coffee outside of the city, this is your place. We even featured it on our recent YouTube video as my husband had been dreaming about coming back here for a latte ever since last year‚Ä¶ he got his wish!!
review_2_text:
The biggest value of this place lies on its retro vibe and the owner, who was lovely. But it being located right on the narrow street side plus having busy footfalls of incoming tourists nearby make the atmosphere not as chill as expected (loud!).

My coffee was more on the milky taste than coffee. The carrot cake was good enough but nothing to write home about.
review_3_text: Lovely cafe a short walk from Baan Kang Wat artist village. Lovely vibe and carrot cake was delicious. Highly recommend coming here for a quiet coffee and cake.
review_4_text: We stayed at an Airbnb in the same property as this cafe and we were so lucky because the cafe was so amazing! The owners were so kind and generous, the space was so gorgeous and natural, and the food was great!! Everyone should try this cafe!
review_5_text:
I really love this caf√©
Nice owner, nice coffee, nice service

name: Valentan brew&bake
review_1_text:
‚Ä¢ Diverse Bakery Selection: Visitors frequently highlight the wide variety of homemade baked goods, including popular items like the Mango Cheese Pie, Honey Bee Lemon Cheese Pie, and burnt cheesecake.
‚Ä¢ Quality Coffee: The coffee is often described by patrons as strong, aromatic, and high-quality, with specific mentions of their signature "Valentan" drink.
‚Ä¢ Inviting Ambiance: The shop features both indoor and outdoor seating areas, decorated with white curtains and small garden spaces that make it a favorite for photography.
‚Ä¢ Convenient Amenities: The caf√© is noted for having friendly, attentive service and offers dedicated parking, which is a significant plus for visitors in the area.
review_2_text: During my stay in Chiang Mai, here‚Äôs the one I go everyday for dessertsüòÜ Varieties of cakes to choose for desserts and also have delicious meals for lunch. ü§©
review_3_text: I have visited here many times and always had good service and food. Highly recommended.
review_4_text:
New coffee shop that with a beautiful interior design! The wifi is strong, its in a quite back alley and there‚Äôs lots of plants inside which makes for a nice, calming work atmosphere.

I recommend coming here when you want to work calmly on your laptop with a nice drink & dessert üòä
review_5_text: It‚Äôs a really lovely shop. I like their hot tea as I don‚Äôt want to consume too much sugar. An added bonus: you can see the magnificent sunset after a day‚Äôs work if you turn right and come to the highway.

name: Kumo Bake Uchi
review_1_text:
The cakes here are absolutely delicious!
I ordered the orange cake ‚Äî the jam on top is a little sweet with a hint of tanginess, and the sponge itself has just the right level of sweetness. The balance of flavors is perfect.
I also tried the peach cheese milk tea, which was super refreshing. I asked for 25% sugar, and it turned out just right.
My friend got the coffee yuzu soda without specifying any sweetness level, but it still tasted great ‚Äî very smooth and well-balanced.
Overall, both the cakes and drinks here are perfectly sweetened. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
I love everything in Kumo Bake Uchi
One of the best Pure Matcha in Chiang Mai üíöüíö highly recommend
review_3_text:
The coffee shop has new zone for larger space. The price of bakery is reasonable and it's all home made.
I love having time here.
There are 2 house separate space between coffee shop zone and seating zone. If you want to find some coffeeshop for working I recommend to visit Kumo bake.
review_4_text:
a lovely japanese style cafe. I liked the matcha tea very much.
It would be better if the cafe uses porcelain instead of plastic cups
review_5_text:
Love this cafe atmosphere. The owner is very cute and kind, she‚Äôs good service.

Their cake and drink is good and the price is ok not too expensive

name: Huan Kaew Coffee
review_1_text: A beautiful place with lots of dolls and figurines. Behind the restaurant, there‚Äôs a large garden that feels like stepping into a Hayao Miyazaki fairy tale. The decorations are gorgeous, and the food is also very delicious.
review_2_text: Coffee is nice, quiet atmosphere. The food is good too.
review_3_text: Yummy! I love pad kra prao here so much! Whenever I came to these areas, this‚Äôs the must location to visit for having the nicest food with friendly prices.
review_4_text: Family run the business. Food is great and price is great as well. Nice and peaceful garden area to eat. I highly recommend this restaurant.
review_5_text: Chill ambiance and delicious food

name: More Craft
review_1_text:
This coffee shop serves really good quality coffee! The owner is super friendly and genuinely passionate about the craft, and it shows in every cup.

They also offer non-caffeine drinks, including matcha sourced from Chiang Rai.
review_2_text:
This is not just another coffee shop.

It's a wholesome place which reflects the owner's joy of serving people. He is a happy man happy to serve you.
I watch him make each drink with the same level of focus, never multitasking or doing too fast- measuring each time so it's the perfect balance.

The coffee is very good! Great Quality beans are used - you can get medium or dark.

The iced matcha is so smooth and dreamy. Not bitter, not grainy. You can choose Japanese matcha for the better experience!

If you want it a certain way feel free to ask him, his English is great.

Outside oat milk option available.

Mr Ko is amazing.
I end up spending hours here.
review_3_text: A hidden gem making truly excellent espresso. When you drive by you might just assume this is any other standard coffee shop but it‚Äôs more than that. The owner is really passionate about finding delicious local beans and pulls a truly excellent shot of espresso. It‚Äôs a great place to try if you want to get a taste of the beans that are grown and roasted around Chiang Mai. The owner speaks English so if you‚Äôre serious about coffee just let him know and he‚Äôll tell you what beans he has available and what will suit your taste preferences. They also have a nice selection of Matcha as well, if that‚Äôs your cup of tea! Definitely give this place a try!
review_4_text:
This is a little hidden gem‚Ä¶.worth a stop off as the coffee is considered, very tasty and a great price!

The staff are warm, kind and generous! A really great coffee shop and what Chiang Mai is all about :)
review_5_text:
Fantastic coffee and people.
Great selection of coffee, matcha and tea. Very high quality and prepared with care and precision.
Always great people to hang out with and chat.
Kou is a wonderful person with deep passion for coffee and service

name: TechSpace Cafe'.CNX

name: Oxygen Coffee Studio - Wildside
review_1_text:
Since arriving in Chiang Mai last November, I‚Äôve explored dozens of cafes, but Oxygen Coffee Studio Wildside is truly in a league of its own.
The outdoor seating area is a sanctuary. It offers a nature-oriented atmosphere that brings a sense of calm and relaxed joy that is hard to find elsewhere. If you are looking for comfort and peace, this is the place to be.
The coffee quality is top-grade. I particularly enjoyed the "Thai brightness" of their standard beans‚Äîthe flavor profile and texture are unique and sophisticated. It‚Äôs clear the baristas here are operating at another level. Whether you are a coffee connoisseur or just looking for a beautiful place to unwind, I cannot recommend this studio enough.
review_2_text: We had amazing lattes here, had to come back for more!
review_3_text: W place definitely coming back the toast is incredible 5 stars
review_4_text: Very good
review_5_text: Everything is great, including the service, snacks, and drinks. The prices are affordable, not too expensive. You can work here, get free Wi-Fi, and enjoy a shady atmosphere. ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: 99 Villa & Cafe
review_1_text:
visited the caf√© with a friend and it was such a beautiful experience. The caf√© is a bit far from the city center (around 5 km), but it‚Äôs absolutely worth the trip. The place is peaceful, charming, and surrounded by nature. At times, it felt like being in an Alice in Wonderland garden, with rabbits hopping around, ducks, and even pigs nearby.
There were very few people when we visited (day week around 4pm) which made the atmosphere even more special. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to disconnect, read, write, or simply relax, with the sound of the river flowing in the background.
The service was incredibly kind and attentive. We shared a two-tier basket of pastries with fruit. The portions are small, more like tasting samples, but the flavors were outstandin, delicate and absolutely delicious.

I forgot to ask for my cappuccino without sugar, and the staff was so kind that they prepared a new one for me without charging for the first cappuccino at all ‚ù§. That gesture really stood out.

Overall, the place is beautiful, calm, and full of charm. I highly recommend visiting for the pastries and for a quiet, relaxing afternoon surrounded by nature.

Service and experience: 10/10.
review_2_text: The house's colors and the gardens made me feel like I'd stepped into Alice's Wonderland. The food portions were enormous, and the rabbits, ducks, geese, and piglets running around on the lawn‚Äîthe harmonious coexistence of people and animals‚Äîmade me feel completely at peace. It was a wonderful feeling!
review_3_text: Decoration and vibe are the best . You can chill with fine atmosphere and so cute to take pictures and they also have some kind of cute animals which is so nice with positive energy. One of my top three favorite cafe in CNX.
review_4_text:
Found this wonderful caf√© while staying in Chiang Mai for a month.
As soon as you walk through the outside gate, you‚Äôll know you‚Äôre in a unique place. It really feels like you just stepped into a story book.
There is a little stream outside with ducks and bunnies and the caf√© even has its own pet pig.
We sat inside one of the air conditioned building and ordered a cake two smoothies which were huge btw. and looked more like art works rather than beverages.
Location, food, drinks and service was all outstanding.
Love this unique and beautiful establishment. ü´∂üëå
We will be back for sure.
review_5_text:

All great üëç

name: GRAPH Coffee Baankangwat
review_1_text:
Coffee 'fine dining'!

I was absolutely amazed by the menu in Graph coffee - techniques used (cold brew jelly) and flavor combinations (coffee with tomato and lime) are unique. I've been to various specialty coffee places across Europe, never encountered anything like that.

This is a must try when you're in Baan Kang Wat, perfect place, located in the heart of the village, giving you the outlook on many craft shops.

Super friendly and helpful staff and a quick service. Would love to see more places experiment with coffee like that.

11/10, highly recommended!
review_2_text: Went during the cooler season in Chiang Mai so it was not too hot and stuffy. The shop has innovative coffee menu just like a bar. I really like the Graph No.29, slight hint of pineapple and the margarita like salt added a new flavour  combination.
review_3_text:
The most crowded spot in this area, so we had to drop by for a coffee. Unfortunately, only bills above ‡∏ø300 are accepted for credit card payment.

Orders are placed at the counter, and you‚Äôll be given a small tin with an alphabet on it. The staff will then bring the drinks to your table.

The Volcano Latte was one of the popular picks. It uses oat milk, and I was pleasantly surprised that there was no usual oat milk aftertaste. The drink was very smooth, slightly sweet, and served mildly chilled.
review_4_text: Place is nice and ‚ÄúTrendy‚Äù , this come with a ln extra price tag ‚Ä¶ me living in Chiang mai long enough , prefer not to pay. Coffe was good , not something that I cannot get in Many other local shops with half price tag. It‚Äôs kind of place that young crowd are willing to pay extra in order to have a nice capture for social media. Or maybe I‚Äôm not their target audience.  You can try and see.
review_5_text: Good coffee and good staff. Even though there‚Äôre lots of customers. The staff still nice and let us know we need to wait a bit

name: FINE HOMESTAY & Local crafts shop
review_1_text:
The service by the owner left us feeling uninvited, even when purchasing items. Firstly I enter the store and ask if I need to take off shoes and she just points to her shoes, with a blank expression.

There‚Äôs no changing room so you need to try items on top of your clothes, which we did respectfully. The whole time we are admiring clothes and giving them a go on top of our clothes- she continues being blunt and uninviting. The only time she speaks is after my friend puts the dress she tried on back on the rack,  she finally talks to us saying ‚Äú is that not good for you‚Äù. My friend politely responds they are nice but not as much on her body. She doesn‚Äôt respond or smile and we are left leaving that they just have a pay and go away attitude.

We end up buying hand made side bags (three of them) despite her acting like our presence was a burden. My friend grabs a pair of pants to try and she bluntly and in a tone says shoes off twice even though my friend hadn‚Äôt even began putting them on. Mind you, we are being so friendly with smiles despite these interactions trying to make up for the tense energy. After paying, my friend asks to use her cafe bathroom and she says no.

I don‚Äôt know what her problem is but you can communicate if something is wrong, we asked about shoes, tried over our clothes and admired everything without trying to disrupt anything. Although items are cute I could not endorse others to spend their money over other places that actually want to make potential customers feel welcome.
review_2_text:
Feeling safe & satisfied of my staying here. Public area‚Äôs clean and free to use.
I love the lychi coffee very much.
And thanks to Pui‚Äôs treat!
review_3_text:
I stayed at FINE HOMESTAY & FINE BREW for a month, solo and honestly, it felt more like staying at a relative‚Äôs beautifully designed home than a typical guesthouse.

First, the location is perfect. You‚Äôre a short stroll to 7-Eleven for midnight snacks, close to Baan Kang Wat for your artsy weekend wandering, and surrounded by solid cafes. A personal favorite was mo.cha Coffee, open seven days a week, always quiet, and ideal for getting serious work done without the background buzz of a hundred digital nomads on calls.

The space itself is spotless and full of character. You can tell Pui, the owner, really put heart and soul into the details, there are little design touches and cute corners everywhere that make it feel like a real home, not just a sterile rental.

What sets this place apart is that it isn‚Äôt just a homestay. There‚Äôs an on-site cafe brewing genuinely good coffee (not the ‚Äújust okay‚Äù you settle for at many places), and they also sell handcrafted Thai crochet pieces, jewelry, and dresses (mostly for the ladies, but fun to browse).

Pui, the host, is a gem. She‚Äôs extremely hospitable, often offering you freshly brewed coffee, sharing fruit, or just sitting down for a good chat about life. You don‚Äôt get that kind of warmth in most places, it feels natural, not forced. Though there‚Äôs slight language barrier, her English is still conversational, just try to keep simple, slow and slightly louder.

Cleanliness and comfort were top-notch the whole time I was there. The vibe is quiet and relaxing, making it easy to focus if you‚Äôre working remotely or just want to unwind without constant noise.

A small heads-up: it‚Äôs not a big hotel with full-time staff or luxury facilities and that‚Äôs exactly why it works. You come here for the human touch, thoughtful design, and a sense of community (if you want it). If you‚Äôre looking for a cozy, home-like base with a great host and strong local flavor, this is it. I left feeling recharged, and a bit spoiled for my next stay anywhere else.
review_4_text:
My first time in Chiang Mai and Fine Homestay & Pui gave me a warm welcome.
- Location is great, somewhat in more local & less tourist area. It is surrounded by nature, many great restaurants in walking distance. If you love the green, the nature, then this is the best location in Chiang Mai (after Fine Homestay, we tried other areas to experience and we realized that Fine Homestay's the best when it comes to being close to the nature). Get up early and take a walk around the neighborhood, it feels so greattt!.
- The room is super cozy and clean. Strong wifi for online working. Just feels like home. Just some noise at night as the house is on the street, but just put on the earplugs (provided by Pui) and you will be fine.
- Pui is a super host. She is caring, attentive, kind and so helpful. She gave us lots of recommendation for good restaurants. She also surprised us with tea and fresh fruits sometimes
review_5_text:
We stayed at FINE Homestay for a month as a couple, and it was an absolutely delightful experience. The house is warm, welcoming, and incredibly comfortable ‚Äì we slept so well every single night! The host, Pui, is truly one of a kind. She is sweet, caring, and always ready to help with anything you need. From offering great local tips to surprising us with fresh fruit as a welcome gift, she made sure our stay felt special and hassle-free.

If you‚Äôre looking for a cozy and relaxing place with a host who genuinely cares about her guests, we can‚Äôt recommend FINE Homestay enough. We‚Äôd happily stay here again!

review_1_text:

review_2_text: We ordered 2 chai tea. The wifi connection took very long time and it'svery slow.  Every Starbucks should have an easy & fast connection. Customers expect that. In the process of log-in, I had to provide passport number & phone number!  This is unacceptable. Also, the chai tea came on a plastic net!  It's the most unhealthy way to drink tea! As of 2024, there were over 40,000 Starbucks coffee shops operating worldwide. Odds are, you have been to more than ten of them.

name: ROASTIV
review_1_text:
One of the absolute best coffee shops in the city, hands down. We literally make a special trip here every single morning just for their cappuccino; it‚Äôs that good. The quality is incredibly consistent: every cup is perfectly balanced, silky smooth, and made with real care.

The atmosphere is so cozy and welcoming that it has become our little morning ritual; starting the day here with a coffee feels like a proper treat. And as if the coffee wasn‚Äôt enough, their homemade natural ice cream is absolutely delicious.

Highly recommend!
review_2_text: Craving homemade ice cream? This place is a must-try! My favorite flavor was Yakult Pipo üòãlight, creamy, not too sweet, and seriously addictive. ü§çüç¶
review_3_text: A small place but bring a very solid game with coffee and bagels. The latte was perfect, not too bitter, a generous portion and at a super affordable price. The bagel was very good quality too, although a bit pricy for the portion.  The bagel and coffee stands are in the same shop but they take separate payments. All good and very pleasant atmosphere and service.
review_4_text: Roastiv is a great spot to start your morning with a good cup of coffee. They offer a variety of coffee options, along with delicious bagels from Volks, all in the same space. The staff is friendly, and there‚Äôs also outdoor seating if you prefer to enjoy your coffee outside. A solid choice for a relaxed breakfast or coffee break!
review_5_text: Came here based on google reviews when wife and I came to One Nimman for some shopping. Coffee was ok. nothing so extraordinary. I think it really depends on your taste. for me I like a mocha with a very rich cacao taste. this did not have the taste to my liking. the place is nice and service was good. not my favorite coffee.

name: 289 Coffee
review_1_text: 289 Everyday Coffee at Chiang Mai‚Äôs Airport Business Park is a fantastic caf√© with a relaxing vibe. Nestled in a peaceful campus by a pond, it‚Äôs an ideal spot to enjoy quality specialty coffee. Their flat white is superb, rich, smooth, and perfectly balanced. The service from Form and Aom is exceptional; their friendliness and attention to detail make every visit special. Whether you're working or simply relaxing, the tranquil setting and excellent coffee create a wonderful experience. For anyone in Chiang Mai, 289 Everyday Coffee is a top choice for great coffee, a serene atmosphere, and outstanding service. Very much recommended!
review_2_text:
"‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏î‡∏µ ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡πÑ‡∏°‡πà‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏™‡∏µ‡πà‡∏¢‡∏á‡∏î‡∏ß‡∏á"

Here, you can savor special coffee as your everyday brew. Enjoy high-quality coffee with a consistent taste!!!!!! No need to leave your satisfaction to chance. And most notably, the pricing is a testament to the ultimate in friendly generosity.

When in Chiang Mai, this is an invitation to a taste adventure you shouldn‚Äôt miss.

name: Mingmitr Coffee - ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏¢
review_1_text: I stopped by Ming Mitr Caf√© while exploring Chiang Mai and had an espresso. It wasn‚Äôt bad at all‚Äîsmooth, well balanced, and properly extracted. The atmosphere is relaxed and cozy, making it a nice place to take a short break from the heat and the busy streets. Good spot for a casual coffee stop.
review_2_text:
Chilled atmosphere and nice staff.
The drinks are good and this location is easily walkable to the airport.
review_3_text: A great cafe. I like this place for the ambience. We'll designed. Good air-conditioning, friendly staff. Coffee prices are typical, not extraordinary. Ordered an iced Black coffee which is hard to screw up. Can't comment on the other drinks yet. WiFi seems good enough. Not overly crowded but a lively atmosphere in the late afternoon.
review_4_text:
‚ÄúPerfect for locals/residents and visitors (tourists or those who happen to be in this area).‚Äù  Those were my thoughts when I came here for coffee for the first time even though I had lived in Chiangmai for several years.

The Xym Caf√© is modeled after Starbucks and for the most part they get it right, from the airconditioning to the light upbeat instrumental music to the incredibly luxurious comfy seats and spaciousness of the place to the availability of Cold Brew, Nitro, Drip, and other coffee options, to the sale of mugs and desserts.   But with an exception:  all of this available at a fraction of what you‚Äôd pay at Starbucks.  Oh, and they have plants with watering mists that keep the plants looking green.

Opens at 7am for you early birds who want to seize the day and get a head start on life.  There are also Chang and Singha beer options, just like any self-respecting Thai establishment. Heineken is represented too.
And local Thai snacks to accompany your coffee / beer or other beverage choices in this garden-like setting.  There‚Äôs the floral/plant motif that runs through this whole cafe.

Perfect all-around place to come solo, bring someone special, and just have some private time away from the bustle of the world.  This cafe has parking, and is located next to a 7-11 if you need to pick up a few items before/after your coffee.

Pro Tourist Tip:
The Xym Caf√© is also located directly right across the ‚ÄúOld Chiangmai Cultural Center‚Äù (which has nightly food and cultural performances, depending on the season), so it‚Äôs great to be at Xym Caf√© in the late afternoon and pop over to the Old Chiangmai Cultural Center in the evening for their activities.  The cultural center grounds is nice for a walk too, and there‚Äôs a famous Japanese restaurant within its vicinity, along with also a famous malt whiskey drinking place for aficionados.  There‚Äôs also the Ma Nee night market (which has a galore of food stalls) just a mere 2 minute stroll from the cafe.  So, all in all, this Caf√© is perfect for an afternoon relaxing stopover before the evening activities just right across from it.

Kindly give me a thumbs up if you found this review helpful.  It encourages me to keep doing this.  Thanks.
review_5_text: Obsessed with this place!!!!!!! All I had in chiang mai was mingmitr coffe

Honestly, it's one of the worst Amazon coffee in Chiang Mai.
Vietnam definitely has this place beat.
So much for my order inside. The latte is simple, and you have to oder 2 if you want a full cup. You can do better at 7-Eleven and cheaper.
The pastry is well. Go to a local cafe and get everything.

This was a choice waiting on immigration to open. This is a last choice.  üòí
review_3_text: They need to have oatmilk alternative for hot coffee, not everyone wants to drink a hormon induced cancerogenic-proven secretion of a very likely maltreated animal lol. Other than that, I love this franchise, good vibe and good priced.
review_4_text: just another amazon, right ? this one a small cut above the others,homier feel, supply phone chargers and a little more pastry than most, decent parking ( of course it is in the ptt gas station complex at the rear )
review_5_text: The immigration office is close to this eatery. So I always sit there when I go to the immigration office. lovely, quiet, very private, and pleasant to work in. Likewise, full with plants, as suggested by their name.

name: Bulls' CAF√â
review_1_text: fav coffee shop in town.  the staff very friendly. always come to get the coffee in weekdays. thanks for making a heart too.
review_2_text: Very friendly staff, great coffee, nice prices, and good promotions. In addition to having the regular types of coffee and tea, they also have a selection of creative and adventurous flavours!
review_3_text: I've ordered via Grab many times. It's really nice. Especially the Coconut flavoured Coffee.
review_4_text: The owner operator is very knowledgeable coffee lover.
review_5_text: Good quality beverages, reasonable prices and kind services.

name: Peerapong Coffee at Rimping Supermarket Nim City Daily
review_1_text: Flavorful, full bodied taste.  Great spot for a coffee before shopping in Rimping Supermarket. Before having coffee stop at the bakery counter first and pick up & pay for a pastry or custard tart.
review_2_text: I've tried a bunch. Here, you get the best coffee in town from the skilful, heartful, attentive barista. Highly recommended!
review_3_text: I give the coffee 1 star because... well I can't get a coffee since the staff "went to the toilet". Been sitting here for around 20 mins now but nothing.
review_4_text: Best coffee in Chiangmai. Peerapong is my favourite barista.
review_5_text:
What a really good coffee!
Expert service.
My best surprise for a while.
I'll be back
Thank you Mike!!

name: Coffee World - Central Chiangmai (Common Area)
review_1_text: Nice location inside the mall. Very comfortable chairs.  Nice place to relax.  Coffee is ok.  Chocolate cake is on. Service is good.
review_2_text:
New location is open now on 1 floor
, coffee is nice , with many select choices.
review_3_text: Me and a partner had to work on some things for school. Since Starbucks only took card, we found this place who took cash. Got waffles that were good and had free wifi. This is the only time I recommend Coffee World over Starbucks.
review_4_text:
One of me favorite coffee place.
As expected, serve good fresh coffee and cake. Is one of the chain shop.
review_5_text: Good coffee, comfortable seating in an open area of Central Airport Plaza.  Shame that their free wi-fi didn't work; even the staff couldn't get it.

name: RYO „É™„Éß„Ç¶ coffee
review_1_text: This is one of the few shops that serves a really delicious dark roast mocha that suits my taste. The barista is lovely, always smiling, and very friendly.
review_2_text: The caramel latte was not too sweet and had a wonderful caramel aroma. It was delicious! It's a small shop that just opened under an apartment building. The price is affordable. I highly recommend it. üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü I give it 5 stars. I'll definitely be back :)
review_3_text: The coffee is fragrant and tastes great. The staff are kind, polite, and lovely.

name: Honey Berry Slowbar Coffee
review_1_text: Just a small coffee truck on the side of the street. You can choose the roast level and the prices are the same for light, medium, and dark. It‚Äôs a good coffee pick up spot.
review_2_text:
My favourite spot in Chiang Mai.
Relax with the drink under the trees.
review_3_text: Great!‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: It's good, give it a try. You can sit and watch the red cars and pigeons under the big trees; it's nice and cool. The coffee is good and reasonably priced. I didn't get a chance to take a picture before I finished it all! The matcha green tea is also pretty good. Come try it!
review_5_text: Very good street coffee, close to the Saturday night market, next to a wild golf course, the uncle is very cute, the coffee quality is also good, better than my moka and wood wood, very cost-effective, a friend who passed by here recommended it to have a cup

name: Cham Chaa Coffee
review_1_text:
The worst Matcha Latte I've ever had.

Avoid this Cafe at Chiang Mai
Immigration. You will seriously regret it. The price isn't even cheap for something this bad.

The worst part is that, even at the first sip, I can feel they might used the expired matcha powder or smth, as I am a big matcha fan‚Ä¶.

When I said the drink was not tasty and asked them to fix it, the staff got angry, poured it into the sink right in front of me, and walked away. No apology at all.

(‚ÄúNo refund and no renew, cannot‚Äù the staff even about to yell at me!!!!)
review_2_text:
Can I give ‚Äúzero star‚Äù???

The worst cafe at all!!!

The staffs are rude and aggressive!!!

Please avoid this place, don‚Äôt buy negative energy with your own money !!!

Pls
review_3_text: Nice place and when you go there i recommend to wear a nice dress.

name: Koji Nakama Cafe & Bistro
review_1_text: One of my best local food experience. It's delicious and well prepared, even the fried egg was differently good.
review_2_text: I ordered food through Line Man and found worms in it. I would like to ask the restaurant to please double-check their food before preparing it for customers.
review_3_text: Good service, very delicious food.

name: Coffee by JinJu
review_1_text: Great coffee in the morning when you have an appointment at immigration... much better than Amazon at the gasstation... nice guy, deserves your support! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüôèüèª
review_2_text: Very friendly and good coffee
review_3_text: Cute little place, the owners are sweet. I ordered a very delicious Thai tea! Recommend to anyone in the area :)

name: ‡πÄ‡∏¢‡∏ß‡πà‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏µ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: The food was delicious, and the atmosphere inside the restaurant was superb. It's a great place to bring the kids. We'll definitely come back again!
review_2_text: The food and drinks are delicious and affordable.
review_3_text: The coffee is delicious, and the papaya salad is incredibly spicy! The vendor is so kind and even gave me free tea. Thank you, kind vendor!
review_4_text: The atmosphere is good. The food is worth the price.
review_5_text: Very friendly service and completely reasonable pricesü§ó

name: NORTH DEGREE COFFEE ROASTERY
review_1_text: Good coffee. Free hot and cold water available. Convenient location access to banks and other stores . A good place to hang out with friends and wait for bank queue.

name: On The Way Cafe Chiangmai ‡∏≠‡∏£‡πà‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏¢‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏û‡∏ß‡∏á‡∏°‡∏≤@ Central Chiangmai Airport
DREAM CHAF√â by KODANGCHA
review_1_text: Found this cute little place while walking by but it‚Äôs quite hard to see if you‚Äôre not looking for it. The service was great. The owner was super super friendly and all the bubble teas on the menu are roughly ‡∏ø20. I got an espresso coffee for ‡∏ø40! It was great at a great price!
review_2_text: Very wonderful lady who came and opened the shop just for us! The best bubble tea I had, we got taro milk tea and brown sugar milk tea each only cost 20 baht and the tapioka was freeü´∂ Definitely coming back tomorrow, thank you:))
review_3_text: Very good

name: Burkta ABP
review_1_text: Nice coffee van in front of the airport business park. The iced latte was made just the way I liked it. Service was friendly. A couple of tables available to lounge at while sipping your drink.
review_2_text:
# Good services
# Ambience is good
# Good coffee
review_3_text: Good coffee üòä
review_4_text:
Great coffee, lots of places to chill.
No straws for the environment. Oh my!

name: Day off house
review_1_text: We stayed a few weeks and want to stay again after becoming friends with the host and her family. New coffee shop she just opened is amazing the manger tony is a lifelong friend now as well. Night market is close by. Good restaurants are close and old city is an easy walk. The area of the city had a pretty serious flood last year but the owner and house keeper have kept things together. This is a storage container build so keep in mind it's not fully soundproof and you should be respectful of other people no partys! We wanted to meet people and make friends so this was the perfect place for us.
review_2_text: Favorite place in Chiang Mai. I come to Chiang Mai quite often and always return to the Day off house. It‚Äôs located in a cute and quiet area of Chiang Mai run my the sweetest ladies. Rooms are always clean and super comfy.
review_3_text:
Beautiful home in the heart of Chiang Mai, real family feel, a peaceful, warm, friendly place. Really great distance from the city whether walking or driving. The host and her family are so friendly and kind. The concept of staying in a converted shipping container is so cool, it had a lovely atmosphere.
Great price and location, would definitely recommend ‚ú®‚≠êÔ∏è
review_4_text:
Spacious, clean and modern en suite with a comfy double bed and balcony. Exactly as shown online
Great location between the old town and airport with tasty restaurants and a 711 in walking distance.

Also lovely owners who gave me sandwiches, fruit and homemade yoghurt which I really appreciated and made me feel right at home during my stay.

Room cleaned every ~3days/ on request , well equipped kitchen area

10/10 would recommend this experience to a friend‚ù§Ô∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
review_5_text: I stayed at Day Off House for a month while taking a Thai massage course, and it was the perfect place to call home. The rooms were spacious, impeccably clean, and thoughtfully designed for comfort, and having a small kitchen was a great bonus for preparing snacks and quick meals. However, the best part of my stay was the incredible hospitality of the family running the guesthouse‚Äîthey were always around, eager to connect, and truly went above and beyond to make me feel welcome. They took my friend and me to a cozy local coffee shop, helped me find a place to get a haircut, and made every effort to ensure we had an amazing experience. Their warmth and generosity turned my stay into something far more meaningful than just accommodation, and I left feeling like part of their extended family. If you‚Äôre looking for a place that offers not just comfort but a genuine sense of belonging, Day Off House is the perfect choice‚ÄîI can‚Äôt wait to return!

name: Gurkha Chyia
review_1_text:
Very nice little restaurant and take away shop. The prices are fair and not expensive and the food is decent and very good. It's good to find a nice place like this for Indian / Myanmar / Nepali food in the city that has reasonable prices. I hope they manage to keep the quality high as the price low for a long time.
I'll go again for sure
review_2_text:
Amazing taste and authentic flavors!
Gurkha Chyia has the best puri bhaji, Gurkha chai, and noodles ‚Äî all so delicious and freshly made. The food reminds me of real Gurkha home-style cooking. The place is clean, cozy, and has a warm atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone who loves authentic Gurkha food!
review_3_text: Very friendly owner. Tasted good & reasonable at 50 baht. Pani puri was not the usual mint coriander, but I still enjoyed it. Vegan friendly.
review_4_text: Nice Burmese/Nepali/Indian food. The Burmese noodle salad, tea leaf salad and roti are especially good. The masala chai is the best I‚Äôve had so far in Chiang Mai.
review_5_text: A truly wonderful place in Chiang Mai for Burmese, Nepali, and Indian food. The food here is absolutely amazing rich flavors.Every dish feels homemade and yummy. Really like the kind, welcoming, and genuinely warm atmosphere. You feel like a guest than a customer. One of those rare spots you keep coming back to, both for the food and the people. üôè

name: Boy Slow Bar Coffee ‡∏®‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏õ‡∏¥‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á
review_1_text: Very cute little coffee shop and great coffee/latte!! It‚Äôs run by a lovely couple. We came here every morning for breakfast during our stay in Chiang Mai. Thank you for making us the best coffee every morning!
review_2_text:
This is the best coffee in Chiangmai (and I think the best espresso I ever had - yes better than the Italy).

The barista is a proper artist of the art of making coffee, really a must visit if you are in Chiangmai!

The couple running the place are super nice!

You can also work from the laptop here as there‚Äôs a small room with solid WiFi.

Just fantastic.
review_3_text:
Wonderful and delicious little caf√© in Chiang Mai!
I highly recommend it if you‚Äôre staying nearby. It‚Äôs run by a lovely couple, and it‚Äôs such a joy to come here every morning for a delicious coffee or matcha, made with so much care and heart.
Also, their waffles are amazing!
Thanks to the owners for their kindness and beautiful energy !
review_4_text: We stayed at an Airbnb down the street and came here every morning for coffee. The owner was so friendly and the coffee was amazing. We also enjoyed the waffles! Highly recommend this gem. Some afternoon we even went back for a Thai tea.
review_5_text: A small coffee place only for to go. The guy is nice and put some effort to make my cup. The bean they use is dark roast, so I tried ice cappuccino and it was very good.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Mostly located every PTT gas station one of my favorite coffee shops in Thailand, they have standard and almost same coffee taste in every location , good strong tasty coffee. Reasonable prices .  Coffee Amazon is my always first  choice.
review_2_text: As expected, Amazon has a good consistency with it's menu, looks and taste, so you can always order your favourite drinks, this one has nice amount of greenery to look at too, it is little bit hidden in the corner of the gas station tho.
review_3_text: Came here for online meetings while in Thailand. Very consistent service from all Cafe Amazons in Thailand.
review_4_text: Every day at 6a. Great coffee and environment for starting the day! The people are great!
review_5_text: Disappointing, limited range of not very attractive sandwiches etc

name: All Day Coffee Food&Beverage
review_1_text: This place is simply amazing. My partner and I were lucky to find it close to our homestay! We would have come everyday but the owner/chef took a well deserved vacation. It‚Äôs a one man show, with a cute lil pup guard dog and a homey atmosphere inside. The food is very affordable (50-80 baht a dish) and usually comes with a yummy broth on the side. We repeatedly got the pad-see-ew, pad-ka-krow, tom kha gai because they were the best dishes of our trip. Seriously don‚Äôt miss out on this spot!
review_2_text: Amazing food and great portions! It‚Äôs a really small and cozy place, with freshly cooked food and very friendly and nice owner. it‚Äôs also very affordable! A must visit if you are in the area!
review_3_text: This place is a gem! The restaurant serves tasty and healthy dishes, very good quality and good prices. The chef is really nice and prepares the food outside. The eating area is a cozy place that feels like home. The adjacent Caf√© is run by a very nice lady and offers tasty drinks that can also be ordered in the restaurant.
review_4_text: So happy we found this hidden gem just a few steps away from our place! Food is amazing and the chef basically runs the place by himself! Come here and support this business, each dish is worth a try!!
review_5_text: It‚Äôs definitely more like a restaurant than a cafe. You wanna try their red curry with crispy pork because it‚Äôs very good. It‚Äôs a small yet good AC space especially for the price.

name: Ongsa
review_1_text: Looks good but it's not 24h open as it says
review_2_text:
Drive by, there's parking at the food court.
I ordered a 25% sweet Thai tea. It tasted good, smooth, and had a nice tea aroma.
The price was reasonable.
The atmosphere was nice, with bright white tones and a nice view outside. I enjoyed reading a book.
Recommended.
review_3_text: The Thai tea is delicious. It's a small shop with a nice atmosphere and is very chill. If you're lucky, you might see a cat in the parking lot behind the shop. üò∫ It's very cute and noisy.
review_4_text: Newly opened coffee shop. White shop, clean, beautifully decorated, good coffee, cool air conditioning, normal price.
review_5_text: Delicious coffee, great atmosphere.

name: ‡∏ö‡∏∏‡∏ç‡∏õ‡∏±‡πã‡∏ô ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà Boonpun cafe
review_1_text: If you reading this post, please try to noodle soup right next to it. local Mama noodle soup with pork rib. you wont find it anywhere in Chiang Mai. it taste so good and yet no information could be find. it makes me wanna go back for more!!!  BTW coffee is good here.
review_2_text: Very good thai tea. Cozy place. Nice barista but with bad english. I‚Äôve ordered green tea and got thai tea but everything was tasty and nicely presented so I don‚Äôt mind.
review_3_text: We stumbled upon this cafe during the city walk. It was a great experience. Friendly barista, good coffee, decent price.
review_4_text: Neat little cafe that opens early morning, with fragrant coffee, attentive owner and cozy atmosphere.
review_5_text: Great coffee at a really great price. I definitely recommend it.

name: JOYLIDAY Coffee - ‡πÄ‡∏•‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏Ñ‡∏±‡πà‡∏ß‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ
review_1_text: Amazing coffee and lovely people - this place was my hidden gem in Chiang Mai! It‚Äôs next to the Muay Thai gym where my husband trained and I enjoyed many Thai espressos while I waited - so delicious and they take so much care with every drink. Highly recommend!
review_2_text: Good Coffee, Good Price, Nice Place to sit and relax - Iced Americano with Orange Medium Roast
review_3_text: The coffee is delicious and great value for money. The shop isn't quite finished yet, so it might be a bit hot sitting inside.
review_4_text: Good coffee quality, good packaging, reasonable price. Good‚ú®üëç

name: After Sunrise ‡∏®‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏õ‡∏¥‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á
review_1_text: Absolutely loved this place! The coffee at After Sunrise is smooth and flavorful ‚Äî you can tell they really care about quality. The staff were incredibly friendly and made the whole experience warm and welcoming. Perfect spot to relax, enjoy a good cup of coffee, and start your day right. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: If you‚Äôre around here, this is a great spot for good coffee and a chill vibe.
review_3_text: Best coffee shop in town! Friendly staff and atmosphere! Good selection of coffee and tea! I would recommend!
review_4_text: Cozy atmosphere cute cats delicious drinks and food
review_5_text: Loved the drinks and the cozy intimate bar seating. Relaxing music and friendly baristro.

name: Fulfill Coffee Bar
review_1_text: great coffee great music.
review_2_text: Good music  great coffee

name: Ziel Koffie
review_1_text: A small coffee shop hidden in a quiet alley, yet not difficult to find. The coffee tastes great, with various bean origins to choose from. The owner is polite and very attentive to every cup‚Äîso it‚Äôs better not to order too many at once, or you might have to wait a little. There‚Äôs also a chubby, sleepy black cat acting as the shop‚Äôs little entertainer. ‚òïüêà‚Äç‚¨õ‚ú®
review_2_text: The coffee was delicious and super affordable. Koffie the cat was an exceptional host, she was upset we moved him from his chair but she still stayed and sat on her box. She is super cute. She even let me give her kisses. The owner is very friendly
review_3_text:
An absolute hidden gem in Chiang Mai!!! This small caf√© serves the best coffee we had in the city. There‚Äôs a huge variety to choose from, and all beans are locally sourced from Thailand.

The owner is super kind and friendly and shares local tips and information, which makes the experience even more special. You can notice the passion he has for coffee!

If you‚Äôre looking for truly great coffee away from the usual tourist spots, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!
review_4_text: This is one of the best coffee places that I‚Äôve been in Chiang Mai. Don‚Äôt skip it. The coffee is so good, the owner is very nice and knows everything about the products that he is selling and the cat is the cutest cat ever.
review_5_text: What a lovely cozy cafe hidden in the small alley area. The coffee is surprisingly great! With the reasonable price. The owner is very lovely, welcoming and his cat name Coffee also very sweet. 100 out of 10!

name: ‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏Ç-‡∏Ç‡∏¥‡∏ï ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: The coffee is really delicious, no complaints, and the price is not expensive.

name: ‡πÇ‡∏à‡πâ‡∏Å wish me luck
review_1_text: Excellent quality Vietnamese coffee for 40 baht. The porridge in the same area is very high quality at a good price.
review_2_text: The best Vietnamese coffee you can find in Chiang Mai. And served with attention and grace.
review_3_text: Very nice coffee shop with tasty Vietnamese food.  Vietemese coffee is pretty cool.  This is a different and unique experience for coffee lovers.  We enjoyed our experience at this nice shop.   I recommend this shop
review_4_text: Gem!
review_5_text: This breakfast stall near Ghatmanee offers porridge, fried eggs, Vietnamese bami, and Vietnamese coffee. The Vietnamese coffee is delicious for 40 baht. It's a nice, spacious dining area with free water.

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡πÑ‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏Å
review_1_text: Love it! Very friendly staff
review_2_text: Delicious coffee very friendly
review_3_text: This small shop offers drinks starting at 19 baht. The vendor is efficient and quick, so you don't have to wait long. The drinks taste pretty good!

name: Libera Coffee
review_1_text: Little bit expensive but the cappuccino was excellent and a good size
review_2_text: Good coffee shop next to Astra Condo
review_3_text: The coffee there is not good but the price is high. 80‡∏ø for an Americano I expect more. Seems their main customer is guests in Astra condo. You can find way better coffee with cheaper price across the street.
review_4_text: 75 baht for a tiny cappuccino, I wanted to throw it in their face, but I am nice and I wouldn‚Äôt do that, although I still had that feeling. Please owner of this business, do not rip people off, if you charge this much money make sure the size is at least double of this. YOU LITERALLY GAVE ME A BABYCINO. Rip off
review_5_text: Decent atmosphere but pretty mediocre coffee

name: Heartwork the Sharing Space
review_1_text: ‚ÄãThis is a fantastic co-working spot in Chiang Mai! The vibe is so warm and welcoming, and it's always quiet, which is perfect for getting work done. The Honey Lemon Soda is an absolute must-try, and the staff are wonderful. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
Great spot for WFA. I require Wi-Fi, power outlets, a large table, a clean restroom, and air conditioning. It meets all my needs.

The cost is the price of a drink plus a 20 THB top-up.
review_3_text:
Workplace - Good and quiet
Coffee - Good
Food - A big NO!!!

I ordered the "pork omelette with rice," but I only received an "omelette with rice." Even though I didn't get what I paid for, I was charged the full price.

This place is only good for working, not for ordering food. The food isn't even made here. They order it from outside. I realized this too late when I saw someone bringing in food from another place.

Bad service!
review_4_text: Cute little cafe serving food and drinks. They have space upstairs with tables and chair for working but it gets crowded so if you want to secure a seat I suggest going early. Everyone is friendly and recommend if you need a quiet spot to work.
review_5_text: Great coffee and good space with some good working chairs. It‚Äôs more like a very good workable cafe with good drinks than a coworking space. If you are sitting here, then they charge you 20thb extra, which is totally ok given the quality of the coffee by itself already and you get good tables, chairs, fans, AC. It‚Äôs well worth it if you wanna get some work done especially. My hot cappuccino was great.

name: Berries Cafe & Bar
review_1_text: This was the only breakfast spot we trusted and kept coming back to during our entire stay in Chiang Mai. It‚Äôs a cozy hole-in-the-wall place with great food and a clean, pleasant atmosphere‚Äîno weird smells at all. Even the bathroom is spotless. They have books you can read, sell amazing cookies (which I brought along on the loop), and the staff are polite, friendly, and speak English. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: Just lovely,  friendly cafe within 5 minutes walk of the Old Town.  Really good coffee! Small food menu done really well! Oranges for my orange coffee were sqeezed in front of me! Delicious!!!
review_3_text:
Superb little restaurant close to town. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing. I went there for lunch and ordered the beef plate, shrimp toast with homemade sauce, fish n chips and shrimp pasta. Everything was very good and well presented.
The owner is super friendly and speaks perfect English.
I really recommend this restaurant for lunch or brunch, with the family, as a couple or even on your own.
A big thank you to the owner for his dedication and politeness to his customers ‚ù§Ô∏èü•á
review_4_text: My girlfriend stumbled upon this place and we decided to give it a try. And gosh were we glad we did. Besides the fact that this little cafe/restaurant looked really clean and cute, the food and drinks were absolutely phenomenal! You can really taste it was made with love. But what made this place special in particular was the owner Tim. He made us feel like home. Such a warm and humble person. He had a chat with us about our stay in Chiang Mai and even made us a list of things to do during the rest of our stay without us even asking for it. Absolutely a great guy and great place with great food and drinks. Highly highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone visiting Chiang Mai!
review_5_text: Something really went wrong, we arrived at the store and the owner was really nice, only after an hour we received 2 omelettes out of 3 dishes, and he told us that he didn't have ingredients to prepare the 3rd dish. That is - a whole hour without food and without certainty. The eggs were not cooked.. not a good experience to start the morning

name: Slow bar on the way @‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏°‡πà‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏≤
review_1_text: Absolutely love this cafe and prices are super affordable. Peach tea for just 30 thb is incredible. Also the view is sooo pretty!
review_2_text: A really good coffee shop in a quaint neighbourhood. The service is great, with the barista knowing what she is selling and being able to communicate it! I had the classic "es yen" here and even though that's like a Spanish Latte, it just tasted great! Definitely a must visit in Haiya.
review_3_text: Lovely little Cafe with a lot of options to choose from. The Barista Lady was friendly and lively and made delicious drinks. I ordered a Rose Thai Tea which was refreshing! The drinks didnt take long and the scenic view was beautiful. I would recommend this place!
review_4_text: cheap drinks and very lovely girl serving them. i had a coconut matcha foam and i didn‚Äôt love it, i wish it was real coconut juice as i always think the bottled one tastes pretty different.
review_5_text: 30‡∏ø for a coffee? Yes. Awesome. Amazing little place to relax. Not top of the line coffee but absolutely awesome for a quick pick me up. Super friendly staff. I recommend the Thai teas and flavored sodas. We got the ice latte Moka and it was decent!

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏π ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà Deva Ladoo Chiangmai
review_1_text: Ordered cocoa drink on the go. Inexpensive and the coco is rich, the texture of their bubble is perfect too.
review_2_text: There are offerings to Lord Ganesha and the Lord Buddha in the room. There are ceremonies for offering on important days. I go almost every day with faith. Jai GaneshüïâÔ∏è
review_3_text: This shop offers the widest and most complete selection of items for worshipping deities in Chiang Mai. The ladoo sweets are delicious, especially the Montichu ladoo. For those who don't come to buy anything, there is also a Ganesha statue available for worship inside.
review_4_text: The shop plays pleasant Indian music and the shop smells wonderful. The deities are beautiful and there are many items to choose from. Yesterday I bought a Lakshmi statue, a Navadurga gold plate, an Indian garland, and rose incense. The temple inside is beautiful, sacred, luxurious, and peaceful. It is a very luxurious and peaceful temple. I recommend it to those who believe in superstition. Thank you.
review_5_text: The staff provided excellent service and helpful advice. There was a wide selection of desserts, which were beautiful and delicious. There were also statues of Buddha available for worship and prayer. The interior of the shop was beautiful.

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏á‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏¢‡πá‡∏ô (‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÉ‡∏ï‡πâ) ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà the best of southern thaitea in chiangmai
review_1_text: The iced tea is very delicious. I was high for days. It's very strong. If you've never been here, you might want to slow down because the shop is near the intersection to Ra Kaeng. If there's no parking in front of the shop, you can park in the alley that goes through to Ra Kaeng and walk back. The shop is chill and comfortable, suitable for takeaway. But if you want to sit in the shop, there are tables. The shop might be a little dark. I'd like to see some more lights. üòÖ
review_2_text: The taste was great! But I'm giving it 4 stars because it's a bit far from home. The shop is easy to find, a small, minimalist shop opposite Montfort Primary School. ü§©üëçüèΩ
review_3_text:
Made with tea leaves from the south, the tea has a rich aroma and flavor.
Sweetness can be adjusted: 25%, 50%, 75%. The shop has some comfortable seating.
review_4_text: The tea is so good. It's delicious and the shop is chic. The owner is very friendly and kind. ü•∞‚ù§Ô∏èü´∂üèª
review_5_text:
A new shop, truly from the South.
The rich flavor reminded me of the Hat Yai tea I'd tried there.

name: Roar Cafe
review_1_text: I absolutely love Roar! Great coffee, especially the iced coconut americano. They serve fresh bakery and breakfast (American - English style, eggs, sausage, etc) but also Greek yogurt. Nice staff, quiet, nice space, excellent WiFi, AC, great to work (laptop friendly) and super honest prices. Highly recommend it :)
review_2_text: Was staying nearby at the Astra and this little coffee shop saved the morning. The baristas are sweet, and the flat white was smooth with cute art :) Calm and open air environment .. you won‚Äôt freeze of A/C üôè
review_3_text: Only bought coffees here but it‚Äôs amazing, they started to remember our order. It was just downstairs from where we‚Äôre staying and went everyday for 2 weeks! And tried other places but not as good coffee!
review_4_text: Highly recommend, delicious food. Free wifi provided too which is a nice bonus. We ordered the scrambled egg sausage and bacon on rice bowl - yum! Definitely hit the spot. Coffee is on point too. Thank you!
review_5_text: Stumbled here by accident & the matcha & caramel machiato were amazing as were the chocolate danish & almond croissant

name: Green Queen - Cannabis Shop
review_1_text: Mint is very friendly & professional, they have a great variety of selections and the best prices I‚Äôve seen in Thailand, I would highly recommend this business to anyone.
review_2_text: ‚Üñ(^œâ^)‚Üó The boss is a warm-hearted handsome guy. The products are great and he gave us a discount and a small gift
review_3_text: Good weed good prices the most expensive one is 299 baht for 1g and its very good
review_4_text:
Best coffeeshop with best manager !! ü§†
Some Bubble üçå Gummy 50% +
Crazy stuffs here !
review_5_text: Best place I have came across! Worth the visit! Good quality and great customer service

name: ‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏°‡πà‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏≤
review_1_text: Nice little bar and good variety of local and international beers! Relaxing music with a view on the river and friendly owner. Definitely recommend for a stop. I think no food available, but plenty of beer and some coffee as well (I think). Came here twice during our stay.
review_2_text: ‚ÄúThe atmosphere and view are great, and the drinks are delicious, but the staff are not very friendly. !!! When I asked about the price and was ready to pay, the staff were busy on their phones
review_3_text: good place to sit down and people watch , good beer selection
review_4_text: Good beer and drink selection, staff should improve in politeness and service.
review_5_text: Lovely place for a drink by the canal.

name: On The Way Chang klan
review_1_text: Not much to say: a great place to start the day - just along the road, but so friendly with great coffee. Will be back, best to start the Chiangmai mornings‚Ä¶
review_2_text:
If I could give 100/10 I would do it.
Criss really has the best service, coffee and we love coming here every day.

We bring our own oat milk which he keeps and we order 2 drinks every day.

For me a cold cappuccino oat and a lemon lychee. üòç  my boyfriend always drinks his hot cappuccino‚Äôs and has NO energy crashes during the day. (Thats says how good the coffee is)!!
review_3_text:
This is one of my favorite coffee places I‚Äôve come across in all my travels.

The owner is the friendliest guy and always has a smile on his face.

Coffee is dialed and on point, every time. In the early AM there isn‚Äôt many people here, but once the day gets going there are always people lined up.

Really a great find and worth making a stop at!
review_4_text: Go to this coffee stand! Delicious coffee, great prices, and the barista‚Äîwho seems to also be the owner‚Äîis the sweetest! He also speaks excellent English and will tailor the coffee to your taste preference. Thank you for your yummy coffee and kindness ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: Chris made this place great. Excellent priced, great tasting coffee options in cute boutique stand with seating and music. Chris was very friendly and informative about the area while serving a delicious morning cappuccino and mocha that tasted excellent.
