Going to come back here every morning for the rest of our stay in Chiang Mai.

name: ‡∏ï‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ö‡∏∏‡∏ç Coffee Station
review_1_text:
Hidden Gem small coffee shop in Chiangmai city
Amazing price compared to the taste and quality of coffee.
Cozy atmosphere.
You can park car or motorcycle on the road nearby.
Be back for sure.
review_2_text: Hidden gem in Chiang mai with delicious coffeee!!! And such cheap prices too! Highly recommend! Vegan milks available too!
review_3_text: My new favorite coffee place in Chiang Mai!!! Super friendly owner and good price with delicious coffee that makes us come back every dayüòç Plum Americano is üî•üî•üî•they also have plant based milk available for vegans üíö
review_4_text: Owner was quite fluent with English and was great to talk all things culture with him. Coffee was good and nice to sit in the sun in an informal environment. And just chat .
review_5_text: Excellent Mocha coffee. Very friendly and relaxed place. They even gave us homemade Christmas biscuits and mixed berries tea. Popular with locals. Lovely Wat nearby.

name: The Shepherd
review_1_text: The pup that stays here is so sweet and the coffee came with this little sticker! The vibe is chill and the workers are nice. Most importantly, the coffee is great!!!
review_2_text:
Good coffee, cool place and nice latte art.
Place looks great with art and very chill. Smells like freshly grinded coffee too, nice.
Come check it out if nearby and need a latte
review_3_text: Great coffee - requested flat whites and they were perfect. Better than a lot in Australia.
review_4_text: Great coffee and friendly staff ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text:
One of my absolute favourite coffee spots in Chiangmai. Good choice of beans and an amazing dark roast.

The aesthetic is super cool and they always have good turns playing.

Located on a pretty soi with seats available  outside.

Staff are also awesome!

name: ‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏µ‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏™‡∏ï‡∏≤‡∏ü‡∏≤&‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏™‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏° ‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏ô
review_1_text:
Another recommended rotee shop in the city.
Price is reasonable. And the taste is good, edible.
A bit disappointed with a young lady who served the customer, seemed she is the daughter or the owner or something. She didn‚Äôt perform that well in her job. NO SMILE at all. Hope she gets better soon üîú.
review_2_text: Good vibe and delicious!
review_3_text: Pleasantly surprised with a piece of cheese and crispy roti or prata  for only 20 thb. Black coffee and ginger tea only 15 thb each and comes with a free tea. So sweet.
review_4_text: One of the best rotee and coffee shops in town. Went here for a late night munch and was not disappointed. Went for the milk hot tea and banana roti. Definitely recommend.
review_5_text: Tea, coffee, roti, mataba chicken roti, banana roti..... Mainly roti related all foods are available.

name: VP Coffee at VP City Park
review_1_text:
This is an adorable coffee shop and cafe.

The coffee is delicious! There is also a selection of light meals that are great for breakfast or lunch.

You will be sitting in the middle of a beautiful park filled with trees, exercise paths, and an assortment of structures for exercise or use by  special events.
review_2_text: Very green and best landscaping. Friendly atmosphere and helpful staff. Good food and lovely coffee.
review_3_text: A truly wonderful spot! The staff here are so warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere is just beautiful ‚Äî surrounded by trees, calm, and peaceful. It‚Äôs the perfect place to relax with a good cup of coffee and enjoy nature. Highly recommend!
review_4_text: Wonderful chill place for coffee & food in the City surrounded by trees and flowers. Great for your pets also.
review_5_text:
Really like this place. The outside environment is beautiful, being a park, and the coffee shop itself is stylish and modern with great outdoor seating

Coffee: 4.5/5
Price: 5/5
Atmosphere: 4.5/5
Service: 5/5

name: Monkey Coffee
review_1_text:
My favorite place to go for coffee in Chiang Mai.

The coffee is great and the owner is friendly and a great local guide.

Highly recommend.
review_2_text: A very high quality coffee shop offers several types of coffee, I chose Brazilian coffee was really delicious and very different from other stores using high quality coffee, the store owner is really friendly and helps with information and tips and information to travelers, thank you üôè
review_3_text: It‚Äôs a small place but with really good coffee. I mean, you can even choose the coffee bean you wantüëå
review_4_text: Monkey is a great place to relax on the comfortable couch and have a nice cold coffee. You can choose from  different coffee beans, i had the Brasil one and it tasted great. While drinking your coffee you can have a nice chat with owner. She can also give you a lot travel information in and around Chiangmai.
review_5_text: Lovely shop ,Selected coffee been,Great service. Friendly owner.

name: Anatolia Cafe&Bistro, Grill Turkish Restaurant+Rent Motorcyle
review_1_text:
Food was incredible! We had the beef and the chicken kebabs. The salads were quite tasty, too.
We will be back and bring friends.
review_2_text: A bit of a wait ‚Äî 45 minutes to an hour for two meals ‚Äî but it was totally worth it. Food was flavorful and quite literally, perfect.
review_3_text: I‚Äôm eating breakfast at 4:00 pm. A little late but delicious. Mediterranean focused with Thai as well. Very friendly family.  My third visit.
review_4_text: Food was so tasty! We really enjoyed our meal üôÇ would recommend
review_5_text: The doner taste is authentic. Very good. Best tea of my life here. Highly recommend you eat at this place.

name: Khom Kik!!
review_1_text: A cozy coffee shop decorated in a beautiful vintage style.

name: Outside In Cafe & Studio
review_1_text: Lovely little coffee shop, with great coffee and pleasant service.  The front windows are open and there are fans and a nice breeze. I went every day of my trip.
review_2_text: Great coffee it‚Äôs Cool, beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean a lovely little cozy spot just a minute walk from the Empress hotel.  Lovely helpful people working here
review_3_text: Very friendly people and very delicious coffee!
review_4_text: Really cute place! But just know that they don't have food here. Just coffee and cakes. (Some photos on their Facebook page might lead you to believe otherwise! Coffee was nice and the place is rally comfy!
review_5_text: Very good service with great vanilla lattes. Good price, but lost a star because there's no AC. Open wall and fans allow for good air flow to make up for it though.

name: 2 WAY Coffee & Drink
review_1_text: A chill-out restaurant with affordable prices. They serve simple grilled food such as grilled pork and steamed fish curry. Delicious and convenient to take home.
review_2_text: It is currently under improvement.
review_3_text: This shop is very delicious.

name: anamii coffee.
review_1_text: Win You are amazing   wish you succesfully about  your buissiness üòçüòç
review_2_text: The coffee shop manager provided excellent service and managed the business exceptionally well. I could see they provided truly great customer service, and their coffee was delicious. Highly recommend!
review_3_text: The staff was good. Obviously, I will be back again it‚Äôs very good  shop I don‚Äôt know the staff maybe his name is win he is very good at coffee shop thank you very much. I will be back. Have a good day.
review_4_text: Great coffee and great service
review_5_text: A friendly atmosphere with a small terrace for smokers‚Ä¶ the coffee is perfect, she sweetens it to your liking, and her smile to say thank you makes your day even better!! ü•∞

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô ME WE Coffee
review_1_text: A very small coffee shop with very reasonable pricing.
review_2_text:
Great cappuccino!
Opening hours 08:30ish - 16:00.
I paid 35 THB for one cup
review_3_text:
Great drinks, very good prices, and WiFi is very good!
I finished my 4 hour work there üòå
review_4_text: The owner is incredibly friendly and funny. You can also follow a massage course from her :‚Å†-‚Å†)
review_5_text: Tasty coffee and tea for good price. Highly recommend üëçüèª

name: Lemon Lee
review_1_text:
Very charming, inexpensive little coffee shop right in the canal.
Stop for a coffee, iced drink, ice cream or even a beer or cocktail.

name: Splendish
review_1_text: Lovely place and cute staff
review_2_text: Not open

name: Hippo Coffee Roaster at Little Shelter
review_1_text: At the riverside, good view, nice coffee with a small cookie. There‚Äôs a small solo exhibition there, I like the art atmosphere. And had a happy talk with other guests.
review_2_text:
Beautiful spot with great coffee.
We didn‚Äôt try the food, but the food menu looks good as well.
review_3_text:
Coffee shop with no coffee. They were open and didn't have no coffee beans. After we settled for just food (which was okay) we found out later they got coffee through other costumers.

Regardless the place itself is very nice and calm
review_4_text: Lovely chill place to get a coffee with relaxation by the river. Super chill and good coffee.  Will be back!
review_5_text: River front Hidden Gem in the middle of Chiang Mai. So peaceful and quiet.

name: ‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏î‡πà‡∏ô ‡∏Å‡πà‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡πÑ‡∏ü‡∏ü‡πâ‡∏≤
review_1_text: Good sound system, delicious food, good service.
review_2_text: Fast service, clean place, convenient parking.

name: Improvise coffee
review_1_text:
Wellmade coffee served in large cups.  Nice selection of croissants, baked goods & cookies.

Delicious steamed buns ... mushroom is my favorite.

Calm atmosphere with modern jazz in the background.
review_2_text: In a city full of small coffee shops, it‚Äôs not easy to stand out‚Äîbut if you‚Äôre into strong yet balanced espresso drinks, Improvise is worth a visit. They offer a range of roasts, from light to bold, and the very reasonably priced strong roast cappuccino, served in a small cup and perfectly prepared, really hits the spot. With AC, WiFi, and a relatively spacious setting, it‚Äôs a winner.
review_3_text:
A good place to stop if you are around and need a coffee and some ac to cool down.
It is the best coffee shop on a 1km perimeter üòÖ

Coffee is good, 8/10
But it was too strong for me and the barista didn‚Äôt know English to be able to give him the feedback. They do have croissants and that is nice. Didn‚Äôt try them though.
review_4_text: Cakes are not eatable, they do not serve your dish even you are the only guests and seats are very uncomfortable.
review_5_text: Hot cappuccino w/ light roast for 55B. Very delicious. Also many hot sticky buns to choose from, 25B.

name: Minimal Coffee - ‡∏õ‡πà‡∏≤‡πÑ‡∏°‡πâ Charoenprathet
review_1_text:
This is my favorite Minimal Coffee location. The service is always excellent, friendly, and smooth. You can choose to sit comfortably inside with air conditioning or outside under the umbrellas, which is great depending on the weather.

The coffee is consistently good ‚Äî I‚Äôve never been disappointed here. It‚Äôs also a perfect spot for parents who are picking up their kids from the nearby school. Relaxed atmosphere, good drinks, and reliable quality every time.

Highly recommended! ‚òïÔ∏è
review_2_text: Brand new caf√© ‚Äî clean, quaint, and friendly service. Offers Wi-Fi and AC. Located along the quiet Chang Klan Road ‚Äî a great spot to get some work done or enjoy a good read.
review_3_text: Such a nice coffee to start off the day with ‚Äî rich, smooth, and exactly what I needed before my brain decided to work. Grabbed some takeaway for my coworker too, and it was a hit. This place deserves all five stars. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
review_4_text: On Charoen Prathet Road, just before Wat Chai Mongkol, there's a small coffee shop with warm service and a wide selection of coffees. The atmosphere is quiet and perfect for relaxing or working.
review_5_text: Been there a couple times, nice place to sit and relax ! Took some pics, nice spot for meet friends !

name: Minimal coffee ‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏î‡πà‡∏ô-‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏ä URBAN MYX Banden - Rajavej
review_1_text: Great new minimal coffee branch near Rajavej! Lovely local Chiang Mai coffee beans which you can choose from for your order (dark, medium, and light roast) with very friendly English-speaking baristas. Cute, compact, and so affordable!
review_2_text: Cute minimalist Cafe... terrific Chiang Mai beans - 3 levels of roasting ... friendly English speaking service ...
review_3_text: It's a great spot for a morning coffee break, perfect for a stop before work or after dropping the kids off at school. The shop is beautiful and the taste is excellent.
review_4_text: I like this branch the most. The staff are lovely, and even though I've never met the owner, they seem very attentive to the shop. It's a small shop, but they're constantly improving and developing it. It's excellent!
review_5_text: Standard taste, lovely staff.

name: ‡∏°‡∏∞‡∏û‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏ó‡∏¥‡∏û‡∏¢‡πå
review_1_text:
The coconut and avocado blended with fresh milk was delicious.
The vendor was very kind.
review_2_text: Welcome, dear customers!
review_3_text: Having eaten at many restaurants in Chiang Mai, this one is the best.

name: ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏õ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏ç‡∏à‡∏ô‡πå by coffee Rey
review_1_text: My son loves eating this very much!

name: MOMOTEA ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: It's small, but the menu is substantial and varied, the prices are reasonable, and the food is good.

name: KONG PRESSO
review_1_text: This is a beautiful quiet cafe. Hand made coffee! Hand Ground. Hand pressed.
review_2_text: Nice coffee with river view. Freshly grinded americano was very good!
review_3_text: Nice coffee ‚òïü§åüèª
review_4_text: Relaxed coffee bar by the river. Lovely location and very friendly service!
review_5_text: The shop is quiet and suitable for business meetings and relaxation. They use good quality coffee.

name: Mooncafe by fon
review_1_text:
I stumbled upon this place by pure chance, but I wasn't disappointed! The place is very cute, and the manager is lovely! She even came back to check if I liked my order (Thai tea), and if it was sweet enough for me (I told her I like it sweet)!
Just a stone's throw from the Night Bazaar, it's perfect for a quick tea/coffee/juice break! I highly recommend it :)

(P.S.: Smoking is allowed outside)

name: B@B coffee
review_1_text: Good coffee reasonable price

name: School Coffee
review_1_text: Great coffee shop, cozy with good coffee. Loved the vibe and the staff are very friendly.  I had a dirty latte nicely presented in a small glass, you can tell the shop cares about the coffee experience. Will definitely go back and look forward to bringing friends here.
review_2_text: How delightful to get locally grown coffee, brewed and filtered, hot, just the way I love my favorite morning beverage. The lesson about coffee fermentation and curing blew my mind! Some 30 years of this drink and I'm just now understanding how it is created. Unforgettable experience. You must stop in and taste.
review_3_text:
If you want to try Thai coffee beans while you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai, you have to come check this place out.
It‚Äôll open your eyes to a whole new coffee experience.
review_4_text: The affogato that they made is different but is the best, they use coconut milk is more like a latte, definitely good to try :)
review_5_text: Delicious coffee and tea (hot and cold) and other beverages plus assorted tasty pastries in a beautiful shop decorated like a schoolhouse. Baristas are friendly and knowledgeable. They roast and sell coffee beans too.  Located about 550 meters south of Chiang Mai‚Äôs train station in the Wat Ket district (east side of the Ping River).

name: OH MY CUP
review_1_text: Best Coffee in Chiang Mai. Amazing cookies and brownies.  Must go to place when here.
review_2_text:
I was really intrigued seeing such a nice and cute place in a more industrial area. They really looked to create a nice brand and branding.

Besides the really tasty milk tea I've got, the owners are sooo friendly!! I ran out of gas on my bike and I didn't know what to do and so they brought me a canister of gasoline and helped me fill my bike. They were incredibly helpful and I'm really grateful for this!! Thanks
review_3_text: The best coffee and smoothie in town
review_4_text: Lovely coffee in a relaxed happy environment.
review_5_text: A small shop with a good layout and lots of seating. The coffee is very good. I'm a regular customer who admitted that I intended to visit another shop, but I stumbled upon this one. I was completely smitten by this shop. The price is not expensive at all and the quality far exceeds the price. I will visit often and add it to my list of favorite shops. And the cheese toast is really good, no kidding.

name: Super Wings Home Cafe
review_1_text: True to the name the wings here are definitely super good. Cooked to perfection they are crispy on the outside and meat just falls off the bone. If your not in the mood for wings don't worry they have a full menu that will satisfy any craving.
review_2_text: Outside the city center. Very quiet place, easy. The food we ordered was good. The prices are correct. A good place for lunch or dinner.
review_3_text: Delicious!  Hard to find potato dishes in Thailand
review_4_text: Came back two days in a row. They have the very best wings! Super cheap prices.
review_5_text: Delicious food and you can't beat the price. As a Canadian to see macaroni and cheese on a menu was very exciting. Came back to this spot multiple times in my stay in Chiang Mai!

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô ‡∏´‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏ô ‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏¥‡πà‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü Coffee & tea
review_1_text: Delicious! Highly recommended. The owner provides excellent service. The drinks are delicious ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: It's delicious.
review_3_text: ‡∏û‡∏≠‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ

name: Kai cookies & tea
review_1_text: good place to visit, good food and tasty
review_2_text: The coffee is delicious, and the owner is lovely and fun to talk to.
review_3_text: What kind of khanom jeen nam ngiao is this? It's a truly northern Thai flavor. Anyone who comes to see it must come and try it.
review_4_text: Khao Soi, Nam Khiao Wan Kai, and Hang Lay Curry are all delicious. I recommend them.
review_5_text: Fragrant tea, not too sweet, inexpensive, small shop.

name: Coffee Coffee Vit
review_1_text: Delicious coffee and milkshake. Friendly owner.
review_2_text: A very sweet lady made me a delicious mocha ice!

name: The racer 69 cafe
review_1_text: This is permanently closed :(

name: Vegan Food Cook to order for health
‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏õ‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏•‡πâ‡∏≤
review_1_text:
The shop offers hot and cold drinks, snacks, and ready-to-eat meals for those visiting the hospital. I personally like their savory crispy snacks; they're delicious and have a nice peppery aroma.
The shop uses coffee beans from the Royal Project, Faculty of Agriculture, Chiang Mai University, which is considered one of the first producers of roasted coffee beans in Chiang Mai. It's a classic, original recipe.
I ordered a hot cappuccino and it came with a sweet taste from the syrup. It seems to be a flavor that customers prefer. If you prefer it without sugar, don't forget to tell the barista.

name: Kindi Coffee
review_1_text:
Lovely little corner shop with delicious Americano. The smoothies she made also looked delicious and fresh!
She‚Äôs on her own working hard so patience will be appreciated.
review_2_text: Foreigners are not welcome here, unfortunately. Looks like a decent shop though.  Waited at least 15 minutes at the checkout counter without any acknowledgement or service.

name: 5Dimensions Coffee Roaster
review_1_text: Great specialty coffee and a beautiful atmosphere. The owner is super knowledgeable and passionate, even giving us a complimentary piccolo to taste while we chatted about brewing. A must-visit for coffee nerds and casual drinkers alike!
review_2_text: Lucky to try their very first roast using the new roaster machine ‚Äî and it was absolutely impressive! The house blend and Single O both delivered full, balanced flavors even though freshly roasted. Each cup was rich, aromatic, and perfectly crafted. Highly recommended for passionate baristas and caf√© owners who appreciate quality coffee and precision roasting. A must-visit spot for true coffee lovers in Chiang Mai!
review_3_text: the place where you can have Aussie style coffee, also great beans selection
review_4_text: Exceptional choice. Multiple single origins and a house blend to choose from. The cafe is in a peaceful setting and has a lovely atmosphere. Is by far the best coffee I‚Äôve had in CM and it‚Äôs less expensive than all of the other speciality shops I‚Äôve visited.
review_5_text:
Very cool Cafe specialising in high quality coffee.
Friendly, knowledgeable proprietor who did his coffee apprenticeship in Australia. Hightech roasting equipment. All the regular coffees plus several pour - over filter options from Africa, Central & South America.

name: ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏õ‡∏≠‡∏±‡πà‡∏ß‡∏•‡∏±‡πâ‡∏ß ‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÇ‡∏Æ‡∏°
review_1_text: There's so much ice, I thought I was buying a glass of water for 20 baht.
review_2_text: üåÆüåÆüåÆüçûüçûüßã

name: Chilled Coffee
review_1_text: Good coffee, beautiful seller, good service, located in NT.

name: Honey Bee Coffee and Meal
review_1_text: Beautiful atmosphere.
review_2_text:
Great Location
Great Stuff
Recommend it !
review_3_text: Nice place
review_4_text: The food is delicious, the craft cocoa is tasty with a slight tang. The atmosphere is great, very warm and comfortable. The service is good, and the automatic toilet is amazing!
review_5_text: The craft cocoa is delicious, the cake is soft and just the right amount of sweetness. The owner is polite, welcoming, and friendly, and the atmosphere is wonderful.

name: Beam&Col. coffee bar
review_1_text:
Suitable for remote work! Prices are reasonable for beverages, less than 100 baht. They have coworking space on second floor: 180baht per day or 250baht with coffee included. But, in general, the first floor offers decent tables and seats for work. Internet connection is unstable but if you have your own router, should be fine! Definitely recommend it!
Obs: they accept payments using Moretta!
review_2_text:
hidden gem!
Stumbled across the place, a giant hall/garage type of house renovated into a space, very chill and cozy, love to spend a whole afternoon here.

Coffee not cheap, I remember my flat white is 85B, comparing to normal small cafe. But understandably as the space and atmosphere, it plays nice music too.

totally recommend to come, experience and chill.
review_3_text:
Beam&Col. Coffee Bar, located inside Weave Artisan Society, has the charm of an old warehouse with a spacious and comfortable atmosphere.

The large space offers good distance between tables, making it ideal for working or using a laptop. While the drinks are decent, the environment is perfect for productivity and relaxation.
review_4_text: Internet speed is so fast around 250-300 mbps. Creamy marsmellow latte was exceptional. Architecture and atmosphere on point. Perfect place for remote working. Only problem is that their internet credit seems to limited for 3 hours per order. So it seems you have to order regularly but that‚Äôs okey for what you get
review_5_text:
This review is for the coffee shop inside Weave Artisan. The coffee is just ok, taste is not so nice and the temperature was a bit confused. But every time I visit I find the staffs attitude sucks. No hello, no thank you, no smile. Today I picked up 2 waters and was about to place a coffee order when the server just barked ‚Äú40 baht‚Äù at me.
I won‚Äôt be going back - even road side coffee stalls give a nicer service and they don‚Äôt charge 85baht for a latte.

name: Forty One Cafe‚Äô (41 Cafe‚Äô)
review_1_text:
I came across this little cafe while i walked earlier the canal.
Its owned by Thai people and you can definitely feel that. There is much more personality behind this little cafe then you think from the first sight.
I am in love with them, because of multiple reasons.
1. their coffee is fabulous, smooth and soooo cheap! One cappuccino is 45baht, 1.20‚Ç¨, and its still so premium!
2. the staff is so friendly, kind and welcoming
3. its good for me, bad for the owner, its so quiet here, i was literally the only person in this cafe.
I hope my review helps to let people know that little gem here in the south of Chiang Mai.
There is also a very nice temple close by.
review_2_text:
I love hanging out here with my besties.
It‚Äôs such a chilled vibes to have.
Great Thai food and delicious coffee.
Good Pricing, easy to sit and relax.
I enjoy coming here in the late morning for my happy brunch. Perfect place to be üíï
review_3_text: Just the perfect cafe. Such lovely, chill vibes and absolutely delicious coffee. It is such a clean place and decorated really nicely but the big reason to come is how nice the staff are. It is usually an aunt and her nephew working here and they are so so kind. Shoutout to the coconut cake which my wife had most days we were here ü•≤
review_4_text: Very nice coffee and a relaxing atmosphere. The price is great too only 45 THB. I‚Äôve paid more elsewhere for coffee that didn‚Äôt taste nearly as good as it does here.
review_5_text: This quiet little cafe has decent seating spread around the place, outlets and wifi available, and friendly staff. The coffee and cake I ordered isn‚Äôt bad :) It was a great place to get work done today, and the neighborhood is nice for a walk!

name: Poon Coffee & Restaurant
review_1_text:
I've been eating there almost every day for the past 6 weeks. Everything is good: Thai food, European food, coffee, breakfast.
Mike and Poon are the best hosts, always welcoming you with a smile.
It can be very busy sometimes, so don't be in a hurry. Take your time and give them a chance, you won't regret it!
review_2_text: The lady and gentleman are both very nice. I have been there several times. The breakfast or lunch are all delicious and served beautifully. They have European food , Thai food , and drinks. Definitely will be there again.
review_3_text: Delicious shrimp fried rice! Definitely hit the spot. Cute and cozy place with a good atmosphere for working. Seemed like a lovely place where everyone knew each other.
review_4_text:
We ordered the rice soup from the Thai breakfast menu. It was delicious - especially when I added a little spiced vinegar.
Also the chocolate shake with blended ice was so nice we went back in the afternoon for another one.
review_5_text:
You can live abroad for years, eat like a local, learn the rhythms, and swear you don‚Äôt miss a thing.

Then one random morning your brain whispers, not in Thai: tuna sandwich.

I‚Äôve had plenty over the last couple of years, chasing that simple, salty, familiar bite like it‚Äôs a postcard from another life. And without a doubt, Poon Coffee & Restaurant (‡∏û‡∏π‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà) makes the best tuna sandwich in all of Chiang Mai.

It starts with the bread. Toasted just right, that sweet spot between sturdy and tender. Light butter. The kind of toast that makes a quiet crunch and then gets out of the way.

Then the tuna. Not a polite little smear. A real amount. Seasoned well, stacked between three slices of bread like someone decided you deserved a double-decker moment.

On the side: crisp lettuce, tomatoes, onions, plus a slice of watermelon and dragonfruit, like a small edible reminder that you‚Äôre not back home at all, and that‚Äôs kind of the point.

I washed it down with an Americano, the way I always do. Ice water alongside. A small cookie, because Thailand is generous like that.

‚ÄúHeaven‚Äù is a big word, but breakfast like this earns it. If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai and you get that sudden craving for something that tastes like memory, go see the good people at Poon Coffee & Restaurant. They‚Äôll take care of you.

P.S. they have lots of Thai and Western food too!

name: DoReTea Caf√© & Studio
review_1_text: Absolutely amazing! The best doughnuts I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äì fresh, soft, and perfectly airy. We tried the coconut, cinnamon, and glazed ones, and each was delicious. The coffee and smoothie were fantastic too. Highly recommend! ‚òïüç©
review_2_text: I ordered takeaway so I‚Äôm not sure about service or environment. I ordered the glaze donut, chocolate donut and Thai tea. The glaze donut was delicious and tasted fresh. The chocolate donut was dry and did not taste fresh. The Thai tea tasted nice, not overly sweet but the portion was so disappointing. Even when I filled the cup with ice at home it was not nearly full.
review_3_text: Really lovely, chill cafe with great donuts, food and drinks. The owners are really kind and lovely. I know Khun Noom who is a talented guitarist, guitar teacher and music producer. Noom also teaches guitar and can produce any sort of music in his home studio at reasonable prices.
review_4_text:
Really cosy caf√© with nice owner! Inside of the shop is decorated as a living room, so we felt so comfortable and chill there!

Donuts have amazing taste and are good priced. So soft and fluffy that you cant stop eating ü§£ü§£
review_5_text: Quiet cafe that also has recording studios and guitar lessons. Nice donuts and thai tea and matcha

name: TJ Coffee Roaster
review_1_text:
Hidden gem found !

Great environment
Order mocha + 1 more shot (not very sweet)
Compare to Starbuck (sugary drink)

I assume u know how to choose a more healthier coffee ü§≠

I believe it very newly open

Seat at bar counter drink coffee new style it's very refreshing

Modem theme with old school vaspa design
üëçüèªüëçüèª

Traveller from üá∏üá¨
review_2_text: TJ Coffee shop is a small cafe serving a variety of coffee and non-coffee drinks, including beer.  I had an espresso made with beans from the Chiang Mai area.  The flavor was excellent.  I went back a couple of days later for another one.
review_3_text: Very nice latte, nutty flavour profile.
review_4_text: We google Beam&Col, but run into TJ by a beautiful mistake.  The coffee is amazing with rich & various aftertastes, and the vibe is relaxing.  No food and desert is served, so guests could taste and enjoy coffee purely.
review_5_text: They do not have coffee beans for sale....disappointing

name: ‡∏™‡∏´‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏ô (SAHABAAN.COFFEE)
review_1_text: Nice Place, not so crowded. 5 min from Chiang Mai Gate market by foot. You can choose bean for  your coffee from light to dark roast. Very enjoy :)
review_2_text: Very smooth and nice coffee in reasonable price. Peaceful and cozy environment with lovely cat, Mocha. üòá Perfect place for coffee lovers and cat lovers
review_3_text:
Coffee was good,

You can choose your coffee roast (medium, dark)
Nice and cozy atmosphere
Good prices
review_4_text:
A cozy coffee spot, this place  is definitely worth a visit.

üëçüèª‚≠êÔ∏èQuiet and peaceful setting,high-quality drip coffee, good matcha-Matcha good ,affordable prices and near Chiang Mai Gate.
review_5_text:
Great coffees, amazing hospitality!

This cosy cafe is a passion project to a very friendly host. The coffees here are brewed using moka pot and aeropress using beans roasted from their own plantation. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the area!

name: Achi@Cha Coffee
review_1_text: Hidden Gem that we stumbled upon! Great vibe, super yummy coffee, we had a cappuccino, an Iced Latte and our child had a treat drink called coco mint! The family that runs the shop is so kind. It‚Äôs a great place to chill out!
review_2_text: friendly.  nice coffee.  chill
review_3_text: Stumbled upon this friendly place when I was cycling around, it appeared exactly when I needed something refreshing!
review_4_text:
Delicious drinks
Great prices
Amazing atmosphere under the trees

The coffee is very fragrant and rich, and the green tea is strong. The shop may not be large and there aren't many seats, but the baristas are very attentive.

There's enough parking in front of the shop for one car, but it might be more convenient if you're traveling by motorcycle.

If you're passing by, I highly recommend stopping by and giving it a try.
review_5_text: The lemon tea is not very good, it is a small cup and I finish it quickly. The price is 35 baht. You can also drink coffee here. There are two semi-automatic coffee machines, the price is about 50 baht.

name: ‡∏°‡∏¥‡∏£‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏¥‡∏•‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏Å‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°
review_1_text: Wonderful place for coffee lovers. Reasonable prices, fast service. Payment in cash.
review_2_text: I picked up caramel macchiato here and it was a bit too sweet.
review_3_text: The best coffee we had in Thailand so far! Also the place has good vibes and it is just nice to sit here and chill.
review_4_text: It is a really cozy and chill cafe with plenty of choices. Cold to hot coffees, fresh teas. Really friendly owners and reasonable price
review_5_text: good drink shop!!!

name: NP COFFEE SLOW BAR
review_1_text:
Really beautiful taste coffee, lovely owner.
Thank you for the Espresso ice coffee yummy üòãüòã.
review_2_text: Closed during posted hours üëé
review_3_text: Closed during opening hours. Incorrect information!
review_4_text:
Back in Chiang Mai, I came back to this place with my girlfriend.

We ordered two drinks:
1. Iced Americano with medium roast coffee beans: The coffee was incredibly fragrant and the taste was even better than the big branded coffees.
2. Matcha Latte: The green tea aroma was amazing, the flavor was just right, and the green tea flavor was top-notch.

Price: Very affordable for the quality, around 50 baht per cup.

I highly recommend this great place to everyone.
review_5_text:
The drinks taste really good üëç I really like them üòã The owner is cheerful and friendly, and the spaghetti is delicious. The shop is very cute.

The drinks taste really good üëç I really like them üòã The owner is cheerful, friendly, and has great taste. The spaghetti is delicious. The shop is very cute.

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü ‡∏≠‡∏≠‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏¢‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏Å‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°
review_1_text: The staff have no service mind. They don't care about taking orders from customers. When they see customers approaching to order drinks, they walk away. They don't care about customers. They don't have a service mind. When customers want to order drinks, they scowl. They don't care or are willing to take orders. They don't prioritize service. When they see customers approaching, they must greet them first. They can't just walk away and ignore them when they want to order drinks. The coffee tastes a bit poor. That's enough...the only time I'll go to this branch.üëé
review_2_text:
This roadside beverage stall offers a mildly sweet Thai tea.
The young staff speaks excellent English, is friendly and helpful.
review_3_text:
This coffee shop offers incredibly cheap prices and amazing taste. A light-roast Americano for only 35 baht has a sweet, fruity aroma and a great balance‚Ä¶plus the flavor profile is complex, with a lovely, fragrant aftertaste.

I highly recommend trying it!
review_4_text: This shop has great-tasting tea and coffee. The staff are lovely, always smiling and greeting customers warmly.
review_5_text: Whenever I go to buy something, the staff is never in the store. I don't know where they've gone. Every time.

name: Beans Yard Coffee Roaster
review_1_text: I really like the coffee here! And the coffee beans! They are very good coffee roaster! I I must come here every time when I come to Chiangmai ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: Organized and clean little place. Convenient and quick. Very friendly and nice.
review_3_text: The shop is so cute and the owner is so friendly. I happened to stop by while passing by, and the coffee here is so delicious, it's definitely worth a try. ‚òïÔ∏è‚ú®Ô∏è

name: Eat In by Jinju ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏î ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ ‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ö‡∏¥‡∏ô
review_1_text:
Very nice women opposite the immigration office
The coffee is very nice
I. An recommended to come here while you wait for your visa ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
review_2_text:
I came here to renew my visa and grab a coffee. It's right across from the immigration office.

Free parking is available.

It's cheap and delicious, only 40 pesos a cup!
review_3_text: I love and miss you so much, Meng Jinju.

name: TENTEN SUKIYAKI & CAFE
review_1_text: Hidden upstairs near our hotel we found this Japanese gem. The quality of the food was excellent. Every dish was flavorful and well presented. The restaurant is a quiet and comfortable place to have a delicious meal, a few beers on tap and some sake. Service is very attentive and detail oriented. A perfect spot for our last night in Chiang Mai. We are amazed at the quality they can offer at this price point. Do not hesitate to visit if you want an alternative to Thai food.
review_2_text:
Excellent beverages. Superb coffee and service was excellent. The establishment was spotlessly clean, cool, relaxed and friendly. Another 'gem' in Chiang Mai. I will definitely return for a meal next time.
Thank you so much for adding to my memories ‚ù§Ô∏è of Chiang Mai. Thank you üòä üôè
review_3_text: We were here for NYE dinner and they didn't disappoint. Wagyu Sukiyaki was phenomenal including wagyu steak bowl and yakisoba! The service is superb too.
review_4_text:
Taste: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ
Price: ‚òÖ
Service: ‚òÖ‚òÖ

The taste is well worth the price, and it‚Äôs truly the best beef in Chiang Mai. Our bill came to nearly 4,000 baht, but due to a mistake in the calculation, we almost ended up paying more. I‚Äôm not sure if it was just an error or because we are foreigners, but it‚Äôs important to double-check the bill.
review_5_text: The place's main thing is serving a proper sukiyaki with high quality Japanese beef. If it's your first time trying sukiyaki, they will explain everything and show you how to cook it. To accompany it you can order some good sake or Japanese beer. The place accepts card payments which is rare in Thailand.

name: Alchemy Vegan
review_1_text: I had a great experience at Alchemy Vegan. I ordered the Burmese tea leaf salad and the hummus pesto on toast, and everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully prepared. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, making it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy a delicious vegetarian meal. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
Was searching for a good veg restaurant at chaing mai and finally found this out.  had Buddha bowl bursting with fresh, vibrant flavors ü•ó,  then comes the Rich, nutty sesame milk that‚Äôs smooth and comforting üòã
my fav Fried rice perfectly seasoned, churros crisp and indulgent üçöüç©Cozy ambience with limited space, but staff are super helpful and friendly ‚òï‚ú®üòä but Green Thai noodles were a bit too spicy for our taste üå∂Ô∏è
review_3_text: I ordered in churros from this place, which were really good! It came with two dips - Chocolate and Caramel. Both really good but the caramel was insanely good. I ordered the cinnamon sugar churros - I don't don't think they are always available but if you do get a chance, order it! Also, they gave me 6pcs instead of 4üòÑwhich were huge and good enough to share.
review_4_text:
Ordered via Grab, 2 sandwiches, food arrived still hot , fresh and all was delicious. Will definitely explore their menu more.
Updated 7/2025: visiting the restaurant, staff was very kind and helpful, speak soft, order 3 dishes, made fresh quickly. Very good taste. The couscous salad was amazing and unfortunately so rare to find.
The toilets are extremely clean !!! And it looks like the place is well managed.
review_5_text: I‚Äôve eaten at Alchemy Vegan a few times now, and it‚Äôs one of my favorite vegan restaurants in town. Every visit I get the Thai milk tea with oat milk ‚Äî it‚Äôs creamy and delicious! The green salad with avocado and lime dressing is fresh and pairs perfectly with the sourdough. I also love the cheesy olive toast ‚Äî the vegan cheese is rich and satisfying. And don‚Äôt skip the chocolate cake! It‚Äôs decadent, definitely big enough to share. The space is calm, the staff are kind, and it‚Äôs always a great spot to relax and enjoy a good meal.

name: Artisan Caf√©
review_1_text: I had the best matcha latte with oat milk here since I came to Chiang Mai. I ordered one hot matcha to drink in their charming and comfortable seating and took an iced matcha to go in my travel mug. Both were equally delicious. My partner ordered a house made cold brew coffee. He said it was delicious too and came with a single, huge round ice cube in a low ball cocktail glass. Nice touch. This place is classy and quirky with nice tea cups, glasses, couches, and other interesting furniture.
review_2_text: I had iced coffee and it was very good.  However, I came here mostly for the beautiful decor and comfy chairs.  It‚Äôs a good place to sit and work for a while.
review_3_text: Another good coffee shop to try in Chiang Mai. Their coffee is good and made very well. They have good desserts, a couple of different cookies and some croissants. We chose one of each. The one near old town has a bit more seating than the one near Nimman, which is why we chose this location. This coffee shop has a bit more choices than some of the other coffee shops we have rated. This is probably our second favorite shop in Chiang Mai. Highly recommended.
review_4_text: My husband and I came here many times during our stay in CM. This place is perfect for breakfast. Great coffee, great Bagel, great environment and the owner and staff are all very friendly. If we come back to CM will definitely visit again üôè
review_5_text: Reduced rating for the coffee as very small cup for 75 baht. It's tasty but nothing great. Very nice cafe setting with a couple of people working online.

name: THREE CHIANG MAI
review_1_text:
Great coffee place.
Found this cafe accidentally by passing near it.
Tasty coffee, professional serving, calm music, stylish interior.
Highly recommend! ‚ú®
review_2_text:
If you‚Äôre in the mood for a good cup of coffee, this place is worth checking out. It‚Äôs a bit pricey for Chiang Mai, but totally fair for the quality. Their house blend already hit the spot for me.

Good vibe. Good-taste cafe.
review_3_text: After three weeks of trying well-reviewed coffee shops, this is the first place I'd recommend if someone asked me where to go for good, interesting coffee. Both the flat white and the pour over were excellent, and really interesting beans too. Tasting notes appeared really clearly in the cup
review_4_text:
Great little spot. They are very friendly and
opening at 8:33. They only accept cash and transfer
review_5_text:
Date of Visit: August 24th

I visited because I heard this place has won many awards. The coffee had a bit of acidity, but the taste was not bad. It's cool and quiet, making it a good spot to get some work done. Since there's a Saturday market nearby, it would be nice to take a break here before heading to the market.

name: Intend coffee cnx
review_1_text:
Lovely little coffee shop on the south of the old city! The owners are welcoming and friendly and felt so relaxed at an ease. The coffee tasted divine! I chose the Chiang mai bean (dark roast) but they also have a medium roast too from Columbia but yet to try that.

Ive been 3 days on a row! When you find good coffee on your doorstep, it‚Äôs a no brainer! ‚òïÔ∏èüëåüèª
review_2_text:
great place runs by a great people with a lot of passion, been super nice.
i bought some whiskey coffee beans and they gave me other samples so i can try more things. the guy really explained me how everything works and gave me some tips.
definitely coming back.
review_3_text:
LOVE this cafe! Coffee is incredibly delicious and smooth. Although my hotel has included coffee, I skip it to go here!

The owner is very kind and knowledgeable about his coffee. I asked about his drawing and he gave me a little coffee lesson! He also roasts the coffee beans in-house.
review_4_text: The coffee here is so delicious and flavourful - the best I‚Äôve had in CM so far! I had the oat milk latte with medium roast. The owners are really friendly too. I would definitely come back ‚ò∫Ô∏è.
review_5_text: The americano dark roast is one of the best I've drank. Prefer it to be non acidic and not so bitter. Perfect! Nice ambience and owner!

name: MEVA Icecream & Smoothie
review_1_text: My friend enjoyed her taro ice cream and I enjoyed my coconut ice cream and we both love the passion fruit sorbet in this sweet little ice cream shop - lovely lady and old gentlemen serving great selection of cold treats, a variety of complementary toppings, water and tissue pepper are provided too
review_2_text: Well worth the visit. We tried the coconut milk ice cream and loved it! The free topping station is such a lovely little detail to customise the ice cream too. There are chairs to sit and enjoy inside and outside the shop
review_3_text: Really lovely wee icecream shop. Meva makes all the icecream her self. There are many very yummy vegan options. Everything is very reasonably priced. Definitely a must visit for sweet treats in Chiang Mai
review_4_text: Amazing place! They opened a few minutes earlier for us, the portions are big and the ice cream is delicious! This place also has free topping bar with a huge variety of add-ons, so that's cool as well!!
review_5_text: A bit disappointing considering the good review. Free topping is great if you like lots of extras with your ice cream. Coconut ice cream was decent, vanilla choc chip was almost identical to cheap stuff you can get in the supermarket

name: BRB Cafe
review_1_text: Stopped in for brunch, what a pleasant discovery. Both orders were generous, fresh, great value and this venue is a color party for the eyes. Loved finding yet another treasure in Chiang Mai for future visits. üëç‚ù§Ô∏èüôè
review_2_text: The staff and food were very good. I ordered the pan eggs and a single waffle. The atmosphere of the cafe was great too since it was connected with a nice hotel.
review_3_text: We've been sitting here waiting for our smoothies for over 20 minutes. There's an unpleasant smell coming from the kitchen in the dining room.
review_4_text: Coffee was terrible, tasted like instant or robusta. The English breakfast was an ok facsimile. But german sausage had cheese in it like the awful US brats. Beans were the real deal. 'salad' with nothing on it (not even a lemon). Bacon was ok. But ham was just the standard thin 'wet' processed meat but fried.
review_5_text: How is this place not packed with customers? Perfect ambience, excellent location. Oh, did I mention the poached eggs on avocado toast was truly exquisite!!!

name: Inthanin Coffee
review_1_text: So I stopped in here to wait for a friend ordered an Americano. I was expecting bitter harsh taste. Instead I got a smooth almost cold brew like cup. Really great surprise. They have WiFi couches and seats. I didn't see any outlets though. Prices range from 35  to 80. Smoothie 65 and have prepackaged pastries and what not.
review_2_text: Lovely place, great staff and great coffee.
review_3_text: Good coffee good price but no free water !!!
review_4_text: Again something that said open but unable to make coffee.
review_5_text:
Intanin, a coffee shop located in a Bangchak gas station,
at a branch in Chiang Mai near the airport.
The shop is large and spacious, with chairs, a bar, and tables. It can accommodate about 15 people inside and another 4 people outside in a garden setting.
I was visiting Chiang Mai today, so I stopped by this cafe to meet up with my team. They have everything.
I ordered a hot Americano for 40 baht (members get a discount, so it's 35 baht).
I also ordered a croissant for 40 baht. It was incredibly soft and smooth, and delicious.
The shop is open from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM.
If you're passing through, stop by and enjoy a meal. The staff are friendly and helpful. They also sell souvenirs.

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡πÅ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡πå‡∏ó‡∏¥‡∏û‡πÄ‡∏ô‡∏ï‡∏£ & ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏î
review_1_text: Good service, polite staff, clean wash, fast service, and affordable price. I'll definitely come back for another wash. Highly recommended.
review_2_text: I always come here to wash my car whenever I have something to do nearby. It's very clean and the service is great.
review_3_text: The price is cheap, the washing is clean, and the service is very satisfactory.
review_4_text: The car wash is very clean.

name: ROSE SIAM
review_1_text: Nice relaxing cafe with a selection of vegetarian meals and coffee at the temple. I had pineapple fried rice with pumpkin chips, but they also have a number of vegetarian combo sets.
review_2_text: Cute caf√© to get respite from the sun. I had the siew mai, pineapple fried rice and a chai tea. 138 Baht. Satisfied my lunch appetite.
review_3_text: Nice cafe like a hidden gem near the temple. Cozy atmosphere and inexpensive desserts.
review_4_text: During my time in Chiang Mai I had about five different Americano-Orange drinks in five different coffee shops. Americano-Orange is my favourite drink and here I liked it the most. The quality was always similarly good in all five coffee shops but here I had the special vibe of being close to the Silver Temple, also, the cup was a little larger than in the other places, and it was a little lower price than elsewhere.
review_5_text: Very nice coffee.

name: Minimal coffee ‡πÅ‡∏¢‡∏Å‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ö‡∏¥‡∏ô
review_1_text: This is my 2nd visit to a Minimal coffee shop and is now my ‚Äògo to‚Äô place in Chiang Mai for a hot dark roast cappuccino!! .  Nice size of cup, great price, open early, clean, modern, AC, and lovely attentive staff. Well done in a saturated market,
review_2_text: Very good coffee, different roasts available, reasonable prices, enjoy
review_3_text:
The shop is clean, the air conditioning is cool, and the coffee is delicious.
Parking is difficult, so you'll have to find street parking. The coffee is standard for a minimalist shop, and prices start at just 45-50 baht. If you're looking for coffee, stop by and enjoy a cup. You can collect points and get a cup of coffee from this shop. It's great!
review_4_text: The shop is small and cute, with cool air conditioning and plenty of seating. The drinks are delicious. The staff are cheerful, agile, and provide excellent service.
review_5_text: The staff at the shop are all very friendly and provide excellent service. The coffee tastes great, absolutely delicious! You have to try it!

name: NADA COFFEE "‡∏ì‡∏î‡∏≤ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà"
review_1_text: The best coffee I've had in Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: Very delicious Hot Cappuccino üòã
review_3_text: Last year I discovered "NADA COFFEE" and this year we've seen Dada again. She's a wonderful person, very kind, and this year the location is perfect and peaceful. There are plenty of places to eat and shops nearby!
review_4_text: The tea is delicious. Come and try it!
review_5_text: Fresh coffee, cheap and delicious, I recommend it.

name: kohicha.cnx - coffee x matcha
review_1_text:
I almost didn‚Äôt post this review since I don‚Äôt want to blow up this spot, but after going here multiple times within the two weeks we were in Chiang Mai, I felt like it was my duty to share how magical this place is.

As someone who drinks matcha everyday at home I was craving  quality matcha spot and kohicha is quite literally the best matcha experience I‚Äôve had. Their menu has a wide variety of strains with tasting notes listed as well as a guide to which ones make for good lattes and which are best drank just with water. Oat milk swap is free and there are other alt milk options!

All the staff is really knowledgeable and have great recommendations.

The wifi is great for working and there are a few larger tables and outlets. It does get busy so these spots are not always guaranteed. It‚Äôs also a dog friendly location which has been a welcome distraction in my experience.

I‚Äôd also highly recommend the daifuku strawberry mochi. I get it every time! The chocolate cake is also phenomenal. The Nutty Yama has been my favorite so far out of the ~10 I‚Äôve tried but it‚Äôs also a limited edition option.

Bring cash as card is not accepted.
review_2_text:
A newly opened spot that‚Äôs likely to become very popular soon.

The drinks are excellent, the staff is friendly, and the desserts are really good. The air conditioning is extremely cold, so it‚Äôs best to bring something warm to wear. The place looks great inside, and the prices are reasonable.
review_3_text: A hidden minimalist gem in the heart of Chiang Mai. KOHICHA offers such a peaceful and calm atmosphere‚Äîit‚Äôs the perfect place to slow down. Every drink is crafted with so much care and the flavors are truly exceptional. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a quiet, high-quality coffee/tea break! ‚ú®üçµ
review_4_text: excellence. huge thoughtfully selected menu of ceremonial grade matcha with free oat milk option. absolutely loved it, the staff were so nice and welcoming. definitely recommend!
review_5_text: Premium matcha and great coffee. Nice atmosphere - close to the city but quiet and relaxing. Definitely worth a visit in Chiang Mai.

name: SOL.CAFE
review_1_text: Great place! They have some delicious coffee and many varieties. The area is quite nice and give great camping vibes
review_2_text:
Delicious coffee at great prices :-)
I only wish I had discovered this place earlier during my stay in Chiang Mai. Highly recommended :-)
review_3_text:
This caf√© has been my spot since the first day I arrived in Chiang Mai. The coffee is really good, and the Jazminty Milk was one of my favorites. It‚Äôs a very quiet place, usually with few people around, perfect for sitting down, writing for a while, or just relaxing.

The two girls who run the caf√© ‚ÄîI think they are sisters‚Äî are very kind and always pleasant with customers. It really feels good to come here.

For me, it has become a special place. Highly recommended.
review_4_text: A cozy and nice little coffee shop ‚Äì warm atmosphere, friendly staff, and a great place to relax with a cup of coffee. Perfect spot to spend a slow afternoon or catch up with friends.
review_5_text:
Really cool coffee shop with brilliant service, lovely surroundings and ambiance. Come enjoy the sun and a great coffee at Sol.Cafe! üåû

Highly recommended!

name: Bambino Jeweler cafe
review_1_text: Bam is a great jeweler and shop owner. This is primarily a jewelry store, but there is a small cafe inside as well serving a variety of drinks. I bought some blue-green sapphire earrings set in sterling silver for approximately $48 USD here. Beautiful, quality earrings. Bam was super helpful and friendly! If you‚Äôre looking for earrings, this is a good shop to try out!
review_2_text: Small cafe but I used the jewelry services The lady can do everything for you from simple repairs to creating a piece of jewelry She also sells magnificent creations
review_3_text: very nice little coffee place combined with a jewellery shop, nothing too special, but great for good to-go morning coffee :)
review_4_text: An absolute gem!! Bam has a truly unique and beautiful collection of handmade jewelry. She also makes everything custom-made to order. Gold, silver, and gemstones. I'll definitely be back!
review_5_text: Excellent service for new jewelry creations and alterations.

name: Coffee Alley
review_1_text: I went to give alms here on Saturday morning. The atmosphere was very good. It was full of Lanna atmosphere.

name: LUNGO COFFEE BAR
review_1_text: The staff here are amazing! Such welcoming space, full of smiles and laughs. I got an iced cappuccino and had lovely conversations and laughs with the staff while I waited - I will definitely be back !
review_2_text: Good coffee good vibe
review_3_text: Delicious coffee americano-lynche.
review_4_text:
üíØThis is a regular spotüíØ
‚úÖGreat tasting coffee
‚úÖAffordable prices
‚úÖFriendly staff
‚úÖGreat drinks
review_5_text: I stopped by by chance after seeing the Google reviews, and the coffee is delicious.

name: Meo Cafe‚Äô
review_1_text: Cute little cafe! Great coffee, great service.
review_2_text: I really liked this place.  It was right around the corner from where we were staying.  Nice quiet atmosphere off the main road.

name: Mellow Cat Coffee (Coffee Shop. Not a cat cafe and not a hostel.)
review_1_text: Not the best I've tried but still good

name: farmer's house Coffee
review_1_text: This is a very nice spot to just have a drink and enjoy the view. I have also taken the river cruise they provide and it a very good way to have a two hour relaxing time. The boat stops for around half an hour at a nice cafe where they provide ice cream and drinks. Definitely try this place out when in Chaing Mai
review_2_text:
Lovely Simple coffee shop on a boat.

I love the narrow bar facing river.
Coffee Is served in cute fashion on decorated steel plate with Tiny shoot of tea on a side.

Boat also servers as station for small boat tours up the river

Access is via temple .
Everything super charming
review_3_text: Lovely, quiet place to have a morning coffee. There is plenty of space to sit on the boats and enjoy the peacefulness of the area. It is shaded and cool but with spots that get warm morning sun, too.
review_4_text: Came here for coffee with amazing river view. Peaceful and soothing to the heart. You have to walk through the temple to get to this coffee.
review_5_text: Coffee shop has some nice busget conscious meals..Khao Soi example 59baht... Coffee is OK... the place is part of the Wat Chai Mongkol complex. The cafe is absolutely on the river front... the whole complex is interesting.

name: Chanom Arom D (‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏°‡∏ì‡πå‡∏î‡∏µ)
review_1_text: very good

name: Notarista1720
review_1_text: Nice hidden cafe to relax, very good coffee and latte, homemade ice cream, friendly owner.
review_2_text:
Nice cosy place, home made ice creams and coffee, with good prices!
Nice owner!
review_3_text: Lawyer+Baristaüëçüëçüëç
review_4_text: The coffee tastes great, fragrant and well-balanced. I recommend the coffee beans from Bo Kluea, Nan province. The shop is located in a small alley next to Ouan Ocha Chicken Rice, Branch 2.

name: Dreamtime Cafe
review_1_text: For the second time. The banana cake is delicious, the coffee is average. The shop is pretty, but there are few chairs, so you might not be allowed to sit inside. There is some seating outside, though. üòä
review_2_text: Beat vibe fr fr
review_3_text: Coffee, pastries, and a great atmosphere. A perfect place to relax and chill out.
review_4_text: I really like the moist chocolate cake; it's delicious. The atmosphere is nice, and there's convenient parking.
review_5_text:
This cafe has a wooden style interior with cool air conditioning, while the outdoor area overlooks the Ping River ‚Äì a great vibe both inside and out.

The coffee is delicious, with both dark and medium roasts available.

There's also a very large parking area, accommodating many cars.

name: TEDS Coffee & Eatery
review_1_text:
TEDS is a pet-friendly caf√© with a calm, quiet ambience‚ÄîI fell for it as soon as I walked in. It‚Äôs peaceful yet welcoming and lots of people work here with their pets. No pet smell at all‚Äîthere are multiple air purifiers throughout the shop.

There‚Äôs a nice selection of coffee beans; my iced latte (medium roast) was aromatic and smooth. The carrot cake wasn‚Äôt too sweet, which I loved.

They also have a meeting room (just ask the staff), plus plenty of seating: work desks, a second-floor counter bar, cozy couches, a four-seat corner and outdoor garden tables.
review_2_text:
Coffee, Cuteness & Chill Vibes

My first time here. A cozy pet-friendly caf√© just a 10-minute walk from Haan-Tueng Chiangmai, the Michelin-recommended spot. Run by two adorable ‚Äúowners‚Äù ‚Äî Teddy & friend üêæ üòÜ‚Äî usually napping like caf√© mascots.

Coffee‚Äôs nice and reasonably priced, with a few homey bakes. Gets busy with teens and locals on holidays, so if prefer to a private and peaceful vibe - better avoid peak times.
review_3_text: Visited during the day and really cool place with dogs wandering around (the small one is cute . )Great work vibe with lots of powerpoints and fair prices. It does get busy, though, and seating feels limited. The outdoor space could be improved honestly it‚Äôs underused and lacks atmosphere. Still worth visiting.
review_4_text: A very cool Bistro with Workspace. Great Coffee and Cakes, friendly Staff and a great atmosphere. The 2 Dogs are also lovely.
review_5_text: It is cozy and quiet coffee shop with a calm, relaxing atmosphere. The two dogs are super friendly and adorable. They really make the place special. You can see they are even on the logo. The toilets are clean, and it‚Äôs a lovely spot to work or study inside, or to hang out with friends outdoors.

name: Beanbag coffee
review_1_text:
‚òï The Ultimate Cozy Work Cafe in Chiang Mai! ü•ê

This spot is absolutely perfect for a working day. They completely tick all the boxes: convenient parking and a comfortable working area with great vibes.

Their many seating selection makes it incredibly comfortable while enjoying their excellent drinks and fresh bakeries.

Beyond the great space, the staff truly stands out. Their friendliness is the first thing you notice and instantly makes the place feel welcoming.

Considering the high quality and comfortable vibe, the prices are definitely affordable and offer great value. If you need a cozy and wallet-friendly place to chill or work with your laptop in Chiang Mai, you can't miss this one! üëç
review_2_text: A place worth visiting. The coffee is delicious and the people are very friendly. The gravel road at the entrance is a bit slippery, so other people coming here must be very careful. I fell down by accident lol But the owner of the store is very good and provided me with basic medical care. I am very grateful. Thai people are really nice. I love Thailand!
review_3_text:
Consumer Advice.

The atmosphere, the staff and the drinks are good. I wanted to update my review as I feel I had been a bit too harsh in my previous review.

While the ice is a bit too much, I would recommend people to ask about the ice levels of their drinks first before ordering as it can be quite a lot. Really other than this there is nothing wrong with this cafe. Simply an issue of ice level.

This review is for others to consider before ordering their drinks.
review_4_text: A lovely place with great coffee and friendly staff. Huge carpark is a plus as well
review_5_text: There are three sofa seats for more than three people in the store, while the others are double seats. The environment is very good, with many green plants. The waitress is also very friendly, but when we went yesterday, the coffee machine broke down and we didn't drink freshly ground coffee. It's a pity that the bread is very soft and delicious

name: CRATE
review_1_text:
Dayum. What a cute find. Their menu is also great and the staff is super hospitable. The atmosphere is killer. You do not notice that you‚Äôre on the side of the road.

Come come ü§ó‚ú®

Edit: this hot cacao is one of the best I‚Äôve had in Chiang mai ü•∞
review_2_text: The place has a really nice atmosphere with a cozy wooden and green vibe. The chocolate blended drink was really good. I had the Larn Kua as my main dish ‚Äî it didn‚Äôt taste super traditional, but it was still delicious. If I get the chance, I‚Äôd definitely come back here!
review_3_text: Really nice place with different areas. Food is always amazing and good value. Staff are nice . Only note is the back patio area could do with some renovations eg if they added another dining area there or fixed it up abit.
review_4_text: What a great Restaurant and Coffee Shop. Beautiful Yard, great design, super Food and amazing Coffee. Friendly Staff
review_5_text: Love this place!!! So chill here a big garden, cold inside with a good menu with great breakfast/ coffee. This is such a rare combo for these kind of prices. Normally a place has good coffee but not good food, or good food, not good coffee. Crate has good both, friendly staff, and beautiful garden. Happy to just chill, or work here as wifi is plenty fast. Keep up the good work team!

name: Pangfan Coffee
review_1_text: Christmas Vibe Cafe. Really enjoyed the croissants as well as the dirty coffee I had. In fact I think the croissants are some of the best I've had in Chiang Mai. Extremely fresh and they do toast them which is really good. Owner is very nice as well I've spoken to him a few times and his English is very good. They don't have much of a restaurant menu so mostly what you can order is what you see in the front display.
review_2_text:
One of the best chilling cafe around here. There're many things that I'm fond of..

- Clean air : The smog in here is almost free (6-10) while outside is around 200. The temperature is just nice as well.
- Friendly with customers : They provided free pillows and blankets which are cleaned really well. You're free to nap, leaning, chating or whatever.
- Spacious, many type of tables, chairs, and sofa

The price is average. There's some discount on the cakes sometimes.

I'd suggest you give it a go if you want to chill around in the smoke-free cafe.

Updated : provided free printing
review_3_text:
Great coffee spot with plenty of parking and ample space for anyone who needs to do work. Lots of comfortable chairs, including the big plush loveseats you see in tv shows.

Really delicious north Thailand coffee on offer here, very good to start the day! Highly recommend!
review_4_text: A cool Coffee Shop with nice atmosphere. Friendly Staff, Carpark in the front of the door
review_5_text: Very good coffee shop both for working or just hanging out, it has an incredibly comfy seating area with many different options: couches, comfy chairs, regular chairs, bar chairs etc. Part of the coffee shop is also colder so depending on preference you can choose what temperature you like. Very relaxing and cozy jazz music, super friendly staff. Tons of places to charge devices. Also oat milk only costs 15baht extra so cheaper than most other places ‚ò∫Ô∏èfor my needs I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs one of the best coffee shops in Chiang mai

name: Kindred Studio
review_1_text: Great space with magical art. There‚Äôs poetry reading here every month. Cozy, friendly warm people. Events on all year round. I would come here each time I visit Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: A chill, comfortable space in the middle of a food-centered marketplace. Refreshments are mostly homemade. It really comes into its own as a literary and small performance space hosting readings, open mic and performance
review_3_text: Went to the open mic, the talent and variety was excellent. Staff were lovely and friendly. I'll definitely be back üß°üôèüèª
review_4_text: I went with some friends to an art and bass night. Its a cozy space with everything we needed. Everyone was friendly and it had a nice atmosphere.
review_5_text: I absolutely adore this space! üíõ Kindred is a true sanctuary for artists and musicians‚Äîa wellspring of warmth, creativity, and endless inspiration. The atmosphere is not just welcoming but deeply nourishing, making it a place where creativity thrives and connections flourish. Thank you for cultivating such a wholesome, magical haven for the arts!

name: Hippo & Pineapple
review_1_text: The best hot coffee in town (I would say in Thailand) and delicious food (you should try their homemade brookie, it‚Äôs really tasty). We were there twice. There is a laundromat nearby, so you can do your laundry and have breakfast at the same time. The perfect place.
review_2_text: Wonderful brunch spot with great ambiance, fantastic coffee, and clean, delicious food. Homemade English muffins and bagels, a vinyl record player, and full English breakfast here!
review_3_text: Today we had Breakfast in this cool Bistro with a bit nostalgy and a warm welcome from the black house cat. Our Sets where delicious, same as our Hot Latte and Hot Cappuccino.
review_4_text: Came here for sweet treat o‚Äôclock. Time was telling cause these desserts were tasty. The carrot cake was our favorite. It was moist with the perfect amount of buttercream frosting. Our next favorite was the brookie. Get the milk ready cause it‚Äôs rich. Our third favorite was the scone. While it was super good tasting, it was very crumbly and I would dare say a little bit dry. The jam tasted awesome BUT the strawberry chunks were too big and practically the only part of jam so it just needs a little more!
review_5_text: This is an exceptionally good confectionary and cafe! The pastries and cakes are very generously sized (basically like anything you‚Äôd find in the U.S.) and priced for Thailand - any other cafe would be selling their offerings for twice the price and certainly wouldn‚Äôt taste half as good. The WiFi‚Äôs good and they‚Äôve got comfortable seats to relax in, though you can tell some of the furniture is past its prime. The cafe itself is nice and spacious. Good place to do some work if you don‚Äôt mind the somewhat busy intersection it bumps up against!

name: Mong Mori Boutique Hotel ‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏£‡∏°‡∏°‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏°‡∏£‡∏¥
review_1_text:
Beautiful place with warm people.
Everything was clean, peaceful, and perfectly located.
Would love to come back again!
review_2_text: Hidden Gem! Nearby Wat-Umong and Close to the Night Food Market and Nimman. The place is really comfy and good vibes!
review_3_text: The room was nice. People are super nice.
review_4_text:
Very cool place
Clean apartment
I like this place ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: Nice & friendly hotel üòä

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Great coffee Hot Decent size cup Reasonable price
review_2_text: Love there coffee and cappuccino.
review_3_text: Good standard coffee
review_4_text: ok
review_5_text: Ok

name: Trailer coffee khunklong
review_1_text: A little bit of jungle and a great cup of coffee just off Canal Road!
review_2_text: This cafe' is besides of the road. Coffee is good. The cafe is decorated by old wooden doors or school desk and chair. Some area of floor has big hole that your foot may fall into.
review_3_text: One of the best options for coffee around the area. The only place where I don‚Äôt add any sugar to my cappuccino. I love this place!
review_4_text: Honestly it's one of The Best coffee in chiangmai. Quality of coffee is amazing, it's so creamy and smooth! Thank you alot! Visiting this place for around 2 years, and every time having great experience!
review_5_text: Good test with Amemericano and traditional noodles

name: M&M Coffee Club
review_1_text: Relaxing black themed indoor air conditioned cafe , perfect place to get away from the heat over some coffee . Ordered cappuccino , big volume and  taste was great , price was considered cheap for this big cup ! Shop uses single origin Thai local arabica medium roast beans. I like it ! Taste much better than some overrated cafes out there . Definitely a place for coffee lovers . üëçüèª
review_2_text: Quietly tucked back from the busy road, this coffee shop is a great spot to relax in. The staff are so friendly and went above and beyond to help me and provided excellent drinks. Thank you!
review_3_text:
Organic coffee bean, rich and smooth taste.
Competitive price with Air con and wifi
review_4_text: A newly opened cafe. Served with high quality coffee beans, tried their mocha love the nutty taste of the coffee. The customer services are really good, you‚Äôll be served with a friendly greeting and smile and the prices are affordable. Definitely will be back again!
review_5_text: Good coffee with very cute prices

name: TODA coffee & co. | CNX
review_1_text: Nice matcha and lovely atmosphere and if you are looking for a place to relax, please visit this place!
review_2_text: one of the most beautiful coffee shops that is secluded and quiet! so nice
review_3_text: Cool working space in the midst of nature. Big glasshouse lead to a forest is stunning. Coffee also beyond expectations
review_4_text: Only place open on a Monday! Great service
review_5_text: Love this space

name: Mong Mori Slow Bar Cafe
review_1_text: Excellent coffee, pleasant atmosphere, awesome decoration ! As others wrote, good for working or just relax. We fully enjoyed !!
review_2_text:
Lovely hidden speciality coffee shop with a friendly barista who has expertise with brewing coffee and recommending the right coffee beans
Got a free filter drip :)
review_3_text: Cute small cozy place, good to talk or work here.
review_4_text: Cool little hidden gem in Chiang Mai. If you‚Äôre even remotely a coffee or matcha person come check it out. Staff was great, great vibes, great coffee. Shout out to Caleb for an awesome service!
review_5_text: Great coffee and atmosphere!

name: COCOA CHA
review_1_text: Relaxed place in a very calm area. Super friendly and attentive owner. The drinks are good and inexpensive. Drop by if you want to make a short stop to refuel your energy :)
review_2_text:
cute small cafe at the side of the road.
Very kind owner and nice drinks!

Would visit again :)
review_3_text:
The food is delicious, and the owner is very kind and friendly.
The price is also reasonable. I will definitely come again. üòä

name: UniqueCafe'byMook&Mom
review_1_text:
Cafe called Unique Cafe but how unique?  Not big, I would say rather small however rather cozy.  Also they have outside seating.  No pastries available.

Nice place to take a rest if u r nearby.

name: VTHORY
review_1_text:
Make a stop and stay
At VTHORY CAFE

name: ‡∏ú‡∏•‡πÑ‡∏°‡πâ‡∏™‡∏°‡∏π‡∏ó‡∏ï‡∏µ‡πâ‡πÅ‡∏ñ‡∏ß‡∏î‡∏±‡∏á
review_1_text: My local tea shop and juice bar.
review_2_text: Great food !
review_3_text:
A large cup of Thai milk was only 20 yuan, and they said it wasn't too sweet. It was delicious! A great deal.
The restaurant is also very cheap, but the spicy food is quite spicy. I recommend the pork fried rice; it's fragrant and delicious.
review_4_text: The menu is in Chinese, and locals eat there too; it's very cheap.
review_5_text: Good value, and there are cooked food stalls sharing the storefront behind it.

name: ‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ä‡∏±‡∏Å ‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏∏‡πÇ‡∏°‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡πå
review_1_text:
A cheap and delicious juice stand ü•§
You can get a less sweet Thai tea for just 30b!
A must-try if you're visiting Wat Umong!

name: Coff-Cac : ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡πÅ‡∏Ñ‡∏ï
review_1_text:
The coffee tastes great and is very aromatic, so much so that I had to go back for more. Plus, it's not too expensive, making it great value for money.

The shop might not be ideal for sitting and enjoying your coffee, but if you love delicious coffee, you have to come!!!

I only recommend the coffee. I also ordered Milo, but it wasn't good. It was very bland and lacked flavor and aroma. I think they should add more Milo powder to make it stronger.
review_2_text: This coffee shop, which includes the owner's home, is run by adorable twin sisters üë∂. The owner speaks English and I learned that most Thais prefer dark roast coffee beans, while the younger generation is starting to embrace light roasts. The beans in the shop are carefully selected by the owner and are very delicious!
review_3_text: The coffee is good. It's located on the main road and has parking.

name: Family Home 2 Chiang Mai
review_1_text: ‚Äè stayed at this hostel for three nights and had a fantastic experience. The beds were very comfortable, which ensured a good night's sleep. The best part was the atmosphere; it was incredibly welcoming and social, making it easy to meet and connect with other travelers. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a great hostel experience.
review_2_text:
I stayed in the dorm and had a really good experience. The place has a warm, home-like atmosphere that makes you feel comfortable right away.

The dorm was clean and well maintained, with a relaxed vibe that made it easy to rest and meet other travelers. The staff were very kind and helpful, always happy to assist and share local tips.
review_3_text: Love how social this hostel is. Even when you don't stay with them, you can book their daily sticky waterfall tours! I'll definitely visit this place when I'm back in Chiang mai. The staff are so friendly and helpful which really makes you feel a part of their family too.
review_4_text: My first stay at a hostel and was absolutely blown away with an unforgettable experience. The entire staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, offering breakfast, laundry and drinks for generous prices, assisting in planning excursions, and flexible for check in/out times. Socially, there were always things to do and people to talk with, the amenities were always clean, the rooms were quiet and could fall asleep easily. I will never forget my experience here and cannot recommend enough
review_5_text: Loved this place. Incredibly social hostel without any of the ‚Äúfree shots at the bar‚Äù forced fun type stuff. There‚Äôs just a really nice social area where everyone chills and makes friends. They also have daytime and nighttime activities organised every day with loads of people going on them. Staff really lovely too

name: GORD CHIANGMAI HOTEL
review_1_text:
We walked through this little local street and saw GORD, a very charming hotel with character, like a hidden oasis in a very hot day.  So we stopped for lunch. Love the oasis atmosphere, so relaxing. Staff was well trained, so welcoming and friendly. We order three dishes: Ginger chicken with rice was very well crafted, the juicy and tender chicken meat and homemade ginger sauce was so savoury favor; Vermicelli minced pork kra-pao was a must if you look for the local spice; And not to miss tasty and crispy outside and tender on the inside chicken wings.
We will definitely try the hotel next time. üëç‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: Absolutely loved my stay here at this hotel. The service was amazing. One morning I had an early pick up for a tour they, made me a sandwich to go. So unexpected and so sweet. They were very helpful with locations and recommending various activities. Would stay here again. Central location as well, so lots of options with food, Sunday market etc.
review_3_text: Outstanding...great location (get bottom floor room if you can).  Its peaceful, its clean, very friendly and a great location....really love this town, Gord hotel is very close to everything you need, will def be back, ty to the staff, especially the nice guy who is from the Cambodia border area
review_4_text: Great hotel for the price. The owners/front desk employees are so helpful and kind. Ideally located near night markets, temples and nightlife activities, but still very quiet at night. Clean, spacious rooms with basic amenities. Didn't get the opportunity to eat breakfast or at the onsite restaurant, but the outside areas are nice and relaxing.
review_5_text: It is the second time we come, the first to eat and we loved it and we have had breakfast again. Everything is very good, they are very fast and friendly when attending to you and the place is beautiful. The price are very good

name: GAAD Coffee/Bar & Conversation
review_1_text:
Flat White 75‡∏ø (2026)

Has English menu, also accepts card.

Friendly staff. The cute girl who took my order also made my coffee, she is very careful when pouring foam milk into the cup.

There are at least 2 floors up, I went to the second floor, with a charging port for my phone and facing outside, so is a nice place to sit.

It is nice environment, some nice music, and quiet. And nice coffee.
