I think is good to have some chat with friends, or quietly enjoying the day, reading a book, or listening to music, or just watching the outside busy street.

Nice place for me.
review_2_text:
One of the best caf√©s I‚Äôve visited in Chiang Mai. I could feel that beloved sour-tangy flavour in the Americano ‚Äî exactly how I like my coffee. The flat white was also exceptional.

The ambience is simple, elegant, and really calming. Coffee that truly hits the spot and makes you want to come back again.

A perfect place to hang around, relax, and enjoy great coffee in Chiang Mai. Highly recommended!
review_3_text: Such a good coffee and very nicely place They use north Thai coffee beans ,The shop is near Chiang Mai Gate Market. Makes you see the lifestyle of local people. Sourdough tuna pesto sandwich is delicious.
review_4_text: Good coffee, staff are friendly, working space with a good vibes but I don‚Äôt see any food menu and bakery
review_5_text:
Good place for a quick refresher. Alcohol and coffee in one place. Nice ambients. Nice renovation. Look at those wiring
..above you

name: Breakfast & brunch for healthy chamalay caf√© bistro @Chiang Mai
review_1_text: They open at 8 AM. In Chiang Mai, being able to enjoy such a hearty breakfast so early in the morning is a real treat. The food and drinks were delicious, giving me the energy for the day. Although the prices aren't exactly cheap, the ingredients are incredibly high-quality, and I highly recommend this restaurant.
review_2_text:
Nice place, cool, good atmosphere
Good mix of western style food & drinks but no full English breakfast. No thai food either. Good presentation, but bland.  Sourdough spinach cheese & mushroom very bland without salt. Advocado, spinch & egg toast also bland without salt.
Special 'jaguar' coffee mediocre even with two shots. Shakes and smoothies are on the small side.  Tables & benches are smallish. Overall style over substance. Quite pricy too.  Will not return.
review_3_text: So many avocado options in the menu that i just want to try them all. lol The place is quiet, calming, and no wonder it has great reviews! Their Matcha Latte tastes good too! Avooolicious. ü•ëüíØü´∂üèª
review_4_text: Lovely, quaint little breakfast spot across from the art centre and close to the food market. Choco bowl with soy protein was my favourite, lots of vegan/vego options along with usual eggs etc. Owner/cook is so friendly, always happy and welcomes you with a smile. Coffee is good, closed on Wednesdays.
review_5_text: It‚Äôs nothing like you see in the pictures ;) so don‚Äôt expect something extraordinary. I got a smoothie bowl with a few bits of fruit and a spoonful of seeds. Of course it tastes nice, cause it‚Äôs fruit, but it‚Äôs not worth the price üôè

name: Cozy Cafe Chiangmai
review_1_text: Very good food, the service is great, everything is made to order which I love. The atmosphere is very chill and quiet. It‚Äôs like sitting in your living room to have a meal. So lovely. I‚Äôve eaten here three times now and haven‚Äôt been disappointed with any of my meals. The fruit shakes are a must try and the matcha is just as good!
review_2_text: Delicious Lattes with pretty designs.  Had a bacon cheeseburger and fries.  Was Craving bc all the rice and noodles we've been eating.  Pretty good.  Hubby had English breakfast and he really enjoyed it.
review_3_text: Really good food both Thai and western. Best fried chicken in town. Lots of tree and outdoor dinning area is recommended. Parking is available.
review_4_text: Cozy and very relax. We have been there in the afternoon try to find the place to escape the sun. The waiter is kind enough to turn on the air con for us. We ordered cold pressed and yogurt drink. They are very nice and fresh.
review_5_text:
We adore this place. The coffee is consistently superb (top tier amongst the coffee shops we‚Äôve tried in Chiang Mai). The food is delicious and great value for money. And the service is warm and friendly each and every time.

Great coffee. Great food. Great people.

How could this be anything other than a 5-Star highly recommended spot?

name: Gord Chiangmai Kitchen ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏Å‡∏≠‡∏î‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà - Breakfast, Brunch & Lunch in the garden
review_1_text:
A very enjoyable breakfast, with both Western and Thai options. The menu is available all day, which is great üòçüòç

It wasn't too noisy, with both hotel guests and others coming in for breakfast. The atmosphere was very relaxing, and the breakfast was delicious.

Credit cards are accepted for orders over 200 baht without any extra fees. üëçüëç

I'm sure the lunch here must be good too, haha.
review_2_text: Some of the best food I have had in Thailand so far. Also a nice clean, relaxing atmosphere. Actually came back two days in a row to try some more food. The flavors and quality of food are crazy good. Definitely try this pork stuff, it‚Äôs amazing.. The squid is incredible as well
review_3_text:
Was so fortunate to stumble upon this gem today! The food is delicious, healthy and inexpensive. All the tables are surrounded by tropical greenery and there is a carp pond next to some comfy leather sofas, making for a lovely atmosphere.
What really stood out was the wonderful staff, who helped me with my sleeping baby. They provided an extra fan for him and moved the entire sofa further into the restaurant when it started pouring down with rain to make sure he wasn‚Äôt splashed ü•π Thank you!
review_4_text:
We stayed at this little resort for two nights, and I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place if you come to Chiang Mai for a short visit. The location was spot on, we enjoyed are walks around the old down, it‚Äôs cute little streets. The food at the hotel was tasty and not expensive.

üå¥ If you enjoy discovering hidden gems in Thailand , come join me on Instagram: @tanya.hanoff
review_5_text: Very cosy and nice food (also quite cheap). The chocolate chip with banana was one of the best things I‚Äôve eaten in a while

name: NU NU NINI's CAFE'
review_1_text: Stopped for a quick morning coffee on the way out. Very sweet staff, you get a glass of iced water with your coffee which is a nice touch. Great for watching the daily hustle of the traffic, which of course makes it a little noisy. Still very good though.
review_2_text:
Great view‚Ä¶ if you‚Äôre skilled at mentally photoshopping out the forest of power lines.
As for the coffee ‚Äî let‚Äôs just say the scenery ended up being the stronger part of the experience üòÖ
review_3_text: Very good location. Nice coffee shop. I had coffee with apple pie, it was tasteful. Friendly staff.
review_4_text: I NEVER take sugar in my coffee, but the girl who took my order thought I asked for some. It was too sweet and tasted bad. Hopefully, she learns to listen more carefully when taking orders.
review_5_text:
This little corner coffee shop is absolutely one of our favorites in Chiang Mai!
The owner roasts her own coffee every day (which sometimes smells amazing) and grinds it fresh for every coffee drink.
They make some amazing lattes and cappuccinos, but also have a wide variety of other choices.
There is seating on the street level that is open, but if you prefer a quieter place to relax or work, there is a large, air conditioned room upstairs with couches and tables where you can sit and enjoy your time.
Free WiFi is available.
They have coffee and tea drinks, milk drinks, sodas, water, and smoothies, as well as really great danishes, croissants, and desserts. Ice cream is available, too.
Prices are really reasonable for the high quality.
We will keep recommending this little place to all of our friends!

name: Friend Coffee & Bar
review_1_text: Very clean and good mood. Until late time, coffee is available because it‚Äôs running with bar together from 6pm. Kind staff. I just feel outside space is too small but very good for computer works in day and good drinking sun night.
review_2_text: A little more expensive, but good coffee & nice interior. Peaceful and cool. Nice break from the main streets!
review_3_text:
Love the vibe of this place, very minimal interior and clean. Spacious enough to do some work, though a lot of the seating is not conducive to doing extensive laptop work.

Coffee was top notch. I got the Double Black which is 2 shots of espresso and orange. It was good if you like that sort of thing.

Shout out to the music curator, I loved the music. It was a soulful deep house kind of vibe. Exactly my cup of tea (or coffee rather üòâ)
review_4_text: Solid matcha latte and excellent atmosphere! I would skip on the pastries here though, nothing outstanding
review_5_text: This a good place to read, rest and good taste of coffee . üëçüëçüëç Canada visitor.

name: Kalm Coffee
review_1_text: This is an amazingly cool space that is very inviting for just about everybody. It has a nice calm, feel to it. You can sit here and relax, enjoy editing to photos, reading some emails and just getting a great vibe, this is a very one of the kind place that should be in many places, not just here.
review_2_text: We visited this cafe that is located in Kalm Village. The ambience is very nice and there is a library upstairs. Staff were friendly. We tried the latte and local tea drink. Both were very good. We enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere here.
review_3_text: A cute coffee shop cafe with a variety of teas and coffees. They also had dessert, though not many of it - only around 4 options to pick from. The brownie was good! Lovely interior.
review_4_text: Nice and quiet spot to read, chill, or simply do nothing. Ordered an iced latte and enjoyed the peaceful silence in the caf√©.
review_5_text:
Amazing concept, comfortable coffee shop, perfect air temperature, spacious indoor and outdoor area, and dirty cofee was absolutely delicious! What else do you want?

Drink selection is limited but still good enough.

name: Nok Kafe / Home Cooked Vegetarian and Thai Food
review_1_text: Highly recommended for vegetarians! Auntie is super nice and welcoming, she‚Äôll customize each dish for you. Ate here four times, the food is delicious! Tried the spicy thai basil fried rice, tom yum fried rice, tofu curry, mushrooms stir fry, broccoli stir fry, and the ginger tofu stir fry! Every dish on the menu can be made vegetarian with eggs/tofu. They have a very loving dog as well, don‚Äôt forget to play with it when you‚Äôre there. I‚Äôll miss this place.
review_2_text: Amazing Khao Soi soup! The best I had in Chiang Mai. I am not the fan of fish sause so either here was very little or none. I went for veggie option and my partner ordered veggie plus tofu.
review_3_text:
Home cooking haven. If you wanna have a meal that feels like your aunt and granny are cooking for you, this is your place.

Food is fresh, tasty, with some herbs hand-picked on the spot right before preparation, and gets ready swiftly. And the menu is very affordable.

The atmosphere is lovely, full (like, full!) of plants, on a not so busy street, with a home vibe whose only downside is the maker space next to it which 1 out of 3 times we've eaten here this far has had some loud noise.

The ladies who run this are so very kind. I can definitely feel the love they put into the food, and have come here almost daily during my stay.

I'd 1000% recommend it!
review_4_text: This is a hidden hole in the wall that we discovered the last day of our stay of 10 days! To increase the irony, we stayed at the hotel right next to it, but the tendency is to walk towards the action and main street... We wished we had discovered it before because this was by far the best meal and dishes we had in Thailand! Atmosphere is quiet surrounded by nature and the owner served us with grace. The food was literally spectacular. I wish Michelin would discover this place because the food is high quality and to the level of the highest quality restaurants with prices of any street food quality... Seriously you must try this place! Thank you so much for this last meal before our flight. The highlight of food of our 2 weeks in Thailand.
review_5_text: Excellent food in a really nice, relaxed atmosphere. A great place to go after a long day of sightseeing and you want good food with a chill vibe.

name: Pangkhon Coffee
review_1_text: Cute local coffee cafe. Serving locally roasted coffee. The Americano I ordered was very good. We also ordered a vanilla lattes with oat milk and it was not good. It was still black and we asked if it had oat milk and they said no. It was not creamy at all.
review_2_text:
Cappuchino tasted really bad. Was given a replacement but still tasted strange.

Places used old milk or old beans. Will not go again.
review_3_text: We ordered a hot latte and a iced hazlenut latte for 120THB! The coffee was amazing and we will definitely be back. We didn‚Äôt order food but the table next to us did and it looked really nice.
review_4_text:
I had fried vegetables with rice. It had a twist of garlic and chili, very delicious. Good value as well, only 65 baht.
Not busy at all. I might return for copy paste this dish.
review_5_text: I came to have a massage and as it is connected to the coffee shop, it was a bit noisy. The lady that gave me the massage had a cold, and not only she was wiping her nose while she was giving the massage, but also she was sending text messages. You could improve your respect for your customers.

name: Craft.coffee
review_1_text:
Nice coffee. Prepared well.
The Latte was rich and flavourful... Strong coffee flavour.
A niche along the street for a bit of a rest to enjoy nice coffee.
review_2_text:
We stopped by chance and couldn‚Äôt have been more pleasantly surprised!!
The coffee is one of the best I‚Äôve had so far. The young barista was lovely and made us an excellent coffee. It‚Äôs a small corner to take a break and enjoy a relaxed atmosphere.
review_3_text: Excellent coffee, you can see how it is made. It is a proper craft coffee, and you can taste it. Super good coffee and some spots to sit in the shade. Absolutely recommend! They also have oat milk
review_4_text: This coffee was so good! I‚Äôve worked in cafes at home in the UK for years and this is one of the best tasting coffees I‚Äôve ever had, definitely recommend. Also a really cute sitting area! ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text:
This coffee spot was an amazing experience! ‚òï‚ú®

In just three days, we ended up going there six times and every single visit was great.

The coffee tastes incredible! You can choose between two types of beans dark or medium roast and both are absolutely delicious.

I also tried their matcha, and let me tell you, the quality is very good and very tasty! üçµ

One of the best things about this place is affordable, making it one of the best spots to enjoy a great cup of coffee without breaking the bank.

And to top it all off, the staff is super friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better! üíõ

name: CAPULUS Chiang Mai
review_1_text:
This coffee shop is a MUST. The decor is incredible, it‚Äôs so comfy and cozy while giving dark academia vibes‚Ä¶. The staff was sooo sweet, coffee was perfect and tasty and they offer free snacks.

I mean‚Ä¶ 5 stars. It‚Äôs also bigger than I thought when looking at the pictures; perfect place to work or read a book
review_2_text: A beautiful caf√© to enjoy a good cup of coffee in a calm and relaxed atmosphere. The d√©cor is elegant and thoughtfully curated, creating a soothing space that invites you to stay longer than planned. Perfect for unwinding, reading for a while, or simply savoring the moment ‚òïüå±ü™¥
review_3_text: Walked past this coffee shop and glad we decided to pop in. Lovely, quirky place with extremely helpful and friendly staff. The atmosphere is very relaxed and they really care about their coffee. Well worth a visit
review_4_text: Very welcoming coffee shop with charming library-inspired decor.  It was a great place for friends to catch up over some very delicious coffees.  The beverage-only menu is supplemented with a lovely assortment of free snacks.  The vibe was relaxed and low-key, the service was very friendly and efficient, and everything was spotlessly clean.  Definitely a good choice for a leisurely chat in a cool, cozy cafe.
review_5_text: I love spending my mornings working here. The staff is so friendly and kind. And the whole vibe of this place is amazing.

name: Daily Cha
review_1_text:
Best place I found to have cheap and delicious coffee or tea.

I ordered the coconut americano coffee, the coconut matcha and the Thai tea, and everything was delicious!

Great drinks for a cheap price, and very good size.

The staff is friendly, and depending on who takes your order speaks english as well.

Saw a lot of locals getting their drinks here, and that is a good signal.

The menu is HUGE with great variety! And they also have a special menu all with matcha, and another for coconut coffee tea or drinks, I add a translated photo.

For 20-25 baht you get a big delicious drink, and you can complement it with some delicious thai sweets from around the corner.

I don‚Äôt know exactly the hours the shop is open, but it is open at morning for sure.
It is inside the market under the roof, next to the ‚ÄúCoffee Tid Doi‚Äù shop.

Don‚Äôt miss it! :)
review_2_text: Delicious!

name: Psalm 1 shop & coffee
review_1_text:
Visiting from Seattle, USA!
After a wonderful breakfast across the street, we stopped in for a coffee and were not prepared for how good it was.

The latte is lightly sweetened to be perfectly balanced, and the cappuccino was excellent.
review_2_text: This is such a great place to stop and get coffee! Just opened 3 months ago. Only 40 - 50 baht for a delicious coffee- I had the iced cappuccino! The owner is so sweet and friendly!! Don‚Äôt miss this place :)
review_3_text: Best Thai tea I have gotten so far. Locals come here, and it's affordable. Hidden gem üíé
review_4_text: Lovely place in town with very high quality coffee at a very cheap price.
review_5_text: Friendly and professional service. We really enjoyed our time having coffee. We highly recommend this place!

name: KHAMLA COFFEE & TEA
review_1_text: Best coffee in chiang mai !!
review_2_text: I love it here! The girl here is so cute, and the food is delicious too.
review_3_text: Delicious coffee at an affordable price. A great place to relax. Highly recommended!
review_4_text: This shop serves high-quality coffee.

name: Aree Coffee and Tea
review_1_text: A nice spot for morning coffee. And a friend of Aree's sometimes stops by with an exotic bird or monkey, too.
review_2_text: Cofe or tea morning till noon. Weekend the family will take over as Saturday crowd there for local night market.

name: Jomkwan Coffee Caf√© @Wualai
review_1_text: Although the shop is currently under renovation, I think I'll definitely be back to this coffee shop next year. Today I ordered an iced cappuccino. The flavor was well-balanced and not too sweet. The owner was very friendly. I like this place.
review_2_text:
Really lovely coffee shop with great coffee on silver street.

Lovely calm vibe instead and great tasting coffee.

Lovely staff.

Would recommend
review_3_text: Such nice lovely owners which are taking care of their customers. We ordered several times different smoothies with no sugar added for 35 baht each and all of them were delicious (cantaloupe, Orange, lychee‚Ä¶). Thank you üôè
review_4_text: Excellent smoothies and lovely service. I asked for less sugar and she adjusted it to exactly my taste by making try a few times. So thoughtful.
review_5_text: Best smoothies in Chiang Mai - and the owners are so friendly! We have come here every day of our month-long vacation in Chiang Mai!

name: Bear Hug Cafe'
review_1_text: I went here when I first got to Chiang Mai many months ago, and decided to take a friend who visited last week to show her the cute aesthetic of this shop and their fun latte art. Highly recommend this place, and the egg drop sandwiches are really good, too. ü§≠
review_2_text:
I was really excited to visit Bear Hug Caf√© after seeing photos online, especially for their latte art, but unfortunately it turned out to be a disappointment. When I ordered, they told me they couldn‚Äôt do latte art, which was surprising since that‚Äôs what the place is supposed to be known for.
The caf√© felt dusty and old, with an atmosphere that was a bit uninviting. The food options were limited, and the quality didn‚Äôt impress me. Overall, it was not the experience I expected, and I left feeling disappointed. I wouldn‚Äôt personally recommend it based on my visit.
review_3_text: Amazing food and cafe! Vibe is super cute.. staff is nice and service is very very quick. Highlighly recommend the frappe and the sandwiches.
review_4_text:
Amazing drinks and food !!! Staff are nice service is great. Atmosphere is super cute with vibey music playing softly in the background.
Great spot to pop in for a lunch or to bring your laptop, chill out and do some work.
review_5_text: Bacon toast was pure perfection! Among all the coffee shops I've been to in Chiang Mai, the toast here has a unique charm that makes me desperately want to come back for more. If I get the chance to visit again, I'm excited to try other items on their menu. Highly recommended

name: Rei coffee roaster
review_1_text: I love the atmosphere! And coffee is sooo delightful! Highly recommended
review_2_text: Best espresso I‚Äòve had on my trip so far, perfectly extracted light roast. Roasted in-house. Beans from thailand are available as hand brew.
review_3_text:
Rei Coffee Roaster ‚Äì Specialty Coffee in Chiang Mai

Rei Coffee Roaster is a specialty coffee shop located at 5/1 Phra Pok Klao Road, Phra Singh, Chiang Mai. The caf√© offers a minimalist and stylish ambiance, providing a cozy environment for coffee enthusiasts. Their menu features a variety of specialty coffee blends and delicious desserts. The caf√© operates daily from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM.
review_4_text:
One of the best coffee in Thailand‚ÄîI missed this coffee so much while I was abroad. The blend of Brazilian and Laotian beans is incredible. The caramel custard paired perfectly with the coffee. üçÆ‚òïÔ∏è

The service was outstanding, and the owner, who roasts the beans himself, is not only kind but also highly knowledgeable about coffee. If you're a coffee lover, I highly recommend this place. Plus, the prices are very reasonable!
review_5_text:
Great spot to take a break. Had a delicious iced matcha and my husband had an iced coffee. They also have Australian MilkLab almond milk and Japanese Oakside oatmilk available.

Great music too.

name: Ma-chill Coffee
review_1_text:
You love coffee?
Your needs might very well be satisfied here.
Very good coffee and super tasty pastries.
Unfortunately the place is a little small.
review_2_text: Best roastery and coffee in town. Very chill vibes with great taste of music all day long. I love it. I‚Äôve been coming here since many years, and they did a great effort to make the place better and keep up with quality coffee beans and delicious home made pastries üòã
review_3_text: One of the best espressos in chiang mai. You can choose the coffee you want too. You enjoy every sip. Never burnt. Perfect flavor. Iced coffee never tastes watered down because the espresso is rich. Great milk alternatives (extra 10 baht). Also always has really good music. Cool people work there
review_4_text: Lovely oat lattes, cakes and pastry were really tasty. Bonus is they have a sweet doggie who is super friendly.
review_5_text: The Dirty Coffee here is a must-try. ‚Äî aromatic, and incredibly smooth. The cafe offers a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere, making it perfect for sitting and reading a book. They also sell their house blend beans for home brewing, which is a big plus! Highly recommended.

name: ‡∏à‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏û‡∏£‡∏£‡∏î‡∏¥ ‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏°‡∏ì‡πå‡∏î‡∏µ Coffee
review_1_text: There are three cats that guard the coffee house/temple. Inside there is an Oni that guards the kingdom as well. It's like a little Buddhist temple coffee house. They welcomed me and fed me. Most grateful ü•∞üôèüèºüî•
review_2_text: Americano here is really good. Service is 5 star!
review_3_text: Good Americano.
review_4_text: There's delicious coffee, peace, and a sacred atmosphere. Everyone can come and join in the chanting. üôè
review_5_text: Clean, bright, peaceful, drink delicious coffee while listening to chanting, make merit with sacred objects directly from the temple and the monk. On the second floor you can go up to sit and meditate. Followers of Luang Pu Du and Luang Ta Ma must come. Chant the Chakravartin to adjust your realm at all times. It is in Chiang Mai city, convenient to come and go. There is a small amount of parking space in front of the shop, but you can park opposite the shop on the footpath of the inner moat in front of the temple, then walk across to buy coffee.

name: Coffee waf
review_1_text:
Found this cafe with a good review while looking for a place to get some work done, and yes, the reviews were all correct. I really love this place.

First of all, the weather was cool that day, so it felt so nice with a good morning vibe in the open-air area, and they even have charging spots. The staff are really nice and give warm hospitality.

The coffee is not bad and I enjoyed it, though the ice was a bit too much and made the flavor fade a little. Still, it is cheap and definitely worth trying.
review_2_text: Al last! Find my little oyster üòÇ awesome coffee! I love coffee and looking for a new creative but GOOD COFFE! Yummy highly recommend it üôèüáπüá≠
review_3_text: Coffee Waf is such a lovely little caf√©! The owner makes every cup of coffee with so much passion and care. You can really taste it. The prices are very reasonable, and the coffee tastes absolutely delicious. Whether it‚Äôs a cappuccino or any other coffee, she puts her heart and enthusiasm into every single one. A real hidden gem! ‚òï
review_4_text: my favorite coffee in chiang mai..delicious drinks made with manual espresso press, pleasant atmosphere and super friendly staff
review_5_text: Perfect spot for coffee chillout with pleasant atmosphere, nice people/visitors and very kind coffe making lady.

name: La Friandise Restaurant & Coffee Shop
review_1_text: Cannot recommend this restaurant enough. chef Jerome has worked in Can Fabes which is the first Spanish restaurant to be awarded 3 Michelin stars. He then worked in various Michelin restaurants before opening his own in Chiangmai. The restaurant is cozy with very good ambience and service is very attentive and warm. The home made terrine is to die for whereas my favorite is the prawn risotto. It is one of the best risotto I have ever had and I highly recommend this dish. The chef is very friendly and will come out and greet you and discuss the dishes with you. Please do come here if you happens to be in Chiangmai. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
review_2_text:
This restaurant is the best French restaurant I‚Äôve ever been to. The food is amazing!!! I could not even manage to describe how I feel when I have the first bite of the beef, the juice like exploding in your mouth ‚Äî‚Äî and you feel like you are in heaven, and I‚Äôm not exaggerating!
I‚Äôm not a gourmet, I took a long time thinking how to describe the taste? I just think the taste is very complex and complicated, but the magic is: everything is in perfect balance. All the ingredients are in good complementary relationships with each other, like the beef‚Äôs meat flavor with sweet and sour pomelo, the fragrance of salmon with fresh green vegetables‚Ä¶ all I can say is amazing and could not find other words. No wonder it is made by a professional French chef with 20 years of experience.
My only question is: How come such a wonderful place with relatively little people found that? It should be known to the world haha!
Me and my husband would definitely come twice when we are in Chiang Mai again. You will definitely like here and this place is especially good for dating because the vibe is really romantic!
review_3_text:
La Friandise in Chiang Mai is truly a hidden treasure that deserves every bit of attention. From the moment you arrive, you are warmly welcomed by an exceptionally friendly team that speaks several languages with ease ‚Äì this instantly makes you feel comfortable and appreciated as a guest.

The cuisine is nothing short of outstanding. Each dish is presented with the finesse and creativity you would expect from star-level dining, combining exquisite flavors, perfect textures, and a clear passion for detail. It is rare to find such high culinary standards delivered so consistently, and every plate feels like a little work of art.

The atmosphere is just as impressive: a modern, stylish, and elegant interior design that creates the perfect setting for both a relaxed dinner or a special evening out. It strikes a great balance between sophistication and comfort, so you can fully enjoy your meal without feeling rushed or out of place.

Despite the top-class quality, the prices remain very fair and reasonable, making La Friandise an incredible value compared to many other fine-dining experiences. This combination of excellence and accessibility is what makes the restaurant such a standout.

All in all, La Friandise is not only highly recommended, but a true insider‚Äôs tip in Chiang Mai. If you love fine dining, welcoming service, and a modern yet cozy atmosphere, you should absolutely not miss this place.
review_4_text:
Great hidden gem a bit outside the Old City walls. The restaurant is both: restaurant and coffee shop. It‚Äòs run by a young French-Thai couple. He‚Äòs the chef and she‚Äòs the boss - taking care of everything else.

The restaurant‚Äòs vibe is modern yet warm. They have a nice back yard with a few tables too. The menu is very small so they specialize on a few things and make those really well. I had the grilled mackerel. It was delicious! Value for money is good too. Will definitely be back.
review_5_text: My boyfriend and I just happen to pass by after our spa and went in for a treat! The chef and his wife also are the owners, and the staff are so welcoming and nice. I was looking through the reviews and wanted to order the lasagna, but it was not in the current menu. The chef was so accommodating to make me a lasagna with river prawns as a special. My boyfriend got the braised beef shanks and it melted in our mouth! (I had to try because it looked so good!) We enjoyed every food we ordered, no complaints! The desserts were also amazing!  We savored every bite. Truly a french cuisine. We loved the food and the service. Funny thing is, this was our best meal in both Chiang Mai and Bangkok! (We did like some authentic Thai cuisine too but for our last day this experience took it up a notch). Thank you both for the warm welcome!

name: Roastniyom Coffee - ‡∏°‡∏ì‡∏µ‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏£
review_1_text:
Roastiyom 60 ‡∏ø (2026)

Has English menu.

I actually don‚Äôt know what exactly is Roastiyom but since it is its signature so I give it a try.

It is nice, like latte but somehow tastier, maybe sweeter.

Good environment, with charging port available. Small but cozy.

Many locals.

Not sure if there is a toilet but it is not at the premise.
review_2_text: What a great place - with polite and friendly staff, tasty coffee that comes with a glass of water and a mini-jar of condensed milk, tasty cakes and relaxing atmosphere. The location is great too: just between the mall district and the old town. A must for a break in exploring.
review_3_text:
Open from 7am, it's a great place to relax after a morning stroll
The place is relaxing, calm and the soft background music helps to feel that sensation. As well as The gentle and polite staff :)
My brownie and cappuccino were also good !
review_4_text:
Cozy little cafe.
I didn‚Äôt like the coffee, nor the croissant too much though.
review_5_text:
We had Iced Matcha Latte and Croissants for Breakfast. Everything was good and I can really recommend the Matcha Latte (we had 50% sweetness)!
Nice seats indoor and also to sit outdoor.

name: ‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏•‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏à‡∏¢ Baan Lom Joey coffee & homemade bakery
review_1_text: Probably their first visitor from Kosovo (as people say here)! Had americano for few days in a row and some eggs. Owner is nice and welcoming. I would recommend!
review_2_text: Highly recommend visiting here! The owner was sweet, welcoming and very hospitable. We got two Thai milks teas and one milk green tea. Everything was delicious! I will be back next time I come to Chiang Mai!
review_3_text:
What an amazing place to grab a coffee. Really good local coffee and relaxed atmosphere.

So good!
review_4_text: Amazing iced lattes with just the right amount of sweetness and the most insane fresh baked coconut chiffon cake!!! Soooo yummy 10/10 recommend
review_5_text: Such a sweet caf√©! The owner is a lovely sweet lady. We went here twice during our stay in Chiang Mai because we really enjoyed the coffee and the waffles with nutella and cream. They even have oat milk for the coffee.

name: Rompho coffee
review_1_text: This coffee shop is a nice and cozy place. The coffee tastes good and the price is reasonable. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is a good place to relax and study.
review_2_text: Nice sharing space for monk chat and good  cheap price coffee.
review_3_text: Nice for nature air coffee with lovely people.
review_4_text: The best Thai Tea in Chiangmai
review_5_text:
A little insider tip for coffee lovers

Rompho Coffee is a truly lovely little caf√© that immediately invites you to linger. If you're not in the mood for crowded chains, you'll find a very relaxed atmosphere here.

The delicious drinks are particularly noteworthy ‚Äì whether coffee or other refreshments, the quality is top-notch. And the best part: all this comes at very reasonable prices, which you won't find everywhere for this quality. A charming spot for a short break or the perfect start to the day. A definite 5 stars!

name: Magokoro Teahouse by ‡∏°‡∏µ‡πÉ‡∏à‡πÉ‡∏´‡πâ‡∏°‡∏±‡∏ó‡∏â‡∏∞
review_1_text:
We discovered Magokoro Teahouse by coincidence while walking through Chiang Mai and decided to stop in for some tea - what a great decision. The place is beautifully designed in a traditional Japanese teahouse style, with a calm and peaceful atmosphere. There‚Äôs also a lovely garden area outside, which must be even more beautiful during the day (we visited after dark).

The matcha selection is outstanding, with several grades and varieties to choose from. The staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, and the presentation of the tea was elegant and authentic.

We enjoyed the experience so much that we even bought some matcha to take home. A truly serene and authentic spot - highly recommended for any tea lover visiting Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: Came in for a late dessert and was blown away by the quality of food and beverage, gorgeous tatami room, also the friendly service from the wait staff. By far the best place for Japanese style parfaits. The Yuzu parfait came with sorbet and yoghurt gelato, a perfectly balanced dessert with all the trimmings. The hojicha parfait came with hojicha gelato that's smokey, rich and decadent, perfectly paired with mochi and red beans. We also ordered sencha tea that came in the most beautiful artisan teapot, the best quality ceramic I've experienced in a tea house outside of Japan. The Japanese garden is simply zen and a delight. Definitely coming back for more!
review_3_text: Love the real Japanese vibe and the matcha taste was great! I ordered the usucha set with wagachi and loved it. Want to order the second one, but have to stop myself 'coz I still have a lot of matcha selection in my freezer üòä If I lived in Chiangmai, I guess I would find myself come here quite often. Thank you for having this beautiful matcha house in the city center like this so, people can come here and experience peace! Hope your business will always do well.
review_4_text: Beautiful place with different areas to see. Extensive menu of matcha drinks. We took yamayuki. Interesting flavor, but personally felt too much wakame seaweed flavor. Matcha roll was perfectly smooth and not too sweet. Expect to wait in the queue to be sifted
review_5_text:
Very disappointing experience for a place with so much potential. On a positive note, the Kokoro matcha was really good. Unfortunately, that was the highlight.

The service was poor, and communication with the waiter was difficult due to a language barrier. The place was extremely crowded, which completely took away the calm, quiet feeling you‚Äôd expect from a Japanese matcha tea house. It felt like they were trying to squeeze in as many people as possible, making it anything but relaxing.

We asked for a bit of extra milk, and only after checking our bill were we told we could get a small amount ‚Äî just once. While we were still drinking our matcha, the waiter brought the bill, took our credit card, and didn‚Äôt return it. About 10 minutes after we could see the payment had gone through, we had to ask for our card back. This was uncomfortable, especially with how packed the place was and the card left unattended.

This place has all the elements to be something special, but unfortunately it fell short. It felt overpriced and underdelivered.

name: Bella Goose Cafe at the Hill
review_1_text:
Bella Goose Caf√© at The Hill is a charming little escape tucked away in the hills of Thailand. From the moment you arrive, the peaceful atmosphere and beautiful greenery invite you to slow down and enjoy the moment. The setting is calm and refreshing, with lovely views that make it perfect for a relaxed morning or afternoon.
The caf√© itself is cozy and tastefully designed, offering comfortable indoor seating as well as outdoor spots to soak in the scenery. The food and drinks are thoughtfully prepared, with fresh flavors and beautifully presented dishes. The coffee is especially good‚Äîsmooth, rich, and clearly made with care.
What truly makes Bella Goose Caf√© special is its warm, welcoming feel. Friendly service, great food, and a serene location come together to create a place you‚Äôll want to visit again. It‚Äôs a true hidden gem and well worth the stop. ‚òïüåø
review_2_text: After a delightful discovery experience at Bella Goose at the Pond, we had to check this one out and it was well worth it! Loved the genuine vibe, especially the original style caf√© doors. The Beetroot Scramble was amazing and the PB Mocha was yummy. I couldn't resist the presentation of the Good Morning Smoothie Bowl, so we went back for it later. It was legit and did not disappoint!!
review_3_text:
Food - Healthy & the taste just nice.

Service - Friendly helpful with lots of smiles.

Atmosphere - Clean, tidy, modern chill cafe.

Lots of choices in the menu, scratching head which to pick. Overall the drink & food is awesome.

Found this Bella Goose randomly & not regret to be here. Keep it up üí™üèº
review_4_text:
Love this place! While in Chiang Mai for my trail race I ate here twice.

The first time was just before their closing time so it was practically empty. The second time was lunch time and most of the tables were full, but you can still find sitting outside.

The place is located on a corner of a busy intersection but once inside you can barely hear cars and motorcycles outside.

The waitresses are super nice and friendly. They pay attention to the customers and quickly respond if you need them.

You don‚Äôt have to wait long for your food to be served. Both times I had a coffee and a cinnamon roll. They are so good!

If I ever return to Chiang Mai I‚Äôll definitely eat here again.
review_5_text:
Bella Goose is one of those rare places that quietly becomes part of your routine‚Äîand then your memory. Tucked into Chiang Mai, it became my daily spot. A place where coffee isn‚Äôt just served, it‚Äôs respected.

The piccolo was flawless every time‚Äîsilk-smooth, perfectly textured, carrying a bold, confident espresso that lingered just long enough. Their espresso stands among the best I‚Äôve had in Thailand, and knowing they roast their own beans, sourced through real relationships with local farmers, makes each cup feel intentional.

Whoever is behind the bar is truly gifted‚Äîlatte art is never guaranteed, yet here every piccolo arrives like a small painting. Consistency like that is rare. It‚Äôs craft.
And then there‚Äôs the food. The smoked salmon bagel is unforgettable‚Äîthe kind of dish that follows you home in your thoughts. A beautifully made bagel, rich smoked salmon, a perfect schmear, all plated with care. Every plate tells you the same story: this team loves what they do.

But the heart of Bella Goose is its people. The kindest, warmest staff I encountered in Thailand‚Äîno contest. They go beyond service and straight into connection. I showed up every day, and somehow, it felt like coming home. That doesn‚Äôt happen by accident. That‚Äôs great leadership and genuine hospitality.

Bella Goose is a place to meet, to rest, to work, to linger. A place where time slows just enough for you to notice how good things can be. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more.

name: Starbucks
review_1_text:
I really like the Starbucks it‚Äôs easy and convenient to the night bizarre market and the service is really fast and good and I also love that you can get sweet tea in Thailand. If you order a black shaken iced tea with five sugar pumps, you‚Äôll have sweet tea like you have in Texas. You can adjust accordingly to your taste. I don‚Äôt like mine super sweet so if you‚Äôd like it super sweet, maybe seven or eight pumps

it‚Äôs right across the street from the Marriott and right on the street with the night bizarre market

I hope this helps and I hope you enjoy your time in Thailand
review_2_text: Spacious little but plenty of tables starbucks. Great plates and beverages that i have not seen in other starbucks not even in Bangkok. Very clean and the coffees are made very well. It has all the great taste as it should be and its location is incredible.
review_3_text:
The staff here are polite, friendly, and helpful. The prices are standard for Starbucks in Thailand. My chai tea cost 95B. They also have a good selection of merchandise available, including the Christmas range.
The cafe is big with lots of seating available. They pull the blinds half down when it is too sunny üòä
review_4_text: Not a good representative of Starbucks - and I've been to hundreds of them in many countries. Not only does my starbucks card from Indonesia not work here (how is that possible?), they don't have a bathroom (astronomically rare), and the Starbucks internet wants you to register name, passport ?? etc. That's quite bizarre in itself, I go to a lot of cafe's out here in Thailand, I can't remember needing to give a bunch of personal details to use the wifi - data collection anyone? This is a extremely poor representative of Starbucks stores.
review_5_text: A nice oasis on a hot afternoon; enjoyed an ice coffee. Great service, friendly and helpful staff.

name: Art Farmer Cafe
review_1_text: Great coffee spot. Cute decorations for Halloween. Was my go to place while I was in chiang mai. Staff is very friendly and greets you with a smile. Coffee is very good. Go with the medium roast. Try their specialty drinks. I enjoyed a mojito espresso every morning.
review_2_text: This was by far one of the best coffee I had. Medium roasted latte just masterful. It has a rich taste, very creamy texture and fruity notes. I took two bags of these beans to brew it myself!
review_3_text:
The coffee was excellent. The service perfect. The only thing I would do here is refresh the interior. The trouble with the nearly all white interior is the maintenance needed to keep it looking good. It only really needs someone with a pot of white paint and an eye for decluttering and using the space better. There are some merchandising stands in the wrong place and the DJ kit could be designed into the space much better. The tiles you probably have to lay again. They are toast.
All this is forgiven because the coffee and the music are very nice.
review_4_text:
Awesome coffee and dessert.
üèñÔ∏èüëç‚òïÔ∏èüçµüç∞üßÅ

Iced Americano, latte and cocoa all have a fruity aroma and a strong coffee flavor, which is delicious. The icy cheesecake is super delicious! The staff here are also very polite and the service is very good. üëç
review_5_text:
The coffee was too good and of high quality. This was our go to place for morning coffee during our chiang mai stay.

The barista girl was cool and friendly. Would definitely visit again.

Highly recommended for your caffeine fix. Definitely visit if you‚Äôre around the neighbourhood, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

name: Savor Society
review_1_text: Savor Society is a very relaxing place for a strong cup of coffee. I got the Iced Coconut Latte and cannot recommend it enough. The coffee flavor did not get diluted at all! I wish I had time to come back and get it again.
review_2_text:
Very cool coffee shop and cafe.

The coffee choices cover a wide range of serving styles and coffee beans that are roasted in house. Savor Society is serious about coffee! Be prepared to state the serving style, the temperature (hot or iced), and type of beans. Enjoy the high quality coffee.

The are nice food choices too. Many of the breakfast meals include freshly made bagels. The attractive selection of sweets will surely tempt you.

Have a seat and enjoy sitting in a shop that is thoughtfully and a bit eclectically decorated.

You‚Äôll find this shop is well patronized morning, noon, and afternoon.  Join the friendly crowd and enjoy the Savor Society!

Feeling down and visiting the Bangkok Hospital? You can grab a coffee from the Savor Society location there!
review_3_text: So good! The latte (I selected Laos beans dark roast) is delicious, I could taste the unique notes. The cake is perfectly lightly sweetened and the fluffy cream balances the denser (but soft and moist) chocolate base.
review_4_text:
Best coffee and best value in Chiang Mai.
The Basque Burnt  cheesecake is not too sweet just perfect with the coffee.üëçüëçüòãüòã
review_5_text: 5/5 stars! We're so lucky to have this amazing coffee shop just around the corner from our place. The perfect spot to start our day with a great cup of coffee and delicious drinks. The service is top-notch, and the upstairs seating area is cozy and comfortable. It's the ideal spot to relax and catch up with friends and family. Highly recommended!

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏î‡πÉ‡∏à Escape room in Chiang Mai Thailand Ê≥∞ÂõΩÊ∏ÖËøàÂØÜÂÆ§ÈÄÉËÑ±
review_1_text:
The staff were very accommodating and friendly. They explained everything nicely.

It is definitely not for the faint-hearted. This is my second time trying this out and not finishing again.

The props and experience was very thrilling and scary. The actors were awesome.

Check the prices and promotion first too.
You will also get 50% off their food and drink menu once you choose a package.

The location is very convenient, close to the heart of the city.

There are 4-5 games to experience lasting 60-90mins. There is 5 levels of scary with zero for the easily scared.

They also have pictures and videos for your memories at the end. =D
review_2_text: It's definitely the best escape room I've ever done. It is more of an experience where you follow a story than working out puzzles and clues. We didn't even do the scariest level, and my heart was racing the entire time. The staff were absolutely amazing and really put on a show. With student discount it's only 500baht and lasts over an hour, I'd highly recommend.
review_3_text: What an experience!!! Great service by all the staff. Great acting and support crew. I‚Äôm a bit of a softie when it comes to horror, so I‚Äôm happy I managed to finish. Definitely worth an hour or two of your time on a rainy Chiang Mai evening. Thanks guys! ‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏Ñ‡∏∏‡∏ì‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö
review_4_text:
One of the best and definitely scariest experience I had in Chiang Mai.

We had five levels of difficulty to choose and one scary experience.

I was literally shaking.

If you‚Äôre looking for an escape room that combines an horror experience in the best way possible -

This is the place!
review_5_text: This place was great!! Very scary, for my family (I never get scared), I strongly suggest this. The staff is really nice and make it a very enjoyable experience.

name: Cafe de L'Amour
review_1_text:
Came into this quaint little cafe in Chiang Mai for some Aircon and a rest. Nice and cosy that just does a limited selection of food and drinks (primarily coffee) but that is fine.

I ordered the mocha-banana-frappe, my wife had a mocha-mint-frappe and my son had a hot latte.

All perfectly tasty and reasonably priced (THB180 in total). Limited seating but that‚Äôs part of the appeal.

My only gripe is they don‚Äôt accept Apple Pay - only a local banking QR code or cash.
review_2_text: Very cool little spot and Chiang Mai. Has indoor and outdoor seating with a tree growing through some of the sitting area. Servicewas very polite and everything was made from scratch grinding beans for every single order.
review_3_text: Small cafe with a lovely vibe, fine coffee and delicious cakes. Plenty of different seating options although I liked the most the ones inside around a living tree that gives the place soothing atmosphere. Sometimes there are offered locally grown fruits in the basket next to the entrance for a bargain price.
review_4_text: Brilliant little coffee shop near Chang klan area. I‚Äôve been coming here for nearly 15 years. Great coffee, fresh juices, smoothies and good little club sandwich if need a change from Thai food. Friendly happy faces, parking and good vibes. Small quaint place to stop and sit outside or inside. I love to come here when I go to my favourite massage shop Aree Thai massage near Anantara. Come down and support local business on Si Don Chai Rd just around corner from night bazaar‚Ä¶
review_5_text: Very cute cafe with good drinks. I tried the rose tea latte and my friend tried cocoa latte pearl (bubble was out so we replaced with pearl). Both were great. I liked the atmosphere of the shop - not a big place but plants were all around, felt cool even in a hot afternoon. Had place for parking.

name: ùôãùòºùôêùôéùôÄ ùò∞ùòØ ùòµùò©ùò¶ ùëØùë∞ùë≥ùë≥ Coffee and Rooftop bar
review_1_text:
I really dug the 'raw' industrial decor as you head up to the rooftop bar, it gives the whole place a cool, unfinished character.

The vibe is super chill, especially when you‚Äôre just sitting back with a couple of cold Singha beers. Watching the sunset from up there is gorgeous and easily the best part of the evening. Also, keep an eye out for the two resident cats; the ginger one is a total character and pretty cheeky!

The food was just okay for me, but you‚Äôre really coming here for the relaxed atmosphere rather than a gourmet meal. My only real gripe was the music, it was a bit loud for such a laid-back spot, so lowering the volume would be a huge plus. Definitely a solid choice for a low-key hangout.
review_2_text:
Cool spot! Great coffee (and good value at only 60 baht for a latte!), cool retro vibe furniture, and stylish barista.

Opens early at 7am, has cute cats wandering around and a chill outdoor terrace right opposite the Shangri-La.

Trendy caf√© by day, rooftop bar by night ‚Äî what more do you need? This place is a hidden gem.
review_3_text:
This place is a great hidden jem with lots of tasty appetizers that they make fresh in house. Unbeatable prices on local beers.

When it's not raining sitting upstairs is a very relaxing atmosphere and the staff are very hospitable.

We were here during slow season so it was not very busy at all yet the staff was still running around to make sure we were comfortable and having a good time.

They accept music requests aswell which is nice.

We mostly dealt with Posh (unsure of spelling of his name) and the other two employees Simba and Nala are pictured below.
review_4_text:
Very nice roof top bar with friendly staff and surprisingly good food. The beer selection is the usual suspects + Asahi, which are reasonably priced (Chang is 88 bhat and the rest are only a little more).

Would highly recommend visiting if you want a chill location with some live DJs
review_5_text: Lovely little bar and coffee shop. We almost missed it and walked past as it is so well hidden. A little sign outside indicates that it is open and that they have a upstairs balcony. The balcony upstairs is very spacious and open with a lot of ambient lighting. Nice view of the Shangri la hotel opposite. The bar serves food as well as a variety of flavoured beers that are locally made in Thailand. Good place to have a chilled drink.

name: C9 CAFE
review_1_text: Really nice little find, charming little restaurant. The food was really tasty and fresh. I just forgot to check for no Garlic, the menu did not express garlic was in the avacado. Avacado and coconut smoothy was delisious. The prices were really inexpensive, some items cheaper than eating in the market. Nice decor and clean.
review_2_text: Our second time here for breakfast! Food is delicious and there is a good selection from western style breakfast to Thai breakfast. Coffee was also great.
review_3_text: Best breakfast we had in years! Delicious food and cafe. Very friendly service and nice setting.
review_4_text: Amazing pasta close to Astra Condo! Good thaifood, very good breakfast. Nice decoration food and affordable prices
review_5_text:
Really delicious food. Great, off the main road atmosphere.  Friendly waitstaff.
Highly recommend.

name: Mosaic Market & Cafe Chiang Mai
review_1_text: Lovely secret gem! This place is decorated will love, care and style. I went there during their Christmas Market fair and it was really nice to enjoy the atmosphere, Christmas music and browse around their handmade selection of products and then enjoy a nice tea while chilling in their living room area. Very quiet, super friendly staff, they also have delicious cakes and very affordable prices. If you're looking for crafts, handmade souvenirs and presents, this is the place to get them. They're so conscious and eco-friendly, and sell many natural skin products, essential oils, creams, candles, clothes, bags, jewelry and much more. I'll definitely visit this place again!
review_2_text:
I stumbled upon this spot when I was on the hunt for a clothing shop. The staff were so welcoming and patient and I instantly felt comfortable finding a table to get cozy and make some art!
Highly recommend the Thai Milk Tea! Affordable and delicious. Cafe takes both card and cash payments. There is also a second level for more seating too.
Will be definitely bringing my friends back here soon!!
review_3_text:
This place is wonderful! Open until 6.30pm which is a bonus.

Such a lovely quiet space to work or meet a friend. They also have an upstairs with bookable meeting rooms and more space to relax. Comfortable sofas.

Lots of light from the big windows. Drink selection is great, cookies are yummy!
review_4_text:
I love the co-working space this beautiful social enterprise has! Two floors of seating, delicious cookies/cakes and lunch pies üòã

Ill definitely come back again soon. ü•∞
review_5_text:
This place is a true hidden gem in Chiang Mai.

I stopped in for coffee (and the world‚Äôs best home made cookie!)‚Ä¶ loved the laid back atmosphere, friendly people and the space is beautiful.

Was a nice change of pace from a typical coffee shop.

They also have lots of interesting things for sale.

If you‚Äôre looking for a unique place to relax, I highly recommend it!

name: GoGreen Bar - Weed & Cannabis
review_1_text:
Zada was incredibly helpful and
knowledgeable during my visit. She took the time to listen to what I was looking for and made thoughtful recommendations based on my preferences. Her friendly attitude and professional vibe made the whole experience super comfortable and easy. You can tell she really knows her stuff and genuinely cares about helping customers find the right products.
review_2_text: Great shop with an awesome vibe and super friendly staff. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for a unique cocktail or looking to enjoy some quality medicine, this is the perfect spot to check out. Highly recommend!
review_3_text:
Selection kinda sucks and 450-500 baht for just ONE gram of good weed sucks a lot
Almost every other dispensary in chiang mai sells at least an eighth for 450-500
review_4_text: The staff is really nice. The drinks are really good and decorated so lovely.
review_5_text: Upscale dispensary that also serves drinks too. This is the best place to buy, smoke & hang out. My go to place for bud in Chiang Mai. They have flower for every budget. Employees are very friendly & they roll for free (please tip)

name: Roastniyom Coffee - The Astra Condo
review_1_text: Great variety in the drink menu and tasty croissants. Lots of good seating space to work or a quiet visit, spots to charge your devices, and wifi. Unsure of the other reviews complaining about staff.. We stayed at the Astra and came here daily for a week and had no issues.
review_2_text:
Nice little coffee shop for condo dwellers with many types of seating options around, some have power socket so ideal for recharging while having your preferred dose of caffeine. They also offer many types of cookies, brownies and cheesecakes. Plus four basic types of croissants - pure, ham&cheese, almond and chocolate. Good place to start a day.

EDIT: After one year of regular visits I simply have to give the fifth star. They added more types of pastries and have many special drinks during events and holidays.
review_3_text: The lady in the morning is so rude if you are a foreigner. 7:10 am being yelled at "no coffee" not a great way to start the morning when it says it opens at 7, the people across the street are very kind. I suggest to give them your business.
review_4_text:
I come to this caf√© almost every day since it‚Äôs in my residence, but the service has become really unpleasant because of one staff member, Tang Mo. She never says hello, never smiles, and barely answers when you ask for something.

Today I tried to buy a cake displayed on the counter, and she pretended not to see which one I meant ‚Äî apparently because she had kept it for herself. It was extremely unprofessional and disrespectful.

I‚Äôm not sure if she‚Äôs the owner or just has a problem with foreigners, but her attitude is very rude and makes it uncomfortable to even grab a takeaway coffee.
review_5_text: Great spot to work or just enjoy a good coffee! The place is calm, cozy, has reliable Wi-Fi, and the staff are super friendly üôè

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü Perfect blend coffee
review_1_text: Great coffee. Really good blend. What I like about the location is the chilled non touristic atmosphere next to local restaurants and shops. And the price is reasonable at 50 for. Capoucino (vs 120 at Starbucks)
review_2_text:
It has been my favorite cafe before and even after COVID19. It seems the surrounding business has gone down after the pandemic. It is a pity. Hope that the economy will rise again soon.
The Americano and cappuccino are nice and cheap. The environment is chill and has a local relaxing ambience.
review_3_text:
Very good americano and fair price!
I sometimes have other drinks too, but I mostly come in the early morning for my breakfast coffee ‚òï and she opens at 6h30am !
Like her Perfect Blend it's a Perfect time!
Not directly in the busy Changkhlan Road, I love to sit outside enjoying my morning coffee ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_4_text: Good place to chill and have some coffee and small snack. The ice lattee was about 40 baht and it had a lot of ice, half coffee, and half condensed milk. Not too expensive and it is relaxing place but could be better with more amount of coffee. For the distance wise, it is close to some hotel area, you can walk a bit and relax before you start your day (or at the end of day relaxation).
review_5_text:
One of my favorite coffee shops in Chiangmai. Others are bigger or have fancier decor but the coffee in this place is quite good and the prices are outstanding.

They have their own roaster so locally roasted beans are for sale as well. I‚Äôve had their Americano and their Oreo Coffee Smoothie, both are excellent.

Not far from the Shangra-la this is one of Chiangmai‚Äôs hidden gems!

name: KAHI NUI COFFEE - Street side caf√© bakery
review_1_text: Delicious coffee and baked goods! But he‚Äôs suddenly disappeared and not sure where he moved to or closed down?
review_2_text: perfect iced mocha and owner is very friendly, great value and highly recommended
review_3_text: Really the best coffee I have had in Thailand for only 40 bhat
review_4_text: Street-side coffee carts have everything, and even use organic beans.

name: pista.chio cafe
review_1_text: Grilled cheese sandwich is so perfect price is very cheap is 69‡∏ø a cute little cafe I think it's a new opened coffee shop There are very good promotions
review_2_text:
Coffee here is great, and the team at Pista.chio are genuinely honest and helpful. I lost a ring on a day I‚Äôd been to several places, so I went back everywhere to check. Pista.chio took my details, and the next day they messaged to say they‚Äôd found it. The barista said they searched around the store and found it that morning.

Also, their Thai tea is excellent. Chatramue will always be my favourite, but this is a very close second.
review_3_text: Underrated place for coffee. Did not try any food here but their flat white is very good, much better than the coffee place two stores down. Great service and very polite.
review_4_text: Well made coffee drinks.  Bright interior with big windows for people watching.
review_5_text: This place is underrated - great vibe, great coffee and great service. All for a great price too. Def would recommend üëåüèæ

name: Transit Number 8
review_1_text:
Really loved this cafe‚Äôs concept and food! Worked here for a bit with my laptop, otherwise i really liked the pork don they had - this is kinda like a cafe concept with other shops owned by the same company (massage parlour, rice bowl shop etc), so i could order the rice dishes from the shop across the mini street. I really liked the milk roti too, crispy and they gave you a bottle of condensed milk so you could add as much as you‚Äôd like! :) def kid friendly and a great spot for instsgram pics!! oh they have coffee and beans/ drip bags too.

Note that you‚Äôll have to pay an entrance fee.

i felt it was pretty pricey for thai local pricing though !
review_2_text: Very beautifully decorated like a tiny Japanese town during winter. Met the lady owner, very sweet lady. The coconut cake is a must try! Will need to pay an "entrance" fees to enter but can take the ticket and exchange for food/drinks. Only downside - the staff within the cafe could be more cheerful and prices inside the cafe are touristy priced. Overall, enjoyed our 2hr stopover at this cafe ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: Been meaning to review this place for years but never got around to doing so until someone asked me where was my most memorable coffee experience and I have to say THIS !! Hands down!!  Everything from decor, service, coffee selection, taste, smell, even temperature is a perfect 5star+ The coffee was brewed perfectly and the infused milk was NOTHING I‚Äôve ever tried before. The rose/ orange/ whatever else they used were paired amazingly well with coffee. Who would have guessed. This was such a random find on my trip to Chiang Mai but it‚Äôs moments like these which stays with you for a long time.
review_4_text:
I ordered 2 cups of coffee for take-away, which were Transit Number 8 (Dirty Latte) and Soft Latte. The Transit Number 8 was good enough, but the Soft Latte was quite a fail because I felt that they didn‚Äôt use ice cream / soft serve but more likely whipped cream.

The price for a cup of coffee is little bit above the average cafes in Chiang Mai.

I didn‚Äôt go to their dining area, which was in a unique design (as many people reviews), but I very much liked their front store set-up and design. Really felt like I was in Japan.
review_5_text: First, they charge you 70bht/person at the entrance. Then you find out there's no empty seats on Sunday. Girls just save a seat with a drink, then go to another seat to make pictures. Some laptop users also were there. The coffee tasted ok. Maybe come on weekday.

name: Coffice Coffee Roaster
review_1_text: Had a morning visit and honestythis has become one of my favourite spots in Chiang Mai. The matcha is top-tier ‚Äî balanced and not sweet at all. The bagels were incredibly fresh showing real quality. There‚Äôs enough seating inside plus a few outdoor tables, perfect for a calm start to the day. I also love the peaceful residential setting away from traffic. Can‚Äôt wait to return :)
review_2_text: Great place right by the airport. Super chill part of town. Great coffee and prices. The scone was very delicious!
review_3_text: Love Coffice near Wing 41! Their iced cocoa is a must-try‚Äîso rich and delicious. They've got a solid range of bakery items too, and everything is very reasonably priced. Perfect for a quick and tasty stop. üç©üç™‚òïÔ∏èüçµ
review_4_text:
The coffee and toffee cake are excellent, and there‚Äôs a wide variety of cakes to choose from. The staff is friendly and welcoming.

However, it‚Äôs not an ideal for working with laptop, as the tables are small and electrical outlets are limited.
review_5_text:
Its a hype new cafe in town
The cafe is quite packed since the cafe quite small from what i thought
They provide breads and non coffee drinks too here.
The sweet potato bread taste quite nice , its full of sweet potato filling inside
The tomato bagel looks cute too
They provide a small air-con seating area
Their outdoor seating area much more bigger
And its not recommended for a big grup to come since its quite small
They also provide a car park next to the cafe
One plus thing for me is their toilet superbly clean
They probably need to provide a cover for their  pastries and bread since its unhygienic coz its not separated from the seating area

name: POND Bakery
review_1_text:
Give 5 star for strawberry shortcake.
Light cream. Not too sweet.
Parking not convenient.
You have to buy tickets 70 thb /person.
But this coupon can use as money in shop.
review_2_text: Cakes look good and different options, but it tastes just not that good as it looks. Too much cream and the cake dough tastes cheap. Atmospheres just ok.
review_3_text: Absolutely delicious cakes baked with love. Very tasty and sweet. Friendly people and fast service, super fresh selection, be early before all sold out.
review_4_text: All the fruits were rotten and in a terrible state, so I threw them all away.
review_5_text: Small and cute cafe. Wasn‚Äôt expecting much for the taste due to the reviews but the cake was actually good. Service was good too.

name: The cofreze
review_1_text:
Dirty coffee is a must! Just the right amount of sweetness for the espresso shot.
Iced chocolate is also very good.
review_2_text: This place is even better than we expected! The coffee and matcha are really good. The shi-o pan and the red beans with toasted bread are super delicious. So sad I only got takeaway for one ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely come back next time. Highly recommended!!!
review_3_text:
The coffee was great, no complaints.
The staff was also friendly, and the ambience was nice.

My only issue was when I decided to buy the coffee beans, Strawberry Kix blend, I was informed that at first by the staff for 500 gram, the price is 600 baht, which I agreed and I waited for 15-20 minutes because the 500 gram pack was not available, then when I was about to pay, the other staff told me the price was actually 820 baht for 500 gram. I just pay because I dont wanna prolong the issue there and in a rush.

I just hope next time the staff wouldn't give incorrect information that's a bit misleading, because it's not like I didn't clarify at first.

Thank you.
review_4_text: Cool n friendly. Good chocolate and matcha drink. Minimal interior
review_5_text: The cofreze This cafe is both spacious inside and out. They have so many varieties of coffee beans. They have like a fridge or something (I don‚Äôt know), but it can keep coffee beans really well. Before giving the coffee beans to the barista, you pick them out of the fridge, then give them to the barista. He or she will make coffee for you.

name: Also Cafe Chiangmai
review_1_text: Visited in the morning and nice home-style caf√© with small rooms. My drink and food were both great and the staff were super kind letting me sit quietly during closing time. I did notice one of the staff member seemed unwell ‚Äî hope they‚Äôre okay and get rest soon. Really fair prices overall.
review_2_text:
Chill vibes all around üç∑
‚úÖ Great service / Reasonable prices / Perfect for photo lovers & cafe hoppers. The desserts are delicious‚Äînot too sweet!
review_3_text: I came here without any plans, but was pleasantly surprised by the tasty food and relaxed atmosphere. For me, this place is perfect for creating meaningful memories with special people.
review_4_text:
The store has good mood. Musics playlist is nice.
The cafe also provide Photo booth.
The store interior is cozy.
Many seats in cafe is comfortable.
There is no parking lot.
The price is fair compare to other cafe near by but the taste of drink is good.
I order iced Americano and I love it.
You could find free time reading or relax here during the day.
review_5_text: Here is the small chic coffee cafe where you can enjoy with good coffee and take photos to your social as well.  One bad thing if you want to visit here is parking lot.   It is good for bikes and walking if you want to come.

name: Elite cafe‚Äô ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á ‡∏°‡∏ä ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Went to the cafe van. Had a latte and a Thai tea. Both were perfection
review_2_text: ü™¥‚òïÔ∏èperfect coffee place to unwind
review_3_text: good!!
review_4_text: I was about to enter the shop and saw a person smoking and then immediately left. I don't understand why the shop allows smoking in the shop area and there are children nearby.
review_5_text: The smell of cigarette smoke is very strong. It's an open-air shop where customers can smoke, but not everyone wants to smell cigarette smoke. If smoking is allowed, there should be a suitable area. Also, there are other restaurants in the vicinity, and not everyone wants to breathe in cigarette smoke.

name: Rogu Roti at Transit no.8
review_1_text: This is the first time we eat at this place! The dessert is delicious, well presented, and full of flavor. Staff are friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is cozy and relaxing. Definitely one of our favorite places ‚Äî we‚Äôll be back again soon! üçΩÔ∏è‚ú®
review_2_text: I came to the small restaurant again. I like the food, staffs, service and the atmosphere.
review_3_text: Loved the vibe here! Totally worth paying a visit üòä Also, this place is not just ‚Äúaesthetic‚Äù but they also serve really good food ‚ò∫Ô∏è Garlic fried rice with pork is a must try!
review_4_text: Came here for the roti, and left very happy! Good food, great ambience and service! Chill cafe to hang out at
review_5_text: Lovely space with lots of seating in a calm space. The woman Great popcorn chicken, roti, and free refills on hot Thai tea.

name: WARI „ÉØ„Éº„É™ COFFEE
review_1_text:
Sometimes i get my coffee using Grab, it is lighting fast! It surprises me usually ü§ó‚ú®

Latte is my go to here, offers different varieties of beans.

would like to try thai tea as many ppl recommend.
Thank you for your very quick and kind service. üòäüôèüèº
review_2_text: One of the really good Thai Tea and the price is very reasonable. Recommended!!
review_3_text: Love Kame as always! Good to see new branch here. Have a limited spot. Quick grab & go are recommended!
review_4_text: Good Vibes Good Life
review_5_text: It‚Äôs nice

name: ‡∏´‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ç‡∏à‡∏ß‡∏ô ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà/‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏≠‡∏ß‡∏• ‡∏Ñ‡∏π‡∏ã‡∏µ‡∏ôObbouan Cuisine
review_1_text: Cozy spot with delicious food, reasonable prices, and plenty of parking for convenience! Loved the less sweet latte ‚Äì it was perfect. The Thai dessert was fragrant and tasty. Highly recommend!
review_2_text:
- The design and theme color of the shop is very attractive.
- Staffs are friendly and welcoming.
- Plenty of parking lots.
- Tum Tim was full of flour, little water chestnut.
- Ginkgo was hard and bitter.
- Actually, their savor is less sweet therefore no need to order less sweet. Otherwise, it is quite bland.
- Price is reasonable.
review_3_text: Chicken and soy noodles was way over cooked and the noodles were gelatinous. Latte smoothie was week to my taste. I would say very average, low prices, lovely place and cool.
review_4_text: Nice place nice Thai dessert.
review_5_text: Good

name: Na Coffee
review_1_text: It is a unique coffee. In each cup, you can make orange coffee without orange juice, melon coffee without syrup. The coffee bean selection is very refined. It's not just about the coffee; tea and chocolate can also be brewed with rich and satisfying flavors.
review_2_text: Good cocoa bomb, recommend
review_3_text: The owner/barista is serious about coffee. She sources quality beans from around the world.
review_4_text: ü§© This is so cool
review_5_text: Cozy nice Coffeeshop with very good coffee and sinfull cakes

name: ‡∏•‡∏∏‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏≠‡πä‡∏î Coffee House
review_1_text: What a great find. A real hidden gem. Tucked away in lush urban garden surroundings. A great place to relax with friend. Warm welcoming staff. A little off the beaten track but well worth the relaxed atmosphere.
review_2_text:
The atmosphere is quiet and chill. Uncle Aed is friendly and kind.
It's a great place to enjoy tea or coffee and chat with friends.
review_3_text:
I recommend this place. Great atmosphere and delicious coffee.
The owner is kind and the baristas are lovely.
review_4_text: This cafe has a great mood, music, and coffee‚Äîeverything goes by so smoothly, the day flies by. The owner, an elderly gentleman, is also very kind.

name: New Batch Suthep
review_1_text: Great new coffee on canal. Much needed in this location. Baristas and coffee are both  legit
review_2_text: Great coffee for cheap price!

name: Thong-Urai Cafe & Paw Made Painting
review_1_text:
Art studio cafe with great signature iced chocolate!!! I ordered basque cheesecake and it get along together very well. Also many choices of desserts and comfortable foods.
Next time I will try foods and coffee/matcha.
The place very peaceful, staffs are friendly and helpful.
I ,very much, enjoyed my visiting, eat&drink while reading.
review_2_text:
We had coffee and participated in the workshop! No need to reserve but better to check on weekends- coffee was absolutely nice, nutty with a nice aroma.
Workshop was very fun, with the instructor helping us to sketch and for the last touch;)) all the paints and canvas is provided. Just have to pay for drinks and canvas based on the size u choose! Certainly a memorable experience to enjoy during ur stay in chiangmai
10000% recommended!
review_3_text: I had a lovely time today participating in one of the painting workshops. Our host was wonderful and helped me set up my canvas and offer guidance on canvas selection, improving my painting and offering encouragement when I didn't know what to do. There was great music in the background which helped to relax into the process. The coffee I had there was great - I didn't sample the food but it smelled amazing.
review_4_text: Cozy and pretty space with relaxing atmosphere and delicious coffee. Enough space to get Chiang Mai on canvas. Recommended for everyone!!!! Called in the morning and visited by walk-in, relaxed. Cheaper than booking through tour site
review_5_text: The painting session was a delightful experience, offering a relaxing atmosphere. The instructor provided clear guidance, which was very helpful, and I appreciate that. Furthermore, the cafe's ambiance created a perfect environment for creativity and social interaction. I found it to be a memorable experience with good service, and I recommend it. Overall, it was a wonderful combination of art and a nice cafe vibe.

name: EVERGREEN CAFE HOTEL
review_1_text: Amazing stay! So so so nice our best in Thailand so far. Highly recommend! The service and staff are excellent. They have free snacks and water for you self serve. The room is beautiful - has everything you need and is situated in a quiet side street. We had a great sleep on a comfy bed!
review_2_text: Very nice owners. And the hotel is so pretty. The room was clean. Got 1 free drink per person each day, they make it fresh it was really good, also the cakes homemade and really nice. Location is walkable to One Nimman like 20 mins but with Grab or bike you are there in no-time.
review_3_text: Thank you for providing such a wonderful stay! The drinks were great every day, especially the siu mai (steamed dumplings) they were delicious! We'll definitely come back next time, and hopefully we can book a room then. Thank you!
review_4_text: Had an absolutely amazing stay here. The rooms are so clean, comfortable and spacious. The staff are so friendly and helpful and the cafe downstairs is great. I would definitely recommend for your visit to Chiang Mai!
review_5_text:
This is my second time in Chiang Mai. This time, my friend and I stayed here for three nights. The hotel owner and two staff members were very friendly, which I think is why I love Thailand so much.
by the way the drinks here are delicious.
ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑

name: Piang Cafe Chiang Mai
review_1_text: Cute vintage cafe with delicious drinks! I had the roselle coffee üòç
review_2_text:
Tasty. Cozy with tg
he atmosphere around modern Lanna building style.
review_3_text: My favourite cafe in Suandok ‚ù§Ô∏è It's a bit hard to find if you don't live nearby, but you'll love it when you find here. The place has an antique style interior and is cosy. Love their scone and tea!
review_4_text: Possibly the best coffee I've had in Thailand. And the red velvet cake was unreal.
review_5_text: Just the perfect place for me, love the decoration and the building, peace and some green plants indoor. In the heart of the city, 5 mins from Nimman, you can escape and chill.

name: Full Of Happiness Coffee.RB (‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ ‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏Å)
review_1_text: After finishing my work, I found a small Japanese bakery. I had a hot American coffee ‚òïÔ∏è. Everyday's blend is my favorite flavor, with a good balance of sweet and sour. The music in the shop üéµ is also quite nice. I read a book üìó. I was full of happiness üòä‚òÄÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: Amazing with coffee, Java plum smoothies and also vibes, impressive with music taste ;)
review_3_text:
Visiting from Seattle,  USA!
Beautiful shop with great coffee and great taste in music! Had a cappucino and a latte, both were lovely. Staff were very sweet.
review_4_text: There are about 4 different types of coffee beans. The coffee tastes very good üôÇüëç
review_5_text: Very compact,convenient little coffee shop, but the variety of coffee beans are wide. I personally like the relaxing atmosphere. Will definitely be my regular grab&go coffee place

name: EVERGREEN COFFEE Suandok
