review_1_text: The Matcha original japan comes to your hands. After taste is guaranteed by high quality of matcha. This place suites with people who require a peace and calm. Owner is very nice and mindful.
review_2_text: I love the vibe of this place. It‚Äôs study-friendly, has a clean bathroom, and amazing matcha lattes. They serve high-quality matcha and I‚Äôm always there for it. üçµ
review_3_text: Amazing coffee, amazing staff! Very nice and peaceful cafe to sit and chill!
review_4_text: Cute coffee shop, great matcha!
review_5_text:
Lovely place with great matcha and coffee.
Staff super helpful üôå

name: Thank You Teacher & Warrior club house
review_1_text: Ordered a waffle and the waitresses forgot even i asked two times. The drinks are average.
review_2_text: Lovely location, friendly owners.
review_3_text: A lovely shop with good service, offering food and drinks. ü´∞
review_4_text:
A cute and comfortable coffee shop with a spacious interior. The coffee is strong and aromatic, and delicious.
To get to the shop, enter the alley next to the PTT gas station. Parking is available.
review_5_text:
A stylish coffee house has opened next to the first hole at the Star Dome. 
You can relax here while overlooking the course and practice range.

name: Stella Coffee
review_1_text:
Roast and Roll in Chiang Mai is a hidden gem that captures the perfect blend of ambiance, comfort, and quality. The staff here are exceptionally friendly, welcoming you with warm smiles and a genuine eagerness to make your experience enjoyable. They go out of their way to ensure you feel right at home.

The seating is wonderfully cozy, especially their comfy couches, which make it a great spot to settle in and relax. Whether you're catching up with friends or enjoying some solo time, the seating setup invites you to linger. It's the kind of place where time slips by as you sip your coffee and watch the world go by ‚Äì the people-watching here is a treat, with a lively mix of locals and travelers adding to the charm.

The coffee and food are excellent, with rich flavors and careful attention to detail. Roast and Roll strikes a perfect balance between quality and a laid-back vibe, making it a must-visit spot in Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: Lovely little caf√© for takeaway coffee. I‚Äôve been coming here for a few days now and the coffee is delicious. The lady is extremely kind and welcoming. Highly recommended!
review_3_text: Great coffee, cake was delicious. Staff are so friendly. Recommend!!!
review_4_text: Very chill  and good coffee
review_5_text: The coffee is delicious. When visiting Chieng Mai, I loved to start my days with my coffee and butter cake, and I enjoyed the great service and charming attention.

name: Hopp
review_1_text: Very chill, delicious water, cool air conditioning, very enjoyable to sit in ~
review_2_text: The iced Thai tea is delicious; creamy and well-balanced, with just the right amount of sweetness. The iced Americano, medium roast and unsweetened, has a lovely aroma and taste that I really enjoyed. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_3_text: It's a very chill working space. Every drink on the menu is high quality. It's clean. The owner is handsome and super friendly. Hahahahaha.
review_4_text: The shop is beautiful, you can sit and relax. The coffee tastes good.
review_5_text: Good coffee, friendly staff, very enjoyable.

name: Nara Coffee
review_1_text: A small shop, a small cafe under the trees, shady, cool, delicious drinks.

name: ‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≤‡∏¢ ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡πÑ‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏Å
review_1_text: Nice stand with friendly people
review_2_text: This small shop is located in the area of ‚Äã‚Äãthe Thai Post Office. They have a wide variety of drinks at reasonable prices, starting at 20 baht. Free pearls are available for regular drinks. Fresh coffee costs 35 baht and up. They have seating and a loyalty card: buy 10 cups, get 1 free. The taste is sweet and delicious. The vendors are nimble and quick. You don't have to wait long. The service is good.

name: ‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏Ç‡∏û‡∏≠‡∏î‡∏µ simply happy coffee
review_1_text:
Cozy caf√© with a garden-like atmosphere. The space is filled with large, lush trees, making it feel as if you are sitting inside a green garden rather than a caf√©

One unique highlight is the separate bookshop on site, which adds a nice, peaceful touch for those who enjoy reading or browsing books while having a drink.

The staff are very friendly and can communicate well in English, which is a big plus for international visitors. The drinks are tasty and thoughtfully presented, with nice attention to detail. Overall, it‚Äôs a great spot to relax, enjoy good coffee, and slow down for a while.
review_2_text:
Amazing!

Thai tea 65 ‡∏ø (2025)

Has English menu.

Stumbled upon this lovely cafe and I am so glad. The entrance had me at Hobbiton vibe.

Such a nice homey place, with seating inside and outside, a super giant tree like Ehwa tree in Avatar.

I am sold at hello.

Thai tea was good, a little too sweet to my liking although I already requested half sweet.

The outside environment is best, okay quiet, but may have mosquitos.

And there have some live music performance on certain dates with artist.

I think this place has not blown up in IG yet, and secretly I wish it never will so it would keep its nice charm, but how selfish I am.
review_3_text:
Best coffee shop. Such beautiful atmosphere here, with astonishing trees, great coffee and artists. They have lovely and tender performance here.
I found this magic little place, makes my Sunday happy.
review_4_text:
Good place to get a coffe and relax.

Not ideal for working with laptop cuz no proper sits with charger.

They have a big tree in the garden that make the atmosphere very nice üëç

Coffe not expensive.

Service was great. They are very nice and friendly!
review_5_text:
Nice cafe with small outdoor garden.
Nice place to hang out with friends.
Quite a lot of seats hiding in the garden.

name: Treespresso cafe
review_1_text: Grabbed a quick coffee here and loved the relaxed atmosphere of the shop. The tree in the middle of the yard is beautiful and we loved the peaceful vibe. Staff are great, prices are good. I love when coffee shops serve a small glass of water with a coffee -- it's the little things. We would come back again for coffee and to give the food a try.
review_2_text: Absolutely wonderful hot cappuccino and a wonderful beautiful garden area spend your afternoon
review_3_text:
Our work spot for the day.

Small cafe with a large outdoor space. We sat outdoor today as the weather is cloudy and the large tree canopy keeps the area pretty cool.

I love the rattan pool deck chairs ... U can easily fall asleep here üò¥üò¥üò¥

F&B :
Orange Tea was good. The base tea tastes like thai tea and the orange flavour pairs well with this black tea.

Biscoff machiatto
Didnt like this at all unfortunately. Shall have to try something else next time üòÖ

Parking : within compound
review_4_text:
Serene place to get coffee. Quiet and comfortable.
Plenty of parking space too.
review_5_text:
Pleasant Experience:
It was really pleasant surprise having a light meal at Treespresso Cafe. Everything from coffee & soda to main course as well as dessert were delicious and presented in a very impressive way. It is gem hidden in a narrow ally but credit goes to my wife Eram who discovered it. Staff were also courteous and helpful in selecting items. Overall it was an excellent experience & we both enjoyed a lot.

name: SEUA
review_1_text: Great little cafe in a quiet little street. They have put in a lot of effort to succesfully create a  fabulous Xmasy atmosphere this december! Big presies tower at the entrance  and Xmas trees inside. There's also a small gallery and a small co-working space. Definitely worth a visit!
review_2_text: Seua is super cool! It's very chic and arty. Nice vibes. Wonderful Thai soul songs. Wonderful to sip coffee and chill out in this beautiful cafe!
review_3_text: Really cool cafe. The atmosphere is quite chill. They served good coffee. Both cappuccino and dirty were great and full of flavor. One of the shops you can sit and sip all they long.
review_4_text: The store was super cute and Christmasy, latte was nice
review_5_text: I ordered one hot americano and iced latte, and they were tasty and worth spending. The coffee mainly tasted fruity with medium roasted beans. The baristas were so nice and friendly. Its location was near Chiang Mai railway station by 5-min walking. Personally, I will come back again in the next trip to CNX.

name: ‡∏°‡∏¥‡πà‡∏á‡∏°‡∏¥‡∏ï‡∏£ ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü
review_1_text:
Always reliable.

Es Yen.  Thai Style Coffee - strong but not sweet.  Delicious

Bold coffee flavors and delicious drinks ... hot or cold. Hydrate with a refreshing Italian Soda before heading into the heat.

Convenient location at RimPing Supermarket for a quick cup before shopping.
review_2_text: Excellent coffee shop. Located inside the shopping mall.  Nice cool AC inside.  Fast friendly service.
review_3_text:
Good taste
Good service
Good mood
review_4_text:
One of the few cafes around here that was open early.
Fast service and cozy layout.
review_5_text: Their iced latte was super good that I had even take away after having one cup there. yummy!!

name: Minimal coffee Sanpakoi
review_1_text:
Delicious coffee drinks at this always reliable chain of coffee shops.

Great break before or after shopping at San Pa Koi Market.   Large picture window is great for people watching at this popular market.
review_2_text: The strength is the coffee, the weakness is the service. I never have high expectations because it's always the same every time I come here. üòÖ
review_3_text: What a great find. I'll definitely be back. 45 baht hot latte with a choice of light, medium or dark roasted coffee grown here in Thailand. Friendly staff, great seating indoors and out.
review_4_text: Good quality for affordable price coffee. üòç
review_5_text: Delicious cappuccino, friendly service, great prices and atmosphere.

name: Pour&Purr Home cafe
review_1_text: Excellent coffee with local beans roasted by the owner on site.
review_2_text: Best latte we've had in Thailand
review_3_text: The coffee is excellent and the shop has so many interesting things, mostly antiques. You can also buy a guitar there.
review_4_text: Good coffee with a well-rounded flavor. Coffee lovers shouldn't miss this place. The owner is cute, friendly, and speaks politely. The atmosphere is chill and cute. I highly recommend it. ‚òïüçµ The green tea is also well-rounded and delicious. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_5_text: A small but very nice caf√©. Owned by someone who moved from Bangkok to Chiang Mai, and it shows. It has a great urban feel. Really good music. Beautiful decor. Very friendly, open-minded people. Great homemade coffee and iced tea.

name: Bus Coffee
review_1_text: A very cute little coffee shop, where we got to drink delicious coffee each morning for a few days üòå Best coffee in town for a fair price! Very friendly and warmhearted owners - you should definitely try them out! ‚òÄÔ∏è
review_2_text:
25B for coffee latte. (Actually it seems everything is 25B)

This is a home cafe, nice.

It‚Äôs cozy and relax, and coffee is good.

Good to come and enjoy.
review_3_text:
Nice change of pace.

Refreshing blue lemon soda.  Crispy and delicious seeded cookies.

No smoking.
review_4_text:
Great coffee,friendly staff well worth a visit coffee 25 Baht
Now they only do takeaway drinks.
Still good quality coffee at a reasonable price and nice owners.
review_5_text: Friendly staff,  cheap local coffee place with good Gaffey(coffee in Thai) Could use a better fan system and a toilet

name: Hebi cafe - ‡πÄ‡∏Æ‡∏∞‡∏ö‡∏¥‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: This is one of the best coffee shops in Chiang Mai, located on a quiet street. I highly recommend the waffle ‚Äî it‚Äôs crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The beverages are also great, and the prices are reasonable. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to relax and escape the noise of the town. The owner, Sun, is so kind and welcoming. I truly enjoyed my time at Hebi ‚Äî thank you so much! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: Such a cute and cozy little caf√© with incredibly friendly staff. Easily one of the best cups of coffee you‚Äôll find in Chiang Mai!
review_3_text: Great local coffee shop across from our hotel. A daily stop (sometimes twice per day :)) for me during our stay. Warm, welcoming, friendly Thai hospitality along with delicious expresso and ice coffee. If you're lucky, you might even get to meet Meg and Seymour, the resident cats üêà. Highly recommend!
review_4_text: My one of the favorite coffee places in Chiang Mai. So friendly and helpful owner. Best Matcha Latte so far. This place has lovely friendly cats
review_5_text: such a cute coffee shop, the lady who served me was so sweet. Made a great iced oat latte. Will definitely be returning whilst I‚Äôm in Chiang Mai.

name: ‡∏ô.‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏∏‡∏™‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏ô‡∏ß‡∏•
review_1_text: Stumbled into this coffee shop while exploring this street. It‚Äôs looks so unassuming but once you step inside, it‚Äôs like a Coca Cola museum üòÇ delicious coffee at half the price charged by other hipster coffee places in town (40 THB for a great cup of hot latte) and even though I didn‚Äôt get to try any of the pastries, they were all decently priced and looks delicious. Owner is friendly too!
review_2_text:
Coca cola collectors will love this coffeeshop . Cabinets full of coke and other soda cans.

Simply seating but good vibes overall

Parking : Kerbside only

Seating : indoor , non- air-conditioned
review_3_text: Cozy neighborhood coffee shop with classic vibes. Good coffee at great prices, this shop is like a small step back in time. Nice to sit outside and watch the street go by, and if I lived in the neighborhood I imagine I'd come here often. Owners are very friendly. Some small pastries available.
review_4_text: Really nice atmos. The owners are super sweet. Coffee is great. Recommended!!!
review_5_text: good coffee at affordable prices. fun collections of books and stuff to look at and bring back the old days to my mind.

name: good coffee
review_1_text:
I'm trying to support local businesses in my area in Chiang Mai.
I saw this coffee shop and gave it a try.
The coffee was okay. Irs got a weird aftertaste. I think 7-ELEVEN is better. That's just my opinion.  You also get more for your money.
The guy was really polite.
I also like the decor of the coffee shop.
review_2_text: One of the best places for get a strong and cheap coffee in Chiang Mai ! And very good service in a nice atmosphere üëçüëçüëç
review_3_text: Had hot thai tea because of very salty meal at northern eatery not too far away. Gd place to relax as it was drizzly too. Good pricing.
review_4_text: Love this place! Very friendly owners who speak good English and Thai, really good fresh Thai coffee, delicious Thai food, WIFI and a great little outdoor garden seating area, at the front of the cafe. This is a place I love to come for a few hours to relax, read a book or meet friends. A nice relaxing atmosphere.
review_5_text: Local fresh coffee shop with local price

name: LA-MOON COFFEE
review_1_text: Amazing service and great coffee, the Italian sodas are so refreshing. A gem of a coffee stop, we kept going back while in Chiang Mai
review_2_text: Very nice coffee. And very friendly people.
review_3_text: The orange coffee is delicious. The seller is very pretty.

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏à‡∏á ‡∏ä‡∏á ‡∏î‡∏µ ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏™‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏õ‡πà‡∏≠‡∏¢
review_1_text:
Delicious Southern Thai tea.
The taste is good.
Good value for money.
review_2_text: This is incredibly strong southern Thai tea. It makes me miss home in the south.
review_3_text: I ordered 50% sweetness but received very sweet tea. It couldn't be changed because it was already brewed.

name: Box coffee‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏õ‡∏¥‡∏á
review_1_text:
ive gone here a handful of times and its been consistently good. 5/5

Bonus: stamp card,get 10 stamps= 1 free coffee.
Extra bonus: shop kitty!!!
review_2_text: Very lovely service, nice take away coffee or also seat next to the desk
review_3_text: Very, very good coffee üôÇ

name: La-Moon
review_1_text:
Super cute corner coffee shop with all the Thai milk drinks you could hope for! üßã most reasonable prices I‚Äôve seen by far with quick service and a very kind and welcoming vendor!

I‚Äôd recommend this place over any other vendor for your daily coffee/tea üòã. Glad I discovered this place on my last day! ‚ù§Ô∏è

(I‚Äôd already drank 1/3 of my drink in the photo haha)
review_2_text: A great little caf√© with unbeatable prices. The owner is very friendly and works so quickly. It's definitely worth a visit!
review_3_text: The coffee is fragrant, strong, and has a well-rounded flavor. I highly recommend it.

name: VOLKS charoenmuang : bagels and coffee
review_1_text: I stumbled upon this place on a quick run to my school. I tried their americano - on the lighter side. But my favorite was the blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese. Everything was so delicious and a cute cozy shop to explore for breakfast in chiang mai
review_2_text: I love this amazing BLT bagel sandwich with egg added. Highly recommend!!!
review_3_text: ‚Äúvery friendly service and good breakfast/ brunch options‚Äù ü•∞ü•∞
review_4_text: Wide variety of bagels with a unique texture. The crust is crunchy while the airy and chewy interiors make Volks bagels a great way to start your day. Limited seating for the pop up format.
review_5_text: Amazing Bagles in city ü§§

name: Chakaimuk ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÑ‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏Å‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏° ‡∏™‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏õ‡πà‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡πà‡∏≠‡∏¢ by ‡∏ô‡∏π‡πã‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏î
review_1_text: Very friendly attendant, quality product and fair price. I recommend!
review_2_text: A cafe in front of Sankeppai Market. The friendly owner makes me want to come here every day. It's the perfect place to eat at the market and enjoy bubble tea. They also sell small figurines, so kids will love it.
review_3_text: Good taste, reasonable price, cute seller, very good service, there is a place to sit and wait in front of the shop.

name: coffee
review_1_text: Coffee was very good, affordable and fast!

name: La Leng Kaffee
review_1_text: Look around the tiny little place and you can tell from all those coffee-related paraphernalia that they are serious about their hsnd roasted coffee. Very good coffee. Don't be surprised by non-coffee stuff. The place sells motorcycle spare parts on ebay. So I've heard.
review_2_text: Happy üòä
review_3_text: It was fun to help you make your own coffee, and the taste was amazing! Above all, the cozy atmosphere and the owner were pleasant and friendly. It was the best :-)
review_4_text:
Coffee shop near Chiang Mai train station.

The coffee beans are roasted by hand, ground fresh for you, and the service is outstanding.

The coffee has a flavor that will surprise you.

name: ‡πÇ‡∏ã‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå
review_1_text: Just visit during weekday
review_2_text: This was fantastic! My train was at 9:35, and I arrived by motorcycle taxi at 9:31. Immediately, a staff member asked if I was taking the 9:35 train, directed me to the counter to buy a ticket, and showed me which vehicle to take, ensuring I caught the train on time. The service was amazing!
review_3_text: OK
review_5_text: Cool, relaxed

name: Black Single Coffee Bar
review_1_text: A fantastic little coffee shop run by two talented baristas. I‚Äôve been coming here for years, but I‚Äôve never written a review before, this place deserves a good one. The guys that run this place have great taste, and take a lot of pride in giving you the best possible coffee at a very reasonable price.. what more could you ask for? I like a hot cappuccino and theirs is perfect for 55 baht. Most places charge almost 100 baht for a cappuccino that doesn‚Äôt measure up to theirs. These guys  take great pride in their work and it‚Äôs a pleasure to see and an even greater pleasure to taste their coffee. The atmosphere is nice, they played great music, but the coffee is the main reason for visiting this establishment. Give B.S.C a try, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
review_2_text: Small place, good vibe, and great price. Most important, the coffee was delicious! Another place to add to my list of Chiang Mai coffee shops to return to
review_3_text: With only one week in Chiang Mai I set out to see and try new coffee shops but by day two I stumbled upon Black Single Coffee and fell in love with this beautiful little shop! The shop itself is smaller but maturely decorated, with unique black and white decor, a cozy but refreshing environment! The owner works daily to craft and design delicious, affordable, and beautiful coffee!!! No better way to start a morning then with a sunrise walk, adorable latte art, bible study, and a welcoming smile from our wonderful barista!!! The coffee itself is delicious and carefully crafted to perfection! If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet coffee this isn‚Äôt it, but if you want a genuinely amazing drink this is the place! The latte art is truly incredible and always brought a smile to my face, I‚Äôll be admiring it forever! Thank you so much Pan for a lovely week of coffee and smiles!!!! ü§é‚òïÔ∏è
review_4_text: This coffee shop provides an outstanding informative experience. The bartista provides you with 3 different coffee bean roasts to choose from. He will share a little taste and flavor information and you can select your bean.  You can also mix beans.  The dude who works here is pretty charming and it is nice to watch him chat about his passion. I recommend this coffee shop. There is No legal car parking here.
review_5_text:
This is a very popular coffee shop in Chiang Mai with the locals and tourists.
The vibe in this cafe is so cool. The decor is spot on. üëå
This is the kind of place you just want to sit and chill.

The seating is limited on the inside.  There is also seating on the outside.
The Barista is the skills. I was so impressed with his pour. It tasted great as well. He I the best Barista I've seen in my travels.  The menu for the coffee was great.

name: P E A N U T . P A T T E R Cafe
review_1_text: We waited there for out train and it was the perfect spot. Very reasonably priced, good wifi, clean toilet. We ordered the signature coffee drink and later a cocoa and thai tea and all three drinks really tasted sooo good. Absolutely recommend stopping by!
review_2_text: Google maps says its open today from 8am.  Im standing in front of the cafe at 10.15am and its closed.  Typical.
review_3_text: Just outside of the Chiang Mai train station. Fantastic drinks at more than reasonable prices. The environment is great for getting some work done before catching a train. The toilet is very clean.
review_4_text:
Comfortable place to chill on a hot afternoon.
3mins walk to the train station
review_5_text: Such a vibe here üòå I like this caf√© so much.

name: LATIBULE INK&CAFE
review_1_text: A lovely Cozy Cafe with great Coffee. The baristas are skilled and welcoming, just like their furry friends (the cats are adorable). For me though, the highlight is found in the back of the coffee shop where I got a phenomenal stick and poke tattoo, the requested design was even better than I imagined and she really took her time with the tattoo, patiently perfecting it. 100% recommend for anybody looking for a highly skilled stick and poke artist or great coffee üêà
review_2_text: What a lovely place . The cafe owners are really welcoming and friendly.
review_3_text: Nice Coffee!!! Good Vibe
review_4_text: Nice cafe, good coffee, and cute tattoo works!!
review_5_text: Niceüëç

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏¢‡∏° ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏à‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏ç‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á Niyomcoffee
review_1_text:
Very kind and friendly people! Fast service and a really nice latte. And I‚Äôve had some amazing lattes in my life living in Vancouver and South America. I‚Äôll definitely come back here again.

Also they have a huge selection, good prices, lots of little snacks, and a lovely outdoor covered area to sit and enjoy your coffee.

If you‚Äôre in the area definitely come for a coffee üëåüèº

I got a latte (see photo)
review_2_text: I've been coming to Niyom Coffee here in Chiang Mai since it opened on 23.12.2016. Mon & K the sister brother owners are friendly & fabulous at making my favourite Lattecinos.. all snacks & drinks are high quality & very reasonably priced. K & Mon's other staff  including Daeng & Arm are great too! Highly recommended! Thanks guys!
review_3_text: I always order the light roast Americano from both branches ‚Äî it‚Äôs my go-to! The flavor is aromatic, and perfectly balanced. The quality is consistent every time, and the baristas really know how to bring out the best in the beans.
review_4_text: Nice staff,  good drink
review_5_text: Super coffee, friendly service, price just right

name: Minimal Coffee - ‡∏™‡∏ñ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏µ‡∏£‡∏ñ‡πÑ‡∏ü
review_1_text: Great modern coffeebar with super friendly staff.
review_2_text: Solid cup of Joe. Chill vibes, good spot to kill a little time if you're catching/getting off a bus around the corner, and want some good coffee and some AC.
review_3_text: Good coffee, lovely and friendly staff. Great place to exercise at the train park and then chill out afterwards. Perfect!
review_4_text: After getting off the train, I went straight to drink coffee and immediately turned on my computer to work. I remember it used to be a small shop, but now it's become very big.
review_5_text:
Strong coffee, friendly staff, and comfortable seating.
This cafe is open early, which is great (7:00 AM - 4:00 PM), but I'm a little disappointed that it closes a bit early.

name: Bogie Coffee Bar
review_1_text: amazing coffee with very kid and sweet owner
review_2_text:
Cute caf√© right on the street. With seating.

A wide selection of coffees and teas. The service is very friendly.

It's perfect for a quick break after arriving by train.

The view isn't breathtaking, but it's quite fun to watch all the drivers.
review_3_text: The coffee is good and delicious, and the atmosphere is nice and relaxing.

name: Chimm coffee
review_1_text: I highly recommend this! Cocoa lovers are going to love it. The flavor is super intense‚ÄîI‚Äôm definitely coming back for more.
review_2_text: Staff are very friendly and Chimm coffee must try
review_3_text: Went there for the macha latte was really good hit for the gym üí™üèΩ. Gave me lot of energy. Will go again. Great customer service as well very kind. And they had vegan milk options
review_4_text: love this espresso and americano
review_5_text: Creamy and rich matcha at a very reasonable price.

name: BIG Body Coffee ‡πÄ‡∏à‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏ç‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á
review_1_text: The best coffeeshop
review_2_text: One of my favorite coffee shop ü•∞ great coffee here!
review_3_text: Good coffee and very friendly barista / owner
review_4_text:
I just visited BIG Body Coffee for the first time, and I can say that I was impressed from the moment I stepped inside. üíõ

The shop is small but very cute. The atmosphere is warm and professional, yet not too formal. The walls are lined with SCA certificates. You can tell the baristas here aren't just playing around with coffee. ‚òï

I ordered an iced Americano in Omkoi‚Äîit was incredibly fragrant and had a full body, truly living up to the name "Big Body." üëç

The counter has a selection of coffee beans, including Nicaragua, Kenya, and Honduras. Perfect for coffee lovers who love to try new things. Every cup seems to have its own story.

Overall, this shop is incredibly attentive to every detail: the coffee, the atmosphere, and the decor.
If you enjoy good coffee with a touch of dedication, I highly recommend you give it a try. ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: A cute coffee shop with a selection of specialty coffee beans. The prices are very good and the quality is also very good. The owner is a roaster with a lot of knowledge and experience about coffee.

name: Baan Tookata cafe
review_1_text: welcoming and friendly space with best prices and flavors. Near railway station. Highly recommended to feel Chiang Mai vibe.
review_2_text: This is my favourite cafe in Chiang Maiü•∫‚ô•Ô∏èShe is very lovely and makes the best coffee and teas. I absolutely love her service. I‚Äôm so obsessed with this place üî•üî•üî•üôèüôèüôèüôè
review_3_text:
Such a cozy spot with friendly service!
Absolutely magnificent vegetarian Belgian waffles! It's rare to find them egg-free and this perfect. They were light, crispy, and delicious with honey. The cappuccino was expertly made, too. A truly high-quality breakfast experience. Highly recommended!
review_4_text: Lovely friendly owner, great service and products.
review_5_text: Good coffee and many many cool places

name: Lanpoh Coffee
review_1_text: Excellent food, cozy atmosphere, it's a hidden gem. Recommended and will definitely be back for more.
review_2_text:
Max and Kai are two /wonderful/ people. Their coffee is amazing (could do with a bit less ice, though) and their food is great. The prices are a bit steep for your average Thai places (I top out at 40 baht most places) but it's worth it for the atmosphere if you don't mind paying for that sort of thing. It also helps to know a bit of Thai, too, because Max and Kai tend to like to talk to you and get to know you better, especially if you live in the area. It's sort of off-the-beaten path and I've never seen more than two other people there.

tl;dr Great place, great food, just a tad steep on the average Thai prices.
review_3_text: Great coffee and tea drinks, fast WiFi, and a beautiful patio with lots of fans.  Off the main road, so look for the chalkboard sign.
review_4_text: Nice atmosphere. Food and drinks are delicious and beautiful!

name: ‡∏≠‡∏¥‡∏™‡∏¢‡∏≤‡∏´‡πå ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÄ‡πÄ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏î - Isaiah Coffee
review_1_text: Lovely coffee, dark or medium roast to order. Phan, the owner is really lovely and friendly and helpful. I recommend calling in here!
review_2_text: Love this coffee shop great coffee I call in  everyday now great service the owner is a beautiful young girl always smiling and a great atmosphere please try this place as its just opened üòä
review_3_text: Coffee deliciouse. The owner is very kind and nice. Ill come back definitely.
review_4_text: Young owner barista very hardworking all by herself!
review_5_text: A beautiful young woman skillfully makes delicious coffee. Her smile makes me feel at ease. If it were close to my house, I would want to stop by every day.

name: Slope motion studio&cafe
review_1_text:
I like the Thai Tea, taste is good. The garden is nice, the cats is nice too.
They have smoke area seperately
review_2_text: Came here for a drink after visiting wat pha lat and had a delicious iced green tea and flat white. Also loved playing the guitar they had on hand! Staff were super friendly and attentive
review_3_text: Fantastic cafe to come and relax whilst you‚Äôre serenaded by various acoustic artists.  Plenty of seating outdoors, good WiFi and power points inside of you want to work.  Coffee is great and costs 55 baht for a latte.  Highly recommend this little oasis in suburbia! #BeatTheGrind
review_4_text: Nice place for chill out in the afternoon. Tasty coffee with relaxing environment! Good location around Chiang Mai University area.
review_5_text: Good coffee , Nature & Relex atmosphere

name: Plearn cafe : ‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ô ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà ‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á ‡∏°‡∏ä.
review_1_text:
tables and chairs are uncomfortable for tall people at all!
coffee is so-so maybe i did a wrong choice to light roast‚Ä¶it taste too sour
but i like the big tree growing from the coffee house.it‚Äôs chill and happy to have my coffee with the ancient tree
i like the atmosphere(though AC was too cold!)so i did a drawing of this little cafe
review_2_text: The cafe is built with a tall tree jutting from its center. That itself is pretty cool. It has both covered seating downstairs and a rather un-maintained terrace upstairs (could use some TLC and cleaning). The drinks were not very good but the staff were friendly.
review_3_text: Lovely small coffee shop. Here provides drinks and desserts. Brownie is super tasty, drinks are great, love it. Will definitely come back if I visit Chiang Mai.
review_4_text: Ordered via grab : Thai tea and banana cake were very good but the french fries were the worst I had ever had - undercooked, no salt - impossible to eat
review_5_text:
Good place for local coffee but good taste!
More local coffee place. Coffee price start from 50THB. Middle roasted coffee bean is recommended!

name: Fav. coffee roaster - Umong
review_1_text: Very good coffee for only 50 baht! ‚òïÔ∏è I was surprised by how many choices they have on the menu for such a small coffee shop. The staff were really nice, and I was so glad I found this place. If I lived in Chiang Mai, I would definitely come here every day. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: Dirty coffee has quickly become my favorite. This caf√© serves one that‚Äôs perfectly roasted, with a rich smoky depth while staying smooth and wonderfully aromatic. Ïª§ÌîºÎßõÏùÄ Î¨ºÎ°†Ïù¥Í≥† Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞ÍπåÏßÄ thumbs up.
review_3_text:
Really good iced Thai tea and latte.
The quantity is smaller but it's not diluted down by 50% ice.
Rich, smooth dreamy caffeine experience.

If you sit behind the barista it is a quieter place. You can watch the road and people go by from the front, although noisy.
review_4_text:
I‚Äôve been coming here every morning for many weeks, and I can honestly say that Fav.Coffee Roaster is by far the best coffee in the hood.

The super friendly staff makes every visit a delight, and the nice atmosphere provides the perfect setting to start my day. The quality of the coffee and the warm vibe of the place have truly made an impression on me‚ÄîI will miss it when I have to move on.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a top-notch coffee experience!
review_5_text:
Wonderful little coffee joint in Suthep. Great coffee and vibe. Defo be back.

Just off the roadside, so can chill and watch the world go by.

name: Tantawan Caf√©
review_1_text: We loved our time at the Tanawan Cafe. The donuts were large and very tasty. The service was excellent.  We lived playing with the cats while we wipped our coffee. They were so friendly and playful. The space is very thoughtful with colorful vintage feel. Definitely worth a visit!
review_2_text:
Cute, somewhat nostalgically designed, student-oriented cafe with a homey hospitality. The solo lady manning the operations is very friendly and the kittens rather naughty üò∏üòª (they got rounded up and sent to the back one time üòÜ).

It's quiet here as it's in a small alley. The clientele are mostly students having lunch and studying.

I like stopping by here because of the donuts. Homemade, old school type with some meat to it rather than a modern-day airy light one. They're not special on their own but in the atmosphere of this bright yellow space, it feels specialüåª
review_3_text: Great little cafe with such lovely and kind staff. During my stay in Chiang Mai I visited the cafe every morning for iced coffee and donuts and everything was perfection. The vibe is cosy and homely, I felt very comfortable inside.
review_4_text: a cozy place with a very nice owner who makes you feel welcome :) the donut and the drink were absolutely amazing, 200% recommend this place !!
review_5_text: Freshly baked donuts with a variety of flavors, a nice place with a great environment for a quiet afternoon break, and a very friendly welcome. I will definitely come back kaa üç©ü§é

name: Roslamoon Coffee - ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏£‡∏™‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏ô
review_1_text: Great little coffee spot. Friendly staff, fair priced and tasty coffee.
review_2_text:
My Thai milk tea is very good.
It‚Äôs a small store with some chairs and tables.
In the morning there are many people come to buy take away drinks so I have to wait a bit long.
It‚Äôs cute that the staff writes ‚Äòhave a nice day‚Äô on the cup.
review_3_text: Picked up Thai tea here. The quality of the drink was great, but I waited for 20+ minutes to get my drink.
review_4_text: Lovely place, great coffee and music. You can use as working place.
review_5_text: Friendly, Comfy, Chit chat with friends

name: Matchi Matchi
review_1_text: Enjoyed the matcha soft serve. Chilled at the cafe for a while after check out to pass the time. Great ambience, especially the songs played. Would return to try more of their menu.
review_2_text: The matcha pudding was too bitter, and the dessert portion was too small for the price. The place is cute and unique, and I love the vibes.
review_3_text:
Checked out this popular matcha caf√© in Chiang Mai and it did not disappoint üçµüíö

We got the classic + matcha choux, soft serve (cutely served btw), and my forever fave ‚Äî rare cheesecake üòç

The whole place is super cozy and cute. Totally in love with the vibe! ‚ú®
review_4_text: first time in chiang mai and so first time in this coffee shop! my family and me spent a lovely time there, where we tried different deserts and drinks that were all really good! plus the staff was really nice and the atmosphere is just the perfect amount of calm :) highly recommend!
review_5_text: I‚Äôm so glad I stopped here for some ice cream. The food was delicious and well prepared, and the vibes are fun. Come here when you want something cute and to feel good. The staff is very friendly. I highly recommend!

name: 9 Siblings Restaurant
review_1_text:
I‚Äôd added 9 Siblings to my list before my trip to Thailand. I think I‚Äôd seen it mentioned by a YouTuber previously.

Either way, I was not disappointed. I ate there twice during my few days in Chiang Mai. I‚Äôm 100% sure I‚Äôd have ended up back there again if not for being caught out by the 8pm closing time.

The decor was nice and their vibe was nice, chill and casual, perfect for a solo traveller. The staff were lovely friendly too.

For breakfast I had one of the set menu choices and on the same day, I went back for dinner and got their beef khao soi to takeaway. Unfortunately I got there close to closing time so I took it back to my hotel room to eat. It was SO unbelievably good!!

It was my first time ever trying khao soi so I have nothing to compare it to but wow, the flavours, the tender beef, the broth, the onions adding a extra zing, the portion size, everything about it was chefs kiss. And to think it only cost 100 baht.

If I‚Äôd had more time in Chiang Mai, I would‚Äôve gone back to try the chicken khao soi as well as many other things on their menu. Yum.
review_2_text: This restaurant was a 30 minute walk from our hotel, but I feel it was worth it. It was one of the best Khao Soi I have had in Chiang Mai. Friendly staff, and a quaint clean atmosphere. Would eat there again.
review_3_text:
I really liked this place!
Loved the atmosphere and the staff, especially the elderly people working there are absolute sweethearts! ü´∂üèª The food was good and we paid a total of 260 baht for food and drinks for two people.
review_4_text:
The food was more suited to foreigners than authentic Thai. The Pad Thai was edible, but not very good. The flavor wasn't very intense (I'm not talking about spicy).

The place is cozy with Lego elements (there's also a display), although the name doesn't suggest it. The downside is that the staff doesn't clean the tables regularly, so you have to eat in an atmosphere of dirty tables.

My visit was at the end of October.
review_5_text:
Lovely little Khao soi place hidden 5mins away from the gate market. Very tender chicken drumsticks and flavourful broth.
The stirred pork was also very tender.
Worth a visit if u are in the area.

name: OWL brasserie
review_1_text: A great fusion experience. You'll love the place when you enter the front gate and walk through the courtyard, inside the restaurant it's nice, spacious and cozy. They change menu every 4 months and you can tell from the menu and the food that the chef knows how to cook cuisines from all over the world, I only ordered 4 dishes and I can taste Asian, Italian, Spanish and French, everything was cooked to perfection and the service is also very good, I'd love to come again for sure!
review_2_text: Been here twice in a week.  Cooking was excellent. We had the Akami ceviche, beef tartare, coq co vin, and risotto. You can tell the care and passion they put in to it. Ten out of ten. ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: Food is super duper delicious. Services are incredible. Most of ingredients are self-made by Chef. All dishes I ordered were yummy. Really recommended that you need to try and you will have the 2nd and 3rd time for sure. It‚Äôs worth your spending.
review_4_text: Food is creative and flavourful. After an amazing dinner we had to come back for lunch a few days later. Second visit did not disappoint. I am surprised they don‚Äôt have a Michelin Star.
review_5_text:
This is truly one of the best Western restaurants in Chiang Mai.
We had originally booked a table for dinner, but due to a change in our schedule, we visited earlier in the afternoon instead.
Although the lunch menu offered fewer selections, the quality and flavor of the dishes remained outstanding. Highly recommended.

name: yield coffee
review_1_text: Great newly opened modern cafe that gives you a different vibe than most others and it feels a bit like a bar sort of. The drinks are great and reasonably priced for the space and there are some comfy chairs. I like the vibe and there is a few good tables. Since this place is fairly new, everything is clean and nice.
review_2_text: Cool oldies music. Trendy and relaxing. Enjoyed a nice coffee (for me) post lunch. Not busy when we visited.
review_3_text:
Cute little caf√© with reasonable price.
Love the vibes here so much it‚Äôs super instagenic !

Plenty of parking spot as well.
review_4_text: A nice coffee shop near the old town. The coffee tastes great, the prices are reasonable, and the owner has great taste in music ‚Äì the playlist is really goodÔºÅLove it!
review_5_text:
Good coffee made to order.Light roast blend of Thai and Ethiopia.
Looks like a good work space.

name: Mom and Me
review_1_text:
This place is really popular, so expected a short wait for a table - it's a small place.
The menu is good and has some Thai dishes and western style breakfast too.
Our dishes were great and the atmosphere and ambience is cute.
review_2_text: I absolutely loved this place!! We came here for breakfast and while the service was on the slower side, the food, lattes and juices were incredible. I could smell her cooking the garlic chicken in the back and the taste of that crispy garlic is still making my mouth water. The vibe in the restaurant is also really cool and very peaceful. Highly recommend for some good coffee and breakfast.
review_3_text:
A nice breakfast retaurant.

Its very small, with only a few tables, so recommend getting here early.

The service was great, coffee strong and food tasty. A nice way to start the day.

We had avacardo on toast qith scrambled egg.  Two coffee's and a ginger tea.  It came in less than 200b per person.

The portions were very generous.
review_4_text: If you‚Äôre looking for good chicken, this is the place to go! A lovely family run restaurant tucked off the a main Street - super quiet and peaceful in the garden. Also incredibly cheap - what‚Äôs not to like!
review_5_text:
My canteen!
I've been coming here every lunchtime for a month now. The food is excellent and lovingly prepared by Li and her daughter.
The setting, filled with flowers and plants, is also very soothing and relaxing.
I highly recommend it !

name: Maison Maison
review_1_text: This spot is a gem, it‚Äôs very yummy and great atmosphere. We were 8 people and we sat upstairs for breakfast, the food was really good but not cheap. I took the waffles with strawberries and blueberries and they were really pretty and good. Everyone liked the food and the service was really nice. The only thing is that some of the chocolates are kinda bitter just so people know
review_2_text: We came here because a popular spot down the street was too busy.. and we are so glad we found this place! Absolutely delicious. It‚Äôs very quaint, quick service, and nice people. The best breakfast we have had in Chiang Mai. Would definitely return and recommend to anyone. We LOVED the waffle with berries. The all meat breakfast was great as well as the flat white (with oatmilk).
review_3_text:
Absolutely delicious, it‚Äôs next to Sun Ray‚Äôs which is really popular and everyone is going there. We have been there too yesterday so we could compare. Maison Maison has more options and food is absolutely delicious and healthy! Besides that it‚Äôs als bigger and the places to sit is perfect and more comfortable!

The people who are working there are also really nice and respectful. I would recommend it. For us it was 10 out of 10
review_4_text: I ended up here by chance because the place I initially wanted was too crowded and it turned out to be a great discovery. Calm atmosphere, excellent bowls and smoothies, friendly staff and really good quality. Highly recommended.
review_5_text:
Well plated acai bowl. warm and cozy environment.

The owner should give the two staff a raise. they were both so friendly and did their best to recommend meals and answer all my questions!

name: Area 41 Coffee&Cafe
review_1_text: The ice coffee latte is not bad, with a bit sweetness. Also provides special menu allowing people to experience something different.The shop facing the main road, traffic is busy on weekdays, but bright and ok soundproofing as long as the music broadcasting or customers talking too loud.  Seems like local people like to chill here too.
review_2_text:
Made from the help with the blind.Good quality Coffee. Carefully made drinks and cakes were exceptionally good taste too, especially Young Coconut Cake.
Price friendly cakes here too and the quality are exceptionally good.
Clean and good seating.
Highly recommend.
review_3_text:
This is in conjunction with the blind people education. I feel great to have found this and support it.

It has cozy sitting, inside and outside. Beautiful and quiet and clean.

Latte 50B comes with a beautiful foam deco, it is a flower, can you see?

I really enjoy this place. Thank you for keep the maintenance hard work!
review_4_text:
Nice coffee with very aesthetic vibes!

Aircon was crisp, prices were fair (~50 THB per drink) and it‚Äôs very cool to see they have their entire menu available in braille! Plenty of both indoor and outdoor seating available.

Highly recommend anyone coming here before/after the Shabu Buffet next door like we did ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text: Good place to rest and have a coffee after hhot day outside

name: Phordee Bistro
review_1_text:
I like Phordee Bistro a lot, I keep going back for brunch or lunch.
Good food, nice people, a cosy and comfortable air-con place.
Today I went back again for lunch; I had Kaeng Hang Lay (northern pork belly curry) , Kai Dou (fried egg), Khao Suay (plain rice), washed down with a soda.
And then chilled over an hour nursing a capaccino, and had a durian ice lollly before I tore myself away.
Good job, Phordee Bistro!
review_2_text: This was a wonderful place to have a delicious meal. I ordered the green curry vegetarian, which included oyster mushrooms. The owner added eggplant, per my request. The plating was divine, the details with the flowers and the leaves made the presentation of the food much better. The papaya salad was delicious as well. I‚Äôm definitely coming back.
review_3_text: Absolutely delicious! Ordered Green Papaya Salad (spicy) and Coconut Chicken soup (not spicy) with LOTS of fresh veggies, lemongrass and ginger. The soup is worth the trip alone. The fries were great. Everything was proper temperature. Service was super and server was very nice. Will definitely go again.
review_4_text:
Delicious food in reasonable price. I recommend the"Deep fried pork intestines with Garlic Server with spicy dipping sauce". This should be the best pork intestines I've every tasted. And owner ( so as chef) are really friendly. The Thai Coconut chicken soup is amazing as well.
Definitely will promote this restaurant to my friend who will come Chiang Mai.
review_5_text:
Wow! The best meal I've had in months. This place is amazing. Flavor that just grabs you by the taste buds and takes you on a journey.

The pad Thai was easily the best I've ever eaten. I have a whole new appreciation for what I considered to be an overrated dish.

The pineapple fried rice was so smokey with a subtle sweetness that we both loved.

The som tum with the fish was freakishly good. It paired so well together. Easily the best som tum I've tried in Thailand.

Last was the shrimp cakes which were crunchy and exactly what I wanted.

Seriously, don't miss this place!

name: Coffee at Come-on Place
review_1_text: Hidden gem, this place is incredible. The hosts are so kind and generous. The iced green is one of the best I've had here. To top it off they have 5 beautiful corgis. Definitely worth a visit
review_2_text: amazing amazing amazing cafe!!! Lovely waitress and a beautiful area to sit in. Like 8 stunning corgis running about the place being beautiful and stunning and cute. One came and sat on the table and the waitress asked if we wanted him down but we absolutely did not. He kept us company as we played cards and drank our tasty drinks around him.
review_3_text:
The nicest cafe surrounded by greenery and trees. Seats are outside and there's cute corgis running around, the cutest and friendliest dogs you can pet!
Very cute off the beaten track cafe if you like quirky, greenery and dogs!
review_4_text: CORGIS CORGIS CORGIS also there is coffee which is quite nice, don't mind the barking they're very friendly
review_5_text:
Sweet Corgis, friendly hosts and they gave me a Oreo brownie for free and also gave me some mosquito repellent.
I can definitly recommend this cafe.

name: Milkland BuakHard ‡∏ï‡∏£‡∏á‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏í‡πÇ‡∏ô‡∏Ø
review_1_text:
Review of MilkLand, Chiang Mai

If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai and craving something deliciously fresh, MilkLand is a must-visit! This cozy spot beautifully showcases the unique and strong partnership between Thailand and Denmark, where Danish dairy expertise meets Thai creativity. This relationship between the two nations goes beyond mere business; it‚Äôs a celebration of quality and innovation that has stood the test of time, and MilkLand is a shining example of this collaboration.

MilkLand specializes in smoothies, baked goods, and coffee-based drinks, each crafted with high-quality dairy that reflects Denmark's rich dairy tradition. Their yogurt smoothies, in particular, are a standout‚Äîperfectly balanced in tartness and sweetness, and ideal for a refreshing break on a warm Chiang Mai day. Their coffee drinks, made with creamy milk and paired with freshly baked treats, offer a delightful experience that‚Äôs both indulgent and energizing.

For those curious to experience Danish culture, MilkLand brings a taste of it right here to Thailand. And for anyone inspired to visit Denmark afterward, here‚Äôs a tip: maybe skip December! Winter in Denmark is very dark, with limited daylight, which can be a stark contrast to the vibrant, sunlit atmosphere here in Chiang Mai. Instead, enjoy the Danish influence at MilkLand in the warm Thai sunshine.

Whether you‚Äôre a dairy lover or simply in the mood for a delicious smoothie or coffee treat, MilkLand delivers quality and charm. It‚Äôs more than just a caf√©; it‚Äôs a celebration of the strong, enduring connection between Denmark and Thailand. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: What the... why is milk so delicious...üò≥üò≥
review_3_text: Good place nice vibe
review_4_text:
üòâ An after-school playground for Thai students

1. I went because I was curious about the milk flavors. They have a pretty good selection of drinks. I tried an iced mocha and it was pretty good.
2. There were a ton of Thai students. They seemed to be waiting for their after-school ride home. There wasn't a single seat.
3. When you order, they give you a buzzer, and your drink will be ready when you wait. It's popular with students, so there was a bit of a wait.
review_5_text: Excellent place where you can have a quality shake, milkshakes, chocolates. Dairy products. Super

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏∏‡∏ì‡∏•‡∏∏‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü
review_1_text: The coffee is delicious, the prices are reasonable, and the owner is friendly.
review_2_text: Smells like coffee, especially pea berries.

name: ‡∏õ‡∏±‡πä‡∏°‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü Coffee Station
review_1_text: A welfare coffee shop within the Highway District. A small shop with reasonable prices and a moderate coffee flavor. If you're stopping by to run errands within the district or to eat in the district, you can stop by and eat. There aren't many people.
review_2_text: Free water and cool fans are provided.

name: Katai Cafe ‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≤‡∏¢ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: The coffee is delicious...the owner is very friendly...after finishing my coffee...I went for a relaxing walk at Nong Buak Haad Park next door...
review_2_text: The shop is absolutely beautiful, the decor is lovely, the staff provides excellent service, and the coffee and drinks are delicious.
review_3_text: Good coffee, small but friendly place, affordable prices
review_4_text: The coffee is very delicious. I drink it every morning.
review_5_text: The coffee is delicious.

name: ‡∏õ‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏ü‡πâ‡∏≤ coffee
review_1_text: A beautifully designed place and caf√©, right in the city center, perfect for taking a break and enjoying a coffee, smoothie or many other things.

name: Workshop Coffee Space & CatHouse
review_1_text: The smell is very bad, the cats didn‚Äôt have water and almost no food, some of tem very skinny. 4 of them had really bad infections in the eyes. The room is small, no windows and no fresh air. They pee close to where they eat, not hygienic at all. I felt so bad seeing the cats living there. I hope this Place changes, as I see many bad reviews. That‚Äôs inappropriated for cat‚Äôs health and comfort.
review_2_text: The first floor is ok, but the upper floor with cat smells so terrible ü§Æ. No one is care enough to take care of the cats. They didn‚Äôt even take them to baht or brush them!! They only feed and left the cat all alone by themselves. It‚Äôs like a small cage that traps them.
review_3_text: The staff didn't even ask what I want and also told me nothing about the cats. I had no idea that the cats were upstairs. Looking from outside the place was nice, but once you're inside there were nothing like that. The place wasn't clean and also the bathroom. Moreover, every cats were skinny and they didn't have blankets or anything to keep the cats warm in a very very small, cold air-conditioned room. When I was there, the cats were seeking something to lay on and keep warm , so they just used every customers' bags. That was very depressive. The coffee was fine but wasn't worth a baht. Will never go back again. If you want to keep 5-6 cats together in such a small room can you please at least take good care of them?
review_4_text: The mocha was lovely. The cats seem very content, comfortable and well looked after. The place upstairs isn't very comfy for guests but you're only there to see the cats so it's fine!
review_5_text: Best green tea I ever tried. Charming and peaceful place in noising Chiang Mai. I will repeat sure!

name: Gain Ground
review_1_text: Gain Ground is an exquisite cafe (and shop) attached to a hotel serving high-quality tea with high-quality service. Truly a gem!

name: til.cafe
review_1_text: Funny guy with his great coffee shop, would definitely come again.
review_2_text: Great spot with a 70s retro feel. Good music. And outdoor area, view of the old wall.
review_3_text: Nice combination with fried banana, 50 meters from cafe
review_4_text:
This cafe is near Chiang Mai Gate. The window overlooks the gate and the tranquil surroundings. When I visited, there weren't many people, so I was able to enjoy my drink leisurely. I ordered a hojicha latte, and it was, as expected, delicious. Hojicha lattes are often bitter, but this one had a richer flavor.

There's outdoor seating, but it was too hot, so I sat inside. The speakers were good, and the music selection was great. The atmosphere was so great that I'd love to go back again.
review_5_text:
Visited here two days in a row! The coffee aroma is wonderful and delicious!
It's hard to find a place with great lattes, but this is a great place for them.
I've tried a cafe latte, an Americano, and a mocha latte, and they were all a success.
It's a great place to just sit back and relax, enjoying the view outside the window. While the road is right in front, it's quiet.
The view of Tapae Gate and the lush greenery behind is soothing.

name: GRAPH contemporary
review_1_text:
A vintage yet stylish cafe. You may miss the entrance when u pass by the cafe but it is a different world when u goes in. The cafe is very spacious with 2 floors. The upper floor is without ac, so it can be quite hot.

There many special drinks for this cafe, but the price is quite pricey and the taste is not particularly outstanding.

Good place to chill around or if u wanna try GRAPH as this branch is far less crowded than the other branches of GRAPH.
review_2_text: Amazing coffee! There's an unassuming entrance, but I was blown away once I walked inside. Very cool, trendy vibes here with chill music. Coffee options are excellent--lots of cold brew mixes and single origin options. I really enjoyed my coffee and also ordered a carrot cake, which had great icing. Really can't go wrong here, I'd recommend anyone who loves coffee to check out one of the Graph shops around town. Prices are slightly higher, but it's a great coffee experience and I look forward to going back.
review_3_text: Just amazing coffee in beautiful surroundings. The menu was so creative and both our drinks were sublime. They have a few branches in the city but this felt the most relaxing and interesting.
review_4_text: Graph is such a vibe. The space is super aesthetic ‚Äî and perfect for photos, but also cozy enough to hang out for a while.
review_5_text: Good vibes. Great spacious design. Good, creative coffee. Friendly and helpful staffs. Down side, there‚Äôs only 1 mixed toilet which is really annoying. If you want to spend your time here, maybe an hour chat is cool, over the afternoon when things aren‚Äôt busy. My personal view, best to take away. Chairs aren‚Äôt comfortable. It‚Äôs really for quick chat, photos and nicely presented coffee. Still give it 4-star for product quality and services.

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏±‡∏•‡∏ó‡πå ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏ô (Cult Caffeine)
review_1_text: What made me want to try this spot? The name. The interior is honestly insane. Definitely an experience. As you walk in you're greeted by a wall of posters and old school telephones with cute messages on them. You walk through the doorway, mirrors on your left and a massive open space to your right. Incredibly tall ceiling. More art. A bar. A small shop selling Tees, keychains, caps. Then you slide the door open to the coffee shop with clinical stainless steel seating, a small baked goods selection and your go-to coffee orders and a sign that says we should thank Buddha for caffeine. Perk: getting to choose your beans. Light, medium or dark roast. Super cool experience. This place must be an absolute vibe at night.
review_2_text: The owner only allows employees to serve coffee in single-use cups, said the employee. I do not support a business that chooses to create more waste. The world will benefit from businesses making small choices to reuse instead of throwing out. I hope this invokes positive change. Lots of love.
review_3_text: Cool coffee shop! Cool name! Love the vibe
review_4_text:
Good drinks, but even better vibes! The shop is decorated so beautifully and it‚Äôs super peaceful inside. Highly recommend for anyone who loves taking photos.
you'll get amazing shots here.
review_5_text: Perfect spot for coffee. Good service decent coffee n chill ambience. Can work too.

name: la.moon cold cafe
review_1_text: I got a dirty coffee and seriously, it's the best one in Chiang Mai. I had the best in Shanghai, but this one also has that flavor that changes with every sip. The only thing is the glass should be chilled, the milk should be cold, and the ice is a bit of a problem, but everything else is really well made. I'd totally recommend it.
review_2_text:
The outside of this store doesn't look big.

As a result, I didn't know until I went in that there was another cave.

Three areas are connected together.

It's a spacious cafe in Chiang Mai.

Due to my coffee shop bad habits

I directly ordered medium roasted hot American coffee without thinking.

Test the level of each cafe shop with very basic coffee

It's about 80 points. No surprise there but satisfied

I also ordered Brown Clouds.

Chocolate with vanilla cream

The chocolate is very rich.

Try the signature cold-extracted coffee next time.
review_3_text:
La.moon cold cafe is a pleasantly satisfying spot for coffee lovers. The aroma and flavor of the coffee are both impressive, with a wide range of options to choose from ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre into classic brews or something a bit more adventurous.

Their cakes are a delightful bonus ‚Äî rich, well-balanced, and clearly made with quality ingredients. The overall vibe is cozy and inviting, making it a great place to relax or catch up with friends.

Highly recommended if you‚Äôre looking for a cafe that takes both coffee and dessert seriously.
review_4_text: Wonderful place for coffee lovers - serves classic coffees, six varieties of cold brew, signature coffee and teas. The place is clean, tidy and cozy. The staff is welcoming and friendly. There's a lovely selection of desserts to complement the coffees. The mini croissants are the blast!
review_5_text:
One of favourite cafes in Chiang Mai! The dark roast is sensational.

Staff are awesome and always polite. Great vibe inside too, to either chill out or work.

name: The Toys Club
review_1_text:
I have been in Chiang Mai for so long.

This is my first time to enter this interesting bar

I didn't expect the atmosphere to be so good.

Relaxed and friendly

The handsome boss spin the vinyls by himself. Was quite good.

All kinds of alcohol are available here.

Draft beer, whiskey, highball, cocktails

I think Asahi draft beer is good.

It provides coffee during the day.

Perfectly achieve the living state of morning C and night A
review_2_text: Absolutely loved the vibe at Toy Club Chiang Mai! Fantastic drinks ‚Äì especially enjoyed trying the [mention KOSAPAN or TENDO if you remember which one you liked better, otherwise keep it general]. The attention to detail, like the perfectly stacked ice
review_3_text: Great place for a nerd! You can get a coffee here, play some video games or board games and admire the collection of Japanese pop cultural stuff.
review_4_text: One of the coolest cafes in Chiang Mai that turns into this retro Japanese style bar at night where they're straight up mixing vinyls and serving epic cocktails. You can play you childhoood favorite games in the back and are surrounded by some of the best nostalgic characters in the stands and walls that Japan has to offer. Places like this usually only exist in the movies, we're lucky to have it in real life.
review_5_text: This place makes you travel and go back in time!! Insanely well decorated and there‚Äôs also a coffeeshop and a DJ inside, all in one! Everything is there for you to have fun and enjoy the quirky space. Truly unique!

name: Johoney Ice Cream
review_1_text: A cute homemade ice cream shop with delicious flavors, even local ones. We tried the honeycomb, jambolan, peach and black plum, as well as strawberry sherbert. The flavors are on point and delicious. Highly recommend!!
review_2_text: An out-of-the way ice cream and coffee shop across the river. All ice cream is homemade with exceptional flavors only available in Thailand. Served in frosted bowls if you eat in. Make a point to visit, so worth it!
review_3_text:
Quality homade icecream in Chiangmai. Plenty of flavors to try, I've tried honey comb and their new mango menu. They serve it in a frozen bowl.
The paint point is no proper parking lot. But you have to find it near by this place and walk
review_4_text: Super tasty ice cream! There are many flavors of ice cream and sherbet to choose from at John Honey. Every time you go, there is something new to try because the flavors change with the seasons and new recipes.
review_5_text: home made ice cream with only 4-5 tables.  But the flavours are very impressive.  So many various selection to choose from.  only 50 thb per scoop. Will definitely revisit!!

name: KUMBO MATCHA
review_1_text: The shop itself is nice and well-designed, but there were lots of customers and not enough tables, which made it a bit uncomfortable. The matcha was okay ‚Äî enjoyable, but not particularly memorable.
review_2_text: A-Must Try Matcha Cafe on the 2nd floor of Anusarn building, also our first time visiting here‚òòÔ∏è We order Coconut Matcha and Basque Burnt Matcha Cheesecakeüòã in which we really love its taste so much cause it's so flavorful and less sweetüçØ The Cafe atmosphere inside is Perfect with the sound of soft music playingüé∑and minimal decorationüé® 200% Recommended to absorb the well-balanced in sipping flavorful Matcha beverages amid Comfy atmosphereüëçüëçüëç
review_3_text: Good quality matcha that‚Äôs smooth. Calm, low-key space that‚Äôs easy to hang out in.
review_4_text: Good matcha but waiting for 30 min after order
review_5_text:
The atmosphere really reminds me of some cafes I've been to in both Taiwan and Japan. Love the design of the place and they really serve amazing matcha!
The only thing that was a letdown was the matcha tiramisu, I felt like it was a rip-off...the portion is way tiny and you have to wait a bit for the ladyfingers(savoiardi) to soften and the taste is really so-so, I don't think it's worth the price.
I'd recommend just going for the drinks as they also have a good selection and made with care.

name: Limsakdakul Sanpakoi
review_1_text: Vibrant meeting place. Interesting art and antiques at the back of the cafe.
review_2_text: Best coffee in town, period üëç
review_3_text: Good place, friendly people.
review_4_text:
A coffee shop that blends the charm of Chiang Mai's past, with a familiar and nostalgic feel. Good vibe, good coffee.
There are photo opportunities for social media check-ins.

It was quite crowded the day I went; all the tables were full, even from the front of the shop. It's becoming a trend, so I recommend visiting in the morning.

Street parking is only available until 3 PM; otherwise, your car will be towed.
review_5_text: The shop is cute and very stylishly decorated. There are many photo spots, a corner for collectibles and antiques, and a cute shop inside. The coffee here is really good, fragrant and delicious. The only downside is that there are a lot of tourists, so you might have to wait a bit for your partner. Take the opportunity to walk around and take photos while waiting, but it's worth it.

name: Bella Goose Coffee at Alt_PingRiver
review_1_text:
Bella Goose is top notch.
Grab the piccolo for a silky, well-balanced coffee. If you‚Äôre not feeling caffeine, the honey lemon soda is refreshing and perfect for cooling down.
The staff really make this place special‚Äîso friendly and welcoming.

This is a great spot to get work done. Similar vibe but much smaller than their Hill location.
review_2_text: Arguably one of the best places for breakfast in Chiang Rai - fantastic menu and even better coffee. Should be on your must visit list of chiang mai if you‚Äôre doing a cafe crawl.
review_3_text: If you are looking for a western/American dirty chai, this spot makes a delicious one! Finding a chai tea latte in Thailand has been a search, but this spot is delicious! They also have fantastic rocky road & salted caramel cookies!
review_4_text: Mod is the best barista ever!! So accommodating and makes a good matcha - 10/10!
review_5_text: Really love this cafe! Gorgeous natural light, a calming atmosphere and really tasty coffee and pastries. Staff is always friendly and welcoming!

name: ‡∏≠‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÑ‡∏ß‡∏ó‡∏ä‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
My boyfriend and I absolutely love this caf√© in Chiang Mai!
The lemon soda and cakes are excellent.
He orders them all the time, haha.
You can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on the menu.

It‚Äôs a clean, delicious, and affordable caf√©.
Truly the best caf√© in Chiang Mai!‚ú®‚ú®
review_2_text: In the same compound as the Otteri laundry place, the cafe & bakery newcomer on the block (about 4 months old) offers affordable cofffee and non-coffee drinks plus great smoothies as well as home-made cake. Seats available both inside (air-conditioned) and outside. Closed Mondays.
review_3_text: We ended up here by chance, as we tried  to go to a nearby place but it was closed. Very nice surprise and very nice coffee place! Great cakes and frappes! Recommended.
review_4_text: Great lychee soda! Went to do laundry and saw they were still open at 6 pm which was nice to stay cool while our clothes became clean
review_5_text:
Everything was great, but I'd like to suggest fixing the cake box. It wasn't securely packed, making it very easy for the cake to be damaged.
The cake arrived upside down; please fix that.
From the rider: Instead of receiving payment, I ended up losing money on that, so the rider didn't actually receive the cake.

name: TRIO - ‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏µ‡πÇ‡∏≠
review_1_text: I always be there after work.
review_2_text: Mellow space to share a beer!
review_3_text: Verry good !!

name: Mandala cocoa
review_1_text:
Sure! Here‚Äôs a polished, natural-sounding review you can use:

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Mandala Cocoa is an excellent place for high-quality cacao. The cacao is rich, well-crafted, and full of deep, concentrated flavors‚Äîevery sip tastes amazing. The location is great and very relaxing, perfect for enjoying and focusing on the taste experience. Everything was so good, definitely two thumbs up üëçüëç. Highly recommended for cacao lovers!
review_2_text: üç´üí• Boom Boom Chocolate lives up to its name. Rich, intense, and unapologetically chocolatey‚Äîdeep cocoa flavour, smooth finish, zero fluff. One sip and it hits hard in the best way. A must for serious chocolate lovers!
review_3_text: We‚Äôve been to bamboo saturday market in Chiang Mai and met him at his cocoa stall. We just bought his raw cocoa powder and it turned out to be one of the best cocoas we‚Äôve ever tried. This cocoa is filled with love and dedication and so it‚Äôs best for cocoa ceremonies. Thank you, we‚Äôll visit you again soon :)
review_4_text: I was very blessed to encounter this chocolate business in Jungle Market on a Saturday morning. This is the best chocolate drink ive ever tasted in my life! Order the BOOM BOOM CHOCOLATE which is not on their menu, except if youre in the Jungle Market. No need to put sugar/sweet milk. You will not regret it. Trust me. I know what i am talking about. This is the best.
review_5_text: Absolutely loved the Mondala Cocoa I picked up at the Sanpakhoi market! This cacao from Chiang Dao is truly special. Rich, flavorful, and incredibly satisfying. A must-try for any chocolate lover! üç´

name: Yardoo kids Cafe
review_1_text:
A very cute cafe with many different indoor and outdoor spaces. The toys and areas were clean and not worn. I appreciated that they allowed me in even though I didn‚Äôt have a method of QR payment, only cash. And, they gave my daughter a cute Pok√©mon gift upon leaving. They have the sweetest staff.

There was no one really monitoring the areas so parents of younger ones need to be somewhat vigilant at all times - with toys on higher shelves and a steep slide into the ball pit
review_2_text: Had my son‚Äôs 4th birthday party here and it was wonderful! It was a private party and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. The decorations were fantastic and the staff were wonderful. Really great toys, outside area and excellent slide. 100% would recommend. Coffees were delicious too. Thank you Yardoo üôè
review_3_text:
Great family and kids space with both indoor and outdoor play spaces. Whole room with Plan International wooden toys. Another room with big slide and ball pit.

Food is adequate. Only downside is they use plastic cutlery in plastic bags and disposable bowls for all dining, creating tons of unnecessary waste.
review_4_text: It was good size for my 2yo toddler. Safe and clean toys and playground. Staff was nice and friendly too. Just one thing, there are TOO MANY mosquitoes (especially hiding in the indoor slide/ball pool area) in such a place for kids, the owner should consider to leave a mosquito catch during the night‚Ä¶ Mosquitoes carry diseases and kill most human on earth üò¨
review_5_text: The staff at the entrance are friendly and helpful, but the counter/cashier service needs improvement. The overall service experience feels inconsistent and below expectations.

name: Half.cnx
review_1_text: Nice spot for coffee with a view of the park
review_2_text: Good vibes, but coffee is not really good. and seats are not comfort
review_3_text: Feeling good
review_4_text:
This shop is very clever in its marketing and advertising. The facade facing the garden is illuminated with striking orange lights.
Great location near the garden entrance/exit.
Beautiful view.
The drinks are okay.
The decor uses raw materials, exposing the surfaces of the old building.
There are air-conditioned rooms on the 1st and 2nd floors.
The 3rd floor is open air.
This was a shop I visited at the perfect time.
You can scan to view the menu before entering.
And you can scan to order drinks.
review_5_text:
Who would have thought there'd be such a great cafe next to Chiang Mai train station! This is ùóõùóÆùóπùó≥.ùó∞ùóªùòÖ. I love the cool design of the cafe. It's a three-story building with a raw, loft-style feel, but when the large windows open, you get a full view of the lush green railway park. The atmosphere is airy and spacious; it's very relaxing and not at all cramped. üòåüåø

For those who love taking photos, ùóõùóÆùóπùó≥.ùó∞ùóªùòÖ has tons of chic spots. The coffee is good, the pastries are delicious, and it's perfect for working or just taking a break in the afternoon. This is another must-visit spot in Chiang Mai that I highly recommend everyone experience! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüíì

Hard to believe there‚Äôs such a vibe right next to the Chiang Mai Railway Station! ùóõùóÆùóπùó≥.ùó∞ùóªùòÖ is a stunning 3-story industrial loft that perfectly balances its raw, edgy design with the lush, green views of the Railway Park. The space is so airy and open‚Äîdefinitely a place where you can just sit back and breathe. üòåüåø

For all the photographers out there, this place is a goldmine for cool shots. The coffee is top-notch, the treats are delicious, and it‚Äôs the ideal spot to get some work done or just enjoy a quiet afternoon. If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai, you‚Äôve got to check this one out! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüíó

name: Ploy Cafe Slow Bar
review_1_text:
Best Thai tea! Must try.
The food also delicious!
review_2_text: Variety of Breakfasts. Delicious. Nice Service üòÉMy favorite place in Chiang Mai!
review_3_text: Super friendly and relaxing little coffee stall along the road. Thanks for all the great coffee!
review_4_text: Super chill roadside slow bar
review_5_text: Amazing coffee and even better service!!

name: Round n Round
review_1_text:
Christmas theme decoration is Super cute and cozyüòçüòç

Sitting area and order area are separated, makes the sitting area more private. I love that!!

Variety choice of bread (Shio pan the most) MUST NOT MISS!! So delicious
review_2_text: Cute cafe in ChiangMai, variety type of bread. Buy from one place and bring to the sitting zone (self-service).
review_3_text: I recently visited ROUND N ROUND, and it was a great experience! The caf√© has a chilled zone where you can comfortably enjoy salted breads. Their fresh bread, straight from the oven, is definitely a highlight‚Äîsoft, warm, and delicious. The overall vibe is relaxing, making it a perfect spot to unwind. Plus, the caf√© offers plenty of parking space, which is super convenient. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to enjoy fresh food in a cozy setting, this is a great choice!
review_4_text: The best place for Shio Pan in Chiang Mai offers an exceptional experience. The original shio pan is perfectly crispy on the outside and delightfully soft on the inside. The venue provides ample parking space and comfortable seating, making it a great place to relax and enjoy delicious bread. I highly recommend trying the bread with their dipping sauce ‚Äì it‚Äôs absolutely amazing!
review_5_text:
Round n Round is a charming bakery that‚Äôs definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai. The highlight here is the bread‚Äîfreshly baked, with a wide variety of choices ranging from crusty loaves to soft, sweet pastries. Each item looks thoughtfully made, and the quality is impressive.

The shop atmosphere is cozy and homey, with warm wooden decor and a relaxed vibe that makes you feel comfortable the moment you walk in. It‚Äôs clear that attention has been given to both the design and the customer experience.

There‚Äôs plenty of parking available, which is a big plus especially if you‚Äôre driving. However, one thing to note is that the dining area is located separately from the main selling area. While this setup helps keep the bakery space organized, it can feel slightly inconvenient if you‚Äôre hoping to enjoy your food on the spot without moving between areas.

Overall, Round n Round is a lovely place for quality baked goods, a calm atmosphere, and a nice little break from the city buzz. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys fresh bread and relaxing spaces.

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏õ‡∏ï‡∏ó.‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà-‡πÑ‡∏Æ‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏¢‡πå
review_1_text: It is more a coffee shop than Cafe but you can get snack which are unique and tasty. Good for a quick stop with a great atmosphere. Also free wifi for you digital nomads.
review_2_text: Brand new building! Very clean and plenty of seating.
review_3_text:
Great coffee
Staff friendly and helpful
Enjoy coffee in hereüòâ üòâ üòâ
review_4_text: Good coffee, nice layouts setups inside, friendly customers services, good location.
review_5_text: I love this Amazon great coffee and great staff

name: Black Canyon ‡∏£‡∏û.‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏∏‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏û ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
No matter the location,  always reliable for quality & service.

Food is always fresh and delicious.  Well made coffee drinks.
review_2_text:
Well, the food is... meh. BUT if you're really hungry like we were then you will enjoy it.
I understand that not every restaurant will be a 5 star rating.
This coffee shop/restaurant does the job.

I would say don't go out of your way BUT if you're getting your truck fixed nearby hungry and need to wait- then this place is PERFECT.

It is worth a stop by plus they have cannabis teas and coffeeü§î
review_3_text: A very good quality Black Canyon. The food is all delicious and the staff are friendly. It‚Äôs right next to Bangkok hospital so we ate here while visiting the hospital. We were very hungry and this place hit the spot.
review_4_text:
I came here with a coupon from Bangkok Hospital that is next door.
There is a list of choices for that, a few drinks and a few food selections.
