I asked about tuna sandwich and was pointed to a display (see photo 1) with a good looking sandwich and selected that.
As I was eating in they didn‚Äôt want me to take pre-packed but serve it on a plate‚Ä¶ and all I got was a half can of tuna between 2 tasteless slices of white bread without crust.  No lettuce, tomato, or mayo in sight. Bland and tasteless.
Even worse than any school or hospital cafeteria.
2 tables sent their food back while I was there.

Maybe this is acceptable if your mind is worried about a loved one in hospital and you don‚Äôt taste anything or don‚Äôt care - but otherwise I‚Äôd strongly advise against going here.
review_5_text:
I wanted to like this place and the food, but unfortunately, it didn't meet my expectations. I ordered the Ribeye with Truffle sauce, cooked medium-rare. They seemed to focus too much on the truffle and not enough on the meat. When I first looked at it, I thought it was chopped meat; however, upon cutting into it, it turned out to be very dry and stringy. The truffle sauce was okay but nothing exceptional. The salad was fresh, and the potato was pretty standard. I also ordered the combo, which included the Thai Iced tea. It was better than what you'd get at 7, but not nearly as good as what Hand Brand offers.

Additionally, I had an iced Coffee from here in the morning, it was bitter and not very flavorful.

name: Mingmitr Coffee - ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ó‡∏µ‡∏õ
review_1_text: Tables in coffee shop are very comfortable and cleaned with plugs under the tables. The drinks are good. I love hot latte. Recommend!!!
review_2_text: Warm decorations and good coffee
review_3_text: Clean, friendly, awesome staff! Great coffee.
review_4_text: The drink tastes really good.
review_5_text: Good choice and Good service

name: Starbucks Bangkok Hospital Chiangmai
review_1_text: This is a great Starbucks, they have a huge seating area and great customer service. I received my order quickly and it was delicious, as usual with a Starbucks. I don‚Äôt typically visit Starbucks but it is super convenient being right here at Bangkok hospital while waiting for tests, etc. it is a cashless store, but they take all other forms of payment, including my debit card from America so you don‚Äôt have to have a Thai bank account in order to pay here.
review_2_text: It is a cashless store. I hate these stores. What's next? Kiosk ordering like at McDonalds or KFC? Customer service going out of fashion I guess.
review_3_text: They refuse to accept cash. Ridiculous. It should be illegal to not accept cash.
review_4_text: Today I was lucky enough to get a free coffee. The shop offered a free drip coffee. It's a special seasonal coffee. I really like it. It goes really well with the cheesecake. It's so delicious.
review_5_text:
I'm a Bangkok resident but a tourist and didn't want to go home, so I registered for a Gift Set here.
The staff were very helpful from the moment I called to inquire about the Gift Set, advising on parking, and informing me about the drive-thru service where I could pick up the Gift Set.
I was very impressed. The service at the drive-thru was also excellent; the staff member was very polite, warmed the croissant perfectly, and did exactly as I requested‚Äîslicing it first before warming it up. They followed my instructions precisely. Thank you so much!

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Small gas station branch. The drinks and service were great! I couldn't see a toilet which was the only problem really.
review_2_text: It is a small coffee shop with the same great taste and service that you receive in most cafe Amazon.  Good price and a good location.  This shop is located behind the gas station.  There are some car park spots next to the 7/11.
review_3_text:
Very small amazon, but same taste.
Also parking limited.
review_4_text: I had hot cafe latte. The price is (55)baht and taste is good. I like it.
review_5_text: it's small Amazon Cafe.

review_2_text:
Affordable price.
Every glass is packed with ice.

I don't know about other branches, but this one is 35 baht for a cold one.

name: Fresh Me ‡∏£.‡∏û.‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏∏‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏û ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: it was one of the most surpriseing visit of chiangmai. I never expected such a small shop to have such great milk tea. not only that I went back to order the strawberry delight, an amazing blend of juice and tea. my friend got the strawberry gelato, he had such a great reaction I had to try his drink. my reaction was the same. it was more than amazing.
review_2_text: FreshMe is an amazing bubble tea shop! Their drinks are super tasty, fresh, and made with quality ingredients. They have lots of options, from classic milk teas to fruity blends, so there‚Äôs something for everyone. The tapioca pearls are always chewy and perfect. The staff is friendly, and the shop has a cozy vibe. If you love bubble tea, FreshMe is the place to go!
review_3_text: The calamansi tea is so refreshing! They also have a promotion every Monday and Wednesday. ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_4_text: The staff are very unprofessional. You ask for one thing and get another. The price is very expensive. Don't buy anything from here. You will be disappointed.
review_5_text: I got a lot. It's delicious and just the right amount of sweet.

name: Gourmet Primo Cafe Chiang Mai
review_1_text:
Great distraction during a hospital visit.

Well made coffee and drinks. Large selection of fresh sweet and savory items.

Located off the ground lobby of Bangkok Hospital Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: Located on the ground floor at Chiangmai Bangkok Hospital. The best Coffee and pastry selections.
review_3_text:
The coffee shop at Bangkok Hospital Chiang Mai has delicious drinks.
The prices are reasonable, and they also sell inexpensive baked goods and pastries.
I often stop by while waiting to drop off patients. It's located near the checkout counter on the 1st floor.
review_4_text: The staff were so lovely, like they stepped straight out of Disney, super friendly. The snacks in the shop were also incredibly delicious ‚Äì I was surprised there was a snack shop in a hospital! Very impressed.

name: NIMMAN COFFEE - ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏ó‡∏ß‡∏µ‡πÇ‡∏ä‡∏Ñ
review_1_text: The iced cappuccino tasted absolutely excellent!

name: Savor Society Superior
review_1_text:
Excellent cup of coffee.  The service is kind and friendly.   Nice place to sit with a coffee.  But, the chairs are not very comfortable.  I think nobody sits here because these chairs are
Very uncomfortable for a foreigner who has a large body.  Management please consider buying larger more Comfortable chairs.
review_2_text: Very good coffee with a great choice of coffee beans. Thank you Panwad for being always friendly and keep smiling.
review_3_text: Good coffee with a wide selection of beans and brew styles. Each cup has its own character. The service is friendly and makes the whole experience even better.
review_4_text:
One of two new specialty coffee shops in the new wing of Bangkok hospital. I‚Äôm overall satisfied, but the baristas struggled a bit making a piccolo latte. Perhaps they are only recently trained.

Edit: downgraded to 3 stars. After drinking more of my latte, it proves to be uninteresting. Almost watery, milk is lacking any texture.
review_5_text: This coffee shop is located on the 2nd floor of the Plaza2 building of  Bangkok Hospital Chiang Mai. Good coffee with affordable price. Barista is very friendly and helpful for coffee recommendations. There are seats and tables for you to enjoy your coffee too.

name: WARI Coffee to go
review_1_text: I wish i could give this place 5 stars ‚Äì they have a great selection of beans and the prices are very reasonable. However, the portion sizes are inconsistent. Sometimes it‚Äôs almost only half a cup!
review_2_text: The coffee tastes good, the female staff member is friendly, and the price is reasonable.
review_3_text: The staff needs improvement; the service is terrible, like we're begging for free food. Two male staff members were at the Udon Thani branch. Other branches have better service.
review_4_text:
The male staff member was impolite and acted like he was asking for free food.
Please improve this behavior.
review_5_text: Udomphon branch, the staff are very rude.

name: Pumpkin.P
review_1_text:
Purchased a drink on 14/12/2024.

They also have rice dishes like omelets and more.

I bought a honey lemon soda for 40 baht.
It tasted delicious, just the right amount of sourness.
review_2_text: Smoothie + salad is delicious.
review_3_text: Refreshing ü•∞

name: BILLY BEAN

review_2_text: Best option for coffee if you‚Äôre at the hospital - certainly better than the big brand store nearby that charges more than 3x for a terrible latte üòú
review_3_text: This coffee is perfect for those who prefer medium-light roasts.

name: Coconut Shake & Ice Cream ‡∏°‡∏∞‡∏û‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏õ‡∏±‡πà‡∏ô ‡πÑ‡∏≠‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏°
review_1_text: My friend and I had the simple coconut ice cream cone with nuts‚Ä¶. My only disappointment is that there wasn‚Äôt more because it was delicious! And cheap! 25 baht. Definitely recommend!!
review_2_text:
New Store!
Their Coffee Coconut Frappe (55 baht) is so good! üëçüëç
review_3_text: The coconut shake and ice cream were delicious, but the staff didn't seem to want to sell them.

name: Main Wall Climbing Gym
review_1_text: Very modern and nice climbing gym. Both bouldering, lead climbing and few auto belay routes. Price was 450 baht for person and 100 baht for rental shoes. Shoes are quite new and decent. For grading system they use V scale.
review_2_text: Amazing climbing center, gear shops are well equipped and reasonable price. Kids loving it and their instructors are very good. We will be coming here for a long time. Has good parking space as well.
review_3_text:
I have climbed at many gyms within Australia eg: Sydney, Brisbane  Perth and Adelaide and now I'm attending the "Mai Wall rock climbing and bouldering complex in Chiang Mai. I must say it's extremely well set out, with fantastic climb selections from beginners to hard-core climbers. There's a separate wam-up room with finger racks and a -45 degree bouldering warm up as well. Lockers for your valuables are available and they also sell a small range of climbing essentials on site.
If your a beginner or just haven't bought all your gear yet, you can hire the equipment as well.
Very happy to recommend this climbing gym to anyone. Cheers Van Moore
I rate this gym up there with the best I've experienced in Australia
Also it is kept very clean and tidy which is a credit to the management...thank you!
review_4_text:
Me and my partner have been climbing for 11 years now, and we always make a point of going to local gyms whenever we travel.

Main wall is clean, relatively cool and well staffed. It is perfect for a visit once maybe twice during a holiday visit to CM.

Setting wise (Bouldering only!), it's definitely angled at the more intermediate climber which is understandable. My partner climbs ~6b/v4 and I climb ~7b+/v8/v9, and there was a lack of harder climbs there for me.

From what I could see there were no bouldering problems set for the two higher v grade colour tags, with ~5 blue tags at v5-6 which was a shame.

We both still had a good 2 hours climb however, and enjoyed our time there. If you are an advanced boulderer, it's a perfect gym for a good stretch and to hold onto some plastic for a bit, but don't expect a hard project session.
review_5_text:
Very good climbing gym. I tried only bouldering, and although routes are mostly easy/intermediate (I found only one v7) they are still fun to climb. The only problem is that they don‚Äôt have AC so it can be quite hot

Gym also has a separate training room with 2024 Moonboard, campus board, and plenty of climbing training stuff.

name: Deep green @ Deejai Garden
review_1_text: This is definitely my favorite spot in Chiang Mai! It‚Äôs a true hidden paradise, where you can relax with a joint and take a dip in the pool while listening to some amazing music. The fried rice was one of the best we have had on the trip, thai iced tea as well as peach iced tea were also fabulous! Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough, make sure to add it to your itinerary!
review_2_text: Just passing by and popped in for a quick coffee + toilet break, but wow ‚Äì turned out to be an incredibly cool space! Amazing visual art all around and even a proper smoking area. Ended up chilling and enjoying the vibe for over an hour. Totally unexpected gem! ‚òïüé®
review_3_text: Cool, friendly spot for some drinks and smoke with your mates. Simple food, great cocktails on offer. Nothing more, nothing less.
review_4_text:
Really friendly bar with swimming pool you can use when you spend 100 baht minimum.
Nice chill out and smoking area, great djs at night. Great hang to start or close the day, hippie traveler vibes with a 90‚Äôs feel.
review_5_text: Beautiful place. Good music. Awesome Swimming pool. The only problem for me was that they just accept cash.

name: Baan Buri Caf√© & Restaurant
review_1_text: Delicious food and drinks, quick service, cozy place. The staffs are very friendly.  Food decoration are beautiful. Tasty Tom Yum Goong set, delicious mango pancake and waffle. Especially coffee and matcha latte. We enjoy the restaurant.
review_2_text: Ordered the Massaman chicken curry with rice and a mango shake. Both were good value for the price. The mango shake was refreshing, though the artificial flavour was a bit stronger than other mango shakes I‚Äôve had in Thailand. The Massaman was tasty but only had one piece of chicken. Still decent considering the portion size and price. Presentation is excellent. 4 stars for atmosphere cause i think place needs a lil bit of revamping and better lighting. Service was great & lightning fast.
review_3_text: Loved the French toast‚Äîfluffy, lightly sweet, and not soggy at all. The American breakfast was hearty and filling, with well-cooked eggs, crispy bacon, and tasty sausages. A great choice if you‚Äôre craving a classic breakfast. The place has a calm ambiance perfect for a morning meal.
review_4_text:
Absolutely Loved This Place!

We stopped by Baan Buri Caf√© and were honestly surprised by how great everything was. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, the staff are super friendly, and the service is quick and attentive.

The food and drinks were fresh, tasty, and beautifully served. You can really feel the love and attention they put into every dish.

The caf√© has a really positive vibe, perfect for relaxing, grabbing a light meal, or just enjoying a good coffee break.
Highly recommended for anyone visiting the area, this place definitely deserves more attention.

We‚Äôll gladly come back again!
review_5_text: Baan Buri is both a caf√© and a restaurant. The espresso 'Thai style', served with milk and sugar over ice in a large glass, is strong, slightly sweet, and ice-cold ‚Äì a real find in Thailand! The muffin with soft chocolate chunks on chocolate sauce ‚Äì here served with rosemary and two orange wedges ‚Äì easily lives up to its name, "Chocolate Combo." The Thai service is good and friendly. The ambiance, with a touch of coffeehouse, exoticism, and Thai style ‚Äì naturally, what else? ‚Äì is somewhere between delicious, wonderful, and perfect. Sorry, couldn‚Äòt resist to try before the shooting üòÇ

name: Bloomin' Moon Hostel, Chiang Mai Old Town
review_1_text:
I paid more by accident, and the kind waitress gave me my money back ‚Äî I really appreciate the honesty!
Thank you so much! By the way, the coffee was delicious. The lunch portion was generous, and the quality of the meat was very good.
They offer free water refills and always ask if we are okay, so you can see they truly care about their customers.ü•∞
review_2_text: Review for the coffee shop attached: Cutest little coffee shop with an incredible variety of hot/cold matcha/coffee options. Staff was the absolute friendliest with nothing but smiles as they helped us decide what to order. Went for the fresh coconut iced americano and the moon drop. Both were spectacular. The moon drop is a super unique blend of textures, temperatures, and flavors! Definitely will stop back by.
review_3_text: I had breakfast with my family here and it was one of the most beautiful meals I‚Äôve ever had! The food was delicious and fresh, served in an amazing way! The staff is also super nice and the serving time quick! Strongly recommend!!!
review_4_text: I stayed here 5D4N here and I completely enjoy the stay. All staff are kind and helpful. They greeted me every morning when I came down to the cafe. Free breakfast provided to guest also tastes very good. I did ordered the tomyum spaghetti, omg the best ever had. There are 7-11 and laundry nearby which is very convenient. Recommended!
review_5_text:
Came back 3 times! worth it, even tho a bit pricier compared to other restaurants. Their coffee and staff are very good, and we tried their fruits and salads.
Only suggestion is portions could be a bit bigger for the price.

name: Sweet Home coffee -A little Corner
review_1_text: If there‚Äôs one place you need to visit in Chiang Mai, it‚Äôs this cafe!! The staff are truly the kindest people you‚Äôve ever met ‚Äî so happy and helpful in the most authentic way ‚Äî and the food and drinks are as delicious as they are beautiful (see photos if you want a spoiler, but seriously, you will not be disappointed)!! It‚Äôs a little hole in the wall spot with just a few tables, but we went twice and they had room for us both times. And it‚Äôs perfect with little kids, as they had kid-friendly treats and a bag of toys! Our favorites were the mango sticky rice, fruit platter, and fresh coconut, but their entire menu looks absolutely incredible. This is by far one of our favorite cafes in all of Thailand, we wish we lived here so we could be regulars!!
review_2_text:
What a perfect place! The staff are so lovely, and it‚Äôs the best mango sticky rice I‚Äôve ever had!!! I came here three times and I definitely want to come back again. You order a dish and receive a piece of art, everything is made with so much care!
Highly recommend! The prices are also very fair.
review_3_text:
‚óè‚óè‚óèSweet Home Coffee is a,Chiang Mai top pick‚óè‚óè‚óè
Everything about SHC is top notch üëå
The coffee quality is great.
Service by everyone is excellent.
And the space is cozy and super welcoming.
Unfortunately,  the owner has lost her lease by the the end off December 2025. She has not found a new space as of end November 2025  please stay tuned.
Handicap doable and recommended
Inexpensive
Restrooms NO
Final take....Highly recommended for all of the above.  ....but hurry!!!
review_4_text: This is the best americano we had in Chiangmai! And it‚Äôs cheaper than most places. You might need to wait for a while but it‚Äôs definitely worth waiting because they serve everything with sincerity. Will definitely come back again next time to try more stuff
review_5_text: The passion they put in preparing the food and drinks is INCREDIBLE!! They have the best mango sticky rice I‚Äôve tasted, the iced latte was also amazing, better than in overpriced coffee shops. The muesli and yogurt bowl with fruits was to die for and we came back every morning! We have a 3 year old and they brought her toys to play with and prepared her a bowl of oat milk like she was royalty.

name: HappyBlue Coffee - the neighborhood cafe
review_1_text:
Such a nice little caf√© tucked away from the crowds it‚Äôs a perfect spot if you‚Äôre looking to escape the hustle and bustle for a bit. The location feels calm and minimalistic, with very chill background music that makes it easy to relax and enjoy your time.

The cappuccino with oat milk was the real highlight for me. Creamy, smooth, and absolutely delicious this was easily the kind of coffee I‚Äôd come back for again. The croissant was served warm and nicely flaky, exactly how it should be.

I also tried the coconut matcha, which was really well balanced, not too sweet and not too bitter, making it very enjoyable. The only downside for me was the signature lemon cake. It wasn‚Äôt as spongy as I expected and leaned a bit dry and too sweet for my taste. Not terrible, just not my favorite.

Overall, a great spot for a quality cappuccino with oat milk and a peaceful atmosphere. Definitely worth stopping by if you want good coffee in a calm, tucked-away setting.
review_2_text:
Cute, kind of hidden cafe with good cappuccino and delicious Matcha (especially the Matcha Coconut drink). Adding oat milk costs only +5 THB, and there are also other plant-based milk options. And there is an option to use premium matcha instead of regular for +30 THB

The croissant was delicious even though the baked goods are a bit overpriced

The atmosphere is quiet and calm, which is just what I wa looking for
review_3_text: Quaint cafe perched in a deceivingly quiet back street given how central it is. Tended to by warm and welcoming folks who speak great English. Serves up solid drinks, and the pastries look equally swell. Sees decent foot traffic on a weekend morning.
review_4_text: I stumbled upon the cutest little caf√© ‚Äî the perfect hideaway for a peaceful coffee break. It‚Äôs cozy and beautifully decorated, with soft music playing in the background that makes you feel instantly relaxed. The prices are super friendly, and the calm vibe makes it such a lovely spot to read a book or just unwind. Totally a hidden gem!
review_5_text: Delicious coffee! We got a latte and the Coconut Thai Tea Cloud, and both were great though the tea cloud was the star! The atmosphere is very calming and quiet, tucked down a side street near the main walking street. Id recommend it to everyone!

name: Weekday Coffee&Bar
review_1_text: Cute, modern facade slyly hides a large, airy patio out back. Great drinks to go along with the space, served up by a real friendly group of staff. Not busy on a weekday afternoon, lovely spot.
review_2_text: Came by for 2 ice coffees at 9am o. A Friday. Only a couple before us who ordered coffees and dessert. Waited at least 20 minutes before I got impatient and lost track of how long we waited. If in a hurry I suggest this isn't the spot. Nice decor and coffee was decent.
review_3_text: SUCH A CUTE GIRLY COFFEE SHOP. They have nice drink items and sweet treats. They played girly songs. It was suchhhh a vibe. Plus you can make bracelets and paint plates. It was so cute
review_4_text:
Korean style of cafe that sounds accidentally?... It was clean and quiet. I was able to see the room, but it is a space that is large even if I use it with my family, and I am looking forward to opening a new one on the second floor bar soon. Coffee also uses Arabica beans, so I think I thought about the taste and aroma.
Just be careful when you go out to the backyard, tall people
review_5_text: great atmosphere, amazing service, good prices, good quality and quantity, had a great time painting plaster plates and eating yummy food and good drinks

name: Dada Kafe
review_1_text: Aw man‚Ä¶really want to give this place a higher rating because the staff were so friendly & liked the atmosphere, but the food (pineapple fried rice) was just average. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing. Coconut shake was decent.
review_2_text: Calm place, nice people and healthy food. A must in Chiang Ma√Ø. Energy smoothie based on avocado + mango + coconut milk + honey is to take if you want a pause in the old city and restart üòÄ
review_3_text:
Breakfast.
Good food.
Fresh Passion Fruit Juice -> Fantastic

üí¥ CASH ONLY üí¥
review_4_text: Excellent food - probably the best I‚Äôve had in this trip to Thailand so far - fresh rice paper rolls, stir fried morning glory, and an excellent fried fish with lemongrass and lime.  And such lovely staff ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: I was recommended to Dada. My experience supported that recommendation. Lovely fresh food, well prepared - using fresh ingredients prepared on the premises. Well presented at reasonable prices. Good menu with choice of Thai and European dishes. Ensure you try their fruit and vegetable smoothies - many designed to help stay healthy.  Family run with friendly staff.  A place not to miss.

name: ‡∏ó‡∏≠‡∏ù‡∏±‡∏ô Thor-Phan Coffee Roaster
review_1_text: A true specialty coffee spot in Chiang Mai. You can genuinely taste the quality of the coffee (smooth, balanced, and thoughtfully brewed) unlike many places where the flavor is overwhelmed by a burnt aftertaste. Really good coffee, done right ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: I can picky when it comes to my coffee, and this place is one of the best! The espresso pulls are really smooth and not bitter. The coffee shop is simple but nice and chilled with two AC units. Combined with a few games it has, it‚Äôs a wonderful place for a coffee break.
review_3_text:
I've ordered a caramel latte (specifically asked for just a little sweetness)
Saying that it was amazing is just an understatement. This is by far one of the best coffees I've ever had.
Vanilla latte was also good but just a little below the first one in my taste scale
The taste is rich and smooth, the foam is not too thick which is good IMHO.
The atmosphere is nice and relaxing, not too many people during lunch time.
review_4_text: Good filtered coffee, great quality espresso based coffee, all the tasting notes mentioned were spot on. It is just the chair , not that good for my back if its a long time sitting. But overall very awesome place to get your daily specialty coffee that is roasted by their own in the same place!
review_5_text: I came in for a morning coffee and was very impressed. The americano was very good and the coffee beans were very good and fresh. The place is nicely set up and decorated and the service was great. Prices are pretty reasonable. Although it‚Äôs a little small it was nice. They also serve some homemade baked goods which looked pretty tasty.

name: Konjohn coffee 2
review_1_text: Great coffee shop in the bottom floor of the Jomkitti Hotel, plenty of tea options and coffee and cakes! Staff is great. The lemon honey tea is so very refreshing! Lemon cake is good too!
review_2_text:
Small nice, air-conditioned Caf√©.
Selection is not too wide, varied but I think that's also a plus.
You can also choose your roast, light, medium or dark roast according to the coffee/latte you have selected.
But for example for a latte the medium roast (not so bitter) costs a little bit more.
Their Thai tea tastes really great, strong Thai tea flavor, you can also choose your sweetness.
Prices are good, acceptable
They have a toilet to use, toilet paper is outside the toilet to take inside with you.
All in all a nice small cafe to escape the hot heat.
review_3_text:
The staff were polite and the coffees I tried were both great (medium and dark roasts).

There's plenty of seating and the aircon is strong.
review_4_text: This cafe has a very relaxing nice vibe and a few comfy chairs and ok tables available. The prices of their drinks are pretty fair and a bit cheaper comparing to similar cafes with AC. My light roast americano was not good as expected though.
review_5_text: Chilled vibe with the ambient instrumental music and comfy seats and sofas. Other customers are silent so we are talking quietly ourselves! Choice of roast level for the coffees of light, medium or dark. Choice of sugar level in the iced mocha. Basque cheesecake was really similar to those I've had in Andalusia! 100% recommended. To note - cash only.

name: Durianism Cafe‚Äô Phra Singh Chiang Mai ‡∏ó‡∏∏‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡∏û‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏™‡∏¥‡∏£‡πå‡∏ü 365 ‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ô
review_1_text:
This is a place for durian lovers. All sorts of durian inspired desserts, from sticky rice to drinks and ice cream.

They do serve meals too. But we didn't try. It has pasta and so on.

Shout out to the best durian ice cream I ever had so far.
review_2_text:
Our first stop after arriving and we all got the flavoured milks. Very tasty.
Food wise, 3 of us got the same thing, crispy back chicken with rice. Very tasty, but far too much garlic on it. Literally see the garlic. Vampires don't stand a chance tonight.
Great location and good for people watching.
If you use a debit or credit card, you'll pay 3% more no big deal, but cash is easier.
review_3_text:
If you are a true durian lover, just eat it from the fruit markets. I paid for the most expensive 5 star durian and it wasn't ripe. I know what good durian is and didn't come back here.

Saying that the durian sticky rice was good using ripe durian.
review_4_text: Being Asian, I always love durian. And to have a cafe with varieties are awesome. Staffs are friendly, actually most Thais are super very friendly. This is my 3rd time to the cafe & sadly last night here. Highly recommended. Will definitely come back if I'm visiting Chiang Mai‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text:
Food is nice. They have shop which is nice. Got buy something nice for present.
Nearest to the temple, is nice area you seat outside eating while watching the people walking.

name: Fresh Brewed Coffee
review_1_text:
After reading other reviews I feel like my review I'm about to leave doesn't justify the place - maybe a timing issue üôÉ

I ordered a hot latte and a Thai ice green tea. Although the coffee was good, the green tea was just average.

The service was extremely slow (no one else there) and took 15 minutes to make our take away order. This is the main reason for the low rating score.

The atmosphere of this Cafe is 5 star üåü with the comfortable lounges and the plant arrangement was also fabulous. I will try again and update my review if the service changed.

If you found this review helpful, please leave a thumbs up üëç (it's free!) and follow me for more honest reviews üôè ‚ù§Ô∏è üôå
review_2_text: This is a coffee shop in a hotel. The front desk is the coffee shop and the hotel is upstairs.Absolutely loved this place! Coffee was perfectly smooth, and the atmosphere was so cozy and inviting. The barista was super friendly and made great recommendations. I'll definitely be back‚Äîthis is my new favorite spot in Chiang Mai.
review_3_text: Really nice atmosphere, really good service, get to choose your own coffee beans, baristas are excellent and really welcoming. Great place for a coffee
review_4_text: Excellent cup of cappuccino! Very smooth coffee but service is ok. People are friendly but not efficient.
review_5_text: Very nice and cozy vibe quiet place. Smooth coffee and good craft. Recommend for coffee lover. Friendly & expert barista.

name: Woody Coffee ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏ß‡∏π‡πâ‡∏î‡∏î‡∏µ‡πâ
review_1_text: The coffee was excellent, and I loved the aroma of the blend Woody made. If you enjoy nice coffee with friendly owners, you should definitely give this place a try. I've become a regular customer already. üòçüòÇ
review_2_text: We came here twice drinking cappuccinos and it was very tasty. The atmosphere is very relaxed and vibing perfect for a little reading while sipping good coffee. The owner is very kind he even gave us some recommendations where to go in Chiang Mai ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_3_text: I love this cafe because they open so early in the morning (6.30 am.) that help me easily find the coffee to wake me up. If you would like to get calm and coffee please come. They serve coffee with resonable price. You could choose your taste by choosing the dark roasted or medium roasted coffee bean. You also can find some sandwich on weekend.
review_4_text: It is a very new place and the baristas are super nice. I got a cappuccino and it was very good!
review_5_text: What a wonderful artisan coffee shop! We stumbled upon this place when we were bleary-eyed after the night bus. The coffee is Chiang Mai beans and it smells and tastes wonderful. Artsy hipster vibe with good music and cool, friendly owners. Definitely worth a visit (or several!)

name: NORTH COFFEE ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏û‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏¥‡∏á‡∏´‡πå
review_1_text: Wow, only 35 baht for a DELICIOUS iced vanilla latte! It was quite big too, definitely the best value I‚Äôve found in chiang mai! üòç I got half sweet and the lady working was very nice and speedy in preparing the drink! ‚òïÔ∏è
review_2_text: I order Thai tea here, not bad but it will be great if they change to paper cup the plastic cup isn't good for hot beverage.
review_3_text:
the iced cappuccino was amazing and only 35thb !
great flavour and quite big
review_4_text:
Make coffee with Thai smile.
The location is convenient, it‚Äôs a simple roadside take way shop (coffee and Thai tea). The staff is very friendly. It's nice to have an iced drink in the chill morning.
review_5_text: We had coffee here every day during our week stay in Chiang Mai. Very nice taste and very affordable place. Lady who works here is very nice and sweet and makes really good coffee and other drinks. It is always many people here, locals and foreigners as well.

name: CHEDI little stand
review_1_text: Awesome little coffee stand tucked away on a nice sunny street in Chiang Mai. I enjoyed the Chedi special, iced coffee with homemade cream - was delicious! Owner is really friendly, and there‚Äôs a few nice spots to sit outside. Highly recommend! ‚òïÔ∏è
review_2_text: Stopped by this random coffee stand because they had a very interesting storefront display. So impressed that this tiny stand produces such a wonderful coffee. Will definitely be back for more.
review_3_text: Came for the Cinemarise film handbills,  but stayed and returned for the coffee and the serene vibe.  If I could take this little stand and put it in my pocket I would.  It‚Äôs the little space that could. Everything about it is well thought-off and created a very comforting vibe, to think they don‚Äôt actually have that much space and part of enjoying the coffee,  was a enjoying the world moving outside,  with the Wat Chedi Luang in view,  framed by an apartment complex.  The two days I went there, was so hot, I had to opt for cold coffee ‚ÄîThe Chedi, no sugar, simply perfect. Thank you for comforting me on my visit. Didn‚Äôt really have much interaction with anyone but just being there with my sad soul,  and good coffee, listening to the birds outside, felt like a hug already.
review_4_text: Stumbled upon this place and was happy to have found it. Great coffee, a few chairs outside to sit and relax on the quiet street and very friendly service.
review_5_text: Cutest little coffee stand with trinkets store attached.

name: Bella Goose Coffee at Alt_ChiangMai
review_1_text:
This spot was an awesome find, I have been to their other locations and this one, like the others did not disappoint.

This time I went for the Americano. Fantastic. Definitely a chill spot to catch up on some emails. The space is small but intentionally and thoughtfully designed. The barista working was incredibly friendly , which seems to be a common theme with Bella Goose, best team in Thailand.
review_2_text: Loved the coffee here. Only had a simple flat white, early-ish in the morning, so wasn't busy at all. We really liked it (of course this was for a bit of nostalgic Aussie coffee, not for a Thai experience!).
review_3_text: The only pumpkin latte except Starbucks in town, but it was too sweet‚Ä¶and expensive, the seat wasn‚Äôt comfortable, quite awkward to work from outside when people working inside the coworking space.
review_4_text:
Absolutely love Bella Goose! ü™ø
I‚Äôm a big fan of their smoothies and cakes every item on the menu is a hit. My favorite smoothie bowl can only be found here, and it never disappoints.

Their smoothies are beautifully presented, taste amazing, and come with generous toppings. Best of all, they‚Äôre guilt-free and perfect as a healthy breakfast option.

What really makes the experience even better is the service. Special shout-out to Jaab, the barista at this branch always friendly, polite, and genuinely helpful when recommending menu items. A true gem!

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a delicious and wholesome treat to start the day right. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
review_5_text: Super nice caf√©! The atmosphere was modern and felt very new. We just tried the caf√©, but it looks wonderful for remote work as well. They have great coffee and delicious smoothies and the stuff was really really nice.

name: Shongcafe Chiang Mai
review_1_text: Really nice coffee shop just off the main street. Both the iced latte and iced americano orange were both so tasty, and so affordable. Service was excellent and with a smile too :)
review_2_text: Delicious coffee and cute little packaged cakes! Quick service! 10/10
review_3_text: Great experience..BEST COFFEE IN TOWN ‚òïÔ∏è ‚òïÔ∏è ‚òïÔ∏è ‚ù§Ô∏è üíô üíú üíñ üáπüá≠ THE BEST üëå ‚úåÔ∏è üáπüá≠
review_4_text: Lovely hot üî• coffee cappuccino for 40 baht and lovely happy owner 10/10 from us! ü§§
review_5_text: Very cute little coffee shop with a few seats so you can relax. The drinks are very refreshing with plenty of ice and coffee or flavouring and only cost 40 baht. We tried both a soda and a latte. The lady who runs it is very friendly.

name: Thaan Aoan
review_1_text:
I had a pleasant meal at Thaan Aoan Restaurant in Chiang Mai. The food is good and generally well prepared, with flavors that reflect traditional Thai cuisine without being overly adjusted for tourists.

The menu offers a decent selection of local dishes. What we tried was tasty and made with fresh ingredients, even if not particularly memorable. Portions are fair and prices are reasonable for the area.

The atmosphere is simple and relaxed, suitable for an easy, no-frills meal. Service was polite and efficient, nothing exceptional but perfectly adequate.

Overall, Thaan Aoan is a solid option if you‚Äôre nearby and looking for straightforward Thai food in a calm setting. Not a standout destination, but a reliable choice.i
review_2_text:
This place deserves 5 stars all around, one of the best in all of Chiang Mai.

Each dish was prepared fresh and presented with care. Food was flavourful, portions large, and food quality high, all with very reasonable prices. The mango bowl was a highlight!

Service was friendly, polite, and quick without being intrusive. The restaurant has a welcoming vibe. Will definitely be back!
review_3_text: By far my favorite place to eat in Chiang Mai for a sit down (or to-go) restaurant.  You can eat in comfortable air conditioning or out in a beautiful outdoor rain forest type/patio setting. I have only had the breakfast (several times) and the food is delicious. I am very picky about how I like my hashbrowns and they were not only done perfectly as I requested, but they were the best tasting too! Atmosphere is wonderful, staff is so friendly and polite, especially Sky - he has been a wealth of knowledge for me and has provided so much valuable advice regarding the area. The prices are very good, portions are excellent...I would get a taxi from miles and miles away just to eat here!
review_4_text:
Was pleasantly surprised with the meal I got here. It was next to a main road and even though I sat outside with all the planting and lights it was actually very atmospheric.
Pretty standard Thai meal of spring rolls, pad Thai and mango sticky rice but it was my last night in Chiang Mai and you can't go wrong with these classics.
Really lovely food and impeccable service and not expensive for what I got.
Very tasty and super impressed.
review_5_text: On my last morning in Chiang Mai I went for breakfast at this restaurant and it was great. I was hungry and was travelling to Chiang Rai so I ordered two portions, a cup of coffee and a mango smoothie as dessert. I recommend eating here. Food was clean and tasty and the staff was kind and smiling. Thank you üôèüèº

name: TWENTY MAR
review_1_text: The atmosphere is good, and the boss and the staff are very friendly. Of course, it tastes great. Personally, the coffee tastes the best in Chiang Mai. I said I would visit every day before returning to Korea, but unfortunately, today is a temporary closure...
review_2_text:
Amazing coffee, they really know how to make great drinks. A must visit if you are looking for unique drinks and an awesome overall experience. Had to buy some coffee beans as well because the coffee was great.

The service is also top-notch. Not a lot of seats and no kids allowed. So just a nice coffee drinking experience for coffee lovers. Absolute mist visit!
review_3_text: Small shop but very cosy place. If you like to listen to soft music and sit with a cup of nice coffee, this is the place. Bring your love one and I believe she/he will enjoy... We ordered Perfect Orange & Super Dirty. Both are üòò
review_4_text:
This is place is a mood, like a coffee speakeasy.  They have a smooth jazz vibe with the music, and everything is about the coffee.

They have a couple variations of the classic Thai coffee drink ‚Äúthe dirty‚Äù.  We tried the ‚Äúsense of dirty‚Äù and the ‚Äúsuper dirty‚Äù. Both were unique improvements on the original. They really elevate everything.  High craft coffee.
review_5_text:
Good spot to enjoy your specialty coffee from Colombia. With a twist of Japanese look and feel. Kind of not for ‚Äòkanji‚Äô and ¬¥kids‚Äô‚Ä¶ but for sure ¬¥adult only‚Äô

Highly recommended for the mood and vibes !!

name: Blue Coffee At Old Town
review_1_text:
As good as the Blue Coffee near Nimman.
Very nice and cozy seating, inside as outside.
Their hot cappuccino is 80 baht, which is my opinion a fair price overall.
Definitely a nice little cafe and the staff is very kind and friendly.
review_2_text:
I‚Äôve had Blue Coffee in Maya Mall, and thus knew this would be a good time. I really enjoy the Blue Coffee, iced, that I got with no sweetness.

Wi-Fi is nice, seating is decent, and quiet enough to rest / talk. Would definitely recommend this spot - and full disclaimer got a 10 baht discount for writing this review.
review_3_text:
If you‚Äôre looking for a caf√© that perfectly blends calm vibes with minimalist charm, Blue Coffee at Old Town is an absolute must-visit. Located right in the heart of Chiang Mai‚Äôs historic old town, this spot stands out with its clean, simple aesthetic and bright, airy atmosphere. Large glass panels open up the space beautifully, making it feel spacious and refreshing whether you‚Äôre sitting inside the cool air-conditioned room or choosing a cozy seat by the street.

Their drink selection is solid ‚Äî from smooth, well-balanced coffee to refreshing signature beverages ‚Äî and everything is crafted with noticeable care. The bakery corner is another highlight; fresh pastries with just the right sweetness, perfect for pairing with your drink and slowing down for a quiet moment.

Whether you‚Äôre dropping by for a mid-day coffee break, looking for a comfy place to work, or just exploring the old town, Blue Coffee delivers both great taste and great vibes. It‚Äôs the kind of caf√© that makes you want to linger a little longer.
review_4_text:
Absolutely loved Blue Coffee in Chiang Mai!
A cosy spot with really warm vibes, perfect for a quick caffeine fix or a slow morning. The coffee is smooth, fragrant, and well-balanced ‚Äî you can really taste the quality. Staff were friendly and welcoming, making the whole experience even better.

The caf√© is clean, comfortable, and a nice escape from the busy streets. Prices are reasonable too. Definitely a place I‚Äôd return to whenever I‚Äôm in Chiang Mai. Highly recommended! ‚òïüíô
review_5_text: Cozy cafe with outside seating area. Great coffee selection! Almost no waiting for my order to arrive. Cafe is shared space with the treasury museum of Chiang Mai.

name: MINTNIMAL
review_1_text: Absolutely wonderful banana chocolate cake, and the Thai iced tea is made fresh and is wonderfully roasted tea leaf-flavored. Cute little shop, too!
review_2_text: literally kicked out to wait into the heat while there was plenty of space inside. Very long waiting times, not sure how serving a scoop of ice cream can take this long. Smoothie was good, ice cream tastes meh
review_3_text: The smoothie I got was frickin great and chunky. There‚Äôs a nice vibe to the place as well.
review_4_text:
Very cute place to take a break, a great selection of ice-creams and sorbets, as well as a few baked treats too.

Went back a second time, the apple cake was delicious!
review_5_text: A mint lover‚Äôs paradise! We had a Mintnimal cocoa, mint ice cream and a slice of apple cake with salted caramel sauce - all were amazing. We will be returning!

name: Herb Basics
review_1_text: If you love Herbal products, this shop  is a ‚Äúmust go‚Äù place. Quality is great and price is reasonable. You can buy cosmetics and essential oil, balm made from herbal. There are also coffee and cakes inside. You can sit and relax inside. Every time I‚Äôm in Chiang Mai, I always go shopping in this place. ü§©
review_2_text:
A popular shop to buy inexpensive herbal products made locally in Chiangmai.
A large majority of the products are aromatherapy related and personal toiletries, emphasising natural and free of harmful chemicals.
There‚Äôs a refreshment counter serving barista coffee and snacks too.
Worth to check it out if you‚Äôre around the area.
review_3_text: The atmosphere is cozy, and the scent is relaxing. Desserts are good portions, and the salted caramel brownie is amazing.
review_4_text: It's my second time in the shop. Last September, I bought some essential oils and cosmetics and had Thai milk tea to spend whole afternoon. Now, I take vacation with family and take them here. Soft drinks are good, staffs are kind, products are fantastic. I enjoy everything here!
review_5_text:
Very elegant coffee and perfume shop.  Coffee good.  Cosmetics good quality and well priced, at least the body lotion I bought is.
Certainly would come here again. üòäüòäüòä

name: Lazy Lemon, Old City
review_1_text: Massive breakfast servings for lower cost, really delicious breakfast to help start your day off right. Recommend the Happy Bowl and Pancakes with Mixed Fruits. Coffee was really worthwhile, coming from an Australian. Would love to come back and visit here again soon.
review_2_text: The avocado and poached eggs on toast was some of the best I have ever had. The side salad with balsamic vinegar and roasted tomato was a delicious surprise. Quality was incredible and will definitely be back before I leave. I aso tried the tropical pancakes which were really delicious.
review_3_text:
I usually don‚Äôt distrust reviews, but in the case of Lazy Lemonn, it‚Äôs impossible not to wonder how this place has achieved such a high rating. The only plausible explanation is that the reviews are seriously inflated, because the real experience falls far short of what is promised.

There were two of us, and we arrived at 8:29 a.m. As soon as we walked in, a girl told us they weren‚Äôt open yet, in a rather dry manner. I asked if we could simply sit and wait, since there was less than a minute to go and there were already other customers sitting outside. She reluctantly agreed.
What‚Äôs striking is that while we were waiting, the staff were calmly preparing things behind the counter, yet the menu wasn‚Äôt brought to us until 8:45 am, fifteen minutes after their supposed opening time. A first sign of disorganization‚Ä¶ or indifference.

The latte was disappointing: it tasted almost entirely like milk, with no balance or character. The iced Thai tea was fine, nothing more.
The ham and cheese bagel was a complete disaster: chewy, clearly defrosted, with visible cracks on the surface. A low quality product whose appearance already warned you that the taste and quality would not justify the price.
The pancakes with tropical fruit were good, but by no means exceptional or memorable, something you can easily find in dozens of caf√©s around Chiang Mai without paying an ‚ÄúInstagram premium.‚Äù

If the food was underwhelming, the service finished sinking the experience. With the exception of one male staff member who was genuinely kind and service oriented, the rest of the staff, especially a girl wearing a hat and a black-and-white sweater, had a rude, unfriendly, almost confrontational attitude, as if serving you were a favor rather than their job.
From the moment we arrived, the feeling was clear: we were not welcome.

No one asks how the food was, not even when they see plates left half untouched. There is zero interest in customer feedback or improvement. The unspoken message is simple: pay and leave. Preferably as quickly as possible.

To make matters worse, they only accept cash, something that is not mentioned on any sign nor communicated when you arrive. In 2026, for a modern and far from cheap caf√©, not accepting cards is simply unacceptable.

First and last time.
Don‚Äôt waste your time or money on this place with inflated reviews. Chiang Mai is full of caf√©s that are infinitely better, with honest products and, above all, warm and respectful service. Lazy Lemonn offers neither.

I regret writing such a negative review, as I don‚Äôt enjoy doing so, but the experience was so uncomfortable and disappointing that if it helps other customers make a better decision before coming here for breakfast, it‚Äôs worth being clear:
walk past it, it‚Äôs absolutely not worth it.
review_4_text: Amazing breakfast spot in the middle of city center. Service is a bit slow depending on the rush, but the wait is worth it. The weather in mid-November was bliss-if you‚Äôre lucky you‚Äôll get one of the 5 patio tables. Reasonable price for excellent quality western-style breakfast. Everything we tried from the food to the coffee was on point.
review_5_text:
Encore Lazy Lemon!
So disappointed Avocado on Toast SOLD out. No Avocado.

However, scrambled eggs with cheese on toast EXCELLENT! Must Order!

Strawberry and banana smoothie also üëçüèº GREAT!

Must come again ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥

name: To The Moon Guesthouse
review_1_text:
A typical Chiang Mai vibe hotel. We had one of our best holidays. For the whole 7 days, never got tired of staying here doing nothing but relaxing. We saw many other guests staying like us for hours. All felt relaxed.
A unforgettable cozy vibe here, with breeze, birds, 8 puppies, swimming pool, soft music and the whole decorations. No need to walk out for cafes. Here it's enough.
The location is also good. Near Tha Phae Gate. Easy to walk within old city and to eastern markets out of old city. Easy to find good juice bar and Thai boat noodles within 5-minute walk.
One other best thing is, it's quite with such good location. Barely no noise of motor bike.
Would definitely come back next time.
review_2_text: I absolutely adore this hotel. Honestly, out of my six weeks traveling across Thailand and Vietnam, this has been my absolute favorite stay and how lucky I am I to have found this gem üíé! The place is newly renovated, lovely rooms and the atmosphere / vibe is great! Super nice outside area and pool to chill and relax. Plus they have 8 puppies! ü•π highly recommend this place - 10/10 and nearly forgot, the owners are lovely and super sweet!
review_3_text:
What we liked:
- great location
- really nice exterior
- dogs but unfortunately not sterilized (puppies around)
- laundry service
- staff ladies and young gentleman super nice

What we did not like:
- room was not ready at point of check-in (especially as we asked for an early check-in before arrival after 20h flight) -> we had to wait for additional 30 minutes and we did not get any offer such as a soft drink while waiting
- room 16 was on top floor with steep and narrow steps. We asked for a room on ground floor as we are not that mobile but was not possible
- room was small which is ok but what we did not like is that the bathroom was super tiny, mouldy, smelly and without window and the bed head was directly next to it
- room 16 is next to the washing machines and generator which can be quite noisy at night

So in short, pleasant stay but we were hoping for more and more customer centric service (especially by reception) e.g. making a room switch possible due to mobility issues or helping bring the suitcases up or down or having a drink while waiting until the room is ready.
review_4_text: Fave place. Very quirky design. Great for a day by the pool. Great food and drinks. I stayed in a tent on the second floor. Great experience. Ideal location for temples bars and restaurants. Plus there's 6 gorgeous puppies that just wander around loving attention
review_5_text: Literally come here every day lol. Heaven on earth and they have the cutest puppies ever. (The owner took in three strays and one had 8 adorable puppies). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

name: SukiShake Caf√©
review_1_text: We came for breakfast around 11am. It was quite busy and there was only one table left. The menu had lots of options and was pretty affordable. The food was delicious and took around 15 minutes to come. The food was fresh and the portions were great. The staff were friendly and the service was good. Everytime we walk past here it is full and I can see why! Would recommend.
review_2_text:
We arrived in Chiang Mai at 7am after a long ride from Bangkok. I went to Google maps and found this breakfast place was close to our accommodation. We waited until it opened and had the most delicious breakfast. They have lots of healthy freshly prepared meals. We have been here 5 times and order different things each time.
Everything tastes unreal and at a very good price. We have been traveling Thailand for 2 months and this is definitely my favourite breakfast/ lunch spot.
The negative reviews are not accurate at all.
My favourite is the sourdough bread with cream cheese and fresh tomato 10/10.
review_3_text: I came here three years ago and had a great experience,but this time was even better. I am happy to see they expanded the team and how the things have improved. The food as usual is delicious and went there every day of my stay in Chiang Mai. Congrats and see u on the next visit .
review_4_text: A lovely spot for health lovers! The prices are super affordable, and everything tastes amazing. I tried the Combo Set for only 200 THB, which includes a rice bowl and a freshly pressed juice. I chose honey + ginger + lime + cinnamon, and it was perfect refreshing and flavorful. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys healthy and delicious food. Lots of menu options to explore!
review_5_text: This is a nice little place. I found it to be on the more expensive for Chiang Mai. We paid 416 baht for 1 a√ßa√≠ bowl and 1 plate of avocado toast and eggs. Other than that the food was decent!

name: Mitt Studio
review_1_text: Such a great place to do ceramic work. The studio is clean, well-organized, and really relaxing‚Äîperfect for focusing and enjoying the process. The staff are friendly and helpful, and they explain everything clearly without hovering. Materials and tools are well prepared, and the overall vibe is calm and inspiring. I‚Äôll definitely come back again!
review_2_text:
Took two hours, one day of hand building and one day of turning. Very nice staff with lots of good feedback. If you like coffee they offer that too.
And if you not hear long they ship it international!
review_3_text: Had a fantastic time here again, this time I learned wheel throwing. My wife and I have been coming here for over 3 years. Great teachers, great personalities, great art! Lovely place to relax and create some art, really bright and welcoming. Highly recommend.
review_4_text: Had such a great time here - such a unique, cozy, welcoming studio for anyone who wants to do some crafts üíó would recommend to everyone who wants to just relax and make art!
review_5_text: Affordable first time pot throwing class! You get a couple hours to practice on the wheel and then keep a few pieces you make. The instructors speak some English so it was easy for us foreigners to understand the instructions very well. Friendly and easy to follow, just takes practice.

name: Glyn Chiangmai Thai Cuisine ‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏¥‡πà‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢‡∏Ñ‡∏π‡∏ã‡∏µ‡∏ô ‚Äì Breakfast, Brunch & Lunch with Local Charm
review_1_text:
Highly Recommended Oasis in the City
‚ÄãThis restaurant left a profound impression on my family and me. The quality and service far exceeded the price point‚Äîtruly excellent value for money.
‚ÄãThe staff were all incredibly polite and kind, contributing to the overall wonderful experience. I ordered the smoothie, Thai tea, spaghetti, Tom Yum Goong (Spicy Shrimp Soup), and a salad, and I felt that every dish was prepared with great attention to detail and care.
‚ÄãWhile the space itself is not very large, the atmosphere is incredibly relaxing and peaceful. It truly feels like a hidden "oasis" right in the heart of the city. We left feeling completely satisfied and impressed.
review_2_text:
The decor of the place is fresh and the atmosphere good.
The food is good and the mix berry smoothie was a delight. We tried waffle fruit bowl and French toast fruit plates with caramel macchiato coffee and smoothie. The portions were adequate and felt quite fulfilling.
Can visit if nearby.
review_3_text: We stopped here for breakfast and it was a great find. The Four Treasures breakfast was a really delicious mix of flavours and beautifully done. The space is airy and cool with welcome air conditioning, and the team were warm and attentive. Would absolutely recommend if you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai.
review_4_text: Presentation matches the food! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è we enjoyed it so much! Staff were also friendly and even took photos for us. Will definitely come back here!
review_5_text: Service was great and the atmosphere had a very chill vibe. Food was decent but not great. The beef krapow was really tough and had no business being served like this. Portions were a little small too. The kiwi smoothie was refreshing and is a plus point. One thing I thought wasn't great was that they were giving away a free salad in exchange for a Google review, but I think they'll give a review regardless of a good or bad review.

name: Meilleur Wine Coffee
review_1_text:
Walking through the streets of Chiang Mai, my wife and I found this Wine Oasis. The first  proper well curated selection of wines from around the world.
Its nice interior, and music, mixed with friendly attitude, at the correct room temperature, made our visit delightful. My wife had a glass of French  rose wine, I ordered a premium local lager beer, and then we shared a bottle of La Vieille Ferme white wine which drenched our curiosity to try new things in a town not very used to serving wine.
Feeling grateful, Sam Zesati and B√°rbara Ortega
review_2_text: Very small but perfectly formed! A great selection of bottled wines, only a couple available by the glass but they were lovely. The owners are super friendly and the service excellent. Highly recommend for anyone wanting something more relaxed and refined to drink in Chiang Mai!
review_3_text: Great selection of wines (for Asia) and fair prices. Really enjoyed my Montepulciano red wine from the Abruzzo region. Probably the best place for a decent glass of wine in Chiang Mai Old town.
review_4_text: Small, cozy wine bar. Well curated selection of wine from around the globe and some things to nibble on while enjoying your wine. Nice little terrace, if you prefer to sit outside. Professional coffee maker available as well.
review_5_text: Very nice ambiance and stocked with good wines. The layout is excellent. My wife & I had a very relaxing glass of Italian wine, before buying a french Pinot Noir for the hotel. We will return.

name: Montree House
review_1_text: Quiet and chill cafe located in the center of town. Great coffee beans. Coming here everyday.
review_2_text: In the back of an eclectic yard, down a small lane from another small lane‚Ä¶ it is worth seeking out. Most flavorful coffee I found in this area, and open early!
review_3_text: We had a lovely stay at Montree House! The room was spacious and the furnishings were new. The owner is incredibly friendly! There's free coffee downstairs, which is really delicious! You share the bathroom and refrigerator with another room, but we didn't mind that at all.
review_4_text: Nice coffee and relaxed atmosphere. A comfortable place to spend some time in Chiang Mai ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text: Such a cute place with very good coffee. üòÅüòÅ

name: ENP Coffee In City
review_1_text: Fantastic vegan white chocolate and macadamia cookie and the best vegan banana bread! The bread was moist for a vegan dessert not to mention the delicious iced thai tea. We are pleased with their vegan desserts.
review_2_text:
A calm, cool space where you can enjoy an excellent coffee and something to eat whilst supporting a fantastic organisation, Elephant Nature Park, and a remarkable woman, Lek Chailert.
I highly recommend a visit here...and to Elephant Nature Park, which is an ethical sanctuary.
review_3_text: Thai tea is superb. I asked for unsweetened and got sweet, but that‚Äôs ok. It‚Äôs delicious anyways. I love the Thai tea here. The inside is very clean and service was friendly. There is air conditioning, so it‚Äôs great to come in and cool off from the heat. Grab a good drink and eat up before your next adventure.
review_4_text:
Good coffee but very bad coffee cups. Spilled the cappuccino all over my shirt and pants. Had to go launder the shirt in the restroom. Now it‚Äôs all soaking wet. Very bad cup lids. I advise to not use them at all. Get a cup to stay or take the to-go cup without the lid.

Also minus half a point for not having a whole milk.
review_5_text: Great place to stop for coffee and snacks. Also ice cream! And lots of space in air con

name: CHEF COFFEE.cnx
review_1_text: It was a very nice and refreshing iced Americano during the hot day in Chiang Mai. A small, yet cozy and nice coffee (not only) spot inside the old city. Also enjoyed the conversation :) and thanks for the hint on visiting Chiang Mai university's surroundings! I went there and it was amazing üôå
review_2_text:
My partner had coffee here, got a stomach ache directly afterwards and later had to throw up.
Not 100% sure if it's from here but the last food we had before this was eaten hours before and definitely safe so probably something wrong with the ice cubes or milk.
review_3_text:
easy to stop  by
the owner is so freindly.
latte is worth trying
review_4_text: We stumbled across this cute little coffee shop while we were walking past craving a refreshing iced mocha and some iced milk tea. They delivered! It was delicious! We can definitely recommend them if you are in the area üëçüèº‚òï
review_5_text: Beautiful coffee and nice service

name: SOME SPACE.CNX
review_1_text: This is where you get your cold drinks in a hot day. You‚Äôll feel refreshed after each sip. I suggest having the drinks with the yogurt for an added tang and creaminess. The owners are welcoming and fun to talk to!
review_2_text:
I visited this caf√© yesterday and had a really nice experience. They offer frappes, but not a coffee one, so I asked if it would be possible to make it. They told me they had never done it before, but were happy to try ‚Äî and the result was delicious.
They made me a coffee frappe with oat milk, perfectly balanced, smooth, and very tasty. You can really tell when people put effort into something, even if it‚Äôs not on the menu. We even talked about possibly adding it to the menu in the future, because it turned out so well.
The staff were friendly and open-minded, and the atmosphere was calm and welcoming.
If a coffee oat milk frappe ever makes it onto the menu‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúTotty - frappetotty‚Äù wouldn‚Äôt be a bad name üòâ.
Definitely a place I‚Äôd come back to.
review_3_text: Awesome place with delicious drinks! They have fruit smoothies, matcha drinks, coffees, lattes, frappes, and smiles! Very friendly owners are always here and ready to serve you a tasty drink and a nice smile!
review_4_text: Notice to espresso aficionados: they have a SINGLE  dose grinder. Ask for their m√©dium roast and they will serve you a beautifully extracted fruity coffee like we rarely see in any coffee shop. And it is not even expensive. And on top of that they are some of the friendliest owners there is and love to share about coffee. Go, it's quite an experience.
review_5_text: This cafe is such a hidden gem! The coffee is absolutely delicious and aromatic ‚Äî you can really taste the quality in every sip. The owner is super friendly and takes time to chat with customers, which makes the experience even more special. I love the warm, welcoming vibe here, and I‚Äôd definitely recommend everyone to come and try it out. Trust me, you‚Äôll want to come back again!

name: Happy Monday coffee
review_1_text: Small spot in central location. I had a mango smoothie and a carrot muffin. Mango smoothie was creamy and mango flavor of moderate intensity. I really liked the texture. The carrot muffin seemed handmade and of great quality for 70baht, it was served warm when seated. There is also a small backyard.
review_2_text: We‚Äôve only been in Chiang Mai for a couple of days and we‚Äôve been to Happy Monday Coffee twice. Both times we had a mango and a passion fruit smoothie. It was so freaking good. They make it without sugar for you. It‚Äôs very smooth blended frozen fruit that you can even scoop out of your cup at first. Super tasteful and delicious! And they even have a cute little garden behind the house which is very calm and relaxed üôèüèº
review_3_text:
A small open-air coffee shop in the middle of a tourist street.
They serve nice coffee (if lucky you might find imported beans) along with other small snacks such as sandwiches and croissants. The price is quite reasonable.

A nice place to stop, take a break from the busy life, read a chapter from a book, or just have a good chat with a friend.
review_4_text:
Happy Monday Cafe is a cafe that exudes a charming, laid-back vibe that immediately sets you at ease.

The drink we tried was the Coconut Coffee and their signature Happy Monday. They masterfully merges the comforting warmth of well-brewed coffee with the tropical twist of coconut. The coconut flavour was far from overwhelming and instead complemented the rich, robust taste of the coffee.

This caf√© is definitely a gem in Chiang Mai that shouldn‚Äôt be missed.
review_5_text:
Good family owned coffee shop, they also had small selection of pastry.
Limited seating, but nice environment
Coffee and tea were good.
Good for a quick break from the heat. AC.

name: The Coffee Bull School
review_1_text: AungKarn is a very kind, nice and generous owner of this lovely cafe. He is a true coffee master who knows from planting coffee tree, roasting beans to dripping. He is also a film teacher in a university. What is the most precious thing is that he is openminded and willing to share his coffee knowledge with different people. We enjoyed a unforgettable afternoon with AungKarn in this ancient house. I will recommend to anyone who loves coffee!
review_2_text:
Intrigued by the bric-a-brac inside, I walked in the coffee bull school and interrupted Aungkarn while he was teaching a student. That did not fuss him; to the contrary - he included me in his lesson. I ended up spending all afternoon there, chatting with him and his student about coffee, history, love, religion and all things in between.
I am so grateful for the time we spent together, it‚Äôs for these moments of connection between strange humans that I travel!
review_3_text:
Organic, home grown coffee beans. The owner is very nice and loves what he does. I‚Äôm surprised this place doesn‚Äôt have more reviews or customers.
Also - the iced coffee is huge!
review_4_text: Angkarn, the owner, is one of the sweetest, most genuine and passionate people we've ever met. He gave us amazing recommendations for local food, and really spent time with us!! And his carefully chosen, hand-roasted coffee is OUT OF THIS WORLD. I'd recommend this place to EVERYONE!
review_5_text: Best place for coffee beans. Price is too reasonable for the quality. Talk to Ajarn Angkarn ( Mr. Tuesday ) the owner and you will go back with more thsn just coffee but sincerity and good thoughts.

name: Starbucks (Thapae)
review_1_text: This Starbucks is in a great location. You can see Chiang Mai's famous ancient buildings from the second floor. No tickets are required. There are flocks of pigeons in front of the door, but I still recommend that you come at night.
review_2_text:
If you‚Äôre looking for one of the only places in Chiang Mai that DOESNT have a bidet in the men‚Äôs toilet, THIS IS THE PLACE! Even the worst hostels in the city have them installed.

What a disgrace for an international coffee chain!!! Friends don‚Äôt let friends drink corporate garbage coffee anyway. Do yourself a favor and get better coffee literally anywhere!
review_3_text:
It‚Äôs too crowded to stay.
The drink warms in my hand,
with nowhere to sit.
The restroom is closed,
a sign reads Out of service.
Some people stand on the narrow stair landing,
setting their drinks down to eat.
Only the counter
keeps selling.
review_4_text: Bought the chiang mai souvenir mug here. Overall it was good. Ordered matcha latte and matcha croissant. Good location.
review_5_text:
I would like to thank Bell for his kindness and professionalism. What a polite and helpful young gentleman. He actually made my and my wife's visit to Starbucks a real pleasure. This branch overlooks Tha Phae Gate. Its cool, clean and spacious. A great branch üëç.
I actually wanted to get a selfie with Bell but it was rather busy due to Yi Peng festival. Hope you dont mind my capturing your imagine for this review. Thank you üòä üôè

name: The Story 106 Co-Working Space &Cafe
review_1_text:
Very quiet caf√©, perfect for working or reading. The atmosphere is calm and cozy, ideal if you‚Äôre looking for a place to focus without distractions. Right next door there‚Äôs a lovely shop selling wooden accessories and small handcrafted items, perfect for home decor or as thoughtful gifts.
The staff is very friendly and welcoming. I ordered an organic cacao and it was delicious. Definitely a place to come back to üßã‚òïüç™üíïüòäü´∂
review_2_text: This place is a boutique cafe. The boutique has a plethora of hand craft wood work, from practical kitchen ware like chop sticks, ladles, photo frames and item meant for display.  The coffee and food is the main draw for me.  Latte from espresso machine with a selection of light roast to dart roast. The medium roast is entirely Thai local coffee beans with a medium body and nutty flavour. Pastries are great too. Banana croffle, mango sticky rice we had were well presented and look really nice. A place to hang out for 2 hours, browsing through the wood crafts and enjoy the latte and pastries. The wall was well decorated. Highly recommended.
review_3_text:
Got the whole space to ourselves on a Saturday morning at Level 1. Started the day with their bakes and coffee.

Presentation of food when served was nice, but the food was so-so. WiFi credentials are only provided after payment is made. Latency is fast!

Credit cards are accepted, though there is a 3% surcharge for card payments.
review_4_text: A charming, quiet, and private co-working space ‚Äî perfect for boosting productivity and creativity. The coffee is excellent, and the breakfast is a great bonus. Highly recommended for anyone seeking focus and inspiration.
review_5_text:
My favorite cafe for work!
The second floor is mostly a co-working space! You just need to buy a drink and they give you the Wi-Fi password.
It‚Äôs very comfortable, silent and the internet is pretty good.

name: Single Origin Store Tha Pae
review_1_text:
I'm a coffee nut. This was actually my third cup for the day. Still ready and willing to try and find a good coffee ‚òï place.  I had an Americano Berry floral. We also tried the coconut thai and the coconut matcha. All very good. My only complaint which is true for any beverage place is that they always put too much ice in your cold drinks. Like 90% ice 10% actual drink which lasts not more than a couple of sips.

The atmosphere and setup is  relaxed There's actually a second floor but wasn't available for us at that time. Service is really good. The attendants are attentive.

It's quite a variety retail as well as an ice cream shop. Great place to chill and relax.
review_2_text:
So for all coffee enthusiasts and snobs, this is the place. I‚Äôm a very passionate home barista and annoying as hell as a customer because the coffee almost never meets my expectations. This was the first place in ages to deliver more than expected!

The vibe is immaculate, the staff friendly, chill and attentive, the music is a vibe and fits well, the cookie slapped and the coffee‚Ä¶
well I had one and immediately after, ordered a second.

Especially the Chiang Rai Saenchai Estate was brutally good as a flat white.
What awaits you are first class beans, kind of the best machine on the market (Kees van der Westen Spirit- if you know, you know), Mahlk√∂nig EK43 OG Grinder and other MK grinders + even one from Ditting.

And the homies know how to use the gear. So you‚Äôll get what you pay for!

They also offer beans to buy, drip bags, ice cream, apparel and more. Amazing place for enthusiasts.
review_3_text:
The coffee here is excellent ‚Äî high quality with a great selection of beans, offering a rich yet well-balanced flavor. The atmosphere is just as impressive: calm, comfortable, and thoughtfully designed.

The location is unbeatable, right by Ta Phae Gate. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to work while watching people come and go, with the old city wall right in front of you. A great place to slow down and enjoy both the coffee and the surroundings.
review_4_text:
Came here for our last day in Chiang Mai while we waited for the train. Was a great chill space to sit and watch the busy road outside. Great location. Little bit of calm in amongst the hustle and bustle of old town.

Really cool selection of drinks. We also got a bunch of food. Was hearty and filling. Spent just under 1000 baht but it felt worth it for the food, aircon and place to relax before the  trek out.
review_5_text:
I found this place when I made a visit to Tha Pae Gate, tried out their americano orange and it was perfect!

I also love the coffee presentation. They really put effort in presenting the coffee just the way it is pictured in the book menu.

Nice ambience, especially in the afternoon and evening while enjoying the view of Tha Pae Gate and its surrounding.

If you're looking for a good coffee with a nice atmosphere, I highly recommend this place!

name: CoolMuang Coffee
review_1_text:
‚òï‚ú®

CoolMuang Coffee is a cozy local caf√© with a warm atmosphere. The coffee is smooth and flavorful, made with care, and the space is perfect for relaxing or taking a short break. A great spot to enjoy good coffee and chill vibes in town.
review_2_text: I never realized that the tiny building was just where they made the coffee. There are several other areas... all with very comfortable seating ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüôè. A very relaxed and comfortable area right in the middle of busy Thae Phae Gate. Good coffee too üòéüëçüëç. Free parking for bikes and cars too. Wow!
review_3_text: Awesome little coffee shop that serves amazing lattes!! The vibe is really cool with a small outdoor area. Got 3 lattes and 2 water bottles for 260 baht.
review_4_text: Coffee was average. Kinda touristy. Not much to mention. They have indoor and outdoor seatings which was great.
review_5_text: Very comfortable breakfast spot even though it is located just right next to main road‚Ä¶ must try the picanha beef fried rice, the porridge also surprisingly yummy

name: STORIES
review_1_text:
Stories in Chiang Mai is a solid choice if you are looking for a meal that feels both fresh and indulgent. Also, the staff were so nice and friendly. The burger is a standout. It arrives well-assembled with a juicy patty and a generous amount of melted cheese, all balanced by crisp lettuce and pickles that add a nice crunch. The seasoned potato wedges served on the side are a highlight as well, providing a satisfying texture that beats standard fries.
The smoothie bowl is equally impressive and clearly prepared with care. It is packed with a vibrant mix of toppings like sliced bananas, dragon fruit, blueberries, and a hearty portion of granola and seeds for texture. The presentation is beautiful, even featuring a small decorative flower that makes the dish feel special. It is a great spot for a relaxed meal where the quality of the ingredients really shines through in every bite.
review_2_text:
A very modern and stylish cafe.
They offer a wide variety of foods and drinks.
I got their cappuccino for 75 baht which is a bit pricey but it was a very good cappuccino. Italians would approve.
Besides that the staff is very friendly and their seating inside got AC. Outside you can take a seat and observe the streets. Great cafe.
review_3_text: I came across this spot this morning while exploring Chiang Mai, it‚Äôs a cute little restaurant. The vibe is nice. I ordered the mixed berry French toast which I enjoyed very much. I‚Äôm not entirely a fan of the service style, or walking up to order your food but I will say the food didn‚Äôt take very long. French toast were 10/10 not too sweet and the fruits were perfect!
review_4_text:
If you‚Äôre looking for a cozy spot to sip your morning coffee and enjoy a hearty breakfast, this place is a gem. They‚Äôve got plenty of vegetarian and vegan options, which makes it easy for everyone to find something delicious. And the best part? It‚Äôs not one of those overly ‚Äúexperimental‚Äù cafes. you get comfort food done right.

If Chiang Mai is your last stop in Thailand, this cafe is the kind of place you‚Äôll be glad you wrapped up your trip with. Sure, the staff can come off a little snobby, but honestly, my breakfast was so good it completely made up for it. One of those meals that just puts a smile on your face.
review_5_text: Just flew into Chiang Mai, checked in, and stumbled into Four Stories ‚Äî it instantly felt like a home away from home. Exceptional in every way, from the atmosphere to the care and comfort. Exactly what you want after landing in a new city. Highly recommend.

name: Aob-Sook cafe & restaurant
review_1_text:
Tucked away in a small Soi near Thapai gate.
A small caf√© restaurant which has a good selection of western dishes and croissants.
The shakes are wonderful. However the food though wonderfully presented and cooked felt a little bland. They just needed something more. (taste wise)
Maybe I'm just used to Thai food too much.
Great if you want a quiet place to eat. No car parking. It has motorcycle parking. WiFi
review_2_text: This cafe is awesome, like ABSOLUTE AWESOME! Came here for breakfast & tea time. They have a number of delicious food & drinks. Staff team are really nice people and their service is top notch.
review_3_text: This was probably the best breakfast I've had in... all my life? & I've had a lot of good breakfasts. The bread is AMAZING, both the croissant and the sourdough. The crispy potatoes were heavenly. Drinks amazing. I'm VERY impressed with this place.
review_4_text: A favorite cafe in the old city for delicious fresh baked pastries and superb sourdough breads.  Offering an extensive range of very good coffee drinks, tasty brunch options and many pasta choices as well.  Very lovely staff, talented friendly chef, and an easy atmosphere with inside AC seating and shaded outdoor seating.  Everything we tried was perfectly prepared and plated.
