review_5_text: Delicious! This place is so lovely. Great food, atmosphere and service. I feel like a lot of places don‚Äôt do food and coffee well, but they sure do! So considerate of allergens as well!

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ò‡∏∏‡πå‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢ ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ï‡∏π‡∏ó‡πà‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏û
review_1_text: I ordered a drink via delivery and paid an additional 10 baht to have the ice separated, but the restaurant refused. I requested a refund through the app, but was refused, citing insufficient evidence. They shifted responsibility to the customer. The restaurant should thoroughly review the order and verify its accuracy. 10 baht isn't much, but it's money. How much will this cost to multiple customers? The comments are full of people who haven't received the ice separated service. If they're not going to separate the ice, why would they charge extra?
review_2_text: I ordered through a delivery app, but I'm confused why it's so difficult to just not want ice. I mean, don't put it in a cup. And you're not wasting the store's ice anyway, so there's no need to include it since I'm not drinking it immediately. Usually, when I order without ice, it's fine, but why have they included it these past two days?
review_3_text: It's just a storefront located at the entrance of the Im Hotel; there's no seating area. There's one long bench in front of the shop for customers to sit and wait for their drinks. However, it's the branch closest to the moat.
review_4_text: The staff were friendly and smiling, the service was good, and the coffee was made to a high standard. It's a shame there aren't any proper tables to sit at.
review_5_text: The two female staff members were kind, friendly, and provided excellent service, even bowing respectfully.

name: Yourproject_
review_1_text:
One of the most inspiring hidden spots in Chiang Mai!
Yourproject_ is a beautiful blend of a vintage boutique and a cozy coffee shop. You can sip a well-made cappuccino while browsing through curated vintage pieces - from fashion to unique home decor.
The space feels artistic and relaxed, with a touch of Tokyo-style aesthetics. Every visit brings something new.
I included it in my Chiang Mai recommendations - check it in profile!
review_2_text:
Great Vibe, lovely weird combo of interior design and coffee place with nice music, nice owner and last bn least: great coffee.
Loved the Tonic Espresso (will take that one home)!
review_3_text: I recently visited this coffee shop and I must say, it was a true gem. The coffee was amazing, and I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they also offered oat milk. The small corners filled with vintage furniture gave the place a cozy and unique atmosphere, reminiscent of Berlin. The music selection was also fantastic, with a great mix of hits. While the prices may be a bit higher than other places I've seen (100bts latte with out), the overall experience was well worth it. I highly recommend this coffee shop for its delicious coffee, charming ambiance, and excellent music. It's definitely a must-visit spot for coffee lovers.
review_4_text:
another cafe well hidden as it looks just like a normal residential house.

The coffee is very good, I got flat white 80B, and it has lovely music, one with good sound system. the seating area also has different kind but limited, totally good to have space and not crowded.
review_5_text: What a place! Speciality coffee was very good, I got Ethiopia and what a flavor! My fianc√© got matcha and it was the best matcha in town. Atmosphere inside so chill, some music, some vinyls to buy, really cool furniture. Highly recommend for matcha and coffee lovers. It‚Äôs a little bit more expensive but really worth it.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text:
We had to check out an Amazon cafe during our stay in Chiang Mai after seeing them all around. Very comfortable indoor seating area. The matcha lattes are delicious. We almost did not go since there are so many other non-chain cafes around but glad we tried it out.

Now for my standard comments. Location is very clean and well kept.
review_2_text:
Great for co-working spaces. Strong air-conditioned so long sleeves are a must.

I have been here twice.
review_3_text: Nice packaging. Diverse flavors. Try the coffee marble cold drink. Try have special clever straws ;)
review_4_text: Can't say I have ever had a bad experience at an amazon cafe : )
review_5_text: Great coffee shop chain throughout Thailand very much in the Starbucks vein but better value and free wi-fi. We haven't eaten there yet but sure we do will soon.

name: ‡πÅ‡∏≠‡πà‡∏ß‡∏î‡∏µ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà All Day Breakfast and coffee
review_1_text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
American breakfast was super delicious. Fresh ingredients, solid portion of veggies. We ate there two days in a row. Great value for money.
Highly recommended üëå
review_2_text:
Amazing breakfast the lady is really cool and the food is perfect and cheap. I enjoyed it so much.
Just one thing, waiting 40min is a bit too much , she was preparing everything by herself so it‚Äôs understandable but don‚Äôt stay if you need to go quick.

Again very good place/food/person
review_3_text:
Lovely ambience with really friendly owner! The place is ready at 7.30am and you can sit outside to enjoy the morning sun!!

The breakfast is simple and nice, not to mention the wonderful perk-me-up coffee! A good place to relax and chat.
review_4_text: Super fresh, simple tasty and cheap! 3$ only for a nice breakfast/lunch
review_5_text: Coming here, I recommend the green tea menu because it is very delicious. Good service staff Room services and car rental services are also available. And I will definitely come back again.

name: SipSpot
review_1_text: A very good coffee place with good vibes but also: the owner‚Äôs attitude to the clients. It‚Äôs like coming to someone‚Äôs home. I liked the details there and the taste. The only suggestion would be to make espresso as the last drink in the queue cuz I came with a friend who ordered flat white and when my espresso arrived it wasn‚Äôt hot but warm. Anyway, I‚Äôm extremely happy to visit this place and wanna come again!
review_2_text: Highly recommended. 1. I asked before ordering if the cold brew is light roasted, she said yes, but it turns out to be dark roasted and too bitter for me. She immediately made another coffee for me without any hesitation for free. 2. The new coffee, which is the lab sip, it‚Äôs good. 3. It‚Äôs very chill, sitting by the roadside but it‚Äôs not hot at all
review_3_text: The Arabica coffee roasted just nice and perfect taste with flavourful aroma... Just happened to walk by this shop and the ambience and the smell of the coffee captire my attention...  try out whenever you around this area...
review_4_text: One of the best flat whites that i have had in a while‚Ä¶ and its open late which is nice for me who drinks coffee even at night
review_5_text: I ordered affogato and the espresso was perfect!As a coffee consultant from the Philippines who also advocate supporting local farmers, it's good to know that SipSpot used 100% local beans  from Thailand.

name: Cha haus.Thapae & The gifted vibes
review_1_text: Highly recommend for Thai tea! We are staying right down the road from here and stumbled upon it and I‚Äôm so glad we did. The biscoff lover is AMAZING! The cream cheese is basically just a really thick foam that‚Äôs absolutely delicious. 10/10 recommend and will be making daily stops here.
review_2_text:
The tea was super rich, both Thai tea and cheese topping were perfectly balance.

I ordered the Double Thai Tea Cheese yesterday, and it was absolutely amazing!
I really want to drink it again, but I can‚Äôt üò≠
If I come back to Chiang Mai, I‚Äôll definitely come back here!

They also have Reiki + Sound Healing in the same place!
an incredible spot to stay calm and stay delicious at the same time.ü•πüå≥
It‚Äôs not far from Tha Phae Road, yet it feels so peaceful, just like home. üè°

The service was so warm and friendly!
And there‚Äôs a cute dog named khun "Happy" who came to greet us
barking a bitüòÖ
but super adorable üêï

I really love this place. Highly recommended! üåø‚ú®üßãüëçüèª
review_3_text: This place is such a hidden gem! The biscoff lover drink with whipped cream cheese was AMAZING. Some of the best Thai tea we‚Äôve had while in Thailand.
review_4_text: Very good, simple Thai tea. We got 10% sweet and it‚Äôs perfect! The bread with custard is nice too. You sit outside.
review_5_text: This is always my favourite place to order afternoon tea on Grab! They have a great variety of drinks, and one of my favourites is the Osmanthus tea with 25% sweetness. The delivery is always fast, and the shop really pays attention to small details. Everything is nicely packed and well prepared ‚Äî love it! ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Coffee Bar Thapae
review_1_text:
Was casually walking around when i discovered this shop.

The owner is a kind & happy gentleman who suggested me his signature Dirty coffee (i was skeptical) & i absolutely loved it, must try. Also tried Americano.

This is a must visit place if you want to have a heartily warm conversation & a coffee.

This shop deserves more attention, please walk by if you are looking for a wholesome experience.
review_2_text: Tasty coffee to go for a really good price. The place is quite small but has few seats in case you want to have your drink there.
review_3_text: I ordered an iced mocha, it came with too much ice (there was barely any milk in it). I asked to make it with less ice and that‚Äôs what I ended up with (see picture). The taste is pretty good but prices are not exactly cheap so I would expect a full cup, not half full. If I ask for less ice it‚Äôs because I want more milk in it.
review_4_text: It's a warm feeling shop with good coffee and reasonable prices. I'd like everyone to come my fave one Caramel Macchiato!! Sooo good
review_5_text:
This hidden gem matches the best coffee bars in Italy! Be sure to try their Black Orange and Black Honey Lemon for a Thai twist.
Their iced Mokka and Cappuccino are sensational!

name: Into Thapae Street Coffee
review_1_text: I‚Äôve had many dirty coffees from China, Singapore, Japan, but this is easily one of the top ones i‚Äôve tasted!! The coffee to milk ratio is perfect and I think they concocted their own milk to be creamier and a lil sweet, just how I like it! It‚Äôs a hidden gem situated at a very unassuming alley beside a laundromat so you can do laundry too~ The owner is very nice and kind, and the vibe was outdoors but nice and cooling. I loved my experience here!!! Definitely will be back!
review_2_text: The medium roast and med-dark roast Americanos were nicely made. Barista was friendly, too. The seating area is a driveway next to a laundry shop, leading to a private residence. Quaint little place to relax and enjoy a cuppa.
review_3_text: The Best coffee I've had in weeks. Great little spot here in Chang Moi. Has a breeze flowing on a hot day. I'm doing my laundry right next door at Clean Space,  I can keep an eye on it all and enjoy a decent coffee.          Top Spot!
review_4_text: Good coffee, reasonable price, Thapae area. You can wash and dry clothes next door and sip coffee while waiting. The atmosphere is comfortable. The owner is kind. They also sell homemade pastries. Delicious!!!
review_5_text: Excellent Thai style (hot and cold though hot is not listed he will make it for you) coffee. Quiet place to sit and enjoy it down the alleyway behind the stand. Very settling place to wait in line for Mr. Pierre

name: Batch : baked and brew
review_1_text:
Great for coffee and a snack.
Cappuccino was 60B.
Strong and hot.
Perfect.
review_2_text: Its just within the vicinity of Raming Lodge, where I am staying so it‚Äôs very accessible for me. And I tried their Brown Sugar and Pan De Chocolat and i loved it! My go to when I‚Äôm craving for something sweet! Plus the lady staff is very nice too! Love the overall vibe of the coffee shop üíö
review_3_text: Top notch cafe with a stellar coffee barrister. The coffees are smooth, delicious and when I visited they were brewing coffee from Laos and also Thai style coffee which was a real treat. Thank you for the soothing coffee experience. It‚Äôs set in a nice street with a modern interior.
review_4_text:
Cute little coffee with some pastries and donuts, good prices, i had a cappuccino for 55 baht. They have pretty comfortable tables and chairs in case you want to work and great air conditioning which is rare. Also great wifi.
Coffee is good but would be nicer if they were served in actual cups and not plastic.
review_5_text: Drove across town to get gluten free brunch and we were told they‚Äôre not serving any food today üòÑ they have no gluten free cakes or pastries available. They were kind enough to let us sit in the shop while we worked out where we could go next.

name: ‡∏™‡πÇ‡∏•‡∏ß‡πå‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ü‡∏ß‡∏¥‡πà‡∏á-Slow Living Coffee
review_1_text:
(‚úø‚ô•‚Äø‚ô•‚úø)
I absolutely loved my visit to ‡∏™‡πÇ‡∏•‡∏ß‡πå‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ü‡∏ß‡∏¥‡πà‡∏á coffeeshop. The service was top-notch: friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. I ordered a Dirty Latte, and it was simply delicious, perfectly balanced and beautifully presented. The location has such a cozy, ambient vibe that makes it a great place to relax or get some work done.

Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for good coffee and great atmosphere.
review_2_text:
I visited this caf√© for the first time last month, and the atmosphere was absolutely amazing ‚Äî calm, cozy, and full of good vibes. The staff were really friendly and took great care of me. Since then, I‚Äôve been coming back regularly for their coffee because the price is reasonable and the taste is totally worth it.

I also found out that at night, they turn the place into a beer bar, which sounds really cool! I hope I can visit one evening soon.

If you‚Äôre looking for a nice caf√© or a chill beer bar, I highly recommend this place. It‚Äôs located on the second floor of the building!
review_3_text: The place is really next level , managed by young chap , it‚Äôs got one of the most untouched classy vibe..  I must mentioned music they have in cafe it‚Äôs better than many pubs and bars ..
review_4_text: It's really good! Americano rychee is specialüëçüëç
review_5_text: Love the coffee and company!

name: Craftsmanship Caf√©
review_1_text:
I had Dirty ‚òïÔ∏è and it was great. It was little bit more sweet than on other places but I like it this way. This place has peaceful vibe in busy street üôÇ

They also sell coffee beans üëç
review_2_text: Great vibes, tasty drinks, and a perfect spot to work and chill!
review_3_text: A lovely caf√© with a great atmosphere and a beautiful view of Chiang Mai. They use locally grown Chiang Mai coffee beans, and the flavor is excellent. Definitely worth a visit!
review_4_text: nice oasis

name: T'leaf Cafe
review_1_text: Wonderful place with proper latte
review_2_text: If you want to try Burmese food, this is the place to go. I've been here three times, and it's super delicious, whether it's fried rice or noodles. I love the refreshing and not-too-greasy seasoning. The environment is also very comfortable; I love coming here in the afternoon to enjoy the sunshine.

name: Cafe Chungdam
review_1_text:
It was a very bad idea to come here. After a long flight, I was extremely hungry. We ordered a Hawaiian pizza that was advertised on the menu board and two salads.

The salads took more than 30 minutes and were brought only after I mentioned the waiting time. The pizza arrived after about 40 minutes in total. It was absolutely not worth the wait ‚Äî it tasted like a cheap store-bought pizza. I honestly don‚Äôt understand why it took so long to prepare. The dough was completely dry.

The only positive thing is that the salad was actually tasty.
review_2_text:
Great matcha and big selection of smoothie bowls that come generously topped.
Nice place for laptop work too (wifi, chargers, comfortable sitting).
review_3_text: Not a good place if you want to Work. To sit and use your laptop you have to buy food/drinks for 150 bath per hour. Coffee was good.
review_4_text: A vibrant and cozy place to dine. Their menu has a variety of options, they have Thai cuisine and western. I was delighted that they have alternative options for dairy milk such as oat/soy milk.
review_5_text: Friendly, attentive service, with a modern, airy ambience right across the moat. Good coffee. Good wifi but no power outlets available (the ones next to me were covered with tape). Called Moats Moment Cafe outside (?).

name: anamii.coffee X woody restaurant bar
review_1_text:
So in love with this hidden gem. Just walking along the phae road when suddenly found this little cool coffee shop for hangout.

My luck, the coffee was good, the service was top notch, the vibe is nice and the place is good for a hangout session.

Definitely will come again when i'm around.
review_2_text:
Absolutely loved the experience at Anamii.Coffee x Woody Restaurant Bar! The caf√© side offers excellent coffee‚Äîsmooth, rich, and clearly brewed with passion. Great spot to unwind or get some work done during the day.

Come evening, the vibe shifts perfectly into a stylish restaurant-bar setting. Friendly staff, great ambiance, and a unique dual-concept that really works.
Highly recommended when you‚Äôre in for a chill coffee break !!! üòÉüòÉ
review_3_text: The coffee is very delicious! The service is good and the barista is cute ^^
review_4_text: The best coffee in Chiang Mai made by the nicest Thai!! üôèüèΩüôèüèΩ
review_5_text: Cool menu and cold cocoa!!

name: STORIES Ping River ‚Ä¢ cafe&bistro ‚Ä¢
review_1_text:
I am writing to express my disappointment with my recent visit to your restaurant during the New Year‚Äôs countdown event. Unfortunately, this was one of the worst dining and countdown experiences I have ever had.

The food quality was extremely poor. The dishes were served cold, bland, and tasteless. We waited an unreasonably long time for our food, and when it finally arrived, it was not worth the wait at all. At one point, we only wanted to ask for the bill, but even that process took a long time.

In addition, there were serious problems with the service. Our order was forgotten, and communication with the staff was very difficult, as they did not seem to understand what we were asking for. Everything felt chaotic and unorganized. What was most unacceptable was that a female staff member openly argued with customers, which was very unprofessional.

Moreover, for such an important event as a New Year‚Äôs countdown, there was no manager or supervisor present to take responsibility or manage the situation. This made the overall experience even more disappointing.

This was my first time visiting your restaurant, and it will definitely be my last. It is very unfortunate that my first New Year‚Äôs countdown experience of the year turned out to be so unpleasant. I felt extremely disappointed and dissatisfied with both the service and the management.

I hope you will take this feedback seriously and improve your service and staff management in the future, especially during impor
review_2_text: Great location by the river and friendly accommodating staff. We ordered 3 dishes and only 1 dish actually taste good (the rice with fluffy omelette and prawns) although a bit too spicy (I requested for reduced spicines). The pasta with soft shell crab comes with white sauce (taste a bit like cloying beschamel sauce) which doesn't go with the crab. The sour pork entree is too salty and too sour, unbalanced flavour overall. The live music outside clashes with the live music from next door restaurant (this is definitely not their fault) but staff are happy for us to chose to sit inside. Price point on the mid-upmarket scale.
review_3_text: Beautiful setting with a fantastic view of the Old Bridge and the lively bars and restaurants across the Ping River. This place has so much potential, though it feels like it could do a bit more to match the beauty of its surroundings. The atmosphere comes entirely from the location - not from the setup or the music. I came around 5:30 pm for sunset and was surprised to find it almost empty, despite the stunning scenery. Hopefully, they‚Äôll refine the experience in the future.
review_4_text: This place quite calm and has delicious food. Stuff are very kind and prices are acceptable. Best place for calm, dinner and drinking
review_5_text: The food was all very very good! The service was nice and accommodating the food didn't come super fast, but this isn't a fast past vibe it's a place you go to relax and enjoy atmosphere. My kids love the the playground and there were kid friendly items on menu. We spent the evening enjoying music and food. I almost didn't go because of recent bad reviews but I'm very glad we did

name: SELF
review_1_text:
Lovely coffee. I had one of their signature called ‚ÄòCitrus Boy‚Äô which is milk coffee with orange syrup. It was so good.

The place is perfect for hiding away from the afternoon sun to sit back and relax with good music.
review_2_text:
Hidden gem doesn‚Äôt even begin to describe it, after countless caf√©s around Chiang Mai, this one stands out as unforgettable.
When coffee is done right, it demands your full attention. No distractions, no extras, just you and the cup, completely absorbed in its flavor and aroma.
review_3_text:
Exceeded all expectations ‚Äî truly a hidden gem, even after visiting over 50 caf√©s in Chiang Mai.
A truly great cup of coffee makes you only drink coffee ‚Äî nothing else. You‚Äôre fully immersed, surrounded by the aroma and flavor.

Started with the Citrus Boy. I love citrus-based drinks, and this one nailed it ‚Äî a beautiful blend of citrusy sweetness, vanilla, milk, and espresso. Topped with a slice of orange soaked perfectly in espresso.

Immediately ordered a second ‚Äî the Black Amber. I‚Äôm a big fan of truffle, so this was a no-brainer. It came with a passionfruit crisp on top, and right before serving, they sprinkled fresh black truffle over the coffee ‚Äî the aroma and depth it added were incredible.

The vibe and music? Spot on. Whether it‚Äôs sunny or rainy, this place just makes you feel calm, cozy, and safe.

I drink and drunk hereüëâigÔºöOneCupWithYv
review_4_text: This quirky coffee shop, with its small sign and retro minimalist design, offers unique but limited coffee options. The citrus coffee with milk blend, surprisingly delightful, is a must-try. The service is excellent, transporting you to an oldies feel coffee shop. However, the price may not be the cheapest for coffee, it‚Äôs worth for trying
review_5_text: Definitely one of my favorite coffee shops in Chiang Mai. Very minimalistic and modern cafe that is also a listening bar. When we were there they played very experimental tunes. Jazzy-electro-krautrocky music. This place is also good if you have to do some work. Cappuccino is delicious and prizes are very fair. The girls who run the place are super nice and hip.

name: Still.Coffee&Life
review_1_text:
A hidden caf√© with city views.
To get there, you need to enter through a clothing store and go up to the fifth floor, which already makes it a bit different. The space has a minimalist, warehouse-style design that feels clean and well thought out.
It‚Äôs a quiet, tidy place, ideal for reading or working on your laptop. The city views add a nice touch without being overwhelming.
The service is good and friendly, and everything feels well organized. A comfortable spot to spend some time inüíï‚ú®‚òï
review_2_text:
To me, this place is a hidden gem in Chiang Mai. Located at 4F inside an old mall, near to Warorot market. Ordered filter coffee, local beans, nice coffee. The most attractive points for me is the large space, tranquil environment, unlike those famous coffee shops. Great view of quiet streets around. The only inconvenient things is the toilet is located at 6F, you need to get the key from shop owner in order to access the toilet.
If you are looking for a place to enjoy and book and a cup of great coffee, this is the place i highly recommend.
review_3_text:
We spotted this cafe on Google Maps and decided to check it out and were pleasantly surprised by how good the drinks were.

We ordered the Rainy Pink and Haven't We Met and were truly impressed by the flavour profiles and presentation of the drinks.

Highly recommend popping by for drinks if you're in the area.
review_4_text:
I found this coffee shop thanks to a recommendation from someone I met during a tour yesterday. It is very hidden inside a clothes market, and you have to climb all the way up to the 4th floor. Honestly, while walking up the stairs, I kept doubting myself and wondering if I was going the right way.

But once you reach the top, you will be rewarded with a cozy space, great vibes, and really good coffee. The journey makes it even more special. Definitely worth the adventure if you love unique, tucked-away caf√©s. Highly recommended! ‚òï‚ú®
review_5_text:
What a stylish place! Very unique, feels like a secret spot. I've tried not coffee drink, it was yummy and refreshing.  They make coffee, mostly.
Love all the drawings with cats

name: Going up cafe
review_1_text: Fresh sandwiches homemade which has a good taste and clean. Friendly staffs and reasonable price. Seating is available for eat in and balcony. Breakfast menu is interesting and please try sandwich and wrap. Coffee and drinks  is available Must try
review_2_text: They have a little bit of seating inside and outside with it being A/C inside. Very clean and food was good and fair price. Didn't take a picture beforehand but enjoyed it all! We had the smoothie and iced latte as well as a chicken wrap and chicken sandwich and would eat here again!
review_3_text: Had breakfast in Going Up Cafe for 4 days from Jan 12-15, 2026.  Menu includes breakfast sets and many varieties of sandwiches at very reasonable prices.  All are freshly prepared on the spot.  Great service and ambience.   Staff were very efficient in their service of customers in the cafe as well as online / phone orders for takeaway.  Clearly a very popular cafe with many Thai locals dining in the cafe and also order takeaway.   A gem in Chiang Mai not to be missed if one wishes to have freshly prepared sandwiches instead of paying over-priced breakfast in the hotels within walking distance from the cafe (eg Melia hotel, Anantara and others).  Highly recommend.
review_4_text: Small cafe making expert toasted sandwiches ü•™ great prices- around 70-80 baht each. A nice selection of smoothies and drinks also on offer. The staff were very polite and welcoming. Thanks guys keep up the great work
review_5_text: Up early and this place was open.  Great breakfast, coffee and vibe.  The sandwiches look delicious.

name: LAZY LEMON BREAKFAST CLUB
review_1_text: This place is amazing. Food is delicious and like art. We got tea, which had fresh herbs, compote pancakes and avocado toast. Every single thing exceeded expectations. Highly highly recommend especially if you are craving western food
review_2_text: Amazing amazing experience at the last lemon breakfast at club!! Saw this place in a Chiang mai YouTube video and had to come because it‚Äôs super aesthetic pancake + tropical fruit plate and it‚Äôs beautiful menu üôèüèº did not disappoint!! I got an egg and bacon with pancakes and added sourdough in the side (iykyk) and my girlfriend got the tropical pancakes! Everything was delicious, pancakes with syrup were a highlight! 10/10 recommend this lowkey spot üò≠‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: Food here is delicious, beautifully presented and very reasonably priced! We got the tropical fruit pancakes, they were light and fluffy as a cloud and came with so much fruit we had to take them in a to-go box because we weren‚Äôt able to finish them all. Service was perfect as well! Recommend this place for breakfast.
review_4_text: Getting breakfast here was exceptional! I got avocado toast. My husband got pancakes with bacon and eggs and my brother got pancakes with fruit and each dish was a work of art and also extremely well plated and cooked and of course delicious. Would definitely come back here for breakfast again
review_5_text:
Very cute place and the food is amazing. I like their menu design and the outdoor sitting area. Their logo has a cat and a lemon on it. It really goes well with the colors of the table and the rest of the set up. ü§≠ I really liked this place. Will definitely be back next time I‚Äôm in the city.

Affordable prices
Food amazing
Friendly staff
Fast service

name: Buncha‚Äôs slow bar
review_1_text: Atmospheric place, good people, coffee and prices. However it‚Äôs very hot inside and if you would like to work with your laptop - there‚Äôs  no tables
review_2_text: Really cool coffee spot! Friendly service, great cappuccino. You can choose which roast you like- light, medium, dark. They gave me some cute stickers as well ;)
review_3_text: I go to another branch which is at Jing Jai Market very often, this is my first time at this one. Coffee is pretty good and affordable!!
review_4_text: Very nice speciality coffee, super friendly staff and chill atmosphere ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text: Very good Piccolo and a fine selection of coffee beans from the Chiang Mai region.

name: Iron32 Hotel Bar and Bistro
review_1_text: We stayed here 3 nights on the top floor. We spent pretty much a whole day drinking on the very spacious patio overlooking the city. The room could get hot, but AC works well. Very clean with modern amenities. The staff is friendly and the restuarant downstairs is tasty and super convenient for breakfast. The location is close walking distance to many things including the night bazaar, restaurants, bars and massage parlours. We really enjoyed our stay here and are really pleased with our selection of Iron32
review_2_text: This hotel was fantastic and clean and comfortable.  The owner was helpful finding us another place to stay as well when we wanted to extend our stay but he was booked solid. Had the green curry chicken for lunch as well and that was also fantastic. This hotel is in a great location with plenty of nightlife as well as authentic shopping from the local market. There is also a great security entrance to the building and rooms as well. This place was all pros and no cons. Would definitely recommend to a friend or family member!
review_3_text: I stayed in the hotel, the room was comfortable and clean. Great location. But being on the main street you get street noise which you can't do anything about it. I also had most of my breakfast /lunch there ,food also good. Very nice and friendly staff. No parking here though. If you rented a car, there might be street parking but don't count on it.
review_4_text:
Loved our stay here at iron 32. We had a party of ten stay here and we had the entire hotel to ourselves. It was a perfect location for us, right around the corner from a busy night market! Everything was walking distance with cute little spots to eat at.

Turbo was amazing host and his staff was extremely friendly. This place was run very well, trustworthy host and staff I might add. The place was extremely clean and well decorated.

Iron 32, won't disappoint! Especially of you have a large group of friends travelling!
review_5_text:
The rooms are in a nice size, each with a private terrace. Room service and fresh towels provided everyday.Staff are also friendly.

Staffs serving breakfast was very disorganized. Each time, they'd forgot to bring us something we have ordered. we'll have to keep reminding them.
And rooms facing main street is noisy at night time.

name: Banviang Coffee
review_1_text: The orange and coconut were crazy fresh and sweet ‚Äî just perfect. And the coffee? So fresh with great body. This tiny caf√© had that warm Thai vibe I love‚Ä¶ smiles, kindness, everything. Out of my 10 days in Chiang Mai, this place made me the happiest for sure. üíõ‚ú®
review_2_text:
One lovely corner cafe in which I have lovely conversations and moments.
PLUS very tasty coffee ‚òïÔ∏è
review_3_text: So nice owner Po. Coffee&cookies is yummy. Also unique hand crafted bracelets, anklets.
review_4_text:
Small coffee shop yet the drinks are good to give a try.
The shop has coconut americano, which is the combination of fresh coconut juice with a shot of espresso.
Mango smoothies without sugar still has the natural sweetness.
The shop owner is nice.
review_5_text:
It‚Äôs really a special little cafe, quite, unique.
You can just sit outside, have a cup of coffee,chitchat with your friends, so chill.
But to be honest there‚Äôs no air conditioning so if you come on a summer day it‚Äôs really hot.
But we love it even it‚Äôs 40 degree outside, a sip of ice latte can be haven!
The big portion of mango smoothie is really pure and sweet , love it.
So if you are wondering in town , just come.

name: Wawee Coffee Kadluang
review_1_text:
Iced Thai Tea 60 ‡∏ø (2025)

Has English menu.

Great cafe to rest after the nearby market strolling. It is almost empty when i arrived.

I could have nice AC, charge my phone and enjoy the quietness.

Normally those popular cafe are crowded with instafamous and other tourist, so i am glad to be here.

Spend a good couple hours to read and really enjoy myself.
review_2_text:
Dirty seats, dirty restrooms üöª but air conditioned
The only reason to come in here abuy overpriced coffee or tea is the crypt quality AC.
FILTHY, and I've been in Chiang Mai many times.
The cloth chairs were so dirty I actually moved to a non cloth upholstered seat. ( see pics ).
Restrooms were filthy.
Next to Ping River,  this place could be so much better for the price.
Service was adequate at best.
‚óè‚óè‚óè‚óè‚óèNOT RECOMMENDED unless you need a dose of AC in the Chiang Mai heat.‚óè‚óè‚óè‚óè‚óè
Final take....The üçã lemon iced tea was ok.
review_3_text: Super quaint coffee shop with an attached bookstore! Nice seating options by the river. As a heads up: their bathroom is out of service at the time of this review, so you‚Äôll have to use the one across the street. Also, their AC is out of commission, though they are using portable AC units.
review_4_text: No A/C, place looks like it's about to fall into the river, the rear is basically a dump. No hello or smile upon entry, everyone wearing masks like they are afraid of breathing air.  Skip it.
review_5_text: No air conditioning but the place is five star with 100 hat drinks. The owner must have money issues, it's 39c outside and no Aircon. They do they just don't wanna turn it on. Place is failing for a reason

name: Caf√© Amazon @SCB‡∏ó‡πà‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏û ‡∏ò‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏£‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢‡∏û‡∏≤‡∏ì‡∏¥‡∏ä‡∏¢‡πå‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏á‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏ç‡πà‡∏ä‡∏±‡πâ‡∏ô2
review_1_text:
Cool place to rest during a super hot day.
Or, have a drink while waiting for your number to be called at the adjoining SCB bank. Nice comfortable seats

Accepts cash, credit card, prompt payment but not alipay payment.
review_2_text: I don‚Äôt want go to Starbucks because they support Israel trrst state with money , so I prefer to go to there but they have 1 hour limited internet and The coffee I shared the picture of below is a large size coffee. Yes, I haven't drank the coffee yet. very little. You can't compete like this
review_3_text:
Amazon Coffee INSIDE SCB Bank.

Well made coffee, comfortable seating.   VERY air-conditioned
review_4_text: Forget Starbucks, this is the place to have a coffee ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: They gave us company for my wife and I to earn money from gaming

name: On the Way Coffee
review_1_text: Great coffee, great friendly service at a great price. What more does one need?!  Came here every morning for a week as I was staying at a nearby hotel. This coffee stand does not serve food. They have a few types of packaged cookies that look tasty. But people come for the fantastic drinks
review_2_text: Love this coffee shop. There were lots of locals when we went. The owner is so nice and welcoming. Cappuccino is flavourful, delicious and great price. We will come back every morning until we leave.
review_3_text: Great value real espresso coffee for 45b. Tastes great aswell!
review_4_text: Some of the best coffee of the city and at THE best price! Not every day but most days they also have very tasty sandwiches for only 25 baht. Always very friendly service also. I go here almost every day, love it :)
review_5_text: Amazing coconut water with black iced coffee! Lovely gentleman serving us as well. Good vibes!!

name: Absolutely Roti & Tea : ‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏µ‡∏õ‡πâ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏î by ‡∏•‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏à
review_1_text:
Quite an interesting place to have breakfast.  The rotis are made fresh to order and come in a variety of flavours, including with chicken curry.

We loved the banana and nutella, and the cheese, as well as the plain one.

Service was quick and tables are often at a premium.

The coffees were okay.
review_2_text: This is the best breakfast spot in all of Chiang Mai. The roti and tea is incredible. Staff are super friendly and hospitable. A must try if you're in Chiang Mai. They only cook in coconut oil and don't use MSG.
review_3_text:
This restaurant, located on the street, is, in my opinion, the best in Chiang Mai. The staff here are incredibly kind, delightful, and eager to communicate. Having enjoyed Roti in various cities such as Kota Kinabalu, Kuala Lumpur, Johor Bahru, Bangkok, and Phuket, I must say that this experience is truly amazing. If you're looking to enjoy Roti in the morning, this restaurant is a must-visit.
‚Äª They are using healthy coconut oil and goat milk straight from the farm.
review_4_text:
Run by 3 macik, was there at 11am and it's no crowd, Likely I'm the late one there. The restaurant had moved and is now across the road, you can park along the road to visit the restaurant, just be sure to avoid the red and white pedestrian tiles. The food they served looks fantastic, Will need to visit at least few more time to taste them all.
Tips: ate the mutton curry, the mutton is soo tender, it's probably fresh from Hamza farm, don't miss the goat milk and lastly the ice lemon tea is huge for 59baht.
review_5_text: While walking in the morning around the temples we found their stalls and were attracted by the smell and we decided to stop. We enjoyed the roti with cheese, children got the spinach cheese roti and the coffee with goat milk was super tasty üòãüòãüòã. Miss Juju is super friendly and she also gives us details about their own farm. The opening time is 6am until 11am.

name: Bake n Wake Co-Working Space
review_1_text:
üåü Amazing Caf√© Experience!
Stopped by for breakfast and coffee, and I was impressed from the moment I walked in. The place is clean, has a cozy atmosphere, and every breakfast dish was fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious.

The coffee was aromatic and rich, clearly made from high-quality beans and prepared with care. A must-try for all coffee lovers!

What stood out the most was the exceptional service ‚Äì special thanks to Khun Dew‚ù§Ô∏è, who was incredibly friendly and helpful. Always smiling, polite, and ready to give great recommendations. It really made the experience feel warm and welcoming.

‚úÖ Delicious food
‚úÖ Quality coffee
‚úÖ Outstanding service
‚úÖ Super clean environment

If you're looking for a cozy caf√© with great breakfast, top-notch coffee, and excellent service ‚Äì this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: Delicious ice cream served with a smile!! After a long day out walking, it was so wonderful to relax in this spacious caf√© furnished with comfortable chairs and tables. There are work stations for those wanting to get work done. Soft music plays in the background to further enhance the experience!! We would definitely come back again!!
review_3_text: The cafe staff were exceptionally friendly and made me feel very welcome. The atmosphere was pleasant and airy, making it a great place to relax. Their drinks were also really good . Will miss this place so much , the cafe and also the hotel üò¢
review_4_text: Loved everything about this place! The food is super tasty and the service is just amazing. It‚Äôs clean, neat, and has such a cozy vibe. The breakfast menu is simple but sooo good. My top pick? Definitely the Matcha Coconut ‚Äî highly recommend! üíöü••
review_5_text: Amazing coffee experience, very good food, generous portions, excellent lunches. Very pleasant staff. I recommend it.

name: MEDELL√çN - Yes, we cannabis (420 weed shop Â§ßÈ∫ª ÎßàÎ¶¨ÌôîÎÇò)
review_1_text:
Very nice and chill place with a lot of space and great atmosphere. You can sit upstairs, play billiards, enjoy drinks or snacks, and even go out to the balcony to smoke ‚Äì which is very rare in Chiang Mai!

I really like their original and creative packaging ‚Äì small ‚Äúegg‚Äù jars that keep the smell perfectly sealed, super practical for storage. Big plus for that!

They offer a good selection of strains ‚Äì both indoor and outdoor, all Thai-grown, plus sometimes imported ones from Amsterdam. When I was there, they had two hash types, which is great ‚Äì not every shop has that!

Prices are fair:

Outdoor from 70 THB

Indoor from 300 THB to 450 THB

Quality is very nice ‚Äì great smell, clean burn, good effect.
The owner has been running coffee shops in Chiang Mai for years ‚Äì this is already his second location, and you can really feel the experience and passion.

Also, the owner is extremely friendly, polite, and VERY HELPFUL ‚Äì speaks very good English, so it‚Äôs easy to communicate and ask about strains or recommendations.

Highly recommend for anyone looking for authentic Thai weed, good hash, and a comfortable chill spot to relax. üåøüí®
review_2_text: Best cannabis lounge in Chiang Mai by far. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and a pool table upstairs along with a balcony that overlooks the street. They also serve delicious food. Try the Oreo milkshake and butter chicken with garlic naanüòã
review_3_text: Really loved the vibe here üåø‚ú® Super cozy spot with a nice chill atmosphere, good music, and that neon cannabis sign giving the whole place a cool touch. The staff are friendly, the seating is comfortable, and the menu has some fun options to try (the shakes are a win). Perfect spot to just relax, hang out, and spend time without any rush. Definitely worth coming back.
review_4_text: Big shop with very friendly staff. Great selection of both outdoor and indoor items. There is even a room for smoking. Good prices and regular promotions.
review_5_text:
Amazing place beautiful vibe
Weed start form 50 thb
And They have really beautiful Pool Table üé±and private lounge .
Amazing 5star

name: Dumnern Saduak Coffee Cafe Chiang Mai
review_1_text: We found this restaurant by researching and was not disappointed. It is a very local restaurant, where there is no english menu (also, no wifi). We have been in Chiang mai for a couple of weeks now and tjis was a GREAT surprise, food-wise. It is not a touristy place at all and we found the food to be DELICIOUS. By watching the plates that were being ordered by the tables around, we understood that there are some dishes that are the fav ones - like the one I ordered:  scrambled eggs with seafood on top of rice. And I was surprised by how delicious it was. My husband ordered the rice with fried fish and he also was very pleased with it‚Äôs flavores and quality. They offer a very unique selection of chillis/ sauces. Both our plates costed 70 bahts. And we would love to come back to try many other dishes from the menu.
review_2_text: Food was delicious and clean, huge portions. Highly recommend - great service. They have a name-calling system when your order's ready, which I thought was a nice touch. Will definitely be back.
review_3_text: There are coffee shop and restaurant with separate cooking areas, but with common dining area. I should say food was not great, but capuchino was fantastic. We enjoyed sitting under the tree with a cup of good coffee.
review_4_text: good coffee good food and cheap. staff can speak english well and someone can speak Chinese language. good location near Chiangmai university
review_5_text: Good for students lunch, reasonable price and quantity. Plain rice refillable.

name: SOFUTO CREAM ‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á ‡∏°‡∏ä.
review_1_text:
Very nice Japanese desserts. There‚Äôs a big variety.
The souffl√© pancakes are delightful ‚Äî I recommend trying them.
The matcha wasn‚Äôt really my favorite, but overall it left a very pleasant impression.
review_2_text: Love the Japanese style souffl√© pancakes ü•∞ Sofuto Cream has a very nice selection of desserts, it‚Äôs one of my favorite spots to indulge in light fluffy carbs on cheat days. They have several locations in Chiang Mai so Google your way to the nearest spot and enjoy yourself ü§§ü´∂ü•∞
review_3_text: Yummy Japanese style desserts, and the kakigori is massive. Best to enjoy with your gang!ü•û
review_4_text: Sofuto Cream, located behind Chiang Mai University (CMU), is a cozy Japanese-style caf√© known for its premium soft-serve ice cream made from pure cow's milk sourced from Japan and Italy. The caf√© offers a variety of flavors, including matcha, Hokkaido milk, and seasonal treats like Musang King durian and strawberry daifuku. In addition to soft-serve, they serve Kakigori, a finely shaved ice dessert topped with fresh ingredients like mango or red bean. With its minimalist and inviting interior, Sofuto Cream is a popular spot among students and dessert lovers seeking a peaceful place to enjoy high-quality treats.
review_5_text:
So good!!

I'm not an ice cream person but their matcha soft serve is delicious, creamy smooth, right amount of matcha, not bitter.

It was sweet for me but not as sweet as what other places offer.

The strawberry cheesecake Mochi was good too, didn't think there was ice cream inside, wasn't a fan, I don't like biting into the cold.

Inexpensive place with good standards

name: Favor Cafe' Chiang Mai
review_1_text: This is a quiet and lovely little cafe . Although the drinks weren't amazing, the cake was delicious enough! The staff were very warm and polite, and the atmosphere was great.
review_2_text: üíïüçëüçµüç§
review_3_text: Quiet place and coffee is tasty.
review_4_text: Pad Thai is the best!!!! I recommend !!!! Also I ordered ‚ÄúBlack Orange‚Äù which mean black coffee  orange juice that is so refreshing
review_5_text: Good üëçüèª

name: temp.cnx
review_1_text: Here's another newly opened cafe near my house that I'd like to recommend. It's a nice place to sit, with a relaxed atmosphere, delicious desserts, and great drinks. I'll try the food next time and write a more detailed review.üòä
review_2_text: nice place, very spacious and comfortable. the food is very good, especially the beef fried rice. such a memorable experience. there are also a lot of parking spaces.
review_3_text: Coffee is good. Atmosphere is so cool as well. The staff is nice. There is parking lot. The price is reasonable. Just comeüëç
review_4_text: Great coffee and brunch menus. Reviewers mention quality food and friendly service.
review_5_text:
Super friendly staff with great service.
Tasty food and drinks at good prices.
Perfect for a date or just chilling.
:):):) recommended

name: LAW COFF & CO ‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏ß‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü ‡πÅ‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏î‡πå ‡πÇ‡∏Ñ ‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á‡∏°‡∏ä.
review_1_text: We gotta gather all the laws in this world to break free from jails. Drinking a cup of coffee frees me from the jail of sleepiness. The staff are super nice and smiley. The coffee tastes amazing. Besides all the different coffees and drinks, the shop also has some souvenirs like T-shirts, postcards, and stickers. The WiFi is super fast with a really long password, so hackers will have a tough time messing with your privacy. The shop has both inside and outside seating. Being close to Suthep Road and Chiang Mai University is a huge plus. They also have a reward program where you get a 40 Thai Baht discount after buying 10 cups.
review_2_text: I hit up this cafe every time I'm in Chiang Mai. I still remember how the chef made the coffee. It's the best coffee in all of Chiang Mai; there's no better. The perfect amount of milk and coffee, the flat white tastes exceptional, the coffee is very intense, and it's always take dark roast. This December, I visited many cafes, but even those that promote great design can't compare to this tiny one on the corner. I love this place.
review_3_text: ‡∏ø50 for a very delicious cappuccino. Highly recommend their medium roast.
review_4_text: My favorite coffee beans ‚ù§Ô∏è I also like going to the other Law coffee shops at CMU.  Light roast R&B blend.  I buy 3 bags of these every month.  Thank you üôè
review_5_text: This place is so good.  I highly recommend !! Such a great value for your bucks.  Kudos to the team

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: I like it. The price is cheap. The taste is the best
review_2_text: I have been to Thailand for a total of one year and can understand some Thai.  The waiter's attitude is too "good". I will use Thai language when I am bored. I will write an email to the company.  Never see again.
review_3_text: The coffee shop I usually go closed so I went here. the coffee is just as any other amazon coffee which is not that good. But the staff at this shop really has an attitude when he serves or talks to you. Nice one.
review_4_text: Cozy place to relax. Better not come during exam weeks.
review_5_text: Green tea is made of black tea with adding green coloring. Makes one wonder what all those smoothies are made of

name: Bankha.cnx
review_1_text: homey cafe vibeüëçüèªüè° wifi available, good coffee and bakery, recommend for chilling with your friends (we‚Äôre have a lot of boardgame) or study/reading a book/workingü•∞
review_2_text:
Such a Cozy cafe.
Good drink
Good mood
Great VIBE!!!
review_3_text:
A new shop near the university.
Beautifully decorated, perfect for chilling out or reading a book.
review_4_text:
Delicious coffee, great atmosphere. Perfect for chilling out for a long time!
#The owner is so lovely!
review_5_text: A newly opened coffee shop in a hidden location, but the drinks are delicious! They also have games to play and the staff provides great service. ü§≤‚ù§Ô∏è

name: BOTAN COFFEE BY PE.SHOP
review_1_text: Good coffee
review_2_text: Delish
review_3_text: The welcome was warm and the staff incredibly friendly! The latte and lemon tea were absolutely delicious, as were the farm-fresh yogurts and the brownie ü§§ A fantastic caf√© in the heart of Chiang Mai University with very reasonable prices: just perfect! üëç
review_4_text: The matcha is delicious. There are both matcha lattes and pure/coconut water. Everything else is delicious. There are bakery and desserts to try. The price is cute. The shop has a half-price program, making the price even cheaper. The atmosphere is friendly. Everyone in the shop is very good and friendly. The shop is nice to sit in, but you should avoid children's break time. The shop can be a bit noisy because it's a break time, but it's a short time and not too disturbing.
review_5_text: The coffee tastes great, with every roast available. They offer free seasonal fruit, and the prices are very reasonable. You won't be disappointed if you stop by!

name: Fav. coffee. roaster - UniLoft
review_1_text: There‚Äôs really nothing to complain about apart from lack of parking space. I wouldn‚Äôt mind drinking from this place everyday.
review_2_text: Excellent coffee and lovely service. This is a small coffee booth with a few seats. The medium dark roast is just perfect - not too sour or acidic. The server is friendly and prices are great.
review_3_text: Great coffee in a good location (and very cheap prices). I strongly recommend!
review_4_text: This place makes the best cappuccino from the several places in the area that I have tried. I've also had an Es-Yen - my first - and it was excellent. They will have my business whenever I stay in this part of the area.
review_5_text: This place is amazing value for money. High quality coffee and friendly service.

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏à‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏ô‡∏° (Since 2015) Jaabnom
review_1_text: Amazing cute little cafe. They have a study room as well which is chargeable. The scrambled egg with toast bread and northern pork sausage was the best. The hot Thai tea was so calming and is the best on a rainy day. Overall a nice place for breakfast they open at 9 am.
review_2_text: I had the cocoa husk tea, with bread, custard and chocolate dipping. I couldn't believe how delicious it was. I will definitely go back and try other flavors. It's worth the price. Owners very nice. Really recommend !! Check in !!
review_3_text: Good place for cacao drinks and beverages. Chill vibes, chitchat place with friends. But you can't bring ANY food in here. Even if you order a lot of things, you still can't bring and eat outside food. They gonna talk with you like "We not allowed to bring any food to eat here, you can eat them outside". For me, it's rude when you talk too loud to embarrass others in the restaurant. They talk to my mate like that, haha. But the food and beverages are still good to me, tho. I went to this place 6 times already. I can say that the cacao and food are good enough to come back.
review_4_text: This is a great place with a nice cozy atmosphere and delicious deserts. Especially their craft chocolate is amazing. Made of real cocoa beans. Drinking chocolate was 80 bhat and toast with chocolate, banana and condensed milk was 45 bhat.
review_5_text: This is the most gorgeous little place to sit and work, read or hang out! The family who run it are so lovely and the food and drinks are delicious. Such a wide range of drinks on offer and lots of flavours of sweet treats. The prices are so cheap too.

name: Monday Cafe
review_1_text: The coffee shop has been turned into a place to stay.
review_2_text: Colorful cafe with nice drinks near the Chiang Mai university.
review_3_text: Very chill out place. Good 360 view of doi suthep good and delicious menu of coffee. friendly weed smoking zone
review_4_text: It's a lovely cafe with several antique cars. It's beautiful to take pictures.
review_5_text: Good

name: Coffee77
review_1_text: One of my default coffee shops around the neighborhood to chill at mostly due to its quietness and decent coffee. Open air seating within a garden. During the day when it doesn't rain it's comfortable under the shades but inside or towards late afternoon there's definitely mosquitoes abound. Toilet cleanliness could be better.
review_2_text: Cute covered outdoor cafe.  Babe got an Iced Caramel milk and I got an Apple tea and they were both so delicious
review_3_text:
short review:
Excellent coffee a normal price, good cookies and chill vibe setting, don't miss this!

They offer 3 types specialty coffee in light, medium, and medium-dark roast.
For your milk based coffee they also have oat milk.
I tried the medium roast in espresso and it's a great acidic entry for anyone who wants to try something different, come and see how espresso can be something else than plain bitterness and dry after taste.
Good coffee beans is great, but they know how to pull a shot correctly, and espresso enthusiasts know it's not about pressing a button on an expensive machine.

As usual, not much food to go with it but they have exceptionally good cookies almond or chocolate, don't let their look fool you these are dense!
The pricing is really friendly too, usually this type places charge you "specialty money coffee" , and the setting is their garden with tables laying around, chill jazz music..

The street still has some traffic but very slow paced, not a major route so I'd consider this a chill place for South Asia üòÖ
review_4_text: Very cosy and quiet coffee shop with affordable coffee and different kinds of roasts. Nice surroundings. Highly recommended!
review_5_text: Really good coffee. Breakfast was ok, nice people.

name: ‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ä‡∏±‡∏¢‡πÇ‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏Å‡∏¥‡∏£‡πå‡∏™‡∏î‡∏õ‡∏±‡πà‡∏ô
review_1_text: My favorite place to buy yogurt smoothies!! I recommend the avocado or mango though everything is delicious.
review_2_text: Good helping of yogurt! Fantastic.
review_3_text: Tasty and cheap price
review_4_text: This is a real dessert, very sweet, extremely sweet, incredibly sweet. Iced bread dessert starts at 49 baht.
review_5_text: All the smoothies are delicious.

name: Kanvela Craft Chocolate Cafe ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏•‡∏≤ ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏ó‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏ö‡∏¥‡∏ô41
review_1_text:
If you love chocolate you'll love this place. Didn't disappoint.

Great Thai region chocolate selections. And while I'm not a fan of soft Serene, their Dubai Chocolate cup was to die for. A heaping sample of so many of the items in the store you wanted but didn't buy.

I also enjoyed their Yuzu Sparkling Tea.

review_3_text:
Delicious craft chocolate, refreshing soft drinks, and tempting desserts. I especially enjoyed the choco-orange juice (though I forgot the exact name) such an unexpected yet delightful combination.

The caf√© also offers plenty of parking space and comfortable seating area.
review_4_text:
Paradise for chocolate lovers! Everything is delicious. I've tried 78% Thai dark chocolate- hot chocolate with real chocolate! Macadamia biscoff candy - each of them are a piece of art! And really yummy too. Flourless cake has beautiful plating and is really nice too, not too sweet, perfect if you don't really like very sweet desserts. The space itself is well designed üëå
You can buy chocolate and gift boxes with candies, and chocolate coated nuts.
review_5_text:
The atmosphere was fantastic.
Chocolate was rich. Coffee was smooth. What else I can have

name: General coffee
review_1_text: Cool Coffee Shop, delicious Cappuccino, delicious cakes, very friendly Staff.
review_2_text:
+ Great coffee with different roast selections
+ Reasonable prices
+ Polite staff
+ Relaxing atmosphere
+ Plenty of seats
+ Motorcycle parking at front, convenient
+ Location is easy to find
- traffic at front is always bad
review_3_text:
Tried this new coffee shop today. Seems to be a franchise from USA. The seating area is very comfortable with a touch of understated class. The coffees were exceptional, if you like a strong almost sour roast.
However, I felt the serving size could've been a bit more generously portioned. The pastries were a home run! Price for 2 coffees and 2 pastries 280 baht.
review_4_text:
Beautiful new coffeeshop with very modern interior. The coffee is really good, but don‚Äôt forget about the pastries! I especially recommend the blueberry cheesecake.

Plenty of seats inside, and you can buy some other snacks and drinks with merch from the machine
review_5_text: It‚Äôs a good place to take a rest, though the music is a little bit loud for working. They have sufficient place to charge. And open until 7pm. But they don‚Äôt provide free water, and a little bit too dark after 5:30pm. Sometimes people put their feet on the sofa. 75B for iced latte, overall, still has good value.

name: Penny‚Äôs Sweet House
review_1_text:
Attractive setting in a renovated home.  Comfortable place to relax and enjoy excellent coffee.  Also offer multiple bakery items which we did not try, but looked great.
Convenient off street parking also.
review_2_text: Love the vibe here, but ordered a hot chocolate today and it was unfortunately lukewarm. Would love to see more consistency with drink temperatures. Still a great spot for a meeting!
review_3_text: We had such an enjoyable time here. Classic period setting. Peaceful place to sit and enjoy coffee milkshake and cheese cake. The lemon cheese cake was delicious. Friendly service tops the experience off. Fantastic üòä
review_4_text: Delicious desserts and good cafe
review_5_text: not really bad, chill vibes for having a coffee

name: DeeNan Coffee
review_1_text:
One of the best ChiangMai cafe. If you looking for real coffee.

They make their own brand coffee from plantation to cafe.

Really recommend!!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: Nice setup with some bench tables and very affordable drinks.  It‚Äôs an open area with just fans to keep you cool so probably not a great place to work when it‚Äôs hot.  A latte costs 35 baht, I tried the Thai tea which was delicious!  There are power point but oddly enough I saw a sign on it that said it costs 5 baht an hour to charge from.  They sell their own brand of coffee here and you can buy the beans to take home. Th owner was very friendly and welcoming. #BeatTheGrind
review_3_text: Small coffee place Under the trees, a bit bitter coffee, probably due to torr√©faction. Good price.
review_4_text: Superb coffee flavour. The uniqueness of this coffeeshop is the owner has his own farm up north n also selects coffee bean from Lisu hill tribers directly. Unpretentious simple place that sell a lot of coffee.
review_5_text:
Really good coffee shop with passionate owner that will help you to choose the best coffee beans matching to your taste.
I took 10 min to talk with him and he explained me how he produces his beans, it was really interesting. He explained me about his roasting techniques.
Price is reasonable and I'm happy to buy my coffee locally !

name: Trofe.cnx
review_1_text: Like it
review_2_text: Amazing Barista!
review_3_text: I ordered an Americano and a dark roast latte via Grab. The Americano was very sour, and the latte's lid wasn't sealed properly, so some liquid spilled into the bag.
review_4_text: The drinks and desserts were delicious! The atmosphere in the cafe was great, very comfortable. I highly recommend this cafe. The staff provided excellent service.
review_5_text:
Good coffee, great atmosphere. They sell football jerseys.
If you like coffee and football, this is a great community!

name: Fernpresso Flagship Store at Suandok
review_1_text:
Fernpresso is a great caf√© to relax or get some work done in Chiang Mai. ‚òï We ordered a hot cappuccino and an iced latte, both of which tasted excellent ‚Äî rich, smooth, and well-balanced. The caf√© has a modern and stylish interior with comfortable seating, making it a nice spot to spend some time reading, working, or chatting with friends.

In addition to coffee, they also have a selection of freshly baked goods. The pastries are definitely worth trying, especially if you want something to accompany your drink. The atmosphere is calm and relatively quiet, which is perfect for people looking for a peaceful caf√© experience.

Parking is easy for motorbikes, but car parking is limited, so plan accordingly. The staff are polite and attentive, contributing to a pleasant overall experience.

Overall, Fernpresso at Suandok is a cozy, modern caf√© with good coffee, tasty bakery items, and a peaceful vibe ‚Äî ideal for both casual visitors and those looking to work or study in a quiet environment. Definitely worth a stop when exploring Chiang Mai
review_2_text:
Perfect Brunch! Everything you want to start your day!

I recently visited this cozy spot, hoping to start my day with some avocado toast, but unfortunately, they were out of avocados. As a vegetarian, I found their breakfast menu somewhat lacking in showcased vegetarian options, which was disappointing.

That said, their Thai tea with almond milk was frothy and absolutely delicious, and the fresh fruit juice smoothies were refreshing and flavorful. I also tried the breakfast sandwich on fresh whole-grain bread, which was excellent‚Äîhearty, flavorful, and satisfying. However, I wasn‚Äôt informed that the sandwich included cheese, which was an issue for me as I‚Äôm lactose intolerant. The staff were super friendly and warm, but they could benefit from being more knowledgeable about the menu and its ingredients.

The restaurant has a chill, laid-back vibe, with quiet music that makes it a great place to study or relax. There's both an air-conditioned indoor space and outdoor seating where you can enjoy the bustle of the busy street.

Overall, the vibe and drinks stood out, and the food was tasty, but a bit more attention to menu transparency and vegetarian options would elevate the experience.
review_3_text: I have officially visited all the fernpresso locations. The coffee is excellent.  Good customer service.  The cakes and sweet have a large selection.  Located across the street from the train station. I recommend this shop
review_4_text: Good price, nice latte and good service. It'll be good for working. It's spaciousüëç
review_5_text: I keep going back to Fernpresso! Great place!

name: Roastniyom coffee(Suan Dok)
review_1_text: This was a nice place to visit. Very quiet but vibrant. The coffee was good, the chairs were very  comfortable for seating and talking. The location has wifi for laptop working. It is right next door to the hospital so there are a lot of ppl that come in and out for business and pleasure. You must be comfortable with the traffic flow of customers to enjoy the location. Once you are inside and seated, the atmosphere is fine. I will visit again.
review_2_text:
Good place to work from if you have noise cancelling headphones. Well located if you‚Äôre living in Nimman.

Possibility to sit at the tables with regular chairs or to go for lower tables with more comfortable sofas or leather blanket.

Coffee is good. Air conditioning tends to be too high, so being a jumper with you.
review_3_text: This is a franchise cafe with good coffee. It definitely has franchise vibe, which is not my preference. Americano is 55thb here and it‚Äôs good
review_4_text: The best coffee shop around near Suan Dok hospital. You can come to chill out or working. There‚Äôs space for you to sit and have a coffee and work. Pleas come and enjoy your time!!
review_5_text:
Edit June 2023...
Recently renovated and really nice looking but the WiFi is still horrible.
AC and good coffee at reasonable prices.

Good coffee and comfortable environment but the last two times I've gone there the Wifi was not working so, 3/5 stars

name: Under Over Cafe
review_1_text:
This is a small cafe.

The atmosphere is very good.

A full set of tables and chairs of Snow Peak

It makes people feel very intimate.

Quiet, the decoration style is very Japanese.

It is suitable for a rest alone.

The coffee is good.

Medium-baked American style

The acidity is moderate, retaining a little aroma of deep baking.

Latte, ordered deep baking

It belongs to the upper middle level.

The cost performance is not bad.

The main thing is comfort and quiet.
review_2_text:
A charming, intimate caf√© with limited parking, but the experience is well worth the inconvenience.

This small cozy cafe is owner-operated, offering freshly baked goods and exceptional coffee.
review_3_text: We had a wonderful breakfast! The service Is very good and food and coffee so special! Recommended!!
review_4_text: Very good coffee and bread. Recommend
review_5_text: Delicious coffee and so cheap too!

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ò‡∏∏‡πå‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢ ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏∏‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏û
review_1_text:
Thank you for opening this place. I'm a regular Thai customer!

The staff are so nice. The customer left the shop and they still hadn't finished thanking me. LOL. But they should change their greeting from "Please check the menu while you wait." It makes you feel like you have to wait. It should be "Please check the menu first." That would be better.

I applied for a membership card and it's the best deal in the world. Today I tried the double matcha latte. It's 50% sweet and very well-balanced. But I forgot the one before. The bottom sip is sweet and well-balanced. The top is tea. It's very strong and bitter. I like it. It's not bitter like coffee. When I stir it again, it's very well-balanced. And there are so many other menus to try. There's even a menu that supports Thai products. I'm a big fan of Thai products. There are always a lot of customers.
review_2_text:
Thai Coffee Shop, located in front of the Faculty of Dentistry, Chiang Mai University. Delicious drinks, standard Thai coffee.
Clean shop, friendly staff.
There are about 5 tables.
Parking on the street.
review_3_text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê The Friendliest Punthai Branch in Town | Essential Stop for Daily Thai Tea & Coffee on Suthep Roadü•§‚òï
.
Punthai Coffee, Suthep Road branch, is one of the few branches in Chiang Mai located outside a gas station and right in the heart of the city. What impressed us most about this branch is the friendliness of the staff.
.
As a regular (everyday) Thai tea drinker, Punthai's 75% sweetened Thai tea has a rich and perfectly sweet flavor. With a Max Card, the price is only 27 baht per cup, which is a great value (although limited to 10 cups per month). The shop also offers promotions pairing drinks with a wide selection of desserts, including croissants, sandwiches, and even dim sum items like buns and dumplings.
.
Note: Since I came to buy food in the morning to go to work, parking on the side of the road wasn't difficult. Even on weekend mornings, you can park in front of the shop or across the street. We usually didn't have to wait long, as there were usually 4-5 staff members working at the same time during peak hours.
.
In summary, this Punthai branch This is perfect for those looking for affordable everyday drinks. It's even more worthwhile with a membership card, but parking can be difficult during the morning or afternoon on weekdays for those driving.

üìçLocation: Located on busy Suthep Road, right next to 7-11. Easy to find and conveniently located near Chiang Mai University's Suan Dok Campus.
‚ú®The Vibe: Clean with a minimal design. Offers a bar with three high chairs and a couple of tables.
üèÜStrengths: Exceptional staff friendliness (the most friendly Punthai branch we've found in town!). They offer reliable taste and great value, especially with a Max Card membership (Thai Tea at THB 27). Excellent variety of bakery and snacks, including dim sum.
üí°Parking Note: Easy street parking in the early mornings and weekends; challenging during weekday peak hours.

üìùHighly recommended for international travelers who want to try quality coffee or non-coffee Thai brand drinks at an affordable price. Dim sum and Thai-style bakery items are also available.
review_4_text:
The new shop is beautiful and has comfortable seating, not cramped.
The staff provides excellent service.
review_5_text: The staff provided good service, the coffee was delicious, the shop area was not very large, and there was no restroom available.

name: Onuma Green Rabb ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏£ ‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏Å ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
I love this cafe. The whole vibe is nice and cozy and green. Good aircon, comfortable seats, affordable drinks, soft lighting, outlets. I got a honey granola croffle and hot tea.

I was working today but I'd definitely come back on the weekend with a nice book
review_2_text: I love the vibe + the coffee quality and baristas skills are great. The only thing I wish was different was the opening hour, 10 seems a bit late but that only means I'd just love to have my morning coffee there :) food options are rather limited, perhaps adding fresh pastries like croissants would be a good idea!
review_3_text:
A nice place with great greens and environment to have a cup of dark roasted americano. The coffee is well balanced and strong in taste but yet not too acidic.
Nice environment for a quiet afternoon enjoying your sip of coffee.
Friendly barrister and staff even though I speak a foreign language.
Got 300g of roasted beans for self brewing and making.
review_4_text: Cute and comfortable specialty coffee shop¬†with a small selection of good Thai beans. We tried two pour-overs,¬†and both were fantastic. The space is filled with plants and has a relaxing feel. We got to connect with the owner, who is really kind and knew we were interested in specialty beans, so he showed us a variety of beans and gave us recommendations for a couple really good ones.
review_5_text:
The coffee is very good and served in lovely cups. Beautifully presented.

We didn't eat there, as we only wanted coffee.

The most sad thing is that lone fish are kept in sad conditions in vases. They can't swim due to the plant roots and it is no life for a poor living creature. There are many fish in small little vases.

They would do much better to release the fish and keep the plants only.

üôèüôèI hope that the owners will read this and make a change. üôèüôè

The shop is really lovely and books are available to read or flip through.

The coffee as I said was excellent üëå

name: Yosniyom Coffee
review_1_text: Micro cafe/Hole in the Wall with limited indoor seating and footpath seating that has a cool corner breeze. Limited choices of coffee comparing to competitors but two roasts profiles available - medium or medium/dark . My iced americano was nothing extraordinary and non descriptive. No obvious signs of food available on display.
review_2_text: Good coffee. Nice little spot to relax and enjoy a cup of coffeeüßã. But a bit pricey compared to the other cafes in the area.
review_3_text: Best coffee in town for single origins and micro lots. Also home made ice creams and non coffee drinks
review_4_text: Cheap and decent coffee. Workout at gym 30 m away ( the playground) the. Get ur coffee here üòÅ
review_5_text: Their vanilla latte is highly recommended to try. Make me feel active for every morning üòâ

name: Found
review_1_text: Lovely small place friendly staff
review_2_text: This shop is very nice, with a beautiful view. The matcha is delicious and worth the price. I would like to inform the shop that the smell of cigarettes from the shop's smoking area. As a customer who is allergic to cigarette smells, it spoils the atmosphere while drinking coffee and has to endure the smell all the time in the shop. I would like to ask the shop to consider changing/moving the smoking area away from the customer area and adjusting the direction of that area so that the smell does not enter the shop area. I personally like the shop very much, but I would like to inform you that if this problem persists, I may decide not to return to use the service again, which would be a great pity.
review_3_text:
I felt the Christmas spirit a month before.
It's small, but I like that I can stay for a long time.
I appreciate the outlets at the tables.
Coffee is a given.
It's a shame that there aren't many hot drinks besides coffee, but I enjoyed a refreshing apple tea.
review_4_text:
This small, relaxed shop, located in the alley next to Wat Suan Dok in Chiang Mai, exudes a cozy vibe. The white and wood accents are pleasing to the eye. There's ample seating both inside and outside, and it's not crowded. It's a great place to relax and get some work done.

They have a full range of basic drinks, including coffee, non-coffee, soda, and even dirty drinks. Stop by!

‚òïÔ∏è Iced Americano 60 baht
review_5_text:
üìç @Found.cnx
#NakhonWiangPing #EuropeanSecretCafe

"Feel Good" with a relaxing atmosphere on your day off. A hidden European-style cafe fused with nature, featuring striking olive trees. Enjoy a variety of drinks paired with Cheese Pie. On weekends, the cafe offers both air-conditioned indoor seating and outdoor seating. Friendly service awaits. You have to experience it for yourself!

name: Kyodo Coffee Roasters
review_1_text: Great little place for coffee, quality and have also oat milk :)
review_2_text:
my new fav cafe in chiang mai :)
super friendly staff and owners
review_3_text: really good coffee, nice interior and super friendly staff :)
review_4_text: Great coffee and service! üáπüá≠‚ù§Ô∏èüáµüá±
review_5_text: Super cute/quaint little cafe. Carefully and expertly made, balanced coffee. What a nice surprise! Highly recommend.

name: ROWDY COFFEE
review_1_text: Great coffee, warm service, and a place that just feels good to be in. Love coming back here.
review_2_text: The coffee beans are so unique and such a good aroma coffee. Nice for a quick grab and chill. Great coffee with chilled vibes.
review_3_text: Lovely little coffee spot. Good vibes, great coffee. Perfect for a quick break or catch-up.
review_4_text:
Cool cafe to chill out.
Nice to relax with a good drink
Love the environment and atmosphere
review_5_text:
Really good coffee
My morning started from here
Barista are nice and joynable
Get good morning, Good coffee here ü•≥

name: Agri Chapter : Art Farmer
review_1_text:
The place has a cozy vibe with green and brown tones, lots of wood, and a warm, relaxing atmosphere.

They serve spaghetti, steaks, salads, wraps, and sandwiches ‚Äî all tasty and reasonably priced. The coffee and matcha are also really good.

Overall, it‚Äôs a comfortable spot with good food and drinks.
review_2_text: A newly open cafe at CMU, good location and free paring space. Available both European and Thai food menu. The price is quite high in average, but b8g portion.
review_3_text: My new favourite coffee shop in Chiang Mai. This place ticks all the boxes for me.  Art Farmer Cafe has always had some of the best coffee you can get in Thailand but now with this new venue they have a wonderfully designed environment. Very good place to get work done, great music, wonderful people, and now they do good food too.
review_4_text: New cafe at faculty of agriculture, so sage green here! Big space and plenty seats
review_5_text: Excellent coffee made to order.

name: Fern Forest Cafe
review_1_text:
A Hidden Green Oasis in the Heart of Chiang Mai üåø

Fern Forest Cafe is a true gem tucked away in the city. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre surrounded by lush greenery and tall trees fresh, shaded, and incredibly peaceful. It feels like escaping into a secret garden right in the middle of Chiang Mai.

The atmosphere is perfect for relaxing and staying awhile. Many international visitors love spending time here, and it‚Äôs easy to understand why, it‚Äôs calm, charming, and beautifully natural.

I ordered the tiramisu and coconut cake, and both were excellent. The tiramisu was rich and well-balanced, the coconut cake light and fragrant without being too sweet.

The yuzu cold brew coffee was also fantastic refreshing, smooth, and a perfect pairing with the desserts.

If you‚Äôre looking for a serene garden caf√© with great cakes and quality drinks, this is definitely a must visit in Chiang Mai.
Highly recommended.
review_2_text: It's a popular place with people waiting in line for a table. We ordered a fruit smoothie and the black forest chocolate shake. Both were amazing. The smoothie was bursting with flavor while the shake, topped with tiny squares of cake and a cherry, was sweetly thick. The rich green curry goes well with the roti. The tumeric rice is well balanced, with fried battered fish fillets. Service is fast despite the place fully packed. Ambience is an oasis of forest in the middle of the city.
review_3_text:
Delicious food, great ambience and very professional and polite staff.

The food came in a timely manner, seemingly fresh and perfectly cooked. We had the club sandwhich and pasta salmon with pesto. They got our orders right and it was prepared perfectly. The salmon was juicy and flavorful and cooked to perfection. I'm from Norway so I know salmon, and I was very happy with it.

The club sandwhich was also really good and presented beautifully. There could have been more fries, but it was good as is too.

We also ordered the mango/passion fruit smoothie and the berry smoothie. Tasted as expected, very good ü§ó
