The ambience is very calm, chill with smooth jazz playing at the perfect level. Of course they fern theme in itself makes it feel like you're close to nature and it's the perfect place to eat.

Staff was very polite and served all our needs.

All in all a good place to eat for a chill meal. Their desserts seemed amazing but we didn't order any.
review_4_text:
A sweet little place making you feel right in the lap of nature with great food, ambient music and sound of water.

Food quantity and quality are both good with one of the best Caramel Milkshakes!
The tropical and fruit bowls are a little too cold (need atleast 30 min outside for the temperature to come down to being eatable). Hence one piece of advise will be to kindly keep them in a little less colder place before serving so that they can be eaten straightaway.

Loved the rest.
review_5_text: This charming little restaurant and caf√© is a true hidden gem, beautifully surrounded by lush greenery that creates a calm and relaxing atmosphere from the moment you arrive. One of the highlights is the peaceful pond filled with colorful koi carp, which adds a special, almost meditative touch to the place. The thoughtfully designed indoor seating is cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot to slow down, enjoy good food or coffee, and simply soak in the tranquil surroundings. Also calculate some waiting time for a free table if you come in the afternoon.

name: MARS.cnx
review_1_text: Really like the concept. The ambience is great. Feels like that you are in a restaurant that‚Äôs on Mars. They have given effort to make it look like one from the walls, chairs, desks and everything. Staff looked friendly. Service was good. Just went there for a coffee and it was good too. Recommend. Love from üá±üá∞
review_2_text:
We had passed by this cafe several times before finally deciding to stop in, and we‚Äôre so glad we did. From the outside it already caught our attention with its unique style, but stepping inside was even better. The atmosphere was super cool and creative‚Äîsomething about the design and interior gave us this futuristic, almost ‚ÄúMars-like‚Äù vibe. It‚Äôs definitely not your average coffee shop; every corner feels thoughtfully designed and Instagram-worthy.

We ordered their signature drinks along with coffee, and both were excellent. The flavors were rich and well-balanced, clearly made with care, and the presentation was just as impressive. It‚Äôs one of those places where you can tell the drinks are crafted to stand out, not just served.

Beyond the drinks, the overall experience was really enjoyable. The seating was comfortable, the music matched the vibe, and it was the kind of place where you can relax for a while‚Äîwhether to chat with friends, read a book, or just enjoy the ambiance.

This cafe has such a cool personality that makes it stand out in town. We left already planning to come back again, not only for the great drinks but also for the one-of-a-kind atmosphere. A must-visit if you‚Äôre looking for something different and stylish!
review_3_text:
I ended up at MARS.cnx on a whim, and it instantly felt different. The space has this surreal, almost dream-like vibe ‚Äî part art gallery, part cozy hideaway. The design is cool, and the music? Absolutely spot-on. It creates this perfect atmosphere that makes you want to stay longer.
I only had a cappuccino, but the place is definitely a hidden gem for a creative, laid-back escape.
review_4_text:
The space is modern yet minimal, with warm wooden tones and big windows that let in lots of nature light. Their signature drinks are delicious especially the cold brew and dirty coffee.
The staff are friendly and the vibes feel peaceful. One of definitely worth visit.
review_5_text: MARS.cnx gets very positive feedback overall ‚Äî high ratings, particularly for its atmosphere, theme, creativity, and vibe. It seems to be less about being a serious gourmet food destination and more about the experience: d√©cor, ambiance, drinks, photo opportunities. If you go expecting that, you‚Äôre likely to enjoy it a lot. If your priority is large food portions, a super quiet caf√© for studying, or cheap coffee, there might be better choices.

name: Starbucks
review_1_text: I didn‚Äôt actually eat here.  However, I recommend this as the best place to work for a while on the computer.  Lots of comfortable seating, WiFi and electrical outlets.
review_2_text:
1. We waited and waited for our order. Finally I had to go to the counter to ask what happened... the sandwich was already cold... they had to warm it up again. It wasn't that busy, either.

2. I asked to have our table cleaned... the server cleaned the table and wiped the crumbs from another customer's order onto the floor!!! No sweeping up.

The service really needs to be improved.

Nice People, Bad Training.
review_3_text: Super comfy. Waiting in here for almost 5 hours (I got night flight) and everything in here is perfect. The ambience is very good. You can walk around the building which has pond and mini garden if you are boring. And you can also walk to 7 eleven, just 2 minutes walking to grab a snack
review_4_text:
This double story building is situated opposite the Suan Dok gate on the western side of the most in Chang Mai old town.

It has a convenient drive-in facility but inside you will experience a nice ambience even though the air conditioning is super cold. You can also sit outside.

Generally, the decoration is comfortable browns and wood and laid-back style. Check out the photos
review_5_text: Nice location with both indoor and outdoor area. Also have the drive trough service. There is a meeting room available on the second floor also. :)

name: Zohng Coffee
review_1_text:
Zohng Coffee is highly recommended!
A very nice and unique style in the inside and some nice outdoor seating area as well.
There is an upper floor, which is for the Hostel Guests the waiter told me.
Their Cappuccino was pretty solid and around 80 baht.
Their food seemed to be pretty good as well.
review_2_text: Very good meals, wide menu and tasty food! Had steak with egg for breakfast and the seasonal fruit mix, 10/10! The eggs benedict were missing the hollandeise sauce, but they had their own personal twist which was very good!
review_3_text: I had a fantastic breakfast at this cozy restaurant right in the center of Chiang Mai, just a short walk from Wat Phra Singh. I ordered a Croque Madame that was absolutely delicious, perfectly prepared and full of flavor. The cappuccino was spot-on as well ‚Äî and as an Italian, I can say it really impressed me. Friendly service, relaxed atmosphere, and great quality overall. Highly recommended for a perfect start to the day!
review_4_text: The avocado toast was fresh and creamy, perfectly paired with crispy bacon and a cup of latte. The Zhong breakfast was satisfying and well-balanced, with classic flavors done right. A comforting and filling meal to start the day.
review_5_text:
Really nice atmosphere
the new decoration makes the place feel more modern and comfortable.
There‚Äôs a good variety of food to choose from, especially the chicken breast steak and the beef burger, both were really good.
The coffee is great, and the service is friendly and attentive.
Overall a chill spot with good food and drinks. Would definitely come back.

name: Pran Cafe
review_1_text: I was looking at near cafes when I was temple hopping and found this place in maps. Cute and cozy cafe. Quiet enough to enjoy coffee and read a book. They take card (5% surcharge) and cash. Food, coffee and drinks were great. Interior and exterior were nice. Beside it is their hotel. Nice place to check out!
review_2_text: This place was extraordinarily exceptional. A beautiful and aesthetically decorated place. Our experience  in Chiang Mai was enhanced due to this cafe that I found on Booking.com. Now this Cafe will be my go-to whenever I visit Chiang Mai again. The location is very close to the Chiang Mai gate where all the action takes place. The rooms were very beautiful, modern and very comfortable. Each room has a small balcony to enjoy the morning sun or the afternoon siesta. The cafe has very friendly and polite staff at check-in as well as the breakfast kitchen. The owner-Ms. Pree and her husband are delightful people who makes you feel you are home away from home. The morning breakfast is also very good with excellent coffee that you can buy from the cafe. It is locally grown and has a hint of the taste of the hills around Chiang Mai. The thai food selection for the breakfast was delicious and I am still craving for it miles away. They also had some very good vegetarian options. Moreover, they also helped arrange all the tours that I took at Chiang Mail with a 10% discount. Do not book tours at the airport, they were more expensive than the ones I got from Pran Cafe. We were there during the Loh Kratong festival hence the Cafe was fully booked. I wished we could have stayed longer..this place was one of the highlights of our incredible time in Chiang Mai. I came away feeling that I left my extended family back at this cafe. I was also traveling with my 83 year old father who was very comfortable and happy at this beautiful cafe. Also, did I say that the plants and flowers in this cafe makes one feel that they are in paradise. I will surely be back to this location. Book your whole stay in Chiang Mai at this place..you will not regret it. Wifi and all other modern amenities are great.
review_3_text: Cute cafe with tasty food and delicious cappuccinos! The owner is really sweet and brought her dog over to me so I could pet it. Good WiFi and air conditioning, so it was a nice place for remote work.
review_4_text: This cafe looks amazing! Such a cute decor and ambience! Food was sooo good delicious! Staff very polite and friendly. Loved everything about this cosy cafe.
review_5_text:
The cafe has a amazing architecture and decor that gives it an appealing aesthetic, making it a good place to have a look at.
Unfortunately however, although the food was good, the menu is quite limited with its options.
Additionally, the staff are a bit too laid-back and not focused enough.
Still a decent place to visit though.

name: CNX
review_1_text: Amazing drinks/cocktails at a great price! Perfect place to stop before the Sunday Night market. Great vibes.
review_2_text: Cozy rooftop, seats inside if raining. Worth a visit! Extra plus for the great plane spotting views from the northern departures. Cocktails are cheap and most were very tasty.
review_3_text: Lovely chill place to have a drink and watch the world go by. Music was great! We came back twice.
review_4_text: Cute authentic place for sunset drinks with a view and fresh air.
review_5_text: So disappointed that there is no food here anymore. I used to love the menu and the elevator that brought the meals up to the rooftop patio was such a fun quirk. Very quiet atmosphere now when we went too. Zero locals. I remember this place being packed. Things seem to have changed a lot since the pandemic...

name: Greather Coffee
review_1_text:
Modern, spacious coffee shop with a clean and inviting vibe‚Äîplenty of seating to chill for a while or just grab a quick drink before exploring the area.
I had the iced matcha: refreshing, well-made, and exactly what I needed on a warm day.
They also sell small pastries and bags of coffee beans.
Great spot if you're in the neighborhood and want a comfortable place for coffee. Recommended!
review_2_text: Very kind staff. Good coffee. It's worth the wait for the coffee. If you are gf, warn them not to crumble any cookies on your drinks!
review_3_text: Lovely owner, great service! The waffle sandwich has the perfect mix of sweet and savory. Loved it!
review_4_text: Had a good coffee polite host. Simple clean ambience
review_5_text:
Great coffee selection.
Anaerobic Thai was very good.
Made perfectly to order.

name: .Werb Haus Coffee
review_1_text: Stumbled upon .Werb Haus in Chiang Mai‚Äôs Old City and instantly loved the earthy orange tones and retro art of ginger cats artwork on the coffee cups ‚Äî it has a warm, laid-back vibe. The owner was super welcoming and helped me pick a drink. I ended up trying ES-Yen, a cold espresso I‚Äôd never had before ‚Äî surprisingly smooth and very effective (kept me wired until 2 AM). Spent a good hour just chatting with him and soaking in the Songkran chaos on the street. Ended up staying for a beer and enjoying the moment. Great spot, even better people.
review_2_text:
Great coffee at a coffee shop away from the main road. Coffee prices are slightly cheaper compared to the other coffee shops. Quick service too, and the baristar is able to make the drink efficiently.

WiFi is available, but slightly unstable.

Many seats and plug points available.
review_3_text: The cappuccino here is very fragrant and delicious. Maybe it‚Äôs the best one I have tasted in Chiang Mai so far. However, the cake is a bit sweet. Great vibe with nice deco. Kpop playlists are often played in the store. It‚Äôs also my work playlist (‚Åé‚ÅçÃ¥Ãõ·¥ó‚ÅçÃ¥Ãõ‚Åé)
review_4_text: Nice two-floor cafe. Good price coffee, the place is quiet, has enough space and each table has their charger available, good for working on your laptop.
review_5_text:
Best caf√© in the neighborhood üí™

Coffee is really good, with plenty of different options, and prices are more than reasonable.

Not many desserts options, that's maybe the only improvement I'd suggest!

name: The Peaberry Cafe & Coworking
review_1_text:
The Peaberry Caf√© offers super delicious and fresh smoothies and a√ßa√≠ bowls, along with good coffee. The staff are friendly and the service is quite fast, which makes the experience even better.
Just a note ‚Äî it‚Äôs not a dedicated coworking space with desks and ergonomic chairs, but more of a work-friendly caf√©. It‚Äôs a comfortable place to bring your laptop and get some work done while enjoying brunch, a smoothie, or a coffee.
Overall, a great spot for tasty, healthy food and a relaxed work-friendly environment!
review_2_text: We had the Nutella french toast and sunny side up eggs. For drinks the peach soda, chocobananut smoothie, Carmel macchiato and Thia style Expresso.  All were very delicious. üíØ% recommend.  They even have an adorable and playful kat Luna.
review_3_text: Very nice coffee shop serving breakfast. I had the typical western breakfast. Scrambled eggs, toast and sausage. No complaints. We worked a little in the co working space and later split a Nutella French toast. So delicious. Excellent service.
review_4_text: Great atmosphere, delicious drinks/smoothies, they offer oat milk/dairy-free options which I appreciated. Staff was incredibly friendly and even let me and another person stay a little bit after closing to finish working on our laptops. Will be coming back here, had an awesome experience :)
review_5_text: Had a delicious Thai iced coffee and French toast at peaberry cafe. Such a peaceful vibe inside and there was a really cute cat too!

name: LANN Cafe'
review_1_text:
Lann ‚Äì where coffee meets calm and excellent taste in design

Lann is one of those rare little caf√©s that feels intentionally beautiful without trying too hard. Tucked right in front of a hotel spa (yes, that kind of vibe), it‚Äôs the perfect spot to decompress before or after pretending you live a slower, more elegant life.

There‚Äôs easy parking (already winning), and once inside, you immediately feel how much care the owners put into every detail. The space blends classic Thai rattan textures with clean, modern architecture, creating a mood that‚Äôs equal parts cozy, stylish, and quietly luxurious. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you sit down and instantly lower your voice without knowing why.

Great coffee, calm energy, and an atmosphere that makes you want to stay longer than planned‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre post-spa, pre-meeting, or just escaping Bangkok chaos for a moment.

Highly recommended if you appreciate good design, thoughtful spaces, and caf√©s that feel like a small retreat rather than just another caffeine stop
review_2_text: Had a wonderful experience at LANN Cafe‚Äô in Chiang Mai. I tried their signature chili fried rice, which was full of flavor with just the right level of spice ‚Äî absolutely delicious. The mango passionfruit frappe was refreshing, perfectly balanced, and a great match for the meal. The service was friendly and attentive, and the location is lovely, calm, and convenient (at the heart of the center area) for relaxing or enjoying a meal. Highly recommended if you‚Äôre looking for great taste, good service, and a nice atmosphere.
review_3_text:
You have to come eat here! So delicious and super cute vibes!

Their breakfast was top tier! The bread they brought to the table was so fresh and very delicious! I try to stay away from bread but I literally almost finished the entire basket! That‚Äôs how good it was!

very instagramable and cute for photos. The staff was friendly!
review_4_text: Great breakfast place in Chiang Mai center! I was desperately searching for a breakfast spot where I can have a nice meal before touring the center of Chiang Mai. They have a very nice menu and if the decor is very relaxed and beautiful. The service was wonderful! I had a breakfast platter with bacon,ham, eggs, sausage, and tomato. Fully recommended!
review_5_text: LANN CAFE is a charming spot on the edge of the Old City. The atmosphere is relaxing, especially in the garden area. The space is small and cozy, thoughtfully designed with a stylish touch. Prices are on the higher side for Chiang Mai, but still inexpensive compared to most European cities. Service was fast and the staff were friendly and attentive. The place is clean, and the brunch was delicious. Overall, I definitely recommend it!

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Nice place to get Good Roffe insider the hospital. Rally buss in the morsning.
review_2_text: It is okay to order here if you have no choice and need some caffeine for the day. Go for premium coffee to get the real milk. Coffee is dark roast and it is bitter.
review_3_text: Good coffee
review_4_text: Cafe Amazon is a chain coffee shop located inside Maharanakhon Chiang Mai (Suan Dok) Hospital. They offer seasonal flavors that you'll never get tired of. They serve high-quality, delicious coffee. It's located on the first floor of the hospital, near the blood collection room, across from the 7-Eleven and bakery.
review_5_text: All the staff were lovely and working hard against the clock, which was great. I really liked it. Even though there were many customers, they were still smiling and cheerful, and served quickly. No long waits.

name: Tar Sawang Coffee At Suandok
review_1_text:
Wonderful hotdog and coffee set.
The hot dogs are surprisingly quite delicious.
Americano is nice.
review_2_text: Clean, minimal interior. They let you choose the coffee blend, so you can go with your preference. It‚Äôs cool and cozy inside, and even someone like me who can‚Äôt handle bitter coffee was fine with it.
review_3_text: Their bread is delicious. The service is great
review_4_text: You can choose roasting of beans, light jazz in the background, cute seats outside - my goodness... the coffee was delicious!!!
review_5_text: Great little coffee shop with delicious coffee and some great pastries too. Service is excellent.

name: Sorasora Cafe (‡πÇ‡∏ã‡∏£‡∏∞ ‡πÇ‡∏ã‡∏£‡∏∞ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà)
review_1_text: Everything is amazing! The coconut cake was well balanced and fresh, with real coconut inside. It was the first time I had tried anything like it in Thailand! They also have a very good gluten-free vanilla cheesecake with a hint of lemon. I also tried the signature banana bread with caramelised banana ‚Äî it was full of different textures and flavours: soft, sweet, salty and crunchy! The owner and staff are also super friendly and kind!
review_2_text: Cute lil cafe was in walkable distance from my hotel. Ordered their signature Caramel banana cloud and Thai tea. The dessert completely blew me away. Staff were very sweet.
review_3_text: Here we go! We‚Äôve been around the town a couple of weeks and tried top rated restaurants and cafes. Of course, we went for coconut cakes and I can tell you we finally find the place for coconut cakes. This place is a little bit off from the busy area but it‚Äôs only 3 minutes walks from Wat Phra Singh. If you are around here, you better try.
review_4_text:
This place has the best coconut cake! It‚Äôs not just a cake with a hint of coconut flavor ‚Äî it‚Äôs packed with real coconut meat and has a rich, intense coconut aroma. It‚Äôs honestly the best coconut cake I‚Äôve had in Thailand!
I also ordered the peach tea, and it was delicious ‚Äî fragrant with real peach pieces you can actually chew.
review_5_text: Let me tell you - this absolutely amazing cake was worth it all. I have never had a better dessert than this piece of art. The owners are really sweet and the food was also really good! Good vibes and really nice food.

name: Something on Mars
review_1_text: The  cocktails üç∏ üç∏ here are really nice. I am not a big gin fan but the blend of gin with the other elements was great. The place is very Insta worthy as are the drinks. However they charge a 10% surcharge on all drinks which aren‚Äôt cheap to begin with. The place was pretty empty so  it didn‚Äôt have the best atmosphere. I think if they reduce some of their prices on their non signature drinks they would have more people coming in because it is a nice place to hang out . The staff were great and very friendly.
review_2_text:
Hidden cocktails bar that serves best cocktails. Tried all signature drinks and you will love them all. Nice service and atmosphere. Will definitely come back.

Highly recommended Autumn No. 9 , Pluto, Venus‚Ä¶ all signature must try.
review_3_text: Super cool bar! And great drinks made by our bartender Art. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a unique and intimate cocktail bar
review_4_text: Having a blast now here. Must visit when in Chiang Mai Thailand‚Ä¶ coffee is perfect and food is superb. Drinks are the best and we‚Äôre having a blast with the friendliest bartender ‚ÄúNes‚Äù ‚Ä¶
review_5_text: The most amazing cocktail, try the ‚ÄúVenus‚Äù it will not disappoint. The bartenders were very knowledgeable and friendly. Such a cool vibe!

name: Esseppo Coffee ‡∏û‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏¥‡∏á‡∏´‡πå
review_1_text: This coffee shop offers a wide variety of menu options at affordable prices. They use high-quality ingredients, and every drink tastes delicious. The staff provides excellent service, always friendly and attentive. They also introduce new seasonal drinks, keeping the menu fresh and exciting. The smoothies are especially impressive‚Äîsuper smooth and perfectly blended. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
Second visit in 2 days! The staff were so lovely and it great drinks. Felt like a local favourite. So many ppl ordering as take away.

Sacha, uk
review_3_text:
I got a Taiwanese milk tea , free boba pearls, you can adjust sugar.
It was delicious + staff adorable
Only 35baht for a large drink !
review_4_text:
Fantastic coffee latte ... strong and crowned with a perfect foam ... takeaway or served by absolutely lovely ladies! And all this for half price compared to the wannabe fancy places. Can the day start better? Well, go and find out for yourself
!
review_5_text: Cute little coffee shop, amazing coffee and great selection.

name: OneDeeDee Coffee House
review_1_text: HIDDEN GEM! This place is a must visit. The waffles are some of the best I have ever had. The Nutella ones were to die for. What really blew my mind was the value for money ‚Äî unbelievably generous for what you get. I would come back again and again without hesitation. If you‚Äôre nearby, don‚Äôt skip this place!
review_2_text: This is such a sweet coffee and breakfast place. Dee Dee, the owner, is so sweet and makes delicious drinks. I usually ordered a Thai tea with no sugar and it was so delicious every time and with lots of foam on top. The chocolate chip waffle is great too! And great  prices!!
review_3_text:
Lovely little cafe off the main road. Nice atmosphere!
Friendly owner.
Enjoyed the bacon and eggs with toast, mango smoothie finished off with a double espresso which was tasty with good crema . Best coffee I've had so far in Thailand. Highly recommended!
review_4_text:
Amazing place, hostess & food
This is clearly a labour of love
Dee Dee enjoys the chat and working from outside her home where she cares for her Mum
She was patient with my indecision and helped my decide on peanut butter (of the quality kind) with almonds and gave me lots of fruit then later tried to give me more
Just go support and enjoy her
review_5_text: Dee Dee is such a nice lady and hostess and the place has such a cute ambience.  Her prices of food is amazingly low at about 1/2-1/3 the price of other places we tried. The breakfast is so big and filling I struggled to finish it. First class food at a more budget price. This is a must stop when visiting Chiang Mai and it's just off the circle going around the inside of the Old City.

name: Around Town Coffee
review_1_text:
Lovely small independent coffee shop over looking a section of the City Wall.

60 THB for an outstanding hot latte. The best I've had in Thailand, smooth, well balanced flavour.

Friendly owner who clearly knows his business well. I'll be here several mornings a week when I return to Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: I drink a lot of coffee, I love the stuff. I‚Äôve been in hundreds of cafes, plantations, resorts all around the world that all specialise in coffee in all forms and I have had plenty of really good coffee. But there are only two that really stand out and I can remember vividly. One is in Vietnam the other is here.  Make sure you get the special blend, it really is special.
review_3_text: Around Town Coffee in Chiang Mai is a total gem‚Äîgreat vibes, friendly barista, and seriously good coffee. The space feels cozy but stylish, perfect for hanging out a bit!
review_4_text:
This guy is the best barista I've had the pleasure of encountering during my stay in Asia (I've been to at least 50 different cafes on my trip). A real pro. He owns the cafe and nailed everything about the establishment. The vibe is relaxed and cozy. The pricing is ridiculously low, it really should be higher for this excellent quality (I told him)! Coffee tastes really, really good, and the latte art is... well, see for yourself in the pics. Most importantly though, he's such a nice person.

We quickly became friends!
I recommend the "Dirty" drink (his is excellent), and of course the hot lattes so you can see his amazingly extraordinary latte art.

Even if you're not thirsty, you should stop by to talk to him!
review_5_text: Flat white was very strong for medium roast. Glad did not go with the dark roast as it looked pretty ominous. Not a welcoming barista.

name: Chong Chaa
review_1_text: So good we came back multiple times! Great morning spot to people watch and have lovely food and coffee. Reasonable prices and welcoming staff here‚ú®
review_2_text: Great cafe to visit on a morning for breakfast and coffee. Friendly staff that make you feel welcome. A must visit in Chiang Mai old town
review_3_text: Lovely cafe with amazing breakfast! Very affordable and a nice atmosphere.
review_4_text: Really good breakfast, we ate here daily during our stay in Chiang Mai. Food is traditional but also sandwiches with special "twist". Try!
review_5_text: The food is great, the service is incredible!!! love ittt

name: The Bell Cafe
review_1_text:
What a little Gem this find was ,wow we loved our filter coffee from this place,if you  love a Good coffee,then it's a must and at 45bht it's even more tasty,we sat outside and watched the world go by.
Served by students who are so friendly. Thank you for a fantastic coffee.
review_2_text: Love the environment and the flavor of the coffee here‚ò∫Ô∏èü´∂üèª. Nice place and wonderful barista
review_3_text: Thai Tea was good, and I wasn't charged extra for Oat Milk vs. Cow Milk. That says a lot! A decent number of tables, cool air (not too cold like some places), and plugs. Can't really ask for much more.
review_4_text: Stop by and try some hot and cold drinks from the students here.üòÅ
review_5_text: Flavour of the iced latte was amazing and really good service.

name: The Haus 224
review_1_text:
Really nice place with a great vibe. From the outside it already looks inviting, and once inside it feels cozy, clean, and well put together. The atmosphere is relaxed but still feels special, perfect for an easy dinner or drinks.
I tried the Summer Day cocktail and it was refreshing, smooth, and easy to drink. Very balanced and light, ideal for starting the meal.
For food, I had a classic Yum seafood soup, and it was excellent. Flavorful, comforting, and well balanced, with fresh shrimp and seafood cooked just right. The broth had depth and a nice kick without being too heavy, making it a great choice if you enjoy traditional Thai flavors.
Service was friendly and attentive, and everything came out at a good pace. Overall, a very solid experience with good food, good drinks, and a comfortable atmosphere. I‚Äôd definitely come back.
review_2_text:
Kaosoi was interesting the way of their own.
But looks like the owner was never greeting at all.
Even he was at front of the door he didn‚Äôt say hello (sawadikha) at all.
It was impressed in chiangmai people. üò¢
If you don‚Äôt mind please say hello to the people in your area.
This is your local place with small business.
Don‚Äôt focus on the menu photo.
review_3_text:
I recently dined at Hausa 224 and had the pleasure of trying three dishes that truly impressed me.

1. **Pomelo Salad:** This refreshing dish was a delightful start to my meal. The pomelo was perfectly ripe, and the combination of flavors‚Äîcrunchy vegetables and zesty dressing‚Äîmade it a vibrant and invigorating experience.

2. **Fire Chicken Curry Noodles:** The star of the show! The noodles were cooked to perfection, and the chicken was tender with just the right amount of spice. The rich curry sauce was bursting with flavor and left me wanting more‚ÄîI highly recommend it for spice lovers!

3. **Bread of Pork:** This dish was a comforting addition to my meal. The pork was juicy and flavorful, and the bread was soft and perfect for soaking up all the delicious juices.

Overall, my experience at Hausa 224 was fantastic, and I can't wait to return for more culinary delights!

---

Feel free to adjust any part to better match your experience!
review_4_text: Lovely building and who doesn‚Äôt love curves and high ceilings. The food was good enough and relatively tasty. It presents well.  It‚Äôs ok for Thai prices.
review_5_text: Wonderful cuisine! Impressed with all dishes especially Tom Yum Kung spaghetti and Khao Soi Mee Krob.  Good vibes for celebrating.

name: Nap‚Äôs Coffee Roaster CNX
review_1_text: Great place for coffee nerds to buy coffee beans! They offer a wide range of origins, from local Thai to Ethiopian, Honduras, Brazil, etc. they have these little tubes with ground coffee and perfume pump heads so you can smell the ground beans and choose the one you like. I got a light roast Ethiopian blend and came back for more the next time.
review_2_text: Great coffee and pastry destination!  Went with the dark roast Cappuccino, very good.  The star of the show however was the Toast Brown Butter, yummy!!
review_3_text: This is an excellent cafe with great tasting coffee with very affordable prices, especially given how modern and clean the aesthetics here are. You can pick the beans you would like, I went with dark smoky but will go for the medium chocolate one next time. They even serve in glass containers making it very easy to recommend.
review_4_text: 10/10 coffee is delicious. Can choose blend, milks, croissant and food for lunch. Nice large seating area. They clearly take pride in their coffee. Can also buy beans here.
review_5_text: The best coffee and service I seen in Chiang Mai. Very much recommend. Just one thing is their water feels containing chloride but maybe that‚Äôs just me. But the cappuccino is soo good with the tasty and thick cream that I still come here just drink water from 7/11

name: Fahtara Coffee (‡∏ü‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ò‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà)
review_1_text:
An Enchanting Jungle Oasis with the Best Coffee in Chiang Mai!

If you‚Äôre searching for a truly magical coffee spot in Chiang Mai, look no further than Fahtara Coffee ‚Äì this place is pure bliss! Tucked away in a serene garden that‚Äôs hidden from the main road, the chill area in the back feels like stepping into a lush jungle paradise. The highlight has to be the antique functioning water wheel gently turning beside a beautiful koi pond ‚Äì it‚Äôs so peaceful watching the water flow and the colorful fish glide by. The whole ambiance is top-notch: tropical plants everywhere, shady spots to relax, and that perfect blend of nature and tranquility that makes you forget you‚Äôre in the city.

The coffee? Hands down some of the best in Chiang Mai ‚Äì rich, perfectly brewed, and full of flavor whether you go for a classic latte or something more adventurous. And don‚Äôt get me started on the food and desserts ‚Äì absolutely 5-star! From fluffy pastries to savory bites, everything is fresh, delicious, and beautifully presented.
It‚Äôs no wonder this place can get crowded ‚Äì it‚Äôs popular for all the right reasons! The vibes are so inviting that I take all my friends here whenever they‚Äôre in town; it‚Äôs become my absolute favorite spot to unwind, catch up, or just soak in the beauty. If you want an unforgettable cafe experience that‚Äôs equal parts relaxing and Instagram-worthy, Fahtara is a must-visit. Can‚Äôt wait to go back! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
review_2_text: This place is gorgeous, relaxing with the best outdoor vibe. There‚Äôs a tree right in the middle, thoughtful decor everywhere, and a soft mist that makes it feel extra calm. We stopped in after a massage for smoothies, coffee, and a pizza, and everything hit the spot. The service was warm and  attentive.
review_3_text: What a lovely cafe. Its almost magical out back with the water mill, fog and koi fish. Music is perfect. Atmosphere 20/10 cappuccino 30/10. It was hot, great flavor, good size.   I didn't have the food but I saw some go out and it looked good. Also so the smoking coconut coffee drink they do. Looked stunning. I just don't drink cold drinks. 200/10 recommend this place. Also has strong wifi.
review_4_text: We both had eggs Benedict and they were superb. The atmosphere is relaxing and peaceful. It was one of the few places open and we are so thankful we stumbled upon it. We‚Äôve been back twice already.
review_5_text: So glad we found this place ‚Äî it‚Äôs our second year coming here whenever we visit Chiang Mai! The coffee is excellent ‚Äî strong, smooth, and perfectly balanced (I‚Äôm quite picky about coffee, and this one really impressed me!). The honey toast was to die for ‚Äî crispy, tasty, and consistently great both times we visited. The relaxing atmosphere with the water mill adds such a lovely touch. A must-visit spot for coffee and dessert lovers!

name: Inner Cafe & Bistro
review_1_text:
Wow!
Another amazing cafe in Chiang Mai. Great Tasty Food, Friendly Service, Welcoming Ambience and very Convenient Seating.

The campus includes a Hostel, 24h Coin Laundry, few other eateries and few shops.
review_2_text: Good brunch spot. A lot of options on the menu. In my opinion the avocado egg toast would have needed more salt. Mango bowl was delicious. Liked it.
review_3_text:
We had breakfast and came back the next day for lunch.  The drinks are amazing but I had the lemon soda for Lunch and it was very sour and I didn‚Äôt like it. But the smoothies and coffees were delicious.

Our breakfast was delicious. The Lunch was lovely too. Lots of options on the menu hard to pick what you want. Their menu is all day so you can get breakfast at any time.

The prices were very good too.

Definitely recommend coming here.
review_4_text: Good breakfast, cheap and fast. Coffee is rather delicate could be little bit stronger. Good smothies and juices
review_5_text: Came here for breakfast. Got avocado and toast beautiful. I got avocado and toast with bacon and the bacon was lovely as well. Highly recommended and the price was good as well

name: the butterfly effect - organic cafe
review_1_text:
The avocado chocolate cake seems to be sent from heaven - honestly the best cake I've ever tried. Just the right amount of sweetness and the avocado works wonderfully with the chocolate. Place has a fancy design with wooden elements. However, I sensed somehow a weird vibe inside the coffee, nobody talks and stares at their phones. If you talk the whole room listens which is why we decided to eat outside.

The cake is a full recommendation while the ambience might not be for everyone.
review_2_text: My favourite breakfast and lunch spot in Chiang Mai. Unbeatable chilled atmosphere, super friendly staff and don‚Äôt miss out on the Iced Oat Latte, flavoured Hemp Milks, Chia Pudding and Kimchi Sourdough Sandwich.
review_3_text:
This was a lovely cafe with great drink and food options. This was the first time I‚Äôve had a matcha cortado and I loved the more matcha-forward tasted compared to a more milk heavy latte. The sourdough toasts and smoothie bowl were all fantastic as well. Everything is vegan, so no dairy and plenty of alternative milk options.

The space has tons of windows and feels so bright with the variety of plants and wood furniture. A great place to spend a little time!
review_4_text: This cafe is beautiful and a refreshing stop from the heat. The food is delicious, in taste, looks, and smell. The smoothies are must haves and served in cool flasks. This was the best breakfast my friends and I had throughout our entire trip in the country, I'd highly recommend.
review_5_text: I ordered the kimchi, pumpkin and cashew toast and WOW. It was outstanding. It‚Äôs been over a week since i‚Äôve had and I still dream about it. Also the mango matcha ü§§ I would come back to Chiang Mai just to eat here. And the staff were very lovely. definitely recommend this place.

name: Caf√© Amazon Three Kings Chiangmai
review_1_text: we had coffee here, coffee was very plain taste. the staff could have been more nice and friendly though. i supposed her having a long day.
review_2_text:
Tucked just a few steps from the iconic Three Kings Monument.
Here i drank a delicious chocolate frappe with a shot of espresso. Always a great combination.
Staff was friendly, great english and my order was done fast.
review_3_text: Love it, my first stop in the morning for an iced cappuccino 60Bht. Cheaper and loads better than any Starbucks. Air-conditioning seating inside plus several tables outside.
review_4_text:
Staff is just OK, not more. Coffee tastes weaker than elsewhere.
Worst of all, it's stupidly cold in there. People are sitting with their jackets buttoned up to the chin.
review_5_text: That‚Äôs the worst coffee ever had in my life. Tasted like it was moldy or rotten and burned. Absolutely terrible. Never go here.

name: Tyme.coffee (‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏°‡πå)
review_1_text: The cat!! Coffee very good! But the cat is soooooooo cute! And we also joined a nice khratong class and everybody was very nice!!
review_2_text:
Stayed at the hostel attached to this cafe and both had excellent classy vibes. The cafe itself is very popular during the day to do some travel planning/computer work.
The ice latte is nice and strong.
But my favorite part is the cat named Jun who‚Äôs the little boss of the whole establishment.
5 stars all around üí´
review_3_text: This cafe is connected to the hostel we are stying in and we can definitely recommend both! We got a flat white and a November soda, they are delicious! It‚Äôs a perfect spot for a cosy afternoon reading a book or getting some work done! ‚òïÔ∏è
review_4_text: Nice coffee and matcha super tasty and great atmosphere too place to see in town
review_5_text: Matcha latte was tasty but not hot enough. Place was nice.

name: Golden Bee Shop & Coffee ‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥‡∏ú‡∏∂‡πâ‡∏á ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
10/10 - my favourite working cafe in Chiang Mai. Delicious drinks, delicious food, affordable local prices - under $100 THB. There is help yourself honey you can use and add to your drinks including raw honey combs you can cut.

EVERYTHING I have ordered on the menu so far has been delicious. I am literally shocked.

Clean, spacious, there are electric outlets, wifi, air conditioning, windows and natural lighting. Washroom is clean but in the back.

The products are really nice also. I like the inhaler, body skin balm, and the lip balm. Made with natural ingredients. Between 45-55 THB.

It closes at 6pm, otherwise, I work work here all day!
review_2_text: Great location, absolutely comfortable seats‚Ä¶ Lots of tables available, beautifully decorated cafe‚Ä¶ Bought some honeycomb for my sweet tooth sugar fix‚Ä¶ The waitress that brought my food to the table had a beautiful big smile delivering the food‚Ä¶ Great food, great prices, oat milk hot Thai tea was fabulous along with the meal.
review_3_text:
if I'd brought my friend with my to chaing mai & to this beautiful cafe ' he would of caused quite the sticky outburst!
There's honey everywhere ' it's just heaven üòç
I have truly enjoyed my two months trip in Thailand but one of the highlights for me which I'll never forget is the Golden Bee ' üêù

Thanks to all the staff for their great smiles and homely honey service
review_4_text: Very clean and lovely AC. We had Durian Moon Cake, a honey latte & Affogato with coconut Ice cream. My partner liked his latte so much he got a second to go! I got the Honey Lemonade and it was lovely. The bit of honeycomb on top was a fantastic touch
review_5_text:
Delicious vegan coffee with oat milk! You have to pay 15 extra baht for the vegan milk, making a latte 75 baht.
But, you have comfortable seats or couch for working and aircon.

name: Por Jai Fruits Juice & Coffee
review_1_text: 2nd time here. This time I went for banana smoothie. Such a bargain price in old city. Chill inside and cozy music in the afternoon. Good place to take a rest
review_2_text:
You need to specify the level of sugar because unfortunately they add it to the smoothies.
Payment is possible only by cash or QR code.

They have nice clay figurines to observe while you wait for your order. The smoothie was tasty, but felt watered down; the cup was very full.
review_3_text:
My partner and I were looking for a coffee and chose this cafe. The coffee was very good so we decided to order something else and the smoothie was also very tasty.
Besides that very nice chill atmosphere and the staff was very kind!!

Would definitely recommend.
review_4_text:
I recently visited this charming little shop in the heart of a quaint old town, and I was blown away by the quality of their offerings. The fruit juices are absolutely incredible‚Äîrefreshing, full of flavor, and made with the freshest ingredients. The coffee is equally impressive, especially the cappuccino, which is just perfect. The prices are extremely reasonable, which makes this place even more of a hidden gem.

The atmosphere is lovely, with outdoor seating right by the street, perfect for sitting back, relaxing, and people-watching. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall experience. I highly recommend this shop to anyone looking for great drinks in a cozy setting.
review_5_text: Really tasty fruit juices and with very reasonable price. Addicted to have 2 cups a day!

name: At All Caf√©
review_1_text: Highly recommend! Cozy environment! Warmly reception n fresh smoothies! High quality coffee! Must come if u r in Chiangmai!
review_2_text: I tried Iced coffee and watermelon juice, both of them are so good ‚ù§Ô∏èowners are kind and also there‚Äôs cute dog who‚Äôs always smiling - I visited to this cafe to see this cutie ü´∂ (first two photos & the last photo were taken by film camera)
review_3_text:
At All Caf√© is an absolutely charming coffee shop that offers not just great coffee but an unforgettable experience. The highlight of this delightful spot is the adorable dog, who is both a well-dressed little companion and a beacon of joy for every guest.

As seen in the photo, this sweet pup, donning an irresistibly cute striped outfit, sits at the table with you, providing unparalleled company. While the dog refrains from drinking coffee‚Äîwisely avoiding any potential snout-burning mishaps‚Äîtheir presence makes the coffee-sipping experience so much better.

The caf√© itself is warm and welcoming, with a cozy ambiance that pairs perfectly with their delicious drinks. Whether you're a dog lover or simply looking for a unique coffee spot to brighten your day, At All Caf√© is a must-visit. Just don't be surprised if you end up staying longer than planned, captivated by the charm of this furry little host!
review_4_text: Delicious Apple üçè smoothies. Couple owners also owned the massage next door. I did 60 min full body and felt like waking on clouds afterwards üòÄüëç. I rented a motorbike with them for four days 200 baht a day with only 1000baht deposit. Cheapest around this area and the Honda scooter ran perfectly. Highly recommended!
review_5_text:
Was here for scooter rental!
Great people and very honest.
Scooter was not the newest but did a great job and for a great price.
Highly recommend

name: Doisuthep Coffee
review_1_text: Enjoy coffee at a temple with stunning forest views. The coffee is delicious and the prices are reasonable.

name: 1998 Coffee and Tea
review_1_text: Super friendly and great tasting coffee. I recommend it!

name: CMVC coffee
review_1_text: This cafe is a part of a school, so the prices are much cheaper than many others around. It‚Äôs na nice AC space with some good tables and chairs. My hot cappuccino was below average quality, but the value is not bad given this location and the price.
review_2_text: Prices range from 30-35 Baht for a hot cold coffee Matcha etc and 40-45 for a smoothie in a clean quiet spacious aircon atmosphere. Excellent place to enjoy a quiet drink and use a laptop while supporting the local vocational school.
review_3_text:
CMVC Coffee, part of Chiangmai vocational College is a specialty coffee shop located in Chiang Mai, Thailand, celebrated for its commitment to high-quality, locally-sourced coffee. The caf√© often features coffee from organic farms in northern Thailand, including single-origin beans from sustainable sources like Paradise Mountain Organic Coffee. Known for its relaxed ambiance and dedication to the art of coffee-making, CMVC uses a variety of brewing techniques and serves a range of unique blends, aiming to offer both locals and tourists a refined coffee experience within a peaceful setting.

The Chiang Mai coffee scene is rich with third-wave coffee shops that emphasize traceability, organic farming, and artisanal brewing, and CMVC Coffee stands out for embodying these values while showcasing the region‚Äôs coffee-growing heritage. If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai, CMVC provides an authentic taste of Thailand‚Äôs coffee culture in a stylish, inviting environment Ôøº.
review_4_text: Just came from Bangkok, where everything is expensive and somewhat superficial. I have to say that this place is very cheap, good and has soul. The owner might praise the employees, they‚Äôre amazing. The school in the front is a pretty building, which enhance the whole view
review_5_text: Air conditioning, fast service and excellent quality drinks stands for five stars. We‚Äôve stopped here twice now and each time, the staff were friendly and fast. The drinks, we‚Äôve had the passion fruit smoothie and lychee soda were perfect and refreshing. Great place with outstanding low prices not like the majority of tourists oriented cafes.

name: Minimal coffee
review_1_text:
I guess ‚Äúminimal‚Äù refers to drink quality here :/

Genuinely the worst drinks i had in Chiang Mai.

Could not finish the coconut matcha, as it was bitter and watery. When served, no coconut water was visible. I assume they ran out of it by the end of the day and just poured in the few drops that was left.

The orange coffee was okay, but look at the amount of ice - full to the top. I saw the barista add even more ice right before serving me, cause the cup had like 3 sips of the drink.

The people working there were nice! Just not good at making drinks. Avoid.
review_2_text:
Coffee Place near the Three Kings Monument.
We had a double espresso & iced coconut americano.
My americano was okay but the espresso, unfortunately, was very sour and my partner didn‚Äôt drink it.
Service was great and store looks cool.
review_3_text:
Clean and modern simple coffee shop that opens earlier than others. Helps someone like me early risers :)
Only downside I see is that there is outside table in front of of the shop but it smells due to cat‚Äôs droppings :(
review_4_text: Nice coffee. Have been before on previous visits. Good tasting hot latte
review_5_text: Damn good coffee! Friendly barista, friendly pricing... I had a dirty latte with 25% sugar, memorable indeed.

name: Brewginning Coffee
review_1_text:
This is a must-visit.
If you like a strong, bold taste, this is the coffee you need to try. the outdoor area it‚Äôs super chilled and the staff is the sweetest.
I‚Äôve been coming here for three years and the quality is always the same. I also love that they have a stamp card for regular customers.
review_2_text: My new, fave coffee shop in Chiang Mai. Friendly helpful team, an open-air indoor outdoor design with lots of seating, solid wifi ‚Ä¶ and most of all, delicious coffees! Open early another huge plus!!
review_3_text:
Brewginning Coffee is one of Chiang Mai's most popular coffee shops right now, and it‚Äôs easy to see why! It has a distinctly trendy social media photo vibe, drawing a large crowd of Chinese, Korean, Japanese, and domestic Thai travellers.
The staff truly elevates the experience; everyone was friendly and served with a warm smile. I ordered an Orange Espresso for my friend, and the presentation was excellent.
If you are looking for a beautiful, vibrant space to enjoy a coffee and capture some great photos, this is your spot. A definite five-star experience!
review_4_text:
had coffee
@brewginning.

this a hip happening place, with crowd, instragrammable

seems like many tourists more into taking photo at chan moi kao road than in coffee

we had dirty and yuzu expresso, later was good but former was nothing like the superb brew @ restr8to

our fault really as the the description was completely different this one here having honey- didn‚Äôt like the sweetness but the nice coffee aroma still there.

2.1.2026
review_5_text: This coffee shop is famous for its IG spot which offers really great coffee made from great beans. The taste of coffee is strong and a good blend. They have a good inside room for working which is perfect if you work from home or work remotely and away from crowds outside. Staff are friendly and give you good recommendations, try cookies which go well with coffee. I would recommend visiting if you are looking for one of the places for coffee with great IG pics.

name: GRAPH Cafe
review_1_text:
This is definitely the most creative and innovative cafe in Thailand. I love their spirit and idea of ‚ÄúGRAGH‚Äù. Totally agreed their initial thought of naming this brand.

Coffee is just amazing and good mixture and combination with others. I really love this cafe. You can feel their soul and mind. It‚Äôs completely different from blue bottle or Starbucks.
review_2_text:
A wonderful cafe in Old Town Chiang Mai. Small and cozy. Super nice staff. Great coffee. The best we‚Äôve had thus far in Chiang Mai. Price is the highest we‚Äôve paid as well.

The space is small and refined rustic. We didn‚Äôt have to wait but previously we came and gave up as it didn‚Äôt seem tables were going to turn anytime soon. They are using a VBM Espresso Machine. Nice attention to detail.
review_3_text: Graph has to be one of the most innovative coffee shops in the world right now. The craft they put into the drinks - avocado cream in dirty lattes, somehow blending coffee and orange juice together PERFECTLY, it‚Äôs super exciting to know that there are people passionately engaged in their craft to this extent. The location in this craft market is also wonderful, chiang mai is one of my favorite places to visit because of this genuine spirit of creativity. Please support Graph, you won‚Äôt regret it.
review_4_text: The coffee is well-crafted, smooth, and full of flavor. Every detail feels thoughtful, from the space to the service. Friendly staff and a great place to slow down and enjoy a quality cup of coffee. Highly recommended
review_5_text:
One of the best coffee experiences I‚Äôve had around the world.
If I could, I would give more than 5 stars ‚ú®
I tried the Lava and their matcha, and both were excellent. The staff is super kind and professional.
A must-try for any coffee lover.

name: Monday__attack
review_1_text: lovely place and decor, kind ladies working. Drinks were just alright, the es yen was small, the capuccino was nothing special. As others have said, many people taking pictures everywhere so it‚Äôs not that much of a relaxing atmosphere. they give you a free ice cream if you review it, that could explain a higher rating.
review_2_text: Roomy yet cosy joint with wavy vibes tucked down a small alley. The servings are solid, the service is cheery, and the ambiance makes the menu prices worthwhile. Not all that busy at noon on a weekend.
review_3_text:
Nice location and delicious drink. You can take plenty of pictures here as they decorate it very nice. There is also a photobooth as well, i forgot how much it was but def give it a try.

The only thing i wanna complain was that i bought a drink but my friend wanna use the washroom. They didnt allow her to use it but requested her to buy a drink first. I found it unusual for a coffee shop like this.
review_4_text: Great interior. I really like old TVs showing noice as a design choice! Coffee is alright, the variations are better than the classic choices.
review_5_text: We‚Äôre at a super cute caf√© called Monday Attack. The decorations here are full of style‚Äîplayful and adorable, with so much character! The staff girls are all sweet and cheerful, always smiling and super friendly. The atmosphere is cozy, photogenic, and really fun to be in. There are little corners perfect for taking pictures, and our whole family is having such a lovely time here

name: Ministry of Roasters - Chiang Mai
review_1_text: Amazing specialty coffee in Chiang Mai! The staff are super knowledgeable and friendly, and the coffee is always perfectly brewed. Great spot to relax, work, or learn about different beans and brewing methods. Cozy, modern vibe and definitely worth a visit for any coffee lover!‚òïüíïüå±
review_2_text: Really like the coffee here. It is very good. I ordered a Hot Americano, the Director blend (Medium Roast - Honduras). The serving cup was unique. It was deep with enough space to allow the notes and aroma to come through clearly while drinking. Nice!
review_3_text: We had a latte and caramel popcorn and omg, both were sooo good. The coffee itself is just amazing. Team is nice and WiFi is good. They also have a cute back garden where you can take few nice pictures and enjoy a coffee if isn‚Äôt too hot. If you‚Äôre a coffee lover, this is the place for you!
review_4_text:
Another must-visit coffee spot in Chiang Mai! ‚òïÔ∏è
They blend their coffee perfectly rich, smooth, and well-balanced in every cup. The caf√© itself is beautifully designed with a modern and minimalist white interior that feels clean, bright, and stylish.

If you‚Äôre a coffee lover or a content creator, this place is a must! Definitely one of those caf√©s you need to check in and experience the taste of their coffee for yourself.
review_5_text:
Exceptional and complex flavours. These guys have it dialed in‚Ä¶.
Can choose your blend of coffee.
Fun space
‚Äîit‚Äôs the price of eating two local Thai dishes but a treat and experience ‚Äî

name: JAI LOY CAFE & ROOFTOP
review_1_text: Amazing place! Amazing views and great friendly staff. Good and drinks are also good‚Ä¶ haven‚Äôt seen views like this anywhere else.
review_2_text:
Poor Value Accommodation! READ the negative reviews...

I don't know how this place can be rated so highly on Agoda, Booking and Google. I suspect this place has paid an internet company to boost it's ratings by giving fake high ratings. I observed 3 or 4 high ratings put in within 1 minute on google reviews most likely by the same person on the evening I stayed there.

The staff are so unmotivated and take hotel guests as intruders when we want to go back to our rooms. There are so many things wrong with this place ...rooms with no windows, super hard beds, dark and dim rooms resembling a jail cell!

The rooftop bar had only 1 table occupied at 8pm on the Friday/Saturday that i went up to take a look. There was a couple in the same lift as me coming down probably deciding the rooftop bar was not worth their baht...

To be fair some of the staff do try to make yr stay more pleasant but the systemic issues with the place are too extreme.

The owner should really take a hard look and stay in the "hotel" to understand the issues or maybe he/she doesn't care and just wants to keep the place afloat.

This is the worst accommodation i have ever stayed in Thailand and I felt so deceived by the high ratings to stay here!
review_3_text:
Jai Loy is our favorite hangout place in Chiang Mai. Amazing and friendly staff which makes the rooftop bar an extraordinary experience. Food and drinks are priced cheaply with high quality.

We, especially, are always enjoying the sunset at around 6 to 7pm when the sun decends behind the mountain: priceless!

A must go place when in Chiang Mai enjoying a relaxed and chilled atmosphere.
review_4_text:
At first I was thinking if the place will be noisy because there is rooftop bar on 5th floor and cafe on the 1st floor, but surprisingly the room was quiet! Room also clean and smells good. I stayed in a private room on the 2nd floor with shared bathroom, and the bathroom was clean.

Location is perfect, many good places that we can reach by walking distance.

Only 1 small feedback, because we have to take off our own shoes or slippers, it will be great if the accommodation can also provide slipper in the room or for us to walk around the communal area üôèüèª
review_5_text:
Mixed review.

We booked the same day as we were quite limited on places available in our budget, they kindly let us check in early for no charge which was great. The only room available was the standard room with no window, at ¬£25 a night. The bed was comfy but the room was quite dingy and smelt musty. The bathroom as well had the typical sewage smell that is all too often here. Plus the A/C spat out smelly air. I think these things wouldn‚Äôt have been a problem if we had spent maybe ¬£10 less per night, but as Thailand has so many budget stays this was one of the more expensive budget rooms but it was not reflected in the quality.
This is not to say don‚Äôt stay here it‚Äôs just a reflection of the standard room with no window, as for the price you can get better (if you book in advance not like us).

Apart from that the staff were nice and there is great seating areas down stairs and on the rooftop with a sunset view. The prices were quite expensive on the rooftop though, I suppose due to the view.

name: Coffee Telling
review_1_text: What an incredible place - I found it by recommendations, and well this is THE BEST coffee in Chiang Mai. I love coffee - my comparison level of great coffee is Italian coffee - and I must say the coffee here was just SUPERB. I was here every day for the coffee, and what cannot be missed is the atmosphere in the place - such chill & peace üòÄ, plus the Owner is truly amazing, kind and so expert on coffee making - always with a beautiful smile. Lastly, the crema on the coffee is out of this world üòä!!
review_2_text:
The best cup of coffee in Chiang Mai, and the kindest, sweetest owner.
Coffee is 50 baht, he doesn‚Äôt charge for an oat milk alternative, and he uses the best one there is- Oatly! Great banana bread too!
There‚Äôs plenty of seating available outside, and it feels like sitting in someone‚Äôs garden.
There‚Äôs also a cute cat roaming about :)
My husband and I are sad we couldn‚Äôt visit more often and wish we could have stayed in this neighbourhood.
review_3_text:
Cozy spot with lush back and front patios.
The owner and staff are super friendly and cool. Banana bread is out of this world, vegan to top it. Coffee is amazing, and the mango smoothie is mmmmm.
Must visit in CNX for coffee.
review_4_text: This is my FAVORITE coffee spot in Chiang Mai. First of all, the coffee is so delicious and that's what counts the most.. and second it's not extra to have soy milk. The mugs have a decent size, perfect for me. And the owner is very friendly, the atmosphere chill, lot's of greenery and nice decorations. I enjoy coming here so much! Thank you :)
review_5_text: Awesome coffee, even regardless of the very fair price. Very limited menu, usually means really good quality since easier to manage, not the most expensive coffee machine, but everything maintained well, very cozy environment, and excellent quality of delivery!!

name: ShaPel Hostel x Caf√©s
review_1_text: It‚Äôs clean, aircon is great and comfortable, beds are great and private with under bed drawers that lock. Bathroom facilities are nice and perfect location for a backpacker in Chiang Mai. Will note that it isn‚Äôt a very social hostel so if you‚Äôre looking for that wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place, but besides that I had an amazing time and experience here.
review_2_text: First time staying in a hostel! I booked this one as it appeared to be fresh, modern and clean. It was a really good experience and the hostess was amazing. I will 100% stay at the same place when I travel to Chiang mai in the future.
review_3_text: Had a great time at ShaPel Hostel. It's clean and quiet and well-located. A cute caf√© is located downstairs. Recommend if you're looking for a friendly, safe environment. Definitely not a party hostel.
review_4_text: The room is clean and reasonably priced. There‚Äôs a nice caf√© downstairs, and their Thai tea is really delicious! I highly recommend this place ‚Äî it‚Äôs also close to Tha Phae Gate. üòç
review_5_text: Fantstic little gem of a hostel..near Thae Pai gate but quiet zone. Lovely host..very immaculate spaces.

name: kurokuro.coffee.roaster
review_1_text: Such a lovely little coffee shop tucked away next to the temple, it‚Äôs a real hidden gem. The coffee was delicious and the Tiramisu latte was especially amazing. The cafe has such a cute, cosy, cat themed vibe that instantly makes you feel welcome. I‚Äôll definitely be back tomorrow for another coffee and to sample one of their bakes because the tiramisu, brownies and cheesecake all looked incredible. A really sweet spot that‚Äôs well worth a visit. ‚òïüêæüç∞
review_2_text: Today we are at Kurokuro Coffee in Chiangmai. We ordered two cappuccinos with oat milk and two cakes. The cappuccino tastes very good. Cake also tastes good, but there is nothing to come to this caf√© for. The caf√© itself is small, very friendly, quiet and relaxed. The two young people who work in this caf√© are very very nice but they are pretty much all in Thailand... we can really recommend the caf√© to everyone who visits the city. It's already something special.
review_3_text:
Lovely little coffee shop with intimate atmosphere. The staff/owners are very kind. High quality coffee for low price. Cozy to sit and chill, read, have a relaxed conversation. Free drinking water.
Just good laidback vibes - will come again when I am in Chiang Mai.
review_4_text: A truly lovely little caf√©! It‚Äôs a bit hidden, but that‚Äôs part of its charm. The coffee is absolutely delicious  and the cakes are fresh and tasty. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, making you feel right at home. A real hidden gem for anyone who loves great coffee and a cozy atmosphere!
review_5_text:
I'm kind of envious of those who can enjoy coffee at Kurokuro right now üò≠
I tried Dirty Coffee in Udon Thani at the best-rated coffee shop in the city ("Dose Coffee" - never again!) for almost twice the price of Kurokuro. And you know what? I'm deeply disappointed. I hope to come to Chiang Mai someday to have another amazing coffee here... Thanks so much to the staff! They're so welcoming and play great music. I miss them already, oh my! üé∂‚ù§Ô∏è

name: MiLa Thapae Hotel@Chiang Mai Old City
review_1_text: Excellent location, rooms had excellent AC and water, breakfast were very mid, staff extremely friendly and nice, beds comfy
review_2_text: A small boutique hotel that is a calm , cool and quiet oasis from the madness outside.  Absolutely lovely staff who are friendly and helpful and looked after us with delicious breakfasts and coffees.  I was even given a little cream patisserie with a card and candles for my birthday.  Loved our 4 night stay here.
review_3_text: When you first walk in you‚Äôll be greeted by the lovely staff. They are nice, friendly and helpful. We stayed here for 3 nights in the Deluxe Suite with the bathtub. Very spacious room. Such a great value. If you‚Äôre looking for a private and quiet atmosphere this is the spot. We were served simple but good quality breakfast with fresh fruits and juice. The best part was the cafe had free unlimited coffee, juice and smoothies from open until 10pm. Great location not far from the airport or railway station. Overall a great experience and will be staying again when I come back to Chiang Mai. Thank you!
review_4_text: Overall great experience. Strong hot water, walkable distance to east side of old city. In house breakfast is okay. Plenty of local food. Limited parking at front door. Hight CP value. Recommended.
review_5_text: Just got back, comparing to my stay years ago, I feel breakfast quality is going down also with less choices. Bed cover had stains when walking in but probably is just an incidental miss which I tend to believe as all staff are very attentive and friendly during the whole stay. For this price, it‚Äôs still a place with good value. Location is unbeatable it‚Äôs just right next to Thapae gate.

name: Dara Vietnamese Restaurant
review_1_text: Had such a good brunch here ‚Ä¶ clean, fresh food that felt like a much needed break. Super tasty but light, and you actually feel calm and good after eating. If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai and want something soothing that makes your body feel clean, this place is definitely worth trying!!‚ú®
review_2_text: Noodles were incredibly delicious, certainly home made. Lots of fresh vegetables and great flavors. Bowl of noodles was 80 thb and fresh spring rolls just 70. Great quaint spot for lunch. Also very kind service.
review_3_text: 5 stars for the food. Ordered the Pho and Nam Nueng. The vegetables were fresh and clean, and the service was polite and welcoming. The only disappointment was the Thai tea, which was quite thin and not something I would recommend.
review_4_text:
This is a great place to satisfy your craving for Vietnamese food!  I will be back!  I have had the egg coffee both times and it is lovely, though expensive compared to Vietnamese prices.  But we aren't in Vietnam.
Today I wanted Banh Xeo, but it was the only thing on the menu they didn't have!  This happens to me a lot.  Instead, I had Banh Hoi and it was delicious!!  And only 70 baht.  Mmmmmm!  Excellent!  I will want to try something different next time, but I liked this so much, I may stick to it.
I highly recommend this lovely place!
review_5_text: Clean, authentic Vietnamese food. They have a cute backyard where you can spot cats, birds and squirrels while enjoying delicious food and coffee.

name: 8To18 Breakfast&Brew
review_1_text: So happy to have found this cafe! They open early, serve delicious homemade dishes with quality and fresh ingredients. Great variety and huge portions. Their homemade bread is so yummy and same for their chocolate sauce and iced chocolate. Also love their pancakes. Family run, super nice and welcoming and there's acute little cat. Will definitely come back :)
review_2_text:
Ice Americano 10/10

Double shot of espresso over ice 10/10

Rosemary salt bagel with cream cheese egg and mayo 10/10

Seasonal fruit 10/10 (we have wanted just fruit, no added anything, for a while - happy this place has it!)

Mom and pop shop
Free WiFi
Clean
Cleansing wipes on table
Indoor and out door seating
Resident cat on a leash
Music is not loud, and great playlist! (I'm surprised actually how well the volume is)

Got here at 8:25am. Zero wait. Seat your self.

Everyone here is incredibly kind, portion sizes are big. Prices are more than reasonable! I'll be coming back.

------

I went back the next day to try the French toast and egg Sando. Again good stuff!
review_3_text:
I visited this place for brunch and was pleasantly surprised. The pancakes were delicious‚Äîfluffy, flavorful, and definitely the highlight of my visit. The atmosphere is simple, nothing fancy, but comfortable enough to enjoy a relaxed meal.

I also loved the small detail of having wet wipes on the tables, which is both practical and thoughtful. On top of that, the staff was very attentive and friendly, making the overall experience even better. A great spot if you‚Äôre looking for a tasty, no-frills brunch.

The only thing I‚Äôd recommend improving is the cleanliness of the restroom üöΩ.
review_4_text: We visited this brunch spot two days in a row and absolutely loved it. We ordered the bacon pancakes and the seasonal fruit, and everything was fresh and delicious. I can also recommend the French toast!! The interior is minimalist with a really warm and welcoming atmosphere. On top of that, the guy working there was incredibly friendly and made us feel right at home. I can highly recommend this place and would definitely come back!
review_5_text: Worth the wait! Ordered the Sunrise breakfast and the #4NYC Breakfast Bagel Sandwich. Both were amazing and so much food. The staff produces amazing breakfast, at this small restaurant that offers a delicious menu. Drinks come out at the same time as your food, and waters came with the meal.

name: THAI HERB CO.
review_1_text: This place deserves more than 5 starts. The hospitality is unreal, we drove past and thought we‚Äôd (weed üòâ) check it out and now we come everyday while on our travels. Food, beer, weed and a pool table. Plently of areas to sit and just all round good vibes. There‚Äôs not many good places to sit and smoke in Chiang Mai but this place is THE BEST. The lady I think she‚Äôs the owner is great personality, very funny and very friendly shoutout to her
review_2_text: I enjoyed the vibes at night, very cool music playlist. I enjoyed the cheese onion toast my favourite and the owner is nice she accommodated me well due to my leg injury got me a different seat.
review_3_text: Stumbled across this cafe and had to come back a few more times throughout my week here. Kindest staff you could ask for. Great value for money on both food and drinks. The smoothies in particular are incredible. I highly recommend you come here.
review_4_text: Thai Herb Co. Is a favorite spot for us to come to eat, drink, and smoke. The back garden is beautiful and has great vibes/ atmosphere with a pool table. The cannabis is good quality and Pla and the other staff are always pleasant and excited to see us. We love Thai Herb Co and recommend it for anyone looking for a good local spot to hang out. The hours are great too and we never feel rushed! The vibes are great and the cannabis is strong.
review_5_text: I had an amazing experience at Thai Herb.co! The place has a warm and inviting atmosphere, making it a perfect spot to relax and unwind. The quality of their products is outstanding ‚Äî you can really tell they put care and expertise into everything they offer. The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, always ready to help and share their knowledge. Whether you're looking for authentic herbs, wellness products, or just a chill place to hang out, Thai Herb.co is definitely the place to go. Highly recommend for anyone seeking quality, good vibes, and great service!

name: HIDE LAND__SPACE
review_1_text:
The Chiang Mai Rooftop Bar Review
Conversation with Gemini
Write a 210 word review on Hide Land Bar in Chiang Mai. Highlight it's Chic ambience, nice roof top restaurant and excellent view of the surrounding area and also the hill view. Mention how many people come here for the sunset views. The food drinks are famous especially the cocktails

Nestled in the heart of the city, Hide Land is one of Chiang Mai's most captivating "secret" rooftop bars. Known for its chic, industrial-meets-minimalist ambiance, it offers a sophisticated yet relaxed escape from the bustling streets below.

The highlight of any visit is undoubtedly the rooftop restaurant, which provides an excellent 360-degree view of the surrounding urban landscape. As the evening approaches, the space transforms; it is a prime destination for sunset enthusiasts, with dozens of people flocking here daily to catch the golden hour. The sight of the sun dipping behind the lush green hills and the iconic Doi Suthep mountain range is nothing short of breathtaking.

Beyond the scenery, Hide Land has built a stellar reputation for its culinary and mixology offerings. The cocktails are the true stars‚Äîfamous for being expertly balanced and creatively presented. Whether you prefer a classic or a signature Thai-inspired infusion, the drinks are as impressive as the vista. Complementing the bar is a menu of high-quality food that elevates the experience from a simple drink spot to a full dining destination. For anyone seeking a trendy atmosphere and a million-dollar view, Hide Land is an absolute must-visit place
review_2_text: The best for working or studying or just chill. They have really good music and the place is spacious and u can see the city view with mountain. The drinks are pretty good and reasonable. I really like the decorations here..
review_3_text:
Super nice view, good coffee and chocolate drink! They also have matcha and hojicha here. I think the vibe of the place and that you can see the old town view of Changmoi street.
Nice for a sunset too
review_4_text: A beautiful rooftop terrace with a lovely atmosphere and amazing views a perfect spot for taking photos. The menu offers food options as well as a wide variety of drinks, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. It‚Äôs a great place to relax, enjoy the vibe, and spend a nice time while capturing some beautiful moments. Highly recommended ü•∞ü´∂
review_5_text: Great views, vibe & coffee. But we ordered an onigiri, had to wait for 30 min, staff weren‚Äôt approachable and it came out drenched in sauce. Couldn‚Äôt eat it.

name: Hopf Coffee House
review_1_text: We popped in here for a drink and ended up having a few. The atmosphere was great with friendly staff and happy customers. They have live musicians playing good music, and very reasonably priced drinks. I can't comment on the food but I can say we had a great time. Recommended üëç
review_2_text: Super cool bar! Max the owner is really chill and friendly - you feel like a local the first time you go there. They also have live music Friday / Saturday / Sunday. Immaculate vibes üôèüçª
review_3_text: Great food, friendly service and live music at night! Cant beat it.
review_4_text:
This is my absolute favorite bar in Chiang Mai! The place has a magical charm, and the owner truly brings it to life. He personally handles the service and has such a unique and welcoming vibe that makes the experience unforgettable.

The atmosphere feels so warm and familiar‚Äîyou‚Äôll notice many people coming by not just as customers, but as friends who‚Äôve built a connection with the owner. It‚Äôs the kind of place where everyone feels at home, and the amazing vibe keeps you coming back. They have live music every night :)
I ended up spending most of my nights in Chiang Mai here, and I highly recommend you try it! The prices are very reasonable, and the mojitos are absolutely delicious. Don‚Äôt miss out on this gem!
review_5_text: The owner is very friendly and helpful. There is great live music. I recommend you come and have a drink. There are Pai and max waiting to welcome you.

name: Good Shot coffee bar
review_1_text: Nice place to chill with a great medium roast latte anytime of the day. Soft jazzy music playing with patio seats available and watch peoples and car, scooter, tuk tuk passes by. Such a relaxing vibe. Simple snacks and great espresso is the option here.
review_2_text: Cutest, cosy coffee bar - although I only had a Thai coffee, the cake options looked lovely. Beautiful viewing bar outside. Service was fab and drink tasted amazing. Would definitely recommend!
review_3_text:
My favourite every day morning stop! Best cortado ever! And sucha nice ambient with a lovely girl working there!
Happy I was a part of her big moment, the first successful decoration ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: Lovely caf√®, definitely stop by if you‚Äôre going to the nearby temple. The honey almond milk was delicious, not to sweet. The biscoff cookie and the lemon one were really good as well as the banana bread. The coffee was top notch, best we‚Äôve had so far in Thailand.
review_5_text: Cute little spot near the north side for a brew and chill. Seating could be more comfortable. Otherwise ace.

name: Phin & Feta - Coffee & Sourdough
review_1_text:
We had a great experience at Phin & Feta. The Sourdough Donuts were light, a little chewy, and just the right amount of sweet. They were something we kept talking about even after we left.

The Salmon Smash was another standout. It was fresh, full of flavor, and put together really well. The portion was generous and the mix of textures made it easy to enjoy.

The Coconut Blended Coffee was the perfect finish. It was creamy, refreshing, and had a nice coconut flavor without being too sweet.

Overall, everything tasted great and the whole place had a relaxed, welcoming vibe. We‚Äôll definitely be back :)
review_2_text: This small coffee shop was a delightful find for breakfast. A short walk from our hotel their selection of sweet treats and avocado smash is quite nice. Their is limited seating inside and outside, but it was workable for the time we were there. I highly recommend stopping in and sampling some tasty sourdough.
review_3_text: One of the most unique donut I ever had in my life!  This coffee shop is run by a friendly couple. The sourdough donut was soft & chewy like the artisan times. The feta cream on top of the donut was to die for (I fought with my wife for the last bite!)  The feta salt coffee (hand pressed) was very smooth and incredibly flavorful.  What a hidden gem.  We love it!   ÎÑàÎ¨¥ÎÇò ÎßõÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî. ÏïÑÏßÅ Ïù¥Îü∞ Ïª§ÌîºÎ•º Ï≤òÏùåÏúºÎ°ú ÎßàÏÖ®ÏäµÎãàÎã§.
review_4_text: Fantastic little place that has a wonderful smell of fresh sourdough bread in the air. The owners are friendly and knowledgable and answered my questionsvsourdough layman questios. The slice of sourdough with cream cheese, feta and avocado and coffee on the side was delicious Who can ask for more?
review_5_text:
An absolute gem in Chiang Mai!
