Phin and Feta is, without a doubt, one of the best caf√©s in Chiang Mai. Everything here is made with such care and passion ‚Äî you can truly taste it in every bite.

We tried their sourdough bread with real butter, and it was divine. The aroma of the butter alone was irresistible, and the bread itself was perfectly crisp on the outside and soft inside. The sourdough with avocado and salmon was an explosion of flavours ‚Äî fresh, balanced, and beautifully presented.

And then there is the famous sourdough donut with cream and feta ‚Äî an unforgettable experience! Light and airy dough, silky velvet cream, and the subtle touch of feta that makes it truly unique.

The owners are incredibly kind and dedicated, and their love for what they do shines through. A warm, welcoming atmosphere, excellent coffee, and food that delights all the senses ‚Äî Phin and Feta is simply unmissable.

If you love good coffee and sourdough bread, this is the place in Chiang Mai.

name: I Coffee
review_1_text: This has become my go to coffee shop while in Chiang Mai. Great coffee with fair price. It is a stall on the street in the Lanna market so plenty to watch while enjoying their excellent coffee. The staff is super friendly.
review_2_text:
Top quality coffee for a super cheap price. They've got all the equipment like a barista does.

I was pleasantly surprised to see how well they prepared my iced cappuccino. Great espresso shot topped with milk & milk foam. They even added a pinch of coffee grind on top for decoration.

It's an ideal place for takeaway coffee. Loved this place.
review_3_text:
This is my husband and I's favorite cafe in ChiangMai so far.ü§£

Owner here is so friendly and welcoming, she will remember your preferences and adjust your drinks accordingly. We stopped by almost every morning during our week-long stay in ChiangMai this time.

The cappuccino and Thai tea are amazing! (remember to ask for less sugar). It's incredible to be able to enjoy such good drinks at this price.ü§§
review_4_text: Amazing coffee in Chiang Mai for a fair price. The barista here knows exactly what she's doing, and besides she's super nice and friendly. If you like and appreciate good quality coffee, you should come here!
review_5_text:
There are 3 super cheap (below 40 baht) coffee stall nearby: Hom coffee, Prem coffee and I coffee.

Tried all of them and I would say I coffee is the best and smoothest coffee I ever had in cnx.

Supported them alot of time and never get disappointed, I recommended you to do the 'iced green tea with milk', that's a hidden gemin the shop!

The guy owner can speak English and very polite and friendly to talk with.

You may visit or take a lunch in the market opposite then stop for their perfect drinks üíØ

name: Neighborhood Goods
review_1_text: This is an amazing coffee with excellent coffee with a strong flavor profile. The pieces are affordable and the owner is kind and friendly. She is also very knowledgeable about coffee and even makes her own homemade strawberry jam that tasted great with the matcha. Can highly recommend this place and even has outdoor seating. The best part is that glass containers can be used to avoid plastics.
review_2_text: Nice little place and very friendly owner. Please their signature shaken oat espresso! It‚Äôs refreshing and definitely the best world of latte and americano.
review_3_text:
A super cute and stylish little caf√© with lovely staff ü•∞
You can enjoy the cozy vibe sitting outside or go upstairs for a nice view.
The strawberry matcha is delicious ‚Äî totally recommend it! üíûüíû
review_4_text: Absolute gem in Chiang Mai. Best coffee in town & a lovely atmosphere to sit and watch the world go by. Pastries were also amazing. Staff are super welcoming & friendly. No extra charge for Oat milk which is always a win!
review_5_text:
Really cute caf√©, got an iced matcha strawberry with oat milk. Super tasty, not too sweet as requested, real matcha powder and made fresh for the drink. Not top quality matcha but wouldn't expect it to be for that price
Would definitely come again
Beautiful little space, definitely recommend!

name: Mountain Coffee by Noi
review_1_text:
A Flavor Journey in Every Cup: Chiang Dao Coffee with the Most Unique Finish

This Old City gem offers a complete artisan experience that starts with your palate and ends with a story. Beyond their incredible hand-roasted, organic Chiang Dao Arabica coffee and exceptional homemade breads, they serve a cup with a truly unique taste profile.

Coffee Experience: Their must-try Iced Americano showcases beans roasted right on-site. But here‚Äôs what sets it apart: the taste journey. It begins with a surprisingly sweet, bright palette‚Äînotes of citrus and honey‚Äîthat then transforms into a distinct, intentional, warming "burn" at the finish. It‚Äôs not bitter; it‚Äôs a complex, almost smoky depth that lingers beautifully. This unique progression from sweet to roasted warmth is unforgettable.

Perfect Pairings: The homemade Mum's Banana Bread (walnuts, whole wheat, honey) complements the coffee's sweetness, while their Flourless Seed & Nut Bread (no yeast/dairy) stands up to its robust finish.

More than a caf√©‚Äîit's a destination for those who appreciate craftsmanship in both coffee and food. A must-visit for a complete, sophisticated experience in the Old City.
review_2_text:
Absolutely wonderful spot.üëç

Wonderful setting, inside old town. Filled with peaceful nature. They have Oat milk and other vegan-friendly, dairy substitutes available.
I had a wonderful oat milk latte!
Wonderful tasting organic and fresh mountain coffee; all locally sourced.

Service is wonderful and atmosphere is peaceful and relaxing. Plenty of outdoor, yet sheltered, and shaded seating.
The perfect place to stop your walking and take a break.
I am now totally reenergized!

Thank you so much!

I highly recommend this place and I will come back again.
review_3_text:
A favorite spot for getting really flavourfull good coffee. The lovely owner collects his coffeebeans in Chiang Dao and roast it in the garden with years of experience and born out of pure passion.

All the option are simply great and have a rich deep flavour. If you feel like a little adventure ask for an off-menu coffee and be suprised. Support the local family & enjoy your lovely coffee. Above all spend time talking to Noum. She truly cares and is interested in you as a person üôè
review_4_text: Come back a year later. Still my best spot in Chiangmai. It's my dream to sit here and enjoy a cup of coffee every morning under such peaceful and teak style greenery setting. Another kind of 5 star enjoyment.  This year I brought home a few bags of beans as well. Hope to come back soon.  Thx Noi.
review_5_text:
**A Hidden Gem for Coffee Lovers**

Tucked away in the heart of Chiang Mai old town, this coffee shop is an absolute delight for anyone who appreciates great coffee and a cozy ambiance. From the moment you step inside, you're welcomed by the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee and a warm, inviting atmosphere.

The menu boasts a variety of high-quality coffees, from perfectly crafted espresso shots to creamy, indulgent lattes. I opted for their signature latte, and it was *perfection*‚Äîsmooth, velvety, and brewed to bring out the nuanced flavors of their beans. For those who prefer something beyond coffee, their selection of homemade healthy breads and granola is equally impressive.

The owner/ barista is not only skilled but also incredibly friendly, taking the time to explain options and make personalized recommendations.

If you‚Äôre a coffee aficionado or just someone looking for a great spot to unwind, this place is a must-visit. I can‚Äôt wait to come back for more.

**Rating: 5/5**

name: Scoof
review_1_text: A heartwarming spot full of positive energy, plus the drinks are healthy and delicious! I visited on Christmas Eve and loved the afternoon show. Seeing the guests singing along was a wonderful surprise and made for a very happy time.
review_2_text: It‚Äôs a homely, tasty, and healthy brunch spot, as the owner runs their own organic farm. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to escape the hustle and enjoy quality dishes made with premium ingredients, this one is highly recommended.
review_3_text: Just walked past and fancied a coffee stop and scoof looked good. Whole family had smoothies, and food looked good so we all had meals. Kao Tom was delicious, as was chicken with gravy and salad. Also had Spaghetti bolognese and this was good too. Also speaking with staff and found out some of the fresh produce grown on their local farm. Really friendly staff
review_4_text:
New healthy cafe
Healthy & Yummy home grown refreshment with options from booster to detoxification.

Quality sausages plate. Love meat sausages.
A very tasty perilla bun salmon plate.

Fresh squeeze , smoothy and plenty of juices and healthy food create by ‚ÄúDe Farm‚Äù

High ceiling, nice music, cool interior and welcome cafe place.
review_5_text: We stopped here for a mid-morning snack and it was great! We shared an egg & meat dish, a booster shot, a matcha coconut, and a delicious honey kombucha. Everything was so tasty. It was a great vibe and we enjoyed hanging out here for a bit.

name: Fatboi Coffee
review_1_text: Super chill joint on the first floor up in the Neighborhood complex, overlooking the street below. Open-air concept that fits seamlessly into the neo-foodcourt microcosm it's a part of. Friendly staff that brew up some top coffee. Surprisingly quiet on a weekend afternoon.
review_2_text: We went early morning for a coffee and it was super quiet. Nice view from the top balcony and great for watching the busy streets. We had a Thai style iced coffee (with condensed milk) and an affogato and both were really tasty.
review_3_text: Came by to Fatboi Coffee which is in a space-sharing location with some f&b at 2F. Seems like this place is cater more to the evening to night crowd. Very trendy place well done from a very big old shop.
review_4_text:
Nice coffee place, on the 2nd floor of the neighborhood community (newly open) in Chang Moi area.

Ordered Iced Es-yen (95 THB), it tastes good.

Staff was okay‚Ä¶

You can sit at the balcony to watch the view from above.

It was quite difficult to find a parking space.
review_5_text: Great location for people watching or getting some work done. Lots of seating available. Coffee is pretty decent, no choice of beans offered though and no filter/hand pour available. Would be 5 star if these options were available.

name: TARN coffee bar
review_1_text:
Prices are ok and plenty of space to sit inside the market.
Mango smoothie was great, but a bit more expensive than elsewhere.
QR code payments (via Moreta, for example) are accepted, which is very convenient.
review_2_text:
A hidden gem in the market, you get a fresh mango smoothie or an espresso. It was delicious!
And the girl on that prepared our drinks was super nice to us and explained some thai specialities to us.
Also, this caf√© seems to be popular around locals, there were many people.
review_3_text: A stand inside the market, worth the detour, very warm welcome, a large choice for a very good price and above all fresh fruit, thank you to the owner
review_4_text: Jackfruit + Passion is good!
review_5_text: We ordered Americano Lychee and American Coconut. Both are good! üòÄhighly recommended! The owner is also friendly.‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Samsen Villa
review_1_text:
The food is decent but really it's just average for Thailand. I'm not surprised the last Michelin recommendation is from 2023. They've milked the Michelin rec as much as they could and are now selling snacks and whatever they can.
We ordered fish (usually takes at least 20min), soup and some other dishes and we're surprised that everything was on the table within 5-10min. They've maximized efficiency over the freshness, as the fish was definitely pre-fried and then kept warm. Everything was good but nothing special. The coconut shake was too sweet. The service was efficient again, but lackluster.
Good parking if you have a car.
Would I come back? No.
review_2_text: I had higher expectations for a place that has Michelin star rated plates. I had the red snail curry which was very tasty and flavorful whereas the fried squid was quite chewy and bland. I thought the prices were very high compared to other local restaurants. The service was just ok... not a whole lot of engagement or interaction. One of the benefits was that there was some live music which made the atmosphere a bit better. Overall, it was an ok experience.
review_3_text:
Nice Service and Good Taste of Thai foods.

You can enjoy a free complementary dessert when give 3 of 5-stars reviews at the exact time of dining on the table.
review_4_text:
The food is delicious and full of authentic Thai flavors.
Portion sizes are very generous and satisfying.
The atmosphere is calm, peaceful, and very pleasant, with a beautiful riverside setting along the Ping River.
A great place to enjoy a relaxed and high-quality Thai meal.
review_5_text: Thai restaurant with a wide variety of dishes. Nice riverside atmosphere by the Ping River. A great place to relax and enjoy good food in Chiang Mai.

name: Rich Homemade Cake Changmoi
review_1_text:
Such a cozy and beautifully designed caf√©! The atmosphere is warm and relaxing with its wooden interiors, soft lighting, and clean minimalist layout. The space feels very open and comfortable ‚Äî perfect for studying, working, or just enjoying a quiet coffee break.

The pastry display looks amazing and everything is neatly presented. Staff are friendly and welcoming. I really like the attention to detail in the decor ‚Äî simple but stylish, with a nice mix of rustic and modern touches. Definitely a great spot to chill or meet friends. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
A cozy, minimalist caf√© with a calm soul. Warm wood everywhere, soft light and that peaceful atmosphere where time seems to slow down üåø
I ordered a coconut coffee and it was really good: smooth, well balanced, with a subtle tropical touch that fits Chiang Mai perfectly ü••‚ú®
A lovely place to sit, think, read, or simply enjoy the moment.
üìç Chiang Mai
üí≠ Would definitely come back ‚ò∫Ô∏èüòç
review_3_text: This was my second visit, after my first time in April 2025. This place serves the best dirty coffee I‚Äôve found in Chiang Mai so far. The coconut pandan cake is a must-order and, in my opinion, the best item on the menu. The cake is fragrant, not overly sweet, and has pieces of coconut meat in the cream, which adds a great texture. I recommend visiting on a weekday or at a time when most people wouldn‚Äôt usually have dessert, as it can get quite crowded.
review_4_text:
The food was great, and I really enjoyed the coconut cake and dirty coffee. I would say the Americano with coconut water was not as good as we thought. The cafe is well-decorated with rustic interiors (natural wood), but with cutesy art pieces and postcards. You also get free stickers with purchases!

A great place to come sit and work or chat with friends.
review_5_text: I don't usually leave reviews for caf√©s but this one deserves it. Great selection of delicious cakes and coffees and the best background music selection (think 80s, Earth Wind and Fire, Stevie Wonder,  Franki Valli, Bee Gees etc). The brioche custard doughnut, served warm, deserves a special mention üòã. Good service and friendly staff. Perfect!

name: Makad Rooftop
review_1_text: Very good value for money. The owner is super nice and helpful. He really cares about your well-being. The rooftop bar is also nice, meet some nice people there. Rooms are very reasonable for the price!
review_2_text: Beautiful rooftop terrace with lovely views to watch the city sunset. There is a wide variety of drinks at very good prices, which makes it even better. The atmosphere is relaxed and pleasant, perfect for enjoying a drink while the sun goes down. Definitely a great spot to spend the evening üåÑüåÖüåú‚≠ê‚ú®
review_3_text:
We visited Makad Rooftop to watch the sunset üåÖ
There are a few flights of stairs to reach the top, but my mum‚Äîwho has mobility issues‚Äîwas able to take them slowly.

We ordered our food and drinks downstairs before heading up.
The outdoor area was lovely, with plenty of space and a mix of tables, chairs, and comfy sofas to relax on.

The food was fine‚Äîjust what you‚Äôd expect for some light, picky bits‚Äîand the atmosphere was great. We really enjoyed watching the sunset, even if a big block of flats was right in the way üòÇ
review_4_text: This cafe offers a truly magical atmosphere. The beautiful rooftop provides an exceptional view, and the weather here is just perfectly cool and breezy. It‚Äôs the ideal escape for a relaxed, intimate conversation with your significant other. The soulful background music makes everything feel fresh and utterly delightful. A breath of fresh air!
review_5_text: This hostel is so amazing I really love the rooftop area the best. The vibes are so comfy and at night you can see the starts for perfectly. And then if you go out on a night out coming back to watch the sunrise is a bookmark worthy moment for your travel stories ‚òÄÔ∏è also get a soju bucket from the bar ‚ù§Ô∏è also the location of this hostel is in the perfect area for the old town of chiang mai to walk around and explore the town.

name: Blue & Teak eatery. Stay. Space
review_1_text:
Had a lovely English breakfast at Blue & Teak today. The portion size was generous and really filling ‚Äî proper comfort food done right. Everything tasted fresh and well-prepared, just what you want from a hearty breakfast.

The staff were warm and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Great vibes overall ‚Äî relaxed atmosphere, good energy, and a perfect spot to start the day.

Definitely recommended if you‚Äôre craving a solid English breakfast with friendly service. Would happily come back again.
review_2_text: Visited this place three times during our four day stay in Chiang Mai. Absolutely loved it. Staff super super friendly. Very nice vibe. Food was fantastic. My regular one was the creme cheese salmon croissant. My family had a few sour dough options - tried them all and absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended!
review_3_text:
This is a really lovely cafe with excellent food and warm service! It is run by really nice and hardworking people who serve with high quality standards in mind.

The food was overall really delicious and of good quality! A special mention for the Thai Basil Aglio Olio! I was craving for a good aglio olio and Blue & Teak‚Äôs was perfect with a special hint of local flavors. The penne was a little overcooked for my liking but the tomato sauce and sausage was super yummy! I loved everything I ate here and even went twice so I could try more. Their menu was well-designed by the chef and the food was of high quality.

I highly recommend Blue & Teak if you need yummy food with great and friendly service and a cosy atmosphere to people watch or to chill. The location is really great too as there are cute streets and shops nearby!
review_4_text: Wonderful experience! We had the French toast and the egg bacon croissant. Everything we ate was delicious and the staff were so kind and attentive.  I wish I could remember our servers name, she was so sweet and kind. Definitely recommend.
review_5_text:
I had such a lovely experience at Blue & Teak Caf√©. The vibe is cozy, bright, and welcoming ‚Äî the kind of place that instantly makes you feel relaxed the moment you step in.

I ordered their yogurt bowl and hot chocolate, and both were amazing. The yogurt bowl was beautifully presented with fresh fruits, crunchy granola, and a generous portion of yogurt. It tasted just as good as it looked. The hot chocolate was rich and smooth, with the cutest floral latte art on top ‚Äî such a thoughtful touch.

The caf√© itself has this charming, homey atmosphere with a mix of wood, greenery, and soft colors. It‚Äôs perfect for a slow morning, getting some work done, or just enjoying a peaceful moment alone. Staff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive.

Overall, Blue & Teak is a hidden gem ‚Äî simple, delicious, and full of warmth. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. üíô‚ú®

name: khna coffee brewers
review_1_text:
A charming specialty coffee spot in Chiang Mai's Wat Gate neighborhood, housed in a beautifully renovated old wooden house.
It offers a peaceful, homey vibe with natural light flooding through large windows, vintage furnishings, wooden floors, and a lovely garden area out back‚Äîperfect for slowing down and savoring the moment.
The cafe focuses on sustainably sourced single-origin Arabica beans from northern Thailand hills, micro-roasted in small batches for fresh, flavorful brews.  It's a cozy escape ideal for relaxing or light work, with friendly staffs adding to the warm, welcoming feel. A hidden gem for coffee lovers seeking quality and tranquility in Chiang Mai!
review_2_text: One of my to-go spots for coffee in the area. Quiet and cozy. Right across from a few yummy places too - that‚Äôs why I enjoy spending some time on this street with good coffee and food.
review_3_text:
Decent coffee. Good vibes cozy atmosphere.

Sunny breezy cafe of Chiangmai.
review_4_text:
My new favourite cafe in Chiang Mai!! üòçSo good i went back the next day!!
The flat white was so good and iced latte was amazing too. It‚Äôs actually hard to find really good cup of coffee among so many cafes in town but this one is legit. One sip and instant fave! Great price too! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
review_5_text: Loved this place. I was staying just across the road for two weeks and ended up here most days for my daily caffeine fix. They offer two roasts ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶medium and dark and there‚Äôs a beautiful little garden at the back. Very quirky spot and highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area.

name: Chez Nous Wat Ket
review_1_text: What a special, cozy place to enjoy an extraordinary treat and delicious food. We look forward to returning soon.  Everything on the menu looks so delicious.  The atmosphere here is like a warm hug and the food matches that perfectly. The staff are extremely sweet and welcoming.  We look foward to our next visit and recommend this to all who visit beautiful Chiang Mai üôè‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_2_text: Authentic French goodness in Chiang Mai; their croissants and quiche my faves. Beautiful cafe setting, indoor & outdoor seating .. with a friendly service team.
review_3_text:
Hidden gem in heart of Chiang Mai. The signature cuisine Spaghetti with salmon was highly recommended. The bakery shop and quiet restaurant were separated.
The great stuff Ms. Nanny answered all my questions not only menu but history and culture about Chiang Mai. I'll try to visit again next year.
review_4_text: Had an amazing breakfast here, everything was fresh, delicious, and beautifully served. The coffee was rich and perfectly made. The atmosphere is cozy, and the staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. Special thanks to Nani, she made my visit truly exceptional with her warmth and professionalism. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great start to the day!
review_5_text: Small but full of character it is the kind of coffee shop you‚Äôll wish you discovered sooner. Perfect brews, cool vibes, and seriously good pastries. It‚Äôs the spot where great coffee meets great style. Swing by, sip slow, and soak in the chill atmosphere. You‚Äôre gonna love it here!

name: Kilim Coffee House
review_1_text: A lovely Turkish-style coffee shop with a beautifully rich and bold coffee flavor. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, The shop is exceptionally clean and well maintained, which makes the visit even more pleasant. A wonderful spot for anyone who appreciates strong coffee, great ambiance, and attention to detail. Highly recommended:)
review_2_text:
A very nice getaway from the noontime sun after shopping in the Warorot Market.

Turkish style decorations. Both indoor air conditioning and open air seating. Nice coffee. And the boss is very friendly. Reasonable price.

Carpet everywhere. So please take off your shoes before entering.
review_3_text: I visited the place from a friend‚Äôs recommendation, mainly to try the Turkish coffee, and I‚Äôm so glad I did. The place gives a delightful reflection of Turkish culture, not just in the drinks but also in the decor, ambience and honestly feels like you‚Äôve stepped into another corner of the world. I‚Äôd happily recommend it to anyone looking for a caf√© with a unique and culturally rich vibe.
review_4_text: I was on the hunt for a good coffee spot and came across this cafe on Google Maps, so I decided to give it a try. The place had a charming Turkish theme, and the barista shared that he had just returned from Turkey. He even offered a Turkish snack to pair with our coffee, adding an authentic touch to the experience. The cafe has a relaxed, comfortable atmosphere, perfect for lingering and chatting for hours. Highly recommend checking it out!
review_5_text:
I recently visited an amazing authentic Arabic-style cafe located in the Chinese Market area. From the first steps inside, you feel as if you are transported to another world - a world of oriental fairy tales, comfort and tranquility.

The interior is thought out to the smallest detail.

I would especially like to note the third floor - this is a real oasis. A relaxing atmosphere reigns here, where you can slowly enjoy a cup of aromatic Masala tea served in an exquisite teapot. The spicy, rich taste of tea perfectly matches the overall harmony of this place.

If you are looking for a place to relax your soul, immerse yourself in oriental culture and have leisurely conversations - this cafe is definitely worth a visit! Special thanks to gpt chat for choosing the words

Remember about a problem with parking.

name: SINC Cafe‚Äô
review_1_text:
We were there for lunch and the food was delicious. We had a dey kahp soi and minced beef with rice. The price is good.
Only the man who served us seemed to be rather bothered than amused. He did not reply a lot when I asked something and just looked very bored.
review_2_text: Such a cool place!! Every single detail of their interior is so cute!! The food was tasty too ü•∞ I‚Äôd totally come again
review_3_text: Very interesting decor in this cafe. Lots of picture opportunities. Very English friendly with a mix of local and western foods. Their pizza was delicious and crust was crunchy, freshly made. Khao soi was flavorful and yummy as well. We enjoyed our food here very much. Nice place to chill
review_4_text: Very cool vibe, great lounge music, perfect to hangout. Good food. Coffee was average. Friendly staff.
review_5_text: A wonderful place with excellent food, great coffee, and warm, hospitable service. The decor is lovely.

name: Cub House chiangmai
review_1_text:
Bikes cool, aesthetic awesome just hit staff member having a terrible day, unresponsive to good morning (in thai), and other attempts at politeness.
But hey we all have those days
review_2_text:
Cub House Chiang Mai: A Monkey Lover's Paradise
If you're a Honda Monkey fan, Cub House Chiang Mai is a must-visit. This shop is a haven for Monkey enthusiasts, offering a wide range of bikes, accessories, and expert service. Plus, they serve delicious coffee and sell cool merchandise to complete your Monkey experience.
review_3_text: Amazing coffee strong and delicious, the place has a industrial feel and is so cub all around, seams like it does not belongs in this city, great air condition, very fast internet, people are friendly, seams to be a new place, it was literally empty with only alot of employees. Coffee machine a professional from Italy is my guess but everything so clean and neat. Quality selection of pastries. Have a cub dealership inside also.
review_4_text: This is one of my favorite spots in Chiang Mai for coffee and doing work. It is a showroom for Honda motorbikes with a coffee shop inside. The prices for coffee are some of the best in CM 30-55 bth. The coffee tastes excellent! There are tables, chairs, booths, couches, and even a conference table for seating. All seating spots have multiple outlets. They also have pastries and croissants. There is plenty of natural lighting and overhead lights as well. The toilets are super clean.
review_5_text: This is bike shop.for Cub bike lover. But also Good atmosphere for coffee. Large area, quiet, and good caffe.

name: Wake Up Coffee @ B2 Riverside Premier
review_1_text: Clutch coffee shop for overnight in Chiang Mai. Really is 24/7 with chill vibes inside. Only problem was wifi was down when I was there but It didnt bother me as I had stuff to work on offline. The wifi probably usually works too
review_2_text: A cozy place to stay while waiting for my hotel check-in. I arrived in Chiangmai at 5am and I needed to stay somewhere while waiting, good thing this 24 hrs cafe is along the way to my hotel. The staff speaks very well English and very accommodating. Their coffee is tasty and the vibe of the place is quite nice. Not too bright and not too dim. Not too cold either. Wifi available. Highly recommended.
review_3_text: I like this cafe because it's the only 24h cafe I found in Chiang Mai so far (but maybe there are others too). It offers wi-fi and tables with outlets, which is very convenient for working. The drinks are not very special, but they are good. And staff is very friendly and nice.
review_4_text: I came here a long time ago (a few years) while walking around and this time I wanted to stop in to get a coffee and wait before taking a bus to Bangkok, sadly they have gone cashless and I didn‚Äôt want to use my debit card and get an international charge so I had to leave. I remember before there were many people maybe students studying this time there was only one person. Maybe it was a bad time or maybe it‚Äôs not very popular spot. I like that it stays open 24/7 and that was also why i came here because I would need to stay past the typical coffee shop closing time of 6pm. I give it five stars because I didn‚Äôt want to rate low for something out of anyone‚Äôs control, I just felt like sharing that they are cashless now.
review_5_text: Poor quality food and drinks here, industrial grade food. No service, you have to pick your goods at the counter.

name: Coffee & Drink
review_1_text:
If you're near Warorot Market, this is a lovely spot for a cup of coffee (or two). It‚Äôs both a roaster and a cafe, so the quality is top-notch.

I really liked being able to choose between various roasts, and the prices are very reasonable for such a specialty feel.

The rustic decor gives the place a great vibe, and there‚Äôs even a massage and spa upstairs if you need a break from walking. Just a stone‚Äôs throw from the market, it‚Äôs the perfect pit stop to recharge.
review_2_text: Roaster and cafe. Good coffee. Good ambience. Next to Waroros market. Great stop in between. Prices good relative to tourist trap cafes (50 for capoucino). And you can choose the roast.
review_3_text: Great coffee‚Ä¶! Excellent price, and lovely being in the vibe of Wororos Market
review_4_text: Really good coffee ü©∑
review_5_text: Coolest shop ever

name: Homie Coffee
review_1_text: Great little hidden shop next to a parking lot with a lovely owner and propper coffee machine. I‚Äôve had a thai desert cake with thai tea filling  (25thb) and orange americano (45thb). Great way to start a day!
review_2_text: Sweet little coffee place. The lady is very sweet and speaks good english as well. She made a great cappuccino with oat milk. Best price/ quality in Chiang Mai :)
review_3_text:
The place is nice for a good chill and drink to recharge and refresh.
There are chairs and tables for you to sit and rest tired legs after walking around.
The host is very friendly and speak good English.
review_4_text: 10/10!! ü•∞ Such a heartwarming experience. The owner is such a nice, talkative and friendly lady. She‚Äôs so sweet and has very good coffee and drinks üôà You can talk to her and ask her anything. We‚Äôll definitely try to come one more time. Thank you, Gai !!
review_5_text: Best caramel macchiato I had here in Chiang Mai. It‚Äôs a bit hidden but definitely recommend to get a takeaway coffee here! Very kind service.

name: Maktub Coffee Roaster
review_1_text:
The coffee is wonderful and done very well no other than Mr. Ping.
The place is truly amazing.
review_2_text:
Spacious coffee shop with a beautiful balcony and windows.  The barista was super friendly and we enjoyed our drip coffee and latte. Both excellent.

We were confused at first about how to get to the second floor. Just go into the shop on the ground floor and you will see the stairs on your right in the back.
review_3_text: A hidden gem for a great coffee. Upstairs with street view if you like. Fantastic and friendly barista, perfect brew, relaxed vibes.
review_4_text: great coffee lovely cozy place
review_5_text: Finally found my new favorite cozy coffee shop here in Chiang Mai! The atmosphere is lovely, and their focus on specialty coffee really sets them apart. A must-visit for any coffee lover.ü•∞

name: 8oz COFFEE
review_1_text: While strolling through the Warorot market, I really wanted to drink Thai milk tea. I kept smelling the aroma of Thai tea, and only after smelling it closely did I realize that it was coming from a jewelry store. I thought it was very special, so I went in and bought coffee and Thai milk tea. I found it to be surprisingly delicious!

name: Heartening Coffee.Bar
review_1_text: Amazing drip coffee (had the Honduras whisky) and very relaxing atmosphere and friendly service. Highly recommend.
review_2_text: The owner is very friendly, the environment is comfortable and quiet, the drinks are of good quality. Highly recommended.
review_3_text: Gorgeous, tranquil coffee shop. Has really comfortable seats and relaxing music - really enjoyed reading by book here with a pot of peppermint tea. The woman working there was kind enough to refill it so I could have another pot. Really recommend this lovely place!
review_4_text: I spent a really relaxed and chilled out evening here. The owners are lovely people and very creative mixing drinks. Loved it and as a local will be back for sure.
review_5_text:
I feel  cozy and comfy in here.
Coffee is nice and atmospere is good.

name: Nomad Coffee
review_1_text: Calling all Adventurers, Travelers, Coffee Lovers and especially Cyclists: this place is a must visit for so many reasons, starting with the delicious, locally sourced coffee. The owner, Sawang, is a world cyclist ‚Äî he has ridden his bicycle all across Asia, South America, the USA and is now planning his next departure from Vancouver through Canada up to Alaska. He embodies the spirit of the traveler we all can relate to, but don‚Äôt take my word for it‚Äî go meet Sawang yourself. Also, he has 4 books out about his adventures on two wheels. Go for the coffee, stay for the owner‚Äôs stories. üåè ‚òïÔ∏è üìö üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
review_2_text: Fantastic locally grown and roasted beans. Freshly brewed in a cozy little cart by a super friendly owner. Great place to grab an espresso or iced americano. The scones are tasty as well!
review_3_text:
It‚Äôs part of the Michelin Street Food Tour, but I was just passing by when I saw a couple of people lining up for a cup of coffee/tea.
I tried the Iced Thai Milk tea, and I must say, it‚Äôs strong and refreshing.
review_4_text:
Was walking down the street to find a good coffee. I‚Äôm please that we stop on our way to the old town to nomad coffee.
The owner explained us where the coffee is from and we can see the quality of the equipment and the love he put in each brewüôè
review_5_text:
Best coffee in chiang Mai. Mr. Sawang makes it with a lot of love and passion and will also do a little chit chat with you, speaks really good English.
He also helped me find a room.

name: Kadluang Cafe & Roaster
review_1_text:
I honestly can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place. The coffee is consistently excellent, expertly roasted, beautifully brewed, and always fresh. On top of that, the prices are incredibly reasonable, especially for the quality you‚Äôre getting.

The staff are warm, welcoming, and genuinely care about every customer. Service is always fast, friendly, and professional, which makes every visit a pleasure.

And as if the caf√© wasn‚Äôt already amazing enough, the massage upstairs is fantastic. It‚Äôs clean, relaxing, and the therapists are highly skilled. It‚Äôs the perfect way to recharge after enjoying a great coffee.

I‚Äôve been here at least five times now, and I keep coming back for a reason. This place has become one of my absolute favorites. Great coffee, great value, great people, and a great atmosphere. Highly recommended to anyone in the area.
review_2_text:
Excellent selection of local beans, through different processes and roasts.

The light roasts from Chiang Mai are out of this world ‚úåÔ∏è
review_3_text: Such a great coffee shop with lovely atmosphere and very good service. Staff speaks excellent English and is so incredibly friendly and warm. Young people doing their work with love and passion. Very good coffee that they roast themselves, excellent cakes and sandwiches, and all this at very reasonable prices. Bought some of their beans and will be definitely back when in Chiang Mai again.
review_4_text:
first time in here. first time in Thailand üòä

coffee is great. affordable. vibe's good like you are in a not-so-urban place. subtle white noise coming from the vehicles passing by.

first time visit here, hopeful that there will be next ü•∞

hi, Chiang Mai (Moi)! üòÅ
review_5_text: Located near the flower market.  This coffee shop has a special second floor for chilling.   Good coffee. Car parking is difficult.  Good service.  Downstairs No Ac. Upstairs yes has AC.

name: BIG BLACK COFFEE
review_1_text:
The taste was delicious. The seller was very polite.
So cute!

name: Building A
review_1_text: A nice little caf√© inside the market. The atmosphere is cozy and local. There‚Äôs no air-conditioning, but it‚Äôs airy enough to sit and enjoy a drink. There are only a few tables, but the location is very convenient ‚Äî right by the market, easy to stop by after shopping or to grab some souvenirs. The coffee is really good!
review_2_text:
This coffee shop is so good! ‚òïÔ∏è The taste is amazing, prices are super reasonable, and the place has a cute minimal vibe with a small outdoor area. It can get a bit hot during the day, but in the late afternoon it‚Äôs perfect, great light, cozy atmosphere, and totally Instagram-worthy üì∏

Located right inside Kad Luang Market, Chiang Mai, it‚Äôs a must-try spot for coffee lovers. Don‚Äôt miss this one!! highly recommended! üíõ
review_3_text: After a little adventure following Google Maps through Chiangmai's narrow streets, we arrived at this charming coffee shop located in a small soi. *no parking car here
review_4_text: Coconut latte is absolutely amazing! Really nice coffee break in the market
review_5_text: Now that was an incredible coconut matcha ! üòç

name: 1M Coffee
review_1_text:
Whenever I come to Warorot Market, I usually park my bike in front of this place.
The breeze is cool, and the scent of Chinese herbal medicine drifts along with it.
I can drink coffee here, and I think, "I have a place to go back to. Nothing makes me happier."

name: Anyway Cafe (Book Cafe)
review_1_text:
Anyway Cafe is such a lovely caf√© and definitely one of my all-time favorites. ‚òïüìö
I highly recommend everyone to stop by. The location is great, and there are free books for you to enjoy while relaxing in the caf√©.
A perfect place to slow down and spend some quiet time. üí´
review_2_text: Such as a nice cozy and homey book cafe. There‚Äôre full of great translation books and thai fictions. And also lots of rotation workshops and activities that you might enjoyüíô
review_3_text:
I love the shop and they have cool books, both for sale and swapping!

The space is nice to sit and work! Thai milk tea is the best :-)
review_4_text:
An absolutely beautiful small cafe with a very local feel. A perfect place to come and get some work or admin done. I came here twice during my stay in Chiang Mai and both times had delicious drinks and friendly staff. Prices are quite decent as well.

They also hold workshops from time to time (they invited me to a flower arrangement workshop but I unfortunately couldn‚Äôt make it).

They have books for sale, books to swap and just books to read as well.
review_5_text: First thing I stumbled into in Chiang Mai and already the best place ever! Such a cute bookstore and caf√© with all the right values and nice people :))

name: Tanita Coffee House
review_1_text:
We discovered this wonderful family-run caf√© and ended up returning every day of our trip. The coffee is really excellent - you can tell they know what they are doing. The food menu is not huge, but everything is freshly made at home and tastes absolutely delicious. The prices are very fair too, which was a nice surprise.

One thing we really appreciated was the outdoor area. They have water humidifiers set up, which makes it comfortable to sit outside even when it's very hot.

If you are looking for a good caf√© with honest, home-cooked food and great coffee at reasonable prices, we definitely recommend this place. It is run by a lovely family and you can feel the care they put into everything.
review_2_text:
Tanita Coffee House is a true hidden gem in Chiang Mai! The moment you step into the compound, you're transported into a peaceful, traditional Lanna-style oasis. The coffee is excellent‚Äîthey use quality, local Arabica beans‚Äîand the Thai cuisine is delicious. It‚Äôs the perfect, relaxing escape from the city hustle, wrapped in beautiful old-world charm. Highly recommended for an authentic and tranquil coffee experience!

Plus point it's that there is a Thai antiques store located at the back of the coffee shop. Some really interesting pieces and owners are extremely friendly and happy to talk about the history of the items.
review_3_text: Tanita Coffee House is such a charming and peaceful spot tucked away in Chiang Mai. The traditional wooden house setting gives it a cozy, nostalgic vibe that feels instantly relaxing. Their coffee is smooth and well-made, and the whole place has a slow, calming atmosphere that makes you want to stay for hours. A perfect hideaway for anyone who loves quiet caf√©s with character.
review_4_text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. The place feels cozy and friendly, and the food came out fast. I ordered Pad Thai and it was delicious, full of flavor and perfectly cooked. The cappuccino was also really good.
review_5_text:
A Hidden Gem in Chiang Mai !

Staying at Tanita House has been a designer‚Äôs dream. Every morning felt special ‚Äî having breakfast in an antique furniture shop, surrounded by old timber homes full of character and charm.

The wooden houses are beautifully preserved, with rich teak textures and warm details. In the caf√©, vintage sewing machines are cleverly used as table bases ‚Äî playful, functional, and full of personality.

The food is clean, healthy, and homemade, and Aor and her family are incredibly warm and welcoming.

If you love thoughtful design and quiet, soulful stays, I‚Äôd highly recommend this place.

name: Roast8ry Coffee Flagship Store
review_1_text:
Santan Latte 100 ‡∏ø , Walking Fox latte art 200 ‡∏ø  (2025)

Has English menu, can accept card payment.

Seems very famous place as many local and younger generations.

Dim lighting inside with some house or lo-fi music, it is quite noisy to me.

The latte art is very nice, but I feel maybe I pay 200 ‡∏ø for the skill is not very necessary. I remember the cheapest options are also approaching 85 ‡∏ø for Americano or expresso.

there is electric charge port, and free water.

The place is a hip and vibing, maybe suitable for IG photos.

Good coffee also.

It is a little loud inside but there are seating area outside as well.

Maybe I am just too old for this cafe ü§£
review_2_text:
One of my favorite coffee stops in Chiang Mai. The coffee was absolutely amazing with a large variety of choices. Lots of people at this location so come on off peak hours if you want seats. There are seats inside and outside.

The music may be a little loud if you plan on doing work or studying. Absolute great experience overall.
review_3_text:
Another good cafe in Chiang Mai!
Roast8ry got another store close by, but this is their Flagship store which you can tell.
Its a very fancy design and unique vibe here.
The Staff is very friendly, kind and generous.
My only minus is: the price.
I got a Machiato for 95 baht, which is the size of a normal sized espresso.
Of course this is more a lifestyle product than a regular coffee, tho for that price their coffee should be tasting next level, not average.
But besides that, a very nice coffee i recommend to visit.
review_4_text: Roast8ry Flagship is clearly designed to showcase professional barista skills, with a menu full of award-winning options and distinct latte art patterns. I ordered a pour-over from their selection, which was served with a nice scientific presentation. While the shop executes the technical side and the service perfectly, the experience focuses heavily on the "performance" of coffee. A solid stop if you enjoy a modern, showroom-style cafe environment.
review_5_text: Wow! This coffee art is awesome and all (when can you say you got coffee from a world champion?) but my god was this just the most balanced latte I've ever had in my life.  Great smoothness, flavor, and ambiance. The one taking my order pretty much walked me through the whole menu when it looked like I was studying the darn thing taking so long to decide üòÄ.  They also have many different coffee experiences that I have yet to see in other places so it's not just your standard neighborhood coffee place and the prices reflect that. I couldn't care less, definitely coming back to try the rest.

name: Groon Bread & Brunch Cafe
review_1_text:
I had such a wonderful time here! I came yesterday because I wasn't feeling my best and really needed some good comfort food.

I ordered the bagel with scrambled eggs, chorizo, and parmesan. It was excellent and perfectly executed‚Äîthe cooking of the eggs was spot on, and the chorizo was high quality. I also had the Greek yogurt bowl with muesli, honey, and fruit, which was delicious.

The atmosphere is really nice, perfect for those looking to bring a laptop and work for a few hours. Even though the prices are on the higher end for Chiang Mai, it is absolutely worth it. You can really taste that it's homemade and top quality. I highly recommend it and can't wait to come back to try the rest of the menu!
review_2_text:
Absolutely wonderful place to grab brunch with a friend loved one.

The atmosphere is incredible on a crispy November morning in Chiang Mai.

Good: The shio pan was most notable - perfectly enjoyable. Everything else was decent!

So-so: as a matcha lover, I would skip buying from here, nothing to wow.

Bonus: pet-friendly outside seating
review_3_text: A perfect caf√© for breakfast or brunch. The menu offers a wide variety of options to choose from, such as bagels, sandwiches, pasta, coffee, and fresh juices. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and a ‚ÄúGood Morning‚Äù coffee ‚Äî both were very good. The staff is gentle, friendly, and welcoming üç™ü•É‚òï
review_4_text: Amazing little brunch place with the tastiest pesto I‚Äôve ever had, and √† Wonderful ice latte. Beautifully cooked egg and omelette. A little noisy maybe but over all worth a visit just for the pesto! üòÖ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: I like cream coffee very much. The coffee is very mellow and goes well with the coffee. The shop has a variety of menus to choose from. The atmosphere inside the shop is warm, the service staff is good and friendly. Anyone who likes sandwiches should not miss it because the shop bakes bread itself every day.

name: Third Place Coffee - Chiang Mai
review_1_text: The caf√© is very charming, with a lovely two-floor layout, and the coffee is excellent, making it a really enjoyable place to spend some time. The staff is also very friendly and nice.
review_2_text: We orders an Americano and a an iced cappuccino. Very tasty. The staff is friendly and work hard to make a good cup of coffee. The shop has free WiFi and plays relaxing piano jazz vibes.
review_3_text: This caf√© is a gem! The coffee is excellent, rich, and smooth, but the muffin really stole the show, fresh, soft, and full of chocolate. The cozy vibe makes it a perfect spot to relax or get some work done. Definitely a place I‚Äôll be coming back to!
review_4_text: Rather a small cafe. 2nd floor is like a small quiet space with only a few tables. They are open until 7pm, but 2nd floor is only open until 445pm. I got hot cappuccino and it was ok.
review_5_text: I Love this place!!  The lattes are fabulous, the service is exceptional.  I visit every day now that I am living not far away.  Sometimes I enjoy the atmosphere and sometimes I take it to go.  Always perfectly wonderful.  Highly recommend!!  I would call this First Place!!  üèÜ

name: Sonday
review_1_text:
The caf√© has a small and cozy space, with tables suitable for 2 to 3 people, making it more ideal for a quick stop rather than a long sit-down. They serve coffee only, if I‚Äôm not mistaken, which makes it a focused spot for coffee lovers.

The coffee is great for takeaway, and since we enjoy dirty coffee, we decided to give it a try. It was worth trying and didn‚Äôt disappoint.

Overall, it‚Äôs a nice spot to grab a good cup of coffee, especially if you‚Äôre nearby.
review_2_text: Fantastic coffee!!! This is a tiny shop with limited seating but great coffee for 60 THB. They sell a good variety of homemade, artisan cookies too- the chocolate chip and nut one I had was quite nice but not amazing.
review_3_text:
Easily the best Dirty Coffee I've had in Chiang Mai. They've got a special menu with different types of milk used in making dirty. I tried the first option with coconut cream and it was mind-blowingly smooth.

It's a cute little cafe with lovely decorations. But you'll probably not find a table there as there are only 3 of them.

I need to learn from them how they make their coffee.
review_4_text: The location is relatively small, but don't underestimate how tasty their coffees are. More specifically, their dirty lattes show a sense of creativity and innovation from their owners which isn't seen in many other cafes. I specifically liked the mango sticky rice dirty latte, but I'm sure the other ones would also be delicious.
review_5_text: At the barista‚Äôs recommendation, I tried the salted caramel iced coffee - it was delicious! I also snagged two of their cookies to go, and the lemon curd one I‚Äôve eaten so far is tart and yummy. They have a small cafe (maybe 3 tables) and small menu, but several unique flavors of homemade cookies like tiramisu, carrot cake, chocolate with marshmallow, and gooey macadamia nut. The cafe was cutely decorated with Valentine‚Äôs decor, as was my cup. A great spot to grab a drink on your way to CMU or Nimman!

name: Gatone's Burmese Food and Teashop
review_1_text:
I tried the ginger salad and mohinga, both were absolutely delicious. The ginger salad was fresh, crunchy, and perfectly balanced with a light tangy flavor that felt very authentic. The mohinga was comforting and flavorfulbthat reminded me of true Myanmar home-style cooking.

The restaurant has a simple, clean, and Burmese traditional tea shop style sitting area,  the service was friendly and welcoming. It‚Äôs a great place to enjoy real Burmese food in Chiang Mai, especially if you‚Äôre craving something traditional and satisfying. Highly recommended üá≤üá≤üçú
review_2_text: The fried ginger salad looks like an innocent mess but it‚Äôs sooo delicious! I also had the black bean steamed dumplings as dessert with the hot Chinese tea they serve for free - delicious. I‚Äôm vegetarian so I‚Äôm happy I found options here. At a great price and staff is so kind.
review_3_text: I love to eat here for breakfast and lunch. They do not have curry meals, but if you are missing the tea shop in Myanmar, this is the place for you. The food is good and clean, and I love the vibe in this restaurant. Myanmar green tea and water are free to drink here. You just need to grab one where you sit.
review_4_text:
Cute restaurant
Great food ,lot of variety
And tea is so rich and good
review_5_text: My 3rd time eating at Burmese restaurant in a week in this city after discovering I like Burmese food. This is not the best one so far, but it‚Äôs still very good. People at Burmese restaurants are much nicer than those at Thai restaurants somehow.

name: I Tim Baan Yaii - homemade ice cream
review_1_text: The cutest and absolutely delightful ice cream place. The flavor choices are unique enough to be fun to choose but familiar enough to make the right choices. I recommend the sundaes. Creamy and delicious. The interior and exterior are photo worthy.
review_2_text:
Cute place & good price I had Cocoa Bomb
was very yummy and not too sweet.
Love it! 2 big scoops in waffles 125-.
Only Matcha Biscoff +10baht (recommended) Btw, you can try it for free before ordering.
review_3_text:
Quaint cosy little shop with homemade ice cream and coffee/tea.
Ordered a chocolate strawberry ice cream which was really good.. not too sweet
They have flavors like yuzu sorbet, rum and raisins, choc bomb etc
review_4_text:
Homemade ice cream with a homely vibe. They've got a good selection of flavours, I tried their classic Thai Milk Tea flavour and really enjoyed it.

The portions of the ice cream scoop are also good and at a reasonable price. There's also free topping and sauces.

Ample indoor & outdoor space with WiFi & toilet. It could also be used as a space for coworking.
review_5_text: Amazing ice-cream, i ordered the rum raisin. The iced latte was soso though. Great vibes with clean environment, thoughtful decor and white themed design.

name: la.moon cold cafe (‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏®‡∏¥‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏±‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏¢‡πå)
review_1_text: Love coming here in the morning to have my first cup of coffee of the day. Cold brew with coconut flavor is the best! Never knew black coffee could taste so delicious.
review_2_text: The best ceremonial grade matcha latte I‚Äôve had in Chiang Mai! They call is premium matcha (they have two types) and it‚Äôs on the pricier side (155 thb) but I‚Äôd rather pay for good matcha than pay a lesser price for a not so good one. The umami taste is just perfect. Their recipe is on the sweeter side so ask for it to be less sweet or not at all if that‚Äôs what you prefer!
review_3_text: Nice modern cafe with good coffee and nice space with AC. The main thing here is the space that they have long tables with power outlets in the 2nd floor and it‚Äôs pretty optimized for working. Their lemon custard cake is pretty bad so you don‚Äôt want to get that though.
review_4_text:
Perfect for digital nomads. They have a lot of tables with outlets. Place is very quiet.

I tried their iced chocolate, it was good.

Staff are nice too!!
review_5_text:
- I live here for a long time but it‚Äôs it‚Äôs my first time to come here
- They have the second floor it‚Äôs really nice
- I tried that strawberry Matcha latte I think it is too sweet ‚Ä¶

name: Ateme 8me?
review_1_text: This small cafe is located in Soi Sirimangkala, which connects to Nimmanhaemin Road. There's an art school next to the cafe. The atmosphere is outdoors, but it can get hot during the day, so it's better to visit in the evening or morning. The coffee and other drinks are average, but the cakes are delicious and there's a wide variety to choose from. The prices are good and not expensive. There are plenty of tables available.
review_2_text: The cake was incredibly delicious and the price was great. The delivery was fast, within 10 minutes it was ready to eat. I'll definitely be back! üíìü´∂üèª
review_3_text: A small shop. It was quiet on a Sunday. The taste was okay. The price was moderate and suitable for the shop's atmosphere. You can park on the side of the road.
review_4_text: The shop is cute, the cakes look delicious, and the atmosphere is perfect. It's got everything!
review_5_text: Cute cake and cute priceü´∂üèª

name: Mingmitr Coffee
review_1_text: I tried the es yen and a chocolate danish, and I finished the coffee before I walked the remaining few minutes to CMU it was so good! The cafe is clean, modern, and spacious with free wifi and a water station. The indoor chairs are very comfortable, and there is also some outdoor seating. The staff were very kind and spoke great English. There was a decent variety of drinks and pastries on their menu. I walk past the cafe every day and only today finally decided to stop in - and I‚Äôm very glad I did!
review_2_text:
Mingmitr Coffee - Wonderful Drinks and Friendly Service

My group of 7 friends came here and we all loved our drinks! I tried the Hom La Mai Thai style coffee, and the staff were super helpful in adding some extra condensed milk to make it the perfect sweetness for my taste.

I also really enjoyed their clementine juice - it was delicious! And I have to say, I absolutely loved the store's decor and overall atmosphere. It had a really cozy, welcoming vibe.

Overall, a great experience at Mingmitr Coffee. The staff went above and beyond to customize the drinks to our liking, and the friendly service and nice environment made the visit even better. I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try if you're in the area!
review_3_text:
Edit: they renovated this place and now it's a comfy place to shelter from the heat or even work at.

I always get their signature Mingmitr iced coffee drink as it's quite decent.

In my last visit I felt like the staff could be friendlier though.

Small place, friendly service, great drinks.
review_4_text:
Super low prices (a latte and a croissant was ‡∏ø105), GREAT coffee, AC, good WiFi, plenty of seating, friendly service.  Hidden gem of a spot.
Highly recommend.
review_5_text: It seems to be a cafe that local people will grab a cup of coffee to start their day. I got a cup of iced Ming Mitr (65 thb) ‚Äî less sweet. It‚Äôs well balanced and mellow. Nice coffee and affordable price. 5 thb discount for personal cup. üòâ

name: Ombra Caffe Nimman
review_1_text:
The breakfast portions were huge! We had Ombra‚Äôs Breakfast and the Eggs Benedict with avocado cream, plus an add-on of hash browns. The hash browns were really good and nicely crispy. The avocado cream, however, was a bit too much for our liking, and it would have been nicer if it were served warm.

Overall, it‚Äôs a nice spot for a quiet breakfast. The space is also very large, making it suitable for bigger groups as well.
review_2_text:
2026.1.10 Sat

We just arrived in Nimman area today to check into our Airbnb and was directed to this cafe by the owner, as we were unable to do an early check-in before 3pm.

Hard pressed for time, we decided to catch our lunch here. The latte is excellent. Just a bit surprised to be served in paper cups for dine-in service. All the food we ate is excellent.

Love the ambience and love the quality of the food here !
review_3_text: Loved the new addition to our fav Ombra. The menu is the same. The space has different areas. Amazing for work, chitchat with a friend or having a peaceful escape. We would definitely come back. (The staff needs a better training. Maybe a minimum level of English)
review_4_text: Amazing brunch place! For the food, every piece in our breakfast dish was done perfectly; great flavor, and crisp texture indicating its freshness. The cool atmosphere with the outdoor greenery creates a chill place, perfect for coworking or to indulge in a good book.
review_5_text:
Lovely place and atmosphere. The staffs are super helpful and friendly.

The food and coffee also great as well.

I'm so happy with this shop. Strongly recommended.

name: Creativitea
review_1_text:
I recently booked to stay here for one month.  I left half way through my stay due to the way Amy regularly spoke to me in an aggressive and condescending way that was completely unprovoked, I couldn't even walk from my room to the door without her finding a reason to bereate me,  it was awful. I didn't even ask for a refund as I didn't want to deal with another of her outbursts.

It was very upsetting to see the way Amy treated her sweet staff, the staff members mentioned in the earlier reviews have all left.  When I stayed 4 new staff had just been hired, when I left 2 weeks later 2 had already quit, and I hadn't seen one other around so hopefully he got out too.

I wouldn't recommend staying here, every day is like walking on eggshells
review_2_text:
I had an amazing time at creativitea, the room was super spacious, cozy, quit, clean and the bed is very comfortable. Felt very welcomed by the staff and owner. They have free laundry service, which is amazing! Very worth the already good price :)

The area is the best in town in my opinion, super quiet but very close to everything and only 10min away from the airport.
review_3_text: Poor coffee, poor communication from staff. The place looks decent but one of the staff shouldn't have been working and taken a day off to rest when I visited as she behaved strangely.
review_4_text:
Such an amazing, creative space! It really lives up to the name ‚ò∫Ô∏èüë©üèº‚Äçüé®ü´ñ

Creativitea has all of my favorite things ‚Äî delicious tea and coffee, journals, stickers, washi tape, and even 3 adorable kittens!

The business owner Amy is a true gem üíé She‚Äôs incredibly sweet, welcoming, and tapped into the cultural pulse of Chiang Mai ‚Äî she knows all the coolest local spots and activities!

If you‚Äôre swinging by Creativitea as a launchpad to one of the group events Amy organizes, make sure to get there a few minutes early so you can grab a tea and browse her excellent selection of journals, stationery, art supplies, clothes, water bottles, knickknacks, and all sorts of whimsy!
review_5_text: The owner‚Äôs energy is extremely chaotic and aggressive.  I was chastised for unknowingly walking in the "members area", then after calmly expressing that I feel very uncomfortable she shouted "then you can leave!".  Her fear-based, oppressive leadership affects the atmosphere and her sweet staff, who were the only saving grace - kind, professional, and warm despite the tension.  Not a place I feel welcome or will return to.

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏ì‡∏∞‡πÅ‡∏û‡∏ó‡∏¢‡∏®‡∏≤‡∏™‡∏ï‡∏£‡πå ‡∏°‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏ó‡∏¢‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏±‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Amazon always offers good quality coffee and mostly can pay with cards. Prices are half the price compared to Starbucks
review_2_text: Good place to take some coffee
review_3_text: Green tea with honet and lime jelly is my favourite.
review_4_text: Cozy place to chill.
review_5_text: Good taste

name: Light Brown Coffee
review_1_text: More than expectation! the coffee is really really good and many choices of menu. Not too crowded which is good. My light roasted Americano made the day.
review_2_text: Definitely my favorite go to coffee shop, reasonable price. The location is perfect between my gym and office, a lot of parking space along the street in the morning. Their coffee will never fail you, selection of beans and milk alternatives. Banana bread and cheese cake are also available if you feel like a little more than just coffee.
review_3_text:
Tasty tasty black smooth coffee. No fuss cafe. Space for laptops, good lighting and also some seating out the front for a more social group.
Cash only and some good looking pastries and sweets available.
review_4_text: High quality matcha latte with oat milk. They are very friendly and chill atmosphere. Highly recommend!
review_5_text:
There‚Äôs quite a lot of seating available both indoors and outdoors for a small sized cafe but we wanted to takeaway our coffee anyway.

My girlfriend ordered an iced latte and although they didn‚Äôt have decaf, we were able to get just the single shot of espresso in our latte instead of 2 to 3 shots.

My gf said her latte tasted good so we will be back again.

65 baht for a latte - really fairly priced

name: Sol Haus
review_1_text: The best coffee ever! Absolutely love this place.  If you haven't been try it!! Lovely staff and delicious coffee and snacks, the iced latte and chocolate cookie is amazing ü§©
review_2_text:
A lovely hidden coffee shop with high quality coffee and cookies.
Great atmosphere and very friendly service.üôèüèºüíô
review_3_text: Arguably the best coffee I had in Chiang Mai. The interior is clean and cool, and the coffee has some personality to it. Staff werr friendly and accommodating to tourists
review_4_text: Sol haus ‚Äúhouse of the sun‚Äù new coffee shop in Chiangmai. Pet friendly, Great coffee and good vibes. Strongly recommended ‚ÄòDirty Coffee‚Äô and  caramel popcorn for non-coffee menu. üëçüèª
review_5_text:
Lovely little caf√© with excellent coffee.
Relaxed vibe and a really pleasant place to sit.

name: ‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏∞‡∏û‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß ‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏Å (‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏Å) - SDCoconut Smoothies SUANDOK
review_1_text:
Very good coconut-focused smoothie place with very friendly staff. Half of their huge menu items are coconut based so it's just a matter of mixing your favorite fruit(s) or drinks with ü••.

I've had several different mixes here and was not disappointed. Maybe not THE best place for fruit smoothie in town, but the coconut part is certainly good.
review_2_text:
We walked over from the Wat, needing something cool. We both had mixed Berry smoothies. Young lady making them was pleasant.  Mine with milk and yogurt was very good.  Walked back to the Wat and drank them while sitting on a shady bench
Recommended
review_3_text: The SD Coconut House in Chiang Mai is an absolute gem and the perfect oasis on a hot day. Whether you're strolling through the city or seeking a refreshing break, this spot delivers in every way. Their smoothies and coconut ice cream are simply divine‚Äîcreamy, flavorful, and sure to cool you down in the most delightful way. What makes it even more special is the kind and friendly staff who greet you with warmth and genuine hospitality, making you feel right at home. Don't miss a visit here; it's a must-stop for anyone wanting a delicious taste of refreshment in Chiang Mai!
review_4_text:
Coconut and Blue Pea ice cream
Very smooth and creamy taste. Not to be missed if you are in Chiangmai. There's are 3 outlets in Chiangmai.
review_5_text:
This place is very simple however has some of the best coffee in town. I would recommend espresso and coconut milk.
Staff are knowledgeable & friendly. I will be coming back to this coffee shop.

name: Later on | cafe and bar
review_1_text:
A charming and quiet place with seating both indoors and outdoors. The d√©cor is sweet, the staff is kind, and the desserts are good.

I didn‚Äôt personally love their signature drink, though.
review_2_text: Nice quiet cafe tuck in a corner of the rural street. Nice decor and lotsa drinks selection. Recommended if you have a lazy afternoon to read, work or chill.
review_3_text: The cafe is very cozy and a good place to take pictures. Staff was friendly and welcoming. The drinks had the right amount of sweetness and the baked goods were exceptional, especially the chocolate fudge cake. Best part, they have a parking lot.
review_4_text:
Friendly staff, good service(Accidently left 1 drink and the staff chase and brought to the villa where i'm staying(beside the shop), Nice deco, very Instagramable place of cos drinks are nice.
Should try out the ice mocha
review_5_text: Lovely and Cozy cafe! the croffle is my fav! the drinks are so good and the owner is so sweet. also there are parking spaces!! highly recommended

name: 39 Coffee House
review_1_text:
I'm a huge fan of this coffee shop. They offer drip coffee, reasonable prices, a variety of menu options, and friendly service.

The owner is welcoming, and there's even a counter seat available. My personal favorites are the Medium Roast hot Americano and their delicious sandwiches.
review_2_text: Very friendly staff. Good tasting coffee. I will return in a few days to taste the food
review_3_text: I enjoyed my americano very much.
review_4_text: Nice Coffee and friendly Service
review_5_text: I'm from Taiwan. There's only one stylist here. The shampoo and massage are very comfortable, and my hair is incredibly smooth afterwards. I recommend it.

name: R REE DOI ROOM
review_1_text: I enjoyed a great cup of coffee - a medium-roast Hot Americano for just 45 Baht. The atmosphere was perfect for relaxation, with a quiet and clean environment, plus air conditioning.
review_2_text:
A small but cozy restaurant. The shops decoration style is clean and cute. A nice place to chill out and enjoy your time.

They offer a variety of coffee beans both domestically and from aboard and offers light to dark roast. Small snacks are also available.

Opens daily from 7.30 a.m.
Roadside parking for cars. Small area parking for motorcycle.
review_3_text: The best coffee in Chiang Mai!!!! Highly recommend their dark roast beans! The es yen coffee tastes so great too! The vibe here is awesome! very demure very mindful ü§£Must try in ChiangMai!!
review_4_text: Nice little place with nice coffee and nice staff. Great to get my iced macchiato served in a real glass. No worries, to-go plastic cups are also available. Park on the street. They also do some cake and custard. Will try some next time.
review_5_text:
Cappuccino was delicious, temperature was spot on   Owner busy and still very friendly.
I was very happy to see the shop still alive and well after the great flood of 2024.   That same great coffee and friendly people   If you‚Äôre in the area well worth visiting

name: Take Me Home Ice Cream - Ping River
review_1_text:
Promotion Ice Cream Buffet (15-21 Sep 2025)

Both Cheesecakes flavor and Banoffee are great, cookie crumbs inside the ice creams make them more texture and enjoyable.
Holy Basil and Passion fruit Gochujung flavor are weird but good, a little bit spicy.
Worth for Calories
review_2_text:
We found this amazing Italian restaurant by chance, we needed a break from Thia food, we love this food, this place was incredible, the service was top notch as was the pasta and wine, we decided to finish with simple ice-cream, I was proven completely wrong the ice-creamer was totally full of passion and ran us perfectly through the complexity of all his wonderful flavours, what a great experience, thanks a million üôÇ
Yummo...
review_3_text: So good! Staff were welcoming, made suggestions and let us try many flavors. The flavors are unique and so quality!
review_4_text:
All the ice cream had such unique flavors ‚Äî I liked every single one!
And it turns out this place isn‚Äôt only about ice cream ‚Äî they‚Äôve got food as well!
review_5_text:
As an ice cream lover I have to say, it's very good.
Calamansi is my favorite.
Other than that, the place is nice, clean and staff very welcoming.

name: Pra-tuu Dang
review_1_text: A hidden jungle caf√© in Chiang Mai Old City . The traditional Lanna wooden houses give it a cozy, authentic vibe,surrounded by trees and nature.Live music and a bunch of cute cats hanging around. A nice place to sit back and enjoy a slow moment. ‚òïüåøüêæ
review_2_text: The most chill place for everyone in Chiang Mai, great coffee and smoothies, the kindest staff, many cute cats and such a beautiful garden and home to spend your time. Events happening sometimes. You can not miss it ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text:
Spot with spacious garden and many catsüôÇ
Recommended for a nice atmosphere and good coffee
review_4_text: Cute cafe with a garden, cats, and live music :)
review_5_text:
For cat lovers and those looking to relax in a green space - delicious coffee, cakes, and especially try the croffles, a cross between a croissant and a waffle! Incredible!
The kindness of the baristas adds to the charm of this architect-designed house set in a lush garden. Only good vibes!
Best secret cat caf√© in the heart of cnx üòª

name: All Time Coffee
review_1_text: Great espresso, really friendly staff. Perfect for a break when walking through the busy market hall
review_2_text:
Brilliant espresso, lovely staff

Great place to stop in the markets when you need to chill
review_3_text: Hot espresso...good
review_4_text: great!
review_5_text: Good coffee

name: Roastniyom Coffee - Wat Ket Hotel
review_1_text: we had a good time there. The owner was so kind and can speak english! He lets us choose how sweet and how much ice üßä I highly recommend honey lemon chewy, which tastes so good and is suited for this heat in thailand üáπüá≠ if we have a chance to come back to Chiang mai i would be back here üòç if you are a foreigner, just a heads up you can pay by only cash!
review_2_text: Good smell , taste. I recommend !!
review_3_text: Barely average coffee
review_4_text:
This cozy cafe is located on the way to Central Festival. I took shelter from the sudden downpour, and the coffee was delicious, and the air conditioning was cool, so I had a comfortable rest.

I vividly remember doing my laundry at the coin-operated laundromat across the street from my last visit to Chiang Mai üòÄ
review_5_text:
A coffee shop with delicious, standard flavors.

Great coffee, great atmosphere, spacious shop with cute furniture.

name: Ïö∞ Ïπ¥Ìéò
review_1_text:
This is a place that I give 100% to for its decor.
Every angle is stunning and beautiful. The lighting is beautiful.

All the staff are very helpful.
It's the best thing, everyone is so attentive, from the servers to the salespeople.

I arrived early just as the shop opened.
They were arranging flowers.
I love it! I love the smell of fresh flowers.

The food presentation is so beautiful.
Every dish is beautiful, really.
You can see that a lot of thought went into it.

It's so beautiful that it overpowers the taste of the food, lol.
Actually, the food is pretty good for a cafe.

The desserts and drinks are beautiful.
I love the photogenic Cetas Americano.

I love the tortilla and Caesar Chicken.
If the restaurant could take care of the smell from the refrigerator clinging to the vegetables,
this dish would be excellent.

This place is worth a visit.

name: Sinpinta coffee
review_1_text: I really don‚Äôt understand why there is no review. The coffee here is sooo good and i was touched by their smiles. Extra sweet and chilling flowers

name: ‡∏™‡∏°‡∏£ Cafe Chiangmai
review_1_text:
Very tasty and creative cakes.  We had two mochi cakes and a banoffee.  The cakes were beyond our expectation.

For coffee, I had a caramel biscuit coffee.   Very nice as well.

The icon of the restaurant, the Samorn family dogs.  Very cute and add a pet-friendly vibe to the cafe.
review_2_text: Such a cute cafe. I think the main entertainment is doggies. They are adorable, so well behaved and treated. I took Americano and mochi matcha cake. I like matcha, but I think the taste was super strong, so it was hard to finish a piece on my own. I would highly recommend to come and visit this cafe to cuddle with doggies. (And of course, they are pet-friendly)
review_3_text: so happy to see the sausage dogs running around!! sweet and friendly little ones and apparently you can even bring your own pet dog here! otherwise this place was a bit hard to find on grab but the lovely furry friends made up for the company
review_4_text: Amazing coffee with fun specialty flavors. They are decorated for Christmas and it looks unreal right now with snow and everything!! They have 3 gorgeous weiner dogs you can play with and the whole cafe is dauschand themed!! Amazing spot to hang out!
review_5_text:
First impression there: I love these 2 dogs!
They are very well known for their cake. And it is amazing. The drinks were on point and the cafe gives off a relaxing vibes. I would love to stay longer so if you are someone who enjoy sitting in cafe and working or chilling, this is the place.

Overall: Cake&drinks 8/10, Atmosphere 9/10 the interior are to my liking so +1, Staff 8/10 Super friendly, DOGS: 10000000/10

name: The Loft Cafe
review_1_text: Nice place, good service but espresso to milk ratio wasn't ideal. Hence our coffees were bland and diluted. Even for the hot caffe latte we ordered. Food is excellent on Tamarind side and will be back for the Khao Soi and Crispy Namtok Noodles.
review_2_text: The Loft Cafe in Chiang Mai is a gem! I absolutely loved the cool, industrial-chic atmosphere‚Äîit‚Äôs the perfect spot to relax or get some work done. The coffee is excellent, robust, and expertly made, and the pastries are delicious. The staff are friendly and the vibe is always chill and welcoming. Definitely a must-visit for a great cafe experience in Chiang Mai!
review_3_text: Chilled and relaxed serene coffee shop with great affordable food I had the chicken noodle soup for 50 chat and a frappe for 60bhat with crispy pork skin for 10baht. Great experience
review_4_text:
I love this caf√© a lot.
You can have breakfast, lunch, or brunch there until around 3:30‚Äì4:00 PM. The place feels like a combination of different shops.
You order everything at the caf√© first, then sit anywhere you like.

I didn‚Äôt see any air-conditioned indoor area, but the outdoor atmosphere was quite comfortable ‚Äî the weather was slightly rainy, and the space is surrounded by lots of greenery.

It‚Äôs also okay to do remote work upstairs for around 3‚Äì4 hours. It‚Äôs not crowded at all, which makes it even better.
Plus, there‚Äôs a separate and lovely gift shop where you can buy some Burmese traditional products.

Highly recommended if you enjoy a peaceful vibe.
review_5_text: A lovely cafe with quiet atmosphere, the coffee Latte is just ok, but the price is very cheap, so we can‚Äôt complain!

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏¢‡∏° ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏∏‡πà‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏Æ‡πÄ‡∏ï‡πá‡∏• Niyomcoffee
review_1_text:
Great vibe & Great coffee!

Had an iced mint latte that was pretty awesome. The happy vibe in this shop is what happens when a proprieter loves what they do and take pride in how they do it.

Here's the extra good, since it's easy to find a great cup of coffee in Chiang Mai. It's the happy vibe.

While being relatively small in size, the walls of windows make the space feel open, warm & inviting. It is a clean, well lighted place.

The seating design has two couches, two countertops, and four tables inside, and two tables under a covered awning for coffee in a garden.

The way the indoor seating is arranged, the comfortable padded seats and tabletop provide islands of privacy in an open space. It's very well thought out. The decor also changes slightly in each mini seating area to further amplify a feeling of separation and privacy in this open setting.

The decor is also funny, happy, and bright. Kids and the kid in you will be moved towards a relaxing mindset to maybe share conversations and coffee with a friend, or doom scroll in search of the end limits of the internet. In either case, this place will add to the happy mood of your activity.

Plenty of parking. Laundry mat across the street, and  Lotus Fresh next door, as well as a wine shop to grab a bottle for later.

10/10 Fantastic!

Im going back for more.
