review_2_text: Our favourite coffee shop of Thailand after visiting dozens of others across the country during our month stay. The man working here is a true obsessed barista, great attraction to details whilst creating his art. Atmosphere wonderful. We'll be back.
review_3_text: Just discovered Niyom Coffee in Chiang Mai and wow ü§© ‚Äî this place is such a vibe. The coffee is next-level (smooth, rich, and clearly brewed with love), and the caf√© itself has that perfect mix of cozy + minimal that makes you want to hang out all day. The baristas are super friendly and actually take the time to chat about the beans, which makes the whole experience feel personal. Definitely adding this to my ‚Äúmust return‚Äù list whenever I need good coffee and a chill spot. ‚òï‚ú®
review_4_text: I come here regularly. The coffee is well-balanced and satisfying. The staff provides good service. There is parking. The atmosphere in the shop is nice and inviting.
review_5_text: I ordered a latte and a cold Nestea Tea. The presentation was beautiful. The atmosphere is serene and quiet. Very beautiful little place. The prices are amazing. At least 20 - 40 Bht less than anywhere else I've been. Definitely a must for coffee lovers.

name: Black basic coffee
review_1_text:
I ordered the 'Dirty Coffee' becauae the place had 5star rating and I wanted to try something new.
I was asked to drink the whole glass in 3 gulps.
It was truely amazing,  coffee,  vibe and Thailand.
review_2_text: New location near airport plaza. Cool cafe just off the main road coffee made out of the back of a car with nice seating area. Tried the dark and medium roast both really good and good price 50baht. They have other coffee flavours and non coffee options too. Recommend this place üëçüèªowner is super friendly too!
review_3_text:
This small cafe is really cute.

Park on the roadside of the highway

It's really hardcore hahaha

The boss is also very cute and warm.
He should be a coffee lover.

The jars behind the coffee machine are good beans brands

I ordered Latte.

Use deep-roasted beans

Rich and mellow fragrance

Not bad, high score

I can try Americano next time when pass by.

It should not be bad.
review_4_text: Met this guy and his truck/coffee shop on the street and I must say! Best coffee in Thailand! Gotten a flat white and it was amazingly tasty!
review_5_text: There are a lot of coffee shops around this area that are nearer and indoors and we will still choose this coffee above them. Love the taste of the coffee : )

name: P&P Home Cafe
review_1_text: I have to say, I ordered coffee to try and was impressed with both the taste and the price. The atmosphere is relaxing and the service is friendly. They offer breakfast sets, drinks, and homemade baked goods, including apple pie, blueberry cheesecake, and chocolate cake, all delicious and at great prices. It was so good I couldn't resist ordering some to take home for my family to try! I highly recommend P&P Home Cafe; you won't be disappointed!
review_2_text: The atmosphere is great! It feels warm and welcoming, like visiting relatives. It's located in Chiang Mai city, near Maestro Hospital. ;)
review_3_text: I came here with 4 friends. The air conditioning is cool, the coffee is strong and flavorful, and the homemade bakery items are delicious. We'll definitely visit again next time.
review_4_text: Hidden World Coffee House is located in someone's back garden. It has ample space and air conditioning. The coffee and cakes are delicious. I spent a comfortable afternoon here and will definitely come back to try its savory food!

name: ‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ö‡πÅ‡∏Å‡∏•‡πâ‡∏°‡∏¢‡∏≤‡∏¢‡πÅ‡∏≠‡πä‡∏ß
review_1_text: The food was terrible, the noodles were the worst I've ever had. They were also smoking in the restaurant. It was awful. The price and the food quality don't match at all.
review_2_text: Good food, parking available, very cheap.
review_3_text: The food is delicious and very cheap.
review_4_text: The food is delicious and cheap. I'm delighted.
review_5_text: Very cheap, good beer, red banknotes with change.

name: Drink First Love Second
review_1_text: Good coffee. Car wash is awesome. Very friendly and detail very good.
review_2_text: A cozy little house, a quiet hostess, and delicious coffee. Enjoy a quiet afternoon while waiting for your car to be washed! P.S.: Both the coffee and the car wash are very cheap!
review_3_text:
A cute and cozy little shop with delicious orange coffee and pastries.
There's a car wash nearby, so you can sit and wait in the cool, comfortable shop.
üåûüè°üíñüåªüôÜüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü•∞üíï
review_4_text: Cute shop with a friendly atmosphere.
review_5_text: Good coffee and service

name: Cha Lum Dee - Sanpakhoi
review_1_text: Great little coffee stall tucked inside the business center. The ice americano is strong, smooth, and hits the spot every time. Friendly service and quick turnaround ‚Äî perfect for a workday caffeine fix. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: The price is friendly and the food is very delicious. ‚òïÔ∏è
review_3_text: Fresh milk yogurt smoothie, very delicious.
review_4_text: It's cheap and delicious too.

name: ‡∏Æ‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏Å‡πå‡∏ä‡∏≤ ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ ‡∏ó‡∏∏‡πà‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏Æ‡πÄ‡∏ï‡πá‡∏•
review_1_text: great drinks, good price and friendly staff, next to Lotus so lots of parking space
review_2_text: They offer a wide variety of drinks at affordable prices, and the taste is surprisingly good. Today I tried the Taiwanese brown sugar tea with pearls, and it was incredibly delicious. The tea was fragrant and the pearls were chewy.

name: ‡∏û‡∏µ‡πà‡πÄ‡∏•‡πá‡∏Å‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏î
review_1_text: Very good place to drink a good espresso or a thai coffee
review_2_text: The green tea is delicious.
review_3_text: The coffee is delicious, the Thai tea is also delicious, the price is not expensive.

name: Popo‚Äôs Cafe Chiangmai ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡πÅ‡∏°‡∏ß ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Coming here before my flight back. No entrance fee, yet the price of drink and food on the higher side which is I expected. The place quite cozy, the iced latte and toast are good. Caution for those who order food, watch out because the cats seems eyeing the food or water üòÇ Just, when i came in, there are strong cat pee odour. Overall, i think make a good choice came in here just before back to Bangkok. Might came back if going back to Chiang Mai again.
review_2_text: Cute cafe with adorable friendly cats. Clean and well loved.
review_3_text:
My favorite cat cafe! It‚Äôs very welcoming, the staff is so incredibly nice and friendly, the drinks are amazing and all the deserts are delicious! (my god, the nutella burnt cheesecake is to die forü§§)
But, most importantly, the cats are absolutely adorable, well taken care of, groomed and happy:)
Love love love coming hereü•∞ it‚Äôs my happy place!
review_4_text: A lovely small cat cafe, no entry fee, just order a drink is ok! Not many cats there, but everyone is cute!
review_5_text:
I sent my car for service at the Expat Auto and took a short walk down to this cosy Cafe with it's lovely people friendly cats. I ordered a cappuccino and lemon cheese cake which both were delicious. The owner of this small Cafe is a very friendly charming lady and this small Caf√© is a welcome feature in the area.
You find it by going down the Soi between Thai Prakan and the Alpine car electronics shop and opposite Expat Auto take the small Soi on the right and almost at the end of the Soi on the left side is Popo's Caf√©. Well worth a visit to cuddle with cute cats, but be careful, they might steal your cheese cake üòâ

name: Nine Nine Coffee Bar - ‡πÑ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡πå ‡πÑ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡πå ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà ‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå
review_1_text:
Real authentic arabica coffee with range of roasting levels: low/medium/high. All cups are served with double shots that will kick your alertness till sunset üòÇ. The shop is situated in the middle of Chiang Mai Business Park and they offer all varieties of beverages: hot/cold coffee, non-coffee, and pastries.

Price per cup starts from 40-45 THB.
Super cheap price for their good quality coffee.
Do give this place a chance to kickstart your day. My favorite here is peppermint latte ü•∞.
review_2_text: Very nice coffee with good prices and nice open windows. Couldn‚Äôt find yet in CM like this kinda cool coffee shops to work. I think after 5pm it turning into to bar. I visited in the rainy morning and enjoyed a lot. Definitely try their Americano with peach.
review_3_text: I really like the iced latte here. I've gotten it twice now and really enjoyed it. The atmosphere is nice. The place smells a bit strange, but I think it's possibly just paint smells.
review_4_text:
Price is  cheaper than others
I am very satisfied with coffee especially Cocoa The  location is near Payap university it's the best place ever
review_5_text: I was disappointed. It says it‚Äôs a coffee shop that‚Äôs open late, but when I got there, it‚Äôs actually more like a bar and they weren‚Äôt serving coffee at all. If you are going to be a bar, don‚Äôt advertise to be a coffee shop.

name: Not Just Coffee CNX
review_1_text: A lovely small cafe which is near Payap University, the food is not bad, the atmosphere is good! Will try the coffee there next time!
review_2_text:
Amazing food and nice service and atmosphere. We had Baked Spinach with Cheese, Mushroom Cream Soup, Waffle, Roti with extra spinach and cheese, Vietnamese Noodle Pho Bo (Beef), Strawberry Smoothie, Matcha Green Tea.
We can recommend all of it and will be back soon.

Update: As mentioned by the owner I ordered the special dish Roti with extra spinach and cheese again on our second visit. I really recommend it!
review_3_text:
I ordered Iced Vanilla Latte and it was just perfect - the right amount of coffee, milk, and vanilla flavor. The staff was super friendly and offered me a free taste of the Big Toast, which was pretty good too. But my absolute fave was the mixed fruit tart.

The place has a really cozy vibe and they offer free Wi-Fi, which is great if you need to catch up on work. They've got a bunch of food and drinks to choose from. All in all, a great spot to chill and hang out!
review_4_text: Vietnamese beef rice noodles....the soup is too salty. Beef is too hard and tough. Noodles are ready-made. Price 80 baht. Cafe Latte iced 70 baht.
review_5_text: The caf√© has a cozy atmosphere with delicious coffee and tasty food. The staff are friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. Prices are fair, and I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great spot to relax. üåü

name: ‡πÄ‡∏õ‡∏¥‡∏á‡∏ä‡∏°
review_1_text: Good coffee here, brewed in-house. There‚Äôs an open seating area next to the coffee shop
review_2_text: A mighty fine hot latte
review_3_text: The most reasonable price
review_4_text: Excellent! The coffee is almost specialty, a very high standard. The foam is thick, the beans are rich, not over-burnt, the Arabica has a smooth flavor and medium acidity. Great price, very tasty. The design is attractive and the atmosphere is pleasant, the price/quality ratio is 10 out of 10. I'll definitely be back while I'm in the area.
review_5_text: This small coffee shop is not far from Big C Extra. They sell inexpensive drinks and have customers all day. They also sell sandwiches and snacks. I recommend the caramel macchiato; it's less sweet and delicious!

name: Nine Nine Car Protection Center ‡∏®‡∏π‡∏ô‡∏¢‡πå‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏î‡∏ü‡∏¥‡∏•‡πå‡∏°‡πÉ‡∏™‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≠‡∏¢ ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ö‡πÅ‡∏Å‡πâ‡∏ß
review_1_text: Nine Nine was very helpful explaining the product and services. I was told to show up on Monday and it would take 4 hours to apply the Ceramic Coating 3 layer 10H+. When I came back at 12pm, the car looks stunning and had the shine coat all over. The inside was all clean without a speck of dust. I am very happy and will return for the follow up check after 6 months.  Good job Nine Nine!
review_2_text: Good car washing service Fast and clean, delicious coffee and croissants.
review_3_text: The best car wash , ceramic coating and film protect in Doi saket district. Amazing service and quality. There‚Äôs also a cafe right next to the car wash area. Which is very convenient. Great value for money for a good service.
review_4_text: Reasonably priced, did washing inside and outside and they did a good job for my car. Have a nice AC cafe for customers to wait while the car is getting clean. Will definitely visit again.
review_5_text: delicious coffee, pleasant and air-conditioned place and the greatest company of a dog üê∂

name: INTHANIN COFFEE SUPERHIGHWAY
review_1_text: An excellent example of a highway coffee shop.  Coffee service is quick and well presented.  Food is ok if you must.  They have a large selection of snacks as well.  There is a large and comfortable seating area with lounges.  Overall, better than average for this category.
review_2_text: A great place for good food and coffee which doubles as a coworking space. They have electrical plugs for your computer or to charge your phone. Very impressive coffee and other drinks plus you can have lunch. My new go to place for coffee and working on my digital art.
review_3_text: Clean coffee shop with large comfortable seating. Handy if getting petrol and needing a cool down. The only downside is lots of single use plastic, which is common really. I don't always carry a reusable cup with me (and during covid period many places don't allow this anyway).
review_4_text: Is a great place to hang out with friends and family, if you need a charging point, you can charge over here. The surroundings is very quiet and relaxing. A good place to relax and enjoy a cuppa in the morning.
review_5_text: Everything is good and reasonably priced. Staffs are polite and the restaurant is really clean. Menu are varied.

name: Coffee Jame Cafe in garden
review_1_text: Amazing place and full of positive energy! The dogs are adorable and very well looked after. They‚Äôre free to roam as they wish and quite happily come and sit on your feet if they want some attention. Please visit if you have the time üôè
review_2_text:
Super friendly, chill and client orientation. Food is very good quality and different side dish day by day - avocado/apple. Very cheap price, and food super quality. Premium salt/pepper/Tabasco, orange üçä juice.

I so happy to visit every day.
Thank you for the team of this place

Peace. Big hello from guy who ordering extra bread, 3 eggs and +2 ham + orange juice.
review_3_text: We come for the cat, but cats are off on Mon Wed and Fri, only two dogs here played with us. Coconut Americano was good. A quite place for cats and dog's lover, if you come on schedule.
review_4_text: Absolutely delicious! Coffee is great and foot as well. We had pancakes and rice with omelette. A cute little doggy gave as a warmly welcome as well as the owner.
review_5_text: Hidden gem. We went for some lunch and the service and food was fantastic. The staff were friendly. The seating is so cute and they have a little garden you can sit and eat in. I recommend the French toast and vanilla milk.

name: DESERVES coffee and espresso bar
review_1_text: Minimal, Barista and Reasonable Price. My Orange Americano is suitable between real orange Juice and middle roasted coffee from Lampang ( Near Chiangmai) that tastes like Cocoa, Butter, Honey and fruit. The price is reasonable, The Barista can mix the different ingredients balanced. Deserves coffee are recommended to all coffee lovers.
review_2_text: Nice small coffee shop with friendly and knowledgeable barista. There are various coffee beans to choose from with reasonable price.
review_3_text: Nice small coffee shop with knowledgeable and friendly baristas. Imported coffee beans are also available at your choice.
review_4_text: Very good coffee, quick stop to grab a cup coffee! A few seats available.
review_5_text: Good taste of latte.i use Google maps to find this small shop.latte was smooth and richÔºålike it hahaÔºÅ

name: ‡∏≠‡∏≠‡∏ô ‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏∞ ‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏¢‡πå ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏õ‡πà‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡πà‡∏á
review_1_text: The service was excellent! The seller was very nice.
review_2_text: The coffee is very delicious. The staff are very friendly. I will definitely come back and support you again.
review_3_text: The seller provided good service, and the matcha was delicious.
review_4_text: The coffee is fragrant, tastes good, and most importantly, the price is very reasonable.
review_5_text: The barista was very friendly and the coffee was delicious.

name: Soda Kriangkrai ‡πÇ‡∏ã‡∏î‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÑ‡∏Å‡∏£
review_1_text: ‚ÄúTaste good,feels good‚Äù
review_2_text: This craft soda is delicious! You have to try it! üòéüëç
review_3_text:
A cozy coffee shop with a warm, welcoming vibe. The coffee is consistently good, and the staff are friendly and easy to talk to. Definitely a spot you'll want to come back to. ‚òï‚ú®

The coffee and craft sodas are delicious in every glass. The owner has excellent coffee selection skills. Highly recommended! üôÜ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
review_4_text: Craft soda is refreshing and fragrant. I just tried it for the first time and really liked it. You should come and try it. The coffee is fragrant and looks very craft.
review_5_text: The latte is delicious and very creamy!

name: Sook Took Kaew
review_1_text: The best niche cafe

name: HI YOU COFFEE TEA ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏á‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏•‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏Å‡∏≤
review_1_text:
Great customer service.
Quick and easy / great value
review_2_text:
This is a small coffee shop right in front of the newly opened Lotus Go Fresh.
The staff was friendly and the place was clean and well-maintained.
I ordered an Orange Americano, medium roast, and it was clean and delicious.
I also received a coupon for a free drink with eight stamps.
I would definitely come back.

Just a small coffee shop right in front of the newly opened Lotus Go Fresh. The staff are friendly and the place is clean. I ordered an Orange Americano, medium roast, and it was smooth and tasty. I also got a stamp card‚Äî8 stamps = 1 free drink. Definitely would come back!
review_3_text: The coffee is fragrant, tastes good, and is reasonably priced. It's served quickly, and the staff provides good service.
review_4_text: Went to buy at 8:45 AM. The staff were not interested in selling. Called 3 times, busy looking at the phone, even though the sign said it opened at 7:00 AM. It might have been too early so they weren't ready to sell yet.
review_5_text: The coffee here uses stale and overroasted coffee beans. The coffee tastes terrible.

name: Basecamp Trail Cafe (Thailand)
review_1_text: The location is amazing and the area itself is very nice. The staff are friendly and helpful, but the Pad Thai was mostly just noodles, with almost no vegetables or tofu. The portion was also quite small, and since I was hoping for a proper breakfast, it wasn‚Äôt ideal for me. Coffee was okay.
review_2_text:
Great atmosphere chilling house vibes
Delicious smoothies and strong coffee!!!

Good weather.
Uphill location.

Amazing hiking starting off place. Parking spots available.
review_3_text:
Excellent selection of local Thai beans for sale or extraction.

I got V60 local light roast beans over ice, highly reccomend üëå
review_4_text:
There are two cute dogs in this coffee shop(Sometimes they are not in the shop).
I especially like the big brown dog named Taco (It sounds like "Takoyaki" or "Tako( which means octopus in Japanese)" )  because he is very charming and his behaviour and characteristics are really similar to these of my dog.
I took a lot of pictures of him : )
His is like "a beckoning dog" (the original one is a beckoning cat)  as he really made me want to come here.

Customers are also allowed to bring their own dogs so you may have a chance to see other cute dogs.
You can enjoy interacting with dogs without paying additional fee :) though sometimes their dogs are not in the shop.

Their Thai food tastes so good. I think their food has higher quality than other Thai food shops do.
I personally think Thai food is one of the best foods in the world ( though the country may not be the best for me to live in... I am sorry to say this. I still like Thailand as a tourist destination).
review_5_text:
Basecamp Coffee Club is a pleasant caf√© with a relaxed atmosphere, good coffee and tea, and several comfortable seating options. The outdoor terrace is especially nice and a good place to sit and unwind.

Inside, however, the air conditioning is very cold, so it‚Äôs not really a place to warm up. Prices are quite high, particularly for pastries, cakes, and cinnamon rolls, which feel rather expensive for the portions.

A plus point is the small courtyard with convenient parking for scooters and bicycles, as well as a sports shop next door and a small kiosk downstairs. Overall a nice stop for a drink, but noticeably pricey.

name: GEAR Caf√©
review_1_text: Nice food nice drinks nice vibes
review_2_text: Nice owner, quiet and perfect for work. Right in the forest, and wow the prices are perfect 30baht!
review_3_text: The atmosphere of the shop is great, cool and comfortable. It's located in the Faculty of Engineering, a good place to chill out.
review_4_text: It's a nice coffee shop with a pleasant atmosphere. I'll try their hand-drip coffee next time.
review_5_text: The atmosphere is good, not hot, you can sit and chill.

name: Pai Doi Coffee & Burger
review_1_text: Nice
review_2_text: Great and quiet place to chill after the long jog
review_3_text: Great Thai Tea! It is a super calm spot for a drink
review_4_text: Pretty spot to stop and have a mouth watering burger!
review_5_text: There are very few places in this world where you can get high quality hamburger with high quality coffee so lovely presentation and service with love for coffee and hambutger

name: BK Coffee House
review_1_text: Excellent Thai milk tea
review_2_text: Small cafe..great coffee..smoothies and other drinks are available..excellent service..excellent prices
review_3_text:
Small, very tidy shop with a high-quality espresso machine. They offer coffees, smoothies, and ice cream. You're welcome to bring food from the shop next door to your table. They also had vegan milk alternatives.

We had a delicious Americano and passionfruit smoothie and would definitely come back.
review_4_text: The drink shop here is pretty good. After buying my drinks, I went to the gift shop next door. It's small, but it has a lot of stuff, especially at very good prices. You can save a lot of money by just turning the corner. The owner is also very friendly.
review_5_text: Great places for a quick coffee before sightseeing :)

name: Coffee JEANS
review_1_text: Good coffee at a good price and a nice chill spot to relax and recharge after the climb.
review_2_text: üëçüèºüòäüòé
review_3_text: nice coffee, you can visit temple and then take a rest here.
review_4_text: Iced oat latte 10/10
review_5_text: Amazing cappuccino with amazing people, musician included

name: Raan Beem Coffee
review_1_text: Very delicious and cheap coffee. Nice staff. And they have OAT MILK üòç
review_2_text: Great fresh fruit shakes for low money on lower end of straits to Doi Suthep.
review_3_text: Simple place that serves nice drinks. We ordered a mango smoothie - yum! And and orange juice espresso. FUN!
review_4_text: We had a smoothie, an iced cappuccino and a super sweet mango. It's nice to sit there after visiting the wat
review_5_text: Amazing dragon fruit smoothie! Make sure you stop here if you‚Äôre close and thirsty!!! üôå

name: ‡∏Æ‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏¢ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà
review_1_text: A place where you can enjoy a cup of coffee while looking down from the entrance of Doi Suthep Temple~

name: Unknow Cafe Doisuthep
review_1_text: Good taste best coffee
review_2_text: Good taste best coffeeüòã
review_3_text: The smell of coffee mixed with friendship
review_4_text: Good atmosphere, good service, delicious coffee.
review_5_text: Delicious, good service

name: Sansuk cafe
review_1_text:
Late January 2026 We visited Sui Tep restaurant which was full and were accommodated at the fronting caf√© which seemed to be owned by the same establishment as they shared the same menu.

The cafe is a rustic and informal local restaurant servung traditional Northern Thailand cuisine and Thai drinks.

Service was quick and with ample serving sizes and affordable price range.

The curry is treated much like a soup in this area of the country.

Very ideal for quick eats during your visit to the nearby temple.  Generally Thai eateries will have plenty of spices but will be open to have less spicier versions.

name: Sowon - Cafe and Restaurant
review_1_text:
This is korean food restaurant, but also combine with cafe. I drink the tropical ade. It is Quiet & calm place to have a meal, mingle with friend, because they had some board gane. Also the room is soundproof from the sound of passing vehicles, so it's comfy for working online.

Facilities:
* üå¨Ô∏èAC
* üì≥Free wifi
* üé≤ Board game
* üí≥QRis payment (my BCA Indonesian is works)

üçπThey also offering FREE drinks, if you gave review. Want to get it, visit now‚ùó‚ùó‚ùó
review_2_text: Very cozy place with board games and warm sunlight. The menu is quite big as well and the price is very affordable. Was especially surprised by the portion of Kimbap , which turned out to be really big and made me full:) thank you!
review_3_text:
This is THE spot! Very authentic and yummy korean food üòã. Try the kimbap, Rice cake soup! The Rib stew is also good!

I'll definitely come back to this place for more :)
review_4_text: No card just cash or scan :( Came out to about 600 thb, which is a little under $20 usd. Extra star for no wait (only one other table there at the time) and food came out quickly.
review_5_text: Cute and clean cafe that serves Korean food and many types of drinks, there‚Äôs a wide range of menu to choose from too. Would like to come back to visit again!

name: One life Hostel
review_1_text:
Had the best stay here at One Life! A lovely social-but-not-party community feeling hostel!

‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è**I stayed in 9+ hostels in Old City over my 2 months in CNX - see my FAVS at the bottom**‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è

Owner Fabien does an excellent job of making you feel at home, I‚Äôm so impressed he greets everyone by name as they come in the door!

The rooms were great, single beds - not bunksüòç I love that the girls room had an on suite bathroom but the room was so spacious and the bathroom was far from the beds - just perfect!

Beds were cozy, with a huge comforter! Mattress was classic for an asian hostel- fine but not as plush as I am used to from home.

Great wifi, lobby/cafe to work from and free coffee / tea!

+Kawa the dog ü•∞üêï

Amazing - would highly recommend!

‚ÄºÔ∏èI stayed in 9+ hostels in Old City over my 2 months in CNX here are my 5 favs I would stay at again!
(Chill üòå & Party ish üçª & free brekkyüç≥)

üòåüó£Ô∏èüç≥Entaneer Poshtel (south)
üòåüç≥Common Hostel (NW)
üòåüó£Ô∏èOne Life Hostel (north)
üçªüó£Ô∏èIslander Chiang Mai (south)
üçªüçªüó£Ô∏èStamps (east)
review_2_text: Had a lovely 4 night stay at One Life, it was the perfect hostel for my travel style! It was social in the sense that everyone I met was very friendly, but it is not a party vibe so I could sleep peacefully at night. Always kept very clean, and the owners are helpful to arrange tours if you'd like. Kawa, the dog, comes with the owners to work most days to hang out in the lobby and is a perfect angel! She's friendly, but if you're wary of dogs she minds her own business. They also offer a same-day laundry service that is incredibly convenient and affordable. One life is on the same street as many other hostels, so you can find lots of other travelers if you'd like. Also right along the center square of town, and down the street from a 7-11.
review_3_text: This hostel is surrounded with so many things depending on what you want to do, if you want night life, chill night, if you want to book activities !!! The host is called Jenny and Fabien, they are lovely and will make sure you have the most comfortable stay, so far backpacking thailand they have been the best host we‚Äôve had, we came back after being in the south and stayed here again!! The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, shower and toilet is always clean which i think is one of the most important thing when you pick a hostel. if i visit thailand i will always always alwayssss give chiang mai a couple of days and stay here EVERY SINGLE TIME. (also they have the cutest dog ever called Kawa which is such a bonus ;)) Love u Kawa xox
review_4_text:
Probably the best hostel I've stayed in Thailand and my favourite one here too. Super clean and affordable, and they also have a drying area at the toilet for your clothes so that it doesn't stink the main sleeping area. The bed is really comfy, and even though the room can get cold, the duvet was so nice and thick enough that you definitely won't freeze at night.

The owners Jenny and Fabien are also super friendly and are willing to help you as long as you ask. Not to mention the hostel star Kawai (think that's how it's spelt) the Shiba who's really adorable and friendly too.

Really convenient location as well, with a night market just down the road and next to the old city. Not a party hostel, but still really social if you want to. Ended up having breakfast here at the cafe (which is also the reception area) every morning instead of going out even though it might be cheaper just because I could just sit there and people would appear for you to talk to.

Ended up extending my stay in Chiang Mai by 2 nights because I had a really good time here. I know many people who ended up also staying longer because they loved the hostel. Only downside is that it is almost always booked out for each day, so any extension, you would need to check with them early. Last minute extensions are almost impossible (although I was lucky because someone cancelled on the day I was supposed to check out). Jenny and Fabien also took us to the drag show on my first day, and they booked a whole songthaew for the hostel to fetch us over.

TLDR highly recommended hostel, good location, friendly staff, social but not party hostel, great vibes.
review_5_text:
I stayed at One Life Hostel and honestly, it was one of the best parts of my Chiang Mai trip. The hosts were incredibly friendly and welcoming, and they even have a super cute Shiba Inu (sorry, I forgot the name but she made my mornings!).

The rooms are unique and thoughtfully designed. They offer both private rooms and dorms, which is perfect depending on how you‚Äôre traveling. The common area is cozy and great for meeting other travelers, and they even provide free snacks and beverages which is a lovely touch.

Located in a great area with lots of restaurants and cafes nearby, it‚Äôs super convenient. I‚Äôll definitely be staying here again when I‚Äôm back in town!

name: A-Roon coffee
review_1_text:
Best coffee in Chang Mai without a doubt. Extraordinary service and perfect quality.
The basque cheesecake was surprisingly delicious.
The barista is a very nice and very polite young man.

Kop khun ka, my friendüôèüèºü´∂üèº
review_2_text: By far the best coffee in Chiang Mai so far. Espresso 40 baht is light, fruity, lemon, not bitter at all, made from Arabica beans of the family farm of the owner, a young guy. Don't go elsewhere, highly recommended.
review_3_text:
This guy is so cool
True coffee ‚òï lover
He made his own unique espresso machine
He blend his own coffee
And has is own beans ü´ò

We drank piccolo and a beautiful V60 delicious coffee from Nan province for 150 THB together
Nice low sitting, camping  üèïÔ∏è style.
Great spot for local experience
review_4_text: The owner is very friendly and warm.There are many coffee shops in Chiang Mai, but I highly recommend this coffee shop.The owner gave me my favorite cake as a gift.ü§≠Drinking coffee makes me feel happy.‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_5_text: This is the place for caffee lovers and all these people who want to try excellent caffee for just a fair and affordable price. The owner is a caffee enthusiast and every cup he makes it's really the real deal. It's a MUST when you are visiting Chiang Mai! Thank you for great cup of latte and the positive vibes in your great caffee shop! Appreciate it üôå

name: Red Panda Hostel & Cafe
review_1_text:
Red Panda Caf√© & Hostel is an absolute gem in Chiang Mai.

From the moment I arrived, the whole place felt incredibly warm, cozy, and welcoming ‚Äî the kind of hostel where you instantly feel at home. The atmosphere is calm and comfy, perfect for relaxing after exploring the city.

The staff and service are truly exquisite. Everyone is friendly, attentive, and genuinely cares about the guests. They even helped me organize transportation to Mon Jam, which made the trip completely stress-free and easy ‚Äî a huge plus!

The bedding deserves a special mention: the laundry was spotless, fresh, and super comfortable. It‚Äôs one of those small details that makes a big difference, and here it was done perfectly.

On top of all that, the caf√© is lovely and adds so much character to the hostel. Great vibes, great people, and great service all around.

I would 100% stay here again and highly recommend Red Panda Caf√© & Hostel to anyone looking for a cozy, friendly, and well-run place to stay in Chiang Mai.
review_2_text: Very lucky to stay in this nice hostel. The whole place is super modern and convenient. The bed is super clean and comfortable, the breakfast is awesome with many options, both the receptionists are helpful and nice, met some really nice people from different countries. If next time I come to Chiangmai, I would definitely stay in this place again.
review_3_text: This place is amazing! Chonnicha is such a bright, hard working, kind hearted woman (speaks multiply languages also). I have been coming back to this place again and again, because I am so happy with everything. Always clean, charming hostel. The breakfast you can chose and tastes amazing also. They pay attention to details and that everything goes perfectly. I think one if not the best hostel in Ching Mai. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to rest in a safe, clean, charming place.
review_4_text: 10/10 experience! The vibe was amazing, the beds were comfortable, and everything was clean. The free breakfast served daily was great! The staff went above and beyond to make me feel at home. A huge shoutout to P'Emma, P'Chonnicha, and P'Suthep for their professionalism and hospitalityüôåI‚Äôll definitely be back!
review_5_text: Highly recommended youth hostel! The place is tastefully decorated, absolutely gorgeous, and has such a vibrant vibe. It‚Äôs not just a hostel‚Äîit also doubles as a caf√©, and their coffee and drinks are truly delightful. The hostel itself is set in a lovely environment, with spotlessly clean shared bathrooms, incredibly soft beds, and a delicious breakfast. What‚Äôs more, the two female staff members are exceptionally warm, outstanding, and dedicated to serving every guest with care. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back again!

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Best staff in Chiang  Mai in any Amazon .I always friendly, I always start my day with a double espresso , luckily non of those cheap one coffee use free wi fi Nomads here‚Ä¶.
review_2_text: It's not a good workspace because there's a 1-hour limit on wifi. The air isn't that good either, perhaps because of the smell from the air conditioner, and the seats are uncomfortable.
review_3_text: You can pour the entire content of a regular cappuccino into a small cappuccino. A complete scam to make an extra 10 Bahts from customers.
review_4_text: I could smell moles‚Ä¶. Tables were very dirty‚Ä¶ view in front of a temple was good though
review_5_text: I love their hot americano ‚òïÔ∏è, staff is always professional , AC is great, good place to work too or cool down while on road trip

name: Kum Jan Cafe and Thai Dessert
review_1_text: Nice little coffee, good place for relaxing after some hours Chiang Mai. Good music in background, friendly stuff and important -> the air-conditioning is perfect - not to cold like Starbucks. So we spent arround 2h and it was very comfortable. The coffee shop is open for anybody, not only for the hotel guests opposite.
review_2_text:
Lovely chilled cafe, tasty drinks, delicious sandwiches. The owner and staff were super friendly we got a complementary brownie and snacks while hanging out in the front patio. Highly recommend ‚ò∫Ô∏è

While checking into the hotel you get a free drink ticket!
review_3_text: Love this place! The food is incredible tasty! It was the very first time someone taught me how to eat Thai food! The people are so lovely, I felt great here! I highly recommend you to come if you are in Chiang Mai!
review_4_text: Cute little place. Food was ok. The employees are nice, but they might have been a bit understaffed. Took a very long time to get the drinks we ordered. Food came out quick through. And more importantly they have AC
review_5_text: Very local to our hotel. Very friendly staff and the service was good. The menu is very varied and so able to eat all sorts.

name: ASMR Cafe & Wellness
review_1_text:
‡∏•‡∏≥! = delicious üòã

Must do cafe while in Chiang Mai!

Such a pleasant cafe to get the juices flowing... We ordered a Khao Soi which was the best we've ever had... also had a latte which tasted fantastic üòã

The atmosphere was great and the service was 10 out of 10. Prices are also great for what you get.

Highly recommended üëå

If you found this review helpful, please give me a thumbs up üëç (it's free!) and follow me for more honest reviews üôè ‚ù§Ô∏è üôå
review_2_text: Such a great spot! The massage was really good, and I loved the big complimentary bowl of soup ‚Äî the pineapple ginger pork rib soup and passionfruit tom yum were super yummy. The drinks tasted great too. I ordered the Khao Soi Kai and it had a small twist from the usual, subtle but interesting. Definitely worth checking out if you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai.
review_3_text: Of all the places I've been to eat and drink, this is probably my favorite. It is such a nice place, the atmosphere is pretty chill. But the thing is this place also has the best hot chocolate I've tried and they have options on how yoh want your hot cocoa. And the coffee they serve is also very good with different options as well. I get the americano every time i go to a new cafe and I can say it was one of my favourites of all time. The Khao Soi and the Ash Pepper Fried Chicken are also some of the must trys. If you're ever in Chiang Mai, you must definitely give this place a try.
review_4_text: ‚ÄúSuch a lovely find in this diverse food heaven. Authentic flavours made with heart. We tried the morning glory soup ‚Äî what a wonderful surprise! The duck egg added beautiful texture. The d√©cor is elegant, modern and stylish. It‚Äôs a pity we came so late. We‚Äôll definitely be back for the drinks.
review_5_text:
Wow, such an amazing and aesthetically pleasing cafe! I enjoyed working on my laptop here with an iced coffee and their fast wifi. I love that they give you a glass of complimentary ice water on arrival!! üòçüòçüòçüßä

Seriously one of my fave quiet working cafes in CNX!

name: The pool Cafe & swimming
review_1_text: Sunday afternoon and 5 pm . Pool I think closes at 7 pm today . What's not to love. Think the restaurant closes at 5pm so nothing ordered. Price was thb50 entrance. I see there is a sign for thb650 for a month which is a consideration for those staying for a long time.
review_2_text: Clean pool with big space and no one here !! Feel like my own place HAHAHA , 50 BHT  swim you can stay as long as you want. Also they selling coffee for good price.
review_3_text: Really cosy space with great coffee and drinks menu. Cafe has really nice chairs and tables to do some work at. 50baht swimming pool entrance and the area is great to relax in or swim laps. Quite deep one end and shallow on the other. There‚Äôs also a small swimming pool which is a safer option for young children.
review_4_text: A great swimming pool.  Only 50bht for as long as you like.  It has a shallow end but is very deep at the other end.  The perfect place to swim or sunbathe on a hot day.  They do have a small cafe.
review_5_text:
The pool water was so dirty, murky and GROSS!

Price and service were good but facility is old and not worth it if the water is unsanitary!!!

name: alga.cafe
review_1_text:
The cafe features stunning architecture and interior design with beautifully coordinated materials. It creates the ambiance of being in a cozy shelter‚Äîcool and inviting with a warm atmosphere. The wait was a bit long due to their meticulous preparation, but the coffee is delicious. The latte is exceptionally good and aromatic.
‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã
review_2_text: Passed by this cafe on my way to lunch. It‚Äôs air conditioned, empty and had a minimalist environment. Got a pear latte less sweet (thb85) to try, love how the coffee was pretty strong and not overpowered by the milk. The pear syrup also went nicely with the coffee, adding a hint of sweetness but not cloying. Highly recommend as a pit stop in the hot weather!
review_3_text:
A great little cafe just north of Chiang Mai's old city. Alga serves fantastic coffee and cakes. Staff are friendly and the decor is beautiful. From the outside the view of the cafe is stunning and this is matched by the design on the inside. Highly recommended!
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
review_4_text:
Cleanest bathroom in a cafe- Ever.
Free wifi, comfy seats (inside) and good coffee (had the oatmilk latte with dark roast which was was smooth and balanced).
review_5_text: We had pear latte, ice americano and banoffee. That was great. Lots of parking space, indoor and outdoor seating.

name: Speed Addict Society
review_1_text: Great coffee shop where they serve decent drip coffee 107 baht, it's also a Harley Davidson specialist, and though I'm not a motorbike fan, the whole atmosphere is great.
review_2_text: A motorcycle shop with a cafe, selling HD motorcycle accessories, with a lot of products. The motorcycle service is excellent, meticulous, and the prices are reasonable. All the staff are friendly. The coffee is excellent and the price is good. The shop is beautiful and the atmosphere is good. It is not a waste of time to stop by.
review_3_text: Good atmosphere for bikers. Hang out with friends. Also be a modified Harley shop in Chiangmai. Come to check it out. Good taste coffee. Lovely staffs including owner.
review_4_text: Absolutely love this place, great coffee, great price, pool table! Plus bikes bikes bikes
review_5_text: Great little place, friendly staff and good coffee.

name: Meeting Hotel & Coffee Chiang Mai
review_1_text: The staff from the coffee shop called ‚Äûse‚Äú is a very friendly woman! She does an awesome job!
review_2_text: Good location, near tourist attraction, food market, old city. Comfortable room and nice staffs.
review_3_text:
How unpleasant!

This is the first time I‚Äôve had such a dreadful experience before even stepping foot in a hotel. I booked through Airbnb, and everything seemed fine until a few days later, I got a message from the host saying there‚Äôd been a ‚Äúglitch‚Äù in their reservation system and asking me to cancel the booking. That alone is completely unacceptable for any hotel, but unfortunately, it doesn‚Äôt stop there.

When I went to check the cancellation terms, I saw it‚Äôs a strict no-refund policy. Now that‚Äôs where it starts to feel really dodgy. The host surely knows the policy, so why ask me to cancel instead of doing it from their end? Sounds very sketchy like a tactic to keep the money and turn around saying, ‚ÄúOh, the guest cancelled it!‚Äù

I‚Äôve now messaged them asking them to cancel, since they‚Äôre the ones backing out. and surprise, no reply yet. I know it might be early to judge, but honestly, the whole thing feels deliberate.
review_4_text:
The rooms are gorgeous. Very spacious, beautiful and clean! The location is good, not noisy at night. There were two showers‚ù§Ô∏è I really felt very comfortable. It was nice that shampoo and conditioner were prepared for guests, in beautiful, non-disposable jars, as it seemed to me, not the worst quality.
It should be noted that there is no 24-hour reception.
The problem with the room is the mosquitoes that bit at night. But judging by the fumigators, the owner is aware of this, only ours turned out to be empty. And the main problem is the old and very crushed mattress and very bad pillows, it is not comfortable to sleep.
If this problem is solved, this can become the best hotel in Chiang Mai)
review_5_text: The location is excellent, only 100 meters from Baixiang Gate. It is very convenient for dining and shopping nearby. It is only 150 meters away from Feng Feifei Pork Knuckle Rice. There is a 7-11 nearby. There are many places to eat and enjoy local cuisine. There is also a night market. The room is very clean, comfortable and warm. The service is very good. You can walk to the ancient city. It is very centrally located. Recommended

name: On The Way Cafe Chiang Mai (Chiang Mai Technical College Branch)
review_1_text:
2025:
Black Coconut 45 ‡∏ø , same price as last year.

Has English menu, friendly English speaking staff.

Very cool AC. Charging port available.

I do enjoy their black coconut, basically is fresh coconut water and a shot of espresso, I choose the dark roast so it taste both bitter and sweet, very refreshing drink. And a local delight.

2024:
35B for coffee and why you didn‚Äôt go in yet?

I ordered the promoted Black Coconut 45B, it‚Äôs fresh coconut water on a shot of espresso, Wow! How refreshing! Loving it.

Locals enjoy it! I enjoy it too. Has WiFi and charger big big plus!
review_2_text: Best 35baht coffee shop I‚Äôve found so far in Chiang Mai. Indoor with AC, nice clean black decor, and unlike most others I‚Äôve tried - light, medium and dark roasts available. I enjoyed the light roast quite a bit, more than usual for a 35baht coffee. Friendly service as well - only thing missing is a bathroom - but most other 35baht coffee spots are outdoor carts/kiosks, so you‚Äôre not gonna find one there either!
review_3_text:
Really awesome cafe, loved the whole vibe.
The all-black theme inside looks super clean and modern, and the atmosphere is perfect for a spot or to chill or getting some work done.

The coffee was genuinely great, and the service was friendly and quick.

Definitely a spot worth checking out in Chiang Mai.
review_4_text:
Review for On the Way Cafe, Chiang Mai

On a bright and sunny Sunday around noon, I found myself drawn to On the Way Cafe in Chiang Mai. The retro-inspired sign outside caught my eye, promising a unique experience within. As I entered, Sun Rai‚Äôs San Francisco Street was playing softly, adding a warm, nostalgic vibe to the sunny atmosphere. The upbeat melody reminded me of lazy Sunday mornings in a foggy coffee shop back in San Francisco‚Äîonly here, the sunlight streamed through the windows, casting a golden glow across the room.

The cafe itself has a cozy yet vibrant charm, with vintage touches that feel thoughtfully curated. It‚Äôs the perfect place to unwind, inviting you to sit back and take in the bright day outside while savoring something delicious.

I opted for their coconut coffee, intrigued by the blend of local flavors. It was fantastic‚Äîsmooth and creamy, with just the right hint of coconut that brought a refreshing twist without overpowering the coffee. The drink felt like a mini-vacation in itself, blending the comforting richness of coffee with a touch of tropical escape.

On the Way Cafe captures that ideal balance between nostalgia and novelty. Whether you‚Äôre reminiscing about foggy mornings in San Francisco or enjoying the sunny charm of Chiang Mai, this little gem provides a welcoming spot to pause, reflect, and savor the moment. It‚Äôs a must-visit for anyone looking to experience a taste of creativity and warmth on a beautiful, sunlit day in Chiang Mai.
review_5_text:
Decent matcha latte for 60 baht

But no drinking water ...

Many seats, cold AC.

name: PerSimmon Caf√©
review_1_text: Beautiful little coffee shop - very chill ambience and fantastic coffee along with yummy soft cookies.
review_2_text: What a gorgeous find in Chiang Mai! A stones throw from where I am staying. They serve delicious coffee and have a cat (perfect combo) also they sell local ground coffee so I can enjoy the coffee elsewhere too. Such a cute place really quirky and reminds me of home cafes.
review_3_text:
Laid back coffee shop with AC.  Nice coffee and good value.  Inside and outside seating
We had Lattes
review_4_text: Stumbled upon this hidden gem around the corner with coconut ice cream and a nostalgic & relaxed atmosphere üòé
review_5_text: My favorite coffee shop in the old city! Great coffee and lovely people working there‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: Phi SelectedTEA
review_1_text:
A hidden gem for exceptional matcha! üíö

Phi SelectedTEA is a small, beautifully run matcha spot and truly one of the most special places I discovered in Chiang Mai. It‚Äôs a hidden gem ‚Äî the kind of place you feel genuinely lucky to stumble upon, and absolutely worth seeking out.

The owner is incredibly friendly and generous with his knowledge. Having lived in Japan for many years, he brings a depth of experience that you can taste in every cup. You can try and compare different matcha varieties, all prepared with great care, intention and traditional technique. The quality is outstanding.

If you love matcha, or if you simply want to experience authentic Japanese tea in its purest form, this is a place you shouldn‚Äôt miss. A must-visit.
review_2_text:
From the moment I stepped into Phi Selected TEA, I knew I had discovered something special in Chiang Mai. The owner is genuinely passionate and deeply knowledgeable about tea, having lived for 20 years in Japan, he has returned with carefully selected, premium matcha and green teas from Japan, and it shows.

What truly sets this place apart is taking the time to sit and talk with him. He invites you to taste different grades and varieties of matcha, guiding you through flavours and textures so you can discover which one suits your personal palate best. It‚Äôs not just a drink, it‚Äôs an experience. I learned so much about how subtle differences in cultivation, processing and grade create meaningful distinctions in taste.

Yes, the prices are slightly above average but in my opinion they‚Äôre absolutely justified by the quality of the tea and the whole experience. The matcha here is the smoothest and most balanced I‚Äôve ever had no bitterness, just pure umami and sweetness.

If you‚Äôre a matcha lover (or even just curious about high-end Japanese tea), this place deserves a stop. Whether you want a quiet contemplative moment, a fun tasting journey or a meaningful souvenir of Chiang Mai, Phi Selected TEA ticks all the boxes.
review_3_text:
Amazing owner who opened this shop last November! I had such a great experience with my family. The quality is amazing and they have plenty of options.

I highly recommend for an authentic and lowkey experience. The owner is extremely kind - he designed the shop and additional goodies.

You can buy matcha powder here as well! They have some great options
review_4_text: It‚Äôs so good! Must visit! It‚Äôs the real deal. Love this place  this is real Matcha people, forget the Starbucks green thing you get the called Matcha -> this is Matcha real authentic from Japan! Can‚Äôt see this enough go to this place!
review_5_text: If you love drinking Matcha with passionate people, please come visit. The owner will explain and give you a lot of tips for matcha selection. Recommended.

name: Dr.Manny Cafe
review_1_text: Used as a restaurant, not stayed. Khao Tom ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏° was quite good for my stomach every morning. Coffice made me wake up. Took out Sandwich and yummy. You can be relaxed. Could charge mobile and laptop. Mosquito protection is essential.
review_2_text: We have eaten here several times while in Chiang Mai.  It is our favorite here! The prices are great; the Thai food is fabulous and fresh.  Wonderful coffees and fresh fruit shakes.  The staff is lovely and some understand English, quite well.
review_3_text: When simple local food is done so well and authentically, it is such a blessing. Pineapple fried rice, a common dish in Thailand, is yummy and cooked with good Jasmine rice and fresh ingredients. No hypster-ized decor or fancy fusion menu but what is presented on the table is so comforting to the appetite and the soul. Pairing that with a heaven-sent fresh coconut with tender flavourful flesh and refreshingly delicious water, this lunch of 130 baht is  a wonderful first meal in Chiang Mai. A very lucky chance encounter.
review_4_text:
I ate Fried rice chicken, it was super good. Big portion and delicious. People who is working there are really nice.
I will definitely come back.
Please if your are around here, just go there and try their food. You won't regret.
review_5_text:
This restaurante is new in Chiang Mai.

Me and my girlfriend we stayed 5 nights and the best restaurant around was this one!

I am super surprised, how good the food is and how clean and nice.

The owner is very polite!

10/10

name: Small Talk Coffee
review_1_text: Nice aromatic coffee made by a cool local boss. A perfect choice to start the day. Been there everyday during my trip.
review_2_text:
I lived on the opposite side of Chiang Mai‚Ä¶
Still, I rode here nine times just for one thing ‚Äî their coffee.

Rich. Aromatic. Organic beans brewed with real intention.
No hype. No shortcuts. Just pure quality that hits exactly right.

And the owner‚Ä¶
A truly kind, grounded woman.
Every time I stopped by, we ended up talking about life, the world, everything.
It felt less like a caf√© ‚Äî more like stepping into calm energy.

This place became my reset button.
My little sanctuary in the middle of the city.

If you want coffee that actually centers you, this is the place.

Small Talk Coffee ‚Äî where a man comes to breathe.
review_3_text:
Owner was constantly on phone but otherwise kind to us.

Had a mango smoothie (less sweet), and a mango yogurt smoothie normal sweet. Would definitely recommend a touch of sugar, otherwise the smoothie will come out a bit bland / watery tasting. But great price and thus a great value!
review_4_text:
First, I would like to say that the location and the owner were wonderful.  She is super nice.

I did the Google search, and I had to check it out.

I got a hot latte. Yes, I'm that person.  It looked wonderful.  The taste was almost too much milk and not enough coffee flavor. I even brought me some cookies for my afternoon coffee ‚òïÔ∏è üòã

I will come back and get a do over.  üëå
review_5_text: Great coffee. Super nice lady that speaks English and can help you find things you need around Chiang Mai. Her family owns the restaurant next door. Very good food.

name: Lady secret cafe
review_1_text:
Adorable cafe with green views and lovely staff.
We spend 250 baht and got a lucky stuffy.
Coffee is excellent too.
Worth the 4 floor climb.
Not wheelchair accessible.
review_2_text:
This place is truly a wonderful secret
Delicious drinks and yummy pastries
A nice cool and relaxing place to sit and enjoy some treats and time listening to local music while hiding away from the bustling city with a Birds Eye view of the activities below
review_3_text: This cafe has a charming, calm atmosphere‚Äîperfect for a quick coffee break or getting some work done. The cozy rooftop area is a great spot to relax, and there are plenty of seating options inside as well
review_4_text: If you walk into an abandoned warehouse looking thing and wonder if you‚Äôre going the right way ‚Äî you are! Once you‚Äôre up on the fourth floor, tasty drinks, a cool place to recharge, and WiFi await. Was a great place to stop when we had an hour to kill.
review_5_text: Super cute hidden gem on the edge of the old city. Views were immaculate and the coffee was delightful. Definitely recommend for a morning drink.

name: NOOK CAFExBAR
review_1_text: Fantastic breakfast plate. Fha and his staff are so friendly and go out of their way to make sure you‚Äôre happy. The kids had the waffles and pancakes. My husband and I had the yogurt muesli fruit bowl and avocado toast with latte‚Äôs. It did not disappoint!
review_2_text: This caf√© is located next to Premier Hostel, where I regularly stay. The hostel is very convenient and provides good service, and every time I stay there, I also visit this caf√©. Whether for work or meeting with friends, the service here is excellent, genuine and attentive to customers.
review_3_text:
Scale 1-10:
Food-8
Price-6
Service-8
Atmosphere-9
Cleanliness-9
review_4_text: The mango sticky rice, the watermelon juice and watermelon smoothie were all excellent ü§§
review_5_text: We order from here often because we live close by (dine in, takeaway, and delivery)and it's always pretty good. Unfortunately each time we order, something in our order is wrong or missing. (Missing sides, missing fruit, wrong preparation) Today I ordered hot coffee, but received an iced coffee. We've tried to call, but no answer and today we've left Facebook messages trying to fix the order, but no response. It's cheap so I understand and don't expect much, but it would be nice if we could contact someone when things are wrong. Thank you for having us üôè

name: One life Caf√©
review_1_text: Very good spot for breakfast. The atmosphere is chill and friendly with nice people from the hostel and super nice staff always up for a chat. There was an adorable dog when we were there. The coffee is good and the food is nice for a good price
review_2_text:
Must visit this cafe when you're in Chiang Mai. Its so clean and comfortable and social, the owners Jenny and Fabien are lovely too! Such a relaxing vibe. I had Yorkshire Tea and French Toast with Nutella and Banana, and it was AMAZING!
Kawa the dog topped it all off. SO cute!

P.s there is a hostel attached to the cafe, the best hostel I have stayed in so far on my trip.
review_3_text: Lovely little cafe I happened to come across for quick breakfast, the owners are very friendly, and they have the loveliest little dog! The French toast with fruit was so delicious and refreshing! I didn‚Äôt stay, but would definitely wish too if I return to chiang Mai!
review_4_text:
We had breakfast the last morning we stayed at the hostel and it was so freaking good! We ordered one iced latte and an iced mocca which was so so good and after that we had the French toast bacon which was also amazing for a really good priceüôà
Go check it out if you want to have a chill moment and if you want to meet new people or even talk with the owners, Jenny and Fabien who are amazing peopleüòá
review_5_text: Amazing food and drinks. Great atmosphere. The owners are so lovely, and their dog is so cute. I would recommend this place to anyone coming to Chiang Mai! 5‚≠êÔ∏è

name: Stan's Cafe
review_1_text: Stumbled on this cute little cafe and had a delicious iced coffee. Staff were so friendly! If you‚Äôre in the area, don‚Äôt miss out!
review_2_text: Amazing coffee and very friendly staff ‚ù§Ô∏èüôÇ
review_3_text: The smoothies and hot coffee are delicious. There's plenty of seating, and the staff are lovely.
review_4_text:
The drinks are delicious, the staff are kind and friendly, and the restrooms are clean and inviting.
The shop is right next to the restaurant.
review_5_text: The matcha latte was delicious, and the service was great. A perfect place to relax and chill.

name: Box‚Äã Coffee‚Äã ‡∏™‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏ò‡∏£‡∏£‡∏°
review_1_text: As one of many small street venues this is the best one so far i have found here in Chiang Mai. For the price you can choose three types of roast grade. The coffee tastes like real Arabica so for those who like Italian/Spanish taste of coffee that‚Äôs the spot. The lady behind counter is SUPER nice, smiley and that makes this place even greater. Besides coffee you have also other drinks.  Highly recommend!
review_2_text: Good coffee with affordable price. They let you choose the bean and the sweetness of your cofffee before making
review_3_text: I picked up americano and it was just ok. You can choose either medium or dark roast. I got medium, but it tasted like dark roast.
review_4_text: Delicious coffee (with a distorted art of my heart üíîüòÖ), welcoming barista with a beautiful smile üíê made a beautiful cup of coffee ‚òïüòã for a beautiful start of the day, thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏èüôè
review_5_text: good coffee for fair prices

name: Stan‚Äôs Cafe
review_1_text: Delicious coffee specialties, tasty croissants, and a very friendly team. Great store!

name: QUU HOTEL Chiang Mai
review_1_text:
‚∏ª

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Wonderful stay ‚Äî stylish, comfortable, and full of charm!

I‚Äôve stayed here twice and loved both visits. The first time was in a Junior Suite on the road side (room #302, if I remember correctly) ‚Äî super nice, spacious, crisp, and clean. This time I stayed two nights in a Deluxe Room (#203) and loved it just as much.

All the rooms I‚Äôve stayed in are beautifully designed and built with great attention to detail ‚Äî simple but elegant, high-quality, clean, and very comfortable. It feels like staying at a small boutique hotel somewhere in Europe, with lovely greenery and stylish d√©cor. I especially love the cool artworks from around the world displayed throughout the hotel.

The best part is enjoying breakfast early in the morning in the glass room overlooking the vibrant town ‚Äî watching locals jogging by the old town moat of Chiang Mai. The hotel‚Äôs location is perfect too, just 5‚Äì10 minutes from all the nice spots and restaurants.
review_2_text:
Close to Old Town and a 7/11.
Rooms were clean and felt "new".
Good AC and a SMART TV!
No noise from nearby traffic at all.
Friendly staff, could communicate easily in English.
Very good price/quality ratio.
Would absolutely recommend or stay here again.
review_3_text: Love this hotel. Great for everyone‚Äîsolo, couple, friends or family. Very clean, comfortable, good vibes, safe, delicious breakfast. We will be back and highly recommend!
review_4_text:
I booked a stay at Quu Hotel Chiang Mai from 22nd July to 24th July (2 nights), and unfortunately, our experience was extremely disappointing from the moment we arrived. There was no greeting or assistance from the staff, and we had to rely on our Grab driver to carry our heavy luggage in pouring rain. No one helped open the hotel door, and my wife even suffered a minor hand injury due to the heavy door.

Check-in itself went smoothly, and the room mostly matched the booking website photos, though some angles of the room and bathroom were missing. However, there was no standing shower, only a bathtub, which was inconvenient. The room was also very dusty, and we had to use our own wipes just to make it acceptable.

After discussing with my wife, we decided not to stay and requested a partial refund for one night. The staff directed us to Agoda, who told us that the hotel had to approve it. Despite our clear explanation, the hotel rejected our request and falsely claimed that they had offered us a room change, which never happened.

This hotel is unprofessional, unhelpful, and dishonest. I strongly advise against booking here, save yourself the frustration and disappointment.
review_5_text: Everything here was amazing! For a great price , you get a modern and fresh room, free room cleaning every day, a great location across the street from the old city, great service, and a filling and delicious breakfast.

name: Riflesso Artisan Gelato
review_1_text:
The best ice cream in Chiang Mai!
Super creamy, rich flavors, and made with very fresh ingredients. You can really taste the quality and attention to detail. Great variety of unique flavors, friendly staff, and a relaxed atmosphere. A must-visit for all ice cream lovers ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be back! üç¶üòÑ
review_2_text: Giving this place 3 stars. The gelato tasted good, no complaints about the flavor, but it was nothing extraordinary to justify the price. I understand they use imported ingredients and I am not saying they should not charge premium prices, but 100 THB for such a small scoop feels a bit too much. It is decent ice cream, just not something that makes me want to come back again.
review_3_text:
Lovely little place with very tasty and refreshing gelato, perfect to cool down on yet another hot day!
The Chocomint was very mibty which I loved. Not so easy to find good icecream places in the city, so finding Riflesso was a wonderful surprise. I now know where to stop for an gelato icecream break when in the old city.
review_4_text: We taste tested all of their vegan flavors and finally decided on the pistachio and chocolate ones. So good & so creamy! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: Tried their Pistachio Vegan and Dubai Chocolate ‚Äî both were smooth, creamy, and a little sweet. The Pistachio had a rich, I personally prefer their Vegan version compared to the one with milk, nutty flavor that tasted authentic, not artificial. The Dubai Chocolate was deep and indulgent, with a hint of luxury cocoa and Kunafa. Perfect combo if you like balanced sweetness and real flavor!

name: mew.coffee.craft
review_1_text:
Chanced upon this cool quirky cafe with sleepy cat, cosy vibe, chill
music and friendly owner. Nicely located just opposite old town away from the crowd and noise.
review_2_text: The caf√© is small but cozy, with good service. I ordered a hot latte, which was a bit too milky for my taste, but I still enjoyed it!
review_3_text: Lovely cafe! They serve amazing coffe, according to ur liking. We ordered two hot lattes and they were really affordable. The staff was so nice and the sweet cat was also a huge plus! I definitely recommend getting a coffee here!
review_4_text: I had a couple of beers here one night when there were some folks singing on acoustic guitar, was a cool night but they need to work on the sound.
review_5_text: Great place for a hip night out, indie alternative lovers this is the spot! Great staff and good beer options! Coming back again for sure ‚úåüèΩ

name: The Highlandner
review_1_text: Absolutely amazing service. I needed to get new gear for trail running - they were very helpful in selecting the right hydration pack and other essentials. I highly, highly recommend runners to stock up on equipment here and to bring all your questions. Great service!
review_2_text: Made for endurance junkies like myself. Terrific curated quality products for mountain and adventure sports. Can refuel with healthy energy bars for next leg of Northern Thailand bike tour of over 2,000 km. Terrific coffee and music to boot. Solid place and good vibes.
review_3_text: Wow impressive store I didn't even know was here. They seem to focus on running. But have biking and swimming stuff too. Everything is high quality so don't expect cheap prices. But very well stocked and knowledgeable English speaking staff.
review_4_text: Not open on Saturday when you say you are. Same experience at CMU store.  Please update the info
review_5_text: Very solid trail running store. Friendly staff and great selection.

name: IN TOWN Cafe
review_1_text: Our 2nd time visiting this location. The service is wonderful everyone is so friendly, the food is yummy especially the croffle and the chicken fried rice, so flavorful. They offer both Thai and western food and the prices are competitive. We will definitely be back. ü•≥ü•≥
review_2_text:
Cute little cafe with great food and drinks! Situated right in front of the Le Canal Boutique Hotel.

Menu has many creative options for breakfast and lunch, including Thai selections. Fruit and waffle portion was large, easily enough to fill anyone. Presentation was superb, with high quality ingredients and very fresh.

Service was attentive, warm, and friendly. Food came out within 10 minutes, everything made to order. Atmosphere is warm and serene.
review_3_text: I love this little cafe and their staff so much! The food is great, perfect portion sizes (in my opinion) very well priced and the coffee is good! Always have a good playlist on (mostly smooth jazz from memory) as well, which I appreciate - especially seeing as it‚Äôs next to the road by the river.
review_4_text: We‚Äôve been to this cafe several times. The service is wonderful, and the food and coffee are great. In addition to the Thai omelette, we‚Äôve had the fruit and yogurt bowl, mango sticky rice, coconut toast, and croffles (crepe waffle) and we‚Äôve loved it all. The cafe is mostly outdoors. It is noisy due to being next to the road.
review_5_text: Came here once before and tried the coconut waffle with banana and it was beyond delicious! This is my second time here and I tried the scrambled eggs set with the honey toast with chocolate ice cream and once again they exceeded my expectations! The people here went above and beyond to help me and made me feel right at home. I definitely recommend the cafe is actually very nice and welcoming.

name: ‡∏ï‡∏∏‡πâ‡∏¢‡∏ï‡πä‡∏∞‡πÇ‡∏ï ‡∏Ç‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏ô ‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏ô
review_1_text:
the atmosphere makes me feel like at home
foods are very good
must try when you are in Chiang Mai ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: This place is SOOOO good!! Not far from the old city and totally worth it to pop over for a light sweet treat!!! Go go go!!!
review_3_text: Very nice and stylish place. We tried the coffee drinks, soda and desert and all was very good. Try the shortbread, it was amazing. Very pleasant!
review_4_text: The jelly in sweet syrup and plum juice is delicious and refreshing. The Taiwanese-style pies are also very tasty. Everything tastes great and is priced at 40 baht each. The shop is cute, clean, and comfortable.
review_5_text:
This is a small shop, but the desserts here are delicious. There aren't many options, only about 4-5 kinds, but they are all delicious. They are refreshing and tasty, and the prices are not expensive.

name: Baan Borijinda (‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏à‡∏¥‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≤)
review_1_text: Cutest coffee shop with the best coffee in Chiang Mai. Small tranquil place where you can relax and drink excellent coffee. They offer oat milk and are very welcoming. Nicest and cleanest bathroom I have seen in a while. Will definitely come back when in Chiang Mai!
review_2_text: One of the best cups of coffee I've had in Chiang Mai. This city has so many great coffee shops, but Baan Borijinda stands out for quality and flavor. Really nice Americano here, definitely worth the visit if you love coffee. Good prices too and the shop itself is very cozy. Will definitely return!
review_3_text: Cosiest little coffee spot. The ice came as a large spherical ice ball which was a first for me. Delicious iced americano. Highly recommend. Cheers
review_4_text:
I tried the Iced Thai Tea and it was incredible ‚Äî super refreshing and full of flavor. I‚Äôll definitely come back for more!
By the way, I run a travel agency in Cusco, Peru: @dopkertravel ‚úàÔ∏èüáµüá™
review_5_text:
We walked passed to head for breakfast and loved the wood house so we made our way back here after our meal to grab an organic coffee.

Ice cappuccino was good.

They have 3 villas here too which you can see via QR from pics below or via Airbnb.

name: Kanoon Cafe & Bistro
review_1_text: When in Chiang Mai, this hidden gem is a must-visit. Their matcha coconut drink is incredibly delicious ‚Äì it'll make your taste buds explode! The place is adorable, the food is amazing, don't miss it! Very Enjoy!
review_2_text: Kanoon Cafe & Bistro is a gem! I visited around 5 pm, and even though they closed at 5:30, they were incredibly accommodating, letting us enjoy our meal in a relaxing environment until 6 pm. The mixed juice was incredibly tasty, and the mixed fruit waffle was simply yummy. The environment is so cozy, making it a perfect spot to unwind.  The best part? It's Halal! They offer a fantastic selection of dishes, including beef, chicken, Khao Soi, and curries. The staff was friendly and attentive, adding to the overall positive experience.  If you're looking for a delicious meal in a welcoming atmosphere, Kanoon Cafe & Bistro is a must-visit. Highly recommended!
review_3_text: Clean restaurant that serves amazing food. Best meat skewer I had in Thailand by far. Halal and friendly staff
review_4_text: Really enjoy the vibe.. so serene..the food also delicious.. and the service .. üëçüèªthe best..
review_5_text: A beautiful with relaxing ambience cafe. Filled with greenery and colourful flowers. Nice coffee.

name: Burkta Wiang Kaew
review_1_text: I order hot pure matcha and enjoy nice atmosphere.
review_2_text: I tried their signature drink for 75thb and it was good. Their americano was also very good. The store itself is small, but they have a large nice garden right in front of it. The bathroom here is also very clean. It‚Äôs a nice spot to chill overall.
review_3_text: Located in the back part of the courtyard, this is a lovely coffee spot. In the same courtyard there is a cafe and coworking space. There is plenty of shaded seating as well.
review_4_text:
Good coffe, thai tea and a nice environment to relax.

There is also a coworking and two other places to order some food.

The price is a little above average but the quality is worth it.
review_5_text: Arguably the best espresso in CM. Plus point was the green lush outdoor seatings, spacious and away from the hustles.

name: Wabi Sabi Coffee
review_1_text: The quality of coffee was just expected, but the price was super affordable. Besides, they have 2 adorable cats here!
review_2_text:
Simple place & Quick service
Good coffee and matcha
There are Really 2 lovely cats so cute
review_3_text:
Wow!!!....shop 3.
Closer to home
Great coffee made to order.
review_4_text: Work-friendly ‚Ä¢ Free Wi-Fi ‚Ä¢ Power outlets ‚Ä¢Great coffee ü§éü§çü§éü§çü§éü§ç
review_5_text: Good place for a break.

name: mountain view cafe Chiangmai
review_1_text: Great place to sit, work and enjoy a meal! The space is small but has great wifi so I was able to work on my laptop for a few hours. Eggs and toast were 89 baht, good but as is common in asia they were too sweet (I think its the butter??) the 100 baht small fruit plate was great! I‚Äôm sure they rotate but today came with pineapple, watermelon and mango üòç
review_2_text: We loved this place for our morning breakfast. Decent price, food was tasty and we enjoyed quite a lot the banana pancake. The patio is quite and lovely for a relaxing breakfast.
review_3_text:
What a cute and cozy cafe! Very nice staff, good sandwiches, decent cappuccino.
They also have a few handmade jewelry for same and some souvenirs made from an ngo helping women who went thru abuse. I actually bought a necklace as it was very nice and well made.
Give this place a visit. üòÅ

üôãüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è My travel tips & recommendations on insta: deea_journey
review_4_text:
This is a great cafe on Chang Pheuk gate of the walled old city of Chiang Mai. It has a lovely outdoor seating overlooking the busy road and moat and Chang Pheuk gate as well as a great garden outdoor seating behind the guest house (yes they also run a lovely guest house). Indoor air conditioned seating is there too.

Food is good, from breakfast to main course meals - both Thai and western. Coffee is good too.

Best asset is the staff of Mountain View. Very helpful and warm and hospitable,

Lovely maintained plants and water fountains
review_5_text: A cool small cafe on the opposite to chiang phuak market on the main Street. The food is great, usually there is no waiting. It's work friendly cafe, you can also meet other tourists. WiFi and water is free. Closes on 6 pm and sometimes 5 pm.

name: ON THE WAY CAFE @ Jang Sri Poom
review_1_text:
Stepping into On the Way Cafe @ Jan Sri Poom was an absolute delight. It quickly became my favorite Chiang Mai stop. I was immediately struck by the truly calming atmosphere. The interior design thoughtfully uses soft, warm lighting, natural wood tones, and lush greenery, creating a peaceful escape from the city bustle. It‚Äôs the perfect environment whether you need to focus on work, enjoy a quiet read, or simply unwind. I happily spent several hours here and felt completely relaxed and welcome.
Beyond the aesthetics, the service here is genuinely top-tier. Every member of the team is exceptionally friendly, attentive, and clearly passionate about their craft. They were patient in explaining different brewing methods and offered excellent recommendations tailored precisely to my preferences. My order was served quickly, always with a genuine smile, which truly elevated the entire visit.
The menu boasts an impressive variety of cold and hot drinks, catering to every possible craving imaginable. I first tried their signature iced latte, which was perfectly balanced and refreshing, and later enjoyed a rich, expertly crafted hot chocolate. They also frequently have unique seasonal specials and a fantastic selection of teas. This cafe is a must-visit gem‚Äîa rare combination of superb quality, peaceful ambiance, and five-star hospitality. Recommended!
review_2_text:
Happened to pass by this cafe and saw this big Thai tea sign with the price (35 baht!), so I went in and tried it. Safe to say I finally found the best Thai milk tea in Chiang Mai! Yassss! ü§©

P.S. i always ask for less sugar
review_3_text:
This is a great little place. Modern and clean. Note - they ONLY sell hot and cold drinks - the lovely looking macaroons are only for decoration üòÇ.
Great coffee and Thai tea.  Most drinks are only 35 bhat.
review_4_text:
Nice cafe, chill spot with good prices.
Perfect for a relaxing break!
review_5_text: Cute place to grab a drink and cool down. Very kind staff!

name: ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡∏ó‡∏≠‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏°‡πà‡∏≤ - Moo Tod Ama
review_1_text:
A hidden gem!
I ordered an omelette through food grab and it was delicious, well packaged and great value. I decided to come here to check it out and wasn‚Äôt disappointed. Extremely cleanly presented, modern and a relaxed atmosphere. The food is fresh, delicious and great value. This place is on par with any similar good cafe back home at a third of the price.
Highly recommend you try this place out
review_2_text:
Went for breakfast. The restaurant was empty but we were greeted by a friendly staff.
Food was made fresh and rather yummy. The black coffee was not strong enough though.
BLT sandwich was good but I feel that it's a little pricey.
The atmosphere of the restaurant was cosy. Overall, a good place for early breakfast.
review_3_text: The food here was super yummy, good price and the sandwich was really tasty- the bread wasn't sweet, and it was a really good size. I also got a chai latte with coffee that was tasty and enjoyed the fruit bowl with yogurt- although the yogurt was a very liquid consistency. I will come back :)
review_4_text: Had an amazing brunch at Moo Tod Ama! The food was delicious and portion sizes were generous. We ordered one bacon toast and one fried garlic rice with pork, which easily satisfied three people. The staff was super friendly and provided excellent service. Highly recommend this place for a delightful brunch experience!
review_5_text: One of the BEST breakfast I have ate around old city. The chicken is very tender, a great combination with sticky rice. Latte and butterfly pea drink are good too.
