The staffs are very friendly, they also recommend us some must visit site in Chiang Mai. I will definitely visit Moo Tod Ama again. Highly recommend!

name: Blue Coffee at Somphet Market
review_1_text: Very relaxed atmosphere and very friendly service. We had the croissant and the original pretzel and it was fantastic - salty and chewy with the right amount of sweet. The coffee was lovely both hot and cold and we would most certainly return
review_2_text: What a lovely, fancy little coffee shop! Great service from the staff, amazing velvety coffee and yummy sweet treats! They also offer ice cream and coffee packets to take home! Amazing.
review_3_text:
Unfortunately I did not enjoy the matcha latte and the decaf coffee... the flavor was off.
Extremely pricey too.
However the service is impeccable- the barista guy there is amazing. And the place itself is designed very well.
review_4_text: A lovely caf√© by the historic moat‚Äîbright, clean, with friendly staff. Coffee and cakes are delicious, paired with relaxing background music. Comfy chairs and tables make it perfect whether you're working or unwinding! Highly recommend!
review_5_text: I really enjoy here. The coffee and drinks here are so good and delicious croissants. The staffs are so friendly and kind. I'll definitely come back here again. Love it!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Refine Coffee Roaster.TCDC
review_1_text: The mocha was beautifully balanced ‚Äî rich, smooth, and comforting without being too sweet. Paired with their homemade desserts, it created the perfect little moment of calm. The staff were kind and welcoming, adding to the cozy vibe that makes the place feel a bit like home.
review_2_text:
A lovely little coffee spot with a cozy and refreshing vibe. üåø
The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, surrounded by greenery ‚Äî perfect for a peaceful break or a casual meet-up.
The staff are friendly and welcoming, making you feel right at home. Whether you‚Äôre grabbing a quick coffee to go or staying to enjoy it in the garden, it‚Äôs a great place to recharge.
review_3_text: Cute cafe with friendly owner. The coffees are good and the service is really excellent.
review_4_text: My friend told me to try Refine coffee. So when I flew from USA I stop by Refine coffee and it is as good as my friend advertised. Coffee aroma is amazing and the barista Karn told me about the Rose Soda, very refreshing.
review_5_text: Great little Cafe, walked past it many times.  So clean and bright inside.  As you can see from the pictures.  There opening sign is there mascot, who on first entering greeted us.  "So Cute". Staff were very friendly.   Will be back again soon thank you.

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏ã‡∏≠‡∏ô ‡∏õ‡∏ï‡∏ó.‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏°‡πà‡∏≠‡∏¢
review_1_text: They are open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.
review_2_text: üòãüòãüòãüòã

name: ‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ò‡∏∏‡πå‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢ coffee
review_1_text: 5 glasses for almost an hour, is that too long?

name: Prem COFFEE
review_1_text:
Simply unbeatable prices and yummy drinks! 35 baht for iced, 25 baht for hot drinks. The barista who was working today was going nonstop, it was impressive!

I got a yummy iced vanilla latte, half sweet. Highly recommend!
review_2_text: Absolutely incredible and with great prices. I get my coffee and milk tea from here every day. Obsessed with butterfly pea milk tea
review_3_text: My favorite coffee place. Ppl are nice and cheap. They open at 7am. Hot americano 25baht. Ice americano 35baht
review_4_text: super nice, kind and tasty! cafe highly recommend on the ice Brazil, for a strong fully aromatic cafe.
review_5_text:
Always a good iced Thai tea and iced coffee. Perfect sweetness.
The person making coffees/drinks is also very nice!

name: The South African - Cafe, Restaurant & Rooftop
review_1_text: Lovely place to grab a bite of Thai food or a large portion of South African food. Based on the menu we ordered the bunny chow, which looks like a manageable portion however, it came out in a whole sourdough bread bowl! No complaints just very filling. I ordered the pad krapao which was delicious. The fried egg was also cooked perfectly! We would defiantly eat here again!
review_2_text: A very nice, clean restaurant with friendly staff! I had the Chakalaka, which was served with Pap, a corn porridge. Pap tastes similar to Italian polenta and was very delicious! The restaurant has a few South African dishes on the menu, as well as some Thai dishes. I also really enjoyed the yummy Penang Curry. I highly recommend this restaurant!
review_3_text:
Spotless Cleanliness

The establishment gleams with meticulous care‚Äîtables wiped spotless, floors pristine, and restrooms impeccable, fostering a fresh, hygienic vibe that enhances every visit. I was so impressed.
Let me tell you about the desserts.
The desserts here are a real highlight: beautifully presented, generously portioned, and clearly made with attention to detail, and the desserts draw from African traditions, featuring many wonderful delights that will take many visits to sample each one. ü§≠
I will be visiting ofter.

Cheers
GLT
review_4_text: "Lekker Man!, Lekker" If you understand the comment, you‚Äôll understand that the food is truly amazing‚Äîdefinitely feels homemade. It was a really wonderful experience, and I feel fortunate to have visited this place before it becomes super busy and crowded. I especially loved the personal attention they give to their customers.
review_5_text:
Really great.  Had lovely conversations with the owners‚Äì very passionate, and motivated to bring this cafe to life.

A friend and I came here to have a coffee and get some computer work done, and accidently wound up staying through lunchtime‚Äì! Very accommodating owner, willing to answer our questions (and put up with our continuous stay), with an eye tuned to possible improvements to his establishment.
Very clean place, the drinks were tasty and beautiful and the food delicious as well!

Excited for this business's future, as it is clear that a lot of care has gone into (and continues to) it‚ô°
Their prioritization on natural and non-artificial ingredients really makes a difference!

name: Yaya Coffee
review_1_text:
Yaya coffee is the best coffee in Chiang Mai.
Not only does it have a great smooth taste but it comes with a warm heart of the owner Yaya.
She is so kind and so welcoming of foreign tourists and takes the time to tell you the story about her family‚Äôs coffee farms.
You go to her coffee shop as a customer and you leave as a friend.
review_2_text: Yaya has the best coffee in Chiang Mai hands down. I highly recommend her coffee shop to anyone travelling in Chiang Mai. Lots of selection and the most kind person you will ever meet.
review_3_text: Great local family grown coffee from Thailand. Best prices in chiang Mai. Lovely owner lady. Very friendly. It's nice to support her. Closed Sunday. Outside seating. Come and try.
review_4_text: Orange juice coffee was freshly squeezed, and on par with some of the famous coffee places in town!
review_5_text: Yaya is an amazing lovely person with best coffee. My number one stop in chiang mai for her companion and good prices

name: Kuro Kuro Boba
review_1_text: The cutest cafe in Chiang Mai, what a hidden gem this is! Lots of cute and quirky decorations, delicious coffee and a little garden area out back near the river. So peaceful, the staff are amazingly friendly and lovely. There are cats! I recommend this place to all my friends who are visiting Chiang Mai. Reasonable prices too, its really my favourite cafe in the city.
review_2_text: Very cute place, perfect coconut matcha üëåüèª
review_3_text:
Very sweet coffee store ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è In the backyard waits tiny cats to cuddle. Also the coffee tastes wonderful ‚òïÔ∏è

A great place to relax with a coffee in the backyard.
review_4_text: the founder is so sweet! and the latte is to die for. oh dont forget to order the banana cakes. so delightful
review_5_text:
I've been in Chiang Mai for two weeks now and every day I've been here for morning coffee. I made a mistake once and went to a different place which I regret. That says a lot. Best coffee shop in town.

Also they three(?) beutiful cats walking around! And many vegan milk options.

name: T-Koff Coffee
review_1_text: Very nice iced coffee. 45 baht.
review_2_text: Good coffeeüëç
review_3_text:
I've been to T-Koff Coffee several times now, and each time it's been a delight. I particularly like the Iced Thai Coffee Tea. It's intense, aromatic, and simply unique. You rarely find something like it.

The owner is incredibly friendly, always in a good mood, and makes you feel immediately welcome. It's one of those places where you'll want to stay because everything is just right: the taste, atmosphere, and heart.

If you don't stop by, you're really missing out!
review_4_text:
Very very delicious coffee
And at a great price!
Just a cafe without food, highly recommend
review_5_text: The cafe latte was delicious! 40 baht

name: Coffee Time (‡πÉ‡∏Å‡∏•‡πâ‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏á‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏®‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà)
review_1_text: Great coffee, nice ambient and the lady at the counter is super nice
review_2_text: A very nice small coffee shop. The woman owner is extremely nice.
review_3_text: Good coffee at a cheap price. Lovely lady.
review_4_text: Cute little coffee shop with good and cheap coffee and very friendly owner.
review_5_text:
This shop is my most fav. üíõüíõüíõ
Really recommend for all who love easy coffee with good taste and good price.

name: Jukad ‡∏à‡∏π‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏î coffee
review_1_text: Bright modern coffee shop across from Muang Mai Market.   Great spot for a well made coffee drink while you are waiting for a Grab.
review_2_text:
A really good coffee at the market.
Good place to have a break from walking the market.
review_3_text:
Great coffee and great service!
Nice place to cool down after visiting the market.
review_4_text: A cute little cafe next to the market, a good place to rest after shopping.  The lemon and honey ice tea is excellent, as is the coffee.  recommended
review_5_text: Is it ended? I think they don't open on Sundays (or on weekends)

name: Taste Cafe
review_1_text:
I‚Äôve been coming to Taste Cafe for about 8 years now, and I still keep coming back every time I visit Chiang Mai.

It‚Äôs one of those places I feel genuinely connected to. The coffee has always been consistent ‚Äî rich, aromatic, and perfectly balanced, just the way I like it. Whether I order my usual favorite or try something new, I‚Äôm never disappointed.

The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable, great for relaxing, catching up with friends, or even getting some work done. The staff are friendly and welcoming, which makes the experience even more special.

For me, Taste Cafe is a must-visit spot in Chiang Mai ‚Äî a place I‚Äôll always return to. ‚òï
review_2_text:
Fairly crowded on a Sunday morning around 8:45am, but we managed to get a table for two. The crowd continued to build up shortly after.

Food options are limited, though there‚Äôs a wide variety of drinks. We tried the classic shiopan and the shiopan with pork and cream cheese. The classic shiopan was dense on the outside, hollow in the middle, and nicely buttery with a hint of salt ‚Äî enjoyable.

We had a mocha and a latte; both were decent.

The music was a little loud, but overall it‚Äôs a pleasant spot to sit, relax, and people-watch.

Note: credit cards are not accepted ‚Äî payment is via cash or QR only.
review_3_text: Taste Cafe has a great atmosphere and really good coffee. The must try is the Soft Latte. For non coffee drinkers, there are Soft Chocolate, Soft Matcha, and Soft Thai Tea. The cream topping is smooth, lightly sweet, and pairs perfectly with the coffee. I had been in Chiang Mai for 5 days I went there twice, REALLY LOVE HERE
review_4_text:
Among the countless coffee shops in Chiang Mai, this one stands out as truly exceptional. I would confidently rank it in the top ten!

Great coffee and good vibes!
However, this cafe tends to be quite busy throughout the day. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it if you‚Äôre looking for a quiet place.

Soft Latte is my fav!! I bet you try
review_5_text: What a lovely surprise. A contemporary looking spacious open-plan coffee shop with really great coffee, a relaxed musical vibe, prompt & friendly service from the staff and a huge tasty chocolate brownie. Cannot fault it. You must come and get some.

name: Starbucks Nimmanhemin Soi 9
review_1_text:
This is one of my best Starbucks experiences in Thailand. The staff is very nice, the quality of my brewed coffee great and the atmosphere in the store is quiet and relaxing.
I could choose between four different coffee beans and they dripped the coffee in front of me having a nice conversation, more like at a bar. The staff really seems to love what they do. Thank you.
review_2_text:
Nice service with good quality coffee
There are many tables and seats. If you like to sit privately there is the 2nd floor space
review_3_text: The staffs here are nice and polite. Fluent in English. 4 parking spaces for car . The old man at the parking lot is a bit annoying though, moody all the time .
review_4_text: I‚Äôm visiting Chiang Mai and have been to this branch twice during my trip. The staff are very nice, helpful, and friendly. They recommended the drip coffee, and it tasted amazing. The atmosphere is cozy, with charming northern-style decorations. Highly recommend!
review_5_text: Disclaimer that I'm not a Starbucks fan. I gave it another try again here because the location looked nice and I wanted to know for sure that there's plant milk. It really is a nice place to sit and the staff are very nice. I ordered a hot Houjicha Latte w soy milk, no sugar. The drink was more on the warm than hot side, not very flavorful and really sweet, maybe sugar was added? Also really big size even for smallest order.

name: Uncle Kani
review_1_text: The ambiance is great, the cats are super well-behaved, and all the staff members adore them. The food here is delicious too‚Äîespecially the beef, which is perfectly tender, and it only costs 190 baht, such a great deal! The grilled salmon is a bit overcooked, but the rice is fragrant and tasty. I‚Äôll definitely come back just for the beef.
review_2_text: Tranquil atmosphere, with nice music not a large menu (which is a good sign), the food was delicious and the steak meat was grilled medium rare in my dish, I also had the egg on top. It had a great chilled ambience too. At the end when going to pay they have free cat stickers üòÇ, unique little spot and a bit of a gem in Chiang Mai. Highly recommend. I think we will be coming back ! I want to check out their coffee!
review_3_text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Uncle Kani is a lovely, quiet spot in Chiang Mai. One of the highlights is their three super cute cats which make the place feel extra cozy and welcoming.

The food is great ‚Äî we really enjoyed the beef fried rice, steak, and salad. Everything was tasty and affordable. We actually went there twice during our stay,and the second visit was even better. The rice came out hotter and the overall flavor was improved.‚úîÔ∏è

If you‚Äôre looking for a calm place with good food and a relaxedmosphere (plus adorable cats), Uncle Kani is definitely worth a visit
review_4_text:
A small restaurant that serves delicious food. Very specialised menu. Location is a bit tucked away in a local neighbourhood.

The food is great and cooked perfectly. Portion was a bit small so I would recommend to upgrade the beef and tallow fried rice.

Tables are limited, and they frequenly sell out their menu. So arrive early. Also it is a place to enjoy your meal but not to linger since other people will be waiting for your seat.
review_5_text:
lovely place & lovely comfort food! i went here for dinner with my husband & ordered the beef fat fried rice, hashbrown, aus ribeye, peach tea, ginger ale, and the caramel custard thing (shaped heart, so cute). all are tastes nice!

bonus: they had 2 lovely cats hehe. as a cat lover, this is like +10000000 aura! must visit when you are in chiang mai.

name: CHARLIE (‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡∏•‡∏µ) Thai Tea - Nimman Soi13 (Grab&Go)
review_1_text:
Came by specifically to try their Thai tea and was genuinely impressed. The quality exceeded expectations, ordered less sweet, with well-balanced flavors that aren‚Äôt overly sweet ‚Äî exactly to our preference. Standout picks were the Charlie (Salted Caramel Cold Foam Pour Over Thai Milk Tea) and the Soft Latte Thai Tea, both smooth, fragrant, and nicely layered. We went with the staff‚Äôs recommendations for type of tea and honestly, you can‚Äôt go wrong with any of them.

The outlet itself is small and minimal, quite cool inside, with only a handful of chairs available indoors and outdoors. There was no queue when we visited, making it ideal for a quick grab-and-go. Perfect for picking up a drink and strolling around the area. Definitely worth a try if you‚Äôre a Thai tea fan. I prefer this outlet compared others.
review_2_text: Cute store with a cozy atmosphere. You get to choose from their selection of tea leaves and if you order in they allow you to mix your own Thai iced tea as well which makes for a great experience! Smooth balance of flavour and if it‚Äôs your first time in Thailand then I would suggest getting 50% sugar as I‚Äôve noticed their default sugar level is higher than normal.
review_3_text: My first time trying this one, in Chiang Mai. The place just simple, prefer for take away. The thai tea really delicious, yummy! Thick, sweet and you can choose kind of tea.
review_4_text:
A must-visit for tea lovers, especially if you love Thai tea! They offer a wide variety of teas from different parts of Thailand, and you can customize how dark you want your tea and the sweetness level.

I highly recommend the Satun tea (4 mins, 75% sweetness), it‚Äôs rich and flavorful.

They also have a great selection of coffee, but the Thai tea is the real highlight. If you‚Äôre a Thai tea fan, this is the place for you!
review_5_text:
This staff member at this bubble tea shop is an absolute disgrace to Chiang Mai's service industry. From the moment we started ordering, she was impatient and had a terrible attitude. The drink she made was almost entirely ice ‚Äî there was less than 80ml of actual liquid in the cup.

When I tried to raise the issue with her, she remained unfriendly and unhelpful. She kept her back turned to us the entire time, completely unwilling to communicate. Another staff member had to step in to talk to us and then relayed our concerns to her. Her response? She couldn‚Äôt have cared less and said, ‚ÄúGo ahead and complain about us if you want.‚Äù

Absolutely unacceptable behavior and a completely disappointing experience.

I know it's impolite to post someone's photo publicly, but she also showed no respect to us as customers! As a tourist and a foreigner, I don‚Äôt understand why she treated us differently. So disappointed!

name: 8days Cafe
review_1_text:
This caf√© on Nimmanhaemin Road in Chiang Mai has a quiet, peaceful atmosphere with a subtle Japanese-style design. The space feels calm and relaxing, making it a place I instantly fell in love with.

I visited with a friend and we ordered their signature green tea, priced at 150 baht. The flavor was rich and well-balanced, with a smooth, deep taste that felt very comforting. It was clear that a lot of care went into the quality of the tea.

The caf√© is also very photogenic‚Äîevery corner looks great in photos‚Äîyet it never feels noisy or crowded. It‚Äôs an ideal spot to slow down, enjoy a drink, and spend some quiet time with friends. I truly enjoyed being here and would happily come back again.
review_2_text: The Vanilla Sour beer is to die for: flavorful, crisp, and very refreshing.  The staff are great hosts and the menu features local Thai Cuisine.  A short walk from the Silver Temple or a Tuk-tuk from the airport.  Worth it!
review_3_text: This place is absolutely fantastic. Not only is there coffee amazing but they pass all the vibe checks. Super cool design inside and out and you can just tell they put a lot of creativity into their work. I really appreciate this coffee shop and will be back again for another iced Americano.
review_4_text: Amazing little cafe. Cosy and chill with good coffee and good pricey. Great place to get some work done! All coffee is solid
review_5_text: Very good coffee! Delicious desserts! Excellent service and very nice ambiance. You can seat inside with the air conditioning or outside for the fresh air. You can come alone to work or come with friends to enjoy the coffee and the atmosphere!

name: The Larder Cafe & Bar
review_1_text: We came here 9 years ago after hearing about this amazing local eatery. We're back and the food is still top notch! The same staff are still here as well as the delicious food. Do not understand why such low ratings because this , hands down, is THE best place for breakfast/lunch in Chiang Mai! Their fruit is fresh and mounded on your plate. The Raspberry/White Chocolate scones are freshly baked and once they run out, they're gone! The atmosphere is simple yet tasteful. Soft jazzy/contemporary music in the background to add to ambience but nothing overpowering as to disturb a quiet conversation. Their food is edible art! People have complained about the prices and I don't know why. If you tried to find this quality of food and portions, you'd pay twice as much for less quality! DO NOT let the reviews sway you!!! Cone and taste why this is where you should eat!!!
review_2_text:
If you ask any real local person they‚Äôd say this place is the best place for brunch! Ive been coming here for years and the food + service have always been top notched.

My to go is the parmesan scramble egg because it‚Äôs super rich & creamy so much so that it melts in your mouth sometimes. You wouldnt be able to find a better egg than this. Their veggies and tomatoes are fresh & sweet too.

Other bake goods are also nice. Their scones have the half scone half biscuit texture which for me is really addictive haha

Anyway, it‚Äôs the most perfect place to start your day in CNX!
review_3_text:
Super Fluffy crunchy on the edge pancakes with fresh fruit are a showstopper light sweetness and topped generously with vibrant seasonal fruits.

Perfect if you‚Äôre craving something sweet without feeling too heavy.

The scrambled eggs with avocado toast and salmon on the side is a standout. The eggs are soft and creamy, the avocado perfectly ripe, and the smoked salmon adds that extra boost of peanut butter Chocolate protein shake putting a cherry on top.

Zucchini toast is an exquisite menu to try out on a side note.
review_4_text:
Tasty dishes with fresh and quality ingredients.

Still one of my reco places for brunch in Chiangmai.

French toast with mixed fruits today was the best!!!
review_5_text:
So good I had to come back twice!
Portion was huge, coffee was good, the cats were a nice surprise. Just a cool cafe around the neighbourhood ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Memorize Brownie
review_1_text: Tiramisu taste so bad... Only cheap cream not mascarpone at all. I want to give you 1 star but I don't want to be rude... Recommend You to change this. This is not for sale. Only look good and is big portion. I ordered two boxes and I gonna throw everything to the trash.
review_2_text: A nice little cafe to take a break from the hot chiang mai weather. Drinks are alright, as for the brownie, we prefer the original  as compare to the cheesecake flavour. Matcha is nice and the jasmine tea is refreshing.
review_3_text: Wow! Stumbled upon this place after we had dinner and I‚Äôm so glad I did! Their brownies are so good! Which has been surprisingly hard to find here in Chiang Mai. We will definitely be back. The memorize brownie is amazing
review_4_text: Gosh, walked in, place was empty, thinking maybe this was a mistake. Ordered the standard memorize brownie anyway. Was warned the brownie takes ten minutes. By the time the brownie was ready, the place was packed. Then I understood: their brownie is outstanding! Warm, slightly gooey structure, with warmed milk cream... Paired with decent cappuccino. This is truly one of the best I ever had. Well done. If you have a sweet tooth and don't give a damn about calories, macro mix... this is heaven.
review_5_text: I love this brownie kit. So far I have only tried the original brownie. The cream is really delicious so is the brownie. It really does taste like it just came out of the oven if you heat it up. I ordered it on delivery in Bangkok and then realized that my Chiang Mai hotel is right next to the store so I went to check that out. I will definitely order another kit.

name: Subway - Sandwich Restaurants Burger ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏£ ‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏ô
review_1_text: Ate here once way back when I was living in Chiangmai and got the sad-looking thing in my picture. Never returned again.. but I read their standard might have improved since then.
review_2_text: Sandwiches are getting smaller by the day!! While being more expensive! Today, my 6" sandwich was about 4.5", this is borderline scammy !
review_3_text: The Turkey Breast sub is light but filling. Fresh lettuce and cucumbers make it taste balanced. Great for a healthy lunch.
review_4_text: Where's the tuna??? Looks like they only put one scoop of tuna (if that) instead of the standard two on a 6" sub. With that being said, everything else tasted fine.
review_5_text: Love that the staff always check if I want extra veggies or sauce. Makes the experience more personal, and the sandwich tastes just right.

name: ALL BLACK COFFEE
review_1_text:
üê±‚òï Best place in Nimman if you're looking for delicious specialty coffee and a place to chill.
This spot has been my second home for months ‚Äî not only thanks to their flavorful black coffees, friendly staff, and relaxing outdoor space, but maybe mostly because of Bobby: the sweet, adorable cat you‚Äôll usually find on her favorite chair, often in a yogic position and deep sleep.

You can choose from various blends from around the world. Many are single-origin, with info about the washing process, altitude, and bean type. I preferred the hot Americanos: they‚Äôre made so well! A perfect way to really taste the beans and take your time to simmer with your coffee.
review_2_text:
‚òïÔ∏èAll black: Simplicity is the bestüëçüèª
This tiny hidden coffee shop sells only americano with a selection of local and imported beans. Prices vary from 50 to 100+ baht. I tried their Khun Chang Khian for just 50 baht, and the taste is worth more than its priceüëçüèª‚ú®
review_3_text:
Simply the best coffee spot in Nimman. I love black coffee, and their quality is truly top tier ‚Äî you can taste the difference. It‚Äôs incredibly refreshing in the morning.
My little son also loves playing with the owner‚Äôs black cat, who is just as chill as the caf√© vibe.
If black coffee isn‚Äôt your thing, you can still order it and add milk at home . I usually drink half straight and turn the rest into an iced latte.
review_4_text:
Good coffee, cute cat.

Recommend if you like specialty coffee. The espresso has been well-made both times I've been there, not over- or under-extracted, and they have a good range of beans from around the world.

It's a small place with mostly outdoor seating. There is a discount for to-go drinks if you bring your own cup.
review_5_text:
very good selection of speciality coffees.
if you love espresso or long black visit here for wonderful coffee amd service.  it is reasonably price also compared to some other specialty coffee shops nearby

name: Pop Up Tropical Caf√©
review_1_text: Even Moo Deng enjoys to sit, relax and take pics here... üòÅ
review_2_text: Amazing ice cream and amazing sticky rice
review_3_text:
I love this cafe, the juices & food üòã

The corner for this cafe is very good and nice to take your drink in this cafe

Every day, I sit in this coffee for an hour
review_4_text: Fried rice here everyday üòã the best
review_5_text: Nice thai tea

name: yesterday cafe'
review_1_text: One of the best-designed caf√©s in Chiang Mai with truly excellent coffee. The space is beautifully curated and thoughtfully detailed, and the location is perfect. The owner is incredibly sweet and welcoming. God is truly in the details here‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss exploring their hotel right next to the caf√© as well. A must-visit!
review_2_text:
Me and my husband come here twice a week, and we truly love this coffee shop. It‚Äôs the best one open at night, and we always enjoy our visits.

However, today we ordered our usual drinks ‚Äî the hot chocolate and the almond chocolate ‚Äî and unfortunately both were disappointing. The cocoa drink was tasteless, and the almond chocolate had very little chocolate flavor. This has never happened before.

As regular customers, we really hope the owner pays attention to this issue because we don‚Äôt want to lose such a great place.
review_3_text: You can pick and choose your own beans. The flat white was decent, nothing special. The Thai milk tea was alright. Good place to work! The road outside gets busy and noisy, so while the patio is nice, not very conducive. Nice service staff. Indoor seating is chilly. Pretty expensive drinks for the area.
review_4_text:
Something magical about this place because I was mysteriously pulled in while walking past the cafe. ‚ù§Ô∏è

I knew it was going to be good as soon as I saw the design, the architecture, the old wood, and the coffee bar inside. I was immediately greeted by the manager who was very helpful and informative. I don't usually choose coffee bars, but this one is special. After 5 minutes of learning about their slow drip process and the different coffees they offered, I chose the Ethiopian bean.

They take their time and bring you what you need to enjoy the coffee. The Ethiopian blend was amazing. Exactly as described. I drank it without any sugar or cream. I had to have the chocolate croissant.

The seating is comfortable. The atmosphere is relaxing and great for meetings, couples, or by yourself. You don't hear a lot of street noise if you sit inside. I can tell that it would be fun to sit outside in the evenings when it's cooler and you can watch people walk by.

I definitely found a great cafe and will come back. I highly recommend this place if you are picky about coffee and want to experience something different than your average coffee shop. The cost is worth the visit. You are paying for quality and ambience as well as for great service.
review_5_text:
Coffee is good, they made us fast &delicious .
But oh well, came to have a breakfast with literally Noone in cafee besides us . How you can  cook scramble eggs for 45 minutes ?? Was already thinking to leave and get food from 7/11 ... rather than waiting for sooo long for simple scrambled eggs with toast and they didn't make a toast in the end ... I belled on a bell they have for 2 minutes before someone came out to talk to me

name: Pui Coffee
review_1_text: Excellent smoothies, incredibly low prices. We got an Earl Grey Tea latt√© and a GIANT mixed berry yogurt smoothie for 90 baht ($2.80!!)!  Great quality and taste!
review_2_text: Love the shop owner - barista. Whether it's an iced drink or hot drink, she makes it with as much attention to detail and gives a full cup. Very nice person. For the hot coffee, she makes a pretty latte art. And the drinks are very good price. Like 25 baht for a hot latte, 35 baht for cold. She's truly professional.
review_3_text:
The BEST coffee and smoothies in this city ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•∞
Or maybe it's just Pui's smile! She's the sweetest : ‡∏ô‡∏≥‡πâ‡πÉ‡∏à
We had many conversations via Google Translate üòÖ555
I hope she opens a large indoor cafe one day, especially because she supports many local vendors by selling their goods at her cafe: The crochet drink holders, the muffins, the sandwiches, and other things are from several ladies in the neighborhood ‚ú®

I lived on this street for a year, and it's a very close community. Welcoming too, if you come around often enough!
The Spirited Away pot was a farewell gift. That's how much I loved going to this cafe every day ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: Love this coffee spot! We come here for coffee and drinks almost every other day!
review_5_text: This is the best Matcha Latte I‚Äôve ever had! I used to drink Thai Tea and Espresso as well, and they‚Äôre also some of the best drinks I‚Äôve had here. My husband and I usually get our drinks from Pui Coffee every day. If you go after 1 PM, be prepared for a long wait‚Äîthere are so many customers around that time. I once waited about an hour and a half just for two drinks, but it was absolutely worth it. The drinks are delicious!

name: October : Japanese Home Cooking
review_1_text: A cozy little Japanese fusion restaurant! Amazing food!! Highly recommended when you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai!!
review_2_text: Fantastic restaurant! The beef was very high quality and the service was amazing. Our food came so fast we were so surprised! I‚Äôd recommend coming here if you like Japanese food it‚Äôs excellent! 5 stars!
review_3_text:
If Google have 10stars, I will give all!
I‚Äôm a beef lover that‚Äôs why I love this restaurant. Almost every menu are so interesting. My friend and I selected the best 4 menus as the picture. I wasn‚Äôt remembered what‚Äôs the menu that we ordered but all menus are delicious!
I love beef soup and fried rice with garlic. Both menu are excellent more than I can say!
The restaurant have quite less seating. I think I may suggest you had better call to make a reservation in advance.
In totally I like this restaurant.
review_4_text: One of my most favorite restaurants to go to in Chiang Mai. The beef is so tender and delicious. The pasta was also very good and so was the mango cheesecake. So to sum it up, everything on the menu was great! The price is pretty high but it is really worth it.
review_5_text: Very nice authentic Japanese food. The place is cozy the decoration is simple but the staff is very friendly and they also have coffee and Japanese desserts. I eat here often and recommend it to everyone.

name: After Time Cafe
review_1_text: Lovely cafe. Coffee beans are good but the Barista didn't heat the milk properly for a Flat White. Still very nice.
review_2_text: Very nice and cozy place to have coffee and meet up with friends.
review_3_text: Cute coffee shop with delicious coffee. Friendly owner and her little daughter is adorable!
review_4_text: Very cute coffee shop and great iced latte.  They don‚Äôt offer food just some snacks.
review_5_text: Cute coffee shop and friendly owner. Cozy outdoor decoration and the coffee is very nice at reasonable price.

name: Wawee Coffee
review_1_text: A lovely caf√© connected to a bakery, perfect for breakfast or brunch. The space is cozy and beautifully designed, with a calm atmosphere. The food is fresh and delicious, especially the baked goods, and the service is friendly and efficient. A great place to start the day ‚ú®ü´ñüçµüç™‚òï
review_2_text: This is a franchise cafe and there are several locations in Chiang Mai. I have never been to other ones, but this location is fairy nice with AC. It‚Äôs directly connected to a bakery next to it so you can utilize either space. Their wifi is very fast and there are some good seats as well.
review_3_text:
A cool coffee & Bakery shop together with Retro vibe interior...
Can sit outdoor & Indoor...
There are many kinds of bakery products available...

Coffee shop area is quite annoying cause Coffee Grinder noise... Even difficult to have conversation cause of noises...
review_4_text:
It is a comfortable and relaxing place to stop. They have a kitchen to cook you a breakfast, freshly baked goods, sweets on one side and coffee and tea on the other.

Nothing revolutionary - nothing too crazy you know. A variety of seating arrangements indoors and out, English language newspapers, standard air conditioning and soft music‚Ä¶ in a convenient area for many.
Playground Fitness is across the street if you feel the need to shed some calories‚Ä¶
review_5_text:
Very good coffee and cakes, but the attitude of the barista (not the chubby one with glasses) is the worse. She is making unnecessary noises while doing her own duty and talk to us very rudely. I am not coming back here because of her.

The girls from the cake counter are lovely.

name: Rainy's Veggie Burgers
review_1_text:
The Best Veggie Burgers in Chiang Mai ‚Äì A True Hidden Gem!
We were so impressed by the food and the vibe at Rainy's Veggie Burgers that we simply had to come back the next day. This place is a true gem. The burgers are simple yet incredibly flavorful, with the patties being clearly homemade with love and care. It's the perfect, no-frills spot for a delicious and very affordable meal. The atmosphere is so cozy and welcoming, and Rainy herself is just the kindest and friendliest owner. This isn't just a place to eat‚Äîit feels like you're being welcomed into a friend's home. We're already looking forward to our next visit!
review_2_text: This was our first meal in the city and definitely one of the best. We had Khao Suey Burger,Khaprao Sauce burger, Green Thai Sauce Sphagetti,French Fries and Blue Pea Lime juice. Khaprao sauce and Green Thai were spicy but tasty. We even packed two patties for later. This is definitely recommended for vegetarians, vegans around one nimman area. This shop is run by Rainy, a wonderful and friendly person to converse with.
review_3_text:
Rainy is doing such an amazing job with her business so it's not a surprise that her average score here is 5! The burgers and fries are really tasty plus I recommend to go for the butterfly lime juice, it's delicious! However, beside food, Rainy puts so much effort into making her guests to feel like they are at home that I honestly can't remember the last time I had such a pleasant experience when visiting a restaurant. On top of it all, the pricw of the food is very affordable and if you leave the tip, Rainy will make sure it gets donated to the nearest hospital.
Big love from Sinisa and Dragan, we will come back to Chiang Mai next year just to visit Rainy and taste some of the finest veggie burgers in Thailand.
review_4_text:
This little outdoor but covered restaurant in the Nimman neighborhood run by super sweet Rainy/Fon has really tasty fusion burgers and pasta.

Everything is apparently vegan except the buns (which unfortunately contain eggs; I urged her to find vegan buns).
review_5_text: Great burgers, Rainy is very friendly, we felt welcome and comfortable. The food was unique, blending traditional Thai flavours to a modern vegetarian burger.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text:
A quick drinking spot at gas station.

Visited the shop while refuelling the motorcycle at gas station. The weather was pouring rain so I decided to take a sip in here. I ordered ice tea & hot latte. It's quite affordable with generous portion. Nice and okay.
review_2_text: Expensive coffee. The quality and quantity needs improvement. Just because this cafe is easily found at gas stations, it doesn‚Äôt mean you overcharge and underserve your customers.
review_3_text: Can pay with credit cards. Nice place, not overcrowded.
review_4_text: Convenient coffee shop of PTT gas station. Get small discount for CMU students & staffs only regular menu. Neither barista nor signature menu serving, just a recipe following cup to sip. Do not expect smiley face when you redeem discount coupon as it's more like a campus refreshment shop. There are always some unprofessional people in business when margins claimed.
review_5_text: Each single time I come to this place, they made a mistake in the order. It's not a language problem since I speak Thai and rarely have issues with my orders anywhere else, it's just they are tremendously stupid. Not recommended place.

name: I LOVE COFFEE
review_1_text: The best americano orange i ever had! I love the ambiance, internet is fast and it's clean, airy and quiet. I love the chill music they play as well. The only downside is there's no toilet inside the cafe. You need to walk a little outside to use the building's toilet
review_2_text: Good coffee and great service. Best of all, no American pop music playing! They just have unobtrusive musak.
review_3_text: Pretty good cafe on campus with a workable long table and some outside tables and chairs. The prices are as good as others on campus and it‚Äôs good.
review_4_text: Great place for a delicious coffee ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text:
Clean, bright space to sit and work. Only tried the iced latte (very...strong?) I got too energized to finish even half üòÖ
I saw groups of students and teachers come while I was here. Mostly quiet and not too crowded. Plenty of parking. Enjoy!

name: Iris Caf√© Nimman
review_1_text: The charm of the cafe and its owner lift this to 5 stars for me. It's a nice green space a bit off the central part of Nimman and the matcha latte was nice, I think they even had plant milk for it. Inside is with aircon, and there's a cute little pup roaming around.
review_2_text: There's a nice French touch to this cosy homey cafe behind a florist. The man we met was a very friendly Frenchman obviously an expert loving his teas. Ask for teas brewed with blue flowers, had mine with Earl Grey and it lit the senses.
review_3_text:
Comfortable and relaxing !
Small cafe with homemade cake and cookies.
Reasonable price with high-quality food and coffee.
review_4_text: Very cute little spot, would definitely recommend it for anyone who likes looking for a new coffebar
review_5_text:
Calm space off of a busy Nimman Road behind a flower shop.

Well made coffee drinks.  Innovate breakfast... scrambled eggs with an array of grilled vegetables.

name: Double Eleven Cafe&Space
review_1_text: I‚Äôve been a regular customer for about 5 months. Although the shop is a bit small, it‚Äôs clean and beautiful. The coffee tastes really good. My favorite snack from Double Eleven is Toast. The best thing about it is the owners are really really friendly, sweet and kind-hearted. Love it!
review_2_text: I am staying in condo1 but walk all the way to condotel2 s cafe- 11:11- bc this coffee shop is clean, cool, and the barista super friendly and talented!!! Lovely oasis of a place.
review_3_text: A lovely family run business with good coffee, caring service. Good value chicken wraps all made with such attention to detail
review_4_text: The owner is very friendly and helpful. The food and drinks are tasty and reasonably priced.
review_5_text: Friendly guy who owns the shop. Great coffee and lovely atmosphere.

name: ‡πÅ‡∏£‡∏î‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏ÅCoffee
review_1_text: My go to coffee spot in Chiangmai. I‚Äôm here several times per week. Value for money the best that I‚Äôve found,  the owners are super friendly and the hot cappuccino is solid at 40 baht. It‚Äôs more of a stand but there‚Äôs some outside seating and a bathroom if you want to stay for a while. Highly recommend.
review_2_text:
One of the little hidden gems of the coffee scene here in Chiang Mai. Obviously coffee is subjective, but relative to most of the more specialty coffee places in nimman, this place crushes it.
I go out of my way to come to this little coffee stall.
review_3_text:
I come here every day to have coffee, Matcha, Thai tea ..everything üòÇ

New is such a lovely person and the drinks are really good. Thanks to her üíõ
review_4_text: Coffee beans and method of extracting coffee is very delicious. Service by Khun New was fast, professional, and super-clean. Love this cafe!!
review_5_text: Great dark roast Cappuccino and Es Yen. Highly reccomend if you‚Äôre around!

name: The 12 Cafe'
review_1_text: This is a hidden gem with beautiful greenery and open space sitting in a corner. Very peaceful vibes and all flowers in the cafe are fresh and well taken care of. Awesome for private conversations and working solo here.
review_2_text:
Very very good cappuccino, lovely environment and a great service. They tried to create a homely atmosphere and they absolutely nailed it. And I‚Äòm gonna say it again: the cappuccino is fabulous!

Total recommendation from my side if you want to spend a little time working or just chatting with friends.
review_3_text: Food is served after 10:30AM. If you come earlier, only coffee and drinks are available.
review_4_text: Nice little cafe that seems to be run by the next-door Pingnakorn Nimman Hotel. The decor is pleasant, and my hot latte was nice.
review_5_text: Coffee was good and the interior is nice but I don't think I would return as it's part of a hotel.

name: More Coffee
review_1_text: Great take away coffee place in a more quiet area. Iced americano for 40-45 baht depending on the beans you choose. Kind owner.
review_2_text: Great coffee, good price but reliability is a bit of issue. I went there 7.15am and need to wait for them to arrange the shop. I went there the other day around 12.45 and shop already close. So open 7am-1pm as shown in Google is not true.
review_3_text: Sweet little take away coffee corner with amazing coffee and sweet lady making it :) we‚Äôll be back!!!!
review_4_text: Wonderful coffee next to a small local restaurant in a local hideaway middle of the city. Lovely barista üòä‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: We had a great coffee ‚òïÔ∏è! I had the es-yeh (Thai Style) and I loved it! Such a good coffee üôè try it out üëå

name: ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏¥‡πÇ‡∏†‡∏Ñ : Boripok coffee
review_1_text: Nat is incredible and fun. I spend so much time having multiple coffees there. He makes good coffee. It‚Äôs only 45baht for almost everything. Come check out.
review_2_text: What a find!!! The coffee is amazing. He roasts his own beans and sells daily (except Saturday). The owner is such a nice guy and has even created a big of an atmosphere with tables and chairs, arts and crafts and guitars.
review_3_text: Super friendly owner who makes amazing coffee. You can tell he really cares. Always a nice vibe here. feels like a little local treasure. Highly recommend!
review_4_text:
This hidden coffee gem is my favorite place to stop for coffee!
The most quaint mobile coffee shop in front of the round condo.
Not only will you encounter a wonderful barista who takes care with every cup of coffee, but great friends to exchange past and future journey experiences abroad.
It‚Äôs a must visit if you find yourself in Chiang Mai!
Thank you Nat & Mint for making my morning barista experiences most memorable:)
review_5_text: Nat‚Äôs such a chill and friendly guy. I don‚Äôt drink coffee, but both the lemon tea and Thai tea here are perfect. They‚Äôve even got some games, including chess! Always a great vibe!

name: ROASTRYN COFFEE BAR
review_1_text:
Recently moved to this new location. Counter seating only.

Great coffee and the gentleman spoke English so communication is not an issue.

My fresh brewed cappuccino was 45baht

Right to 7-11 so easy parking.
review_2_text:
I went there because it opened early in the morning.
The coffee was also excellent.
Thanks to you, I started my morning off right.
review_3_text: All menus are 45 baht, and the coffee is from Chiang Mai, very strong and fragrant (chocolate flavor). The owner is friendly and chatty haha.
review_4_text: I had the orange smoothie coffee for the first time, and wow, it was delicious. The strong coffee and orange smoothie go so well together. The owner speaks English well and is very friendly. I hope you have a great time üëç üëç
review_5_text: Excellent coffee! Great selection and nicely laid out. A very friendly man who puts in a lot of effort.

name: RADMAK COFFEE
review_1_text: I loved the cappuccino. Five-star coffee!
review_2_text: The coffee is delicious.

name: Miracle coffee@nimmanhaemin
review_1_text:
I found a small but very good coffee shop near my hotel. You can enjoy a delicious cup of coffee on your early morning walk in Chiang Mai. It's located on the left side of Nimmanhaemin Soi 6. A cafe latte costs 35 baht, less than half the price of a high-end coffee shop, and you can enjoy authentic coffee

#Chiengmai #Nimmanhaemin #thai #thailand #chgengmaicoffee #coffee
review_2_text: Quick to go coffee spot with a few outside chairs. 30thb for most of the hot coffee and it‚Äôs 40thb if you want a hot one. Better to get it a to go since it‚Äôs a tiny spot.
review_3_text: Great little shop! Really delicious coffee at great prices. No seating, just grab your cup and go!
review_4_text: Awesome little coffee stand in front of Lotus Express. Been coming here for over 2 years now. The husband and wife who runs the place is so sweet and speak a little bit of English. Their drinks are amazing and when you ask for no sugars, there will be no sugars!
review_5_text: Great little place for a take a away coffee!

name: WAN-WI COFFEE
review_1_text: The coffee is really good. The taste is okay, just like in expensive shops. üòÜüòÜ
review_2_text:
Today, I'm recharging with an iced coffee from Tom's Coffee ‚òïÔ∏è.
I have to say, "It's amazing!" The flavor is rich, the coffee aroma is fragrant, and it's not too sweet.
It's refreshing, perfect for a long workday.
If you're near this shop, stop by and give it a try. I highly recommend it üíØ
review_3_text: A cute little coffee bar. The owner is super friendly. The green tea is fragrant and delicious. The peach soda tea is also great. üòãüòã
review_4_text: I had the opportunity to try the cold milk. It was very delicious. The sweetness was just right, well-balanced, and the colors were beautiful. The shop was clean and looked very appetizing.
review_5_text: Thai tea is very smooth.

name: ALong Cafe
review_1_text: Easy and little place but full with the atmosphere of local with sound of birds and nature sound. Sitting cozy talking with friends reading or relaxing looking the old factory beside. It gives you mythical feel like being somewhere  far from town but still in town.
review_2_text: Good coffee and teas with lovely rural vibes. Total tranquilityüôè
review_3_text: A good place to have some coffee & relax. Friendly staff.
review_4_text: I love coming here in the mornings. I think she makes the best americanos and Es Yen. There is lots of comfortable and clean seating. Even though it‚Äôs by a road and outside it‚Äôs quiet and cozy.
review_5_text: Two very nice black Americano coffees (40B each). Very tranquil rural setting off the road. Shady garden

name: ENTHEOS
review_1_text:
Quite literally, this place has the best burger in Chiang Mai. Honestly, one of the best burgers I've had in the world. The consistency of always getting an amazing burger blows me away. If you are hungry, the multiple burger combo is awesome!
I recommend eating meditatively. Eat slowly, and savor every bite of this deliciousness. üòã
Also, the restaurant is relaxing. And the high amount of plants in this restaurant promote a very calm atmosphere.
Would highly recommend, have gone multiple times, and will go again before I leave Chiang Mai!ü•∞
review_2_text:
Chiang Mai's best cafe and burger place!

1. The inside of the cafe is so clean, and the bathroom is clean.
The outdoor terrace on the second floor is so pretty, and the pictures come out well!

2. The hamburgers are so delicious.. The best hamburger in my life.üçî patty is so thick, and rich in ingredients!
We were very full even though two women shared a burger and a half.

3. Coffee is also delicious. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏ècoffee bean (roasted by the cafe owner himself)

4. The boss and the staff are so kind and sweet!
review_3_text: The coffee there is very good!! Next time we‚Äôll try the burger there!!
review_4_text: Nice and cozy coffee shop. The shop is actually much larger than what you see from the outside. They offer a variety of specialty coffees. The owner is super friendly a nice place to drop by to have a cup of coffee with friends.
review_5_text: We have been looking for a place with good burgers and saw good reviews about Entheos. The reviews are very very accurate. We came here twice. The first time to try the burgers. We both had the double cheeseburger. Additionally, i had fries ans a cola. The burgers were excellent. The patties were nice big and juicy. I grew up in LA with In-N-Out Burger and I can say that these burgers are just as good or dare I say better than In-N-Out. It is a bit pricey but worth it. We had coffee there the next day (Mocha and Flat White). The coffees were also excellent and very reasonably price. We will come back again for burgers and coffee.

name: Mingmitr Coffee
review_1_text:
Amazing coffee!
Every day he created a different piece of art in my cappuccino and instantly made my day ‚Äî simply incredible! And he even did it in my takeaway coffee. You can really feel the passion and attention to detail. Great coffee, lovely atmosphere, and highly recommended ‚òïÔ∏è‚ú®

Cappuccino was very good
review_2_text:
Wow! I'm impressed. I wish they'd do flat white (hot latte with double shot in smaller cup), but I'm very happy to get this hot latte!
The place is full of locals working on their laptop which I like (I can't deal with tourists even if I'm one); and the music is not too loud making it perfect to concentrate.
I'll come back. The barista behind the counter is a magician, I had to order a second latte!
review_3_text: I wanted to give a shout out to their latte art! It‚Äôs so beautiful! The staff are sooooo kind, they always are very diligent and friendly. I love the coffee too!
review_4_text:
Loved coffee from this brand. It had a good aroma and nice flavour even though they made it with dark roasts bean.
I tried many times and now became a regular customer of this brand.
Good coffee shop in Chiangmai!
Highly recommended!
review_5_text:
On a good location, close to the bus station and Mc Cormick hospital you find this coffee shop.

Nice atmosphere and clean. Enough seats available and also enough parking.

The service is of a good level. Very friendly.

The coffee is of very good quality.

Recommendable.

name: Bean Scene Cafe
review_1_text: A/C, wifi, delicious coffe and matcha beverages, best cafe open past 4p for laptop working I found in the area. Low glare, regular hours, open 1p until 7p Tuesday through Friday, closed Monday, closed at 5p Sunday. Could offer simple packaged snacks but it seems like most beverage cafes are focused on doing one thing well. There were 6 people learning to perfect drinks and they remade my 50 baht matcha I didn't understand why but I should have gotten another, it was delicious.
review_2_text:
I had an amazing experience at this cafe! They teach you everything about coffee ‚Äî from the absolute basics to advanced brewing methods and even latte art. The teacher is incredibly kind, patient, and humble. He takes the time to make sure you truly understand each step, and he never gives up until you get it right.

When I first joined, I didn‚Äôt know anything about coffee, but now I feel confident ‚Äî almost like a professional barista! The atmosphere is friendly and inspiring, and you can really feel the teacher‚Äôs passion for coffee. Highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to learn how to make great coffee!

Also after 1Pm you can come and enjoy the good coffee a very nice place for working and drinking a good cup of coffee
review_3_text: Cute small place and nice coffee ‚òï small table outside in a yard/parking area. Prices seem good too. Only dairy milk afaik
review_4_text: It‚Äôs cool,relax and quiet place coffee shop. Coffee is really nice and friendly nice customer service. And also near Bus Terminal 2&3 before we go, we can take a rest that cafe shop.
review_5_text: A wonderful coffee shop with friendly employees! The staff was welcoming from the second I walked in the door. It is a clean and cool interior with good wi-fi. I really enjoyed their matcha‚Äîyou can tell it is good quality and not just ‚Äúgreen tea powder.‚Äù They have soy milk available! Less than a 10 minute walk from Bus Terminals 2 & 3.

name: Nerb Nerb coffee roaster
review_1_text: A place for slow life for chilling with coffee and tea. Barista also recommend a drink whatever you want !!! üëè‚úåÔ∏èüòé price not too high and good taste.
review_2_text: Amazing coffee, possibly the best flat white I've had in Chiang Mai. They use a special milk that is super smooth, creamy and the medium roast beans had a good nutty and fruity balance. Tried the americano with medium roast beans too and the balance was perfect, smooth and silky. Love this place! Wished I could bring their beans home!
review_3_text: A great little coffee shop. I had a cold Americano while I waited for my motorbike to get repaired down the street. Great atmosphere and very kind owner.
review_4_text: The place is quite tiny, not much table; recommend for take away. Parking lot is available behind the shop[same one with the printing shop].They serve specialty coffee, the barrista speaks English very well. The price is very cheap compare to the special bean they served.
review_5_text: Coffee was great! The medium roast wasn‚Äôt bitter and it was very smooth. Burger, the man who runs it, is very nice too and knows a lot about coffee! I‚Äôll definitely come back. They also sell fresh eggs!

name: Mabel Cort Cafe'
review_1_text: Just across McCormick Hospital. A lovely place renovated from once the garage next to the house of Dr. Edwin Charles Cort and his wife, Mabel Cort decades ago. Hence the cafe's name. I had my iced latte in the air-conditioned seating  inside  waiting for the guided tour of the Doctor Prince Museum to start. Might try outdoor area when it's cooler.
review_2_text: Good location, nature environment, hot latte 60 baht Easy parking, open early.
review_3_text: Great cafe one the way from bus terminal to Chiang Mai‚Äôs town centre. Very nice coffee and great atmosphere, and the surrounding garden is amazing.
review_4_text: An excellent spot for an early morning coffee. Very kind staff and delicious coffee drinks.
review_5_text:
Nice brand new ( opened 6 months ago) coffee shop. Coffee is ok ( for my taste)

Shop is very very clean so that‚Äôs absolutely worth a lot of  ++++

The sitting area outside has a big garden around it. Although the road is like 50 meters apart n front of the shop it‚Äôs not annoying with regard to noise,  because the cars drive relatively speaking very slow at this specific location. Today I had my coffee here and I understand that every Monday coffee has 50% off. I do not know if this is a limited promotion or all the time. If in the neighborhood absolutely worth the visit.

name: mosaic coffee
review_1_text: Such a cozy spot! The ambiance truly feels like home, warm and welcoming. Plus, I loved meeting Mocha the dog‚Äîso sweet and friendly. Definitely a place I‚Äôd love to come back to.
review_2_text: Among hundreds of coffee places of various ages in Chiang Mai, Mosaic has been here 17 years and counting. Enjoy coffee drinks and fruit smoothies here with mosaic tables and floors, legacy of owner's business earlier. The big table boasts of great iron works, made by owner's significant other in the back workshop. Cacti inside and out front look well-cared for. Spent an easy afternoon here over a hot cappuccino and a coconut with milk smoothie made more exciting with a shot of espresso.
review_3_text: Coffee was good, I tried the americano served with a side glass of water which is always welcome.  There‚Äôs an area out the front where all the smokers hangout next to the street if you‚Äôre French and need a coffee and cigarette üòù. Inside was comfortable and cool although I did notice a sign saying it‚Äôs 20 baht to charge your phone for an hour on the power point! #BeatTheGrind
review_4_text: I enjoy good coffee. Mosaic Coffee is a wonderful place to enjoy a good cup of coffee and relax. Great atmosphere and staff.
review_5_text: Favourite coffee shop in Chiang mai! The owner Ao magmde all the Moza√Øc art herself, it's very arty, inspiring atmosphere! The coffee is peaceful and perfect for a quiet time. The coffee and brownies are delicious!

name: Fresh&Mild @ The Prince Royal's College
review_1_text:
On campus so mostly for staff and students.
AC, WiFi and coffee all good.
review_2_text: The shop is located inside Prince of Songkla University School, next to the Grade 4 cafeteria. It's a small milk shop in the school, but it has air conditioning and not many tables. Children often come here to order milk.
review_3_text: Located next to the Prince School gymnasium, we recommend the Prince Milk menu, which is butterfly pea milk mixed with coconut milk. Delicious and refreshing! üòª Only 35‡∏ø!
review_4_text: A coffee shop located in Prince School. The shop is decorated cutely. They have desserts, fresh coffee, and fresh milk with pearls. I came here because of a parent meeting.

name: BURGER BAR ‡πÄ‡∏ö‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡πÄ‡∏Å‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü ‡∏ä‡∏≤ ‡∏™‡∏°‡∏π‡∏ó‡∏ï‡∏µ‡πâ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: Was looking for a taste of home and found this gem.  üòã  I ordered a pork hamburger to try something a little different with fries.  The porkburger was flavourful and juicy with a homemade sauce.  The fries, good, crispy and soft in the center.  Milk bubble tea was good as well lots of ice and refreshing.  The price was just over 115 bht with an addition Coke.
review_2_text: Just devoured what might just be the very best (value) burger ever! Dropped in on a whim and ordered the egg cheese burger and an iced cappuccino. The drink was great but the burger was truly spectacular! Made from scratch and TASTY!! The price for the two? I doubt it can be beaten anywhere, Try this place. The welcoming and most friendly service is much appreciated. üëçüëçüëç
review_3_text: Excellent value, great burgers, varied menu with fish and chips, chicken on rice and beef burgers. Smoothies and coffee too!
review_4_text: Fabulous burgers made fresh to order, crispy fries, and excellent iced coffee. Run by a lovely family. You can get food to go but the small dining area is very nice.
review_5_text: Nice place with good coffee and thai drinks. They have a milk for vegans ‚ù§Ô∏è The prices are very reasonable:)

name: TEMPO
review_1_text: Shows open on Google Maps. Was closed, owner not reachable by phone. After a while an employee came and said ‚Äújust open on app, not open now.‚Äù
review_2_text: Excellent coffee and neat place to drink coffee.
review_3_text: This coffee shop and restaurant is a favorite among the students of Dara School because it's located right next to the school's back gate.

name: Lily of the Valley Cafe
review_1_text:
I ordered Cocoa Frappe and Blueberry Cheesecake.
The Frappe was really amazing. It's simple but the taste 5-stars. Pure chocolate taste. Doesn't take like diluted in ice.

The cheesecake was also amazing. From the base that has an interesting crunch, the cheese layer that just creamy and dense but doesn't taste heavy, and the toppings it was really good!

High Praises from room 516
review_2_text: Just dealt with Food Poisoning for the last 48 hours - this place served up sweaty smelling chicken. DO NOT RISK IT. Should have stopped my daughter from eating it but I figured out the smell a little too late.
review_3_text: The owner is very friendly and the service is top notch. ‚ú®
review_4_text: The dry Khao Soi with crispy chicken was delicious. The service was good and lovely.

name: ‡πÄ‡∏õ‡∏•‡πà‡∏á Slow Bar
review_1_text:
The specialty selected bean that you can choose! ‚òïÔ∏è
You can find the quality coffee in cheap price. Nice owner~ also nice community here in a small kiosk.
The shop nearby bus terminal so you can walk to.
review_2_text: Best coffee in town. The boss selects and roasts all of his coffee beans. Can have drip coffee, mocha pot or espresso machine. It's just a small shop but a must try if you come to Chiang Mai! Also there is a small smoothie shop across the road for those hot days, very affordable and very high quality for both.
review_3_text: Great coffee!
review_4_text: A small shop with delicious, fragrant coffee. It's roasted and ground in-house. Most importantly, the owner is very friendly and cheerful.
review_5_text:
This coffee shop focuses heavily on quality. We ordered a dark roast Americano with a crema on top, and it was very rich in flavor. We also tried civet coffee for the first time, and it was incredibly fragrant and smooth.
The owner also let us sample a fruity blend with a light roasted aroma. I highly recommend this shop, especially for coffee lovers passing by the area.

name: ‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏™‡∏î‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏°‡∏Ñ‡∏Ø
review_1_text: Cheap. Value for the price
review_2_text: Fresh milk is deliciously fragrant. Iced cocoa, iced coffee mixed tea, and iced Nestea tea are also delicious and inexpensive. There are pearls, sago, and jelly to choose from. Most importantly, the auntie's custard is very delicious, fragrant, and not too sweet. The auntie who sells it is very kind.
review_4_text:
Delicious and affordable, but not sold every day. Prices start at just 20 baht, and custard-filled bread is 15 baht.

The shop is located right by the roadside, and you can park on the side of the road.
They only sell in the evenings.

name: Coffee Cup ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà‡∏Ñ‡∏±‡∏û
review_1_text: This is a lovely little coffee shop, that has very good lattes. It was a staple for us to go there before continuing on to the Sunshine massage school. The owner is so sweet and kind. The coffees were tasty, and very economically priced. Would highly recommend this cute little coffee shop.
review_2_text: My favorite coffee stand! The owner consistently makes the perfect temperature coffees and is so smiley. She's very sweet! The coffees are economically priced and I stop by every day, since it's close to Sunshine Massage School. I will miss her coffee when I leave!
review_3_text:
My favorite place for coffee
Since 3 month I come here just for coffee
Ladies is so sweet smiling üå∏üå∏üå∏
review_4_text:
I love this place for a hot or iced coffee/latte/mocha....
Good service and attention üëç
review_5_text: Great coffee, great prices and friendly staff! My favorite spot to pick up a coffee during my lunch break.

name: O-KAY coffee & tea
review_1_text:
Great little coffee shop, that serves a great Cha Thai. Love the way they make the Tea, especially when you want it hot, it‚Äôs strong enough and not too sweet.
They have a variety of coffees, on the plan to try them.
review_2_text:
Very good coffee, with the option to choose the sugar level and whether you prefer a strong or medium coffee.

I highly recommend it; I was warmly welcomed!

It would be great if they could also add a coconut milk latte to the menu.üòä
review_3_text: Coffee here is way more than ‚Äúo-kay‚Äù, it‚Äôs really great and the prices are super reasonable. The staff is super friendly too. I keep coming back
review_4_text: A very small but friendly coffee shop. Delicious coffee with a choice of sweetness and medium/dark roast and very good value.
review_5_text: Delicious coffee. You can customize it and pick between medium or dark roast. They have non coffee drinks too. Lovely staff as well! Try it out

name: S&P McCormack hospital
review_1_text:
They have snacks, food, and drinks.
The service staff is excellent.
The food is delicious and clean.
review_3_text: This S&P store in the hospital has everything: food, drinks, and bakery items.

name: StarWork Chiangmai
review_1_text:
1 day price 300 Thb/ person.
*No drink is included in this price.

In my opinion, a bit pricey for Thai minimum wage.
However, the environment is pretty clean but there are ppl walking around(not sure if they were customers or staff or residents).

Therefore, if you need a privacy, you can go in the office room (it‚Äôs already included in the daily price).

Overall I rated 4/5, 1 point missing is for the price (my opinion).
review_2_text: I bought a 1-day pass here for 199 THB (included 1 drink from "Caf√© Amazon" ‚òï There are about 15 working desks with comfortable office chairs. The people here worked quietly üëç (I love it because in other co-working spaces I get annoyed of 20 people talking loudly all the time). At this place I can really focus on my work üëç There is soft background music so it's not boring. (I hate loud background music at other cafe's). The staff was helpful and spoke excellent English üëç They close at time 18.00 (like most co-working spaces) ‚òπ
review_3_text: My workplace is wonderful! It's surrounded by greenery and even has a waterfall. We have free meeting rooms, and the people here are really nice.
review_4_text:
I bet this is a great place for co-working if you work 9am-6pm.

If like many remote workers visiting Thailand you have obligations during late evening / early morning hours - do note that the "24 hours access" on the front page of their website is for their "service office" offering only (quoted starting at 1000 THB / day when I visited).

Hot / cold desks and the relatively-cheaper co-working private offices are only available 9-6pm and there is no key card / key code / biometric etc. system for allowing after-hours access as offered by other co-working spaces in Chiang Mai.

4 stars for a beautiful space and a friendly, helpful representative who answered my questions when I arrived in person. -1 star for a wasted trip that could have been saved by a clearer menu of services (and their hours) on the website.
review_5_text: I recommened service office here is super private and cozy. Near 7-11 and cafe Amazon in area not far from Central festival easy to find. Staff are so nice and friendly.

name: Blue Cafe and Apartment service
review_1_text: we stayed here when we came back to Chaing Mai just for 2 nights as it was near the bus station. i wouldn't stay here if I actually wanted to explore Chaing Mai just because of the distance to things. staff were lovely. did think it was strange that it had a kitchenette (hob) but no pans were provided (it didn't state that when we booked it). bed was mega comfy and the room was huge. bathroom was nice with a lovely warm shower.
review_2_text: ‚ô•Ô∏è Best tasting coffee in Chiangmai also only 60THB, They also have a good food selection menu also well priced.
review_3_text:
This place is great.  Excellent prices and a great atmosphere that feels like something I'd see back home in California.

Try it, you won't regret it.
review_4_text: Just stopped for coffee, but it was good, and the cafe had a nice atmosphere.
review_5_text:
Came here just for a bite and to charge the phone.

Food is a bit overpriced. Drinks 70-120 THB, food 80-180.

I got a smoothie for 80 and personal pizza for 165. They were both good, but wouldn't say any better than cheaper places around. The smoothie was kinda too sweet, pizza was nothing to write home about.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text:
Friendly service.  Calm space for a coffee.   Comfortable indoor seating, nice deck for outdoor seating.

Iced capuchino tasty, butter cake fresh.
review_2_text: Really nice coffee and friendly staff. A great place to kill time of you're hanging around the bus station.
review_3_text: Nice coffee shop for a quick stop. Small but ok!
review_4_text: I liked that there were power plugs for phones and notebooks. Not even seats though.
review_5_text:
Staff's good
Taste is up-to standard
Environment is great

name: Cherry Monkey Craft Bar
review_1_text: Great coffee great staff amazing matcha and now with cats.
review_2_text: The location is great, the coffee is aromatic, and the cafe has a beautiful atmosphere. Whenever I visit Chiang Mai, I always make sure to stop by.
review_3_text: Already was here and everything was amazing. But the last time was disappointing. I came 1 hour before closing. The barista was unfriendly, made a to-go drink instead of nice cups they have, even though I didn‚Äôt ask for it. No water. Also I chose middle roasting but got the cheapest dark one. Felt like the barista wanted me to leave quicklyü•¥
review_4_text: Every time I come during the day, the coffee in this shop is very good. I like whisky coffee best.
review_5_text:
You can choose your favorite coffee beans and place an order.
First of all, the coffee is delicious, and the place stands out with its spacious seating and cool air conditioning.

name: CHIC COFFEE &BAR
review_1_text: I drink a lot of coffee and I love the coffee at this place. Excellent dark roast !  The baristas know how to make good coffee.  Very comfortable and quiet inside.
review_2_text:
Tucked away near Khum Paya resort, this is a chilled out spot perfect for your morning coffee - for us vegans/plant-based, the oat milk option here is delicious and iced or hot, you can be assured you‚Äôll have a beautiful drink every time.

The staff are polite, friendly and considerate in every way - affordable, convenient but also serene in amongst a little hustle and bustle of outer Chiang Mai.

Highly recommend!
review_3_text: The atmosphere and coffee here are very nice they make a very good coffee here for coffee lovers. The location is great, with air-conditioned indoor seating and plush chairs, as well as outdoor seating to enjoy your coffee. It's also very well priced.
review_4_text:
Friendly greetings from staff.
My husband ordered a hot cappuccino and I got iced latte we also got cookies.
Everything was nice.

Good chill vibes inside small cafe - clean and quiet.

nice place to sit and enjoy coffee in the morning :)
review_5_text: Great little coffee shop with excellent coffee, mixed drinks and some snacks. Employees are very kind and respectful, would definitely come back here!

name: Chiangmai Christian International Library
review_1_text: Good place to study and read book! Nice service.
review_2_text: This is the space that helped me the most during my month-long stay in Chiang Mai. It has many great books for children and adults, and a recently opened cafe makes it a great place to read with your children. Regardless of religious affiliation, you are worthy of respect for your continued support of Korean residents. Thank you so much for everything you've done.
review_3_text: This library is Chiang Mai's only Korean-style library operated on a membership basis. Upon joining, you pay a one-time annual fee and gain free library access for one year. You can borrow books, use the bookshelves during library hours, and even study at the book caf√©.
review_4_text:
It feels like a collection of only foreign books, so it's actually better than libraries in Korea.
There are so many books!
There are not only Korean books, but also books in English, Chinese, and Thai, so it's incredibly diverse.
There's a separate children's area, which moms like me are simply grateful for.
review_5_text:
The annual fee is cheap, so it is more economical than studying at a cafe. The cafe must have a drink, but if you pay an annual fee, you can always go and spend time comfortably. It is highly recommended. There is also a parking space.

The annual fee is cheap, so it is more economical than studying at a cafe. The cafe must have a drink, but if you pay an annual fee, you can always go and spend time comfortably. It is highly recommended. There is also a parking space.

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: Americano is not good‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. the interior is great and air-conditioned though
review_2_text:
We enjoyed sitting here for a while and working. We ordered fruit smoothies, but surprisingly the available flavors were strawberry and a couple other berries. Not sure if this is an international brand that has to be consistent, but where was mango or dragon fruit or...
You are in Thailand, be proud of your local fruits!
review_3_text:
Too cold
The staff doesn't know how to control the Aircon
review_4_text: Being able to sit outside under the roof in the shade  is for me personally a pro. The coffee is ok.
review_5_text: Still have a nice coffee. Friendly and pleasant customer services.

name: The Extraction CBP
review_1_text: Ning is the best waitress in the world, I wish she worked in England so I could see her everyday! I will miss her beautiful face every time I‚Äôm not with her
review_2_text: Two very milky flat whites and the barista does not know what "magic" is for the third cup.
review_3_text: Very small coffee
review_4_text: A small coffee shop with two types of coffee beans, both delicious and inexpensive. The menu isn't extensive, so don't overthink it. It's very convenient. The shop has one table inside with plugs, one outside, and one on the side of the road. The green tea is quite ordinary.
review_5_text:
The coffee is delicious and aromatic. They've selected good quality coffee beans for you to try, with a variety of options at reasonable prices.
I give it an 8.5/10. Highly recommend it!

name: MEENCOFFEE
review_1_text: Came close to closing time and got a Thai tea to go. She pulled the tea from the espresso machine. The flavour was intense, smooth, and so fragrant. Definitely coming back. Barista was also friendly and warm.
review_2_text: Good vibes with great coffee ‚òïÔ∏è
review_3_text: Great coffee and nice service!
review_4_text: A good cozy cafe with good coffee and friendly staff
review_5_text:
Best value coffee in the neighborhood/area or even Chiang Mai.

I'm a regular customer. I've been visiting daily for a year now.
The owner/barista is always nice to all her customers; I've never experienced an unhappy or unsatisfied customer.
The cafe is clean, cozy, and has a warm atmosphere. Give this place a visit once, and you won't be disappointed with the taste of the coffee or the value. You might even become a regular here.
The coffee tastes great, and considering the price and quality per cup, it's definitely the best value in Chiang Mai. I've been a regular customer for a year, and it's consistently delicious every time. The owner takes great care of the shop, and she has many regular customers who love it. I've never heard of a customer being dissatisfied with the drinks or service from the owner in all the years I've been here.

The shop is clean, and the atmosphere is warm. If you have the chance to try the drinks here, I guarantee you'll become a regular customer.

name: Rise&Bloom Coffee (Star Avenue 7)
review_1_text: I was recommended this spot by a Korean traveler I met in Pai, and I‚Äôm so glad I followed their advice. This isn‚Äôt just a coffee shop; it‚Äôs a masterclass in craft. The owner is incredibly passionate and clearly a specialist in the field‚Äîtheir knowledge of beans and brewing is deep, yet they are so humble and dedicated to supporting local farmers. You can taste the quality and the heart in every cup. If you're looking for a coffee experience that supports the community and satisfies the soul, do not miss this place.
review_2_text: I loved this coffee shop, the coffee tastes amazing and it is from a farm in Pai, that produces small amounts of good quality coffee beans. The owner is very passionate about his job and you can see that reflected in the quality of his products and the ambience of the store. The banana cake made by his girlfriend was delicious. I can‚Äôt wait to be back next time I ll stop by in Chiang Mai.
review_3_text: The coffee is really delicious. I can‚Äôt believe it tastes this good even when brewed with an espresso machine! Next time, I‚Äôd like to try it as a drip coffee. A friend recommended this place, and I‚Äôm glad I came ‚Äî I really enjoyed it.
review_4_text: Cute small coffee shop. Nice barista. I've ordered light roasted cappuccino with oat milk. It was good .
review_5_text: a small, quiet and cosy caf√© near the bus terminal in Chiang Mai. excellent coffee and a small selection of cakes (to eat in or take away).

name: Stan‚Äôs Cafe
