review_1_text: The coffee is very nice, good quality beans. Price is surprisingly very good (50-100baht). Nice atmosphere.
review_2_text: I liked this place. Sat here drinking coffee and drawing for hours, really enjoyed it :)
review_3_text: Really nice coffee shop with super friendly employees! Highly recommend :)
review_4_text: There are a variety of coffees to choose from, and the prices are very cute. The decorations are in a soothing tone, and there's a big teddy bear too. It's really cute! ‚ú®üß∏‚ú®
review_5_text: A very friendly welcome. Delicious coffee, made with love. Delicious cheesecake with various flavors. We were served homemade cantuccini with our coffee. The owners and staff are proud of their business, and rightly so.

name: Charlie ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡∏•‡∏µ Thai Tea ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ BigC Extra
review_1_text:
I'd seen this shop for a while, but just decided to give it a try. My first impression was the wide selection of teas and their different brewing methods. I hadn't thought about the variety and brewing methods of tea (I thought they only had coffee). But learning about the different types of tea, their aromas, and the brewing techniques was a real eye-opener. I chose Surat Thani tea, steeped for 5 minutes, with 25% sweetness. The staff said it was fragrant and intense, so I ordered it. The aroma, rich flavor, and deliciousness made my day!
It might take a little while, though, because the tea needs to be brewed and there may be a lot of online customers. But I encourage you to support me.
review_2_text:
My first experience with Charlie's Iced Tea.
The promotional price is great, both in-store and for delivery. I ordered the Iced Tea (Gold).
It's fragrant, rich, and most importantly, delicious.
The sweetness level is 75%, just right.
Highly recommended.
Ice tea lovers, don't miss this! üß°üß°üß°
review_3_text: Charlie's menu is very fragrant. You can choose Southern/Northern tea. It's topped with salted caramel foam. It's so smooth.
review_4_text: The prices aren't too high, there's a wide selection of teas, and the staff are helpful and provide good information.
review_5_text: The Surat tea is delicious. The staff are lovely and provide good service. They give very good recommendations.ü§üüèº

name: KAMA KAF√â Big C Xtra Chiangmai 2
review_1_text:
A small but well-equipped kiosk located near KBank and Big C.
Diverse menu, affordable prices.
Tried the clear matcha, small size, 54 baht.
The barista said it had seaweed flavor, but personally, I thought it was very green.
Not really seaweed-flavored. They whip the tea with a frothing machine, and it felt a bit starchy, maybe not enough liquid.
Okay for a casual drink.
The shop is pretty and eye-catching, and the prices are surprisingly good.

Take away only.

name: Star Coffee (Supalai Monte)
review_1_text: This quaint cafe is a hidden gem. The owner Mr Lee is a wonderful man who is extremely happy to help you with just about anything you need.  There‚Äôs delicious fruit shakes, coffees, a variety of iced drinks, an assortment of food and so much more.  If you get a chance to stop by be sure to meet the owner and say hello.  He‚Äôs a delightful man and your day will be better and brighter as a result of your visit here üëçüôèü§ó
review_2_text:
Super bitter coffee. I think it is too roasted! You need to change the brand guys üò≥üòü
Tried many times. All the same üòî
review_3_text: The owner is very friendly and helpful. Everything I had on my 3 or 4 visits here was very good. The coffee was always excellent.
review_4_text: Great coffee and great service for a cheap price
review_5_text: Very tasty ! Thank u for the best coco I ever drink!

name: Bakery by Daeng
review_1_text:
While waiting for our bus for Chiang Rai, we got some beverages and bread to go from here.

Their Thai milk tea was good. It has strong tea flavor balanced out by the milk and a little sweetness. Their iced coffee was strong as well. We also bought a few packs of bread. It was good decision and we had something to munch on during the bus long bus ride.

name: Ristr8to Original
review_1_text:
Hot mocha is a must order. Sg mocha is very milky but theirs is house blend.

This one hits different.

Make sure you finish every single drop before you leave.

The barista here is better than SG one in general. Taste the coffee and you‚Äôll know.

My brother in law ordered the cigaretto and he said it‚Äôs nice. You can try it if you want.

If you duno what is what, the menu has the coffee description.

One thing I really kennut is the barista face is way too near to my coffee -.-
Almost breathing into it when doing yo my order: As shown in photo. But whatever.

You can get coffee beans here as well. Haven‚Äôt tried it but you can ask the staff for recommendations.

You can even request to smell the beans before getting it.

Atmosphere is just meh, normal cafe nothing special. Enjoy the coffee and move to next cafe.
review_2_text: With many cafes in Nimman to choose from, Ristr8to has become a firm favourite of mine. I‚Äôve become partial to a Cortado and have to admit I‚Äôve never been let down here. Smooth and strong its made with care and attention. With wonderfully friendly staff, it‚Äôs nice to have somewhere I can call my local cafe. There‚Äôs a lovely ambiance that allows one to sit back, drink nice coffee and let the world drift by. Based on my own experience I can recommend Rist8to.
review_3_text:
There are coffees you drink, and then there are coffees that slow you down.
Ristr8to is firmly in the second category.
The cappuccino here is exceptional ‚Äî beautifully balanced, with a creamy, velvety texture and a depth that tells you the beans have been treated with real respect. The roast leans toward the complex rather than the aggressive: rich chocolate notes, a gentle nuttiness, and a clean finish with just enough acidity to keep things lively, not sharp. You can taste that this is coffee made by people who obsess over details ‚Äî in the best possible way.
What really elevates the experience, though, is the vibe. Sitting here in Nimman, you‚Äôre surrounded by a mix of young locals, creatives, digital nomads, and curious travelers. There‚Äôs a quiet energy to the place ‚Äî laptops open, conversations flowing, tourists pausing mid-walk for ‚Äújust one more coffee.‚Äù It‚Äôs the kind of caf√© where you don‚Äôt feel rushed, and you don‚Äôt feel invisible either.
I found myself doing what this place seems designed for: sitting still, coffee in hand, watching the world pass by. Traffic, footsteps, snippets of languages, sunlight shifting across tables ‚Äî all of it framed by a damn good cup of coffee.
Some caf√©s are about caffeine.
This one is about presence.
If you‚Äôre in Nimman and you care about coffee ‚Äî really care ‚Äî this is not optional. ‚òï
review_4_text: Extensive menu with almost every variety of coffee you can imagine. Tried some of the popular favorite and agree that the coffee is good. Pretty chill ambience with both indoor and outdoor seating. They do have a few food options like waffles but wish there was more. Place only accepts cash.
review_5_text: I first visited this place 9 years ago, and I‚Äôm amazed that they‚Äôve managed to maintain the exact same high standards. The latte art is still as unique and beautiful as ever‚Äîtruly their signature. The vibe is incredible no matter when you visit; it's the perfect spot for a morning caffeine fix, a late brunch, or a relaxing evening coffee.

name: Lot of Taste
review_1_text:
I recently visited Lot of Taste in Chiang Mai and had a great experience.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming, making the atmosphere feel relaxed and comfortable from the moment I walked in. Their service was attentive and warm, which made the visit even more enjoyable.

The drinks were really good ‚Äî well-balanced, refreshing, and nicely presented. You can tell they put care into both the quality and the details.

Overall, it‚Äôs a lovely place to chill, enjoy good drinks, and experience friendly service. I would definitely come back again! üòä
review_2_text:
A much overrated place.

I first tried their cloud latte (130baht). It was simply an iced latte made from decent doi Chang coffee bean, with a low-quality coconut ice cream on top. And both elements had zero synergy in flavors.

Later i decided it to give it a second try since it features quite a few very interesting beans. I ordered a passion-fruit-fermented black (120baht). As opposed to most fruit-enzyme-processed bean which taste exceptionally fruity and characteristic of the fruit used, it was average at best.

And the barista in the afternoon and night gave me different info about their coffee, which is not a sign of well-trained staff.

At a higher-end price in Chiang Mai, this does not meet the cut.
review_3_text: The coffee was delicious, and the cake was equally good! Perhaps it‚Äôs popular because the place is showing signs of wear and tear. I‚Äôd love to return for the coffee.
review_4_text: This coffee shop demonstrates a clear commitment to exceptional coffee brewing and minimal space design. It has attracted a significant number of patrons, both local and international, and benefits from its proximity to the prominent and bustling Nimmanhaemin Road. However, a notable concern arises regarding the placement of the designated smoking area, which is situated near the public pavement. The proximity of this area allows cigarette smoke to disperse, potentially affecting pedestrians and motorcyclists passing by. I urge the owner of this establishment to consider their social responsibility in this matter, as the current arrangement may negatively impact the health of others. While the coffee quality is commendable, individuals prioritizing social responsibility may wish to re-evaluate their patronage of this establishment.
review_5_text: I had a flat white with oat milk take away - great coffee, good vibes of the cafe. I didn't get a chance to chill at the cafe, but it looked good, modern and reasonably priced. My coffee was 80 plus 20 for oat milk. They didn't have any vegan foods/bakery to offer which was a con, but good overall.

name: fimue
review_1_text: A beautiful caf√© with lovely decoration. The place feels like an antique house, full of vintage furniture and old objects, which gives it a very special charm. I ordered a sesame latte and it was delicious. They also had a tiramisu that I didn‚Äôt try, but it looked amazing. The staff was absolutely charming üç™üç∞‚òï
review_2_text: Had dirty coffee and latte. Very Good coffee! The Owner delivered Tiramisu on our table with a big tray, which makes it feels quite a special service and freshly made cake . Love the ambiance. Very nice deco! They also made drinking water with lemon in it available for the guesses to help themselves. We feel welcomed. Enjoyed our time there! Thank you!
review_3_text: Very nice coffee shop. Unfortunately many people think so. The place was packed with people posing for pictures. But ok. They do sell a lot of cute knock knacks. It‚Äôs worth checking out. The coffee was ok. Not exceptional. But the matcha madeleine was great. Moist and too sweet.
review_4_text:
One of my top cafe experiences in Chiangmai. They also have a super cute shop cat (Messi who is super sweet and friendly), and the cafe is separated into a sitting area and a store area. The cafe sells various trinkets including mother of pearl jewellery and ceramic or glass home goods including little spoons. They also sell home fragrances!

Our drinks were good - Americano was really great (note that hey have no decaf - which seems to be common in Chiang Mai). The strawberry latte was really good and they let me change to oat milk but I‚Äôd say it was a little too sweet for me. Still, very much worth going!
review_5_text: Highly recommend the cinnamon roll! Its one of the best i have had. Not too sweet, fragrant cinnamon and texture is unlike those fluffy rolls, its abit more densed. The tiramisu is very good as well! Would recommend.

name: KLƒÄY cafe
review_1_text:
KLAY Caf√© is such a beautiful hidden gem in Chiang Mai. The moment you step in, you‚Äôll feel the calm, minimalist vibe ‚Äî warm wood tones, natural textures, soft lighting, and thoughtful interior design that makes the whole space feel cozy yet modern. It‚Äôs the kind of caf√© where you just naturally slow down and enjoy your meal.

We tried a few dishes and everything was beautifully plated and full of flavour:

Smoked Salmon & Eggs Toast
The toast was soft and buttery, topped with generous slices of fresh salmon and perfectly runny eggs. The mix of pickles, tomatoes, and passionfruit on the side added a bright, refreshing balance. Loved how satisfying yet light it was.

Thai Beef Salad
A colourful bowl with tender slices of beef, sweet oranges, juicy tomatoes, red onions, and a nice kick from fresh chili. It‚Äôs refreshing with a nice balance of sweet, tangy, and mildly spicy ‚Äî great for brunch or a hot day.

Besides the food, the caf√© also has a small curated retail corner with skincare and lifestyle products, adding a boutique feel to the place. It‚Äôs a lovely spot for brunch, a slow afternoon coffee, or even just to chill and enjoy the aesthetic environment.

Overall, KLAY Caf√© is definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai ‚Äî delicious food, beautiful ambience, and a very inviting atmosphere.
review_2_text:
I haven‚Äôt tried the food yet but I‚Äôve come here several times for drinks and the atmosphere and I love this place.

The staff are super friendly and cool and the interior is beautiful minimal, warm brown/beige tones, very Japanese-inspired. Perfect for anyone who appreciates calm, aesthetic caf√©s. It has indoor and outdoor seatings.

It‚Äôs a small space but very well located in the middle of Nimman. A great spot to stop by, refresh and just enjoy the vibe.
review_3_text: I came to Klay Cafe for breakfast because I wanted something healthy, well-priced and delicious. I got the colorful tropical smoothie bowl which was perfectly balanced in taste and texture. Sometimes bowls can be too sweet, too runny, or sometimes - too cold. This one was just right. However, the tropical bowl wasn‚Äôt the highlight‚Ä¶it was the coffee. I had one of the best flat whites I‚Äôve ever had. It was silky - like sipping a coffee liqueur without the alcohol or overwhelming sweetness. I‚Äôll definitely be back to try some other things on the menu.
review_4_text: The best breakfast we had in Chiang Mai. I think the pictures speak for themselves but they have a great range of dishes in a beautiful setting. The service is slightly slow but it doesn‚Äôt take away from the food and the atmosphere. Great coffee and French toast!
review_5_text:
I‚Äôd heard several people recommend this place, so I had to check it out, and I honestly don‚Äôt understand the hype.

The place was packed, and we ended up sharing a table with three different people during our time there. The chairs and table were wobbly, and even the slightest movement shook the whole table and almost spilled the drink. The food took ages to arrive.
The food itself was fine - nothing amazing, nothing terrible.

The good parts? The prices are good, the staff is very friendly, and they clear tables quickly.

name: Roast8ry Coffee Lab
review_1_text: Nice little coffee shop near One Nimman, within walking distance. Their coffee was unique and interesting. If you want to try something different, this place is a fun one to visit. I went before lunchtime, and it was very busy, but the line moved pretty fast.
review_2_text: Excellent coffee with stunning latte art. Drinks are smooth, well-balanced, and made with real skill. The space is relaxed with both indoor and outdoor seating perfect for anyone who truly appreciates quality coffee.
review_3_text: Coffee was amazing - had the flat white with art, husband had restretto, pricing was good for us but we‚Äôre from London so used to it üòÇ worth it! Guys working there are lovely - lab is nice to sit and enjoy some time in the day.  Award winning - worth a stop if you‚Äôre in the area!!
review_4_text:
This legendary spot is highly recommended for all coffee lovers. Make this (or its sister spot) a must visit. The cafe is located on a fairly quiet Soi in what appears to be an affluent neighborhood.

Absolutely beautiful coffee and friendly team that are always smiling
review_5_text: The baristas here are highly trained and act like chemists. They are happy to explain the beans' origin and the science behind the pour. However, because of its fame, it can get quite crowded. You might have to wait for a seat, and it‚Äôs not really the type of place where you‚Äôd sit for hours with a laptop. You go there for the art and the taste.

name: FOHHIDE
review_1_text:
Hidden little gem.
Sadly, a lot of digital nomads/tourist know that place and take a lot of space to ‚Äûwork‚Äú.
Besides that, their staff is very friendly and helpful. Their Menu is pretty variable and their beans taste good.
And the view‚Ä¶its amazing to start your day with a view over jungly mountain ‚õ∞Ô∏è
review_2_text: Great cafe !!! Super highly recommended. Nice balanced taste of all the flavors. I recommend medium roast. Great taste coffee and an incredible mountain views! It is located on the 5th floor, tiny little elevator up to 5th floor. They use Slayer espresso machine and mahlkonig grinders. They serve light and medium roast.
review_3_text: A true hidden gem in Nimman! The coffee is excellent (highly recommend the Dirty Coffee), and the mountain view from the 5th floor is breathtaking. Bonus: the baristas are very handsome and friendly! 10/10 vibes.
review_4_text:
Fohhide is a must-visit coffee shop in Chiang Mai, living up to its name ("Full of Happiness Hiding"). Tucked away on the 5th floor of a building in Nimmanhaemin Soi 5, it's an elevated oasis.
The coffee is exceptional‚Äîtry a signature espresso mocktail like the "Bua Phen" or the popular Dirty Latte. The real draw, however, is the stunning panoramic view of Doi Suthep from the balcony.
How to Get There:
Find the building entrance on Nimmanhaemin Soi 5. Look for the small elevator or take the stairs up to the 5th floor. It‚Äôs worth the short, hidden journey for the incredible view and quality brew. The atmosphere is peaceful, chic, and perfect for a slow morning.
review_5_text:
A coffee shop in the heart of Nimmanhaemin, with a great atmosphere and great coffee.
A coffee shop where you can relax and enjoy the view of Nimmanhaemin. The atmosphere is great. I ordered the Dirty coffee, which was incredibly smooth and affordable. This shop has a great style.
I'll definitely be back again.

name: Toffee Roasters
review_1_text:
THB70 for the quickest Iced Americano in the world. While it doesn't seem like there would be a lot of space for you to stay, it's highly recommended for those who need their coffee right away and have somewhere else to go.

I'm not fancy enough to go connoisseur with beans so whatever the house blends is fine with me.
review_2_text:
I visited this caf√© in September 2025 and had a hot latte, which turned out to be excellent. At that time, they were using a blend of Brazilian, Thai, and Ethiopian beans, and the coffee was truly delicious.

The flavor was rich, the temperature was perfectly managed‚Äînot too hot and not too cold, just right for a good latte‚Äîand it was really smooth. Inside, the atmosphere is very minimalist. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs very suitable for working on a laptop, as the tables are quite low and small. But it‚Äôs definitely a nice spot to chill.

They play music, serve bread and snacks, and there are even beds. So I recommend this place to anyone who just wants to enjoy a great latte without overthinking it.

For more travel tips and hidden gems, check out my Instagram: @hichem_airways
review_3_text: Great place to experience high standard quality coffee. They are knowledgeable of coffee culture beyond just serving coffee beverages, and we talked about Ethiopian coffee varieties. The almond orange cake was fresh and full of flavours. Congrats!
review_4_text:
Great coffee, we tried 1 hot filter & 1 dirty. One of the best dirty coffee i've tried during our trip in Thailand (i tried at least 20 dirty in every coffeeshop üòÜ).
The hot filter is clean & good acidity.
review_5_text:
Rating: 100/10!
The service and staff are super lovely! ü©∑

This caf√© offers free water (love that üòÜ).
Drinks are good:
‚Ä¢	Green tea ‚Äî mild and a bit seaweed-like, not bitter.
‚Ä¢	Orange juice ‚Äî just okay.
‚Ä¢	Banana bread ‚Äî tasty and not too sweet!

Reasonable price and highly recommended!ü´∂

name: TANN
review_1_text: Very hip and nice coffeeshop / runners shop. They also sell running equipment (not shoes). The coffee shop is a bit hidden and quite small. But they have a nice outdoor seating area. Although it‚Äòs a bit messy too. Sandwiches are very tasty and coffee is good. Staff can be very nice. Depends on who you end up with.
review_2_text: The shop is nice and calm. The staff knows things well about coffee. This is my personal preference that I didn‚Äôt like sour coffee but if you like fruity and sour coffee, you will like this place. Nice outdoor seating.
review_3_text: the vibes / atmosphere of the cafe was nice, calm and relaxing. One of the best places to have a slow morning with a coffee in your hand. The coffee was nice as well. Ordered dirty latte and mocha. I prefer the dirty latte tho. the tuna melts was good as well, delicious !
review_4_text: Stayed nearby Tann coffee during my stay in Chiang Mai and I was there for 3 days consecutively. The coffee was incredible and aromatic, food wise was tasty as well. I ordered the ham and cheese sourdough - crispy, full of flavors and kept you wanting for more. Sourdough with scrambled eggs was simple yet homely. Highly recommend this cozy cafe!
review_5_text:
A nice, simple cafe that opens from 7am onwards. Offering a unique but rather simple menu in term of drink and food.

Espresso, Americano are nice but choose the right one roast will make a big difference.

Love their ham cheese sandwich. Very crunchy sourdough bread with thick cheese applied on top

name: 7 Senses Gelato
review_1_text:
I‚Äôve been to 7 Senses Gelato many times, and it‚Äôs one of those places that I always find myself coming back to. üç® The shop offers a wide selection of flavors, from classic options to creative seasonal ones. Every time I visit, I try to discover a new favorite, though I have to admit that most of the flavors are quite sweet for my personal taste since I don‚Äôt eat much sugar. However, my company ‚Äî whether my friend or boyfriend ‚Äî always enjoys them a lot, so it‚Äôs a great spot to share something sweet together.

The shop provides free drinking water, which I find very thoughtful, especially after eating gelato. The staff are a bit shy but always kind, polite, and ready to help. The atmosphere is peaceful and quiet, perfect for sitting down to enjoy a slow afternoon in Chiang Mai.

The location is convenient but not ideal for car parking since the street is quite small; however, it‚Äôs easy to park a motorbike nearby. I usually order one or two scoops each visit.

Overall, it‚Äôs a charming little gelato shop that serves great flavors with a friendly vibe. Definitely recommended!
review_2_text: Absolutely delicious gelato! There are so many tasty flavors to choose from ‚Äî everything looked amazing, and the ones I tried were creamy, rich, and full of flavor. You can really tell they use high-quality ingredients. The staff were friendly and patient while I was deciding (which was hard because everything looked so good!). The place itself is cute and inviting, perfect for a little treat on a warm day. Definitely worth stopping by if you‚Äôre in the area! üç¶üíõ
review_3_text:
WOW!!!! Amazing gelato, owner is Italian and the gelato is excellent quality, really unique and delicious flavour combinations.

I was hoping to try the famous ricotta and caramelized fig but they had sold out. I had the ricotta and pear instead, which was excellent, as was the strawberry cheesecake. I also got the salted caramel (normally my favourite) but I thought it was lacking in flavour a little (compared with the amazing taste of the other flavours. They also had take away tubs available in a freezer.
Great environment, indoor and outdoor seating.

I‚Äôd love if they had small scoop options as I wanted to try lots of flavors but the scoops were too big!! I‚Äôll just have to come back!!
review_4_text:
üç¶ The ice cream is absolutely delicious ‚Äì creamy, flavorful, and clearly made with care. I‚Äôd happily come back for the taste alone!
That said, I‚Äôm giving 4 out of 5 stars because it‚Äôs a bit pricey, and they don‚Äôt accept card payments. Only cash, Alipay, or LINE Pay are available ‚Äì which isn‚Äôt ideal for everyone. Still, a great place for a sweet treat if you're prepared!
review_5_text:
Nice place for gelato. They have many flavor for you to choose and enough space to sit indoor or outdoor.
The ice-cream portion is big and cup filled accordingly.

name: GRAPH ground
review_1_text:
I asked the staff member for their top recommendation, and he suggested the Monochrome with natural charcoal, describing it as delicious and distinctive. The shop itself has a clean, modern atmosphere that adds to the overall experience.

I have edited this post several times, as I visit the caf√© daily and try a different coffee each time. Today, I tried the Sompetch with orange, and it was excellent
review_2_text: Good and fancy coffee shop. There are several Graph coffee shops in Chiang Mai. I only visited this one. I tried the coffee and bought some beans to take home. We also bought some cute cups. Unfortunately we just had breakfast before. There was no room for pastries. But they surely look good! Next time for sure.
review_3_text:
Graph Ground is one of those caf√©s that makes you stop at the door and go, ‚ÄúOkay, this place knows what it‚Äôs doing.‚Äù*It‚Äôs industrial-modern in the best possible way ‚Äî dark tones, concrete and metal textures, clean lines, and a quiet, creative atmosphere. It feels like the meeting point of urban coffee culture and Chiang Mai craftsmanship, and it pulls that identity off perfectly.

What I Tried

Wildweekend Seasonal Blend
Local Chiang Mai beans with:

* Tropical fruit acidity
* Bergamot notes
* A yogurt-like tang
* Sweet, clean finish

Aromatic, slightly fermented in character, beautifully balanced. One of those coffees where you keep smelling the cup between sips.

Breaking Brown (Espresso Cold Brew + Almond Milk)

* Smooth but deep espresso flavor
* Almond milk adding natural sweetness
* Very ‚Äúthird-wave Chiang Mai‚Äù

Honestly, this one surprised me the most ‚Äî soft, layered, and extremely easy to drink. A comfort coffee but with personality.

Overall Experience

Graph Ground was the perfect choice for today. Calm, design-focused, and serious about its coffee. It captures Chiang Mai‚Äôs modern side in such a clean, stylish way that sitting here instantly puts you in a good headspace.
review_4_text:
Service - 4.5 stars

Seaweed coffee cocktail - 4.5 stars
The seaweed was fragrant and the savoury umami flavour balanced the coffee well. I'm not usually a fan of coffee cocktails but this was well done!

6oz white
Khun chang kian - 4 stars

Huay chom phu - 4 stars

Both were pretty delicate. No obvious notes in the white coffees. Reliable WiFi and clean bathroom.
review_5_text: Recently, the quality of coffee in northern Thailand has dramatically improved, and Thai coffee beans also have a distinct flavor. There are many good cafes in town, and this cafe is one of them. If you like coffee, you‚Äôll like this cafe. They‚Äôre serious about the coffee they serve.

name: Manifreshto Cafe & Restaurant
review_1_text:
I walked around my neighbourhood while i came across this restaurant. I saw from the outside something which hyped me really up: ‚Äûfree range eggs‚Äú, and you can taste that these chickens actually got some sunlight and could enjoy life.
Besides that they look for their ingredients, real cheese, real meat, real eggs,‚Ä¶ their staff is super friendly and kind.
The food was also very good. You can create your own ‚Äûbreakfast‚Äú which is pretty convenient.
10/10
review_2_text: This restaurant was in a very convenient location and seemed full of tourists. I liked the idea that the food was farm to table. We had both the regular and beef Benedict‚Äôs along with a healthy vegetable and fruit smoothie. You could tell everything was made with high quality ingredients and the smoothie tasted very good. The Benedict‚Äôs both tasted really good, but not mind-blowing. Price is a bit higher than other spots.
review_3_text: I was wandering around Nimman  and saw the pulled pork on their menu and knew I had to stop in to try it. I‚Äôve been in Thailand for 6 weeks and was missing some of my favorite foods from the states. This meal did not disappoint! The pork was on a mini hot skillet still sizzling when it came to the table. The presentation was lovely. The pork had a light sauce on it and just a tiny bit spicy. The toast was warm and perfect! So tasty!! Aroi maak maak! I think this was one of  my favorite Meals I‚Äôve had in Thailand  so far, in that it gave me a taste of home but with the high level of quality and presentation the Thais are known for. Highly recommend.
review_4_text:
Good cafe for all day breakfast & they also served some german food, some local beers & all of it looks good but I don't try it. I came only in the morning for breakfast.

You can create your own breakfast & mostly is very good.
Baked potatoes: 5/5
Crispy bacon: 5/5 (well cooked, crispy & flavourful)
English Breakfast Sausage: 4/5
Croissant: 3/5 (a bit chewy & not so crispy)
Scramble egg: 5/5 (cooked perfectly, still moist, creamy & balanced)
Omelette: 5/5 (perfectly cooked).

The environment is also very nice, you can seat indoor or outdoor. The temperature in Chiang Mai is perfect for this kind of setup. It's also a great place to hangout with small circle
review_5_text:
Top-tier brunch spot in Chiang Mai üç≥ü•ó

We found ourselves at Manifreshto every morning of our stay and it was always a win. From the fresh juices and smoothie bowls to the all-day breakfasts and paninis, the ingredients tasted real and the flavour was next level.  Ôøº

The atmosphere? Laid-back, friendly and comfortable. The team genuinely cares about what they serve, you can see they‚Äôve put real effort into sourcing clean ingredients, and the mood is just easy-going and welcoming.  Ôøº

If you‚Äôre in the Nimmanhaemin area and want a place where you feel looked after, with great food, great service and good vibes, this is it. Will definitely be coming back üôå

name: Always LOAF U Nimman Soi.17
review_1_text:
Always LOAF U at Nimman Soi 17 is such a great spot if you‚Äôre into good coffee and pastries. We tried the classic croissant and the matcha strawberry croissant, both served warm with a perfectly flaky, buttery crust. The matcha strawberry croissant really stood out. We enjoyed the tartness of the strawberry paired beautifully with the slightly bitter matcha. It was a well balanced and unique combination.

I also ordered a cappuccino with oat milk, and it was creamy, smooth, and generously sized, which I really appreciated. It is a bit on the pricier side, my cappuccino with oat milk came out to 110 baht, but honestly, it was delightful and worth it.

The atmosphere is very inviting, with soothing music and an amazing pastry selection. There were so many options that it was hard to limit ourselves to just two. Overall, this is a must-stop for a quality cappuccino with oat milk and a great pastry when you‚Äôre in the area.
review_2_text: Such a cozy place! The staff is lovely, the coffee is great, and the selection of desserts is so huge that it‚Äôll take you forever to choose. We tried the croissant, the lemon tart, and the strawberry cream cake in a container ‚Äî everything was absolutely delicious! If you mix the warm croissant with the cream from the cake, it‚Äôs pure magic. The breakfasts are huge and look beautiful. We‚Äôre so happy with everything, thank you! üôè
review_3_text: Delicious at first bite! We had the best experience eating at this quaint cafe. The pastries are light and delightful and not too sweet ‚Äî very French! And beautifully decorated. The staff were very friendly  too. The cafe offers indoor and outdoor seating, and believe it or not there‚Äôs parking for cars one block away. As we were leaving we spotted the certificate from Le Cordon Bleu on the wall, which explains the craft and quality of both food and atmosphere.
review_4_text: Nice cafe offering a large selection of bakery, hot food, and hot/cold drinks. Seating outdoors and indoors with a beautiful Christmas display at the front. Attentive staff with items thoughtfully packaged for take-out. Crepe layer cake and coconut cake was delicious; will definitely be back and try their other offerings in the future.
review_5_text:
It becomes one of my favorite patisseries in Chiang Mai as it‚Äôs baked perfectly with great ingredients and smells so good. Owners and staff are so friendly and give a warm welcome. I had breakfast before (Sourdough with Salmon), which was good. This time I only take away croissants and croissant pops which are my fav now. Croissant is baked beautifully to have a crispy outside while inside so soft.
Located on Nimman Road which is easily walkable from my hotel. It closes on Monday.

name: CHARLIE THAI TEA x KAME KAFE - Nimman Soi9
review_1_text:
Go grab a tea here.. like yesterday üòÖ

I'm usually not a fan of expensive "Instagram cafes", but this one is worth the price tag!
They have a wiiiiide variety of different teas (including green tea, red tear, black tea, Cylon etc) all regionally sourced within Thailand.

They also have a ton of super nice looking and even more delicious Thai tea creation! You'll chosose yiur own tea, vrewing time and sweetness. Really worth testing it out

Unfortunately, they do not offer non-dairy milk options (no oat, almond or other plant based  milk), otherwise this would have been an easy 5 stars for me
review_2_text:
Cute cafe in the Nimman neighbourhood that serves up incredible Thai milk teas.
They have the option to customise which tea (which you can also smell before you order), sweetness level and brew time to decide how intense the tea flavour is.
We went with the servers recommendations and opted for the OG and the Charlie with the Chiang Rai Gold and Songkhla tea options. 50% sweetness was more than enough for us (probably would choose 25% sweetness in the future). Would highly recommend both drinks as a cute relaxing cafe date.
review_3_text: This is the best Thai tea I‚Äôve had in Thailand so far! When you order the Soft Latte Thai Tea, you can choose the type of tea leaves you want, which makes it even better. The tea aroma comes through gently in the drink, and it tastes amazing. I also added an espresso shot to the Mint Choco Latte, and it was incredibly good too! If you‚Äôre a mint-choco lover, I highly recommend it!
review_4_text: The best Thai tea I've ever had. My favourite is OG, and you can choose the tea you like. I tried some and all of them are amazing!
review_5_text:
Such a great find!
This Thai milk tea shop uses no artificial coloring, and the tea still looks beautiful and tastes amazing.
They offer a wide variety of drinks, and every one I tried was full of flavor and made with care.
I loved it so much ‚Äî I could honestly come back every day.
Highly recommended for anyone who appreciates real ingredients and great taste.

name: The Barisotel by The Baristro
review_1_text:
THIS IS FOR THE COFFEE SHOP

A hostel and coffee shop combined - something you see quite often in Nimman, and very convenient. They offer a good selection of different coffee roasts and also sell beans to take home. I tried one of the pastries as well and really enjoyed it.

There‚Äôs seating both indoors and outdoors, with the outdoor area being my clear preference. The atmosphere inside feels a bit stiff, but overall it‚Äôs a nice spot for good coffee and a relaxed break.
review_2_text:
Walked into this cafe and instantly felt like I stepped into a dream. The all-white theme is surreal and calming, perfect for both relaxing and working. I had the English breakfast, which was genuinely authentic and satisfying, followed by a cappuccino and an espresso shot both were spot on.

I spent around 3‚Äì5 hours upstairs working and the vibe was quiet, peaceful, and very Instagrammable. Though the Wi-Fi lagged a bit at times, the overall experience was still excellent. Would totally come back for the aesthetic, the food, and the chill atmosphere.
review_3_text:
I come here almost every day. Work gets done very efficiently, and the staff are extremely kind and thoughtful.
The Wi-Fi connection is stable, and the white-themed d√©cor gives it a stylish feel.
The entrance has a distinctly Japanese aesthetic, and the matcha is served in the traditional Japanese style, making it feel as though I‚Äôm in Japan.
review_4_text:
Beautiful Spot, Disappointing Food Quality

I visited today with a friend after high recommendations, and while the venue is absolutely beautiful and highly photogenic, the food was a big letdown.
Our items were stale and tasted old. My friend‚Äôs scone was dry and crumbling. My House Roti was mainly whipped cream and didn't taste fresh. The quality was far below cheaper street food options. We left both plates unfinished.
Sadly, I won't be returning unless the quality of the pastries and desserts drastically improves
review_5_text:
Review the caf√©, not the hotel.
Food itself was quite good overall.
Staff can improve in the service itself though and even make a buck out of it. Adapting small things that are not on the menu won't hurt really

name: Coffee inc nimman
review_1_text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
A hidden gem in Nimman! üíñ The coffee here is amazing ‚Äî I had the Americano (60 baht) with a lovely toasty, nutty flavor that really stood out.

Both the indoor and outdoor seating areas are cozy and relaxing, making it a perfect spot to chill, catch up with friends, or get some work done. Highly recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre in the area! Many good photos spots and instagrammable.
review_2_text: 10/10 My wife and I come here every single day!! Coffee is great, service by faii is the best!! Love her so much shes so sweet and good at her job! üíïüíï They also sell snus for a good price if you need! :)
review_3_text:
‚òï‚ú® Hidden gem in Nimman!
This caf√© has such a cozy and peaceful vibe ‚Äî chill interior, soft international tunes playing in the background, and the perfect spot to relax or get some work done.

Tried their mocha with 25% sweetness today and wow‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs exactly the flavor I was craving! Definitely adding this place to my list of go-to caf√©s in the area.
‚≠ê 9.5/10

P.S. The AC could be a bit cooler, so if you‚Äôre coming straight from the hot sun, you might still feel a touch warm.
review_4_text: It was a great Saturday. I've been here twice this week. I love the Thai-style mango sticky rice cookies; they're not too sweet. My boyfriend and I ordered some to go with our hot cappuccinos. We'll definitely be back.
review_5_text: Romano Tonic is refreshing and delicious!Simple and good vibe going on there. Sofas near to the window look so cozy. Not too busy so comfortable to sit and relax. Many type of snus are available!!

name: FRIENDS CAFE
review_1_text:
A small, cute caf√© located right in the heart of Nimman, just in front of Stay Collection Hotel. I ordered the coconut coffee and it was surprisingly good! My friend tried the Thai-espresso and it was also very nice and flavorful.

Even though the caf√© is right by the main street and there‚Äôs a bit of noise, you can still talk comfortably ‚Äî though it might be more suitable for a quick grab-and-go. Overall, I really enjoyed it and would definitely come back again!
review_2_text:
Nice little coffee pop up shop.
Its always pretty full, i mean you have 4 seats, and yes they are likely to be full.
Still a great little cafe especially if you just want to to grab to go.
Only minus, it is a bit pricey in my opinion for such a small place.
review_3_text:
Seriously loved this spot! Got the Americano (medium and dark roasts) and the coffee was so good, legit flavor and perfect for a quick boost.

The staff super friendly and welcoming.

It's a small coffee stand but they have a nice little chill area out front. Great vibes for a quick break.

PS. You'll have to find street parking, so plan accordingly.
review_4_text: The taste is good, and I like the slightly heavy texture of the latte. The large ice cubes help maintain the original flavor, allowing me to enjoy it continuously.
review_5_text:
Simple outdoor cafe, order a latte and boss just ask to pay whatever you want.
Nice way of doing business and customer will value it by the quality.

The latte was nice, accurate temperature, nice note, smooth. I almost finish it within 1 mins I have it

name: % Arabica Chiang Mai One Nimman
review_1_text: Such a great cup of coffee with an amazing selection of pour overs, lattes, Americanos, and everything else! The service is also wonderful and the crew were very helpful. This coffee shop is located in One Nimann in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Definitely a must try.
review_2_text: Good coffee, nice staff, but extremely expensive, and probably the least welcoming cafe design I have ever seen. I would say this place is suited for those who want to take well-lit instagram photos, and maybe coffee snobs (I am not equipped to assess if their coffee is high quality enough to justify the price), but definitely not for hanging out or getting work done. Chairs on the second floor are mostly little stools, very uncomfortable, and as far as I can tell, there are no outlets. There is also no washroom in the store, but the OneNimman one is not too far away. Bring back cozy cafes!!
review_3_text: Such a lovely atmosphere! I love the mix of Lanna-style decor and the quiet surroundings. The staff were super friendly and the service was spot-on. Coffee was smooth and delicious‚Äîclassic Arabica quality.
review_4_text: I just stopped here for a short break and ordered a latte. The coffee here is considerably more expensive than at other coffee shops, but thankfully the ambiance is decent.
review_5_text: Seems like a chain (I also saw it in Beijing). A bit more pricey than usual, but the coffee had a unique taste ‚Äî rich and smooth. I really enjoyed it.

name: Krema Cafe
review_1_text: Good coffee shop with nice pastries. The place is quite small. Only a few tables inside and a couple more outside. It feels a bit odd sitting inside. Maybe just because I was by myself when I came here. And it was super quiet. But prices are fair and the guy who worked here was very nice. And I liked the lemon tart.
review_2_text:
We came here specifically for the pistachio tart, and left highly satisfied. While it's on the pricier side for its size, we found that the quality of the flavor was worth it. The flavor is rich and you can take your time to savor it.

As for the drinks, the cheese cream strawberry latte was really, really good too. It tastes like a strawberry shortcake in liquid form and had real chunks of strawberry. The coffee was just okay for me, but it worked well as a palate cleanser to help appreciate the sweetness of the tart.

For an upscale dessert, Krema is an absolute yes.
review_3_text: Absolutely lovely caf√© with a calm, elegant atmosphere. The desserts are beautifully presented and taste just as amazing as they look‚Äîfresh, well-balanced, and not overly sweet. The coffee is smooth and perfectly crafted, making it a great pairing with the pastries. I really enjoyed the cozy, minimalist d√©cor; it‚Äôs a perfect spot to relax, catch up with friends, or enjoy some quiet time. Friendly service and great attention to detail. Highly recommended!
review_4_text: This place is so good. I highly recommend the treats here, not too sweet and so fresh, but for the coffee a bit too light for me anyway, I can't wait to go back and try so many other treats
review_5_text: Such a cool little cafe with almost dessert-like coffees. I would recommend - it‚Äôs a pretty place to stop at in the heat and humidity!

name: KanVela Craft Chocolate x Bangpun Coffee Bar
review_1_text:
Kanvela Craft Chocolate Cafe is a nice place to visit if you love chocolate drinks and a calm caf√© atmosphere.

The caf√© is easy to find and has a friendly, relaxed feeling when you walk in.

Plenty of table and space, which is simple and cozy, with indoor and outdoor seating. It is a good place to sit with friends, study, or enjoy some quiet time alone.

I ordered a 100% craft chocolate that cost 128 THB. The drink was served hot with a smooth and creamy texture and no sugar added, so I could really taste the pure chocolate flavor. It was rich, warm, and comforting, and I felt it was a high-quality chocolate drink.

The caf√© also served the drink with a cookie and a cup of hot tea, which made the experience even better. The cookie was soft and sweet, and the hot tea balanced the strong chocolate taste nicely. But if you don't like pure chocolate they also offer a light chocolate as well.

The staff were polite and served everything with care. They explained the menu and made sure my order was just right. The prices are ok compared to the quality of the chocolate and the nice service make it worth it. (THB100-130)

Overall, Kanvela Craft Chocolate Cafe is a great place for chocolate lovers who want a special, delicious drink and a quiet place to relax.
review_2_text: Great products. Been in love with their multiple choices of products and flavour since I visited the branch in Bangkok. Really spacious here. Much bigger and quieter than Bkk with some parking spaces. Same quality of chocolate. Good standards.
review_3_text: As a big admirer of Kanvela and its amazing chocolate i visited that place. The pralines were amazing, especially the mulled wine. As a chocolate maker from Switzerland i have to say this chocolate is absolutely my favourite one in Thailand, the quality is on its top also the story behind it. Definitely come back and if someone want a really amazing hot chocolate which is absolutely outstanding in Thailand you have to visit here
review_4_text: Delicious chocolates and drinks, beautiful interior, and wonderful service! The guava with chile and salt was some of the best chocolate I have ever tasted. I also tried the taro and coconut, macadamia and biscoff, and green apple - all were gorgeously decorated and sinfully sweet. They have a nice selection of drinks ranging from hot chocolates (using their chocolates, of course) to coffees and teas to juices. There are also many packaged goods that make great gifts for others, or snacks for yourself later! You can sample the chocolate bars, and I loved the strong strawberry flavor of the white chocolate and strawberry bar. There are many other unique chocolate flavors as well, like cereal milk, honey, and some local blends. The women working today were so kind and helpful with their recommendations. I enjoyed my experience sitting among their large plants and savoring each bite or sip of decadent chocolate! If you are on the fence about visiting, let this be your sign to go!
review_5_text: Drinks were not up to our expectation and chocolate was on the light rather than rich side. All drinks were served in plastic glasses. Would be nice if reusable glasses can be used for dine-in. The caf√© is spacious, decor is nice and it is relatively quiet.

name: nana puzzle & coffee
review_1_text: I really like all puzzles here Ôºåmany interesting brands from all over the world Ôºånice coffeeÔºåtasty croissant Ôºåfrom the balconyÔºåyou can have good view Ôºåjust enjoy sunsetÔºåand sometimes airplane pass byÔºåit‚Äôs hard to find this kind of cafe around nimman RD
review_2_text:
A cute new cafe upstairs with puzzles over large tables ‚Ä¶ sometimes you start your own and sometimes you continue on someone else‚Äôs puzzle.
On the menu are various hot and cold drinks, served in unique cups. Wish there were more drink options and maybe also some snacks?
The staff is absolutely lovely and it‚Äôs a great place to spend an afternoon‚Ä¶
review_3_text:
STRONGLY RECCOMENDED - Very good afternoon spent here, the place is chill and has good coffee and drinks. You can play puzzle and have a nice time inside!
Plus the staff is very friendly :)
review_4_text: A new place with very good coffee and atmosphere, loved the puzzle concept!
review_5_text: Hot Latte so good

name: Nimman Forest Cafe ‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏ô ‡∏ü‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏™ ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: I had a thai tea and food:) They were delicious! I had a great time:) All the staff are very kind and friendly. Highly recommend:)
review_2_text:
Hello guys, welcome to everyone.
If you guys come at Chiangmai don‚Äôt know how to sleep and can connect this Nimman forest and cafe it‚Äôs very g beautiful hotel and sweet cafe..it‚Äôs cheaper and get free coffeeüòçüòç
review_3_text: Great coffee, nice atmosphere.  The staff is very nice.
review_4_text: Hidden but worth finding great food and prices friendly workers.
review_5_text: The bedroom is clean, the bed is comfortable, and there are shared male and female bathrooms. The male staff member was helpful. Overall, it's good. It's close to Nimmanhaemin Market, with many cafes and restaurants, including some with live music. The atmosphere is nice, and the price is good. Breakfast is not included. The style is simple and chic loft. There's no parking, so you might want to ask the shops if there is any. There's a cafe downstairs with average-tasting food.

name: MOO Coffee & Bar @One Nimman
review_1_text: Moo Coffee has just opened inside the Maya shopping center. I couldn't find the location on Google Maps, so I'm leaving my review here. I ordered a hot cappuccino to go ‚Äî the drink was great. The staff were friendly and cheerful.
review_2_text: Amazing coffee and great service. Just ask ‚Äúfor here‚Äù. In glass coffee tastes much better than in plastic cup
review_3_text:
Good coffee quality. There are several coffee bean options: light roast, medium roast, dark roast.
The coffee store located inside One Nimman.
The take away bag is very creative.
review_4_text: You can pick up great quality of coffee here at One Nimman. How they make coffee is very detailed and things look right and taste right as well. You can choose your preferred roast level. There are many chairs and tables around as it is located in the food court area.
review_5_text: Well controlled coffee! Good balance of taste with their house blend. Interesting take on innovative drinks like Black Coconut Flower coffee! Passionate & friendly team! Lovely to relax in this huge and airy yet stylish covered food court!!

name: Diciotto SlowBar Coffee
review_1_text: I always walked past that little cafe, but today i went inside and it was a good decision! Compared to others close by, which are charging same or even more, he is the one which is definitely worth it! I got an Machiato Espresso for 80 Baht, not the cheapest, but the way and the quality of it, makes it worth it! The owner, i guess a older thai guy, is very friendly, professional and polite! I definitely recommend coming here since its like an Vietnamese coffee experience! 10/10
review_2_text:
A hidden gem where Japanese precision meets Italian art in the world of coffee. Every cup here is crafted with elegance, care, and passion. Master Ohm is not just a barista ‚Äì he is a true artist, elevating the experience of coffee to something memorable and unique.

The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with beautiful music that perfectly complements the slow bar philosophy. From the rich aroma to the balanced flavors, every sip feels like a journey. If you love coffee, this place is a must-visit ‚Äì not just for the drink, but for the artistry behind it.
review_3_text:
Good vibe to relax and chill while enjoy the boss preparing the coffee...
Espresso is made with Flair manual coffee machine
Love the setup and music
review_4_text: There are many cafes in Chiang Mai, but everything in Diciotto is perfect. I can feel the barista‚Äôs expertise and passion for coffee. I ordered a cup of pour-over with light-roasted beans. The coffee has a rich taste, which really impressed me.
review_5_text:
The barista here takes his craft very seriously and pours a lot of love into his brewing.

He uses manual devices, so your coffee can take time. Hence the concept ‚Äì slow bar. The quality of coffee that comes out of it is top-notch.

I ordered the special dirty coffee. More than the taste (which was great), I loved seeing him prepare it.

It's a small cafe with only about four small tables. And the WiFi isn't great either. So it's not meant for coworking but rather enjoying the coffee over conversations.

My only complaint is with the menu design. It's ridiculously tough to read anything on it. As a designer, I'd be happy to help him out with it.

name: 1% coffee Nimman
review_1_text:
Good, hop coffee shop. Tiny place right by the main road. There is some seating. But most people just stop and by take away. They also sell beans.

The coffee is good and very cheap. 50 Baht for a cappuccino and other hot drinks. Lot‚Äòs of locals but also tourists stop for coffee.
review_2_text: A small, no-nonsense coffee spot in Nimmanhaemin, Chiang Mai. The owner truly knows coffee and gives spot-on recommendations. Fair prices, a solid variety of beans, and quality in every cup. Simple, honest, and made for people who take their coffee seriously.
review_3_text:
Not a cafe-hopper, but definitely a coffee-hopper. so glad I made the right choice!

Chiang Mai has so many cafes, but the coffee here is amazing. I was so impressed with the light roast latte (usually I drink dark roast) that I had to go back and ask what coffee it was.

Definitely a good call among so many coffee spots!
review_4_text:
Stumbled across this small startup coffee shop and boy I was lucky! Great coffee, two good flavour profiles of beans to choose from and since I was the last order of the day, he didn‚Äôt even charge me, what a guy :)
It was my first day & first coffee in Chiang Mai and what a lovely welcome experience.
review_5_text: Randomly found this gem while strolling around Nimman today. I ordered an Americano, and it is so juicy, in fact, much better than many specialty coffee cafes. Would revisit every time I have a chance! Recommended to everyone who loves great coffee, not to mention that it is not pricey at all. I hope the owner gets his own store/building in the future!

name: Large Coffee Nimman
review_1_text:
Lovely clean airy space; more for a quick hang or take out spot. Got the coconut smoothie with less sugar. Was so retaining, smooth, and perfectly coconut. Recommend!

The barista was also super friendly.
review_2_text:
Giving three stars mainly because of the coffee. There might be good options on the menu, but the caramel macchiato I ordered was honestly horrible. They really need to learn how to make a proper caramel macchiato.

That said, the place itself is nice. You can sit for a while or just grab your coffee to go. The staff were good too, no complaints at all. Everything else was fine, but the coffee really let it down for me.
review_3_text: We ordered an iced latte and Thai iced tea. They were both very good and low price for the neighbourhood. The tea has a very fruity/floral flavour.
review_4_text: Delicious coffee beans, fragrant, medium and dark roasted, just the right flavor, perfect for a satisfying drink.
review_5_text:
The coffee is delicious and the portions are generous.
It lives up to its name, Large Coffee.

The shop is beautifully decorated in a yellow and blue theme.
The cups are designed in a lovely color scheme, perfect for taking photos against a backdrop of forests, mountains, and trees.

The prices are reasonable, the coffee is good, and the Thai tea is rich and flavorful. Highly recommended.

name: On the way cafe Chiang Mai
review_1_text: We visited the mini stall in Siri wattana market, we got an iced matcha latter & caramel latte. Both were so nice we both ordered another. Highly recommend :)
review_2_text:
Thai milk tea and coffee are good in quality with very affordable price.
There are 3 types of coffee beans you can choose for your cup of coffee: light roast, medium roast and dark roast.
I don‚Äôt like the bitterness much so my preference is light roast.
35-40 BTH/ drinks.
Owner is very nice too.
You can buy to take away or you can sit at the store to drink.
review_3_text: Best value take out coffee in this area only 35thb for any coffee including cappuccino or latte and many more. You get to choose the roast level of the bean and the process looks professional as well. There are some small seats, but it‚Äôs better to get a to go here.
review_4_text: Great coffee at a decent price with friendly service! This air conditioned cafe has 3 coffee strengths to choose from (light, medium, strong) and offers interesting coffee combinations. For example, the lychee coffee was yummy, as the sweet lychee flavor blended well with the slightly acidic notes of the coffee.
review_5_text: Amazing coffee for a great price, lovely kind service, and rad music. Waited out the rain here and loved it, definitely recommend

name: Sway CNX - Rooftop Artisan Coffee (No more smoothie bowls)
review_1_text:
We came a little before 6pm, the couple before us were able to order coffee but when it was our turn, the staff said we could only order alcohol now. My friends before me were able to order mocktails but when it was my turn, the staff said they did not have mocktails ü§®ü§î
It was a very confusing experience. We did not see any signs about ordering time so I'm not sure what's the rule here.
The view was nice, the drinks were mediocre.
review_2_text: Super cute caf√©! The rooftop view is absolutely stunning, perfect for relaxing or getting some work done. The vibe is cozy, the drinks are good, and it‚Äôs a really nice spot in Nimman to chill and enjoy the scenery
review_3_text: Great 10/10 coffee and even greater place to work on your laptop. 5 floors up, it‚Äôs a secret haven with a lovely team. Music is the perfect vibe to relax and work to.
review_4_text: There is no lift, you have to take the staircases to go up. But it's still worth! Perfect place for the remote worker.
review_5_text: Amazing view, comfortable space to work from, and the coffee is just on another level. Lovely place!

name: Bangpun coffee bar
review_1_text:
It‚Äôs a chill place, quiet most of the times I‚Äôve been there, with good indoor space and even a few tables in a walled-off garden.

The coffee was really good and the chocolate confectionery is to die for. They have a good amount of locally sourced chocolate, too, and the price is right.

Internet is fast too, so it makes for a good space to spend a couple of hours
review_2_text:
Wow ü§©
Discovered a new coffee place n the coffee is fantastic!!

Excellent service n beautifully designed coffee shop. The deserts are so good especially the chocolate cookies!

Without a doubt we will be coming back here every time we visit Chiang Mai!!!
review_3_text: This cafe could work great like a coworking space. Unfortunately, it lacks plugs to charge laptops. I recommend this improvement to the owners if they want to attract more customers.
review_4_text: I got ice cappuccino to go here and it is very good. This store is tiny and only for take aways, but it is not bad to try if you want to get a to go coffee. Most of their coffee are 55THB does not matter it is hot or ice.
review_5_text:
Beautiful little cafe and chocolate shop.
The coffee and chocolate are both high level.
Defo recommend

name: VOLKS bagels G Nimman 17 : coffee and fresh pasta
review_1_text:
Volk‚Äôs Bagel is such a great little find in Nimman. The entrance is a bit easy to miss since you have to go inside the G Nimman Hotel, but once you find it, it‚Äôs totally worth it.

It‚Äôs a small space with mostly stool and bar-top seating, but it‚Äôs comfortable and nicely air-conditioned. They also have fast Wi-Fi, which makes it a solid spot to sit and enjoy your food.

I tried their orange espresso and really liked it‚Ä¶ refreshing and different in a good way. For food, I ordered the sausage and egg sandwich and everything tasted amazing. The bagel was perfectly chewy and fresh, and the flavors all worked really well together.

They also have a ton of specialty bagel options, so I‚Äôm definitely coming back to try more next time I‚Äôm in the area. If you‚Äôre looking for a great bagel sandwich in Nimman, I highly recommend this place.
review_2_text:
Not kettle boiled = not a true bagel in my books. üòê

They do hand-roll and bake them fresh, which helps, but only if you eat them right there while they‚Äôre hot. Because once they cool down, it‚Äôs basically a savory bread donut that‚Äôs lost its will to live. üòÖ

Takeaway or delivery ends up a bit dense and bready rather than chewy, like bread that got tired halfway through trying to be a bagel.

If you‚Äôve had a proper kettle-boiled bagel, the difference is obvious. It‚Äôs like upgrading from instant coffee to a decent caf√© brew.

As a regular ‚Äúbread roll with a hole,‚Äù the taste is great though. But compared to a real New York style bagel, nowhere close. As for the black Truffle  cream cheese, I didn‚Äôt taste Truffle at all ü§î Tasted like regular cream cheese, which was good too, but sadly no truffle taste.

And for the price, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth it. Unless you enjoy paying premium prices for bagel cosplay. üôà

I rated it 4 overall, 5 for the great service and Atmosphere. 3 for the food itself.
review_3_text:
Amazing variety of bagels. Good flavour. Coffee was nice. Atmosphere is minimalist, Nordic, clean. Nice with the glass looking out to the pool.
It‚Äôs not cheap however, a smoked salmon bagel with extra egg and coffee was almost 400 THB!!
review_4_text: Amazing find! Volks Bagels offers the best homemade bagels in the area. The variety of flavors is fantastic and they taste incredibly fresh. The staff is lovely and the atmosphere is great. Highly recommended for a delicious breakfast or lunch!"
review_5_text:
The bagel is good, especially the crispy onion bagel, like it, will come back.

The garlic + olive oil one is a bit oily, not my favourite , but some people may like

name: Slow Bar Zapacoffee ‡∏ã‡∏∞‡∏õ‡πä‡∏∞‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü Specialty Coffee
review_1_text: One of the few places where you can find good coffee in the evening. V60 is great, and the whole experience of sitting under the big beautiful tree with nice cup of coffee is awesome
review_2_text: Rich in flavor and warmth service. If u are looking for slow bar coffee in Chiang Mai, this is the one.
review_3_text: Incredible drip coffee. Skip the big stores and come to this stall
review_4_text: Very good coffee, made with a lot of care and attention
review_5_text: Located in the plant nursery district, this is a delight of coffee knowledge and taste. I have often stopoed by the market stall in Nimman and now I've found the home.

name: Pai Yan Yai Coffee
review_1_text:
I randomly found that cafe on my morning walk, and i am glad i did! Its a cozy little cafe/co-working place with a decent menu and coffee!
The Cappuccino was great, 80 THB.
As you can see on the other pictures, they also have a lot of food, especially their Thai food should be very nice!
The Staff is very welcoming and kind. Overall a great and not to pricey experience, recommended.
review_2_text: Great place for breakfast, lunch, coffees and other drinks. You can also work from here. The staff are very lovely and friendly! Much try their signature coffee! We visit regularly and would definitely recommend.
review_3_text:
This has quietly become my favorite coffee spot in Chiang Mai. And I don‚Äôt say that lightly.
The service is genuinely stellar. Not the performative kind. Just kind, attentive, human. The sort of place where you feel remembered, even if it‚Äôs your first visit.
The atmosphere is calm without being sleepy, and it‚Äôs clearly a local favorite. I‚Äôve had coffee sitting in, coffee to go, rushed mornings and slow ones, and it‚Äôs always exactly right. If you‚Äôre looking for a place you‚Äôll end up returning to every morning without really questioning why, this is it.
review_4_text: Fantastic place to work ‚Äî I‚Äôve been here at least 5 times over the past week. The food and coffee are great, but the real standout is the chocolate cake ‚Äî absolutely out of this world. Most seats have power outlets, which is super convenient. The owner is incredibly friendly and welcoming. Thank you guys!
review_5_text: Good warmth place + nice cake and Juice - good for working if you are looking for a quiet place ,sitting 2nd floor there is no music you can concentrate on work - all chairs cover with pillow very comfy  - Thank you for warm welcome - Had aa very productive meeting here.

name: Roastniyom Coffee
review_1_text: Very cozy little cafe. Good vibe, very friendly and nice staff. Also serve a real coffee with even different beans options.
review_2_text: Great and reasonably priced matcha latte, my bf and I are staying at the service apartment next to it for 2 weeks and have been coming here every morning for coffee and matcha. Their matcha is of high quality. And even i tried somewhere else in Chiang Mai matcha latte, this place is still so far the best.
review_3_text:
- reasonable coffee prices
- iced cappuccino with 50% is super goodddd.  A great cup to refresh your day and it‚Äôs just 70‡∏ø
- Many interesting tea blends are sold here
- free WiFi
- smoking area is outside
- Plugs point are available indoor
- payment by cash or QR code
- Drink-in and to-go are both available
review_4_text:
My go-to cafe in Chiang Mai. It can be packed but the people are friendly and some don‚Äôt mind sharing a table with you. The staff are friendly too!

I recommend the americano with orange juice (THB 100). It‚Äôs refreshing.
review_5_text:
Their tea options are quite good. The drinks are delicious.

Note: More than half of the tables in the caf√© are occupied by individuals who order a drink and work there with their notebook. The place would sell more if there is enough tables for others.

name: Yelloo
review_1_text:
A nice shop that is easy to find in the Nimman area. Bright coffee shop with a simple but effective menu that focuses on the basics. Everything has a sort of clean look to it, including the items you order.

Service is intuitive which is a nice pleasant surprise as well. An enjoyable experience.
review_2_text: Wow. What a gorgeous environment, incredibly friendly staff, and the best unique iced coffee that I've had in my life. You HAVE to try the Yelloo Latte - it's the marriage of a creme brulee and iced coffee, done to perfection. Amazing
review_3_text: I ordered cafe latte choosing dark roasted coffee bean a little bittersweet taste not bad.
review_4_text: The place is great for fun unique drinks, it‚Äôs not too loud, there is also great lighting and great WiFi
review_5_text: Such a gorgeous cafe! Beautiful coffee, made with care. I have enjoyed iced lattes, juice, brownie, and delicious lunch here over the last few days and keep coming back. The staff are so friendly and have remembered my order each day and welcome me with smiles ‚ò∫Ô∏è The interior design and little courtyard is so nice! üôå

name: Ccccc CAFE
review_1_text:
Dirty is nice.
Not too sweet and very creamy.
The coffee is not too strong and blended in very well with the milk.
Friendly staff.
review_2_text:
Excellent coffee shop. A small shop located in the heart of nimmaman. The cheese cake is awesome. They have a good supply of drinks and cakes
To choose From.  2 different roasts to choose from.  Service is friendly.  No parking. Good AC
review_3_text: The dark coffee was amazing! Service is top quality! Highly recommend ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: Dirty coffee was okay. Only shame is the place full of people on laptops leaving no space for customers to consume and killing the ambience. We had to take our dirty coffee in a paper cup outside, which degraded the experience.
review_5_text: Passed by this cafe while staying in Eastin Tan Hotel located next door and decided to come in since it was empty. Ordered cappuccino and mentaiko pasta which were both amazing! My cappuccino choice of dark roast hit the spot and the mentaiko pasta was to die for! Staffs were really polite and friendly and I appreciate the interior, vibe and choice of lofi music. Highly recommended when you are in Nimman!

name: Roastniyom Craft
review_1_text:
Great coffee spot on the 3rd floor of Maya shopping mall. The black orange is really, really good and incredibly refreshing on a hot day. It looked like they were squeezing fresh orange juice for each order, and it was perfectly balanced with the espresso. At 100 baht, it feels like a good value too.

I saw some of the reviews about bad service, but that wasn't my experience at all. I was there on a Tuesday afternoon and the service staff couldn't have been nicer.
review_2_text: Favourite coffee ever..!!! Super friendly service and nice seating in Maya Mall. üòò
review_3_text:
Before you got the nice service. Now with the same price you have to make the queue and pick up yourself. The cake was before on a porcelain plate, now it's iron.
I was regularly here, but no reason anymore. It's a pity..
review_4_text: Excellent hot latte, staff bring drinks to table, polite and friendly, tables to relax on, charging points too, excellent!
review_5_text: Fantastic coffee,  great barista work. I really like it there

name: Changkham Chiangmai Tea Shop ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÉ‡∏ö‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ï‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡∏≥
review_1_text: Amazing tea shop!! I love this style, traditional Chinese tea service but using tea grown in Thailand. What a cool idea! The owner was very friendly and knowledgeable. I had a great time ‚ò∫Ô∏èüôèüèº
review_2_text:
Tea Shop Recommendation

This tea shop is perfect for true tea lovers. The quality of the tea is exceptional, as the shop carefully selects only rare and premium tea leaves. Each cup offers a rich aroma and a refined taste that reflects the uniqueness of the tea leaves.

If you are looking for high-quality tea made from rare leaves, this shop is definitely worth visiting.
review_3_text: An exquisite tea tasting space and shop (Thai teas, Stingless bee honey, ceramics, and upcoming: coffee and Chinese tea rooms). The owner Tian is passionate, a seasoned expert, and very generous. He is as enthusiastic as a visionary entrepreneur can be. Highly recommended! Thank you, Tian.
review_4_text: Beautiful new tea shop with local, good tea from Thailand and tea ware. The very friendly owner took all time to serve tea to taste, explain about tea, answer my questions. I definitely come back!
review_5_text: Amazing selection of Thai teas! The owner is very professional and truly passionate about what he does. Don‚Äôt miss the wild honey it‚Äôs a must-try.

name: Samudlanna
review_1_text:
A good stationery store. I was looking for acrylic paints and markers and found them here.
Parking is at the back of the building.
review_2_text:
We love this little stationary and office/craft supplies store. They seem to have almost everything that you need for a project or for your home office. They also sell quite a lot of home goods, like picture hangers, hooks, tape, adhesives, small hand tools, light bulbs, etc, etc.
The staff is always friendly and helpful.
They often have holiday decor, too.
review_3_text: Walked in looking for paint. No one looked up at me. No one greeted me or asked if I need help. They have lots of good stuff but no customer service.
review_4_text: A nice stationery store--paints and canvases on the mezzanine level, most everything else (writing instruments, notebooks, envelopes, adhesives, whiteboards/corkboards, erasers, craft supplies, binders, etc.) on the ground floor. Carries fewer fountain pens now than 5+ years ago, and doesn't appear to carry capped Uniball Signo pens (I know, that's very specific, but they're personal faves) anymore, but it does carry more locally produced crafts than before and the selection of pens is still large. For those who are on the lookout for fountain pen-friendly paper on a small budget, the kraft paper-covered BSP notebooks (see photo) they carry have done surprisingly well in my experience. (I should note that I prefer extra-fine and fine nibs, which usually write drier than medium and bold nibs.)
review_5_text:
A huge stationary store at Niman...
There are couple of stationary stores in Chaing Mai but this one is bigger and more items then those stores...
There are many things for Students, Artists, Designers, Etc...
The Interior design of the shop is also quite interesting...
If you need stationary no doubt to just go there if you are near Niman...

name: Cozy Owls Chiang Mai
review_1_text:
Stayed here for two nights and honestly, you can‚Äôt beat the price ‚Äî 5 USD a night is insane for what you get. The accommodations were simple but totally fine. My sheets were clean, no hair, and the bed was comfortable enough. The room did get a little warm, but that‚Äôs just part of sharing a dorm with other people, not the hostel‚Äôs fault.

What really stood out was the front desk. Super helpful every time I asked for assistance. They even made calls for me and helped confirm my pickup for an elephant sanctuary reservation I had. They really go out of their way to make sure things run smoothly for you.

Overall, great value, clean stay, and genuinely kind staff. I‚Äôd definitely stay here again.
review_2_text: Overall a pleasant stay. The rooms were ok, you get what you pay for. Cleanliness was very good, the maids would clean and disinfect the rooms and bathroom every day. Mai who was at the front desk goes above and beyond. She‚Äôs so bubbly, positive and friendly a real refreshing ray of light. Unfortunately, the boy who‚Äôs there ‚ÄúPuu‚Äù is miserable and rude. Extremely rude and unhelpful. All he does is sit play his games and look at you like you‚Äôve asked him for a kidney if you require any assistance. Not what I want to be seeing during my travels this negative energy. But it‚Äôs okay because Mai countered it. I would stay here again I liked the vibe, the rooms and the location. Rent a ped though as it‚Äôs way easier to get around
review_3_text: Stayed at Cozy Owls for 1 month in their Double Deluxe Studio. It was perfect. The room is new and spacious. There‚Äôs a little balcony to chill. Staff is very friendly too. Wi-fi is also good, I could work on it. It‚Äôs in a very quiet location, but very close to everything you need (restaurants/supermarket, etc).
review_4_text:
Cozy Owls Chiang Mai is an excellent choice for budget-conscious travelers and long-term visitors, offering a combination of hostel and apartment-style living. Guests consistently praise its exceptional cleanliness‚Äîit‚Äôs often noted as one of the cleanest hostels in the area. The rooms and private accommodations (which sometimes feature balconies with mountain views) are modern and comfortable, providing good value for money.
The staff are frequently highlighted as friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about the local area, enhancing the overall welcoming atmosphere. While the location is a short distance from the Old City, it's conveniently close to local markets like Chang Puak and accessible by local transport.
review_5_text:
Room 301 ‚Äì Terrible experience
There was a strong smell coming from the bathroom, hair on the bed and floor, and dirty marks in the bathroom. The sheets and pillows were also dirty and had hair on them. It was impossible to sleep with those bad odors. When I spoke with the manager, she said it was the guest‚Äôs fault and claimed the room was fine, but she refused to come and check the room herself to see how dirty and smelly it really was.
Stay date: November 6, 2025.

name: Santitham Breakfast‚Äã & Chiang Mai Pizza‚Äã
review_1_text: Great breakfast eatery open from early till past noon, with a casual open-air atmosphere, serving up great food at a decent price, from a menu ranging from Thai staples to Western offerings. Service is warm and cordial. Had the Pad Thai for breakfast, which was as hearty as it was delicious, and well worth the price. The space is amply tabled and while it gets a little busy on a weekday morning catering mostly to foreign diners, a few tables always appear to be available.
review_2_text: Wide variety of breakfast to choose. Both Thai and Western(but does not have Northern Thai food, so keep that in mind). Food are great! Delicious and fairly priced. They got  rice soup, porridge, noodles, omelette, toast and more. Sourdough toast is amazing! Great spot for getting breakfast.
review_3_text: Came here for breakfast, it was ok. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. I got smoked salmon and scrambled eggs. For the price was a bit bland, only 1 small piece of sourdough (although their freshly baked sourdough) and wasn‚Äôt proper smoked salmon, was more flaked salmon. Ice coffee was nice and chill vibe but overall was average.
review_4_text: Easy Thai and western food at reasonable price. Thai food wasn‚Äôt the best but ok. They don‚Äôt accept card payment.
review_5_text:
A top quality restaurant. 10/10 on service, atmosphere and food. We have been to visit for breakfast many times and will continue to go for breakfast until we leave Chiang Mai.
I highly recommend this place, if you want a delicious start to your day üòäüëå
I would like to recommend rice soup with crispy pork and a soft boil egg, shrimp omelette, morning glory with rice, pad thai with shrimp. I look forward to trying other options on their menu as I belive everything will be just as delicious. Their menu is perfectly composed as there is something that will please everyone! Oh and last thing, the coffee is also very good üòä

name: Have You Bean
review_1_text: Nice, chic cafe along a quiet street with a cosy, wood-padded aesthetic and tasteful decorative finishes and furnishings‚Äîalbeit with limited dine-in seating‚Äîsporting a contemporary aesthetic across the board. Tended to by nice and cordial staff/owners, serving up superb coffee and cakes at a pretty solid price.
review_2_text: Just discovered this new coffee shop and already in love! üß°ü§é Great Coffee & Thai Tea at a good reasonable price, with a stylish space that‚Äôs full of charm. Nice staff. The vibes are super relaxed ‚Äî perfect for catching up with friends or getting some work done!
review_3_text: You can feel great taste of coffee. I love here that I can choose the coffee bean with the affordable price.
review_4_text:
A cool coffee space that pop up around the corner of the street. Coffee is good, price is really affordable, the place is great if you want a quiet place to work or relax away from the heat.
You can also choose your coffee roast! Definitely coming back and making it my regular coffee spot.
review_5_text:
I recently stumbled upon this charming little caf√© run by a talented young barrister, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with my experience! The atmosphere is well lit, cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot to relax with a good book or catch up with friends.

The highlight, of course, is the coffee. They use a Victoria Arduino espresso machine and local beans, and you can really taste the quality in every cup.
