The hot latte is a masterpiece‚Äîboth visually stunning and deliciously rich. And let‚Äôs not forget the latte art! Each cup is a work of art, showcasing the barista‚Äôs skill and creativity.

I‚Äôll definitely be returning for more of that amazing coffee and to see what new designs the barista comes up with. Highly recommend!

name: The Donut Cafe
review_1_text:
I got a Thai tea with oat milk, then I asked if they had vegan donuts and to my surprise, ALL DONUTS ARE VEGAN!!! I was so shocked I asked - no egg and no milk? And the sweet cashier said - no egg no milk üòç
So I got the glazed donut and it was pretty good despite being so early for me to eat sweets üòÖ
I will most certainly go back for more!
Updated: went back today at 7:15am for a Thai tea, and they weren‚Äôt open yet. I had a call so took it from there - the WiFi is great! They opened around 7:30am ü§ç
They were very friendly and didn‚Äôt mind making the Thai tea on my reusable cup ü•∞
review_2_text: Been there twice because the food is really good. The atmosphere as well and they have boardgames for you to play while waiting/ eating. Really nice Cafe
review_3_text:
We have been looking for donut spots and were happy to see The Donut Cafe was nearby. It's a nice, open lobby space with lots of seating areas and lots of donut flavors. We got 6 different flavors and have enjoyed them all - but Lemon Poppyseed is THE BEST!

When we brought our donuts to the counter, the cashier let us know it was Buy 6, Get 1 FREE! So we snagged 1 more!

We are satisfied customers and will definitely be back.
review_4_text:
This is a cool spot inside of a hotel in Chiang Mai.

Are these the best donuts? In my opinion, they are not as good. They are on the heavier side. There  is another spot with better flavor and lighter. Also, my bang for your baht.
Now, they do have a huge breakfast menu. I think it's just part of the hotel.
I would come for breakfast or lunch.

The inside is also beautiful üòç
The staff is very friendly.
Plenty of seating.
review_5_text:
This is an absolute little gem for a good sweet treat. The donut is are absolutely delicious and fair priced in relation to the businesses in this area. I had two donuts and a coffee for 175thb.

I had a Boston cr√®me and a maple donut, and both were absolutely delicious.

The cafe is In the lobby of  a hotel so the working ambience is so so, but I would absolutely come here again for the donuts!

name: House no 33 Ô∏è
review_1_text: Lovely cafe with a woody, warmly appearance and a familial atmosphere, with a decent amount of sturdy seating, tended to by a bright and friendly bunch. The drinks and cakes are great, and its morning hours on a weekday don't get too busy, with the jazz playing on its speakers always taking centre stage audio-wise. Fantastic spot for some morning bevs and a bit of focus or a chat.
review_2_text:
This minimalist-style caf√© has a simple and cozy atmosphere, offering a selection of drinks, pastries, and possibly whole cakes for order. I stopped by after having a meal at the restaurant across the street and decided to try some desserts.
The staff were friendly and provided great service. I ordered a scone and a hot chocolate. The hot chocolate was delicious‚Äîrich and well-balanced. However, the scone wasn‚Äôt quite to my taste. It was generously sized, but the texture inside was a bit too crumbly for my liking.
There are a few seats inside, and while the space isn‚Äôt too large, it doesn‚Äôt feel cramped. It‚Äôs a nice spot to relax with a drink. If you enjoy minimalist caf√©s with good service, this place is worth checking out!
review_3_text: One of my favourite-favourite cafes in CNX; I only wish I'd discovered it sooner. Beautiful drinks, and the strawberry cake had a wonderful soft, plush crumb and a frosting that wasn't too sweet or overpowering. No need for sweetener in the hot coffee (unless you enjoy sweet coffee, no judgment!) because there's no unpleasant bitterness to be found, nor is it a sour shot. Very balanced. My favourite iced drink--and I tried several, for science!--was the coffee and fresh orange juice, which is seasonal. Presentation is perfection, and by this I mean that not only is it aesthetically charming with the cups and stickers, but they even open a tab on the iced drink lid for smooth, easy straw insertion. It's not necessary, but I deeply appreciate that level of thoughtful attention to detail. Cafe is mostly quiet, comfortably air conditioned (and there's an air purifier)--perfect place to read, journal, and write letters. Or bring a friend! Seriously, I can't recommend it enough, the quality of the experience and the very reasonable prices had me coming back daily.
review_4_text:
Cosy and clean cafe! Came here to chill as was waiting for the northern food opposite which was packed, surprisingly found another nice place to chill here.
They have quite a wide range of coffee, teas, sofas and a few different varieties of cakes and traditional biscuits.
The coconut latte was just the right taste and creaminess, the butter cake is not overpowering buttery, it's soft and moist, perfect to go with the latte.
Coconut cream pie is another nice cake to go with the lattes, the coconut is on a lightly sweet end.
review_5_text:
Randomly walked into this cafe because the homie feels & while waiting for opposite Huen Muan Jai number.
The honey latte surprisingly good, will come back again for this.

name: So good coffee & smoothie
review_1_text:
Perfect place for a drink stop (takeaway or small sit in place) while waiting for a table at the famous Michelin Khao Soi Maesai up the road.
The passionfruit yoghurt smoothie was a perfect blend of creaminess, sweetness and refreshing tangy flavour. So so delicious and the staff were super friendly too!
Would be keen to try other drinks including the mango, blueberry or mixed berry yoghurt smoothies.
review_2_text: I tried their mixed berries smoothie and it was so good! üçìPerfect balance of sweet and tangy, super refreshing, and you can really taste the fresh fruits. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, which made the visit even better. Price was really affordable too, great value for such quality! Definitely a spot I‚Äôd come back to again. üíï
review_3_text: Amazing coffee, delicious smoothies (the avocado/banana/yoghurt smoothie is going to sustain you for a while), great prices and the owner is so lovely. Small businesses like this are the best part of exploring a city üíó I‚Äôve been coming here every morning while in Chiang Mai. Thank you so much.
review_4_text: Great spot for a take away coffee or smoothie! It‚Äôs very small, so not much of a dine-in place. The service and prices are excellent. So far I‚Äôve just had an Orange Americano. I love that they use real orange juice rather than syrup like some places. Will definitely be back.
review_5_text: This is hands down my favorite smoothie spot in Chiang Mai. I come here often, and the quality is always consistent fresh ingredients, well-balanced flavors, and smoothies that genuinely make you feel good afterward. The space is calm and welcoming, perfect for starting the day or taking a quiet break. It‚Äôs one of those places that quickly becomes part of your routine. If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai and appreciate good smoothies, good energy, and consistency, this spot is a must.

name: Fumo+1Cafe
review_1_text: If you're a coffee lover, add this one to your list. Outstanding quality with local and international blends. Staff are friendly and helpful. Air conditioned. Pastries are very yummy too. Glad I discovered it and it will be a regular for me.
review_2_text:
Coffee shops in Thailand are on another level ‚Äî unique, creative, delicate, and absolutely delicious. This place is a perfect example. Every single detail is beautiful, from the exterior to the interior, the decor, the drinks, and the food.

A must-try in Chiang Mai ü§åüèªüëç
review_3_text: Chic, contemporary joint for bevs and bakes open from real early. Slightly pricey but the quality's there. Nice variety of seating despite the cosy size, with outlets indoors and spots outdoors for lounging.
review_4_text: They have a nice selection of drip coffees and the service was welcoming and friendly. They also have medium and dark roast espresso for milk drinks.  The atmosphere is hip and modern with a retro diner vibe.
review_5_text: Good bakery in a stylish atmosphere. I ordered Thai tea and my husband ordered hot latte coffee. They both are very good.

name: Dee Cafe
review_1_text:
Dropped by Dee Cafe and was pleasantly surprised. Their coffee is really aromatic, smooth and strong enough to perk you up. I had the orange Americano‚Äîthe coffee is quite intense, but it is to my liking. If you prefer something lighter, you can actually ask them to adjust with less coffee and more fresh orange juice‚Äîthey‚Äôre happy to tweak it for your taste.

The raisin Danish puff pastry was nicely done‚Äîcrispy outside, soft inside, not too sweet, just right.

But the one that really stood out was the coconut cake. Super soft, moist, and topped with a thick layer of coconut cream with actual coconut flesh inside. It‚Äôs rich but not jelak‚Äîseriously good!

The cafe itself is cozy and comfortable, perfect spot to chill. I think travellers will find this place worth visiting, especially with their unique drinks and dessert options. Highly recommend trying the ones I mentioned!
review_2_text:
Best matcha and americano coconut in town
Fabrication with fresh coconut with pieces of coconut inside
The owner is very kind
Come on üòç
review_3_text: This is a comfortable little cafe I visit to enjoy a refreshing iced tea or coffee and read a book. The owner is very friendly and makes a great mocha yen. There is comfortable seating, both, inside and outside. The pastries are always fresh. There's also a club card buy 10 get 1 free. That's pretty cool üòé
review_4_text:
Our favorite caf√© in all of Chiang Mai ‚Äì and probably all of Thailand! üòä

We first visited in April 2024 and loved it so much that we made sure to come back in January 2025.

Don makes the best drinks, and we have so many favorites:‚Ä®- Cappuccino (hot & cold) ‚Äì perfect every time‚Ä®- Thai Milk Tea ‚Äì richer and more flavorful than most places, hence the darker color ‚Ä®- Green Tea ‚Äì made with high-quality tea, you can really taste the difference‚Ä®- Thai Tea Lemon ‚Äì not on the menu, but Don made it for us, and wow, it was THE BEST‚Ä®- Honey Lemon Soda ‚Äì so refreshing!

We worked from the caf√© every day, and Don always greeted us with a warm smile ‚Äì it really felt like home. We‚Äôll miss this place so much in the coming months but can‚Äôt wait to come back for more of Don‚Äôs amazing creations.

Highly recommend it to anyone in Chiang Mai!
review_5_text: Nice newly opened cafe with a few good tables and chairs. I tried ice americano and it was good and the guy was nice. You can choose either dark or medium roast here.

name: KOJI MATCHA
review_1_text: A very new matcha shop. We were just visitors walking by when we discovered this cute little place. The drinks are delicious, and the service is perfect. The owner makes everything with so much love‚Äîyou can really feel it. Definitely try it out and see for yourself!
review_2_text: wow.  high quality matcha.  the matcha üçµ foam coconut ü•• is amazing üëè üòã wish I found this place earlier... also the matcha caramel foam is like drinking ice cream üç¶ üòã
review_3_text:
Koji Matcha is the best matcha I‚Äôve ever tried-  rich, smooth, and top quality.
You can tell the girls put so much care into making it, and it tastes incredible. The place is cozy, spotless, and has such a lovely vibe that you just want to come back again and again! Live this place!
review_4_text:
omg absolutely delicious, you need to give this a try :) the girls working there are so kind too.

i wanted to add, this is my favorite matcha place now. have to say, i don‚Äôt know much about match, i just like to drink it. . but this is the best matcha i‚Äôve had , the  flavor is delicious, and i love how delicate they are making it, i like how they do the process in front of you. what a work of art!! :) ü©∑
review_5_text:
Probably the best matcha place I‚Äôve ever been to! From the kindness of the workers to the incredibly made matcha the full experience was perfect.

They helped us choosing the best option for us, we took the ceremony quality matcha, enjoyed them elaborate it and spend good time in the terrace they have.

I‚Äôll sure come back :)

name: AHPO cafe - ‡∏≠‡∏≤‡πÇ‡∏û‡πã ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text:
Nice little home cafe!

The atmosphere is very calm and not tourist-centric. You can park by the street easily.

The coffee has 2 bean selections and it is pretty good. The bean is fresh and they made a nice shot.

The star of the cafe is the toast, which is made by their homemade Shokupan. The toast has a very good texture. I tried the sweet toast with ice cream, it was yummy. However, the ice cream is not my cup of tea.

Inside the cafe is very comfy and good for working. There are plenty of sockets.
review_2_text: Delicious toast! Perfect for 2 or 1 hungry person. üòÜ they have an outdoor and indoor space, both of which were very spacious. Their bread are also homemade! Coffee was also nice, served with one big ice cube.
review_3_text: This is econd time here, I really enjoyed the great atmosphere, music, and delicious coffee. Among the cafes in the area, it was the most delicious one. The side dish of bread was also very tasty, with a crispy crust and moist inside. I received it as a Christmas edition, and it was so adorable.
review_4_text: Signature Toast is very delicous, soft and swet. Coffee tastes so good!
review_5_text: Best toast in town , good vibes.

name: Heart Together .cnx
review_1_text: Ordering coffee here is a bit difficult.  You will receive No smiles, no hello, no thank you, no have a nice day.   Not a polite coffee shop.  But, the coffee taste is excellent.  Management should train the staff in how to behave professionally.
review_2_text: This is my Fav.cafe for work and chill. They're so nice. I even need to order anymore just said SAME, they will bring that too me.
review_3_text: Great cafe! We tried their signature coffee (hot heart style coffee) and matcha latte.
review_4_text: Nice chilled air con bar and cafe serving lights meals, snacks and craft beer.
review_5_text: Very tasty coffee and comfortable coffee shop. Employees are easy to work with and respectful.

name: Calm Stay & Cafe
review_1_text: Good cafe with coffee and cakes. The coffee is reasonable priced. The atmosphere is welcoming. Staff is super friendly. Highly recommend for a little break or work place
review_2_text:
I stayed here for 7 nights. The rooms are incredibly clean and well-organized. Located in a peaceful area, it‚Äôs only a 15-minute walk to Nimman and the Old Town. With Michelin-listed spots and local food stalls nearby, it‚Äôs the perfect base for foodies. It‚Äôs also ideal for those wanting a private bathroom on a budget. The cafe‚Äôs treats are great to give it a try.

Beyond the stay, the owner's kindness was the highlight. As a solo traveler in a career transition, his travel tips and sincere encouragement gave me so much courage to move forward. Calm Stay & Cafe will definitely be my first choice in Chiang Mai.üòä
review_3_text: What can I say about this place? The best carrot cake in Chiang Mai! I highly recommend it. The owner, Fifi, is incredibly kind and makes every customer feel truly welcome. If you're in Chiang Mai, take some time to visit Calm Stay & Caf√©.
review_4_text:
We had a wonderful trip in Chiang Mai with help of airbnb owner. They helped us a lots, are very kind. The room is nice, comfortable and really new. On the first floor, there‚Äôs their coffee shop with good coffee and cake.
Airbnb is near a lots of good Michelin restaurant, from there to One Nimman is close too.
If I come back in Chiang Mai, I will recontact them for sure.
review_5_text: The bestest coffee shop open near to us using good materials and quality i l like there coffee cake and cha thai .there have room for stay also .

name: Very, Very Delicious Coffee
review_1_text: Yes, the name doesn't lie.
review_2_text:
Cheap prices and quick service.
Good Thai iced coffee.
review_3_text: It's average. I wonder if the other menu will be better next time.
review_4_text: I go here almost every day. Best of all, I love that I can order a large size. And the large size is really big.
review_5_text: The milk tea here has a rich and delicious tea flavor.

name: Happy Bird Day coffee
review_1_text:
We really enjoy this little neighborhood coffee shop, and it is definitely one of our favorites!
We always get amazing coffee, lattes, cappuccinos, and matcha drinks here. They have oat milk available for those who prefer to avoid dairy products.
Fresh pastries and cookies are available, too.
The place is small, so seating is a bit limited, but inside and outside seating is available.
We will keep stopping in here and will recommend it to our friends.
review_2_text: Great coffee and the owner seems like a very lovely person. We have been here several times since our accommodation was right around the corner. We really liked their cappuccino and matcha latte and the fact they also served oat milk.
review_3_text: Tiny coffee shop for a reasonable price. I had a cappuccino for 50 baht, which tasted great. Outside have only 5-6 chairs, so probably great just for a quick coffee break
review_4_text:
I love it here! Staff is absolutely gorgeous and their dog Panda is super cute. This place is my 1st or 2nd best coffee spot in Chiang Mai. It‚Äôs little and hidden from the hustle. Worth visiting. You can choose the roast and take a look to the cute pottery store next ‚Äûdoor‚Äù (there is no door tho üòÑ)
I‚Äôve ordered ice americano + extra espresso shot and paid 60 thb
review_5_text: Found this great little coffee shop. This a small little place to enjoy a coffee and they have soothing music playing in the background. Get a similar feeling when you have gone camping and enjoying a nice warm drink.

name: Red Panda Cafe - Santitham
review_1_text: Love this place! However last few times I have come its always closed‚Ä¶ not sure why it doesn‚Äôt show up in google.
review_2_text: I stayed for 10 days, and the bed was made every day. The bed was spacious enough that I could sit up straight without bending over, and it was very soft and comfortable. The soundproofing was a little poor, but backpacker rooms are really unpredictable; if you're worried about noise, just stay in a hotel. Thank you, beautiful Lily! üòòüòòüòò
review_3_text: A peaceful place, friendly atmosphere, and all the staff are lovely. Perfect for reading, working, or just chilling. Highly recommended! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: The atmosphere is great, the coffee is delicious, and there are many beautiful photo spots.
review_5_text:
The matcha milky strawberry menu is delicious!!!!
There are beautiful photo spots and work areas. The atmosphere is great, and the staff is super friendly.

name: Natwat Home Caf√©
review_1_text:
Subject: From Consistency to Uncertainty: An Open Letter to Natwat Home Caf√© from a Loyal Patron
To the Management of Natwat Home Caf√©,
I am writing this letter to express my profound disappointment regarding an incident that occurred at your caf√© on January 2, 2026, at 8:57 am. As a loyal customer who has consistently supported and trusted your establishment since 2024, today‚Äôs experience was deeply upsetting and, quite frankly, embarrassing.
What I encountered this morning was not merely a refusal to allow my dog into the air-conditioned zone; it was a total failure of professional communication. I have attached several photos from my previous visits throughout 2024 and 2025 as evidence that, for nearly two years, your caf√©‚Äôs policy has allowed well-behaved pets in the indoor area. My dog has always been welcomed and has strictly followed all house rules.
Today‚Äôs incident raises several concerning questions regarding your brand‚Äôs standards:
Professional Problem Solving: The staff member informed me that I could not stay inside because of their personal "pet fur allergy." In a self-proclaimed "Pet-Friendly" establishment, I find it unprofessional that internal staffing issues were shifted onto a loyal customer. A professional solution would have been to have another staff member attend to our table, rather than forcing a regular patron to leave the premises.
Public Embarrassment and Lack of Decorum: The staff chose to confront and reject me loudly in front of other guests. This created a highly negative atmosphere, making me and my pet look "disrespectful" in the eyes of others. Consequently, a neighboring table (foreign tourists) misunderstood the situation and asked me to leave. Being "shamed" in public due to a staff member's communication style is the most distressing experience I have ever had at a supposedly professional caf√©.
Inconsistent Policy: Claiming to be a "new staff member who doesn't know the rules" is not a valid excuse for compromising the service standards that a regular customer has relied on for years. If a policy has changed, there should be clear signage or a polite notification upon entry‚Äînot a confrontation in the middle of a meal.
The attached photos prove that I am a customer who loves and has long supported your business, and that my dog is calm and disciplined enough to share a space with others. Today's experience has severely damaged the image of Natwat Home Caf√© that I once admired.
I hope this feedback encourages you to re-evaluate your staff training and internal management. I trust that you will take steps to ensure that no other "pet-loving family" has to endure such an embarrassing and exclusionary experience again.
With deep disappointment,
Ricky T.
Loyal Customer (2024 ‚Äì Present) with documented history
review_2_text: For a small caf√©, Natwat does not feel crowded, the ambience is very calm and inviting. Our service was wonderful, with those little touches of noticing us right when we walked in and suggesting alternatives to things they were out of. They get all of the little touches right. Lovely seating inside or outside in the garden area.
review_3_text: Huge servings, delicious food, reasonable prices, nice ambience, great service.
review_4_text:
Delicious food, I really recommend to try the breakfast quesadilla ü§§
Coffee also is very good and stuff is super friendly.
review_5_text:
Outstanding food! The best coffee I've had in Chiang Mai so far. Will be coming back.

Edit. I've been regularly coming to Natwat over a period of a month and actually ended up moving to the area. My favorite place for breakfast and coffee ü•≥

name: Moddangfire
review_1_text: Great coffee only 25 thb
review_2_text: Good coffee roaster here.
review_3_text: coffee experian
review_4_text: We came for pizza but stumbled upon a coffee shop with a lovely female barista. She was fun to talk to and gave great coffee recommendations. She's got what she likes and can suggest whatever flavor profile you prefer. Definitely stop by! Come for coffee and pizza at this "guerrilla" shop. The owners of both shops are siblings. Highly recommend trying them. Everyone has their own tastes, and what's delicious to us might not be the same for everyone.ü§üüèºüòé
review_5_text: I forgot it was Buddha's birthday today. I arrived this morning following the map, only to find the gates closed and seemingly out of luck. Luckily, a few persistent Korean tourists knocked on the door, allowing me to finally enjoy coffee and pizza. Coffee and pizza is a rare breakfast combination for me, but it felt perfectly natural here. I hadn't realized the items were from two different shops. Perhaps the owners are used to this kind of ordering, so they've quickly gotten their food ready. They have several coffee beans to choose from, and the thin, crispy pizza is delicious and highly recommended. The two owners were incredibly welcoming; if it weren't for their willingness to work overtime, today's breakfast wouldn't have been possible. Thank you so much!

name: ‡∏£‡∏™‡∏û‡∏ç‡∏≤ ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü
review_1_text: The shop owner is cute and friendly. The coffee is delicious and cheap.
review_2_text: I'm addicted to the green tea from this shop. The owner is very cute and friendly.
review_3_text: Delicious green tea. Very friendly service.

name: MAR Marocchino Coffee Chiangmai
review_1_text: Great little place with an outside and inside dining area.  Coffee was good and the waitress was friendly.  Latte will set you back 50 baht, good place to work from but I couldn‚Äôt see many power points inside.  Breakfast is available and the WiFi is fast. #BeatTheGrind
review_2_text:
Nice place to get some work done or relax after an afternoon walk near Ping river. Coffee was nice with nutty taste.

Interior is somewhat modern with white walls and high ceilings.

Wifi available. Electrical sockets are scarce. And the shop closes early in the evening (5:30 PM)
review_3_text: Awesome coffee shop!!  Yummy.  Friendly.  Caramel Macchiato!!  Caffe Latte and Mocha were great too!
review_4_text: Lovely latte, good price, nice staff
review_5_text: Cozy, nice place and brilliant coffee! And Parking lot

name: cherry coffee
review_1_text: Coffee..great. Green tea milk tea..strong. Smooth and creamy cappuccino..

name: Break Coffee at Phudum
review_1_text: Beautiful view üòç Highly recommend üëå
review_2_text: Nice place to take a break and admire the view
review_3_text:
Break Coffee at Phudum is the perfect place to enjoy a good cup of coffee and, if time allows, a leisurely breakfast. The atmosphere invites you to relax and take your time.

I highly recommend sitting in the back, in the hut, where you can enjoy your coffee with your feet dangling and spectacular views of Chiang Mai. The feeling is simply breathtaking and transforms a coffee break into a truly special experience.

An ideal spot to disconnect, enjoy the surroundings, and start your day calmly. Highly recommended.
review_4_text: The scenery is beautiful and the layout is good. There is ample space and it is easy to park cars and motorcycles.

name: Living A Dream ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏≠‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏Å‡πâ‡∏ß
review_1_text: My favorite cafe in Chiang Mai. Location is  perfect. Beautiful view. Good choice of food and drinks. I always have coconut. Green tea latte with almond milk is my second choice.
review_2_text: This restaurant is directly across from the water, so you get a great view. The staff speaks very good english. The food is always delicious. They have indoor and outdoor seating. We really enjoy this place.
review_3_text:
The atmosphere is very beautiful i recommend going here if you are in the lake's area. I got an iced espresso and an almond croissant. The croissant was ok, not too bad not too good, I enjoyed it but would not come back for it.
The iced Espresso i got was an iced latte, I asked why i have milk inside my drink and they told me that I should have ordered an iced Americano and not an espresso because the iced espresso is actually an iced latte. It is not specified in the menu, I don't know if that's is a cultural thing but i would ask next time if my drink has milk inside of it.
review_4_text:
The coffee shop with the best view in Chiang Mai.
I went there the other day, and the service was excellent, especially from the cashier. The food was delicious as well. I highly recommend the fruit granola yogurt and a hot caramel latte.
review_5_text: Free bathroom even if you don‚Äôt buy anything! They are really friendly and the food and drinks are solid with a super awesome view of the water and mountain.

name: Kopi Gusto
review_1_text: I had a very tasty hot cappuccino at Kopi Gusto, Chiang Mai University. Its near the Science and technology new building. Inside and outside area is there to sit and sip your perfect coffee served here. Students are allowed to sit and work here while enjoying their coffee. Inside is air-conditioned. Outside sitting area has a nice ambience with comfy chairs and much greenery for the sore eyes.There are magazines to read and enjoy while you are at Kopi Gusto. Will visit again and check other blends of coffee as well.
review_2_text: Small prices. Cozy and good atmosphere.  Hot coffee is okay. Smoothie is quite good. But all iced coffee with milk is not good.  So just order iced americano if you want to.
review_3_text: Nice place for working and chilling. Good coffee comes with low price.
review_4_text: Kopi Gusto is the best for an early morning cappuccino. ‚òïÔ∏è
review_5_text: Low price, free wifi and strong coffee

name: Starbucks CMU Food Center
review_1_text: Starbucks CMU Food Center is a cozy and convenient spot located within the Chiang Mai University campus. Perfect for students, faculty, and visitors, this Starbucks offers a relaxing environment to unwind or catch up on work. The atmosphere is calm, with plenty of seating options both indoors and outdoors, allowing you to enjoy your coffee in a peaceful setting. As with any Starbucks, the menu features a wide range of coffee drinks, teas, and delicious pastries, all made with their signature quality. The staff are friendly and efficient, ensuring that your order is made just right. Whether you're looking for a quick caffeine fix or a place to study, Starbucks CMU Food Center is a great choice!
review_2_text:
Chill chill chill i love it
So green pretty cozy and quite
review_3_text: good
review_4_text: Nice.
review_5_text: A new place that opened in 2024. It seems like the number of cafe-goers is increasing in Thailand these days. I often see people studying in the cafe. From the outside, it was all open seating, but when I went inside, I found a cozy space. It was Songkran, so there weren't many people, which was nice. I'll have to come back tomorrow.

name: Ta Lon Suan Nom
review_1_text:
This place has fantastic coffee and a nice garden setting where you can sit in the shade and hear the sounds of animals at the zoo, which is just next door. This morning I thought I would try their yogurt/fruit bowl for breakfast, and was super disappointed to find that it was some kind of icy dish with a tiny bit of fruit, topped by a sugary syrup so sweet it could break your teeth. I tried to scoop out just the fruit, but there was so much syrup I couldn‚Äôt eat it. If you like *really sweet* desserts, you might like this dish. But when I see the word ‚Äúyogurt,‚Äù I am expecting something a little tart. If the menu included a description I could have anticipated this and just stuck with my coffee. That said, the staff is friendly, the service is great, and I will for sure come back for more delicious coffee!
‚ù§Ô∏è‚òïÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text: My husband and I stopped by this very cozy place for iced coffee and iced thai tea. It was a great surprise. There is wifi, the attendants speak perfectly English and the drinks were good. We had a great morning in the garden, enjoying the outside area of the cafe.
review_3_text: I had a really good salad! A lot of ingredients and nice dressing. Atmosphere is nice in the yard and stuff are kind.
review_4_text: Very nice peaceful cafe with a nice garden area. The drinks are good and the food is also decent as far as what i tried. I liked the mushed potatoes especially. It‚Äôs a good spot when you feel like having a slow and relaxing time. I also tried their pork burger and it was decent enough and i liked its garlic flavor.
review_5_text: A bit run down! Photos of food & menu not corresponding! I went to the other cafe by the lake which is clean and they have better menu & clear! So sad could be such a nice & great place if some effort & work! Location is nice!

name: Caf√© Amazon CMU Heart ‡∏°.‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: **Caf√© Amazon CMU Heart** is a charming coffee shop located within the Chiang Mai University campus, offering a peaceful spot to relax and enjoy a drink. The caf√© has a cozy ambiance with plenty of seating, making it an ideal place to study, meet up with friends, or take a break between classes. The menu features a variety of drinks, from their signature coffee to refreshing iced beverages, all made with quality ingredients. The friendly service and welcoming environment make this place stand out. Plus, the caf√©‚Äôs location near the heart of the university adds to its convenience for students and visitors. If you're looking for a nice spot to unwind, Caf√© Amazon CMU Heart is a great choice!
review_2_text: Uni wifi accessible, cool to cold a/c, quiet with no music/musak, accessible electricity, great natural light, staff are fabulous and kind. Open from 6am, 7 days/week.
review_3_text: Nice tea
review_4_text: A good place to study and hangout.
review_5_text: None of the staff paid attention to the delivery orders. I really don't understand. There were 4-5 staff filling the bar. From the time I walked into the restaurant, gave my order, and waited for almost 20 minutes, they only took orders at the counter. üòå

name: Supattra x JourneyMan
review_1_text: Opens early in the morning. The staff are friendly. You have a lot of options for matcha. It gets crowded a bit on University days in the morning since everyone is rushing for their coffee. We had Americano medium roast which was amazing.
review_2_text: Absolutely love this cafe! The staff are so nice, the coffee and food is incredible (pad thai crispy pork and the sandwiches are the best!) and unbeatable value, and it's in a really nice part of town, at the foot of Doi Suthep. One of the best cafes in CM.
review_3_text:
After a decade, I returned to what used to be my favorite restaurant, now transformed into a charming coffee shop. The ambiance has evolved, but it retains a welcoming vibe that feels both familiar and new.

The variety of coffee beans available was impressive, even though many had similar taste profiles. The coffee I tried was excellent. Although the Pad Thai has changed from what I remember, it was still enjoyable.

Prices are reasonable and environment is cozy.
review_4_text:
Very positively surprised by how good and tasty the food was.
We stopped there a little bit by accident to have a bite before a long ride and it was really great. We had a caesar salad and then a pad Thai/ a chicken curry. Both dishes were delicious (the Curry üòçüòç).
PS ; it was 2pm and we hadnt eaten since the day before. Portions are really ok.

In addition, the service is really nice and friendly, and we loved the music that was played.
review_5_text:
I would strongly recommend against visiting this place. I went there for a light dinner and ordered the chicken salad, which was supposed to include tomatoes and bell peppers. However, when my order arrived, none of these ingredients were present, and it cost $80.

To make matters worse, my partner ordered the Caesar salad, which came without any protein, Caesar dressing, or the advertised vegetables, yet it was priced the same as my dish at $80. When we inquired about the missing items and the price, the employee merely gave us an awkward smile and walked away.

Overall, this place offers a disappointing menu, terrible service, and false advertising. I strongly advise against visiting.

name: Roasto
review_1_text: Interestingly enough, this little gem carries one of the best hot cappuccino tastes in the area. Black orange is very decent, too. We tried the dark roast beans. You can grab a coffee to go and choose the seating on the campus, we prefer the river area. There is a toilet on the left (when you face the coffee shop) under the roof in a nearby building, where you can also sit comfortably at the tables in the shadow. Staff speaks English and they are very friendly, prices are reasonable as most of the things on campus.
review_2_text:
Nice Coffeeshop in Engineering faculty.
It's very comfortable to meeting or sitting for reading books or working.

There are in and out zoning for sitting.

The price is reasonable.
review_3_text: Iced Mocha with Uganda Beans and less sugar - best Mocha in Chiang Mai at this price range, bar none (50 Baht currently)
review_4_text: A chic coffee shop with delicious coffee. I like Dirty Coffee the most. The shop is near the engineering library.
review_5_text:
The shop is beautiful, with plenty of seating and the air conditioning is cool.
The coffee is delicious, with options for medium and dark roasts.

name: Fresh&Mild since 1992 - Chiang Mai University Food Court Branch
review_1_text:
Good place to study: few people, air conditioned, soft music, comfy table setup, though lacking plugs. Great central location within the campus with access to cheap meals in the food court next door.

Coffee is on the stronger side.
review_2_text: Decent cafe with good square tables for work. The food court right next to it is very crowded during the lunch time, but this cafe is rather quiet and nice to relax. Hot cappuccino here is 50thb and it is good. One thing to keep in your mind is that the power outlet is a bit limited unless you sit by the window.
review_3_text: There's a staff member here with a really bad attitude. They don't even say thank you and always talk to you in a cold and impatient tone. The experience here sucks big time. üëé
review_4_text: Fresh&Mild since 1992 at the CMU Food Center is a great place for those looking for healthy and delicious food. Located conveniently within Chiang Mai University, it offers a variety of fresh, flavorful dishes that are perfect for a quick bite between classes or a relaxed meal with friends. The menu features a wide selection of salads, sandwiches, and smoothies, all made with high-quality ingredients. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, making it a popular spot for students and faculty alike. The friendly staff provide excellent service, and the food is always served fresh and tasty. If you're craving something light, nutritious, and satisfying, this is definitely a go-to place!
review_5_text: It‚Äôs a lovely and cozy place inside the university campus. The coffee is great, so is the ice cream and the atmosphere. Most importantly, the staff is incredibly polite and nice. They always make your day. Today we just stopped by while running because we ran out of water, had only 1000 baht note and felt bad to ask just for water but it wasn‚Äôt problem at all. A good spot when you want to run away from the centre.

name: LAW COFF. STAND ‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏ß‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü ‡∏™‡πÅ‡∏ï‡∏ô‡∏î‡πå RB3
review_1_text: **LAW COFF. STAND RB3** is a cozy little coffee shop located in a convenient spot, perfect for those who want a quick caffeine fix. The place is known for its friendly service and inviting atmosphere. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for a regular cup of coffee, iced drinks, or something more unique, this place has got you covered. The coffee is consistently good, and the staff is always welcoming, making it a nice stop for a relaxing break. With its laid-back vibe, it‚Äôs also a great spot to grab a quick drink on the go or to catch up with friends. If you‚Äôre near the area, it‚Äôs definitely worth checking out!
review_2_text: Great location and same great tasting coffee.  I really like their light roast beans.
review_3_text: Every menu item is reasonably priced, worth the price, and tastes great. The shop doesn't have a place to sit and drink, making it ideal for people who want to buy and then take it to school/the library, or buy and then return to their dorm/home. Personally, my regular order is iced fresh milk, which is the perfect fresh milk! My friends and I all like to order green tea. I'm secretly curious to try it. I'll have to find an opportunity to try it. üòã
review_4_text:
A quality-conscious coffee shop with student prices.
The coffee, drinks, and desserts are all excellent. The flavors are delicious and the food is clean. They have a wide selection of beans and menu items.
They're made quickly, so you don't have to wait long.
Opens at 7:30 AM.
review_5_text:
The coffee is inexpensive and delicious, perfect for university students. It's best to grab a takeaway to enjoy while studying or working, as there's no seating inside the shop.
The coffee tastes really good.

name: Cafe 21st
review_1_text: One of the cafes on campus. It‚Äôs in the art building, so the space is more creative and spacious with a high ceiling. They have very good chairs for working as well. The prices are just as mush as other cafes on campus.
review_2_text: Cheap price, good taste, located inside the Faculty of Architecture. Walk straight in, turn right and you'll find it. There are some plugs to use. Sit and work comfortably.
review_3_text: Coffee shop in the Faculty of Architecture

name: I LOVE COFFEE ‡∏®‡∏π‡∏ô‡∏¢‡πå‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏£ CMU
review_1_text: I LOVE COFFEE at CMU Food Court is a great spot for coffee enthusiasts looking for a quick caffeine fix on campus. Their coffee is rich and aromatic, with a variety of options to choose from, including iced lattes, espressos, and classic hot coffee. Whether you're in need of a morning pick-me-up or an afternoon refreshment, this place has got you covered. The staff is friendly and always ready to make your coffee just the way you like it. With its convenient location in the food court, it's perfect for students and staff who want to grab a quality coffee in between classes or work.
review_2_text: 40thb for a cup of hot americano and it is good. This is a take out only store located in the 2nd floor of the food court.
review_3_text: A comfortable coffee shop with delicious coffee, located behind Chiang Mai University.
review_4_text: delicious

name: HOM HOM NA CAFE
review_1_text: The cafe is cute and it gives you more private space and atmosphere if you don‚Äôt like dining out in public. Plus, the owner is so friendly, kind and makes your eating space comfortable.
review_2_text: This is my go-to shop. The coffee is good, high-quality, and reasonably priced. They have a wide variety of drinks to choose from. The shop has a Japanese theme, and they play music and decorate according to the seasons. The owner is very friendly, and they also sell some fried snacks.
review_3_text: The shop moved from the female dormitory 1 (already demolished) to the male dormitory 6. The shop is closed every Monday. It is a cafe that sells rice dishes and steamed bread as a dessert. The tea menu is considered common except for the matcha which is easy to drink and has a fragrant milky smell for 35 baht. I have not tried the cocoa menu. I have not tried the coffee yet, but the menu with milk is delicious and fragrant and just the right amount. The shop does not have black pearls, but will have konjac pearls instead. If you want to add them, the price will be an additional 5 baht. As for the food, the ramen costs 35 baht, the noodles are soft and the toppings are delicious, especially the Naruto. The soup is considered normal. As for the chicken karaage rice, it is very delicious. You can choose the sauce. I personally chose the tonkatsu sauce, which is delicious. The rice is soft and not soggy. The vegetables are fresh. The fried chicken is fragrant, crispy, and not oily for 35 baht. The shop does not have special orders, but you can ask for more when ordering, for example, 1 chicken and 1 rice, the price will increase to 55 baht. The shop owner is good, smiling, and friendly. There is a point collection system via Line. The shop is small but has a good atmosphere and is clean, but there may be a few ants at the counter (I have never seen any ants in the water or food). There are seats both inside and outside the shop.
review_4_text:
Hom Hom Na Cafe (‡∏´‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏´‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏ô‡∏∞) is located at Male Dormitory 6, Chiang Mai University. It offers a wide variety of Japanese food and drinks that you must try, especially the Karaage Chicken Rice and various snacks, which are all delicious. I personally love the coffee made by the owner, who is very attentive and meticulous in her preparation. The interior is decorated in a Japanese theme, surrounded by trees, creating a pleasant and relaxing atmosphere.
P.S. The owner is very kind and friendly. Feel free to chat with her! üòÖ
review_5_text: This is a shop that offers a variety of drinks, especially fruit tea, which I personally feel is hard to find. The price is not expensive. The shop is small and cute and minimal. There are inexpensive food and snacks. The service is good. There are points to collect (only drinks) ü•∞üíû *The picture shows raspberry tea.

name: Social Science Coffee Shop
review_1_text: Cheap and good coffee

name: Got A+ Coffee
review_1_text: good, beautiful, inexpensive. but I don't like disposable tableware, even if it's eco-friendly.
review_2_text: Very good coffee for a great price!üòç the lady working there is the nicest!! Try their coffee with oatmilk, i can recommend‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_3_text: Nice cheap tea with friendly staff :)
review_4_text: Nice iced tea
review_5_text: Very good coffee in Campus

name: Mild Coffee
review_1_text: We ordered the cold chocolate and it was absolutely amazing. The sweetness level was perfect and creamy and thick. Loved every sip of it !!! It has limited seating and is near another restaurant.
review_2_text:
Always good to go.
They serve a long drink menu but no food. No inside dining but some table and chairs outside.
A little bit less expensive than the rest. Next to 7-11.
review_3_text: Good coffee at a reasonable priceüíØüëåThey serve other drinks too.
review_4_text: Smooth, good tasting coffee, good price for vanilla latte 35 baht and only 30 baht for a smooth very good tasting, slightly sweet regular coffee. For the superior taste this place offers this is the best deal I‚Äôm town for high quality coffee. Very impressive. The coffee is mild and pleasant. The owner uses coffee bean from the north of Thailand, the quality is top notch. It‚Äôs one of the places for coffee I like to frequent. Clean serving area and nice place to sit. Quick order window service. Funny little fact they are closed only one day a month. The 25th of each month is the only day they are closed. Interesting, quirky policy...makes me like the place even more. This place is just perfect for a quick really good tasting cup of Joe. You will be a fan to, this place does not disappoint.
review_5_text: Reasonable price coffee

name: Micha Coffee Shop (CMU Faculty Of Humanities Branch)
review_2_text: Today I went to buy an iced tea with less sugar, emphasizing this to the staff. What I got was iced tea with plenty of sugar. Terrible service, and it wasn't even worth the 45 baht price.
review_3_text: The coffee and jasmine tea were absolutely awful, but the Thai milk tea and green milk tea were pretty good.
review_4_text: Today, at approximately 3:40 PM, I visited the store and the staff seemed unwelcoming and spoke rudely to customers. I'm not sure if they were forced to act that way, but I would like this matter to be given special consideration so that the store will be more inviting.
review_5_text: The staff's manners are completely useless. Honestly, if you don't want to sell, don't sell. Just close the shop. Why are you acting so angrily and making a sour face? You're talking like you're asking for free food? I can't take it.

name: Firefly Factory - Thai & Italian Fusion Restaurant & 3D Immersive Dining Experience
review_1_text:
I really wanted to give a five star review, but there are too many things nit quite matching the atmosphere.

Firstly, the 4 stars is all on atmosphere.  Our kids had a fantastic time interacting with the walls.  They drew pictures which were then scanned up into the projections.  Really fun and rewarding.

Look at the pictures and you will see that the dining experience would be also a great place for romance... at the other end of the room.  Or, the place would be a sensational venue for a special group event if you booked it out entirely.

Some unwarranted criticism in other reviews - you don't need to walk through rubbish or a warehouse.  The restaurant is easy to find.  Go up the stairs and look for the signs - or simply turn right (ser the video).

Warranted comments in other reviews.  The service - yes, the stagg are unfriendly.  They are abrupt and generally just take your order with a forced smile.  There are too many of them, so perhaps they like leaving the work to their colleagues.  I don't know... but it needs fixing to match the experience factor.

The food - the Brazilian styke BBQ was great.  It was tge only dish that truly matched the ambience.  The rest were ordinary - but the portions were good, so I think the pricing is about right.

A few minor things.  There are power cords across the floor.  I almost tripped on one.  They need to be properly secured.

The table positioning means.that some seats are in direct line with the projectors.  I sat with lights in my eyes and couldn't see the people sitting opposite.  Simply putting the edge tables on angles would fix this issue.  Otherwise, take a table in the middle of the room.

The food mostly came out together - so that previously mentioned issue seems to have been fixed.  Although, there was a small gap as only one waiter served us despite there being many staff on hand.

So come here for the experience and enjoy the food.  You will have a good night out.
review_2_text: If you want to go to those super fancy hologram rooms, but you don‚Äôt have enough money to pay for it, This is a place to go! The food is priced reasonably well for the room that you sent in. I recommend getting the salmon as it is very crispy and peppery . But I don‚Äôt recommend getting the floating barbecue because the pork is very chewy but other than that I‚Äôve definitely recommend going to this place because of it‚Äôs holograms and style. I recommend going with you and one other person.
review_3_text: Overall, it was a good experience. However, the staff could benefit from some additional service training. For example, when we ordered a bottle of wine, the server poured it directly into the glasses without first asking our preference or offering to serve each guest individually. Additionally, with four dishes on a small table for two, it would have been helpful if the staff checked in to clear empty plates as we went along. Small improvements in attentiveness would make the dining experience even better.
review_4_text: What an amazing experience! Had a group birthday dinner and it was a magical time. All those projectors set up were very impressive and created a 180 immersion. Drinks were fantastic! Best cocktails I‚Äôve had in Chiang Mai. Definitely a cool place to come with friends for a celebration.
review_5_text: This place is a gem you might not find unless you were looking for it. The food was good-- one of the best takes on khao soi pizza I've had so far. But the atmosphere of the seperate dining spaces is the real draw. It was fun and whimsical.

name: BOB Coffee
review_1_text: A chic spot for bevs, work, and chats, popular with locals and expats alike, as is evident from an ecclectic weekday midafternoon crowd. The place has an interesting layout spanning several separate buildings with a central compound. The place to order is a smaller open-air space immediately to the right upon entering the compound's front gates, tended to by attentive and cordial staff. Past an arch-like way beyond that is an air-conditioned seating hall to the left, and another roomy space to the right, which acts as the venue for the "OB" restaurant after 1700. There's plenty of varied seating across these spaces. The October halloween themed decor dotted throughout is cheeky, real tasteful. Bob's a solid choice anongst cafes in the area.
review_2_text: Great place to have coffee and spend some time to chat or even work! Love the furnitures and the overall vibe there. There's not much to eat tho
review_3_text: Nice coffee, lovely staff, and a comfortable, spacious place where you can choose your own spot.
review_4_text:
Lovely cafe in Santitham. Very good coffee and beautiful aesthetic. Even had super tasty 12 baht brownies!

There is a quiet in door area, seems more suited for co-working. A small outdoor area at the front and a larger courtyard round the back with beautiful plants.

Good coffee, good vibes.
review_5_text: Is a really nice and cosy coffee shop. Their coffee is really nice and the bakery tastes really good. There's other space at the back of the shop where you can take pictures and bring your laptop for work.

name: TORA BAKE „Éà„É©‚Ä¢„Éô„Ç§„ÇØ : Homemade Bakes & Coffee Shop
review_1_text:
Cool and warm ambient, great coffee like Australia's test, great cake and cookie
Very enjoy this momnet.
review_2_text:
Forgot to write a review about this place .

Hidden at the end of a road. Coffee was great but I only took pics of the cakes which were equally good.

Owner was friendly and didn't realise it was a co-working space also until I saw the other area.

Parking : within compound
review_3_text:
This caf√© is tucked away at the end of a quiet alley, making it a peaceful spot to relax. I‚Äôve been here twice, and the cakes are delicious‚Äîlight, fresh, and not too sweet. The atmosphere is cozy, with a charming message board full of cute sticky notes, along with books and self-serve drinking water.

It also serves as a co-working space, offering both indoor and outdoor seating. The restroom is clean, which is always a plus. A great place to unwind or get some work done!
review_4_text: The best cafe in Chiang Mai! Great oat milk latte and matcha. And Mod and the owner are so kind.
review_5_text:
Tucked away in the far back of a Soi, you can find Tora the tiger üêÖ. He doesn't look too impressed with tourist photos but his owner makes some great Coconut Water Americano. The Orange Americano was really nice as well thanks to the fresh orange juice.

We also had a Banoffee cake which was very tasty. It has a biscuit base that tastes similar to Oreos, a thick layer of bananas and it's covered in cream. I generally do not like Banoffee cake but I have to admit this was great üëç

If you're in the area and up for an adventure down the Soi, pay Tora Bake a visit. You'll walk through some traditional Thai living quarters and be able to see the local way of life.

name: Cafe‚Äô Amazon
review_1_text:
Cool cafe
Nice atmosphere
Laptop friendly

--> toilet 5 min walk by street to another building
review_2_text: There was a power outage for over an hour, but the staff were friendly. üòÖ
review_3_text: Sell drinks but for the toilet you have to go to the supermarket 100m down the road even though they have plenty space inside. Dirty windows. Bad set up, bad maintenance
review_4_text: Very best coffee place in Chiang Mai
review_5_text: Tooooo cold. Please adjust your air conditioning. üôè

name: OYES Smoothies & Happy Food - ‡πÇ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏¢‡∏™ ‡∏ú‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏ú‡∏•‡πÑ‡∏°‡πâ‡∏õ‡∏±‡πà‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏Ç‡∏†‡∏≤‡∏û
review_1_text:
OYES Smoothies & Happy Food is a great spot with friendly staff and a pet- and work-friendly atmosphere. The smoothies and a√ßa√≠ bowls are delicious and refreshing, and the coffee is tasty as well. The cookies are absolutely to die for!
It‚Äôs an excellent place for breakfast or brunch, especially if you‚Äôre looking for healthy and satisfying options in a relaxed environment. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
Amazing spot for fresh juices, great coffee, and the best smoothie bowls. Everything is made fresh right in front of you and tastes incredible. A must-visit!
The Sunshine smoothie bowl with a drizzle of honey is absolutely to die for.
review_3_text:
The food- amazing smoothies and smoothie bowls.
The service- most friendly staff in the area.
The atmosphere- wonderfully appointed, soft music, quiet inside, wifi, good vibes, nice outside area.
review_4_text:
Highly recommend. Delicious creamy chocolate strawberry smoothie bowl with chocolate protein. YUM. Delicious and healthy! Best prices too!
Calm relaxing atmosphere. Tried coffee from the Karen Tribe in northern Thailand here , now I have a new favourite coffee bean!!

Wonderful place. Many healthy options with protein (whey + vegan) Come, you‚Äôll enjoy it. üòå
review_5_text:
One of my go to spots to enjoy a tasty and healthy breakfast before going to a coworking space around the corner.

Kind staff and also good coffee!

Pro tip; add in a scoop of Whey protein to make sure you‚Äôll hit your macro‚Äôs

name: Elephant Organic ( Health Foods )
review_1_text:
Very nice place for those passionate about organic and local products
I got a bunch of thai coffee beans and cocoa beans. I am waiting forward to tasting it. The people who work there are also very nice. If I ll visit Chiang Mai again I ll come back for sure.
review_2_text: Been missing the access to herbs, oil, and tinctures and Elephant Organic filled that void internationally. Tucked away down a busy local business shop street. The shop is clean and well well organized. Enjoyed the jams and the friendliness Cee was amazing! If you are in need of natural Earthly necessities stop by.
review_3_text: Amazing shop with super foods, natural products, ceremonial cacao, honey, candles,, essential oils. I‚Äôm a regular here, absolutely love it! And the owner is the best!!!! This is kind of a small business I wish we had more in the world. Thank you!
review_4_text: Fabulous, local health food & healthy products store just near Old City... an easy walk from the North Gate.  Especially love that they stock Pure Thai Naturals products. Nice people & great service.
review_5_text:
An absolute beautiful establishment!

Since I am plant-based/vegan/organic lifestyle, I love to visit and support local organic health stores.

I found elephant organic health foods shop just  by searching organic on Google maps, and this rare gem store popped up as I‚Äôm so thankful and blessed to have found this wonderful place.

For those who are health conscious, looking for organic Superfoods/powders/protein powder/grains, essential oils, delicious smoothies, and other health products, this is the place to stop in and shop. They have a little bit of everything in case you‚Äôre traveling abroad and worried about not having certain items with you to satisfy your health needs.

They have their own brand/ products of organic superfood powders and more to satisfy all of your health needs.

I started out shopping for a vegan floss which I found and I love, then I saw a gentleman walked in and ordered a smoothie which I didn‚Äôt realize until I saw the menu later. So I decided to order the super green smoothie and it was delicious especially if you enjoy your greens, well balanced flavor with the fruits and their in-store brand super green organic powder.

I love how they utilize their own products in their smoothies, a great way to sample their powders so if you plan to make your own smoothies at home , you can buy the powder there and enjoy at home or wherever you‚Äôre staying so you can make your own smoothies.

You can also order their products and have them shipped if you plan to stay in Thailand for sometime

I had the pleasure of speaking with the owner  Sasa who is very friendly, cool, and fun to talk with especially aboutHealth/travel/life /and more. Sasa is very knowledgeable about Health foods/and more to help accommodate your daily needs to optimize nutrition and overall to maintain a healthy body.

I ended up staying in the shop for almost 2 hours, just hanging out having a great conversation with the owner and other team members, shopping around, testing out products, and also ordering a second smoothie which was the berry boost, another delicious smoothie on the menu as I look forward to trying more before I leave.

So I ended up buying a few smoothies, some super green powder, mosquito repellent, vegan floss, and Sasa‚Äôs Bonita essential oil made by the owner.

Overall, this is a beautiful establishment as I am blessed to have found Elephant Organic (Health Foods). Be sure to stop in and try a smoothie and test out some of their products and enjoy a great experience. üòÉüôèüèºüå±üíöü´êü•≠ü••ü•¨üáπüá≠

name: Green Roasters Coffee
review_1_text: Great V60 drip coffee from a local coffee farm 120 baht. Espresso is cheaper of course. The host is very precise, cleans his espresso machine every time, so top quality. Nice atmosphere too.
review_2_text:
This is a great coffee shop in the neighborhood! There are 3 bean roast options available - all of them are local to the Chiang Mai region. The espresso taste is fantastic.

The coffee shop has a cozy feel. And the barista owner is very sweet. The chairs are great for lounging and there‚Äôs WiFi available.
review_3_text:
Coffee made with passion & professional attitude is what I felt from Green Roasters.

The time I went was months ago, I remember they offered choice of house blend from Kanchanaburi,  Chiangmai to seasonal blend from Columbia. Price were very affordable from $45B up.

I ordered Flat White, also it's out of the menu but lady owner made it for me, thank you for the coffee, which was nutty and full body.

The cafe itself is very simple and clean. Their coffee machine is same as i saw in Asama Cafe, which is rare in Chiangmai. The morning I went were all locals and the owner were having a class with secondary school students about coffee beans, I was very impressed that they put their efforts not only on business but to the community too.
review_4_text: So good I had to get a second cuppa. The owner is also extremely friendly; we had a nice chat about his 20-year experience roasting and brewing
review_5_text: Very cozy coffee shop in CNX one of hidden gems that you should visit.

name: Wanwaree
review_1_text: This cafe sells some food and has a small garden. They don‚Äôt have light roast bean and you can choose either medium or dark roast. The drinks were just ok.
review_2_text:
Really lovely tranquil cafe that has good customer service and the best homemade banana cake I've had.

Usually quiet enough to get focused work done!

On the menu is pastries, good coffee, teas and smoothie. All day breakfast is toast with eggs etc.
review_3_text: Quiet comfortable small cafe serving coffee and tea with both AC and outdoor seating. Low key and rarely busy. It's mostly locals that hang out here for an hour or two. Perfect for those looking to escape from heat or rain during the day. Staff is friendly.
review_4_text: Great coffee but most important amazing toast, finally some enjoyable western bread toasted with topping. Great breakfast
review_5_text:
Coffee was good and they sell some sweats that look good. The lady running the place is very friendly. Unfortunately we waited something like 20 minutes for 2 toast, 1 scrambled egg and one fried egg. She is doing everything by herself and the place was not even half full.
The breakfast was basically toast and egg, not so good.

name: Waseda „Çè„Åõ„Å† Chiangmai coffee and milk tea
review_1_text:
Cute little, minimal shop that I really respect is open until 2 AM

Came in, has a freshly brewed cappuccino, and chilled a bit while working in peace
review_2_text: I very very like this shop. There has many  bubble milk tea. The last time I ordered original one, it's very good and the price is so lovely. Now I came again and tried the matcha latte, less sweet that found out it's so fantastic and next time I will order this milk tea again. Delicious and lovely ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: I mostly work from home at night, so I wanted something to keep me awake but I don‚Äôt like coffee. This is matcha with water. (It‚Äôs really hard to find tea or coffee shops open late at night, but this place is one of the rare ones.)
review_4_text: This matcha is so good even I ordered 0% sweets. It means The matcha is good quality I love it üçµ suits for matcha lovers ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: The best bubble tea I have ever had! Open late, amazing service, fresh and absolutely delicious. Made with love! üôè I won‚Äôt be going anywhere else in Chiang Mai ü•∞

name: ZONE Bingsu & Caf√©
review_1_text: Great cosy place
review_2_text: Good place
review_3_text:
This is a bingsu shop near Kad Thanin that's been open for quite some time, but I'm sure many people don't know about it (I haven't seen any posts about it on social media).

The shop's decor features beautifully painted polar-themed murals on the walls. The air conditioning is icy cold, creating a truly chill atmosphere. The shop offers both bingsu and drinks, just like any other cafe. The bingsu comes in two sizes, and the flavors are decent.
review_4_text: ZONE Bingsu & Caf√© is a very stylish cafe. The interior has a calming atmosphere, perfect for relaxing. Their bingsu (Korean shaved ice) is especially delicious, with a wide variety of flavors, including fruit and red beans. Each one is beautifully presented, almost too good to eat. The drink menu is also extensive, offering not only coffee and tea, but also seasonal special drinks. The friendly staff and excellent service are a plus. It's a great spot for chatting with friends, reading alone, or even a date, so be sure to give it a try. I'm sure it'll become your favorite.
review_5_text:
I'll definitely be back here! üíì Normally, when I go to other bingsu places, I don't finish them because they're too sweet.
But I ordered two items at this place and finished them all. They were incredibly delicious, not too sweet, and a joy to eat.
The blueberry bingsu was incredibly delicious! The size M cost 185 baht, which is a great value for the portion.
In the hot weather, if you're looking for a cool dessert, I highly recommend this place.

name: Lanna Laundry & Lanna Coffee
review_1_text: Bring your laundry here! Not only they open 24/7, it is staffed so you don't need to anything after dropping it off!!! You can select water and dryer temperature to your liking. Pick up as quickly as 2 hours. The cost is also unbeatable. 65thb to wash 14kg and another 65thb for drying.
review_2_text: Best laundry ever! State of the art new and clean SpeedQueen laundry machines! Enjoy a drink with aircond while waiting for laundry!! There are friendly staff here to take care of your laundry while you are away and pick-up later!!
review_3_text: The best best best laundry ever.  Drop off fluff and fold in 3 hrs (depending how busy they are).  They even gave me my pocket change back!  Open 24/7, great staff, modern machines, awesome price.  Can they open branches everywhere I live because they‚Äôre really the best!  Thanks Lanna!
review_4_text: Very recently used these guys for my dirty clothes. Friendly service, clothes were clean and folded nicely. Offered me a 3hr turn around but they said I could turn up whenever (they are 24hr which is good). Easy drop off and pick up. Will use again before I leave.
review_5_text: We had a great experience with this laundry service. The staff was very kind and helpful, and everything went smoothly from start to finish. We picked up our clothes later in the night with no issues ‚Äî everything was freshly washed, nicely folded, and smelled amazing. Highly recommended!

name: GANDAMU ‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏π ‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏û‡∏•‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: The shop has a very friendly atmosphere. I had a lot of fun talking to the staff and they gave great recommendations. I was extremely impressed!
review_2_text: The shop owner is polite, friendly, and very welcoming. I'll definitely be a frequent customer next time.
review_3_text: The shop is very friendly and talkative. I had a lot of fun talking with the staff and they gave me really good recommendations. I'm impressed.
review_4_text: The shop owner was very nice and friendly. The shop is great.üòîüëç

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ï‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠ ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏°.‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡∏†‡∏±‡∏è‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
This branch also has 'Thai Tea Slushy'!
Or, as it's also called, the Thai Tea Slushy with the "Hand Brand" logo üòã (You have to spread the word!)

The atmosphere under the classroom building is great; I often stop by to study here.
Because the aroma of Thai tea in the shop helps me relax from studying and also makes me feel more alert.
review_2_text: Cha Tra Mue is a Thai beverage franchise, a Thai tea brand that has been a part of Thailand's culture for over 50 years. They offer drinks such as lemon tea and Thai milk tea, as well as snacks. This branch is located on the 1st floor of the 90th Anniversary Building at Chiang Mai Rajabhat University, Wiang Bua Campus.
review_3_text: I ordered green tea with brown sugar boba. The staff brought me green tea with brown sugar boba. Okay, I understand that communication can be misunderstood. I had already received the order and nothing happened. But the staff turned to another staff and said that the customer was talking nonsense. Is this okay? How did you know? My friend who was standing there heard it all. She glanced at the customer with the corner of her eye. If you don't love service work, go do something else. Or stay in the back and don't come out to greet customers. Just because you're a university student, can you treat me however you want? I came to pay as a customer. Because I asked many friends and they have encountered similar situations many times where the staff have used harsh words. Please improve our service.
review_4_text: The staff have very poor manners; they should receive training in customer service etiquette.
review_5_text: The employee insulted the customer and caused damage.

name: ‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏•‡πà‡∏ô‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: Love the vibe, the place is so cool. Please come and wish you enjoy.
review_2_text:
Very cute ,
Simple
Fun atmosphere
Young people
Very reasonable pricing
25/35 THB for most drinks
review_3_text:
Very nice coffee and good price
Please try this shop
review_4_text:
The coffee is reasonablely priced, and the iced latte was flavorful. I had a butter/milk toast and asked to have honey added. It was delicious. The service staff were very friendly. English isn't spoken but pointing to menu items (every item has a photo) and using Google Translate easily solves any problems.
A cup stacking game is available for use at the large table.
Note: Bathroom and wi-fi are available.
review_5_text:
There are so many cute toys!
There are a few small tables inside and outside,
and the friendly owner prepares food and tea.
It's a cozy cafe, like a snack bar in front of a school. „Öé„Öé
+Chic, chubby cats wander around casually.

I'll add this! It looks like they have a vintage clothing store right next door, and they have so many cute itemsü§©
The clothes are all neatly organized, and if you're good at treasure hunting, you can find some great items.

name: D Milk ‡πÑ‡∏°‡πÇ‡∏•‡∏î‡∏¥‡∏ö ‡πÄ‡∏à‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏ï‡∏≥‡∏´‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö
review_1_text:
The price is reasonable, and there's a good selection of toppings. It's hard to find raw Milo at these shops these days.üòÖ
You can choose the sweetness level, which is exactly what I wanted.
review_2_text: This milk is uniquely fragrant and delicious. It's so good! üëç
review_3_text: Delicious and inexpensive.
review_4_text: The Legend of Milo Raw

name: Larb Heng Charoen, Larb Restaurant & Bar, Spicy Papaya Salad, Curries, and More !
review_1_text: such an authentic family owned thai restaurant. cozy atmosphere and noodle were some of the best I've had in thailand. would like to try all of their menu next time.
review_2_text: Very nice local restaurant. We had 2 local (northern Thailand) dishes very tasty! If you don't like it to spicy request it before ordering because it could get a little hot depending of your choice. Owners very friendly!
review_3_text: We had lunch here several times during the week, everything was fresh and tasty. Lot of options of northern Thailand cuisine.
review_4_text: We just passed by this place randomly. But the food is the best I had in Chiang Mai. The taste of the noodle soup is very condensed and all the meat is so tender. ü§§
review_5_text: Amazing experience of Northern Thai hospitality and excellent authentic food!

name: On the way cafe Chiangmai
review_1_text: Coffee is good quality here, I highly recommend
review_2_text: Thai tea and many other drinks made Lanna Thai traditional way with healthy ingredients.

name: TARAKO BAKERY & CAFE
review_1_text:
Cute little spot for coffee, matcha and ice cream. I stopped by around lunch time needing a quiet break and ordered a matcha latte (they have oat milk!) It was about 70-75 THB and made with traditional methods and attention. The gentleman who made it kindly brought it to a seat I got facing outside on a lovely little tray along with a spoon and a little cookie/biscuit! Nice little surprise and I allowed myself to indulge.

The matcha wasn't bitter nor sweet- a gentle aroma that even those who prefer sugar can enjoy with little to no added sugar. The sweetness in the biscuit can balance it if you want sugar and of course you can add it.

A lovely group of women, I believe one is an owner like the gentleman who served me, gave me some travel advice for temples to visit since it is important to me. We had a nice chat and connected on an authentic level.

Great acoustic music and covers of Western songs played the whole time too. Highly recommend this little gem!
review_2_text: Great Iced Americano. String but mellow and smooth. Lovely homemade ice cream too!
review_3_text: Great Thai tea, you can ask for the level of sweetness you want. Seating is small but very cute!
review_4_text: Tasty cheesecake with fruits - a small portion for just 60 baht. The staff was very friendly and the place had a pleasant atmosphere.
review_5_text: Great quality coffee, great service!

name: GG‚Äôs Caf√©
review_1_text: Nice cafe! Drunk a cup of coffee and one singha beer large size in very cheap price and good atmosphere.
review_2_text: Nice place good vibes good coffee and GG has very good energy!
review_3_text: A Very Cute and Relaxed Coffee Shop. It is a great spot to take it easy, and have a break during the day. The customers are nice, and the owner is passionate about her shop and her coffee!!!
review_4_text: GG is a wonderful young woman with a radiant spirit. She runs the caf√© herself, and the espresso is authentically European ‚Äî a solid 10/10
review_5_text: GG She‚Äôs super friendly and fun, plus the coffee is really good

name: ‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏¨‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏°‡∏ß‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
First of all, Thais can get into the cafe just order a drink and enjoy your cat vibes there. However, foreigners have to pay 100 baht minimum for the entry even though you get a drink as well.
I don't understand why they have 2 prices for the entry, what's the matter?
The cats were so cute and very chubby though.
review_2_text: It's very make your happy if you come here you will love because cats have so cute ü•∞ü•∞If you don't want to play cat games, there are board games and drinks available.
review_3_text:
I'd describe this place as quaint, peaceful, and homey. You'd expect that the place would be dirty because of the aesthetic but everything was clean and smelt good.

The music played in the cafe added to the peaceful vibe of the place, and the service was fast and the staff were really helpful. The drinks they had was cheap too, and were quite good.

If you're in the area, this place is a must-visit for cat lovers.
review_4_text: Found this place coincidentally and was a true gem. The place has a good drinks menu and cute cats. All cats look quite comfortable with people and it shows how well these cats are living in this place. There r also board games, so u can kill ur time if u get bored. But u won't be, because of these cute cats! Such a healing place for me ü•π
review_5_text:
You may have the whole playground with the cats if you visit this place around noon time.

Very peaceful with soft music.

All the cats are super cute.

The beverage price is very reasonable.

name: Keane Coffee and Guest House.
review_1_text: Really nice coffe shop. We had a night flight and had to wait few hours to check in to our hotel so visited this place. The people working didn't mind us waiting and relaxing. We ordered few drinks and truly enjoyed them. The lemon cheesecake tea was unbelievably good.
review_2_text:
If you‚Äôre looking for a cozy-ish spot to sip coffee while escaping the crowds, Keane Coffee & Guest House is a hidden gem near Jing Jai Market. With its vintage and hipster decor, stepping inside feels like entering a warm, inviting home. The ambiance is relaxing with nice music in the background, although the lighting leans a bit too warm for our taste.

The seating is well thought out, with options for both work and chilling. We enjoyed their light and medium roast iced lattes, both of which were made well. They also have a good selection of non-caffeinated drinks, making it a great choice for everyone. They also have non-dairy milk options with additional 20 Bahts. The drinks are priced between 60-85 Bahts which is not bad for the air conditioned cafe.

On a second visit, we tried the Thai iced tea, but it was a bit too creamy for our liking, despite its popularity. The butter cake was tasty but on the small side for the price.

Overall, it‚Äôs a lovely cafe with friendly owners and a chill vibe, perfect for getting some work done or just unwinding with good music.

Definitely worth checking out!
review_3_text:
I‚Äôm so proud of myself for finding such a cozy and minimalist space in Chiang Mai. I even feel a little envious to share this vibe with others! But I truly hope that someone who‚Äôs been longing for a place like this will discover it and find peace of mind here.
The place is super clean and smells amazing. The guest house is safe, quiet, and reasonably priced.
The caf√© is perfect for chilling, reading, or even a photo shoot.
review_4_text: This room has a minimalist and cozy design. The dark green walls create a calm and relaxing ambiance, while the warm beige curtains complement the darker tones. The low bed with dark bedding adds to the simplicity, and the wooden floor provides a natural and warm feel. The bedside table with a lamp and water bottles adds functionality and a welcoming touch. The ceiling-mounted air conditioner ensures comfort, but the room might feel a bit small due to the compact arrangement. Overall, it‚Äôs a practical and serene space.ü´∂üèªüß∏
review_5_text: Feel like home , cozy ,classy, friendly üßãü•§‚òïÔ∏è

name: White House cafe
review_1_text: Really cute little place. Anytime I feel like Pad Ka Praow I come here. Very flavourful and well seasoned. Only 40 baht or 50 baht with an egg. The owners are super nice and friendly too
review_2_text: Nice peaceful atmosphere. Foods and drinks are basic but very good with lovely service from owner. Price is very reasonable compared to busy fancy cafe on Nimmahemin areas.
review_3_text: We always had the place to ourselves. Humble place. Nice and quiet. Very convenient for us as we are checked-in ay the Lotus Hotel. Our go to place to quench thirst!
review_4_text: lovely little place with an awesome atmosphere! we had Thai Tea, Rice with Omelette and Spicy Stir-Fried Minced Pork with Holy Basil.The flavor is very intense and delicious! Also, the owner is very friendly!
review_5_text:
Hidden gem in one of the strangely abandoned attachment of the hotel.
You wouldn‚Äôt expect to find a nice lady serving nice Thai lunches and fruit smoothies. Great value.
-nice tree shade and breeze too

name: D O O R COFFEE
review_1_text: I stumbled upon a small cafe while walking through the alleys near the hotel.
