The coffee was quite good and the prices were very affordable, the owner and her two parrot "employees" were adorable üòÑ. I recommend it to anyone looking for a quick, convenient, yet quality place to have a drink.
review_2_text: The even have Oat (plant-based) milk!!!
review_3_text: Such a lovey Caf√© ü•∞
review_4_text: The price is not expensive, a cup of coffee is 45 baht.
review_5_text:
Simple yet extraordinary, this small doorway behind Rajabhat University houses a compact coffee bar, about the size of the door itself, serving both coffee and non-coffee drinks at incredibly affordable prices, starting from just 30 baht. If you're passing by, stop in and grab a takeaway drink!

üçπIced lime juice with honey 35 baht

name: Sukhum cafe

review_2_text:
Our morning coffee fix at the market and it was great!

First time trying a dirty coffee and thought it was really good, so much so that I almost went for a second cup of their signature drink but had to stop myself..

Definitely come by and support these local coffee cart vendors! üëçüèª
review_3_text: The Thai tea with coffee was good! Thinking about make me want some right now üò©üò©üò©
review_4_text:
Thai tea üëç
Matcha orangeüëç
review_5_text: Very high standard coffee. Do not miss it.

review_1_text: It‚Äôs good~~~
review_2_text: The iced tea is delicious, with a unique aroma. This branch has a huge selection of desserts. I couldn't decide which one to choose. The salespeople are very friendly. If you're looking for a reasonably priced drink, I highly recommend this place. ‚òï

name: Mizu cafe in car cmru.
review_1_text: Delicious coffee, low prices, and great service. I highly recommend when you‚Äôre nearby and want to grab a coffee to go.

review_3_text: Low price and good taste. If you are nearby, I recommend to you.

review_5_text: I ordered for the first time and the green tea and Thai tea were incredibly delicious! I'll definitely order again.

review_2_text: The place is really ‚Äòglass‚Äôy, bright and modern vibe. Drinks selections are variety enough. Coffee itself tastes decent. Dirty is pretty good. Price is considered on a high side. Cafe itself is a bit hideous, need to carefully look out for the logo. Bakery looks good, gonna try next time.
review_3_text: The newest cafe in Nimman. Nice coffee and services. Come and visit, you will never disappoint. ü•∞
review_4_text:
Lovely Cafeüíõ
A must to visit! High quality coffee +  fresh baked bakery
Friendly staffs üòäüéÅ
review_5_text:
Nice and Cozy place with very friendly staffs.
Since I am a BIG fan of Yuzu I ordered ‚ÄúSome Yuzu‚Äù Dang, one sip and you know it, Its a high quality Yuzu right here, must try!

name: Chum Coffee
review_1_text:
Less sweet, normal sweet, or unsweetened ‚Äì you can tell the staff.
Every item on the menu is delicious.

name: HELLO MILK TEA ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡πÑ‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ô ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á ‡∏°.‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡∏†‡∏±‡∏è‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Very affordable Bubble Milk Tea place. Staff doesn‚Äôt really speak english, but the drinks are in english on the menu. Around 20 baht / drink. Very modern and clean look. Can recommend üëçüèº
review_2_text: Affordable, delicious and flavorful, and the shop is cute. I recommend it if you're passing by; give it a try!
review_3_text: Very concentrated, worth the price.

name: 2 yellow
review_1_text: Mango Smoothie so delicious and fresh
review_2_text:
The juices, milk tea, and desserts here are all delicious, but I really wanted to share the new homemade rice paper rolls!‚ùóÔ∏èThe organic vegetables were sweet and went perfectly with the homemade Thai herb sauce!‚ù£Ô∏è
By the way, I'd also like to introduce the designer shop next door, owned by the same owner, which is far superior to Jing Jai Market.
According to the owner, Nhu, she uses traditional Chiang Mai clothing to handcraft bags, carpets, and traditional ornaments, recreating folk art in a modern style.
I bought a beautiful cushion and a blue-dyed T-shirt this time.üåàI'm sure there will be new items ready the next time I visit Chiang Mai.
It's a vibrant place.
Thank you, Nhu and Bee!‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: This is a wonderful shop with delicious smoothies. If you come to Chiang Mai, be sure to check it out.
review_4_text: The smoothie is delicious!

name: Aimee Coffee& bakery
review_1_text: Thai milk tea was good and reasonably priced, and the woman working there was really nice

name: Elite Coffee Old Home (‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á ‡∏°.‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡∏†‡∏±‡∏è)
review_1_text: "Small cafe, great atmosphere. ‚ú® I found a place with soul, delicious coffee, and a typically Thai vibe. The super-friendly owner speaks English, which is a huge plus. I felt absolutely special there! ‚òïÔ∏èüåø #ThaiKlimat #KawkowaPere≈Çka #TravelGirl"
review_2_text: I was passing by and the feeling was so good that I came in, but actually, the dog lured me in haha. It's a cafe run by a young couple, and it's so cozy and just full of good vibes!! You definitely have to try it~ Plus, I don't think I'll be able to forget the taste of the drinks!! I have to come again:)
review_3_text:
If there were 10 stars, I'd give 10!!
This cafe is a hidden gem that you absolutely can't miss if you're in the area!

From the moment you step inside, the aroma of freshly brewed coffee wafts gently to your nose. The staff are cheerful, friendly, and offer excellent menu recommendations (special praise!).

üíµ The prices are reasonable considering the quality and service. Worth every penny!

In short, if you love coffee and a great atmosphere, this is the place!!! üíØ
I'll definitely be back, and I'll bring my friends too! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_4_text: A fantastic roadside shop; the owner is warm and welcoming, the coffee is good, and the interior is comfortable.

name: Homebar
review_1_text: A small pickup coffee place right next to or a part of a local restaurant. I got salted caramel latte and it was not so good unfortunately.
review_2_text: Coffee shop for take away coffee.
review_3_text: Good price and very tasty coffee! Very friendly and quick service
review_4_text:
Friendly, cheap, pleasant, efficient and high quality.
I go there every day ü•∞
review_5_text:
The coffee is delicious. It's a small shop.
The prices are affordable.

I ordered an orange juice coffee for 45 baht.

name: Bang Coffee

name: Lan Kafae Hmong Coffee
review_1_text:
Great place for spending some time‚Äôs admiring the scenery, they sells some great coffee, tea and some snacks.

Got the opportunity to meet the owner / barista / roasters while he worked.

We talked about the coffee beans, quality and sizes, also the region around here.

They make around 40 kg every 1 or 2 weeks depending on the harvest.
review_2_text: Part of Hmong Doi Pui village, there is one of the beautiful coffee shop which is located at the back of the village on the hill. You would be able to have some pure coffee while enjoying look at the view of the village and having a beautiful pictures in the garden, and if you have a little times you would be able to the sample house that they used to live,and coffee plants. I would suggest you to try a very good coffee for those who like coffee.
review_3_text: Great place to take a break. Good view, Thai milk tea is good . Price is reasonable cheap in the tourism place. Lots puzzle game for play.
review_4_text: Great service.  Very friendly staff.  Coffee was very good and affordable.  The Thai tea was the right amount of sweetness.  Shop also sells brain teasers made out of teak wood.
review_5_text: Amazing restaurant and super friendly staff. Their Khao soi is the best in Thailand!! Delicious üòãüòã

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡∏´‡∏•‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏õ‡∏∏‡∏¢
review_1_text: Such a hidden gem! This small, family-run caf√© in a Hmong village is one of the most peaceful spots I‚Äôve visited. The garden view is beautiful, surrounded by mountain air and nature all around. The space is cozy and cute, and the family that runs it is so kind and welcoming. You can feel the love they‚Äôve put into the place. A perfect stop if you‚Äôre looking to slow down, sip something warm, and enjoy the view.
review_2_text: The coffee shop is very beautiful, and you can sit by the river to relax. With its beautiful plants and nice waterfall, it is definitely a good place to relax with the sound of birds and water. But the entrance fee is 20 baht per person. When you go down to the coffee shop, it is very fun. When you go back up, it is very hard.
review_3_text: This is a nice place to enjoy your coffee (or even  cappuccino) and to have a look at the waterfall, valley, garden and mountains. Go to the second floor, the view is amazing. We also bought various nuts there after testing all available sorts. Strawberry is the best. Sour and sweet at once.
review_4_text: Great coffee shop! A hidden gem! The coffee was incredible, and locally sourced. We also ordered a matcha latte, and it was surprisingly very good!
review_5_text: Good coffee, nice atmosphere. Great service :)

name: ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏ß‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ú‡πà‡∏≤‡∏°‡πâ‡∏á‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏õ‡∏∏‡∏¢
review_1_text: ‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§üòäüòäüòäüòä
review_2_text:
Hmong Doi Pui Village

Hmong Doi Pui Village is more than just an ordinary village; it's a cultural learning center that seamlessly blends with the beauty of nature. Located at a considerable altitude, the air here is exceptionally clean, even on the hottest days at sea level.

A hike to the top of the village reveals a beautifully arranged flower garden with a small, artificial waterfall, creating a very relaxing atmosphere.

There's also a Hmong-run coffee shop offering friendly prices, perfect for enjoying a cup of coffee while soaking in the natural beauty of Doi Pui.

Overall, Hmong Doi Pui Village is ideal for those seeking a change from city cafes, wanting to breathe fresh air and learn about local culture.
review_3_text:
Good weather.
Local people, hill tribes.
Living a simple life.
Building houses on the hillsides.
Preserving the traditional hill tribe community style.
review_4_text: A small mountain village accessible via a narrow, poorly maintained road. Here you can see the natural beauty and traditional costumes of the Chiang Mai region. Shopping opportunities and beer gardens complete the sightseeing experience.
review_5_text: There are beautiful views, a small waterfall, and flower beds. The folk art along the way is unique and interesting. There is also an old house called the museum for 10B.

name: Hmong Caf√©
review_1_text:
The cafe has nice view seat.
You can drink coffee while looking at the mountains

Nothing can replace the taste of drinking coffee while looking at the clouds.

The shop owner is very kind , friendly and very beautiful.

You can try local coffee and specialty coffee.
review_2_text: Very nice cafe with great vibe and nature. I think how they roast their coffee is usually dark, so getting hot latte was perfect and very good. You have to go down steep stairs to get here, but it is well worth it. It is a nice relaxing cafe with great coffee indeed.
review_3_text:
Nice place
Good drink
Can sit
Has toilet and charging
review_4_text: Great coffee for a fair price. They also sell excellent matcha powder.
review_5_text: Nice ambience, with seats overlooking the mountains. They serve very nice mocha.

review_1_text: It's nice to drink and eat here with waterfall

Really loved this place
the mountain view is gorgeous and the coffee tastes amazing. They even have comfy reclining chairs where you can just sit back, breathe in the fresh air, and watch the clouds roll over the hills. Such a perfect spot to relax.
review_2_text:
Lady working is very sweet!! Drinks are delicious and view is unreal.

Hidden gem
review_3_text: Great coffee, beautiful view
review_4_text: Delicious coffee, beautiful views. Local atmosphere.
review_5_text: Good coffee and beautiful view!

name: Leng coffee
review_1_text: Great coffee and coca. Quiet atmosphere and a wonderful shop owner.
review_2_text: I enjoyed a very tasty coffee listening to the sound of waterfall while admiring this amazing view! It‚Äôs still a hidden gem and we really enjoyed the no crowd atmosphere.
review_3_text: Delicious wild coffee + honey offered by Leng üôè stunning view, thanks a lot!

name: Cmor by Recall Hotels, Chiangmai
review_1_text:
Cmor Hotel Chiang Mai ‚Äì A Hidden Gem in the Heart of the City

I recently stayed at Cmor Hotel Chiang Mai and had a truly enjoyable experience. The hotel is modern, clean, and located in a quiet yet convenient area near Nimmanhaemin Road ‚Äî one of the trendiest parts of Chiang Mai.

The room was spacious, well-designed, and equipped with all the necessary amenities. I especially appreciated the comfortable bed and the strong Wi-Fi, which made it easy to work and relax.

What really stood out, however, was the staff. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping was incredibly friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed and were always happy to offer recommendations for local attractions and food spots.

The pool area is small but cozy, perfect for a quick dip after a day of exploring. The breakfast buffet was fresh and had a good variety of both local and international options.

Overall, I highly recommend Cmor Hotel for anyone visiting Chiang Mai ‚Äî whether you're traveling for business, with family, or just on a relaxing getaway.
review_2_text:
We were away for a special celebration. I guess this was the 'authentic' experience. Lots of Thai locals use this hotel.

The Pros: rooms are large and clean. Free bottled water, tea and coffee in the room.
Kitchenette for those who want to cook for themselves.
Located in short walking distance to a very busy and popular shopping/dining area.
Small but well presented breakfast

Cons: On a flight path - if you want a peaceful night sleep this is not for you, unless you're a very very deep sleeper.
The ladies on reception were not very friendly and seemed as if we were an inconvenience and that they would rather be somewhere else.
Breakfast not smooth - omelette stand never operated, and i had to turn on the waffle machine as noone could work out why it wasn't doing anything.
Pool on first floor, in the shade.
review_3_text: Great location with convenient transportation. The accommodation is excellent‚Äîvery clean, with a swimming pool and well-appointed rooms. The staff are friendly, lovely, and attentive. Breakfast is good, with a wide variety of options and great taste. The hotel is located in the heart of Chiang Mai, close to Maya Shopping Mall and the airport. Beautiful views and pleasant weather make the stay even better.
review_4_text:
I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights and had a truly wonderful experience.ü•∞ All of the staff were kind, professional, and very sweet, which made my stay in Sharma Cmor much more comfortable.

I especially want to thank a staff member named Puupay. Late one night, when I needed help, she went out of her way to assist me with so much care and discretion. Even though it wasn‚Äôt something the hotel normally provides, she personally helped me and made sure I felt comfortable and not embarrassed at all. Her thoughtfulness and warmth genuinely touched me.ü•∞üòäüôèüôè

Because of people like Puupay, this hotel feels more than just a place to stayü•∞ü•∞ it feels like a place where guests are truly cared for. I highly recommend this hotel and sincerely appreciate the kindness of the staff.
review_5_text: My stay at this hotel was truly delightful. The room was clean, spacious, and beautifully decorated, with all the necessary amenities provided. The staff were warm, welcoming, and offered excellent service throughout my stay. The location was convenient and made traveling around the city very easy. It‚Äôs a great choice whether for relaxation or business. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.‚Äù

name: WAKO BAKE
review_1_text:
so good we went several times!
amazing food, really delicious.
the staff is friendly and polite, great service. The ambience is also nice, with air conditioning, wifi and good music.
review_2_text:
Friendly service, though orders took much longer than expected (30 minutes) considering the few customers at the time.

Food is standard, though portions are small for the price; guess you pay for the setting, which is nicely designed.
review_3_text: We heard about this place from a friend, and wow, what a gem! High-speed 150 Mbps internet, big tables with power sockets, a great food selection, and a beautiful, peaceful garden. It's a perfect place for working and chilling. The bacon sandwich is amazing, and the prices are great.
review_4_text: Delicious vegetarian (and non) food packed with flavour. The garden is so peaceful and the drinks are delicious! I had the spicy red curry, hot Thai tea, and a mango/passion smoothie. The service was quick! Can‚Äôt wait to return.
review_5_text: nice garden, workable environment, fast wifi :) I have used this cafe since 5 years ago and this is always one of my favorite place. Good drink, nice garden, great vibe. You can also rent a team working room by hour here.

name: Mac Cafe Chiangmai
review_1_text: This shop is so friendly and cute, the staff are very nice and recommend the products very well. I had no knowledge about what I wanted and they gave me very great advice! They take care of their costumers very well and the price is great:)
review_2_text: Great service. The staff gave very good advice.
review_3_text: I went in for a 2nd hand MacBook but walked out empty-handed because of the high prices. The woman who helped us was very kind and knowledgeable though, and it‚Äôs a cute cafe.
review_4_text: Mac Cafe in Chiang Mai offers a peaceful retreat despite its busy roadside location. The atmosphere is pleasant, complemented by friendly and accommodating staff. The coffee is particularly noteworthy, making it a worthwhile stop for both a great brew and a tech check-out.
review_5_text: Awesome little spot with great people and a supremely cute Pomeranian. We were told my laptop could be fixed for super cheap and were so impressed with the honesty and absence of profit motive of the staff we ended up buying an M1 for a fantastic price instead. Tom, the owner, is Aussie but speaks Thai and has a local Thai employee as well. Thrilled to have an upgraded laptop now! They make custom tea and espresso drinks at the cafe also :) Come here for fixes n great deals on sweet tech! üíØ

name: Ohana
review_1_text:
I went there while waiting for my laundry to finish. The place is quiet and comfortable, with both indoor and outdoor seating.
I had a wild berry soda, which was delicious and refreshing. I didn‚Äôt get to try the coffee this time, but I will next time.
The barista was very welcoming and friendly. Overall, it‚Äôs a great spot to chill in a cozy, homely, vintage-style atmosphere.

For more travel tips and hidden gems, check out my Instagram: @hichem_airways
review_2_text: Ohana Caf√© is one of my all-time favorite spots! Their carrot cake is my absolute favorite, flavorful, and you can really tell it‚Äôs homemade. They have a lovely selection of desserts, delicious coffee, and the atmosphere is so warm and welcoming. The people here are kind and friendly, and the owner is incredibly sweet and caring. It truly feels like home every time I visit. ‚òïüç∞
review_3_text: One of the best Coffee shop on area. Cozy small and friendly place which has a good coffee and scone. You can sit and relax and might have a new friends. Reasonable price. Lovely owner must try.
review_4_text:
Ohana is a cozy spot that‚Äôs perfect for a quick coffee break of sweet treat. One of my fav menu is the carrot cake‚Äîmoist, flavorful and topped with just the right amount of frosting.
For coffee, I highly recommend the Sparking LA. It‚Äôs a refreshing blend of zesty lime, honey, and a touch of soda fizz with a shot of espresso for that extra kick. The combination of sweet, sour, and a hint of bitterness makes it the perfect pick-me-up.
review_5_text:
Great cafe, my favorite in all of Chiang Mai.
The cappuccino is very tasty, and the homemade buns with homemade jam is delectable. The inside is very cozy and I found it a great place to read or write.
The owner is soo sweet, and she always greets you with a smile.

name: Starbucks Maya Shopping Mall Chiangmai
review_1_text: Good service with all of staff and clean area, just a little bit noisy because they have many tourist, is still be nice
review_2_text: This Starbucks branch is really pleasant and welcoming. The atmosphere is calm and comfortable, making it a great place to sit, relax, or get some work done. The staff were friendly and efficient, and everything felt well organized and clean. It‚Äôs a nice spot to enjoy a coffee break in a relaxed environment, and I‚Äôd happily come back again.
review_3_text: Very conveniently located on the ground floor of Maya. First time I‚Äôve had the Starbucks peppermint chewing gum. See photos. And also first time I‚Äôve had the banana cake with mixed grains.
review_4_text: Visited them twice during my 4 day stay in Chiang Mai. The staff were friendly. The location is good, but there are a lot of kids using it for studying, which is not good for paying customers as they stay there for hours that regular customers paying like us have no place to sit and enjoy our coffee.
review_5_text: The Starbucks in the Maya mall is a great place to hideaway and get some work done in their many tables and cosy nooks. The staff are wonderful, speak really great English and make amazing suggestions for coffee etc. They even do decaf coffee if you love the taste but can‚Äôt handle the caffeine ‚ù§Ô∏èand the wifi is pretty good too.

name: CHALALAI garden ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏∞‡∏¢‡∏á‡∏ä‡∏¥‡∏î ‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏ä‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏±‡∏¢ (‡πÄ‡∏à‡πá‡∏î‡∏¢‡∏≠‡∏î)
review_1_text:
This store sells mayongchid (plango) sweet dessert.
I tried mayongchid cheesecake ice cream. It was good.
The store is next to highway but have a garden vibe seats.
review_2_text: A small store with a garden and they have home made ice cream and smoothie available. Even though it is located on the large street, there is a small garden at the store.
review_3_text: The most delicious coconut smoothie as I walk to CNX Coworking space. Within five minutes I am cooled off and my palate is happy. I have tried their coconut ice cream as well. It‚Äôs a winner.
review_4_text: WOW! You like ice cream? Come HERE! This place is cute for a date and a place to indulge in self-reflection, while you eat amazing ice cream‚ù§Ô∏è
review_5_text: A lovely ice cream and smoothie shop, an oasis of cool and cuteness. Great place to chill. Super friendly service.

name: Roastniyom Coffee Decem
review_1_text: Great experience at Roastniyom Coffee Decem. The coffee was rich and well-balanced, prices are reasonable, and there‚Äôs a great variety of pastries to choose from. Definitely worth a visit in Chiang Mai!
review_2_text:
Coffee to start morning. Nice stop before leaving Chiang Mai
Somewhat difficult to find at first, have to drive slowly in notice
review_3_text: Such a peaceful quiet nice place üòá The friendliest service, great prices and amazing matcha!
review_4_text: Extremely attentive, fast and nice staff and great quality of coffee and drinks. Among my Top 3 Coffee places in Chiang Mai. They have one of the best Cocoa Frappes I have ever tried. Great place, highly recommended to check out when you are in Chiang Mai and are looking for some good coffee.
review_5_text:
Nice bakery.
Good atmosphere.
Coffee below average IMHO.

name: Penguin Ghetto | Coffee and Beverages
review_1_text: Great little cafe! Awesome coffee at cheap prices and really friendly staff. Inside and outside seating. Great orange espresso. Lovely
review_2_text:
LOVE this place! Amazing coffee and cute cafe!
Hidden gem on the back roads of Nimman area.

This cafe is very tiny, but very cute. I hope more people will know about it and support this place because I love it!

We got their cold brew latte which was amazing! The presentation and flavor was utter perfection.  MUST get!

Also got her Oreo cheesecake which was a perfect accompaniment to the delicious cold brew latte.

Cash only and be patient, a great little place to hang out.
review_3_text: Small and lovely vintage cafe on Sompotch 700 years Road. Dtac customer offered 10% discount for the drinks.The entrance is quite small and parking at the side of road. Try this menu "kori kori coffee" (ice cube coffee with cold milk). Coffee bean are from Thai plantation.
review_4_text: Quick coffee spot in the little small vintage space. Inside there is just a coffee bar with the owner who makes coffee or other drinks. Coffee here tastes good but a few seats inside.
review_5_text: Wow... Their coffee is amazing... And Oreo cheescake... Wow... This is a cozy small cafe, peaceful... Staff is very polite n smiling always... Love that... Their coffee menu is cool... Must try... üòäüòÉ

name: Paris House Bakery @CNX
review_1_text:
Cute little coffee shop with freshly baked croissants. I actually have been to their shop before and forgot. Not this one. But they also have a coffee shop in Pridi / Phra Khanong in Bangkok.

The croissants are good and so is the coffee. The owners / staff are very nice. Also a good spot to do some work. Internet is fast.
review_2_text: My go-to breakfast spot in Chiang Mai. Had breakfast here every day for weeks. The owners are super friendly and welcome you like it‚Äôs their home. 10/10 recommend!
review_3_text:
Tick for every box. Atmosphere is welcoming and friendly. Vibe is positive ü©∑ and music great too.üé∂
Menu is simple, and delicious ü§§. Simple things are quite often the best. And affordable. Will definitely make it a regular thing and have already started telling my friends about it. Credit where it's due. üôèüèΩü©∑üé∂
review_4_text: Great breakfast, and beautiful to smell fresh baked croissant!  Ice americano was perfect and the owners very friendly. Good prices for  western style breakfasts.
review_5_text: Best oat cap ive had in Thailand! Absolutely delicious. Owner has lovely energy too which makes this place feel special and welcoming.

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ú‡∏Å‡∏≤ Phaka
review_1_text:
Nice sandwiches and salad at this place. Craft beer and desserts too

The place next door has other hot food and drinks and is the same owner

We had a bacon sandwich and a very good large  Caesar salad
review_2_text: I love this place so so much. I‚Äôve been here a handful of times and it has never disappointed. They always make sure I have plenty of shade and am comfortable, they truly go above and beyond
review_3_text:
Haven't tried the food because of the deliciousness restaurant next door, but the coffee and ice coffee is great.

Friendly and chill guy who runs the place, always plays some nice chill music to vibe with in the garden under the tree üëåüèª
review_4_text: Came across this really cute coffee and tea bus stand while walking in the neighborhood:) I tried the hot apple tea and it was delicious. They have some seating on the side with a fan to keep you cool from the heat. Cash only.
review_5_text: Cozy coffee bus with nice decoration. There are available seats next to the bus under the giant tree. Good place to have some chats with friends. I‚Äôve tried chiangmai arabica mokapot coffee and it tastes good.

name: Camp71 Chiang mai
review_1_text: Lovely little coffee shop, really nice coffee and one of the best honey lemon sodas we‚Äôve had. Really cool clothes shop, you need to explore this just to see the cool things they have here, really retro, and clothing is reasonably priced.
review_2_text:
Date of Visit: August 20th

This is a caf√© I stopped at on my way to Nimmanhaemin. I was recommended the cappuccino. I think the taste was average, but the atmosphere was very nice for working. It was the first caf√© I visited in Chiang Mai, and I have very good memories of it.
review_3_text: Unusual specialist shop selling vintage things, including toys, clocks, sewing machines and other paraphernalia. Looks like a museum selling antique things. Very interesting shop.
review_4_text:
Tranquil place to sit and enjoy the music. Very sweet staff. Only drinks on the menu, coffee, tea and specialty sodas.
Attached to a 3 level clothing store.
review_5_text: Inside an amazing clothes shop that is also part retro museum, pinball machines, model cars by the hundreds, military models

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ MAYA Lifestyle Shopping Center
review_1_text: The worst shop ever, totally unfriendly to customers. I wanted to sit at a table and order coffee. I already had my bag there, and it was impossible to order a coffee from the side of the tables. I had to go to the other side to order and that meant I lost my seat. I just wanted to drink a cup of coffee in peace, not from a paper cup. Truly uncooperative, unfriendly, passive-aggressive, irritating service. One floor down at Roastniyom, it's exactly as it should be, and you order your coffee and she said take a seat. "I'll bring it to your table right away." Thank you so much, because that's how customer service should be, thanks Amazon coffee for nothing. And if you then tell him that this isn't right, they look at you as if to say, "What do you want? You're just a unimportant customer, but what do you want from us?"
review_2_text: Rude employee. They don‚Äôt close at 10, even though it says so, they just closed before and then had a terrible attitude when we asked if they knew about any other cafe. She did speak English and when she got annoyed, she just started saying she didn‚Äôt and ignored us.
review_3_text: Consistent quality across the chain of shops. This location is great for sipping a latte and people watching.
review_4_text:
Bad attitude from staff. Refused to give my wife a splash of milk in her tea, which has never been an issue in any other Cafe Amazons. When I asked why, they just said we can not! I offered to pay extra & they said, no we can not. The staff were rude and laughing between themselves at us. The manager eventually came and gave us some milk.

We'll be giving this one a miss in future.
review_5_text: 40 minute wait because of GRAB and Lineman orders. How about prioritising in person customers instead??? You don‚Äôt give a damn about your customers!!! NEVER AGAIN.

name: We R coffee
review_1_text:
Small shop that you can buy take away or sit at the store to sip your drinks.
There are 3 coffee bean choices:
_ Dark roast: Robusta
_ Medium roast: Arabica
_ Light roast: Arabica
Coffee quality is quite good and the volume is a lot for a very reasonable price.
review_2_text: I picked up ice americano here. It is a tiny cafe, mostly for to go, but the prices are cheaper than most of the coffee places around and the quality is good.
review_3_text: Very quaint coffee place, really nice.  I ordered the iced latte, and it was perfect. Price was even better üôÇ, only goes to show you that you don't need to pay a lot to get good coffee.
review_4_text: a nice cozy place, the barista customized the coffee for me, I got a Mint Coffee black hot while it‚Äôs only available for iced
review_5_text: Good coffee, great price, friendly owner

name: Bang Bo Roti ‡∏ö‡∏±‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏ö‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏µ
review_1_text: This is a very cozy place where you will be greeted with a smile and fed the most delicious roti. We go here every week.
review_2_text:
45 minute to make 1 roti.
When customer ask to cancel because you prefer do Online orders rather then Customer in shop, dont be rude and be polite to him.
The woman very rude
You deserve 0 stars not even 1.
review_3_text: Every time I come to Chiang Mai, I have to stop by. I'm really addicted to Pakistani tea and Southern tea. It's so strong and satisfying. The owner is very kind. He recommended me a thick, soft roti with cheese. Wow, it's so delicious that it comes out of my mouth.
review_4_text:
Bang Bo Roti: A paradise for roti, tea, and coffee lovers in Chiang Mai!
If you're looking for a delicious roti shop in Chiang Mai, you absolutely can't miss "Bang Bo Roti"! Their roti is perfectly sweet and fragrant, with generous fillings and a wide variety of options, from banana and cheese roti to cheese roti and various special rotis ‚Äì guaranteed to please everyone.

But the deliciousness of this shop isn't limited to roti. Their drinks are equally amazing, from fragrant coffee and rich Pakistani tea to refreshing blended drinks.

And you absolutely can't miss the beef rice bowl! It's the best I've ever had. The beef is tender, the flavor is perfectly balanced, and it pairs flawlessly with the hot rice.
review_5_text: The roti is delicious. It's fried until crispy and the filling is just the right amount of sweet. I really like the corn cheese roti. It's delicious. The water is reasonably priced. The hot Pakistani tea is very fragrant. I've never tried it before. P.S. There are musical instruments and board games to play for free. I like this the most.

name: Funky Roaster ‡∏ü‡∏±‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏µ‡πâ ‡πÇ‡∏£‡∏™‡πÄ‡∏ï‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå ÂíñÂï°ÂéÖÂíåÈÖíÂêß
review_1_text:
Cool Coffee Shop that opens early in the morning. So it was perfect for me to stop on my way to the office. Skipping hotel coffee and having a proper one instead.

The place is actually a motorbike rental shop. But they share the space with a coffee shop.
review_2_text:
Cool concept. Cafe/Bike Rental/and BBQ?????
Cool vibe in the morning sipping drinks in a cafe/autoshop. Coffee's alright too.

(posted a photo of their menu)
review_3_text: Very cool coffee place for a quick coffee run. It‚Äôs inside a bike rental shop and the store looks so cool with vintage bikes as props.
review_4_text: I absolutely adore you. This is the strongest coffee in Chiang Mai! And you make it incredibly fast. I don‚Äôt even know how I‚Äôd live without you. Love you!
review_5_text: Very good concept, very good coffee, but sadly provided wifi didn't worked and I had to go somwhere else :(

name: Blue Coffee x Bar Cha at Maya
review_1_text: Excellent matcha latte. Great find in Maya Mall!
review_2_text: A nice long black with medium roasted coffee beans üëç good customer service‚ò∫Ô∏èüëç
review_3_text: Great place for good coffee and matcha.
review_4_text: ü©µü§é
review_5_text: Highly recommended for matcha lovers. üòäüòä another BAR CHA shop, if you are convenient, at Maya shopping mall.

name: Khum coffee
review_1_text:
Located inside Khum Phu Come hotel near a lobby.

Lots of drinks for coffee and non coffee.

Good taste of americano.

The drink was quick served.

Price was not expensive.

name: Mingmitr Coffee - ‡πÄ‡∏à‡πá‡∏î‡∏¢‡∏≠‡∏î
review_1_text:
Cozy coffee shop kind of vibes.  I am here during Chirstmas and NY eve.
The decoration looks really nice!

Good place  to get a hot cappucinon with friends and family.
Staffs are  so friendly.
Pet Friendly environment! There is an orange cat in the neighbour come say hello!
review_2_text: Nice atmosphere and friendly staffs. Lots of drinks and snacks available. A perfect place for your every cup!!
review_3_text:
Mingmitr Coffee Jedyod Branch is very cozy and invating place.

It is a great spot whether you come alone or with friends
Plenty of  parking lot.
review_4_text: Good coffee with reasonable priceüëçüèºüëçüèº
review_5_text: The best coffee, atmosphere, and service in Chiang Mai.

name: Fresh Corner Cafe
review_1_text: Amazing caf√© with perfect coffee and the friendliest staff ‚Äî cozy, welcoming, and easily my new favorite spot in town!
review_2_text:
Delicious coffee and they currently have a student discount
The owner is very friendly and acommodating
review_3_text:
amazing cafeteria! The cocoa strawberry was so good we ordered another one. The cappuccino was also great.
the staff was super friendly and nice, the ambiance is new and beautiful, a perfect place to spend some time.
Also the internet was super fast!
review_4_text:
Such a cozy little gem of a coffee shop! I had the Matcha Latte on my first visit. On my second visit, I tried the Strawberry Milk, which was super refreshing and not overly sweet. The customer service is genuinely warm and friendly, and the prices are very reasonable.

It‚Äôs also a great spot to socialize ‚Äî I met a few English-speaking customers and had some lovely conversations. Highly recommend supporting this local favorite! üíö
review_5_text: Delicious coffee and good portions for a cheap price, good service and they have the view of the mountain. Every time I go by their shop I have Latte to take away and so far have never been disappointed!

name: ‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏π‡πà‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏Ç - U sook ùóõùóºùó∫ùó≤ ùó∞ùóÆùó≥ùó≤
review_1_text: What‚Äôs not to love?? The staff is kind, the ambience is like a cozy crafty back yard garden, the food and drinks are tasty. My new favorite place in santitham üíó
review_2_text: Peaceful nature-style caf√© with a cozy, homey vibe. Not crowded and very relaxing. They even have drawing cards and free books to enjoy. The hojicha is absolutely amazing! Easy to get here and they also serve drinks, bakery, and simple meals. Definitely worth a visit ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: I was passing by the store and the atmosphere seemed nice, so I went in. Inside, there are plenty of tables and various small activities, making it a great place to bring kids. They also have coffee, light meals, and a bakery menu. A hot Americano costs 40 baht, and it was so delicious that I couldn't help but wonder, "Is this only 40 baht?" It was a very smooth and well-balanced coffee. The other menu items were also good :)
review_4_text: This is a cute cafe. The food and drinks are delicious and reasonably priced. We ordered Khao Soi Gai (chicken noodle soup) and Pad Krapow (stir-fried basil with chicken), both were excellent. The matcha sago dessert was unique and tasty. There are many photo opportunities and activities to do. The service was excellent. Highly recommended.
review_5_text: The atmosphere is amazing. Board games and drawing are great for kids, and the Paka Paumoo Sap is the best I've had in Thailand. Kai Soi is also a must-try. The omelets are great for kids, and the coffee is from Nambawon, Thailand!

name: TEA FAC.
review_1_text:
‚ú® Hidden Gem for Tea & Coffee Lovers in Chiang Mai ‚Äì TEA FAC ‚ú®

If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai and looking for a cozy spot to enjoy premium tea or coffee, TEA FAC is a must-visit. Located in a quiet alley not far from the city center, this place blends minimalist aesthetics with a deep love for quality brews.

The menu offers a variety of thoughtfully curated teas‚Äîespecially Thai teas, which are rich, aromatic, and served in beautiful glassware. Their coffee options are also excellent, with beans sourced from local roasters and brewed with precision. I tried their Thai Milk Tea and it was perfectly balanced‚Äîfragrant, smooth, and not overly sweet.

The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, happy to share insights about each drink. The vibe is peaceful, making it a great spot for relaxing, working, or catching up with a friend.

Whether you‚Äôre a tea enthusiast or just looking for caf√©  in Chiang Mai, TEA FAC is a delightful stop. üåø‚òïÔ∏è
review_2_text: Solid bevs and bites at this cafe, decked out in thematic spooky decor for Halloween when I visited. Cordial and efficient service, and though there doesn't seem to be that much seating, it was nice and quiet on the weekday afternoon I went.
review_3_text:
By far one of the tastiest teas and coffees I had in Chiang Mai!
I recommend the rose tea milk and orange juice-coffee.
You can also buy tea leaves/coffee bags to take home.
Discovered this place 2 years ago when I was living here and decided to come back and try it out once more.
The service is real nice!
review_4_text: Not my favorite type of coffee as there is no acidity and they do not have light roast beans to choose from. The prices are very affordable, so it is still worth a try.
review_5_text:
Very cute cafe , tasty medium roast coffee.
Open early at 7:30am.
There is parking for customers.

name: Uhas Cafe ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text:
Clean and bright brand new space with ample seating including power outlets and wifi. Excellent pour over coffee. Overall great and very affordable .

If they added some healthy snacks it would be a great place to get some work done for a longer session.
review_2_text:
They have a lovely light roast coffee hidden away in a drawer.

If you ask them they will take it out üòâ was glad I did as I don‚Äôt normally drink dark roast coffee.

Was one of the best cups I have had in chiang mai.
review_3_text: So glad to find this place for work. Also the food is great and it closes late. I'll be frequenting it for sure üôè
review_4_text: There are plenty of seats and power outlets available. They also offer non-coffee drinks like cocoa. The air conditioning is just right, so it‚Äôs comfortable even for long stays. It‚Äôs open from morning until night, which is really convenient. I was pleasantly surprised by how clean the restroom was.
review_5_text: adorable place

name: ‡πÄ‡∏™‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏Æ‡∏µ‡∏¢ ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏Å‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏™‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: Best shop for print good quality and very fast service . Thanks you ! We will print again here ‚òÄÔ∏èü§òüèÜ
review_2_text: Good atmosphere, good coffee, good taste. The best are banoffee and coffee.
review_3_text: Fast and convenient, in just 15 minutes, you can get your own custom-designed shirt at an affordable price. Enjoy the cozy atmosphere of coffee shop, with a coffee corner where you can relax and sip while waiting for your shirt to be printed.
review_4_text: The staff at this shop are very good at service. I went to there to make a  T shirt and it very quickly, less than 20 minutes, and it was beautiful too. I‚Äôm 100% recommend you.
review_5_text: Walked into here randomly, loved it. Its so cute and you can even make a custom shirt! Will be saving and coming back.

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏ã‡∏≠‡∏ô
review_1_text: Always a good cup of coffee. Staff is friendly and helpful.
review_2_text: My favourite Horjicha frappe with red beans!
review_3_text: Stop by to recharge before continuing every morning. It's inexpensive, doesn't have to wait long, and has a place to sit and chill.
review_4_text: A very nice Cafe Amazon.  It is in a large building with lots of seating.  Not noisy and not too busy.  Clean restrooms and plenty of parking.
review_5_text: i like the place and love the atmosphere here, alos is near from where i live so i came.But the staff's and service here is so bad,talk not polited.Not like the other branches i visited.

name: RUF Cafe
review_1_text: service is nice and coffee is not bad
review_2_text: The air conditioning is cool, the music is great, there's plenty of parking, and the staff are welcoming. Come and check it out! ü§üüèºüòé
review_3_text: The sweet drinks/coffee are delicious. The atmosphere in the shop is beautifully decorated. It is located in the FUR shop. The parking lot is very spacious. When we went, there was a promotion, buy 2 get 1 free. ü•∞
review_4_text: A super chic coffee shop in the Santitham area. The atmosphere is great, with lots of photo spots and a spacious parking area. The staff are friendly and helpful.
review_5_text:
Want to lose weight? Drink an Americano. Want a phone number? Be brave enough to ask.

RUF Cafe, with its Hot Summer style, is located in the FUR CAFE CNX project, alongside a kingdom of imported furniture from America and Scandinavia from famous designers. The colors are eye-catching, and they also sell furniture. There's plenty of parking.
The drink menu includes coffee with a choice of medium and dark roast beans, as well as non-coffee options.

name: FOEI
review_1_text:
FOEI in Santitham is such a hidden gem.

Cozy vibe, great coffee, and super friendly staff. The drinks and desserts are beautifully made and taste amazing. Perfect spot to chill, work, or catch up with friends.

Highly recommended!
review_2_text: I tried here couple of items and can say that matcha tasted better cold. Hot cocoa was more milk than cocoa. The black coffee was üëå
review_3_text: Es-yen is elite! Not overly sweet. Cafe has a quite warm ambience and the cafe next door offers good bakes too.
review_4_text:
Good coffee with great taste at an affordable price Parking is available
Perfect for chilling and relaxing.
review_5_text: Arrived a second before closing, the owner was amazing. I took two cakes and each was better than the other.

name: Becoming Coffee House
review_1_text: Ver good coffee in a nice space. They had their coffee beans being dried right outside and the quality of the coffee is good. I came in and chill a bit and luckily, i got to play with the baby cats and i had a great time here. The staffs were really nice as well.
review_2_text:
Cute little shop with 2 cats. Owner customized my drink because I can't drink milk! Ordered coffee latte (oat milk) black orange coffee and a mixed fruit cookie üç™

Very friendly and speaks good English the female owner is very social
review_3_text:
They proceed their own coffee beans here.
Coffee is good. There are light roasted and medium roasted coffee bean options.
Store owners are nice.
review_4_text: If you are fan of cats and coffee - this place is a must visit. This is cozy cafe with cute cat craft souvenirs, 2 amazing cats and very tasty coffee
review_5_text:
so happy to find the cafe open in early morning, and feel fresh with beautiful garden. Cheese cake and lemon cake are highly reccommened.
P.S. Cats normally join to cafe on Tuesday and Saturday.

name: Bluemochatea
review_1_text:
A cozy and cozy coffee shop, perfect for chilling out.

The owner is lovely and friendly.

This shop is great for meeting friends for work or working quietly on your laptop (Wifi available).

There's seating both indoors (air-conditioned) and outdoors on wooden chairs.

They have a wide variety of drinks, including tea and coffee.

We tried the rose tea ‚Äì it was fragrant and had a strong tea aroma ‚Äì and the hot latte was smooth and delicious.

Regarding the tea roasting section, we recommend trying it yourself. If you like it, you can buy some to take home. If you're planning to open a tea shop, you can come and try the teas and get advice. They even have tea menus available. They roast and wholesale tea leaves, and have many different types and blends of tea.

Parking is available on the street in the alley next to the shop.
review_2_text:
This place is really good for drinks.

I like the americano,
and the various teas.

The owner is very kind.

There's a cute and very friendly dog.

I've been to this shop 10 times already.
review_3_text: You have to come and try it. I stumbled upon this. I don't usually come here for this kind of noodles. It's delicious and the price is good.
review_4_text: This coffee shop has a cozy atmosphere and super strong WiFi. If you're looking for a place to work from morning till evening, I highly recommend this place. Parking is available around the shop, along the street. Once you get there, don't forget to try their new coffee flavors; they have a wide variety to choose from, plus many different teas. I've tried so many that I'm wide awake now!
review_5_text: The coffee is excellent, the tea is fragrant and delicious, and the prices are reasonable.

name: 48 City Coffee n Cookie Cup
review_1_text: There are endless coffee shop options in Chiang Mai, so when you come across a place like 48 City Coffee 'n Cookie Cup, it stands out amongst the masses. The owner is filled with passionate and knowledge about coffee and treats every cup with special care.  His wife makes the cookie cup and it is delicious! His mother also makes a young coconut cake that is divine. It is a lovely neighborhood.
review_2_text: Very sweet little coffee shop. Great coffee. You can pick if you want light, medium, or dark roast. It‚Äôs made perfectly. The cookie cups are homemade by the barista‚Äôs wife! It was delicious.
review_3_text: Hidden Gem in the area!! Have been around this area for a while but never stop by this little cafe. However, his coffee is very good esp. latte Cookie Cup‚òïÔ∏èüç™. Lov it and will come back for more menu. A bit hot to sit in the afternoon though. Suggest for morning time or take out.
review_4_text: My first visit but it certainly won‚Äôt be my last. I tried a latt√© (which was delicious) and had it served in their homemade edible cup. So it‚Äôs a coffee and a cookie in one. Fantastic! I highly recommend to try it. Eco friendly idea.
review_5_text:
Nice Thai tea sweet and smooth.
Flourless chocolate cake and hot cocoa is a good combination.
The coffee here is very good and the barista knows about coffee and he can answer most of the questions about the coffee.
I already tried every menu and I really like it.
I hope you all like this place.
PS. He's not good with english but don't worry he still can talk with english.

name: Le‚Äã Cafe‚Äã Arabica
review_1_text: Lovely little cafe that's operated by a elderly couple. The cake choices were limited but very tasty. We ordered another carrot cake after finishing one. The drinks were also well prepared and served with high quality ceramic coasters.
review_2_text: A small cafe, but things look and feel sophisticated here somehow. I feel the owner care about details and it is pretty impressive. It feels right and smells right being here. The prices of drinks are pretty affordable as well. My ice cappuccino was pretty good. I will come back to try their cake next time.
review_3_text:
Just walking along the Main Street and found the most amazing little coffee shop .
35b for a coffee was very cheap and the coffee was good .
The man was very friendly who runs it .
His brown cookies were amazing.
Nice comfy chairs and the ambience is perfect to get away from crowded areas .

Check it out !!!
review_4_text:
I happened to pass by this cozy little caf√© run by an elderly couple. The coffee is very affordable, and they also offer some pastries. The atmosphere is warm and simple, with air conditioning, some Japanese anime decorations, and comic books. There are plugs for charging your devices as well. I ordered a hot cocoa latte for 40 THB and sat down to relax for a bit.

Feb 28, 2025
review_5_text: What a great place! The owner himself is a older guy and he is so friendly. 10/10 ‚≠êÔ∏è

name: ‡∏≠‡∏≠‡∏ô ‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå ‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏¢‡πå ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏™‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏ò‡∏£‡∏£‡∏°
review_1_text: Amazing coffee and well worth stopping by if your in the area or heading towards Doi Suthep. We stopped the car right next to them and grabbed two hot cappuccinos which ended up being the best ones we had during our time in Chiang Mai. Very cheap at 35 Baht each.
review_2_text: Really yummy coffee! Very affordable. They were one of the only places open at 7.30am. 10/10 would recommend
review_3_text: It's a booth on the way providing great coffee, a large cup of latte for just 45 thb
review_4_text: Had a warm latte. This was better than 90% of the barista coffees in london. Better thans gayles and costa ect... would recommend.
review_5_text: The coffee is great. He has a beautiful Italian machine and the coffee is cheap

name: Chill Chill Coffee
review_1_text:
Location
Tucked away roadside, this new gem has just 3 camp tables outside + 1 indoor seat ‚Äî cozy and unassuming.

Coffee Experience
Ordered their dark roast Americano (single-origin beans from Chiang Rai, Thailand). The rich crema blew me away ‚Äî as a coffee geek, I‚Äôd rank it equally with Sumatra Mandheling! Bold smoky notes layered with subtle peaty earthiness and a cocoa finish. Masterful extraction too.

Price Point
Just ‡∏ø45 for that stellar Americano (all drinks ‡∏ø35-50). Unbeatable value!

Verdict
üìç Dark roast devotees ‚Äî this is your sanctuary.
review_2_text:
Lovely little spot to pick up a coffee - standard iced Black Americano for me, 40 baht.

Lovely flavour to the coffee, and the lady serving took great care in the preparation!
review_3_text: Very good coffee! 4 chairs outside nice to sit in while drinking.
review_4_text: Delicious coffee at a great price. The owner is very nice.
review_5_text: Amazing place to have a cup of coffee and relax. A fan would be nice but otherwise great coffee and chill chairs.üòÑ

name: fine fine mood
review_1_text: One of the best coffee shops in town. I love it so much and they are so nice!!!! Amazing Americano‚ù§Ô∏è The new venue is so cute! Highly recommend
review_2_text: The best coffee is here , I love this coffee shop üòã üòç üíï
review_3_text: Cute little cafe. Friendly guy working there. Very chill, nice for working :)
review_4_text:
Ordered mocha and was delicious.
The owner was calm but kind and friendly.
Like the mood of the place.
review_5_text: Nice and  comfy space for coffee

name: Taste Me Sandwich Cafe
review_1_text: Great little place with delicious food! Bread was very good, all the ingredients were quality and fresh. The latte came with a very cute cat foam art, and tasted great! The worker was very friendly and the service was quick. Overall, a great cafe for a quick meal and a drink. The full sandwich was pretty big so if you're not starving, a half would probably be good too. Will definitely come back!
review_2_text: Probably the best sandwich I have had in Thailand and healthy too. I had Italian Milano Salami, but will try the raw parma ham next time. Nice friendly staff, fair priced.
review_3_text: Sandwich is tasty. The owner is really friendly. Small local shop recommend to visitü§§üëçüëç
review_4_text: the BEST tuna sandwich omg I wanna go back. Plus, peach iced tea is so refreshing loved everything
review_5_text: Delicious Sandwiches, I eat an Italian Salami. Best Quality Food, thanks you so much. Best Sandwich since long Time.

name: KRISP Caf√©
review_1_text: A very cool and incredibly creative place combined with an art gallery. Two floors with plenty of cozy, beautiful spots for working and getting inspired. An interesting space with seating both indoors and outdoors. The coffee is good, and the overall atmosphere makes you want to stay longer. Highly recommended!
review_2_text:
Such a beautiful caf√© with a unique vibe, it feels like a contemporary art museum.
Outside, there‚Äôs a pool designed for sitting and working, which makes the space really special. Inside, you‚Äôll find paintings and sculptures everywhere, adding so much character to the place.

The atmosphere is calm and relaxing, perfect if you‚Äôre looking for a quiet spot to work on your projects. We ordered a mocha and a matcha chocolate, and both were absolutely delicious.

A lovely place to slow down, get inspired, and stay longer than planned. ‚òï‚ú®‚ù§
review_3_text:
I love Krisp because: 1) the coffee is fantastic - the best I've had in Thailand, 2) the interior is so nice. Thoughtfully designed with a great eye for architecture and respecting the modernist style - it's quality. 3) It's a quiet and pleasant space to work or read. Comfortable seats and plenty of space.
It's a home away from home and the service is great too. üôèüèº
review_4_text: A beautiful spot that feels like a little escape from the city chaos. Tasty desserts, good drinks, friendly staff, plenty of seating, and charming decor.
review_5_text: Nice, cozy place with inside and outside sitting. Had coffee and pastries here, both were very good. Baristas were lovely and spoke English :)

name: Areemitr Coffee
review_1_text:
It has been ten days since I returned to my hometown, but I still miss Areemitr‚Äôs coffee so much, especially the decaf. The decaf there was better than any I‚Äôve had in all the many countries I‚Äôve traveled to.

The atmosphere was incredibly quiet, warm, and peaceful. I was deeply impressed by the coffee expert who looked like a grandfather‚Äîor perhaps a father‚Äîand by the kind service of his grandson, or maybe his son. My heart felt warm because of them.

On my last day, I said goodbye and told them I hoped we‚Äôd meet again next year.
I visit Chiang Mai every year, so it felt a little sad that I only discovered this place now.
At the end of 2026, I‚Äôll go there every day :)
Until then, I wish you good health and happiness.
review_2_text:
This place has become very popular over the last few years, especially if you live around Santitham.
It‚Äôs honestly the best coffee ever... made with so much love and it costs only 40 baht.
I always love to support small family business and they are the sweetest.
the son and his dad work together and brew the best coffe, I really like them.
It's always a pleasure to enjoy my morning coffee here. It has such a cute surrounding with the small plants in the sitting area.

Since it became more popular, the waiting time can be a little longer, but that‚Äôs because everyone wants good coffee for 40 baht.
review_3_text:
We stopped by 2 days we were in Chiang Mai, and on Christmas day we got takeaways (where they gave us Dunkin Donuts free with our coffee ü•≤)
They‚Äôre so kind and generous, it cost us 70baht (Aus$3.50) for 2 coffees, mine with almond milk (milk lab too) which is crazy, they could easily charge double, & the coffee is good quality. They provide free water & wifi, and kindly refused when i tried to leave them a tip.
The bathroom for the cafe is in their house which they kindly let me use.

If you are in the area definitely check them out, they deserve all the business they can get & they make incredible coffees.

thank you so much ‚ò∫Ô∏è
review_4_text: Excellent coffee, good price! The owner is very kind, and the service is thoughtful, they provide mosquitoes spray on every table. Sometimes you have to wait over 20mins due to too many customers, but the owner will tell you waiting time while ordering. This cafe is almost my everyday coming-to place. Really a hidden gem!
review_5_text:
The iced latte ‚òï really lives up to the recommendations‚Äîabsolutely delicious. The price is a rare find in this area at just 40 THB.üåü

The owner and his son are incredibly lovely and welcoming, which adds to the experience. The location works perfectly for me and gives off very homey, cozy vibes.

The only small note is that the menu is quite limited, but that‚Äôs totally okay. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!üíñ

name: Magic Brew Coffee
review_1_text:
During my stay in Chiang Mai, my perfect morning routine starts next door at Nana Bakery, where I pick up a freshly baked pastry, then bring it over to Magic Brew Cafe to enjoy with their excellent latte.

This cozy spot attracts many regular Western customers, some even bringing their own breakfast to pair with the coffee. The latte here has a rich, full-bodied flavor with low acidity, which makes it one of my personal favorites in town.

The staff are friendly and welcoming, and the menu is affordable with plenty of variety, making it a great choice for a relaxed and satisfying start to the day.
review_2_text: Absolutely 5 stars. A magic cafe that brews both good coffee and Thai tea. Once you drink their ice latte and fresh orange americano, you will understand why they have queues everyday in the shop. Drinks are cheap, around 40/50 baht per cup. The owner grows his own bean proudly. I think they are a family small business. Do order their ice latte, it‚Äôs strong nutty flavored coffee with special chocolate aroma. Most importantly, try their Thai tea, both black and green are super good. Their tea is way better than Chatramue with same price. I guess their secret is to boil the tea with moka pot. Fantastic flavor! My top 5 cafe in Chiangmai.
review_3_text: This neighborhood cafe seems to have a devoted crowd of regulars and I can understand why. Good relaxing vibes, super friendly barista and his partner who seem dedicated to their craft. Very good coffee at one of the lowest prices around.  What's not to like?
review_4_text: Great coffee, friendly owner, really good music playlist are top 3 elements of a truly great coffee shop. Thai tea coffee mix latte made in a Moka pot has gotta be one of the best taste sensations of the year!  'Hot water and coffee gives bright eyes' is a loose translation of Thai name '‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏° ‡∏ï‡πã‡∏° ‡∏à‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏ô'
review_5_text:
Tried so many coffee and Thai tea in chiang mai. This is the best. The coffee is delicious and made with such care and love. The thai tea is brewed in a mocha pot, it gives it a special kick of freshness and taste.

The smoothies, the coconut, the orange coffee - everything in this shop is so fresh, and you can feel it when you drink.

+ they have a large bar sitting, it functions as a real social hub of santitham.
Costumers are a mix of locals and foreigners with a good palette for coffee.

Highly recommended.

name: Book Thief Cafe
review_1_text:
What a wonderful pleasant surprise. Atmosphere is wonderful, relaxing but stylish. Not noisy, and more upscale than places around it. An oasis of sorts.

I like it so much that I will be back!
review_2_text:
Cozy cafe for "thiefing" your time in reading book, online working or mingle with friend for coffee or muffins. Quiet & calm place, not noisy with traffic.

Facility:
* Free wifi
* QRis pay (BCA gak bisa)
* Card pay (min 300 baht)
* Had 2nd floor
* Had outdoor area
* Had a little bit private spot for meeting (can held 4-12 people i think)
* Had 2 side window spot
* Had swimming pool

Request:
* More electric plug on table spot
review_3_text: Really a cool place with a brilliant design and a positive vibe.. several cozy spaces with seating and surfaces, good for getting things done‚Ä¶ nice people and a simple but satisfying menu.. would recommend to others
review_4_text: My favourite cafe on this side of Chiang Mai to get a great coffee, tasty Thai tea, and most importantly for me to get some work done - perfect location to take a laptop and be productive. Also fantastic service from the barista üôÇ
review_5_text:
Super cute cafe and chill area where you can relax and work from here also.

Coffee was nice but not the best I have had in the area, it‚Äôs worth coming for the chilled vibe and lovely staff though.

name: Stay
review_1_text:
Air conditioner + amazing coffee üëåüèªüëåüèª
The coffee was amazing but I also recommend the milk tea!! Great local flavour! The place is clean and has air conditioner and the prices are good. Give it a try!
review_2_text: I stopped by here because it was so hot while I was walking around. The latte and cappuccino were both rich and delicious. Everyone here is friendly and the coffee is delicious~~
review_3_text: I happened to stop by. A rich and delicious latte~~~!! Highly recommended :)

name: ‡πÄ‡∏≠‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ä‡πá‡∏≠‡∏õ‡∏™‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏ò‡∏£‡∏£‡∏°(NShop IT) ‡∏à‡∏≥‡∏ô‡∏≥‡πÇ‡∏ô‡πä‡∏ï‡∏ö‡∏∏‡πä‡∏Ñ‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ñ‡∏∑‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏¢,‡∏ù‡∏≤‡∏Å,‡∏ã‡πà‡∏≠‡∏°
review_1_text: Good service thank you üôè
review_2_text:
Great store!
Excellent service.
They are very professional and reliable. I recommend them for cameras, laptops, smartphones, and even GoPros. Used items.
Thank you for repairing my beloved camera!
review_3_text: The service is very good. I will recommend my friends to come and support me. ü´∂üèªü´∂üèª
review_4_text: Buy-Sell Service

name: dot.coffee
review_1_text: The atmosphere is relaxing, perfect for studying, just enjoying some quiet time. Coffee tastes amazing rich flavor üëçüëçthe staff are super friendly and polite. I also loved the little details clean tables& nice background music. Definitely one of my new favorite spots. Highly recommend! üåø‚ú®
review_2_text:
Delightful little cafe tucked snugly along a quiet street, sporting a small and tasteful woody interior with a comfy albeit limited number of seats, run by a very nice and friendly owner who brews up some superb coffee. It does draw a rotating crowd akin to its size throughout a weekday afternoon, though a table or two was always available when I visited.

WC‚Äîoutside; facing the shop's facade from the street, go down the entryway to the left, walk all the way down till you see a WC sign on the wall, where you'll be prompted to turn right into the corridor at the far end; it'll be the last door down that corridor. There's a sink right by the initial entryway one can use.
review_3_text: I love this coffee shop! The coconut coffee latte is the best I've had. The shop is small but the interior is very tastefull and well picked. You can tell the owner has a an eye for the beautiful. The music is also chill to work to and not your regular radio pop (except during Christmas to be fair). The owner might seem short of polite phrases but is actually very nice. One time I lost my wallet and didn't know where I left it and he not only checked the shop but also checked the cctv for me. Also very reasonable priced, just an overall 10/10 for me.
review_4_text: It‚Äôs a very nice little shop and the staff was very nice and welcoming. He even exchanged all my coins to paper notes, which I didn‚Äôt even ask for, I was asking him if I can put all my coins in the tip jar and he just exchanged them for me. So kind. Will definitely come back next time I‚Äôm here!
review_5_text:
"Thank you very much indeed! As a coffee shop owner, I prefer good coffee, but the barista makes high-quality coffee and creates a great environment in the room.
Please allow the owner to take a photo with the Library Teacher and English book on the bookshelf.

Additionally, my favorite drink is Matcha Milk Coconut‚Äîit‚Äôs even more delicious!

Thank you so much, na krab.
From Kru Watthanakorn Kanthakaew üòäüôèüèª
I purchased a drinking third time! üòÅ

name: The Juice House - Coffee Shop
review_1_text: Over the past 3 weeks we‚Äôve stopped at local coffee and smoothie shops in the Santitham area to chill and read. Saw the reviews for this spot on a side soi that we‚Äôve must have passed and never noticed. It‚Äôs a small pleasant one man operation with limited AC seating inside and small shaded outdoor area and Wi-Fi. We got a mixed berry and cranberry smoothies which were very good and for only 45 baht! They would be 70-100 baht anywhere else. Definitely return.
review_2_text: Now The Juice House is my favorite coffee and juice place in Chiang Mai. This place in cozy and kind of ‚Äútotally lovely and reasonable‚Äù. Inside and outside sitting. They also have small paper clips ‚Äúplease write your order‚Äù. And the price: hot cappuccino 35; espresso 35 and so on... So it is totally reasonable to have pure fresh pineapple juice plus double espresso for 85 baht. Big thanks to the owner :)
review_3_text:
Juice and blended smoothies are available in fresh fruits or frozen fruits.
The store also serves coffee, other drinks and some baked cookies.
I ordered mixed berries with yogurt. The smoothies texture is very creamy.
review_4_text: came here while waiting for check in nearby.  this place is an ABSOLUTE hidden gem. the latte is good, the juices are great, i ordered the orange carrot, TWICE. they have other fresh juice combinations like beetroot, cantaloupe, watermelon, apple.
review_5_text: The juices here are extremely good value for money they are huge!!  If you get yoghurt added to the drinks they are even better value as they fill you up more than a usual juice.  There‚Äôs not a lot of ice added to the glass so I felt like I was getting great value for money as it‚Äôs super thick!  I tried the banana frappe, that was great. I‚Äôll be back to try the others! #BeatTheGrind

name: ‡∏û‡∏≠‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà & ‡∏ö‡∏¥‡∏™‡πÇ‡∏ó‡∏£ Por Dee Cafe & Bistro
review_1_text: Very cute cafe and bistro. Very quiet and peaceful place. You can definitely enjoy the atmosphere and your coffee. The aunties were very friendly and charming. Coffee was so good. The cheese and spinach toast I ordered was cute and delicious. They only take cash. I'd definitely visit this place again. Great place to chill and relax. This place was very close to my airbnb and recommended by my host. I highly commend ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2_text:
A warm welcome awaits you by Sai and her team.
Beautiful fresh coffee and flavour filled food served with hospitality in a  magestically beautiful and peaceful oasis to relax in.
review_3_text: Such a nice relaxing cafe with a very nice well maintained garden. I came to have lunch and it was not really a good decision as their pasta and food were not as good as many other local restaurants around. However, the space is very nice so I don‚Äôt regret coming here anyways. Getting some drinks would be good here.
review_4_text:
A beautiful caf√© with plants‚Äî but the manager is stubborn and has arrogant pride.

If you order a coffee and charge your MacBook there, they would charge 100 baht per hour. (coffee is around 70 baht, tasteful).

I asked if the charging fee could be cheaper (already I showed intent for paying 'electricity fee'), and the manager got annoyed in 2 minutes and forbade me to enter.

Ok, so I went to another caf√©, and just wrote an honest review.
review_5_text: Great comfortable place to get some work done and drink great coffee.  There‚Äôs a nice padded leather bench seat that extends one length of the place that‚Äôs really nice to sit on.  The tables are beautifully crafted and so solid they don‚Äôt rock around when your leaning on them.  There‚Äôs some futon style seating and an outdoor area but the air conditioned interior is fantastic.  A hot latte will cost you 55 baht, they have WiFi and it‚Äôs quite fast. #BeatTheGrind

name: 32Day coffee
review_1_text:
We stopped by a small takeaway coffee shop in Chiang Mai and were genuinely impressed. We ordered two orange espressos, a coconut coffee, and a vanilla latte ‚Äî and everything was absolutely delicious. Each drink was well-balanced, flavorful, and made with high-quality coffee. The service was wonderful too: friendly, quick, and attentive.

A perfect little spot for great coffee on the go. Highly recommended!
review_2_text: Update 2026 ...Still amazing coffee and always friendly. And Yay! I was their first customer for 2026. Let this be a good omen. üí™üôè GREAT coffee and the owner is the barista and has a good flair for coffee quality.  Glad to see they have a consistent 5 star rating. Really nice owners and it's great to support them. It's more a kiosk than a coffee shop so it's nice for a stop and go coffee. There are tall bar stools outside although space is limited. Two thumbs up from me!
review_3_text: Best coffee in Chiang Mai. I was here in January 2025 and I'm still thinking about it! The owner is super friendly and the coffee tastes delicious! A must try in Chiang Mai ü§†
review_4_text: The BEST coffee in Chiang Mai, no question. Sigo is DIALED IN every day, an expert in his field. There are no bad cups here.
review_5_text: Service with a smile. Great drinks. Great prices. Get the matcha latte. Also has oat milk!

name: ‡∏≠‡∏∏‡∏î‡∏° Coffee
review_1_text: Really lovely coffee shop with a few seats in a little cozy courtyard. They serve the most delicious Thai tea we had in Thailand. Great price too.
review_2_text: Great little coffee shop with good drinks selection. The owner is very professional and kind.
review_3_text: Very amazing a tasty drinks and good price
review_4_text:
Nice drink üçπ
Nice smile üòä
Nice environment ü™ë
review_5_text: Excelen everything üôÇ we visited several times.

name: ‡∏™‡∏ñ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏µ‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥‡∏¢‡∏≤‡∏õ‡∏π ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏Ñ‡∏≥‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏¢‡∏á | Namyapoo Station | ‡∏Ç‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏à‡∏µ‡∏ô ‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥‡∏¢‡∏≤‡∏õ‡∏π ‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥‡πÄ‡∏á‡∏µ‡πâ‡∏¢‡∏ß ‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ß‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÑ‡∏Å‡πà I ‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏ô‡∏π‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏• I ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏î
review_1_text: The taste is good, but the service attitude is not good. The thin woman who took the order had a very bad attitude. Later, a male service was much better. From ordering to paying the bill, the thin woman always had a very bad attitude. If I hadn't made an appointment with a friend to come here, I would definitely change the restaurant and would not come a second time.
review_2_text:
Excellent nam ya pu and nam ngiao! Both among the best that I've had. Environment was v nice, even had live piano. Service was friendly and efficient. Mostly locals here even though it's near the popular jing jai market.

Prices are reasonable. Even with crab was still less than 200baht per person for a nice restaurant. Very happy!
review_3_text: The dish features a rich and creamy crab curry with generous portions of crab meat, making it well worth the price. It is beautifully presented with plenty of fresh vegetables on the side, ensuring a clean and appetizing experience. The appetizers, such as dumplings, and desserts like the traditional Thai ice cream with various toppings, are also delicious and satisfying.
review_4_text:
A good restaurant where the main dishes are based on crab (even if it‚Äôs also possible to order chicken or pork).
The food is good and so is the service.
The only minor negative point is that sole dishes on the menu weren‚Äôt available. The tea was also too strong for me.
Total bill was 540 thb for 4 people.
review_5_text: Beautiful Thai food, good environment

name: Gallery Drip Coffee JingJai Market
review_1_text:
Located at the end of the open air market, this air conditioned cafe offers a much needed respite from the heat. There are Thai beans of various origin, taste profile, and processing method. We were happy to take the staff's recommendation and liked our iced black.

The ice jelly however was kind of weird, too milky and the jelly wasn't smooth like we expected.
review_2_text: This caf√© gets quite busy on weekends, but it‚Äôs spacious with plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors. The coffee is genuinely good, and the staff are fast and friendly. Located right inside Jing Jai Market, it‚Äôs super convenient to enjoy a cup of coffee and then wander around shopping.
review_3_text: A coffee shop serving only drip coffee, with a calm Japanese-style atmosphere and beautifully crafted sustainable natural furniture.
review_4_text: Very friendly staff and delicious drinks - highly recommend the Black Honey Coffee & Thai Tea.
review_5_text: The gallery drip is a pillar in the Thailand coffee scene. From Hua Hin to BkK to CM, it‚Äôs a great place to this location is beautiful and the staff are amazing. Great coffee.

name: The Baristro at Jingjai Market
review_1_text: This is one of the smallest Baristro locations I have visited, but it keeps all the charm and quality the brand is known for. It is nice to know they still offer the full menu, although the selection of coffee beans is somewhat limited. The drinks, however, remain top-notch, with specialty coffee that is hard to match. The recently remodeled space looks beautiful and welcoming, making it an ideal spot for any coffee lover and anyone who appreciates quality beverage
review_2_text: Loving the vibe here on a lazy Wednesday afternoon. Got the americano beer, not actual beer, just americano topped with cream cheese. Perfect snack/drink. And this chain looks amazing (based on the pics on the menu).
review_3_text:
Nice atmosphere and clean vibe cafe.
My favorite is Matcha coconut.
Coffee and Shio pang are very good.
review_4_text:
The hot mocha is nice, got a great latte art on it, no sweet very chocolate and the milk is of good quality! The only downside is they overshadowed the espresso flavour for a bit.

We had the matcha cheese cake too, it‚Äôs quite nice, very matcha!

They lean on the pricy side but you also get comfy seating, free WiFi and air conditioner.

The staff are so friendly. You can also purchase drip bags and whole beans here.
review_5_text: Female waitress (mid 20s?, plump) was unpleasant and cheated us out of money. She didn't honour the advertised discount. We had a vibe she was doing something wrong at the till, but didn't check the change until we'd left. Food was too sweet and drink nothing special. Too loud to talk comfortably.  The waitress made the experience 1*.

name: Roastniyom JJ-ECO ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏£‡∏™‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏¢‡∏°‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ ECO (‡∏ï‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏à‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏à‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡πÄ‡∏Å‡πá‡∏ï)
review_1_text:
A Hidden Gem in the Rhythm of a Hectic Life**

If you're looking for a perfect break spot in the Chang Phueak area, come to **Roastniyom JJ-ECO, True Market branch (Address: RX4W+7H8)**. This shop is like a small oasis hidden in a bustling market.

*   **Atmosphere:** Relaxed and friendly, perfect for a short rest while shopping or waiting for friends. There is both indoor and outdoor seating.
*   **Service:** The staff are friendly and very fast. They are cheerful and make drinks quickly, even during busy times.
*   **Taste:** The coffee has a rich and well-balanced taste as expected from Roastniyom. The latte has a fragrant milk foam and beautiful art on the cup. It's a great drink for re-energizing.
*   **Conclusion:** A great "value-for-money" shop. Convenient and fast. The RX4W+7H8 pin makes it very easy to find! Highly recommended if you are near the Chang Phueak area.
review_2_text:
I visited this caf√© and was truly impressed by both the atmosphere and the quality of the coffee.

However, during my visit on February 10, 2026, the staff member on duty appeared quite tired and slightly tense, which affected the overall experience for customers to some extent. It even made me hesitate to order an additional drink, despite the menu being very appealing. My friends who were with me noticed the same thing.

Having additional staff during busy periods might help the service run more smoothly, as the caf√© is clearly very popular. Every time I visit Chiang Mai, I bring friends here and always recommend this place to other international friends as well.

On a previous visit, I was served by a male staff member who handled a very busy and noisy situation with great professionalism. He was polite, attentive, and considerate. My friends were very impressed, and one of them translated for me when he apologized to customers for the noise that day (the caf√© was extremely crowded). I could tell he was tired and working alone, and although he seemed a bit stressed, he still did his best to smile and provide excellent service to everyone.

Overall, this is a lovely caf√©, and I sincerely hope to have an even better experience on my next visit.
review_3_text:
Nice cafe in heart of the market.

Air conditioning was very comfortable.The place to set inside is limited.But you can sit outside, If the weather is good.

I\nTried the black orange coffee?Which is just expresso in orange juice and it was just Devine.That's what you need on a hot summer day.
review_4_text:
Very nice coffee in this chain. All other branches I got good service. They got my order wrong. Then they told me there's no large lattesüôÑ.
I asked for extra hot. They gave me like warm. I asked them to make it hotter. They microwaved it üò≥üòÖ.
Honestly Roastniyom you normally do better.  This branch has a service problem‚ò†Ô∏è‚ò†Ô∏è‚ò†Ô∏è
review_5_text: The coconut latte was so delicious. Recommended, especially if you do not drink milk. Cold with coconut pieces. The atmosphere is beautiful. Good for work, read or anything talk with a friend. Quite during weekdays.

name: Tinn Coffee
review_1_text: got an ice mocha‚Ä¶ this is the 2nd time i have been here.  excellent hand pressed coffee. the guy works very and there‚Äôs now a long long line. if you are patience, you will have a nice coffee.  practice mindfulness when in line.
review_2_text:
Always a treat watching the coffee being prepared. Tried the orange coffee (60baht) ‚Äî not something I‚Äôd usually pick, but it turned out to be a refreshing way to cool down after exploring Jing Jai Market.
