Matcha latte was sold out during my visit but the hojicha latte (80baht) is tasty too
review_3_text:
Great coffee at this pop up store. Based on Google Maps, they do have a coffee shop which is slightly out of town.

Tried the americano coconut, and it was perfect!

Coffee beans are freshly grinded at the store.

Coffee prices are also reasonable. Staff is patient and friendly. Will definitely return to get a second cup when I visit again.
review_4_text: Unfortunately, our experience at Tinn Coffee did not meet our expectations. The owner clearly puts a lot of time and effort into making each order, but unfortunately the espresso in my cappucino was not very hot and my wife‚Äôs Thai Tea was too watery. The wait was very long as well. I wish I didn‚Äôt have to say this but you may want to look elsewhere in the market for a coffee
review_5_text:
Amazing little coffee corner.
We had the strong (dark) espresso and the espresso coconut (iced)
The coffee was super tasty and mild.

Highly recommended.

name: ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏¥‡πÇ‡∏ô‡πà ‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå ‡∏ï‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏Ñ‡∏≥‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏¢‡∏á Ramino Coffee Bar Kamtieng market
review_1_text:
This is another coffee shop in Chiang Mai. I will say that the gentleman was very pleasant.

The pastries are not freshly made. They are in the fridge.  But I see the waffle machine.  So that's a good thing. I was excited about that.  Dessert, yes!

Now the shop is full of plants. Not I got bit a few times. I kinda rushed to finish my latte.

This was a cafe I wanted to try because I saw the latte art.
He was late getting started, so i won't be too hard on him.
review_2_text: A small coffee shop in a tree market where the seller is attentive to details, recommending menus to customers, asking about their preferences, and being attentive. You can order as you please. I love this shop. There are many menus to choose from.
review_3_text: A coffee shop and bakery in Kad Kham Thiang. Comfortable seating with beautiful potted plants. There are croissants and bakery items to choose from. Sit comfortably after looking at the plants.
review_4_text: Hong Kong egg waffles are delicious! It's close to Jing Zhai Market and a great place to visit the flower market!
review_5_text: I stopped by after sweating profusely at Jingjjai Market, and the drink was so deliciousüòç The owner is also very kind!!ü•∞

name: Curry Puff Coffee, Lotus Kham Thiang
review_1_text:
Well managed shop.  These guys take customer service seriously.  Tables are frequently tidied and clean.

Excellent coffee, beautifully  presented in a real cup & saucer.

Iced latte can be made with dark roast for a full rich flavor.

Chicken curry puff has crisp flakey pastry and a flavorful filling.
review_2_text: Although this shop in a shopping center I was very impressed with the taste and quality of the coffee and the special gem for me was the chicken curry puff for only 10 baht! Wow I was so  impressed, I was hungry and thought a little snack would hold me over and I ended up eating two. Its worth a stop if you need a coffee fix or a light snack. Sorry for the partially eaten Puff!
review_3_text:
An the entranxe of the Lotus Mall
Staff ultra friendly and very nice products and choice. ( coffee, Tea and Smoothies )
Quality / Price unbeatable
review_4_text: Nice coffee shop inside tesco lotus kamthieng. Can choose between medium or dark roasted beans for the espresso based drinks. Curry pufs are nice.
review_5_text: Enjoy a great cup of coffee or an iced coffee. They offer a nice variety.  Loved my iced Mocha. Presentation, vibe and service was awesome. Thank You!

name: Choojai Coffee
review_1_text:
The coffee man who grew, roast, grind and make his own pour over coffee in a bustling weekend market! It‚Äôs as much as an experience as it is good coffee. You get a choice of light or medium roast and my favourite was definitely the light. You can sit for as long as you like, and get as many cups as you like - it‚Äôs a pay as you wish place. Also sells bags of his own beans and ground coffee as well. A lot of people are frightened to approach or sit down as there are no clear signs but take the leap of faith and good coffee will follow (no sugar or milk, just pour over). He speaks decent English but coffee is a universal language.

He is only here on weekends! Saw his stand on a Saturday but not in the exact location marked on google maps. Take your time in finding this place - it‚Äôs worth it!
review_2_text: We saw this coffee on a travel YouTube video and so glad we went to visit. The drip coffee is delicious. There is no set price, you pay by donation. There is a lady there that can draw you on a coffee cup for a donation as well. Great atmosphere and service, definitely recommend checking them out. We went on Saturday and they weren't there and came back to find them on Sunday so might be a Sunday only thing.
review_3_text:
Nice Drip Coffee street stall with interesting pricing: Pay as you like :)

Every cup has a unique drawing too! and you can ask for different levels of roasting. Must stop by if you‚Äôre in Jing Jia Market
review_4_text: Just a guy making pour over. Has light and medium roast. No sugar or milk. He is selling beans on the side and makes them himself. It is free. He is here to make friends and spread love. You can pay but it is up to you and what you can afford. Super nice and creates a wonderful community of people. It is great to listen to the conversations and he truly cares about you and your experience at his little shop. A wonder man.
review_5_text: Good coffee with a relaxing environment. I love the light roast coffee there. Fruity aftertaste note with medium body. Recommended if you are visiting to JingJai Market. (JJ Market)

name: COFFEE ON WHEELS
review_1_text:
Thai tea 40 ‡∏ø (2025)

Has English menu. English speaking staff.

Amazing little coffee place.

Saturday Jingjai market is best. The atmosphere is so cozy and relax and drinking tea is best.

The tea is strong in taste and fit my every desire. Well done tea!

Lovely morning to spend time here.

There are maybe 4 tiny chairs to sit next to it with tiny tables.
review_2_text: Great coffee. Smooth , nicely roasted. Friendly staff and the closest I've been to a surfboard for waaaay to long. Really recommend if at Jing Jai Market. They are at the back behind the food market. Look for the surfboard at the van :-)
review_3_text:
Very friendly team behind this truck at Jing Jai open market and they serve good cold drinks like Thai milk tea and other tea beverages.

Service was quite fast and the wait was relatively short.  They are slightly cheaper than Thancoff truck with prices starting from 40 THB.
review_4_text: my partner ordered kiwi soda, it‚Äôs not something we would ever ordered but it was absolutely delicious i really recommend it!!
review_5_text: Nice Coffee Truck üöõ delicious coffee and Thai tea for affordable prices

name: ÏÇøÍ∞ì ÏïÑÏ†ÄÏî® ÎìúÎ¶Ω Ïª§Ìîº
review_1_text: It was early in the morning, and there were no customers. The assistant was on her phone, so the man with the hat made the coffee and didn't serve it right away. The coffee served in a thin paper cup was passed over with a "no-look" gesture, so I almost spilled it. It was self-priced, so I paid about the same price as a nearby trailer coffee, but the beans were bland and the service was terrible. I didn't even waste 10 baht.
review_2_text:
It was something new.
The man in the hat would make drip coffee on the spot, and he said you could put in as much money as you wanted.
It's hard to describe, but it had a strong coffee aroma and flavor.
review_3_text: Pour drip coffee into a hand-painted cup. It's a refreshingly acidic coffee. There's no separate price; just add it to your cart.

name: ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏ô‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏Ñ‡∏á ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏≥‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏¢‡∏á
review_1_text: Great hot Americano coffees, one dark and one medium roast. Good value at 35 Baht each. In a quiet place in the flower market
review_2_text:
Very good coffee, with a very good PRICE!!!!
MUST TRY!!!!
review_3_text:
The rear of the Lotus

There's no air conditioning, but
the cafe is cool with just a fan.

The apple soda was delicious!
review_4_text:
It's delicious, rich in flavor, and the aroma lingers in your nose.
The price is also affordable.
review_5_text: Delicious coffee, excellent qualityüëçüëç

name: Jowa Cafe & Hotel
review_1_text: I booked based on the glowing reviews we read, but our room 201 - had a tub which was what my wife enjoys most but it‚Äôs small! The bed mattress is on the floor so not easy and comes with several tripping hazards too. The bum gun leaks so our towels were soaked but there is no way to get dry ones when the desk staff is away. No toilet paper so bring your own. Maybe this room is best for short people because everything is very low. The area is not easy to walk so you need to use grab for everything. If you have allergies the a/c filter may be dirty like ours was
review_2_text: Great for a business trip, not much parking space but great roomüëèüëèthey don‚Äôt have breakfast but they do have cafe downstairs, which they give you one free drink if u stay thereüòÅüòÅüòÅtry out orange juice coffee
review_3_text:
Pleasant cafe, good range of espresso drinks (from a gorgeous red La Marzocco), some cakes & sandwiches, *friendly service*, fast wifi, clean restrooms.
No car parking in front, but there's a lot 50 meters away.
review_4_text: Good coffee in a beautifully outfitted environment.  Plenty of power points around, comfortable seats and decent coffee for 55 baht for a hot latte. #BeatTheGrind
review_5_text:
Great property. Quiet and quaint neighbourhood.
Great coffee and awesome front desk.

name: hahm.coffeebar
review_1_text:
Small coffee shop with nice and warmly decoration in Fah Hahm area front of Charoen Rat Rd.

Did not expect much but it surprisingly GOOD coffee. Delicious coffee, fast, and cheap price.
Americano 55THB

Open early from 7AM. Can be your daily dose on your way to work.
review_2_text: Cute aesthetic coffee shop across the famous curry spot. Such a great spot to cool off and enjoy your drinks. Recommend the ‚ÄúHere comes the sun‚Äù. It was refreshing and light - Nothing I‚Äôve ever had! I also got the matcha Latte with oat milk. You can tell it‚Äôs high quality matcha and the oat milk was so creamy. The employee Fon who made our drinks was so sweet.
review_3_text:
Had an excellent caramel macchiato here!!!Just the way I like it

Very nicely designed cafe and the ambiance is very nice
review_4_text: Excellent matcha latte and ‚Äúhere comes the sun‚Äù (incredible yuzu honey espresso) with a really lovely quiet vibe! Highly recommend this cute little place!
review_5_text: I was having lunch around this area so I stopped by this little cafe after lunch. I didn‚Äôt expect much but OMG they have one of the best Thai milk tea! I would love to go back there for their thai milk tea!

name: 168 COFFEE AT CHIANG MAI
review_1_text: Retro cafe that seems more like a drinks place than a place to buy baked goods.  I see more antique radios and televisions than I did baked goods.  Latte will set you back 50 baht and there‚Äôs a large bench in the middle you can work from.  I tried a lemon tea which was nice, can‚Äôt drink coffee at the moment on account of coming back from India and my stomach is riddled with bacteria üòù. Will be back to try their coffees!! #BeatTheGrind
review_2_text: So cute place!!! Good coffee and signature deserts! So nice atmosphere there!!!!
review_3_text: Nice and quite place. Drinks were great.
review_4_text: Good food Excellent service staff and all decoration all as goods üçª
review_5_text: Went later in afternoon so not sure about the bakery. Nothing on offer. Decent Latte though and I enjoyed the last century decor and Philadelphia memorabilia.

name: Zest Espresso Bar
review_1_text: Small tiny espresso bar, owner is very knowledgeable about coffee and very friendly.  Espressos and coffees are offered at different levels of roast.  Very delicious
review_2_text: Cozy coffee bar, great coffee, nice barista perfect for morning and afternoon break
review_3_text:
What a pleasant surprise. The rain came so we saw the signboard and dropped in for a quick coffee after finishing our khao soi across the road. This is definitely one of the better cups I've had in Thailand so far üëç

Am a big coffee nerd back home in Sydney so it was nice to find abit of well-rounded acidity (long black/americano) in place of the usual bombardment of smokey/darker roast tastes that you often get across Thailand, even from supposed 'specialty' coffee joints. Was great seeing the barista enjoy his craft (weighing in, distributing etc).

Small shop with a couple seats and tables inside and a few counter stools outside the window. Very chill.

Don't hesitate to drop in for your caffeine fix if you're in the neighbourhood.
review_4_text: Very simple shop, but everything I ordered over the course of two visits was good. I especially liked the Sun Zest. The owner seemed like a nice guy.
review_5_text:
We went for a coffee here this morning as our hotel was down the road.
The owner was friendly and welcoming, we got a hazelnut latte and an americano with a little milk(my request) which he made perfectly.
The coffee was lovely, the perfect strength and temperature to drink and it was nice to watch the world go by with the seats he had outside!

There is parking outside for a car or a few bikes.

name: AIKORY COFFEE
review_1_text: super worth it! very affordable and tastes good üòä i got mine with light roast beans for 50 THB and it‚Äôs perfect.
review_2_text:
A newly opened shop offering unique flavors, a friendly atmosphere, ample parking, and a wide selection of flower shops, both bouquets and fresh flowers.

This is a coffee shop I recommend to my friends.
review_3_text:
Looking for a delicious, strong-flavored iced tea? Ask for less sugar! This shop is perfect. The owner is very friendly.

P.S. They also have a points system for free drinks!
review_4_text: The coffee tastes good, but the shop is very hot. If they're so serious about keeping the air conditioning on, why did they choose to make the shop out of glass?
review_5_text: Delicious coffee, cool air conditioning and spacious seating.

name: Red Cherry Roastery
review_1_text:
Very cute coffee shop that roasts the beans themselves!

And with that..... freshly baked waffles with coconut ice cream!

We enjoyed üòá

name: SEE IN Cafe
review_1_text:
Very friendly !
üëâüç∫ü§è

name: Koteji Coffee House
review_1_text: Grapefruit soda (two small sips) 105 Thai Baht. You can use this as a reference.
review_3_text: After finishing your Northern Thai curry noodles, you can enjoy tea and desserts next door. The Japanese-style matcha ice cream was surprisingly delicious, and the chocolate in the Banoffee paired perfectly with the cream without being too sweet, making it ideal for those who don't have a sweet tooth but still crave dessert after a meal.
review_4_text:
The Japanese tea room has a lovely ambiance, air conditioning, and is comfortable to sit in.

But given how much effort they put into decorating the space, I'd expect them to at least use real cups for drinks. üòÇ The plastic cups clash completely with the overall atmosphere.

name: Calabash ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏ö‡∏±‡∏ä Healthy drink and fresh coffee
‡∏ã‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà
review_1_text:
Very cute coffee shop that roasts the beans themselves!

And with that..... freshly baked waffles with coconut ice cream!

We enjoyed üòá
review_2_text: Good coffee and nice view
review_3_text:
A small, cozy shop with a warm atmosphere.
We ordered an Americano for 20 baht! You heard right, 20 baht! It was delicious.
The coconut ice cream and freshly made waffles were also amazing.
review_4_text:
The coffee is much cheaper than next door.

They also have coconut ice cream.

I recommend coming here for coffee and ice cream after you finish eating noodles next door.

name: Red Panda Caf√® (CNX) | ‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡πÅ‡∏û‡∏ô‡∏î‡πâ‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏î‡∏á (‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ä.)
review_1_text: I went to Red Panda today for lunch! It is such a fun environment and the service is wonderful! The Khao soi burger really impressed me! I couldn't believe how much it actually tasted like the famous Northern Thai noodle dish! It also didn't sit too heavy on the stomach, like some burgers do. The place has a lot of seating and is also a great place for studying or meetings. I highly recommend you go and try it out!
review_2_text: Place was amazing! Coffee was good and there was a game room with a Nintendo Switch. The slide is super fast as well! It‚Äôs also Christian owned which is rare here in Chiang Mai which makes it 10x better.
review_3_text: If you‚Äôre looking for the best hamburgers in Thailand, Red Panda is unbeatable. The patties are juicy, packed with flavor, and cooked exactly right. Fresh toppings, great buns, and amazing service. Easily one of my favorite spots.
review_4_text:
Really nice and chilled cafe, they have a  spacious area. 2 couch areas, a big wooden table for more people to sit and 3x 2-person tables and 2 high chair sitting areas. Above they have a co-working area which you can book and a game room with Nintendo switch, ping pong table, board games etc.
Really nice place to hang around. Really chill and nice ambience. Staff is very friendly, prices are totally ok and acceptable.
Nice atmosphere. They have a metal slide which you can slide down (on your own risk, it's quite fast).
Their food and drink (Thai Tea) tastes really good, can also recommend the Matcha Brownie. They also have a small section of merchandise, red Panda branded.
Would love to come back here, big recommendation...
review_5_text: very friendly environment, high speed internet and good coffee offcourse üòä

name: Elephant Cafe & Coworking
review_1_text: A nice workable cafe. 2nd floor is more workable with strong AC and a few good tables and chairs. Wifi speed is reading 500+Mbps for download and 250+ for upload. Their cappuccino is decent because they put some effort to make a good mill foam even though the quality of the drinks is a bit inconsistent.  It‚Äôs a great spot to work especially when it‚Äôs hot outside.
review_2_text: Super fast WiFi here I did a speed test and got 100Mbps!  Plenty of space to work from and plenty of power outlets to charge your electronics from here.  Coffee was really good, I ordered an americano for 50 baht which is not too bad.  There‚Äôs a large desk you can work from or smaller individual places to setup.  Place is well air conditioned if you want to beat the heat! #BeatTheGrind
review_3_text:
I was here late July 2023.

Really nice place for coworking. When I was there, only the cafe front part was open, probably because it‚Äôs not uni season yet. This cafe is near the uni and I bet it gets pretty popular! There were a few stray students who came.

The lady who owns the place was super nice and I stayed here for quite a bit, ordering coffee, tea and ice cream.
review_4_text: The boss is very friendly and the drinks are delicious. The most special thing the rooftop of this store is awesome, and you can see the scenery of Chiang Mai University.
review_5_text: Coffee is moderate... nothing special only close late.

name: Hello mƒÅo caf√©
review_1_text: Friendly, helpful staff and the cats behave well and are lovely. However, the cats were not well groomed (the fur had not been brushed) and many of them were sick with runny noses. However, I cannot know whether the cats receive medicine and are groomed later so I will still give a fair review of 3 stars. I just hope the staff finds the time to take a bit more care of the cats or, maybe give the customers brushes so they can do the grooming instead?
review_2_text: I had a great time at the cat caf√©! The cats are super cute, playful, and full of energy. They all look very happy and well cared for. It was a lovely experience, I‚Äôd love to visit again!
review_3_text:
Guys, please help the cats get better - some of them are really sick. Some have runny noses and itchy eyes.

People here have written that the cats are skinny, but I think they look that way because many of them are still teenagers and therefore appear very thin. They have free access to food.

The cat room smells terrible. When you keep multiple animals in the same room, you need to keep it clean. My feet were sticking to the floor, and I'm guessing it's because of the urine that can remain on the cats' paws. You need to wash the floors several times a day and change the litter in their litter box more often. The smell is truly terrible. For comparison, you can go to a similar place in Niman. It's spotlessly clean and there's no smell.

And of course, it's worth mentioning that some of the cats are very dirty. Because they have long hair, some of them have fecal matter under their tails. I feel so sorry for the animals that the staff and owner don't care about them.

In our parish, one of the employees was studying English with a tutor while working. It would be better if you brushed one of the cats or washed them:/
review_4_text: Cozy cafe with delicious drink options. The orange americano and caramel macchiato tastes good. The kittens are very interactive. Got house rules before playing with cats (such as wearing socks). If you are not wearing socks, can buy a pair for 10 baht.
review_5_text:
I found this caf√© accidentally while walking around and I feel so lucky that I did. It's an amazing place with plenty of wonderful, cute and beautiful, unique cats! Maine coons, Persian, Munchkins and others, kittens, adults. All the cats were very playful, friendly and healthy.
The staff members are extremely polite, kind and helpful. They are hardworking and keep the place and litter boxes very clean.
All visitors should wear a pair of socks when entering the cat interaction room, and also mandatory to disinfect your hands.
It's possible to visit the cats only and you can also have drinks (coffee, tea, soft drinks)

I had an amazing time there and recommend it to everyone who loves cats.

name: RotSomJai (Kin Sa Bo)
review_1_text:
Rossomjai Coffee has strategically relocated from a local community setting to a more prominent position near the main road leading to Doi Suthep, a move that is expected to enhance its visibility and accessibility. While the flavor profile of the coffee did not align with my personal preferences, it is important to acknowledge that taste is subjective, and other patrons may find it quite appealing.

Upon attempting to connect to the internet, I noted that the restaurant's Wi-Fi network was detectable. However, there was no visible display of the Wi-Fi password within the establishment. As a guest, I felt a degree of discomfort in approaching the staff to request the password, particularly as they appeared to be fully engaged with their duties at the bar. I suggest that prominently displaying Wi-Fi credentials, perhaps on tables, could significantly improve customer convenience and encourage a more seamless online experience.

Furthermore, I recommend a review of the current table arrangements. My seating position, directly facing the bar, exposed me to a somewhat cluttered area, which could detract from the overall ambiance. Optimizing the layout could enhance the dining experience for guests.

In terms of pricing, the cost of items was acceptable, though it was comparatively higher than some local competitors who offer what I perceive as a more comprehensive experience.
review_2_text: A tiny cafe with good drinks. The thing here is they will adjust your drink how you want it and it is super flexible as you can see in the picture. The space is tiny, so it is better for many to just to get a take away.
review_3_text: Their entrance shows pour over coffee.. but they don‚Äôt have pour over coffee‚Ä¶
review_4_text: Thai milk tea can be adjusted with the sugar levels and how strong tea flavour you want.
review_5_text:
Delicious! I don‚Äôt like overly sweet drinks so I love how customizable these drinks are. You can get 0, 10, 25, 50% sweet as well as adjust for how strong of tea flavor you want.

Got the genmaicha and dark cocoa, both good!

name: T-TEN Cafe & Restaurant
review_1_text: Nice latte and espresso. The Thai-style espresso is quite sweet ü§£ so keep that in mind if you prefer less sugar. Friendly service.
review_2_text: I stopped by T-Ten Cafe recently and honestly, it‚Äôs such a cozy spot. The atmosphere is super relaxed, with a simple but warm design that makes you feel comfortable right away. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you can sit for hours, either reading a book or chatting with friends.
review_3_text: We love T-TEN! The food is very tasty and the service is great. We go at least once a week. They have oat milk too which is good cause I can't drink dairy.
review_4_text:
LOVE it!
I keep coming back. The fried banana is so yummy! And they now have charging ports. Never seen these anywhere else ü•≥‚ú®
Cappuccino is strong üëç

The atmosphere, the service, and the food were all excellent.
review_5_text: Always my first choice whenever I go to ‚Äú‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏≠ Nah-Moh‚Äù (in front of the Chiangmai university). The restaurant offers a wide variety of menu options and also has a small caf√© at the front. It has been open for over ten years since I was in high school and I still love it. A lot of memories with friends and tasty foods.

name: Tidwhan Cafe' | ‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏î‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏ô ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà
review_1_text: Very nice cafe with beautiful outdoors it's like we're sitting in a garden, except during lunch time, otherwise there will be a lot of people and there won't be any seats.good coffee, good prices. The atmosphere is good.
review_2_text: If you want a nice coffee place near RMUTL that's cheap and has tasty drinks, try this place. It's surrounded by green plants, which makes it feel really relaxing. The vibe there is cool and friendly. It's a great place to chill with a good cup of coffee that won't cost you much.
review_3_text: Amazing coffee and cool decor. They have several specialty coffee options for drip. More expensive but totally worth it.
review_4_text:
Quite and cozy place with cute vintage stuff
Board games, tasty drinks
Could be nice to read a book there
review_5_text: Great place! perfect to work and leisure especially if you are a Backpackers. The atmosphere feels like home. Good tast for the Coffee.

name: Press continue cafe
review_1_text: Amazing place to chill and play some games! We played Mario kart on the switch and some Ps5 , they have a menu of nice drinks, the decor is awesome, the owner is just lovely. Comfy couches to sit on, they have retro Nintendo 64, PlayStation 1 and some other ones , loved this spot will be back for sure ! And it was nice and cool in there on a hot day! 5 Stars üåü
review_2_text: I've been here yesterday, what a stunning gaming cafe! Owner and staff have been super friendly and helpful. There are five CRTs with retro consoles where I spent my time. Everything is well set up, cleaned and maintained. You can play almost all retro games you wish. There are also five flat screens with PS5s and Switches. For the retro consoles you buy a drink and can use them, for the modern consoles its 50 THB per hour, which I think is very fair. Highly recommend this place, loved it!
review_3_text:
This cafe bring me further than just playing ps5 but with some of retro consoles I never heared of them even I am the big fan of gaming console

you can order cafe or lots of drink and enjoy many types of game including lots of mainstram games in both single player & multi players like Black myth wukong , Elden ring , Ghost of yotei , tekken 8 , street fighter 6 or even party animals and smash bow in Nintendo you named it.

With service minded , caring , kind from P kwan & P bol I'm highly recommened you guys to visit here even for chating and exchange teenage dream in console

Cheers !!!
review_4_text: One of the most unique cafe experiences you can have. If you love video games, collectible toys and good vibes there is no better place. You can feel the  owners passion in every corner of the store. Drop in but be prepared to stay for a while as you take a trip down memory lane. Don‚Äôt forget to order one of the delicious drinks while you play your day away. Highly recommended.
review_5_text: Amazing and must visit place if you love videogames! Mostly retro but also new ones!!! Got many station where you can play basically every game ever existed!!! Owner is super cool and you can see he has got lots of passion about it! Super rare console and action figures!!!

name: CuppaCharm Coffee
review_1_text:
I visited this caf√© two times, and I had a great experience. The place is clean, with relaxing jazz music playing in the background. The drinks are reasonably priced, with a variety of options, including coffee, tea, and soda. You can also customize the sweetness level and add extras like honey if you prefer. They also offer free Wi-Fi and charging spots, which is super convenient.

I had a chat with the owner, who was incredibly friendly. They mentioned that the caf√© opened just a few months ago and that they‚Äôre planning to introduce a new menu soon. On my first visit, I ordered a Cocoa Latte with regular sweetness. It was delicious! The owner also gave me a banana cake with caramel to try for free, saying they were still perfecting the recipe. It was fantastic!

The next day, I decided to visit again in the late evening and stayed until the place was about to close. One of the owners remembered me and asked if I wanted to try an unreleased drink, a strawberry latte. The day before, I had asked if they had any fruity drinks besides peach since I‚Äôm not a big fan of peach, and they told me the strawberry latte would be available the next day. So, of course, I came back.

The drink was great, but at first, they gave me a regular straw, which made it a bit difficult to mix the strawberry with the milk and drink it properly. When the owner asked for my feedback, I mentioned that the straw wasn‚Äôt strong enough for mixing and wasn‚Äôt wide enough for the strawberry pulp to pass through. She immediately apologized and brought me a larger straw, the kind used for bubble tea. On top of that, she gave me another banana cake on the house.

I‚Äôll definitely be back if I visit this city again!
review_2_text: The caf√© is nice. Cakes are delicious. However, I ordered a cup of filtered coffee (because I saw beautiful v60 gears at the bar), and it's not good. It seems they don't have a clue how to make filter coffee but still sell it üòÖ.
review_3_text: I‚Äôm pretty sure we were given 2 cups of milk when we ordered two hot cappuccinos‚Ä¶ at least say that you don‚Äôt know how to make a drink, but to wait quite a while for that.. just kind of unprofessional. Wanted to give a good review but just being honest about our experience.
review_4_text: Comfortable cafe. Good to sit and chill, or do some work üòå
review_5_text: Located at the entrance of an alley near the university, this coffeeshop will become one of my favorites in Chiang Mai. It has been open for a month by Golf and Sophia, a friendly young Thai couple who are smiling and who will give you a warm welcome. They have concocted different homemade blends of organic coffees from plantations in the Chiang Dao district, north of Chiang Mai. Whether you like a smooth or strong coffee, there will be one to suit your taste. Unless you prefer an excellent green tea or a delicious strawberry milk! The space is bright with a high ceiling. The polished concrete floor and vintage furniture elements contribute to the relaxed atmosphere. This coffeeshop stands out for another significant aspect. Golf and Sophia are lovers of good music and they have equipped their shop with high-end audio equipment. A delicious coffee or tea while listening to good songs and sound in a warm and smiling atmosphere, all this at very reasonable prices... what else?

name: Neo Entertainment Gallery
review_1_text:
Neo Entertainment Gallery locates near Ibis Hotel on Huaykaew road. The place specializes on HIFI stereo, audio equipment and turntable. Neo Entertainment also offers CDs and Vinyls for sell. The upper floors are the vinyls and artworks (thats why they are also an "gallery"). From the looks, they also have mini cafe as well on the lower floor.

Lovely attentive staff at all times during my visit.
review_2_text: Very nice ambience and great coffee
review_3_text: Quality audio/video products
review_5_text: If you want the best sound system, you have to come here.

name: Arboretum Bliss coffee shop
review_1_text: Don't usually leave reviews, however this place deserves one. Great and underrated place for coffee. Spent three consecutive mornings here. Peaceful atmosphere, unassuming place, fantastic affordable latte. Highly recommended. While many may head to the cafes near the reservoir for the views (but more crowded and pricier), I came back to this place during my visits, which still brings me right next to nature within the arboretum
review_2_text: This is the most peaceful little coffee stand that sits inside the Huai Kaeo arboretum. The coffee is great.
review_3_text: This cafe is considered to have the most natural atmosphere in Chiang Mai city. There are many seating areas under large trees in the arboretum, allowing you to enjoy your coffee while listening to beautiful background music.
review_4_text: A small coffee shop with a peaceful atmosphere in a garden.
review_5_text: A lush green coffee shop

name: Juice Central 2
review_1_text:
I regret living on the other side of town, but I'm ready to commute here every day. First of all, this place is amazing because of the friendly staff. I couldn't resist when the owner invited me in. Also, they have excellent homemade baking, which is a rarity in Thailand.

I‚Äôll keep coming back until I‚Äôve tried every single cake. And after that, I'll keep coming until the owner kicks me out! Great place. You should definitely check it out.
review_2_text:
This place became our morning habit. We stop in for a drink almost every day. ü´Ç The owners always meet us with a smile, so warm and friendly, like visiting friends. The atmosphere is simple and kind, without any show - that is why we like to come back. The cafe owners teach us Thai words üôèüòÑ

The coffee is tasty and not expensive. But the best part is their homemade bakery. In Chiang Mai coffee shops it is rare to find something really homemade, fresh and warm. Here they have pies, cakes, cheesecake. My favorite is the pie with pandan - it is amazing! All is fresh and made with love.

üíõ If you want not only coffee, but also a cozy place with good people and real taste - I really recommend to come here.
review_3_text: Absolutely amazing place. The atmosphere created by the crew, along with delicious coffee, smoothies, and pastries, is wonderful. The prices are very friendly. The owner (a very passionate traveller) and the rest of the staff are incredibly helpful‚Äîthey are happy to give recommendations and assist with your travels. Wi-Fi is also available. One of the best places I've visited in Chiang Mai (and I've been to a lot!). Can't wait to come back!
review_4_text: Family-run establishment with comfortable seating and a choice of coffees, juices and baked goods. Nothing fancy but the price is right and it is a pleasant environment for spending an hour if one happens to be in the neighborhood.
review_5_text: We went here almost every day while we were in Chiang Mai. Their cheesecake is phenomenal, honestly one of the best we‚Äôve had. The chocolate brownies and the chocolate cake are really good too. The place has such a cozy vibe, and the owner is very accommodating and welcoming. Definitely a spot we kept coming back to.

name: Curry puff coffee ‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏≠‡∏ä‡∏≠
review_1_text: Delicious curry puff , 10 baht each. Chicken , Taro and green beans.
review_2_text: The place looks nice and cheap drinks nglüòç the staff here is so nice and friendly
review_3_text: Absolutely loved the curry puffs.
review_4_text: Delicious coffee and curry puffs!

name: A-mai Homemade Bakery & Cafe
review_1_text:
Very chill and calm atmosphere, a lot of light, beautiful interior and exterior zones. In general, it‚Äôs a nice place to sit and work, not many customers, pretty good coffee and unordinary desserts.
Just be aware they have a rule 1 order per person, so you are obliged to order at least a drink for each person you came along with
review_2_text: We had such good experience at A-Mai, we came more than once during our stay in Chiang Mei! Delicious coffees and desserts, in a quiet area to focus and get some work done. Owners are so sweet and kind. Thank you, A-Mai!
review_3_text:
This cafe has a great atmosphere. The coffee is delicious and tastes amazing. They offer free Wi-Fi, which is incredibly fast ‚Äî I tested Download 443 Mpbs/ Upload 553, so working is super smooth.
The staff are friendly and helpful. Its a perfect spot to work or chill.
review_4_text: Such a cute place with a cozy Christmas atmosphere‚ù§Ô∏è I love their desserts, they‚Äôre masterpieces beautiful and delicious!
review_5_text: Very lovely, looks like it is intended someone's house but dont be put off - it is a beautiful cafe with lovely service, coffee and thai tea or sweets

name: Starbucks
review_1_text: Good ambiance and great customer service.
review_2_text:
1.) It is the good location on the first floor near the fountain which in front of the mall.
2.) The area for sit it‚Äôs a lot of chairs and tables.
3.) The staffs are active to service you but slow to clean the tables.
**On the weekend is crowded here it‚Äôs not a good choice to come here.
*** MY PROBLEM is a lot of MOSQUITOES fly around I have a mosquito spray they still bit me. I think they should fix this problem it‚Äôs quite dangerous for humans.
review_3_text: The food tastes great, and the service is nice too.
review_4_text: I paid triple the amount for a latte that came tasting of warm milk. I had to request another shot of coffee to flavour the milk. I get a better coffee from any street cart for 45baht. Extremely dissatisfied
review_5_text: My chill spot after walking around Central Mall. I visit this location at least 4 times a week and the staff is friendly. The place is always clean. I see many tourists pop in and out while I dine here.

name: Oxygen Coffee Studio - The BASE Height
review_1_text: LOVE this little coffee shop. We get iced matcha lattes and iced lattes every time and they are ALWAYS perfect and super affordable. The baristas are so so kind and it is nice that it's downstairs from our condo, very convenient. Such a treat!
review_2_text: Great place to grab breakfast. Fast service and good quality. Definitely recommended.
review_3_text:
(Update) Thank you guys for such a fast reaction. Next day owner talked to me, explain situation with stuff and compliment a cappuccino. Are you so sweet, wish you all the best ü•∞

Please teach your new girl to make cappuccino. She try to convince me that you cannot make foam from oatmilk. If fact everyone can do it, even I do it with my small home foamer.

I‚Äôll change my review once you fix this!
review_4_text: Very good coffee and the only place I found that sells English style scones
review_5_text: DELICIOUS iced matcha lattes! Perfect every time. And the baristas are so nice. It's such a treat being able to live so close to this charming little coffee shop :)

name: Caf√© Amazon
review_1_text: As someone who drinks his coffee black, this was easily the best place to get coffee in the mall. The medium roast is bold and smooth, similar to a dark roast elsewhere, but without the burnt taste.
review_2_text: I usually sit in the evening. Honey Lite is my favorite.
review_3_text: Why does the small hot black coffee cost ‡∏ø 65 ÔºüBut here it say‚Äòs ‡∏ø40 on the menu.No good coffee here but some place to sit.
review_4_text: One of Amazon Cafe friendchise located in Central Festival Chiang Mai. Their Thai tea taste normal. The price of the Amazon Cafe is quite cheap compared to other coffee shop in the same area. There are plenty of seat available. The outdoor area is a good place to sit but after 15.30 pm sunlight will reach some of the outdoor area.
review_5_text: 10 minutes until closing their clothes cannot serve me green tea with milk. They tell me to go away even though I'm in the shop in the shoppers door is unlocked bad form

name: Rodem Cafe Î°úÎéÄ Ïπ¥Ìéò
review_1_text: Just moved into the area and love this place it‚Äôs my go to for a good coffee/ pastry and had a smoothie today that‚Äôs delish. Staff is really friendly and good English speaker. Great chilled quiet atmosphere with chill music on.
review_2_text: Probably the best iced cappuccino I‚Äôve had in Thailand during my over two-month stay here. The barista was very friendly. The cheesecake didn‚Äôt quite suit my taste, but I‚Äôd happily come back for the coffee.
review_3_text:
The coffee tastes very good. The staff and the owner of the shop are friendly and also have water for sale.ü•∞ü•∞üòòü•∞
Can‚Äôt wait to come back again üòç
review_4_text: Wonderful coffee hot or cold. The owner is a real barista and she is using real products to prepare every drinks (cacao, matcha, oat milk...)
review_5_text: Great coffee and desserts with great service, I would like to have a cup of joe here frequently üíê

name: Oxygen Coffee Studio
review_1_text: Great coffee, friendly staff, fair price, right beside 7/11 for snacks.
review_2_text: Nice little coffee stand outside 7/11. Good coffee at the right price
review_3_text: Would be perfect if it didn‚Äôt take 20 minutes for espresso and water üò•
review_4_text: Great coffee for a very afordable price!
review_5_text:
It's a tiny kiosk that makes coffee.
Prices are reasonable.
Coffee is OK.
Staff are friendly and polite.
It's very close to D Condo apartments.

It has temperature check and hand sanitizer.
Kiosk has window where you place order and pick up coffee.

It is situated outside 7/11.

name: Caf√© Amazon - ‡∏õ‡∏ï‡∏ó.‡∏ü‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏Æ‡πà‡∏≤‡∏°
review_1_text:
This Cafe Amazon is probably my fav because of the comfy indoor/outdoor seating options & waterfall feature üòç
Quiet setting. So peaceful sitting outside under the covered deck, listening to the sound of running water with beautiful koi fish swimming about. Outdoor outlets make it perfect for working online & being able to enjoy the coffee shop life ü´∂üèΩ
review_2_text: This branch of Cafe Amazon is located in the PTT Fa Ham station. There is a spacious and shady garden area where when you buy a coffee you can sit at a table in the garden. The staff are good and they inform me of various promotions too. I am very impressed with the discount from using the service.
review_3_text: Nice atmosphere, good place to stop and grab some coffee
review_4_text: Calm and cool to RELAX and CHILL besides the HIGHWAY. üòÅ
review_5_text: Nice atmosphere. Friendly customer service. Good coffee.

name: Morrow coff.
review_1_text: "Morrow Coff. is a hidden gem! The coffee is rich and flavorful, the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the prices are surprisingly affordable. The staff truly love what they do ‚Äî their service comes with genuine warmth and a smile. Highly recommended!"
review_2_text:
A tiny homey coffee shop hidden in small alley. Cute decorations with warm welcoming vibe here ready to serve good coffee.‚òïÔ∏è

Reasonable price and friendly staff. They also  offer soft cookies and sweet bitesüç™üç©
review_3_text: Amazinggg mixed berry smoothie. So cute and cozy inside. Perfect place to relax and read
review_4_text: Love this place! Fair prices, quick and friendly service. Small space inside but never super busy so you can sit if you want. Very nice modern decor
review_5_text: A small, quiet cafe perfect for chilling out. Great atmosphere, beautiful lighting for photos. Their new Thai tea cream cheese is incredibly delicious ‚Äì rich, creamy, and perfectly sweet. Their matcha green tea is also gorgeous. The desserts are tasty, the staff are friendly and provide excellent service üëçüèªüëçüèª. Prices are reasonable, you'll get change back from a 100 baht note. Plenty of parking. This is my nth visit.

name: Good Day Coffee ‡∏Å‡∏π‡πä‡∏î‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏¢‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà - ‡∏™‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏π‡πà‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏•‡πá‡∏Å
review_1_text:
One of my favourite coffee‚Äôs in Chiang mai! Their dark roast is superb. I used to visit their hatch on Suthep road, near Nimman, and was delighted to find they‚Äôd opened a little venue near my work.

Cool and bright decor inside, there are seats but it‚Äôs mainly a takeout spot. If you‚Äôre in the area and want a coffee, this place will not disappoint. Also does wonderful selection of tea and other drinks.
review_2_text: They offer three levels of coffee roasting, along with very friendly prices for this area. üëçüëç
review_3_text:
I'm in love with the drinks at this shop! üçµ‚òïÔ∏èü•§
The shop's decor is lovely, and the owner is friendly.
The quality is worth the price! ü•∞
review_4_text: The shopkeepers are friendly, lovely, and very kind.
review_5_text: The coffee is delicious. There's seating available. It's clean and tidy. There's also a restroom. Highly recommended!

name: WARI „ÉØ„Éº„É™ coffee
review_1_text: Best price to quality ratio. üôå Choose between dark, medium and light roast with no extra cost.
review_2_text:
Delicious coffee.

Highly recommended by

IG tomtompanda_traveler
FB tomtompanda traveler
review_3_text: This cafe' got order from walk in and from online platform. They have variaty of coffee bean that you can choose. Unfortunately that I knew it later after the barista had already made my coffee. The normal bean if you did indicate, it will be dark roasted. It is quite bitter than I can accept.
review_4_text: The best coffee we‚Äôve had in Thailand and we‚Äôve had it every day! Really good prices as well. They have lots of different options of beans including from different locations across Thailand. Well worth the trip.
review_5_text: Good taste, have choices of coffee bean, rec. to take away or delivery.

name: Sweets for gods Cafe
review_1_text: Cosy yet elegant, atmospheric little place to eat laddu while looking out at Ganesha.  Both masala chai tea and mango and coconut laddu were rich in flavour, the latter filling with its grainy texture. 150baths.
review_2_text: This place is a hidden gem! The coffee was prime quality and taste, the place is so comfy and the prices are truly cheap. I definitely recommend to visit this place
review_3_text: A beautiful little spot and the masala chai is lovely
review_4_text: Good Vibes!  I met a new friend from England. This place very well:)
review_5_text: It has this certain humbled, regal aesthetic. Felt welcomed and although they don‚Äôt have a full menu they offer delightful & bright sweet snacks for a moment of pleasure during your day. I will be recording this one as a recommended option in Chiang Mae for meetings, computer work, writing, & relaxing. Not to mention it shares a lot with a beautiful temple. This is a secret little place to keep in your heart.

name: Memorize Brownie ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ã‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏±‡∏• ‡πÄ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏• ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà‡∏Ç‡∏ô‡∏°‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏ô ‡∏ö‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πà ‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡πâ‡∏Å ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞ ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÑ‡∏ó‡∏¢ ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ß
review_1_text:
Definitely one of the best brownies every had.
It‚Äôs moisture and dark.
Not too sweet. The frappe is great too.
review_2_text: We had the brownie shot. There are 10 so good enough to share. The brownie was moist and the cream was light. Really enjoyed it.
review_3_text: Legit good brownie shake. Even with no sugar it's sweet. Tastes  good with the brownie chips sprinkled on top
review_4_text: Best brownie in Chiang Mai üòã
review_5_text: Memorize brownie was delicious, coffee was not good one.

name: minimal coffee central festival
review_1_text:
First off coconut iced coffee + dirty coffee ‚òï 5* fantastic. However there is very limited seating. I went to a seat where there were 4 chairs with 1 person and the customer didn't allow me sit as she had a bunch of papers and laptop üíª was probably using it as a workspace. All the other seats also has 1-2 people occupying 4 seats and seemed like they were working.

Tip: find a seat first before ordering.
review_2_text: The coffee was way too sour, and I didn‚Äôt feel welcomed at all. The place also had kind of a cheap vibe.
review_3_text: I got the orange presso which was a delicious afternoon pick me up. 60 baht which i thought was very fair. Got it lightly sweetened which was perfect!
review_4_text: Reasonable and wonderful coffee. 55b for one hot coffee. Must try.
review_5_text:
Well made and delicious coffee.

For the first time I had a seahorse on my coffee.

name: Doppio
review_1_text: Amazing coffee beverages and friendly staff! I had the Black Yellow (pineapple) and Orange Espresso. Really good stuff!
review_2_text: 3 bartistas working today. 3 professionals all very attentive to my requests.  I was provided 3 different roasts to choose from.  The coffee taste very good and the equipment is all professional quality.   It is located inside the shopping mall 3 rd floor 100 meters From the banks. Coffee is not cheap here ! I wish they had more food options.
review_3_text: The americano tastes like sour milk. Order a mix drink to mask the overpriced dirt you're drinking. Stupidly went here multiple times hoping for a different outcome. Stick to Roastinyom, Amazon, or Starbucks.
review_4_text: This is a coffee shop located in the Central Festival. The price of coffee is a little expensive, but the coffee tastes very good and the staff is kind. The chair is very uncomfortable.
review_5_text:
3rd floor coffee kiosk.  Flavorful well made coffee drinks.  Innovative combinations.

Try the 'Dirty Thai Tea,'.  An expresso shot in cold Thai tea.

name: Baan Sabun-nga ‡∏ö‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏∞‡∏ö‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏á‡∏≤
review_1_text:
If you're tired of the noise from cars and motorbikes, this is the perfect place to visit.
It feels like time has stopped-calm and cozy.
The owner is incredibly friendly and speaks excellent English. And the coffee? My wife said, "It's much cheaper and tastes way better than Starbucks at Central Festival!" Highly recommended!
review_2_text: A true hidden gem in Chiang Mai. The coffee is outstanding, and the owner‚Äôs kindness makes every morning feel brighter. I was so happy to enjoy such delicious coffee throughout my stay. Highly recommended!
review_3_text: Quaint little coffee shop on the outskirt of Chiang Mai.  Freshly roasted coffee in a shop that sits in a small well manicured garden.  At 9am with the breeze blowing through, it's a nice place to have your cup and relax a bit.   The owner is super kind and attentive.   Come and see for yourself!
review_4_text: Delicious coffee, tranquil cafe, clean bathroom, and a friendly owner who speaks excellent English. This place ticks all the right boxes. I‚Äôve been here many times and will keep coming back.
review_5_text:
Such a beautiful little garden cafe with a friendly owner and wonderful atmosphere. Perfect place to go after a long day of shopping in Central Festival. Delicious coffee and tea.

Highly recommend!

name: Black Canyon ‡πÄ‡∏ã‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏±‡∏•‡πÄ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏• ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Good service n decent matcha. Abit sweet though but I like the ambience n wifi .
review_2_text:
Foods and beverages there were good but came out pretty slow. It‚Äôs a place where you visit when you have time to kill.

Because the price of drink stalls in Central mall is very high, sitting in a cafe/restaurant like this make more sense.
Proper seating with about the same cost.
review_3_text: We ordered the pad Thai and it was ok. I think I expected it to have a little more flavour. The service was fine and there was no service charge.
review_4_text:
Food is ok drinks is good
1.)I feel like their food is freeze dried go to microwave
2.)if you have member card more value-able10%discount
3.)good table
review_5_text: The fish was old and not really good to eat. It took 30 mins to cook this üí©. Dont recommend.

name: ‡∏Ñ‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏±‡∏Å‡πÑ‡∏°‡πâ Lanna Cafe
review_1_text: We had a great experience here! We stayed at a hotel nearby where there were plenty of options for drinks but we loved this place the most. The women who helped us were so kind and sweet. I ordered an iced coffee and my partner ordered a strawberry smoothie. They offered us each a steamed bun while we waited for our drinks. The also offered us a discount which was very generous given the prices were all very economical. Either way we tipped the woman and she was so very grateful. Please please please try this place out, they even wrapped our drinks in napkins!
review_2_text: Good coffee, reasonable price.
review_3_text: I was staying nearby, and as I was walking past the cafe, the owner struck up a conversation with me. I was having trouble at the time, so I asked her for help, and she helped me out. I'm so grateful üôè I also had Thai tea at the cafe. She adjusted the sweetness just right, and it was delicious. Then she asked if I wanted to eat some food, and showed me all kinds of pictures. The portions were generous and delicious. I could eat it every day. The owner is always smiling, and it's a place that makes me feel glad I came to Chiang Mai. Everything the owner's cooking is delicious!
review_4_text: The coffee tastes good and is satisfactory. There is seating inside, which is a showroom for various decorative wood products, along with renovation design services.
review_5_text: Good and lovely service.

name: 6 Signature tea & coffee
review_1_text: This cafe is super cute and cozy, with a lovely style. The photos turn out so beautiful I have to come back again! ‚ú® The iced tea is delicious, and the matcha is incredibly fragrant.
review_2_text:
Newly opened shop located beneath All Red Hostel.
Rich cocoa, a must-try for cocoa lovers.
The tea is also fragrant, both Thai tea and green tea.
The owner is handsome and provides excellent service. You definitely won't feel lonely here.
review_3_text: Thai tea has the best and strongest flavor üëçüèª
review_4_text: For tea and coffee lovers, I highly recommend this üëç

name: Roastniyom Coffee, Central Festival
review_1_text:
Great location for people watching in the mall. Always reliable coffee.

Delicious coffee and other drinks.  Fresh pastry.
review_2_text: Can‚Äôt really fault this place. Fairly comfortable for a mall coffee. And have wifi
review_3_text:
The shop is located on the 4th floor of Central Chiang Mai. They offer a wide variety of drinks, as well as bakery items and pastries at reasonable prices.

The coffee tastes good, with a decent selection of coffee beans. They also have both premium and regular matcha.

Free drinking water is provided in a pitcher.

The staff are lovely, provide good service, and have a great service mind.
review_4_text: The food was delicious and I really enjoyed it. The staff also provided excellent service; they were very polite, friendly, and cheerful.
review_5_text: My favorite coffee shop at CentralFestival Chiang Mai.

name: Arigato
review_1_text:
Located inside Tops ‚Äî this is our go to spot for coffee ‚Äî it‚Äôs reasonably priced and most importantly, their beans are delicious.  We‚Äôre also greeted with such care and kindness each time.  Highly recommend.

There are also a handful of tables coupled with comfy chairs if you want to sit for a bit.
review_2_text: The matcha is delicious, and the drinks are cheap, but the chairs in the shop are so uncomfortable you'll get tired no matter how long you sit.

name: Light up cafe
review_1_text: The shop offers a variety of drinks, including bubble milk tea, smoothies, coffee, as well as cakes and bread. It is located next to OfficeMate.
review_2_text: I ordered Hot Chocolate and the staff said they only had Cocoa. I said yes, but the staff made me Iced Cocoa. I told them I ordered hot, not cold (do you understand English?). But the staff argued that it was cold and scowled. I asked to speak to the owner. The staff called and said that the owner wouldn't let me change it, even though it was the staff's fault. This is the service at the Central Festival Chiangmai branch.
review_3_text: The staff at this branch are shouting and talking, playing around, and being very loud. You can hear them standing across the street buying things. The owner of the shop at the market is shaking his head and not caring that customers are waiting for drinks in front of the shop. The owner probably never comes to check on them. Very bad.
review_4_text: The service was terrible. They didn't know anything when I asked questions (they had no knowledge of coffee whatsoever, despite selling it). The person taking orders was constantly on their phone, seemingly chatting on LINE, completely ignoring customers. It was like they didn't want to sell anything, and they spoke abruptly and rudely. Absolutely awful.

name: On the table
review_1_text: I really enjoyed their vegan / vegetarian menu: spicy crispy mushroom salad and vegan sushi.
review_2_text:
My family's regular restaurant.

Lots of delicious vegetarian food.
I ordered the Balanced Tofu Rice with Calamari today. I wasn't disappointed.
review_3_text: At first we were hesitant because it had no reviews, but given the wide variety, we decided to take a chance. It was worth it: plenty of drinks to choose from, and delicious food. The service was quick, although the portions could have been bigger. The downside is that they charge a 10% service fee.
review_4_text:
550 Thai Baht, economy class, great value! The portion was very satisfying for two people.

The salad had a bit too much dressing and was a little too sour. The rice looked a bit dry, but the texture was still okay.
review_5_text:
I'm so angry that they're selling such poor quality food. I came here because I wasn't feeling well. The food was expensive, and the panna cotta was terrible. The panna cotta was bland and hard. The sauce was too sweet, lacking strawberry flavor, and was all pink. It made my throat hurt, and I felt sick.

The staff and chef didn't know the order of serving. They brought the main course first, and the salad came last. It made me unable to eat the salad.

The sashimi rice bowl was apparently ordered for children. The staff didn't care about the kitchen, so they put wasabi on the plate. This carelessness was so obvious.

They rushed to take my order. We were still talking, and they already wrote it down.

name: Little Bao-Homemade steamed buns (Central Chiangmai Branch)
review_1_text: A selection of delicious vegan amd vegetarian bao buns (no meat, no fish, no egg, no dairy - plants only!). Stall can be found on the ground floor next to Amazon Cafe. Seating available around stalls in this bustling mall.
review_2_text: This is just a kiosk in Central Festival but me and my daughter simply Love this spot. We are vegans and they sell plant based BAO buns and plant based dumplings both are a must have. We love the bbq plant based pork BAO ‚ù§Ô∏è
review_3_text: There is a small table for two people to sit at. The bao buns are yummy üòã. The mantous is good as well. Nice place for a snack.
review_4_text: Must visit if you're vegan or vegetarian - lots of delicious plant based options, clearly labelled too. It's in the food court area in central mall.
review_5_text: Very friendly and polite staffs. Nice vegetarian and vegan buns! 4th floor of the mall

name: Sosoulful
review_1_text: My wife found this Coffee Shop by accident during a thunderstorm. She brought me here to show me and I am impressed. It is very neat and tidy with a wonderful decor. It is situated on the Super Highway but is fairly quiet once you are inside. I had a caramel frappe and a chicken and rice dish which was a little spicy but absolutely delicious. Worth the effort to visit.
review_2_text: This is not your average instagramable shop! Most of the items are made from scratch in house! Pretty plating and even garnished very fresh fruits, very good homemade bread for sandwiches. We ordered three dishes and they are all 5 stars! Coffee is good too! Highly recommended to go here for brunch!
review_3_text: Wife and I came by Sosoulful to support I Tim. We met him at another coffee shop and he currently works here. It‚Äôs relatively new. Wonderful atmosphere with lots of space. There‚Äôs also parking in the back. I had a Mocha and my wife had a latte. The mocha was good but could use more cacao powder for my personal taste. The latte was also well done. We also got a brownie and it was delicious. They warmed it up so it was perfect. Met the two owners (Blue and Beam. I might have spelled names incorrectly). Very nice people. They are also building out an indoor golf range. Once opened, you can drive some balls indoor and grab coffee. Perfect combo. They also serve food but we did not try. Come by and support local coffee shops. Better than StarSucks.
review_4_text: Came here to support a friend‚Äôs friends‚Äô new venture. Beautiful space with multiple floors. Has two meeting rooms upstairs and plenty of seatings downstairs. As a Christian I love all their public faith decor. Great coffee. Didn‚Äôt get to try their food. They are still working on the golf center which I‚Äôm curious what it would look like. Cool space to gather for sure! Plenty of natural lighting.
review_5_text: Cute cafe, tasty coffee, nice workers, good price.

name: DamKimMim Coffee (‡∏î‡∏≥‡∏Ñ‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏°‡∏¥‡∏°‡∏Ñ‡∏≠‡∏ü‡∏ü‡∏µ‡πà)
review_1_text:
The coffee latte was strong and good. The prices are also inexpensive. My iced latte was 45‡∏ø. They have several types of roasts to choose from. They also have a selection of teas. The baristas are very friendly.
Note: There's no bathroom available to use.
review_2_text: The shade of the black colour from the cafe‚Äôs name exists only in the Lanna language and doesn‚Äôt occur in standard Thai. This cafe maintains that truly Northern charm very well. Quiet, relaxed atmosphere.   Inexpensive prices, tasty coffee (at least coffee!), and warm service won‚Äôt leave the customers disappointed. The parking though might be the issue.
review_3_text: Cheap coffee, super chill and great service. I recommend the black orange!
review_4_text: My mocha was delicious and the atmosphere and staff were very warm and welcoming
review_5_text: One of not many that makes lime green tea and does it really well. Superb recommend

name: Caf√© Amazon ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏°.‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏ä‡∏†‡∏±‡∏è‡πÄ‡∏ä‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏´‡∏°‡πà
review_1_text: Nice weather today.  üçÆüçÆ
review_2_text: This branch is located at Chiang Mai Rajabhat University, Wiang Bua Campus.
review_3_text: The service is very, very slow. It's not that slow, but the staff looks unprepared to manage. Every time I go, it's like this.
review_4_text: I stopped by for a little work, not for a vacation.
review_5_text: The service is very slow every time üòÆ‚Äçüí®

name: STUDY CAFE
review_1_text:
It's the same as the last one!!
It's a good idea, and it's a great deal. It's a wonderful day, and it's a wonderful day! It's a wonderful time.

Cheap drinks and delicious coffee!
There is also a study cafe. Suitable for university students. The staff are friendly and all the drinks are delicious! I recommend the coconut smoothie.üòã
review_2_text: Coconut shake, fragrant, refreshing, suitable for hot weather. It has soft coconut meat. with coconut water for a naturally sweet taste Blend until fine. It's very delicious. As for the other drinks, they were just as delicious, so I really liked them.
review_3_text: The coconut smoothie is delicious. I highly recommend it. The avocado one is 35 baht. The other drinks are also delicious. The price is good. The shop has a great atmosphere. I highly recommend this shop. It's very suitable.
review_4_text: The coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is nice :)
review_5_text: Very tasty coffee! Rich flavor, not much ice. 10 baht discount if you take it with you.

name: ONE AND ONLY : MATCHA (‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ß‡∏°‡∏±‡∏ó‡∏â‡∏∞)
review_1_text: Ordered Grab, packed very well, big ice cubes, separate green tea and milk. I was impressed that it opened late because I had to save it to eat in the morning. All other green tea shops were closed.

name: Gramping Camping
review_1_text:
Camping theme hangout. With tents.

It offer limited assortment of beers and coffee. It does not offer a full range of drinks.

It food is Thai finger foods and barbeque.  In the winter remember to dress well as the night progress it gets cold.
review_2_text:
A camping-style cafe that serves as a slow bar during the day.
They have ROK and Aram equipment.
In the evening, it's a chill-out spot.
Lots of photo props.
Drinks and food available.
Live music at night. Plenty of parking.

*The shop is now open again.
Updated December 2021
*The shop has been renovated into a Dim Cafe in the same location.
*Updated 2023
review_3_text: "Gramping Camping" is a camping-style cafe that offers both daytime and nighttime camping. It has all the necessary equipment, lots of photo spots, a great atmosphere, and beautiful views. üì∑‚ú® The shop is open daily from 10:00 AM to 11:00 PM. Parking is also available.
review_4_text:
Atmosphere: Tent-style camping. Relax and enjoy a cup of coffee. The coffee is excellent. Let's dunk it! It's delicious.
Parking: Available, but not very extensive.
Service: Excellent, with excellent service and advice.
Other conditions: I recommend going on a less sunny or chilly day.
review_5_text:
