name: The Baristro Coffee Roaster
review_1_text:
Food - We only tried chocolate pastry, not too sweet & just nice.

Service - Served with smile

Atmosphere - There‚Äôs indoor & outdoor, we picked outdoor near the river.

There‚Äôs 2 tier, upper or the lower one depends on your pick. Chilling spot for all day long.

The menu nothing fancy but the drink & pastry is great. Lovely moment
review_2_text:
Latte 85 ‡∏ø (2025)

Has English menu, english speaking staff.

Boy oh boy, how glad I am to walk 5km from old town to this cafe.

I know Baristro serves good coffee, and i know this place is special as next to Ping ricer.

The menu are the same as rest of Baristro.

But the venue is nicely built, not as brutalist as the one at train station. But it has such a cozy feeling to it.

Well designed seats and space.

And sitting facing the river can spend a whole afternoon without much problem.

I often wonder what is it to see, it‚Äôs just a muddy river.

But wait, it sort of gives me this calm. The sky is clear bright, the river is flowing slowly, and quiet. And across the river are some green trees.

Occasionally i see tour boat passing, but they are muted and absorb unto the view.

I am glad most tourist dont get to come here for its inconvenience, and i am glad i did. How Thai people enjoy such beauty and nice place.
review_3_text: Buzzing bean bonanza by the Ping River! Dove into the viral soft matcha‚Äîcreamy, dreamy swirls of velvety green goodness that scoop up like a cloud, with that perfect bitter-sweet kick hitting all the right notes‚Äîwhile chilling on a cozy mat right by the gentle waters. Place was absolutely packed with fellow fans, but the electric energy, fresh-roasted aroma, and serene riverside vibes made the wait a thrill. Must-try for your Insta-worthy caffeine fix!
review_4_text:
This place is absolutely glorious! The stylish Japanese-inspired interior design, paired with good, well-thought-out lighting, creates such a cozy and relaxing atmosphere. It‚Äôs truly a mood-lifting experience.

The view is stunning too‚Äîfar better than the nearby cafes. If you're looking for a spot with a beautiful design, great ambiance, and a peaceful vibe, this is hands down the one to choose.

I ordered the Nutella latte, expecting a standard drink, but I was completely blown away after the first sip. The combination of Nutella and coffee is incredibly delicious and satisfying‚Äîdefinitely one of the best surprises I've had.

Without a doubt, this has become one of my favorite spots in Chiang Mai!
review_5_text:
Very spacious cafe along the Ping River.
The cafe has both indoor and outdoor area which u have plenty of spaces to view the beauty of Ping river.
Super relaxing and calming.

Coffee is good and with reasonable price ( except changing alternative milk need to add 25 baht).

Service is so so which some of the Staff seems doesn't want to work there.

name: Hidden Village Chiang Mai
review_1_text:
It‚Äôs truly the best place for parents and kids.
The best place indeed. You can feel that the owner created it more for children to enjoy and for parents to feel comfortable rather than for business profit. For a father like me, who has to take care of a child all day, it has been the perfect place. If you can show a Thai driver‚Äôs license, or if your child studying in Thailand can show a student ID, you get a 50% discount on the entrance fee.
review_2_text:
Hidden Village Chiang Mai: A Must-Visit for Families and Fun Photo Ops!
"If you're looking for a fun, action-packed destination just outside the main city, Hidden Village is the perfect choice, especially if you have children! This venue successfully combines several unique attractions into one engaging space.
Key Highlights & Experience:
The most impressive feature is definitely the Dinosaur Village. The life-sized models‚Äîsome of which move and roar‚Äîprovide a genuinely exciting and slightly educational experience for kids. Beyond the prehistoric giants, the venue offers a Pet Village where children can interact with friendly animals, and fun zones like the Giant Insects section, which is fantastic for unique, Instagram-worthy photos.
Atmosphere & Facilities:
It's a large, well-maintained area that gives the feel of an exploratory, whimsical park. There are plenty of activities and play areas to keep younger visitors entertained for hours. Facilities, including dining options like The Barn Steak House, are available on site, making it easy to spend a half or full day here.
Expert Tip:
While it caters primarily to families, the fun and quirky themed zones offer excellent backdrop material for anyone looking for creative photos. Highly recommend for families visiting Chiang Mai looking for an easy, guaranteed day of fun!"
review_3_text: For the price and the experience, this is easily a 5-star attraction for younger children. It features a charming, simple play area and small animals that you can feed for a small fee. The grounds are spacious and fantastic for kids to explore. I highly recommend The Hidden Village in Chiang Mai to any families with little ones who have the time to visit.
review_4_text: Do you really think this place is expensive? This is not a hotel playground. The grounds are very spacious and constantly being cleaned. Although it‚Äôs not the newest facility, there are many hidden things that children would enjoy. The animals were also living quite comfortably, and the place felt clean for us as well. However, it‚Äôs more suitable for toddlers than older children, and it‚Äôs a good idea to bring a hat. I would recommend not going if it rained the day before.
review_5_text: We arrived at 10am in January. The weather was perfect. Cool and bright. It had rides, animals to feed, horses to ride, playgrounds, and Dinosaur land. It was  THB250 per pax.

name: Life. Coffee bar & beerÔºõ‰∏Ä„Äå
review_1_text:

review_2_text: Currently, they have Shabu buffet for 158 Baht per person with camping atmosphere.
review_3_text:
This used to be a great place for a few drinks and a variety of different meats on a stick.

It has changed hands recently, the tables are in disrepair, and the chairs are 80% broken.

There is no table service, which is fine, but nobody will tell you this.

There should be a process where you choose your meat on a stick selection, be given a tally of your choices, so there is no confusion when you go to pay.
This seems logical to me, yet twice since the new people have taken over, my bill has been almost doubled.

It is a real shame, as the right people managing this place could really make it work.

EDIT: Since writing this review, the tables have been replaced, the area is a whole lot nicer.
review_4_text: Good food with reasonable price :)
review_5_text: An interesting construction based on shipping containers and a location on a highway seem to be e good combination. But the offerings are hardly exciting or different. Coffee during the day and alcohol at night does seem to draw a reasonable number of customers.

name: OMELETTE CAFE MeeChok
review_1_text: We often come here for brunch on weekends. The meals are so delicious, and the ones shown in the pictures are our favorites. The store is small but comfortable, and the staff are always kind and smiling. The location is convenient for parking as it's next to a main road and a 7-Eleven. We hope it continues to thrive for a long time.
review_2_text: Some of the best breakfast places in Chiangmai! I recommend getting an avocado sandwich. I got a beef burger but I think it had too much cooking oil. 100% Recommended!
review_3_text: This is a very high-quality restaurant with delicious food. You can also freely choose your favorite ingredients. I recommend it to everyone.
review_4_text:
Coffee and food are great! ü§© You can create your own menu based on the list they have. I chose spinach from their menu and added it.

There's parking available on the side street.
The seat is in air conditioning area.
review_5_text: One of those places you want to gatekeep but know you shouldn‚Äôt. Consistently great food, coffee, and service, what more could you ask for?! I personally always get the fried chicken with the blue cheese dip, it‚Äôs actually chicken breast, so delicious! Their banana caramel pancakes were also super yum! Highly recommend but don‚Äôt come all at once and ruin my fav breakfast spotüôè

name: Rich Homemade Cake Ruamchok
review_1_text: A cozy cake shop with a relaxing atmosphere that feels like being in a dreamy concrete-and-wood house from a storybook. Perfect for unwinding on a day off or getting some work done in a calm, comfortable setting. The homemade cakes are delicious (cakes may run out if you come late), and there‚Äôs a wide variety of drinks to choose from as well.
review_2_text:
A brand new cafe which opened for a few days. The cafe is in  French cottage style and interior design is nice. The cafe gets 2 floors where the upper floor is workplace,  the ground floor is for cafe.

Drink: Very reasonable price and good taste. Wanna try the cakes too, they all look good.

Service:  Super friendly and helpful
review_3_text: A newly opened coffee shop near Ruamchok. This shop is very cute. They have coffee and bakery products, especially cakes. The shop is usually located at the moat. This is a new branch, already famous for its delicious cakes. This new shop is decorated cutely in a vintage style house. Taking pictures is the best. The lighting is good. The atmosphere is good, like being in Korea. Highly recommended. There is a cool parking lot.
review_4_text:
Beautiful cozy cafe near the city around Ruamchok area. The cafe is located next to the park.

Very friendly staffs.

Great drinks and. Many selection of bakeries.
Work space on the 2nd floor.
review_5_text:
Nice place to chilling here.
Good atmosphere.
Just got a present from staff for their grand opening day, very impressive.

name: Roastniyom coffee ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏†‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏™‡∏ï‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏ó
review_1_text: Very good service and atmosphere. Polite and attentive staffs. There're beans options from light, medium to dark roast for coffee drinker. Barista showed good training and understanding of coffee making. Well managed, indeed.
review_2_text: Drinks are always satisfactory. The ambient is pleasant and calm. Service at this location is welcoming.
review_3_text:
Must come when visit ChiangmaiÔºÅ
Their coffee are delicious as usualüòãüòãüòã
review_4_text: Lovely staff, ample parking, nice outdoor area.
review_5_text: Awesome cafe in Chiangmai. Highly recommended. Let's chill the vibe

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏Ñ‡∏±‡∏û ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏ü‡πà chxb cup caf√©
review_1_text: Average coffee place conveniently located next to a car wash. Seating seem somewhat limited to a few tables and the decor seems to need some refreshing. The barista is friendly and drinks are ok.
review_2_text:
Very friendly staff
good service üëç
low prices
Clean motorbike for 70 baht
have coffee shop with Aircon
review_3_text: Have a cuppa while waiting for your car to be washed. Coffee was ok but the local butter crisps was delicious.
review_4_text: Excellent "Dirty Coffee" poured to perfection! ‚ù§Ô∏è (Car wash next door also recommended)
review_5_text: Great coffee and the price only 45 Baht! The attached car wash was my best find coffee is on top very nice little hangout and fast service. Recommended.

name: 1678 Cafe
review_1_text: A nice cafe with peaceful atmosphere, the coffee is great, the paintings are lovely! We go Ruamchok area pretty often and just knew this place, it‚Äôs a bit hard to find, but worth trying!
review_2_text: The coffee here is amazing, the barista is very good. The food is great too, very good service. Definitely try this place. Will be coming back.
review_3_text: This cafe and hair salon has a great atmosphere, is clean, quiet, and beautiful. They offer both caffeinated and non-caffeinated drinks, as well as alcoholic and non-alcoholic options. They serve single-dish meals at reasonable prices. The staff are friendly. It's a shame we'd already had lunch, but we plan to go back to try the food ‚Äì they have a variety of tempting dishes. The shop is divided into hair salon and cafe areas, making it comfortable to sit in. There are both indoor and outdoor seating options. We'd definitely be back ‚Äì we loved it!
review_4_text:
A wonderful atmosphere! ‚ú®

The greenery is tastefully designed and planted.

The interior is bright and spacious, and the seats are well-spaced, ensuring privacy for each table. It's fantastic!

I love every painting the owner has chosen. üíö

The staff are friendly and polite, and the drinks are above average. ‚ú®

The courtyard is deep and lush, and it would be very comfortable to sit here on a relatively cool afternoon between November and February.

The restrooms are clean and stylish.

1678 Cafe is a great place to read, unwind, or do some online work.

Highly recommended~‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
review_5_text: This cafe is so beautiful! The coffee is great, the pastries are delicious, and the owner is lovely and attentive. It's air-conditioned, has soft music playing, and is a really relaxing place to sit. Most importantly, there are so many gorgeous photo opportunities! I could easily spend a long time here üòç Next time I'll try the food. I'll definitely be back! ü´∞

name: I Dedee Cafe
review_1_text: First the banana strawberry smoothie drink I did not enjoy that much because the banana taste over due. Second the honey toast the cornflakes is not crunch, it's soggy and sticky the rest it's fine. Overall price is 175 baht
review_2_text: Is opposite of cafe company name crypto (mining farm) .. They are very big scamer
review_3_text: Unique cafe.
review_4_text: Lovely place to relax even though it is on a busy road.
review_5_text: Nice Espresso

name: ‡∏•‡∏∏‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏Æ‡∏á‡∏™‡πÇ‡∏•‡∏ß‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå
review_1_text: Good coffee on a van
review_2_text: Use Arabica coffee, it's definitely fragrant and refreshing.
review_3_text: Are there correct operating hours? You can always drink if you are lucky.

name: Pan La Mun 700th
review_1_text:
it's Ok  price is reasonable not too expensive
quality: 6/10
review_2_text: The food is delicious. There are few shops, but the area is spacious. A coffee shop is located on the left at the entrance. There's one grocery store. Free WiFi is available. The atmosphere is beautiful and shady.
review_3_text: The coffee tastes great, the staff are friendly and make everything to order. The shop is clean, stylish, and cute. The prices are reasonable. The coconut and avocado drinks are delicious and a must-try, especially the coconut coffee ‚Äì it's amazing and very fragrant. They also accept the government's co-payment scheme.
review_4_text: Green tea is good, but it's not ideal to sit and enjoy it because it's hot. The shop is located in the cafeteria of the 700-Year Anniversary Government Housing complex.
review_5_text: The shops inside offer a wide variety of choices, including snack and beverage shops.

name: Three Animals Coffee ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏™‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏¥‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏µ‡πâ
review_1_text: The prices are great, everything on the menu is 30 baht. I always order an espresso, but lately it's started having sediment. Sometimes I order a regular sweet espresso but it's not sweet at all, just bland. Sometimes I get a latte instead of an espresso. The owner seems to have hired new staff. I don't want to tell them directly because I don't want to bother the staff and the owner. But overall, the other menu items are good.
review_2_text: Excellent value for money. Highly recommended. Great coffee and beautiful view.

name: 53Slow Bar Coffee
review_1_text: This is a lovely little shop beside the park‚Ä¶ very charming staffs, good (& international) coffee varieties, comfortable little outdoor seating area‚Ä¶ can very much recommend and I will make this a regular stop after morning walks at the PAO
review_2_text: We come several times and try different coffees. Very tasty, we recommend.
review_3_text:
My wife and I have become regulars at this small streetside coffee bar. They really do make amazing coffee! We especially love the cappuccino, latte, and coconut coffee‚Äîdelicious and rich. The atmosphere near the park is cozy and quiet, perfect for a morning coffee after tennis. The bar is stylish, and the equipment is new and neat.
The staff are friendly, always smiling and ready to chat. We highly recommend this place to anyone in the area. Excellent coffee, a pleasant atmosphere, and a cozy spot to relax and socialize.
review_4_text:
Passing by Chiang Mai's Chaloem Phra Kiat Park, I stopped by for a coffee. It's a mobile cafe nestled in a lakeside park.
The coffee was delicious and fragrant.
They also host a flower festival every year from November to January. It's a great place to visit, explore, and enjoy a cup of coffee or tea.
review_5_text: After exploring the lake, it's a great place to grab a quick coffee. They make coffee in a moka pot. You can choose between medium and dark. There are also camping chairs and tables so you can sit and eat.

name: Klin : ‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏¥‡πà‡∏ô - Coffee ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ç‡∏≤ ‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏ô ‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏à. ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ß
review_1_text: Best black tea in my life and very friendly worker in this Shop.
review_2_text: The cafe's front was beautifully decorated, especially during Christmas. The staff were friendly and provided excellent service. I initially wanted to order a hot chocolate with extra strawberries, which wasn't on the menu. The staff member helped me call the owner to ask how much it would cost, but I saw the special Christmas menu item and ordered that instead.
review_3_text: So delicious! They're open at night during the winter festival too. Come on over! Plenty of parking. Cute cafe with lots of photo opportunities. After buying your drinks, you can go for a walk in the provincial park.
review_4_text: Delicious taste. Perfect for relaxing after a workout.

name: OFTEN Coffee
review_1_text: Stopped by for a cup of Thai tea after lunch in Chiang Mai. Its warmth & sweet aroma make it a delightful treat. A bit crowded during lunchtime, but the queue moves quickly. Thanks to the efficient staff. üëç
review_2_text: üòãüòãüòãüòã
review_3_text: A small, cozy shop with delicious iced tea and good service... Parking is available on the street. üòä
review_4_text: This small, cute, and warm shop is very affordable and delicious. üòä
review_5_text: The prices are lovely; I've never seen drinks at these prices in a coffee shop in Chiang Mai. / The green tea has a nice aroma but lacks body.

name: BREW MORE
review_1_text: Found on Grab, order twice in a row, good Cappuccino with variety beans to choose. Very lovely packaging. Worth to try! Will def order again when I am back to Chiang Mai! ü•∞ü•∞‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èüéâüéâ
review_2_text:
Prices start at 45 Baht
I ordered a cup of latte with medium roast
The taste was good for me.
review_3_text:
This cafe is one of best coffee shop  in cnx
The staff is lovely
You should try it !!!!
review_4_text: Stop for coffee not that expensive and Savoring the rich flavors of this exquisite coffee blend
review_5_text: Good specialty coffee with nice experience

name: ‡πÄ‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏°‡πà ‡∏™‡πÄ‡∏õ‡∏ã MEME-SPACE
review_1_text: The food is delicious, the flavors are good, and there's a complete range of both savory and sweet dishes. I really like it. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and is beautiful.
review_2_text:
It's fresh fruit, the bingsu is delicious and just right. I loved it so much!
They also have food at the shop, I'll try it next time ü•≥‚ú®ü•∞ü•∞
review_3_text: I ordered BBQ ribs to eat at home. They were delicious and the pieces were big and full of ingredients. The whole family liked them.
review_4_text: The food is delicious and everything looks delicious. I've eaten there many times.
review_5_text: Great atmosphere and delicious food, this is the place to go!

review_1_text: High quality of coffee. Good taste. Aromatic smell. You can choose level of coffee. And beans. This shop also sell the coffee equipment and coffee beans too. Recommend.
review_2_text: Hidden Gem for coffee lover at Chiang Mai. Price range from 40-80 THB. You can choose type of roast for your coffee from Light - Medium - Dark. I would recommend latte honey hot that taste of wild honey. They do sell many kind of coffee such as Omkoi and Doi Chang and also coffee equipment.
review_3_text: Good coffee. Nice decor. Sells coffee related stuff as well. Great place to do nuthing on the sofa or have a long discussion at the long table on 1st floor.
review_4_text:
LOVE THIS PLACE!!
Best latte I've had in Chiang Mai. Great coffee products and well priced coffee beans. Wife's hot Coco was very nice too.
Great atmosphere!

Highly recommend.
review_5_text: I order a dirty coffee with super strong beansÔºå love it‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Meegin coffee - Mae Rim
review_1_text: Great coffee. Nice service.
review_2_text: Great coffee!
review_3_text: The light roast Americano is great, you have to try it. The cakes are delicious too. The air conditioning is cool, the music is nice, and it's a comfortable place to sit. The prices are affordable for frequent visits. You have to try it because our tastes might be different, and what's delicious to us might not be the same for everyone.ü§üüèºüòé
review_4_text: Regarding the Children's Day event where the shop had a small booth, I have a complaint about the service. I recognized the shop as one I'd eaten at before and tried to buy something, but the seller was talking while looking down and typing or pressing something on their phone. They then looked up and said, "There's a very long queue right now, about 10 cups," and then went back to what they were doing, leaving me standing there confused without taking my order. I asked, "So, you're not selling?" but received no answer. The person next to them just smirked and left without asking if I wanted to wait since there were so many orders. If they had asked, I would have gladly waited. Personally, I felt like they didn't want to sell, so I just walked out. Please improve your service. I didn't make a purchase this time. My experience was very negative.
review_5_text: Meegin coffee, a coffee shop with a great atmosphere. Every menu is delicious. The staff are polite and provide excellent service.

name: Khun Tanai de Cafe
review_1_text:
Cozy atrium 'wedge' at the end of the building.   Large windows with indoor and outdoor seating gives a great view of an intersection in this quiet neighborhood.

The iced cappuccino was well made and flavorfull.  Counter help, helpful.
review_2_text: Padthai was purely sweet, even the sweetness is my favourite savory. On top of that, chives was not clean out.
review_3_text: Nice little spot in Chaing Mai, Thailand, offering a mix of Thai and western food, makes a good pit stop, for drinks and food, there are also toilet facilities. Food was nice however my hot latte was served a little cool for my liking, looked amazing though!
review_4_text: Found this sweet place in my neighbourhood, it has two floors with the view on the temple, sounds of birds in the background and now and then a car passing by. Plenty spots to charge your Laptop and phone. Amazing staff, very helpful, giving advice and opinion and speaks good english :)
review_5_text: a small local coffee place worth checking out

name: BLESSED CAFE
review_1_text: Very good coffee! Must try if you visit Chiang Mai
review_2_text:
The best cup of black coffee I've had in Chiang Mai for three years, better than those specialty coffee shops in the Moat. I was surprised that the very fruity coffee beans are Thai.

Friendly and courteous staff.
review_3_text: The owner is very nice, the products are very high quality, I definitely recommend it.
review_4_text: Amazing coffee! Highly recommend if you are looking for nice staff and high quality coffee ü´∂
review_5_text: The coffee beans at this shop are handpicked and roasted by the owner in Mae Hong Son, which is the heart and soul of their coffee. You can truly feel the care put into every single cup to ensure great quality and flavor ‚Äî and the best part is, the price is very reasonable too.

name: Sheeva Cafe
review_1_text:
This is a coffee shop that's perfect for people waiting at the Land Department office.
- It's a small shop located in the parking lot of the Treasury Department. There are 6 seats inside and one marble table outside.
- The coffee isn't very strong. I ordered a cappuccino, and the milk foam wasn't very smooth.
- The atmosphere inside is okay for waiting for your order.
- If you're looking for fresh coffee while waiting at the Land Department office, give it a try.
review_2_text: The staff are lovely and the cake is delicious.
review_3_text: Delicious coffee at reasonable prices. The barista is lovely. The shop is open Monday to Friday from 7:00 AM to 5:30 PM.

name: Save Cup Coffee
review_1_text:
If you're stuck for somewhere to stop, we recommend stopping by Save Cup Coffee. They have coffee, brownies, and cookies at very reasonable prices. The spacious space is perfect for chilling out at your leisure. üç™üç´‚òï üå¥üåªüå≥üåæ
A little slice of heaven ‚õÖ‚òÅÔ∏èüè°
review_2_text: I really like the atmosphere of this shop. It's cool and relaxing to sit and sip coffee. Plus, the coffee is delicious and not expensive. The cookies are the best and the cornflakes are excellent.
review_3_text: The coffee shop is shady and the cocoa is very delicious. It's perfect for sitting and reading a book.
review_4_text: I love the orange coffee. The coffee is very good, very fragrant, and deliciously well-rounded. Another menu I like is the cookies. They smell of real butter and taste very good. The price is very cute.üíï
review_5_text: The cats in the shop are so cute. The coffee is great. ü•§

name: Coffee Bench by Mat Day Cafe
review_1_text: On the customer service side, the air conditioning is on from 13:00 to 15:00, and the staff seem unprepared to provide service.
review_2_text: Stop by to do some business at The Land, a delicious coffee shop with cool air conditioning.
review_3_text: The coffee tastes great and the service is excellent.
review_4_text: Strong coffee, good.

name: OFF
review_1_text: The shop is cute and the atmosphere is great. Personally, I drink it every morning before work. I don't like sour coffee, so I usually order the dark roast with an extra shot. It's bitter at the start but sweet and fragrant at the end ‚Äì delicious! For me, I'm hooked on this shop's coffee.
review_2_text: The coffee is delicious, the staff provides good service, and the prices are reasonable... I invite everyone to stop by and try it if you have the chance. (It's located opposite the 7th Infantry Battalion, past the Provincial Hall intersection towards Nakornping Hospital and Mae Rim District.)
review_3_text: I ordered a Thai tea with less sugar, but what I got was very sweet üò§. However, the coffee at this shop is delicious; it has a lovely aroma and a great taste.
review_4_text: Coffee prices: Hot drinks 40 baht, Cold drinks 45 baht. The coffee is very strong and bitter.
review_5_text: It's a small branch in a local area. The prices are affordable, the taste is good, and the pastries are delicious. Finding parking might be a little difficult.

review_3_text: They had an unwelcoming expression, like they didn't want to sell anything.
review_4_text: The pizza is delicious, and they have a special sauce unique to the restaurant...^ ^"

review_3_text: A small coffee shop next to TOT, but the taste is strong, the price is not expensive, there are outdoor seats and air-conditioned rooms, free Wi-Fi.

review_5_text: very delicious

review_1_text: This cafe is so nice. It‚Äôs inside the Women‚Äôs Prison, but anyone can go. They have some good Khao Soi and coffee and honey sodas and bakery. The staff are so lovely and nice, and the seating is beautiful. I highly recommend.
review_2_text: The taste is delicious... I must come back again. Taste, shop, savor, and share!

Secret little cutie, cozy place for short relaxing.

Lots of plants, Green environment. Wifi, and chill music.

Great coffee shop in a quiet area.
The coffee is really good and the atmosphere is great.
review_3_text: Authentic coffee taste and nice atmosphere far from chaotic downtown. Will visit next time with a book and might enjoy reading in their garden.
review_4_text: Such a hidden gem in Chang Phuak area. Enjoyed the coffee, cake and the area is very chill and outside has a cabin feeling and inside is modern. Owner is nice as well.
review_5_text: Nice cozy coffee shop üòä Tasty flat white and friendly owner. Thank you very much üôèüèªü§©

review_2_text: The taste is okay, the portion size is appropriate, and the price is good.
review_3_text: delicious

review_5_text: I'm someone who doesn't usually drink coffee but wanted to try it. I recently discovered they have easy-to-drink, non-bitter coffee. The shop owner was very knowledgeable and incredibly kind.

name: Thar Jao Rimping Restaurant/Coffee Shop/Bar

review_3_text: Enchanting place lovely fresh food great vibe with soft live music. Provided mossy spray but to be honest didn't have a problem with gentle breeze.
review_4_text: This is quite a quiet place for family time with a good point of view beside Ping river
review_5_text: Restaurant has its own good location by the Ping river, good foods with good live music start from 19:00 or 19:30 hrs onward

review_1_text:
The food is delicious, the prices are affordable, and the view is beautiful.
The service is excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant; you won't be disappointed.
There are also many photo opportunities.
review_2_text: Very delicious, especially the cake. The owner is lovely and the price is good, not expensive, worth the price. Highly recommended!
review_3_text: The coffee and prices are great. I suggest improving the seating arrangement to provide shade from the sun.
review_5_text: It's good. The atmosphere is good. The only problem is that the sun shines in too much. But overall, it's good.

The coffee is fragrant, delicious, and suits my taste.

name: ‡∏ä‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏Å Onec a day
review_1_text: Newly opened shops like Pearl Tea and Cafe serve drinks for around 25-45 baht. You can also eat there.

name: YOURMINE Coffee Roaster - Ping River
review_1_text:
A new coffee shop has opened under the underpass by the Ping River. It's the third branch of YourMine.
Prices start at 50 baht, with options for light, medium, and dark roasts. The coffee tastes great, and they roast their own beans. They also have imported beans to choose from. There are many fancy and delicious menu items.
For example, coconut foam latte, Black Forest, and matcha strawberry. If you're in the area, stop by often!
review_2_text:
A famous shop from Lampang.
Good coffee, with additional beans to choose from for 20-40 baht.
The Thai coconut tea is delicious.
View by the Ping River.
review_3_text: The cream puffs are delicious, the coffee is good, and the service is excellent.
